text: Had Brussels sprouts and egg, naan, and some drinks at a place that calls itself "all day brunch." Surprisingly, they don't have an espresso machine. The naan turned out to be a thick, pre-made bread rather than actual naan bread. The "tikka masala" spice on the Brussels sprouts was more like a hot sauce and didn't resemble the original dish. It was served with a sunny-side-up egg and some pre-cut cabbage without any dressing. The food was below average, and it's surprising that we had to wait for a table.Disappointing.
Terrible service, terrible food. Bathrooms smell disgusting Also heard the owners engage in wage theft.

Wow will never return here AGAIN. WE WERE assaulted by homeless man during our dinner and nobody came by after it happened. I'll never come back here. Horrible management, horrible service, and not a safe place to have outdoor dining. Stay safe

Please Read Entire PostTHE WORST EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. I just dined outside at Unconventional Diner with a friend. Mid meal a homeless person walked up from behind and me and took an entire piece of chicken off of my plate and spit it towards our direction. He proceeded to chew my food, then took my glass off my table and was acting crazy. No staff or manager was present during the entire ordeal, as several other patrons watched. The manager finally came out because my friend went inside to grab someone as they walked the man down the road. MANAGEMENT SHAME ON YOU. Nobody asked how I was doing after this occurred, and not a SINGLE manager came up to us after this episode. Instead our waiter told us the first order of food which was violated would be compliments of the house. They took nothing off the bill. This was a terrible situation, and horrible customer service. What if I was attacked? Afterwards I went up to management and told them how horrible of an experience this was. While the food was good, this was my worst experience ever at a place I was looking forward to going to. I feel bad for the other patrons and again am so disappointed by those working that night. You weren't even busy, and thoughtfulness goes a long way. GOOD RIDDANCE
It's wasn't that good.  I was disappointed. Probably won't go back any time soon looked better than it tasted.

This place offers, hands down, one of the best brunch experiences with shrimp & grits that are absolutely delectable. I've visited four times and the culinary delight remains a constant, every single time.So, why the 3-star rating? Sadly, it's the customer service that hinders this establishment from becoming a top favorite. Despite the culinary brilliance, every visit comes with a hint of reluctance due to previous encounters with the staff.During my first visit in 2021, the overall experience was delightful, until it was time to leave. I had ordered a bottle of champagne, which I couldn't finish, and a staff member-- not my waitress--corked it for me. However, before I could even set the bottle down, the cork exploded, hitting my head and causing the champagne to spill. This mishap could have had severe consequences had it hit my eye or mouth.Upon reporting this to the manager, the response was less than considerate. After spending around $120 and leaving a 25% tip, not even a replacement bottle was offered as compensation. Having experience as a bartender, I'm aware that the retail price of the champagne is significantly lower than what is charged, and a comped bottle would have been a decent gesture for the inconvenience. I tried to give the benefit of the doubt, attributing this to possibly inadequate training during COVID times.Despite this experience, I returned with a friend, hoping for a better experience. Unfortunately, we faced another corking issue, and it led to a heated exchange between my friend and another manager. It seems the issues are predominantly with the management.The food here is undeniably exquisite, but there's a pressing need for better staff training, especially when it comes to corking bottles, and a shift in attitude towards patrons. It's frustrating to face such issues when we, as customers, are well aware of rules and standards.
DISCLAIMER:My review is based on doordash experience. We received mediocre food and it was not good.
Only for people with dead taste bud that need to be sauced!

This is home ec(onomics) food with booze (shit, I realize I'm dating myself ha). How do you make a chicken gravy that legit tastes like winter soup?How do you pedal a piece of burnt dough with lifeless insides seemingly made of a baby sock as a biscuit? How do you make crab and linguini un-fun? And how does said meal cost almost a hundred bucks??From now on if I hear anyone say a place is a different "take" on normal food, I'm just going to skip it. I now know it's code for people who can't cook with a liquor license.A basket full of blah. Fried chicken was OK tho.

Unconditional Diner in DC offers a nice, modern atmosphere with a welcoming vibe. The food options are solid, and service is quick, making it a great spot for a casual meal. While the service is decent, be aware that a 20% service charge is automatically added to the bill. Overall, a good dining experience with a sleek setting and efficient service.
Food was solid. Service was ok, but a little slow. The ambiance was that of a diner. It was a little overpriced.

I tried the fried chicken sandwich, it was okay, nothing too special. The fries weren't my favorite, just average. The corned beef hash had too much meat for my liking. On the bright side, the blueberry lavender pancakes were really good - they were light, fluffy, and not overly sweet. Sadly, I didn't get to taste any of the mascarpone as my daughter ate it all! The Lebanese fried rice was definitely the highlight of our meal.

I don't like their food so much. I think it was okay not much delicious because it was not cooked good.Their service was so good but they served me in a good manner.Overall their service was good.Their ambiance was not too much good. It was noisy .

I ordered their fried chicken dinner several times during the pandemic when I wasn't dining out. It was some of the best that I've had. The chicken was still crispy when it arrived and well seasoned. The meat was tender. I also enjoyed the sides, I got mashed potatoes which were creamy and a rich, velvety Mac and cheese. I can't wait to dine in sometime.
Food was great but the service is terrible. Barely ever saw our server and had to go ask for the check so we could leave.
It was good but there were two bugs in my water but over all it was good food other then this event
this place is pretty good, not wow but if you order the fried chicken you will leave happy and satisfied.
Food was ok. I think the atmosphere could have been better. I would recommend.

I'd heard rave reviews but was unimpressed in person. I enjoyed my cocktail- the sunshine of your love- and did like reading the creative cocktail list and menu but everything else was a solid 'fine.'It was a hot day so I decided I didn't want anything too heavy and went with the dirty Cesar salad. The roasted tomatoes it claimed to come with was just a scoop of bad salsa. The dish was colorful with a nicely cooked soft boiled egg and black crouton dust atop the greens but the overall taste was not good and I had to force myself through it.We also tried the pot pie poppers which they were known for were- and honestly I don't understand why. Bland and unimpressive.The waitress encouraged us to try dessert because their pastry chef had just won pastry chef of the year but none of the items appealed to us. The space was modern and clean. The bench I sat in was too low for the table though which made things slightly uncomfortable- a silly detail but one that should have been addressed given the level of sophistication they are trying to present with.
Cute place but I guess the bar side isn't open during the weekday mornings. Didn't stay to eat looked more like a bakery style place where you serve yourself.
Just an average place. Food was good be sure to ask questions. They do add different ingredients to the basic breakfast. Service was good. Place was clean and had a good vibe.
Pretty good food.

Went for brunch - drinks were good and the service was great. It was a little bit loud/crowded. I got the brussel sprouts and eggs and honestly it wasn't anything super special. I really loved the pancakes though!

I recently dined at Unconventional Diner and was thoroughly impressed. From the moment I stepped in, it was evident why they seemed to have a Michelin Star. The food was nothing short of phenomenal, each dish bursting with flavor and creativity. The service matched the excellence of the cuisine, with attentive staff ensuring a seamless dining experience. However, I must admit that the decor and ambiance left a bit to be desired. Despite this minor flaw, Unconventional Diner exceeded my expectations and is definitely worth a visit for the culinary delights alone.

Overall great experience! I give 5 stars for something going above and beyond. More than expected. In this case the staff were super friendly and welcoming etc.Great food for me is 4 star though and only becomes 5 when again there is something unusual or unique and extraordinary about it. My baked Brie was close to that. The Peking duck though very nice was only what I expected, maybe a bit too salty when you don't eat the buns to offset that.

Nestled in the heart of culinary excellence, this Michelin-starred brunch restaurant seamlessly marries innovation with tradition. From the meticulously crafted dishes to the elegant ambiance, every aspect exudes sophistication. The diverse menu, showcasing seasonal ingredients, ensures a delightful journey for your taste buds. Attentive service and a carefully curated atmosphere elevate the overall dining experience, making it a truly exceptional brunch destination.
Great place to go for dinner with friends or family. The food is delicious and the service is excellent

Came for brunch on a Saturday around noon and it was super busy! We got reservations and it was definitely the move! Many people got turned away while we were waiting for our table since they are so packed. The interior is so pretty!! It's split up into 3 different sections: front area/open kitchen, bar with seating and second dining area (pink room). Plenty of seating which was nice and the ambiance was lively but not too loud. The food was better than I expected! I got the poutine and it was super flavorful and nicely savory, not overly salty. There was a good amount of meat to fries ratio and plentiful gravy on top. The egg was cooked just right and the yolk mixed in was super good. The Georgia French toast was decent! It wasn't anything special but a good choice if you like peach cobbler! The chicken and waffles was so good! The chicken was nice and crispy and the waffle had so much savoriness to it. The butter and sauces wasn't overly spicy either (even tho it said habanero). The pancakes are so picturesque. I'm not a huge fan of pancakes but my friend really liked them! They give you a lot for one order. Fries were standard and crispy and the sexy sauce was like a ketchup Mayo burger sauce. Standard but in a good way! Ratings: French dip poutine: 8/10Georgia French Toast: 8/10Pancake: 9/10 Chicken and waffles: 8/10 Fries: 9/10 Drinks: 10/10 (strong) Overall, I'd totally come back. BE AWARE they do an automatic 20% gratuity. This was a bit annoying bc our waiter def was lacking... all the staff seemed kind of whatever since the tip was already included. If I went back I'd totally just go to the bar! The bartender was super nice and much better than our waiter. Highly recommend the bar if you can't find a table/aren't picky!
Food was good. Service was good enough. Ambience was nice. Overall good place. Would go back.
Good experience with good food. More for those look for a more fuller meal fare. Definitely worth a try if you want breakfast related eats
Tasty. Go here to fluff your gram.
Good, not fantastic. Lively environment.
Good food.Packed on the weekend. Bar is full of good bottles. Bartenders are decent.

Food was cool, do not think I would go again but would definitely recommend for someone hitting the city for the first time. Keith Lee Review: Customer Service: 8.6/10 (Bartender was the homie rest of the staff was mid)Food: 8.4/10 Overall: 8.5/10

I enjoyed their delivery options during the pandemic such as the fried chicken dinner family size. The chicken was perfectly crispy and seasoned with delicious mashed potatoes and other sides. It was nice to get a restaurant-quality meal delivered. Looking forward to dining there in person when it's safe again.
Unexpected surprise. Very high quality food and prep. Didn't realize this great place at convention Center . will be back!
The food was delicious, and the menu is very diverse. I strongly recommend this place
Interesting menu - everything is always better than it sounds.
Interesting concept over by convention center. Great food, a little pricey but overall very unique experience.
Came here with some friends, and really enjoyed the experience. Food was good.
Good stuff, "alternative" food choices!

This is the most Cozy spot on the map, the service is superb, and the food is scrumptious! I'd recommend this establishment to any of my family members or friends. I get hungry just thinking about this place, and really look forward to my return!

A pleasant time my best friend and I had at this place a week ago. This place is located under the Washington Convention center, it is a bit out of the way from the main road. The menu is very innovative, fresh,different and interesting. We ordered pop pie popper as appetizer, it was ok. The main dish of crab linguine is out of this world, the Wagyu double cheeseburger is also excellently prepared. I would recommend anyone to come, especially the oldies, we were the oldest patrons there, all young folks around made you feel special.

For the cafe part only as I haven't been for dinner recently.Shaw lacks options to get a good lunch. U.D. is comfortable and the food is consistent. I think they play it safe in the lunch cafe because it caters to convention goers, so it isn't the most exciting menu, but damn if everything doesn't taste good. I particularly love the fried chicken sandwich.The dining room and bathrooms are always clean, and you can see into the kitchen (which looks spotless).This is an easy recommendation.
It's in a bit of a weird spot but the people working there were awesome and the food was tasty. We had corned beef hash and yogurt parfait. Probably check the menu if you're bringing a picky eater.
Love the art, ambience and especially the food. Classics with a modern twist and global flair. There's something for everybody.
This place is one of my favorite! The atmosphere is nice and the food is just perfect!!! Especially the crab pasta i had!!
Always great, love the new menu additions. The Greek salad is to die for. Can't wait to come back.
The food was delicious and the service was stellar. Everyone in our party was happy.

I am a DC local and I'm long over due to writing this review. I have been dining at Unconventional Diner for quite sometime, and it was an absolute culinary delight! From the moment I walked in, I was greeted by a chic yet inviting atmosphere that set the stage for an unforgettable meal. The menu offers a creative twist on classic diner fare, with dishes that are both inventive and comforting. I opted for the crispy fried chicken sandwich, and it was hands down one of the best I've ever had - perfectly seasoned, juicy, and served with a side of crispy fries. The attention to detail in each dish was evident, and the flavors were simply exquisite. The service was impeccable, with friendly and knowledgeable staff making sure that every aspect of my dining experience was top-notch. Whether you're a local or just passing through, Unconventional Diner is a must-visit destination for foodies looking for a truly memorable meal in the heart of DC.

We got so lucky to snag a reservation for brunch at this incredible spot--it felt like we hit the foodie jackpot! This was our first time at a Michelin-starred restaurant, and the experience was everything we hoped for and more. Even though the staff was clearly busy, they didn't miss a beat. Everyone was friendly, attentive, and full of great recommendations that made choosing from the menu so much easier. Each dish was a masterpiece, both in flavor and presentation. We savored every bite, but the portions were so generous that we had to take a good portion of it home--a bonus treat for later! The whole experience felt special, from the elegant atmosphere to the attentive service and, of course, the amazing food. If you're looking for a memorable meal that will leave a lasting impression, this place is a must. We can't wait to come back for another round!
Good foods. Very convenient for takeout. I ordered three times during my one-week stay nearby.
Solid choice. I've been many times and will continue to come back. Very approachable food.
Hello everyone, delicious food, good service, great ambiance, recommended, thank you!!
They have the best burger here. Love coming here after work to get a burger and a large piece of chocolate cake.

Stopped by this place for a quick lunch and it was great! You pick and choose your ingredients to make your own bibimbap. Fresh ingredients with a huge variety to choose from. Not the most authentic, but definitely hits the spot when you have a craving.

The service throughout the meal was attentive but not intrusive. The server checked in just the right amount to ensure everything was to my satisfaction, and my glass was never empty. Overall, my experience at Unconventional Diner was delightful. The fried chicken was, without a doubt, the highlight of the meal, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a hearty and satisfying dish. I left the restaurant feeling satisfied and eager to return, especially for that outstanding fried chicken.

My absolute favorite comfort food spot in DC. They have a lot of healthy options as well but I love their comfort food. I had their Fried chicken at least once a week during the pandemic and I still come back all the time to get it. Whenever I eat in though I have the meatloaf it is the best I've ever had. I came last night and they were serving restaurant week, I had the chicken piccata which was terrific. This restaurant is a DC staple.
This place is great. You have to try it out. It had great food and great service. So good.
We had a wonderful dinner and server, Abiana! Food was great, service fantastic, and I will be back.

Unconventional Diner is a great spot for breakfast, dinner or just drinks and apps. My server Kierra was so friendly and knowledgeable. My only suggestion is I wish there was a bread course. Some warm, flaky bread that easily tears apart. With some olive oil. That would definitely be a crowd pleaser!

I came here for brunch on a Hot sunday, my server was extremely helpful and very knowledgeable. The service staff made sure that our water glasses were never empty. And even though they got quickly busy, we never felt rushed or un attended. We enjoyed the chicken sandwich and a very good chorizo shakshuka that our server recommended. Cant go wrong with any of their desserts, the cheesecake and tres leches were delicious. Will definitely be back!
I had a wonderful time. The bar staff were very friendly. My server Mary helped me choose what I wanted for dinner and it was the right choice!! 10/10 will come back and ask for Mary!

I came in with my friend for a casual dinner on a Sunday night, Abby was my server. she was great. very nice and personable service...... AND GREAT FOOD and design for the restaurant. Abby was really great and made the experience phenomenal, great buns too.... ON MY BURGER. get your head out of the gutter...

Everything was wonderful. Had the Broccoli salad and there was a shrimp toast special both were amazing. For main course we had the meatloaf which was so flavorful and the sweet potato curry which was rich but still vegan. Cant wait to come back for brunch.

I visited Unconventional Diner with a large group of colleagues for dinner during a conference and loved everything about it! Great food, excellent drinks and wonderful service. EnvironmentThe restaurant features a large space with plenty of seating both inside and outside. I was particularly impressed by the airy, open-concept design, which let in plenty of light and sunshine, contributing to a delightful atmosphere. Since it was a beautiful day, we opted to sit outside, which enhanced our dining experience.ServiceThe service at Unconventional Diner was exceptional. Despite our large party, our server managed all our orders with ease and organization. The food and drinks were delivered promptly, and our server was enthusiastic, friendly, and attentive to all our questions. The overall service was outstanding and greatly contributed to our positive experience.Food and drinksWhere do I start with the food. Everything was lovely! I highly recommend starting with the cornbread skillet with honey butter--it was absolutely delicious. Another standout side was the macaroni and cheese, which, as someone very particular about this dish, I found to be one of the best in the city. The moroccan taquitos were also a tasty choice. For my main course, I kept it simple and chose the double cheese burger and fries. It was surprisingly good and left me wanting more. To top it off, I had the basque cheesecake and it was incredibly good. I loved every bite. OverallUnconventional Diner is a fantastic place for both food and drinks. I thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of my visit and will definitely be returning. Whether you're dining with a large group or looking for a pleasant place to eat on a beautiful day, Unconventional Diner is an excellent choice.
The service was top notch. Our waiter was so friendly and gave us delicious recommendations. We enjoyed the outdoor seating. If you're in DC you gotta try
MyGreat staff, amazing food, and even being busy the staff was personable. Will definitely return!

Our server Henry was attentive, polite and very nice. I had the Brussels sprouts with purple cabbage, scrambled eggs, biscuit with butter and jam, and chicken sausage. Food came out timely, hot and cooked to order. Everything was tasty.

The food was tasty with many different options from curry to chicken parmesan to chicken pot pie poppers. The waiters were helpful and the hostesses were friendly. The interior is very fun with accent walls, colorful graffiti paintings, and modern chandeliers.
Everything on the menu is worth having, the food is amazing, so good and recommended!

Step into the Unconventional Diner in Washington DC for a dining experience like no other! Embracing creativity in every dish, their burger and chick n waffles defy tradition with bold flavors and innovative twists. The drinks? Absolutely stellar. And let's not forget to applaud Mireya for her top-notch service, making our visit truly memorable. With its unconventional charm and impeccable execution, this diner earns a resounding 10/10.
this pizza is amazing. the quality is very good. the speed that you get the pizza is very good aswell. the location is excellent.
Awesome all around. My go to spot. From the food to the service they never disappoint.
Excellent food. Menu is extensive and seasonal to a particularly high standard. Highly recommended.
Everything we ordered was fresh and delicious. Highly recommend! Definitely coming back.

Unconventional Diner offers a brunch experience that truly stands out from the crowd. From the moment you step inside, the modern yet cozy atmosphere sets the perfect tone for a memorable dining experience.The menu is a delightful blend of classic brunch favorites with creative twists, showcasing the culinary expertise of the chefs. Whether you're in the mood for sweet or savory, there's something to satisfy every palate. The Eggs Benedict with a unique hollandaise sauce and perfectly poached eggs is a standout dish, while the savory pancakes topped with house-made sausage and maple syrup provide a deliciously indulgent treat. I had the loaded breakfast biscuits, which was a bit salty but very good. I chased it down with the Hibiscus Citrus juice, which was soooo good. Definitely recommend!!!What truly sets Unconventional Diner apart is their commitment to using high-quality, locally sourced ingredients, resulting in fresh and flavorful dishes that leave you wanting more. The attentive and friendly staff enhance the dining experience, providing excellent service with a genuine smile.Overall, Unconventional Diner offers a brunch experience that exceeds expectations. Whether you're catching up with friends, celebrating a special occasion, or simply treating yourself to a fantastic meal, this is a brunch spot worth visiting time and time again.

During our visit to Unconventional Diner, we delighted in their loaded breakfast biscuit, complete with sausage, gravy, egg, hashbrowns, and a fluffy biscuit. Each component was cooked to perfection and packed with flavor, creating a hearty and satisfying meal. The trendy yet inviting atmosphere made it a perfect spot to start the day with a delicious breakfast.
Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Good. Food.
Friends and I go here often because it's good food and friendly service every time we visit.
Food was great and the portions were fair for the price. I was surprised the fries were so good. The service was good and staff was friendly.

I had such a fantastic time here, I heard great things and had to see for myself. Dakota provided great cocktail recommendations, and Heath provided excellent customer service. Even the hostess was so accommodating when I asked to be seated at the bar rather than my table reservation. What positive energy they all exude. Makes you want to come back here daily! Not to mention excellent fresh and tasty dishes and stunning cocktails. This is an amazing spot I am so glad I discovered.
Great Lebanese Fried Rice! Tried. Tried one of their appetizers. It was equally awesome

My friends and me made a plan to go to some place in which we had never gone in Unconventional Diner. It was go in first time in the Unconventional Diner. I think that it was our best option to chose the Unconventional Diner.We ordered the burgers finger chips and a Pepsi. The food was so good. I like their food and also my friends very happy to come this Unconventional Diner.Unconventional Diner service we received was so amazing. They made us feel welcomed and gave us an amazing experience. It's a great experience. The ambiance is very welcoming and charming. Amazing wines, food and service. Staff are extremely knowledgeable. Unconventional Diner have great place.Atmosphere is chill and cool but the staff is also really friendly. They know what they're doing and what they're talking about, and you can tell making the customers happy is their main priority. Food is pretty good.I have to say, I enjoyed every single bite of the meal in Unconventional Diner.  Unconventional Diner Service was delightful and very professional.
Awesome food, never had a bad meal! Great atmosphere . Great for groups as well. All time favorite

Unconventional Diner is truly a one of a kind dining experience you MUST go to in Washington, D.C. It offers creative takes on classic American and international dishes that blend soulful comfort with haute technique. I went with a group of friends late at night on the weekday, and there was no wait. However, it is known... without a reservation, they cannot guarantee seating and can only seat upon availability after you arrive.Reservation are encouraged during peak days--such as weekend brunch and holidays because they generally can't accommodate walk-ins. As of December 2023, you can make reservations via Resy at: resy.com/cities/dc/unconâ€? LOCATION/PARKING: Unconventional Diner is located in the heart of Shaw, Washington DC Area. It is located on 9th St NW between M St NW and N St NW. For those who can walk... It is walking distance from the Walter E Washington Convention Center. I am unsure about the parking situation since I do not recall if you can park on the street, however, I am sure there are parking garages you can park at. + EV CHARGING: EV Charging is offered with fees in some of the local parking garages near the establishment. Park anyway cuz its WORTH IT!+ WIFI (Instagram/Yelp): YEP!+ ATMOSPHERE: Unconventional Diner is truly an upscale dining experience! Its a place where family + friends + co workers can come together and have a good time.+ CLEANLINESS OF ESTABLISHMENT: The establishment was clean. Staff were seen cleaning tables when patron leave the resturant. + CUSTOMER SERVICE (GREETING): Overall the staff were extremely nice and was accomodating to my group coming so late at night. + STAFF KNOWLEDGE / ATTENTIVENESS: Although they were busy... Staff constantly refilled our drinks and was attentive to every need. + SPEED OF SERVICE: Food came out quickly.+ DRINK(s)//FOOD(s)//SHOW(s) [Rating 5/5]: I personally got the Conbread Muffin and Double Cheeseburger & fries. I got to try some of my friends Fried Chicken, cast iron brussle sprounts, and Peking duck confit.    = VARIETY: Depending on the time day different options are available for purchase. However, there is quite a large variety of food options.    = APPEARANCE / PRESENTATION: Although its mostly diner food. Expect it to look a little upscale.    = TASTE: Every food was packing a punch full of flavor. For example, the cornbread muffin was made with habanero butter, honey crystals, and pink peppercorn was so freaking good. Or the Brussels sprout had tikka masala and caramelized onions.    = QUANTITY: The portion size was mighty and still quite filling.    = VALUE: It might seem like alot of money, but its worth it! + OVERALL EXPERIENCE [Rating 5/5]: I would love to come back and visit this restaurant when I come back into town.
Excellent Shrimp and Grits! Shrimp was cooked perfectly and the grits were delicious and creamy.

We ordered some drinks and the Chicken Pot Pie Poppers which both came promptly. They were tasty and 'unconventional' but just short of extraordinary .I really love Unconventional Diner as a spot to bring people who are visiting.My coworker and I walked in and got seated quickly. We beat the rush and the place was bustling by the time we left.His entree was Steak Frittitos which was a skirt steak slathered in chimichurri and a side of fries. Mine was the Meatloaf which was veal, pork and beef with a topping of Sriracha glaze served on mashed potatoes and morel gravy. It was really very good, and different - in the best way.A service charge is included.We ended up getting buttermilk, pancakes, sweet potato shakshuka, and Brussels sprouts & fried egg. This was the perfect amount of food. The SHAKSHUKA THOUGH. Absolutely delicious. Definitely a huge fan of all of there food. We decided to get the buttermilk pancakes with everything on the side. Everything bite was fantastic. I look forward to coming back. I was a big fan of the decor and the colors of this restaurant.

Unconventional Diner offers a wonderful dining experience with fresh and inventive food. The chicken pot pie nuggets and crispy Kale appetizer were delicious, and the butternut squash chili was a delightful chunky soup. The French fries were a tasty side, and the carrot cake was a perfect ending to the meal. The staff was great, and the ambiance added to the overall enjoyment of the evening.
Staff was friendly and attentive and our food was excellent! We will definitely be back!
This restaurant is a true culinary haven. The menu offers a diverse range of dishes, each prepared with precision and care. The friendly staff adds a personal touch that makes it even more enjoyable.
Really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. The service was quick and the server was very attentive. I will definitely be back!
Great place for brunch! First time here in DC and went off of yelp. Definitely a place to visit.
The food is diner with a twist. The service was excellent. Would definitely recommend

This place has been on my list since I moved to the area and it didn't disappoint. The atmosphere is bright and cheery. We ordered the fried chicken, salmon and the duck. Our server was great and all the food came out promptly. The fried chicken was delicious, crispy on the outside but juicy on the inside. It came with a side of gravy (just a little too salty) and a biscuit. I felt like the duck was goo, came with a side of bao buns and hoisin sauce, but missing a little something. Salmon was very good too. Overall, the food was good and I would come back to try their brunch menu.Pictures: first - Salmon
The food was delicious and the server was attentive to our needs.The atmosphere is very friendly and welcoming.
We got some good food here with some out of town friends after a day of sightseeing. They loved it too
Delicious food very well portioned and the service was excellent!! Nice place to hangout with friends and family!!
location: Roma Norte, Ciudad de MÃ©xico, Mexico

text: Great, fun menu and great service!
Great food, service and ambiance. Would be happy to go back anytime! Cocktails were amazing!
yummm!!! need I say more! Quality in cost hands down great.

I recently celebrated a friend's birthday at Unconventional Diner and it was a great experience. The cocktails at Unconventional Diner are not only delicious but also creative and fun. My Filipina girlfriend ordered a cocktail with boba and she absolutely loved it. The drinks were the perfect accompaniment to the delicious food.Speaking of food, we all enjoyed our meals -- I loved the meatloaf. It was hearty, flavorful, and comforting - and came with a side. My Pinay gf wished she ordered what I got.Overall, I highly recommend Unconventional Diner for anyone looking for a fun and delicious dining experience with friends. The creative cocktails, delicious food, and lively atmosphere make for a great night out. Thank you to the staff for making my friend's birthday celebration extra special.

Pleasantly surprised by the food here - it's incredible.The menu is extensive and seasonal to a particularly high standard. The chicken and waffle is perfect for this into soul good. There is something for everyone here. The service is always great and the wine selection is nice as well.

Great spot, would definitely come back and recommend to everyone. The service was excellent. Food came out really quick even though it was really busy when we were there on a Sunday afternoon. The menu has a little bit of something for everyone. Located at a great spot. Will 100% be back.
Great food! Every time I have family in town I bring them here. They have something for everyone and you will not be disappointed.
Unique food, incredible ambiance, lovely staff!! Everything we tried was incredible! Highly recommend the biscuits, and even the coffee was incredible.
Very good food and the service was incredible! The cheeseburger is to die for. I would dine here again
It was great. I loved their Caesar salad. Everything was delicious! :) I cannot wait to go there again!

Pleasantly surprised by the food here - it's incredible! We came with a reservation on a Saturday morning. Really busy on a weekend, but were seated very quickly. I ordered the shrimp and grits. SO buttery, SO good. There's a spicy sauce that comes mixed into the grits which is so dang good. Can't wait to come back and try more of the items!
Great service here! I always know I'm going to be treated well when I see Andrew is working. I haven't seen him in a few weeks but it's still been the same great experience nonetheless

Service may have been a little slow but genuinely pleasant and friendly. However the food was fantastic! My friend and I ordered the fried chicken and salmon, both were so good. Will definitely go back!

Fresh, friendly and flavoursome!This place is really delightful.Staff are lovely and helpful. Mesmerising space to sit and enjoy the food. Importantly, the meals are delicious and beautifully presented.After many years I still find this place a pleasure to visit. Well worth a visit for breakfast, brunch or lunch!
Great atmosphere wonderful staff and great food. Offered wonderful recommendations. Highly recommend great price as well

Excellent food, I must say. The menu is extensive and seasonal to a particularly high standard. Definitely fine dining. It can be expensive but worth it and they do different deals on different nights so it's worth checking them out before you book. Highly recommended.

This was the first time that I have been to this restaurant. Cute spot. My food was delicious!!The perfect southern brunch spot. Chicken & waffles and shrimp & grits were chef's kiss. The Georgian Peach French toast with vanilla ice cream was a perfect dessert to share if you're feeling something sweet and decadent! The staffs were friendly and helpful, you can find something you love in the menu! The decor inside of the restaurant was pretty cool too.highly recommend giving this place a try. You won't regret it.

One of my new favorites!!! I do not know why it took me so long to try this place out but it is officially my new "go-to". I love that you can order online now but happy to pickup because the food is so good.
Really unique food and great staff! Grateful for this being in the neighborhood.
The food was delicious and the wait staff was great. It's worth your while to stop here!
Ate dinner here over the weekend . Don't know why I waited so long. Food was amazing, save room for dessert!! Great service, great experience!
Food was great. Atmosphere was great and Leena Ali is a phenomenal chef! Best food in the DMV!!!
Love this spot. The menu is creative, the dining room is nice, and the food is delicious. It's a nice little spot
Great food, great service. This is our favorite date night spot!
Great patio space! They do a great job of keeping things spaced out and comfortable. Get the chicken and waffles!
I love the sandwich and sweet potato. Everything is excellent I love it.

At this point, I have tried almost everything on the menu and not a single item has disappointed. My personal favorite is the steak and eggs. The service is always great and the wine selection is nice.
Unconventional Diner is my favorite place to eat all kinds of food with my friends!

This place was delicious and modern. Yes, food is unconventional but exceeded expectations.Ordered the following Taquitos - light delicious and crispy with sauce to die for Cornbread - I hate carbs usually and it was just so moist and the habanero butter was the icing on the cake, just luscious Fried chicken - smaack yo mama good, the skin was unbelievably crispy and flavorful, didn't care for the hot sauce but the cole slaw was light and not mayoo based. Gravy was delicious and went marvelously with the mashed potatoes.Meatloaf -- totally unreal and has biTs of cheese inside. Outside sauce was very good. Just a loaf of meat that was moist and flavorful. Dessert - mocha cappuccino dessert (brownie, cofffee cream and ice cream) I mean it was so clever and stunning and the textural elements added bY the chOOcolaTe malt balls was just so lovely and made the dessert epic for me .Overall pleasantly surprised as I'm a pretty critical personn. The only feeedback that I i would change is the ice cubes. The cocktails were so good and the cubed crushed ice made the drink watered down and hard to drink. Prices were reasonable and the atmosphere was not pretentious at all.
Wahooo!It's the best restaurant in Washington Dc Both food and service are excellent I loved it
Great food and service. Overall fun little spot to check out. Would certainly go back and have.

I was honestly very satisfied with my visit and procedure. I have since had surgery to correct my issues and the surgery was 100% successful.Perfect experience with both Doris and Dr. Jorgensen...I highly recommend FD for painting and other remodeling. If I wouldn't have hired another company to install our new floors and paint our kitchen cabinets, I would have given FD painters the whole job! Thanks for everything FD!
location: Radnor - Fort Myer Heights, Arlington, VA

text: I LOVE this place. The fried chicken and carrot cake are my favs.
Food was delicious. The place is so nicely decorated food came out fast fresh delicious. I'm definitely coming back here again

Loved this spot! All dishes were fabulous! I would recommend getting ALL appetizers, I really enjoyed the French onion pasta as well, our favorite was the fun modern layout of this place, get free parking on the street!
Amazing service, delicious food, trendy atmosphere.
Mike is the man - made our experience amazing. Delicious food and even better service!!
Really enjoyed our dinner here, would go back!
Love this place! The chickpea curry dish is to die for!

I want to write a review before I forget because this place deserve it! I love the decor, the art OMG!!! Only people who know about interior design and good taste can appreciate how beautiful is this restaurant, but the food my boyfriend order the egg sandwich and I order the Belgian waffles, we ended up getting another egg sandwich because I ate half of his. So good, we are definally gonna come back for lunch, dinner and brunch. Also the ladies at the counter were very helpful. Thank you for bringing a place like that to DC, I'm from Cali so this place remind me a lot like LA.
WOW this place has a beautiful decor and a passionate team surrounding it and it really shows! fresh delicious ingredients make for a wonderful dining experience

Whether you stop by in the morning, afternoon, or evening, you will find something great to eat here. Really fun and interesting food. The name of the place says it all. It's a diner, but unconventional is all respects. Really great addition to the neighborhood.

Went for a late dinner after work and sat at the bar. Service was great, bartender was engaging without being overbearing. We started with the "dirty" Caesar, which was good, and the FG, PB, and J which was interesting and delicious. We shared the meatloaf. Sriracha glaze was perfect. Would definitely go back, especially to try brunch!
Second experience and it was wonderful. Food is definitely delicious and plated to perfection.

On Wednesday 5.9.18 I brought a friend visiting from out of town. We were immediately greeted and seated by two friendly hosts. The space is beautiful, clean, and full of energy (even half full). We ordered the special gazpacho which was outstanding. We also ordered the fish sticks and the pot pie bites since they seem to be a favorite amongst reviewers. The pot pie bites were different than most of the pictures missing the yellow topping and plated differently as well. They were good but not memorable. The fish sticks however were incredible! The saffron aioli that accompanies is so delicious. For entrees we ordered the steak and eggs and the chicken parm. Both executed perfectly. While the steak and eggs was excellent it was steak and eggs. We couldn't stop eating the unique and very rich chicken parm. So much so I'm waiting for Postmates to deliver it to me again right now one day later. We wrapped up with the coconut cream pie which is absolutely the best coconut cream pie I've ever had. The best part of the entire experience was the service. If you are lucky enough to have Jasmine, you will become a regular. While the DC restaurant scene has been blowing up over the years and offering some incredible places to dine, good service is very hard to find in DC. Jasmine knew exactly when to check in to ensure we always had everything we needed. Offered great advice on dishes and was just so incredibly sweet. She is a true gem and a perfect fit in such a refreshingly new addition to the DC dining scene. It did not stop there. My friend and I observed other staff engaging with their guests and all around happy. I tried to catch the GM Donna on the way out to personally thank her and congratulate her on such an amazing team but she was busy keeping the flow and engaging with customers. So here I am writing a yelp review for the first time in years! Â¯\_(ãƒ?_/Â¯
The place is nice but the waiter was very angry and nervous. We were afraid to order :(

Went here for dinner with my two closest friends. Let's just say the company was really the only part of the experience I enjoyed. Food was hilariously overpriced for the blandness and mediocrity that we received. Mac and Cheese tasted like nothing. The sweet potato mash tasted like I was eating a candle. We audibly laughed when we saw the bill was $100. The only good thing about our meal was the grilled cheese but let's be real - that is pretty hard to mess up. Service was good. Our waiter told us he wanted us to have a nice long night, which I appreciated. The icing on the cake was when my friend came back from the bathroom horrified that the restroom was covered in urine and feces. Crappy way to end the night to be honest. If you are looking for a mild dining experience with DC level prices this is the place for you (just avoid the toilets)!

Came here to eat dinner and the food was cold and inedible. Hard to believe a place with such high ratings could serve something like this! The manager was sent over and could not have been more rude. We had to pay full price for everything. Do not come here. We will NEVER return
Room temperature water. Had to steal ice from the wife's drink. Bun for burger was cooked hard as a rock. Wasn't worth the $70.
My food was undercooked , I was very disappointed I heard so many great things about this restaurant .
Why did I get a reservation if I was still going to have to wait outside for 30 minutes
The food is awful. The cornbread as an appetizer was not cooked well. The Mac and cheese noodles were not good, and their custom drinks were also nasty. I would not recommend this place at all.
Update: I emailed management and the email bounced back as incorrect: hospitality@frg.farm
Awful food. Tastes like out if the box food.

Had a reservation for 5:15pm knowing that it might get busy on a Sunday. Hostesses ignored me for a while before looking up. Waited 25 minutes as a party of one. Entrance area was disorganized. After a 25 minutes wait WITH reservation they seated me right at the entrance where everyone was waiting. When I asked for a different table, they said they can't do it, even though half the restaurant seating was empty. Would have loved to try the food but can't comment on it as I didn't even get to that part. Do not recommend. There's better service out there.

We all know DC rat/mice problem but this was on the second floor of venue. The service was good and food decent but after eating and seeing this it kind of killed the vibe. Exterminator is def needed !
Food was amazing!!!Service was beyond upsetting.Get your food to go!We'll never come back because of the service.

Despite the numerous positive reviews that Founding Farmers has garnered, my personal experience was far from satisfactory. The main dishes served were merely average, not living up to the restaurant's highly rated reputation. However, the real disappointment came with the dessert course. The ice cream, which should have been a refreshing treat, was disappointingly melted. More distressingly, the double chocolate cake, which should have been a sweet and satisfying ending to the meal, left me feeling sick and resulted in an unfortunate episode of vomiting. In an industry that thrives on culinary excellence and customer satisfaction, Founding Farmers fell short on my visit, transforming what should have been an enjoyable dining experience into an unpleasant ordeal.
The most overrated restaurant in DC.

Their food was average. Our server Kim was friendly. However, before getting a table, I sat at the bar to get a drink for 20 minutes without even a "hello." The bartenders nor the bar backs would even make eye contact with me. Were they busy? Yes, absolutely. So did they move at a pace to keep up? No. I'm a bartender in Vegas and their service skills were disappointing to say the least. And this wasn't just one bartender, this was everyone behind the bar. No smiles. No "pep in their step." They acted genuinely miserable. Life is too short guys, find something that makes you happy, because bartending is definitely not it.

I wanted some pasta I called the order in I went to pick it up from the founding farmer restaurant at 1924 Pennsylvania Ave. NW. Eve of 8/5/22 The server was OLO no utensils in the bag no napkins was so disappointed it was a tasteless mess didn't look anything like the photo and the flavor was way way worse for seven cheese Pasta very bland and tasteless will never go there again.
Terrible experience at this place. Never went back.  Skip it and move on to another restaurant.

My boyfriend and I went on a Saturday night and the place was very busy and the hosts told us that the wait would be 75-90 minutes. Which was fine and we made the mistake to wait. After about 80 minutes, we went to check to see how much longer it would take to be seated and they told us another 30 minutes even though a lot of people who can in after us we're getting sat before us (including parties of 2). At that point, we just left because it was still packed and food wasn't coming out very fast either. It looked like a nice restaurant with good food but overall not worth being lied to about the 3-hour wait before being able to even eat.

I made a reservation a month in advance and was forced to wait over an hour for a table because they were behind and had people who were sitting for several hours who wouldn't leave. Very unprofessional and bad service. Ruined my entire day and stressed out my whole family who waited hours to eat.
Thank you Amy for making things right!

I tried to call and privately discuss the matter and I was treated about as badly over the phone as I was in the restaurant while being put on hold for 16 minutes and then finally deciding to hang up. Our experience was a disaster and our food came out 9 minutes after ordering it. So of course it was sitting in a window already prepared, but then you take a bite and it's ice cold. Server was nowhere to be found to tell about the issue. Chicken fingers were ice cold in temperature but burning hot with spice (definitely not as listed on the menu) and an empty water jug on our table didn't help cool my mouth. Beignets had a tiny sprinkle of powdered sugar but were still raw, doughy, and undercooked on the inside! On top of 15 other issues, on my way out I was having a conversation about Founding Farmers not offering a kids menus. The host stopped us and said they don't have a kids menu but they have a "smaller size" option the server can ring in for kids. I said well, we asked our server for a kids menu and she said they didn't have one and made no mention of any other options. The host then said "well, ya they don't really tell anyone cause they want you to spend money on the full size entrees". Never again will I patronize a restaurant that allows their employees to conduct themselves in this manner. Food was bad, service was bad, and obviously the restaurant's "values/morals" are bad or badly enforced.
This is the worst food ever and of course the worst service in my life. Never , ever again.
overpriced for too much food. order one for two or three people.
Strange place with dicy service and random food. Good to get drunk, which with its location explains the success
overdone and overpriced. Don't waste your time.

Can't say much about the food. Made a reservation for 8:30 pm on a week night for 4, not a huge party. Waited til 9:15 pm and still not seated (that's effing 45 minutes!). I was about to walk out. What's the point of accepting reservations if you're running half an hour behind? The receptionist didn't even bother to inform us, I sent my husband over and over to check status. Very disappointed at how the restaurant manages the customer flow.

I went to Founding Farmers with 4 friends and we made a reservation for 3pm. When we got there we had to wait 30 minutes to sit down. When we finally sat down the waiter kept forgetting that 5 people were at the table and kept bringing 4 glasses or 4 rollups. I ordered a soda as my drink and they brought out a glass of ice. They said the soda comes after the glass but my glass.WAS.DIRTY!!!!! Then they bring us cans of soda to pour into the glass. Then we wait about 30 more minutes for our food and all the notes we have the waiter about our food we ignored. Like we asked for the mini cheeseburgers without cheese and they still put cheese on it. I didn't like my food and my fork was dirty. I would not go here again.
Truly a terrible place. The service is always beyond slow, the prices are way out of line with the "quality" of the food. Please try something else. There are so many better options in the area.
Wildly overpriced place for overpaid pretentious d ouche bags. LOUD and did I mention wildly overpriced? Go to McDonalds and then find a homeless person on the street to give your money to instead.
The food is very salty and not very good. It's always crowded but I'm not sure why. The food is awful!
Went here for Breakfast was very disappointed.
Bland, overpriced. Wonder why it takes a week to get a reservation here.

Staff told me that I couldnt sit in the four seated table are beacuse I was just a party of two then sat a white couple in the four seated area and they were a couple of two. Never would i eat there again it was a pretty racist moment in there if you asked me. F**k Founding Farmers on Penn
Overcrowded, expensive, mediocre. Skip it.
What a terrible restaurant. No one should go here.
RACIST, DON'T EAT HERE. Don't waste your time with these people, ESPECIALLY people. They will cheat you for a PENNY!

The fish in my fish and chips was undercooked and had an unpleasant aftertaste, plus the chips turned out to be overcooked potato chips mixed with soggy, cold fries at the bottom, and they didn't provide enough ketchup to go with.There was also a huge line for the restrooms (at 2pm on a weekday), although I couldn't understand why such a sub par restaurant would attract such a crowd.Will never, ever go there again.

Terrible Friday date night experience. Over cooked steak(twice) and the service was just terrible. No apologizes or anything only offered to redo the steak. I kindly declined after spending almost 2.5 hours there already. It was a total disappointment.

Went there for brunch with my family: the music is way way too loud for 10 in the morning!!! we were sitting at a booth upstairs, music was blasting from the ceiling speakers, we could not hear ourselves.Besides us, several people complained about the same issue. The waiters and waitresses blamed it on a premium soundsystem that adjusts automatically. Maybe invest in a simple stereo system where you control the volume with a knob? We liked music, but this was ridiculous and it ruined our brunch experience.
too noisy. too salty. too pretentious.
expensive for what it is, went once but not twice.
Underwhelming. Bland food. Expensive. Busy. Nothing special.
They seated us 35 minutes after our reservation. We checked in 4 minutes late. Group of five with obviously hungry kids.
Their reservation system is bs. Even if you book a table they find a reason to keep you waiting
They don't treat Europeans well... Probably mistaken us with white Americans.
I have never been here.
Can I give it zero stars? Why do people go here? A suburban restaurant that doesn't deserve its District square footage.

Sears Home Repair Services-I and my family have been shopping at Sears(&Roebuck) for 80+ years. I use, or used to, Sears Home Repair for all the items bought from the Sears store. BUT NEVER AGAIN. This is the MOST screwed up, lying,scamming bunch on thieves that ever lived! I reported a 2 year old Kenmore Elite washer making noises. Took a week for a repairman to come out. Took it apart..said it was fixed.. you can now use it!...he lef...t WRONG! He was no sooner out of the driveway when all heck broke loose! Washer was in worse shape than before! Immediately called Repair number. Told repairman would call right back...never did! Recalled that evening..told the same thing...never called. I recalled and asked for a Supervisor..no Supervisors on the floor. "I will have one call you right back" Never did..Called the next morning turns out all the calls about washer being left worse that before were never logged! So I had to make another call and schedule another appointment a week later. Same repairman comes out..determines he cant fix it..orders a slew of parts! Must wait another week BUT we can still use it!!! Repairman is gone 15 minutes and washer quits and lid is permanetly locked sgut. Can't get wet clothes out! Called Repair..got the runaround again for 5 hours. Called and email Sears Customer Care in Hoffman Estates IL. Wait a bunch of idiots! Nothing they can do at all! Now I have clothes permantely locked inside a broken washer that will not turn on and next appt is 4/29.I will never EVER buy anything from Sears EVER! They lie, they cheat and are great scammers! Shame on you Sears!
The food was delicious, but it gave me food poisoning about 1 hour later.

well hello everyone its time for me to move on but you e mail me at ajcjean71@yahoo.com an i will only be emails only and go to the website at alexis.chandler74@yahoo.¡­/facebook.com/ kanishascott2004@yahoo.c¡­ god blessd you in keep you.
terrible service and food is gimmicky - so overrated

DO NOT RIDE THE METRO. DC Metro is terrible and the most unproffessional line of trasportation in the dmv. starting next year I will drive to work or if I want to come to DC for anything. You cannot rely on DC Trasportation at all
I will give no star at all if possible. AVOID, AVOID AND AGAIN AVOID! A "total disaster" front desk

I went to founding farmers this evening. I ordered the Chicken Pot Pie and the Mushroom Risotto. I ask before i order this (Because i have never had it.) does the Pot pie travel well? Because i have to take this to work and if it does not then i do not want to order it. The gentleman who was nice enough with the huge red beard tells me it should and that it should not be a problem.The first issue i notice is that there are gnats flying about this establishment which is a bad sign but i assume that they came in through the front door and it was a busy night. The second thing i notice is that the bar area smells a little. ( I say this and i know that they have plates and such from patrons that eat at the bar. But the smell was noticeable and i should have left but was short on time to go anywhere else.)I wait thirty five minutes for my order (which is not a problem if the food is going to be good.) I walk the two blocks to my job and sit and do my little bit of work. (about 30 minutes passes before i look at my food) I pull out medicine that i have to take with food with no other means of eating for the night. I look in the Chicken pot pie box and there is this huge biscuit surrounded by the pot pie filling. The whole thing looks extremely unappetizing. The biscuit is hard stale and dense. The pot pie filling is at a guess to describe is that it tasted like an old fridge. I move on to the risotto and it is rancid. There is no other way to describe it but rancid. I paid 23 dollars for this meal and left a five dollar tip. I threw this food in the trash. Not to mention the fact that the two bites of risotto and the three bites of pot pie have me sick as a dog as i type this and i am not able to take my medicine because i have no food. 1.) Founding Farmers i would like my money back. 2.) I will be telling everyone i work with about this experience. 3. ) I will NEVER eat at this location again and to say that if i ever have a bad experience at the different locations i am done with founding farmers.
Like a souped up Applebee's ...
It's unclear to me why I made a reservation if it wasn't going to be treated as, I don't know, a reservation.
I ordered a house margarita and got charged for a top shelf margarita?Left a very bad taste in my mouth...so did the margarita....it wasn't very good..
Too bland and I think it caters to a very pretentious crowd.
bad service. very bad food.

Why do people ever even eat here? I guess they have a captive audience with GW students and the IMF nearby. I don't get how Founding Farmers can cop so much ATTITUDE about such piss-poor food. What's more, a coworker of mine had her wallet stolen by one of the staff members
Eek! It reeks here, do not go.

May be good food, but if you care about customer services, please avoid this joint. If you order carryout or catering, please check your food before you walk out of this restaurant. I wish I could give them - Star. These people need to go to school or buy a book " Customer service for Dummies " and learn customer service.
No bacon available for breakfast. Undercooked eggs.

New York quality restaurant with a staff of drooling college kids whose parents cut them off so now they have to work for the first time in their life... shame, menu and kitchen are ace, hire restaurant professionals not GW rich kids.
Reservation means nothing to them. I still had to wait 30 mins extra. Overrated food and wait for this restaurant. Been to better places.
The 14th and Pst area is completely racist area, I wouldn't recommend it to African Americans.
Never go here. This place is chaotic a complete mess!
Terrible service the manager was rude to our server who happened to be black. It was embarrassing and uncomfortable.
Went there and got food poisoning from the shrimp and grits - enough said.
Food simply just tastes like it's packed with sugar and filler. Not at all a quality restaurant.
Uh. Awful.
Overpriced and overrated

I have never before been made or treated like a sub human being until I came to founding farmers. My girlfriend and I decided to visit founding farmers after hearing many great things and how great the food is. Upon entering the hostess stand was very rude to us and told us it would be a 45 minute wait or we could sit at the bar. We wanted a table so we chose to wait. We waited and waited and watched as people who came in the door after us were given a table before us. When I inquired to the hostess she just said that when our table was ready our name would be called like she didn't care at all we had to wait all this time. When we were finally seated we were seated in a cramped location. The waiter was a spanish guy with a thick accent and he gave us the worst service ever. It was so obvious he didn't want to wait on us!! I asked what he recommended and he just said everythings good pick something you like. I ordered the gingerale which was way too spicy for me and when I told him I couldn't drink it he rudely snatched the glass off the table and said oh so you just want this taken off your check? And he stormed off. He didn't even offer us dessert at the end he just asked us if we wanted split checks when we were done eating. We had to ask to see the dessert menu. No politeness no smile nothing. Me and my friend couldn't believe how we were being treated. For food I ordered the rotisserie chicken with the sweet which was delicious. My friend ordered the butternut ravioli which she said she liked. We shared a carrot cske for dessert. The food here is good at least. Overall I might come back because I liked the food but would hope to be treated a little better by the staff next time.

I thought I would give FoundIng Farmers one more try for Thanksgiving. With a set menu I assumed it would be impossible for them to ruin the meal.I was wrong. While our waitress was great, in terms of attitude, she clearly missed the mark, as did the entire serving team. If anyone is managing the restaurant they need to spend some time training all of the wait staff. The food was equally problematic. I hoped that with a set menu they would produce their best food. I assume the bus boys were cooking.Our waitress was so rushed she didn't even tell us about Founding Farmers, and what they were all about. After dropping menus I immediately ordered a cocktail, which threw her off. It is a usually wonderful mix of Knob Creek, a touch of Tabasco, and a garnish of bacon. It really is good if made correctly, whoever made it seemed to poor in Tabasco and add a touch of bourbon. I couldn't taste my bread when it came. I have never had to send a drink back in my life.I couldn't get over why they didn't give us bread, as in a basket, instead of one piece per person. The bread is pretty average, so I don't know why they aren't generous with it. Especially considering what we paid for out meal.The soup arrived immediately after the bread hit the table, and before we had ordered wine. The soup was a very odd mix of flavors. I imagine if properly done, it would have been good, unfortunately it was not edible.While we were in the middle of soup, the main courses arrived. A trained server would have taken it back and kept it warm, instead I actually ended up holding my soup while the server dropped the plates on the table. I thought the Entree was overkill. There was no need for six sides and a tiny bit of cranberry sauce. Why not serve two sides, and put some effort into them. Did I mention the food was cold when it came. For the prices they charge they could work on some quality control.Amazingly, while our server kept coming by with a smile and "how is everything", she never asked us if we wanted more wine. Our glasses were empty 15 minutes into the meal. I can't understand why they wouldn't offer to refill them, except out of laziness. Also, when my water glass was 3/4 empty a server picked it up and carried it away. No, they didn't refill it, they carried it away. I had to ask for another glass.Dessert was interesting. The cheesecake was delicious, it always is, but it had obviously been sitting out all day and was almost runny. If the waitress had come back I would have sent it back.The coffee course was also very interesting. We were not offered coffee or tea. I still don't believe this. I have never had dinner when I was not offered coffee or tea in any restaurant in the United States.It was obvious they were desperate to get us out of the table as quickly as possible. I feel bad for them. They spent so much on their concept, but can't get the food and service correct. This has been a problem on multiple visits. Rushing us out was the final straw. They managed to rush us out and clear the table for another party, but until they get their act together, I see no reason to return for bad food and bad service.
The customer service was never that great at Founding Farmers
What a let down! Overrated and pretentious. Too bad. Won't go back.
The mashed potatoes are heated in a microwave.
Disappointing - they are very slow and very rude. STAY AWAY
DO NOT EVER ORDER THE CHILLI!!!!!! It made our entire table sick with the big D.

The service was terrible. Terrible as in god awful. Our waiter was a very brash australian man who acted as though it was an annoyance to wait on us. Whenever we made a request, he would give us a look as though we weren't worth his time. Such arrogance! Our group of four spent a pretty penny and you would think when you spend that kind of money, you get good service. That wasn't the case here. I'll point out the blunders:-He took 20 minutes to get us our drinks and got one of our drinks wrong. When we pointed this out to him, he arrogantly said "no that's the right one." We asked another waiter for a menu, and sure enough, it was incorrect. And wouldn't you know - the wrong drink showed up on our bill. -He never bothered to clear our table. When we were eating dessert, we still had some plates from our appetizer and main course round on the table. -He didn't box up our food but instead brought us the boxes. I don't mind boxing up our food, but when I see waiters at other tables boxing up the patron's food and we're spending over $50 per person, it would have been a nice touch. Also, when he dropped off the boxes, he sort of "threw" them in the middle of the table without making eye contact and walked off. That rudeness was uncalled for!-He didn't even offer us dessert! We had to ask to see the menu. -He was rude, brash and inconsiderate. We usually leave a good tip but with service like this, we definitely did not. This is a shame to me because I saw waiters at other tables that looked friendly and helpful. So maybe we just had bad luck and its possible to receive good service if you get a different waiter. But likely, we won't return and take a chance finding out.

Ive been perusing yelp for awhile now as a guide for places to go and my experience at Founding Farmers was so bad, I had to sign up just to tell everyone. I heard good things about Founding Farmers so my husband decided to make a reservation to check it out. We arrived for dinner and upon walking in the restaurant, we noticed it was hotter inside the building than outside. By the time we were seated, I was dying of thirst and my husband had sweat dripping down his face. The friendly waitress brought over some water and claimed she didn't know why the restaurant was so hot. Was the air conditioning broken?? Or are they too cheap to turn it up on a hot summer day?? Or is this a scam they are running to sell expensive drinks??? My husband and I drank at least six of those jars of water they bring to the table. We noticed patrons at other tables were experiencing the same discomfort. We skipped appetizers and we skipped desserts. We dont even remember how our entrees tasted because we couldn't wait to get out of there. There has to be some sort of a health code violation out there for this sort of thing. I feel like if I stayed any longer I would have become sick from the heat. Horrible experience and I won't be coming back.
truly lousy service, average food. You really can do a lot better than this place.

I've eaten here for lunch several times since its a few blocks away from the federal building where I work, and have had a relatively good experience. The other night I walked into a seemingly open bar with plenty of people inside and was treated basically like dirt by some douche bag behind the bar. I asked if I could have a drink and the smirky reply was "Completely not. I thought you knew some one here." So apparently they were closed, but instead of just saying that to begin with the guy had to make a joke out of it in front of his friends at our expense.Tip: If you're closed then lock the door. If someone comes in after hours (although it was still relatively early) then be cordial about it as you send them on your way. This place just lost my lunch business hopefully along with the rest of my GSA associates.

what a sham!! Really dissappointing. the sales pitch from the servers was long and sounded recorded - I guess they have to keep saying over and over again to brainwash their customer! also, the bartender lied to us the night we were there. my friend ordered a 'constitution' - the bartender made him a 'blackberry julip'. we asked if this was the right drink - he said yes. guess he was banking on us not knowing the difference between a blackberry and a blueberry. well, if you lie about the farm freshness of the food - then I guess it isn't a far stretch!food was not great. drinks took over 30 minutes to get to our table - even though we told the server that we had a theatre time that night. we were paying check, choking our food down and running out the door. also, what the heck with the 'flatbreads'. we pictured a warm, thin crusted flatbread with the toppings listed - instead we got cold bread with cheese on top - why not just change the name? The potpie I ordered was just so not what I was hoping for. really heavy, doughy topping - sure wasn't how 'mama' used to make! Mussels were o.k. - but, the rest of our food just was dumped on the table. Nothing came when it was supposed to. The drinks arrived way after the starters. Just a complete disaster of a dining experience - if I could give it a 1/2 star..that would be generous.

I'm still trying to process the disappointing dinner experience at Founding Farmers - Washington. The service was painfully slow, and the staff seemed overwhelmed.To make matters worse, we were seated at our table only to have a large family seated right next to us shortly after. You'd think they'd prioritize the guests who arrived first, but nope! The family received their food and drinks before us, despite arriving after us.The food itself was a letdown. Overpriced and underseasoned, the fried chicken dish was a disappointment. The green beans, ironically, had more flavor than the main event. The drinks, however, were the redeeming quality of our meal.Overall, I'd say Founding Farmers - Washington needs to revisit their service strategy and rework their menu pricing. Until then, I'd recommend exploring other options in the area.
Very expensive,very small portions, very slow service . The atmosphere is nice but that's about it
Overrated and disappointed! Had a lot of recommendations but the food was bland and not great.
Not healthy. Greasy and too much cheese and butter or oil. Very few options for vegetarians.
Way overpriced for the hype, it's eggs and not special eggs just plain eggs people , why wait for an hour or more to pay $30 for an egg

Staff at the check-in table have horrible attitudes and are not very helpful. There is absolutely no reason to have such nasty attitudes working in the hospitality industry. If you don't like your job, find a new one. Food was also underwhelming. I do not recommend this restaurant.
Not the best farmers restaurant. Farmers fishers and bakers in Georgetown is way more my soeed

Servers don't even know the difference between prosciutto and figs. Our prosciutto bread was missing figs on top and we even show the server a photo of the dish but she claimed that prosciutto is the fig and that they don't serve the dish like that in the photo when the photo we were showing was directly from their own Yelp page. Food was ok. Probably won't come back.
Generally like their food, this is just a bad location that is probably mismanaged and not staffed per their population. They are over crowded and cant handle the dinner rush
Average. Nothing special. Food is good. It is not as seasonal as they say. Won't be back
This place is fair . I feel like all the food is salty. The brunch is pretty good but the dinner menu is just okay
Overrated and very noisy.Food OK.

At this point Founding Farmers is a shell of its former good intentions, left to rot on the laurels of yesteryear. It takes for granted the steady stream of tourists that patronize it, and delivers mediocre did and service as a result.
Disappointed. Very busy, so I expected better.
Service was not great. Food was not great. Cocktails were not great. Chances of us going back? Not great.

Upon reflection we wondered whether this place was trading on complacency and its laurels. We went in to Founding Farmers based on some previous reviews we'd read about locally whilst staying in DC. To say we were underwhelmed is the succinct summary. To elaborate, the finest piece of the meal was the prosciutto bread starter with balsamic and figs. Thoroughly recommended. The mains however were just 'meh', to use a colloquialism. My seven cheese Mac and Cheese tasted of no cheese, and the crab cake main my husband ordered could have been the 'cake' but with no crab, such was the lack of flavour and strength from the crab meat. To be honest the service was also disappointing. Our 'server' didn't actually bring us anything during the meal. We asked another member of staff to chase the drinks after waiting a good 7-10 minutes for them, and these we were bought along by another apologetic member of staff. The mains were served by another member of staff again. The amusing thing was when we paid, our original 'server' then had the cheek to suggest we hadn't tipped enough based on the 18% baseline!! Not sure such an approach is that professional or reflection of what the restaurant is supposed to be about? Feel free to go yourselves, and we may have been the 'Friday Special' but our view is tainted I'm afraid.
Overpriced, not great food, overall not a wonderful experience. Won't go back again.

When it comes to be a good restaurant, you all agree with good food is important. they have a good food but I their restroom was so dirty. I asked workers to clean but seems no one care. I won't come back here again.

My family and I had a reservation for 3:00 on Sunday. When we got there noticed it was quite crowded, so I assumed that this restaurant must be so good. However, we didn't get seated until about ten minutes after 3:00. I assumed it was most likely because it was so crowded. When we were seated, they brought us four glasses for water. However, there were five of us and they told us they would get us another glass. It took them over fifteen minutes to bring us the other glass and kept telling us they would bring the glass. When ordering drinks, my sisters and I order Coke. They brought us the glass without the Coke and came back to us later with three cans.We were there for over an hour before we were even served. And when they brought it to us, even though we asked for certain things and sides with our order, they didn't give us what we exactly asked for. However, we were fine and continued eating. The food was quite bland and the sauce wasn't good. The best thing in my order happens to be the fries. Besides all of that, the decor was beautiful. My experience wasn't the best.

I couldn't agree more with Tom Sietsema--I just don't get the hype. When they first opened in the restaurant desert which was Foggy Bottom, their farm-to-table menu meets trendy hipster mixology was novel enough to coax you past the mediocrity. Not to mention, I've never seem so few vegetarian/vegan options in a "farm" focused restaurant. They literally cook everything in meat or meat byproducts and are completely unaccommodating to inquiries for modifications. If I can find more vegetarian options at Friday's, I know you don't want my business.

If you want to be deaf just to tell people you ate with hipsters from a menu that is neither consistent or focused then this is the place for you.Brunch is much more tolerable and that gives you the rest of the day to stop the ringing in your ears.
It's an over rated, bland, chain, that claims to be local and organic, but I saw their boxes in the alley and they are NOT! It's all a scam.

The employees are careless and are just there to collect the paycheck. Managers should discuss how to have more compassionate employees. Honestly I love founding farmers but its never fun dealing with their staff....How hard could it be to sit people with good attitude and smiles

Waited 30 minutes to sit after being told wait was 10-15 minutes. After being seated, waited 10 minutes for waiter, and another 15 minutes for drink. Otherwise, great drinks and excellent food. But really?

Although this place has 4 stars with 7,600 reviews, I was pretty disappointed at the service and quality of the food. Thank lord I reserved before hand, I got a table at the time I reserved although I arrived early, the place was super packed.
