It was cute that they have a mini bookshelf with books for children and adults to read however the books were old and ripped. The waiting area was small so people were forced to wait outside. When seated, there were no server until a while later. I got the blue cheese balsamic bacon burger. It was average, I had better, but the value for the burger was decent. We also got the signature steak and the steak was burnt! We had it medium, it was definitely well done and burnt. We couldn't rip the burnt pieces out either because it was stuck onto the meat. The steak was really small and thin, not worth it's value. Another thing, I read the reviews about the dirty glasses. Our waiter came with the glasses and it was really dirty, I didn't even want to touch it or drink from it. So I ordered hot water. The cups were filled with coffee stains!! I was really disappointed with everything. I think it's about time for them to change a whole new set of cups and glasses. Everything is really old and disgusting. Wouldn't recommend this place. Definitely overrated.
way overrated and overpriced.open on christmas

After one of my friends told me not to go here, I'm glad I did. Let me explain the 2 stars. Although it was a good meal, the cost did not justify the level of service or the quality of the food. The food was good, but it was not at the level that I was expecting going into it.
Food is average. Nothing special.
weak, overhyped and under seasoned
Food was not special. Been there once and never wanted to go back. If you want American food then I'd suggest to go Sweet water tavern.
The place was not all that they are talking about. The service sucked and the food was alright.
The cornbread was delicious, but the veggie burger was bland.

The food is creative... but not very good. It's hard to understand the long lines that form outside Founding Farmers. I guess it's popularity comes from the scarcity of other formal dining options in an area with many big businesses?
Why all the lines? It's crazy! The food is not so great and the prices are high.
I don't understand the hype of this place. Better to go to Farmers Fishers and Bakers.
Overpriced comfort food. On the greasy side. Very overrated.
Overrated. It's the talk of the town, but I don't know why.
Eh. Wasn't impressive. Went for lunch and was disappointed in the staff and food quality.

Overrated. When I went the first few times I had very friendly service but that was only the first couple of times. The food was just ok/ I think the only thing I really liked were the giant helpings of dessert
Not impressed :(
Overpriced. Always crowded. Incredibly loud. Poor quality of cleanliness. I would not recommend it and I frankly don't understand the appeal.
I don't get why this place has such high reviews. They served me chicken with the feathers still on it. And the food was meh.
Don't know what all the fuss is about. Food is okay--breakfast is best bet.
too salty.
Always a wait even with a reservation at the Georgetown loaction.
The crab cake was delicious but the steak was pure fat. Wasted my money.
Just not very good!
Ok food.... kind of dinery
Too noisy, average food, slow, inattentive service.

This place is OK, went for Sunday Brunch, way too crowded and they could not keep up with the food. Neat menu items but sometimes just gets way too creative on the food, simple is good too. OK, not incredible and been there a few times.
Just Ok
Food is nondescript, atmosphere ok. Nothing special.
Pver priced and caters to a yuppie crowd.
Food was great, but it is so loud from 11:30 on that it is impossible to have a conversation. Breakfast is a better bet.
Service was slow. Food was OK, but expensive.

The food was all right, better than the Tyson's branch but maybe that was just luck. Everything was a bit greasy but every once in a while I guess that's not too bad, definitely not an every week kind of place. What really bothered me was the bar. Their bartenders are very snooty. They refuse to make any changes or adjustments to their drinks and refused to make custom drinks (nothing fancy, my wife just asked for a lemon drop martini) and they said no... Kind of ridiculous.
Too busy, too loud, too hectic and the food is just okay.
I have been three times, hoping to like the place. It was edible but not that great. Won't be returning.
I've had better.
Had the fried chicken...should've have gone to popeyes..
Not as good as I thought it would be.
This place could be really really good but everything is so salty!
This place is so overhyped---there is nothing that special or tasty about it. It is a blah environment with blah food.
I had the land and sea dish and I wasnt impressed... I actually like their sister resturant better. Maybe I will try it again, but the first time was a fail. :/
I went three times with my husband. For the first time, the food was terrible. The third time, the food was OK.
Not sure the food is worth the super long wait......
This was OK, better than their waterfront restaurant

All our workers and our company employees are professional movers. We can start your move as early as 8 a.m. If you are not sure about your move date, that is not a problem! We can tentatively schedule you in order to lock in your rate and then just change your date at no extra charge. We also offer student, military and government discounts if you qualify. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to call me, Office Number 202.723.0792
ok
The only thing nice about this place is 1. the location right along the waterfront and 2. the cucumber cocktail.
Delicious food but too pricey for what it was. I would still recommend it.

Excpected a lot more from this group. I've tried several different times of day in different groups and alone. Menu is so so, service a fail for me too. Many other (hidden) gems in this neighborhood alone.
Went here for Xmas. I ordered the Yankee Pot Roast and it was watery and bland.

This place is all style over substance. You'll like it if you're into gimmicks, that and the young crowd will distract you from the average food and super slow service. Usually full of hipsters taking pictures of their mac'n cheese and bland cornbread
Food was so-so, but the atmosphere was nice.
Too generic overall !
Really?! Does people seriously think this place is worth 4 stars out of 5?! Ok. If you are a foodie, you won't think the saw way.
The food and drinks were great ... but they did take a while to arrive.
Food is mediocre and the service is sooooo sloooooowwww.
This place is okay very average

.My girlfriend ordered a margarita from the bartender and we sat and talked.we were only there 20 minutes but when we asked for the check and she was astonished that the margarita (served in a low rocks glass), was 12$.I think the default standard drink, without mention of the want for a premium brand should always be considered, a house brand not premium. Cost usually 8$ with rail tequila, less in a low portion glass.
My experience for brunch: Loud. Busy. Expensive. Overrated. The food is locally sourced and, therefore, very important. Guess I should've expected it.

Overly eclectic menu with more misses than hits, and doesn't seem organic (is Sysco organic?). Service is spotty and ranges from disinterested to bad, and it's not really a fun scene. Heard good things about brunch, but otherwise, Yelp said it best "I've experienced better."
Food usually good. Service always has an attitude.
Super overated!
I do not understand the hype and high praisefrom washingtonian magazine. To me, this place is a middle of the road spot. Food is decent, but best in DC? No way. Brunch is fairly good.
overpriced, food was meh, wait was super long. would not return.
food ok at one dinner, better at a brunch. prices outrageous.

Very crowded. Hip and trendy. The food was decent. The bozo bartender was drinking with his customers, drunk off his ass, and hit on my girlfriend. Great. Not going here again unless it's the only option short of starvation.

Last month I took my out of town friends to Founding Farmers. Even though I don't like this noisy, crowded and pretentious place my wife had already made reservations. We arrived five-six minutes early and asked for our table. Since our party of four were not complete we were encouraged to have drinks at the bar. Eventually we were seated on the second floor. As soon as we ordered our food the waitress started going through the dessert list. As Dave Barry would say "I am not making this up." Non stop. She told us that since it would take sooooooo long to get the desserts we should order them as soon as we could. This is even before our food have arrived. Obviously the message for us was order and eat as fast as you can and get the hell out..My cheezburger (they have some fancy name for it) was not bad but the fries were horrible. Greasy burned pieces of potatoes laboriously scraped from the bottom of the pan. When I complained the server suggested that I order side order of fries. The rest of our group found their food mediocre. Nothing special to justify their prices.To make a long review short: Founding Farmers have become city slickers..
over priced-not worth it. bad service.
Sslllllloowwww service.
Mediocre.

I want to like this place, I really do. But I can't. I have been here three times now and the service has been exceptionally slow. They've RUN OUT of food once (and certainly have a tendency to not have things "available" on a regular basis)... I had a reservation and STILL got sat at those large "community" tables.. honestly, I left Europe a long time ago.. I ordered halibut. It was overcooked and when I sent it back, I got a greasy, oily slop. Seriously? For damn near $30 it shouldn't make me sick. The red velvet cake was good. A little overwhelming in the sweet department but that's how red velvet is supposed to be. The macaroni and cheese is meh. I've definitely had better. The fried chicken was.... well, if you're from the North, maybe thats acceptable fried chicken. All in all, if the waiter hadn't comped my drinks and apologized profusely for things out of his control- he even said that their managers were still getting the hang of ordering food- I would give this one star. Maybe in a year or two. Save your money and go somewhere else. It's overpriced for the service and quality. Clearly management has some issues to work through.
The food here was on the decline. It was a much better spread before. I was disappointed.
Not as good as it used to be. The quality of food has declined considerably and is not a go-to spot any more.

So after reading reviews for this place, I was skeptical. I had actually even postponed coming here. However, it isn't fair to judge something based solely on others opinions so I had to try it. When we first came in, we were greeted by two unfriendly hostesses, but our waitress was lovely. The food was fine, nothing special.
Very small portions. Food is meh. Everyone makes a fuss about it not because it's good but because it's one of the few places in D.C. where you probably won't get food poisoning.

While the ambiance was lovely and the service attentive, the food fell a bit short of my expectations. Some dishes were delicious, but others lacked the flavor and creativity I was hoping for. Overall, an average dining experience

Service was great with a great view and atmosphere.....the food was not the greatest, for the price and amount of people waiting outside. I hate to say it but Cracker Barrel, I Hop, and even waffle house taste a lot better. The French toast was an additional $3 and it came out as a French toast stick...but better than the microwave ones....the veggie patty was not an imitation patty, it was rice, beats, and beans...had no description so if you were hoping for a beyond patty than you will be highly dissatisfied. The cheesy grits had no flavor and was thick cuts...never had grits that looked like rice pudding.

The food is pretty good but we got here at 12:45 and our reservation was for 1. And we finally got seated at our table and it look 30-40 minutes to get our food. The place was packed though. But it is a nice restaurant with good food but it took a long time to get.
It's fun to walk around and try food. It difficult to find parking and a bit pricey. Some very unique food items however. I would go again.
Nice ambiance, nice patio view of the fountain, and good food, but portions are small, prices are high and very long wait. Better make reservation.
Breakfast is ho hum... think you're better off at the Old Ebbitt Grill.        .
Over-hyped but nice for a date night
Ambience, vibes, service are prompt. Downside is didn't like the food we ordered. Came cold. We were in a hurry , so we left. 3 stars for the ambience.

The food and atmosphere are great. My wife and I both loved it, but the service is not very good. What did we basically feel about the waitress we had? At one point, it took my wife more than 40 minutes to get the cocktail she had ordered (and by then the place would be empty of lots of tables).
It's was good food. Service could be better but, it was busy so maybe that played a part. Drinks were good, food was better.
Overpriced for what you get... even for DC.
Food here is only alright. Came here for both breakfast and dinner, wasn't too impressed each time.

I ordered many items for my dinner but my order had a dish missing though the food quality was satisfactory. And they served the other dish after informing him cause he confused it with some other woman's order.
I had reserved a table at 8:30 but they were unable to sit us down until 9:00 PM. What's the whole point of reserving a table if you can't have an open table for the costumers.
This was our second visit for breakfast/brunch and it was excellent. The food is delicious and the portions are huge. The service is excellent as well. We'll definitely be back again.
Very good, just expensive. It has lots of good options if you want to try more things
Food was ok 6.5 out of ten. Customer was alright as well nothing special much better places to choose from
The food was ok. There is no room to enjoy dinner. The tables and seating was very close together.

Not satisfied with customer service- rude and overly crowded ! They were not responsive to our complaint and did not even care that we wanted to talk to a manager ! The food and menu quality is good tough
food is good , service was slow and bathroom was dirty
Took a long time to seat us even though we showed up on time for our reservation. Once we were seated, we enjoyed the meal but honestly nothing special.
Great food. Make sure you make an reservation to eliminate a long wait time.

This place has raving reviews online, and is considered to be one of the top brunch places in DC, however I did not find it to be all that amazing. The food was okay, nothing out of this world. I had the eggs Benedict for breakfast, and the egg ended up being a bit overcooked for my liking. The potato on the side was also meh making the entire experience memorable for not the right reasons.

Over rated except for the brunch which is pretty good. Otherwise just overrated if you get my drift. And brunch is only worth it if you love to stuff yourself. We had the chicken fried steak and shrimp and grits. The chicken fried steak just had my mouth watering--but only before I actually ate it. It was not much better than one at an I-Hop. Shrimp and Grits a bit better. With the competition they should be better. Breakfast is good though if you want a lot of food.
Diff fdxfggfffxfgggfffzzfxfcfggffffgfffffffgffcfuccuzcx-cchfchixhzcucucxuxxcccuxxuxufxxzhugohojigjogoihjih-jgjhjjjjjjjjjjjjvjjjhvojohzjjijvvvbvgvjvvxvdxjyjhj-jjxDdxxDd_|.fFgcuhd
Brunch was so-so, service was ok
It would be nice if they had a kids menu--plenty of kids seemed to be there. Overall good is good.

Thought it was a little over rated. Had the blueberry pancakes, thought Cracker Barrel's were better. Had the FF scrambled eggs and felt like they were a little under cooked and runny. Did the thick cut bacon with pepper and maple. The bacon was over cooked and could hardly taste any pepper or maple. And lastly the English muffins were board line stale.
Food is mediocre but service is great. But food is the reason to go out to places like this.
the food was good but a good service is something that makes the difference and also the good review. that's why i'm giving them just 3 stars

So this was a recommendation from a family friend and lets just say that we were not disappointed. We made early reservations for 4:30 so that we'd be able to eat casually before our concert at Capital One arena. We were glad we went early on that Friday night because it really started getting busy around 6. We ordered the Brie and Cornbread for our appetizers. My wife ordered the crispy chicken salad and I ordered the Chicken and Waffles. The chicken was so juicy, that on my first bite, it squirted juice almost to the other table :). We were so full that we didn't have room for dessert. We can't wait to go back!
this place has really gone downhill over the years. the food and the service are both sub par at best now. not worth your time in a city of so many options!
Over priced for food that could have tasted better and the service was decent.
Average!! Chicken & Waffles were okay.
It was okay. Nothing really stands out.
A fancy and more expensive Cheesecake Factory.
Great location, experience mediocre. Nothing genuine about the place.

Had to make it here during my brief trip to DC because it has thousands more reviews than any other restaurant rated on Yelp. Because of this, I mistakenly thought it would be incredible. We were finally seated after waiting thirty minutes for our 8:45pm reservation . However, the restaurant was bustling so I told myself it would be worth the wait. We ordered the chicken wings as an appetizer - these were pretty tasty - but we were most excited for our entrees: shrimp bucatini and chicken pot pie. These were both let downs (although the pot pie had a beautiful, flaky, golden-brown crust). I understand the allure of farm to table but at the end of the day, it's not something you can rely on to make your food taste good. I could see myself liking this place way more than I did if the food wasn't so bland.

I would have given them 5 stars a year or two ago but their quality has suffered a little. The food is great, atmosphere is nice, and overall it's a great restaurant but it has seen a slight decline in overall quality. Unfortunately their reservations seem to be meaningless, and if you have a 7pm youll probably be seated by 8, which is very annoying. Overall, I am a fan but the wait times and lack of quality reservations lower the score.

Good decent place. Nothing fancy. I would definitely make a reservation. I didn't and was waiting a long time. The farm bread with proscuitto was very good. The chicken fried steak was very good. I have had better cornbread in the past but it was ok.
Food was okay. Nothing to get excited over. It's more of a tourist trap than anything else.
My husband and I agreed that it was mediocre at its best. Super long wait and not so friendly staff. Food was average and took very long time.
Read a lot about Founding Farmers but did not see a big different to other cafes, the food was average but the service was great!
Great food but very long wait time

The wait was pretty long, but their food.. oh man... The cornbread was delicious! I don't really think their pasta selection is great, but I'd recommend trying it out. The parking is pretty convenient but it could be better. There are corporations everywhere so this place gets pretty busy. Just be aware. They could definitely up their game a bit, but it's worth going for a quick bite on an afternoon.

I have been going to this restaurant for quite a bit now. Their service is pretty good, but they mess up my order on a daily basis. I wouldn't go here if it wasn't so close to my work. It's mediocre at best. I did have some awesome lunch experiences here though!
Food was pretty good but the service was not! Had to ask for everything! Ketchup, creamer, jam, butter, etc. Capreishia was on the verge of rude and really couldn't be bothered.

I just don't get it. The food is ok, the drinks are ok. The vibe is great, so I suppose that's what keeps people coming back for more. I'll come back when the out of town relatives find it on their list of best places, but will never be my first choice.
It's an okay place. I am confused as to why people wait in line for this place.

Honestly, this place has a lot of hype, and I was definitely let down. The food is decent but nothing too out of the ordinary or high quality, and the eggs benedict was pretty salty. The fruit was not fresh or good quality, and seemed like a fruit salad from Safeway, to be honest. The best part of the meal was the English muffin, which was homemade and really tasty.The ambiance is nice, and the service is good, but for the price, you can definitely get better food elsewhere.
This place is over rated because i went here based on good reviews it has but its nothing great
Not bad if you get breakfast. You'll want a reservation and even then, expect to wait.
Server rushed is the entire meal... annoying!
Good, not great. Kind of run-of-the-mill, if you ask me. I would go again with my family since there's something for everyone on the menu. Make sure to make reservations!
Drinks are better than the food. There's one down the street from my house so it's easy to walk to, but they close kind of early for a bar. If there's nothing better to go to this place is fine.
Wait for my table last saturday for too long.
Went the other day and was so bussy that i couldnt get a table.Get a reservation before.
Underwhelmed. Food is decent enough but they're trying too hard.
Great food. Always busy. Food is always good but service is not that great. Too busy.
decent food
The food was okay, not outstanding. The mood is good. The location is good. The notion behind it is good.
We were only in the city for 3 days and managed to eat 2 meals here due to the first one being SO amazing. We had great service both times and the food was perfect. Everything was cooked perfectly.
I just wanted to say that the food was good for breakfast and Brunch.D.R

Not great and not bad. I was with an out of town group and they ended up wanting to visit here. It`ll appeal to everyone, and my guests from Woodcliff Lake, NJ loved it. The older daughter of my friend even said this was the best restaurant she ever visited. Good for her. I would return with another out of town group, but with my DC people, I`ll visit a smaller, quieter DC establisment.
It's OK. Go for Brunch.
Its a good brunch place. We are here quite often.
It was okay. Not really impressed by the food. I've had better.
Food is good. A little over priced. Cool ambiance.
It's not bad. It's just not good. It is a little overpriced and way overhyped. Go if you want mediocre food you can tell people about.
place is cool cocktails are great food is really mehhhh. Nothing special but good value if you are into huge portions
We went there for breakfast. The location and food was good but the staff was rude. We experienced much better service and hospitality elsewhere in DC.
Food was nothing to write home about
nice
I thinks I need to go back and review. At least I can really make heads or tails of the place....
Not as good as the hype.
The food and the drinks were both good, but definitely overpriced. The service was perfectly adequate, but also not stellar. In the end, it was a good place to go, but not worth the expense.
Always crowded, but decent.
Great food, but the hostesses can be a little rude.
Expensive meatloaf. Nuff said.
just cool
like

I have been coming to this place since I first moved to DC, I always take guests but after my last visit I wanted to write a review. I took my my boyfriend there for the first time a few weeks ago and realized that while the ambiance and concept are good, the place is overrated. There are now many restaurants in DC that do the farm fresh concept well, Founding Farmers is just average. We got the Farmhouse Platter and Pimento Cheese farm bread to share. Both were A-OK, nothing bad but nothing that makes you say wow. The chili on the farmhouse platter was the best part. We also got a few drinks, all of which were tasty but small and overpriced. Next time I will try an underrated restaurant.
Ok spot
good food, always crowded. a little pricey.
Great breakfast, great drinks, so-so dinner menu
Excellent food but VERY NOISY. Do not expect to have a business conversation at this restaurant.
Good customer service, great fresh food.

Not bad, but not worth all the hype. The Salmon with mashed potatoes and asparagus was good but overly lathered in the teriyaki-esque sauce it came with. The presentation was nice on a wooden board, but again the sauce was over the top and soaked the board. All in all, a nice experience, the drinks were good and the service was fine.
Decent! Pretty good lunch, price is average for dc location!
not friendley but very good prices

I share the view of many others in their reviews. This place serves good food but nothing like the hype that it has garnered. We had the corn bread, gnocchi, and the prime rib. This is what I expect from a restaurant where I spent what I did - the food was good but nothing to write home about.
Very good food, but small portions. And very loud.
I've had reservations here three times and have still had to wait upward of half an hour or more to be seated. Drinks are good but spendy. Food is unique and tasty.
Wait and service are ridiculous.
great place. would definitely recommend
It's good! Nice dishes, Nice waitresses. We went here several days ago. But I still remember the taste of my dinner.
Service and food ok... greater attention could be paid to both...
Honestly, for all the hype and two-hour lines, it's a total meh.
yummy!
Food & service is not all that.
great food and excellent drinks!!!
it ok but can do better
It's good.
It's a nice place for the yuppie, foodies.
cool
too busy, too noisy. no big deal on prices either.
LOUD. but good food and fun place to hang out
Its cool but when I went for brunch it was packed and the service was slow and I felt ignored. We love the food but the service was too bad. Loved the pretzels!

Not what I expected. The food comes out at different times , the place is packed and loud. And the food was not all that to us and there were 4 at our table. The server was overwhelmed. Younger crowed so I think that's why the reviews are so good.  I am picky and hence the name. ehhhh naw not that great.
nice brunch place
food is pretty good, but service could improve.
I find a little expensive for the food.
Amazing brunch! Excellent service and all around great environment. I especially liked the eggs benny.

Went for the Sunday brunch and it was a buffet style brunch. The french toast and shrimp and grits were good. Everything was good nothing superb. I will go back and try their regular breakfast. Hopefully it is better.
Nice spot. Nice atmosphere p. I would go again.
I wasnt a big fan of the food. My entree was average.

I haven't been to founding farmers in a while- but I remember the food to be pretty ok! The service was quick and friendly. We sat at the bar and had a good time watching them make drinks. I'd go back for brunch.
Was an ok place
food is good but service is generally slow and unresponsive

I gave this restaurant only 2 stars for the bartender's service skills and 3 stars for the food. I was sitting in the bar area for a lunch and ordered a glass of ginger ale with my meal. The bartender served my drink with a small glass. When I asked why my glass was small, he said I did not want ice. I was very surprised with the fact that they were so cheap. If you prefer your drink without ice for any reason which you maybe sick or don't like the taste of drink with ice, you will get a half size of drink even though it is a cup of ginger ale.During my last few experiences in the Founding Farmers, I also found the food was not excellent on taste or presentation as it used to be.
I tried the shrimp grietz, but it was sour. Over priced. Too salty for the crispy shrimp.
This is good for the family but defintly not if your having dinner with friends.
Not bad. A little pricey for what you get but all in all a solid experience
Overrated.
Good food, but over priced and the drinks had way to much ice in them to be worth the money they charge.
Doesn't quite live up to the hype.
They won't seat you even you have a reservation until all parties present

Went the other night with my girlfriend and her mom. Food was great as always. I ordered the salmon and my girlfriend ordered the chicken and waffles. She could not finish it but she said she loved it, and I have had it before and it is very good. Only reason I'm giving 3/5 is because I had a 7pm reservation and called at 6:30 to say that I would be 10 minutes late. The hostes told me to push my reservation to 7:30 because they only have a 15 min grace period. I could have made it before the grace period bit we both agreed to be on the safe side path the reservation to 7:30. When we got there at 7:25 we had to wait until 8:05 for our table to be ready. I understand the food is good and you guys our busy because of people like me telling my friends about this place. The this is its bad business to overbook yourselves past capacity. When I have a reservation pushed back 30 min I don't expect to have to wait an additional 35 min to be seated with guests it was embarrassing.

Plus is that the food is fresh and well cooked. The planked salmon is outstanding. Minus is that it is one of the noisiest room I've ever been in. In the panoply of American restaurants, it rates near the top. But except for the salmon, there is not much imagination. Desserts are huge. Order one for two.

We went when they had a fix menu and the food was really good! lots of food and delicious... wouldn't be able to talk about the regular menu, but would recommend as the service was good too. Make reservations before you go.
It's a good restaurant but a bit expensive.
