all american. Good atmosphere. a little corpate.
Breakfast is good, service could be better
Solid meal. I usually goes to their sister restaurant, Farmers & Bakers (gtown).
Good food, but very pricey!

Don't know what the hype is all about. After waiting for 30 mins even after a reservation, the food was mediocre. Nothing to rave about. The place is at an ideal location, ambiance is nice and service was decent.
First few time I loved this place. Tried the Fried chicken and waffles the slaw that came with was awesome! Def worth a try

Founding Farmers is great the prices are not totally outrageous considering the quality ingredients and handcrafted cocktails. A great lunch, happy hour, date spot. I knocked it down a star bc often is is much too cowed, the wait is much too long and the staff is in the weeds. I feel they should be better prepared.
Food and wine was great. Service could be better.

The drinks here are fantastic out-of-this-world!!!! But there are virtually no discount options or cheap drinks. The food is good- creative and great presentation, however it's very basic American fare, none too exciting. Kitschy atmosphere. Would go back with kids.
Okay food, too hyped up for me, and the service is always slow

Out of town , got here on a Saturday night and it was packed . The wait was about an hour for me and my three friends . The hostess was a little snotty but I haven't met one in a big city that isn't . If your from out of town I suggest you take a nice walk while you wait for a table . Luckily we had a photography gear so we walked around and got some great shots . Dc is beautiful at night .The waitress barley paid any attention to us and wasn't even looking our direction while taking our order. Maybe working in Marketing has skewed my view on the service industry but I'm sure you should service your customers so they are pleased .When I received my drink it had floating particles in it with a cloudy glass I received the farmers daughters burger which was delicious! My friend went on to say it was the best burger he has had in a while. In all honesty Come when it's not crowded Make a reservation Order a burger
Do you love butter? Then this is the place for you.

I love their blueberry pancakes but I feel that they are not always consistent with their food quality. I've gotten the scrambler for the first time and was absolutely disappointing. Will definitely go back for their waffle & pancakes though.
ok, food was tasty but salty. VERY noisy (not energetic...just noisy!!!)
Meh. Is nice to have a meal made with fresh ingredients...
Food was good but it was crowded and very noisy.
The food was good,the service was great,but definitely not worth,the two hour wait!
It used to be amazing, but my last few times have been awful. Wrong orders, egg shells in my food, waiting forever. I don't think I'd go for anything but their drinks.
good but way over hyped
Decent food but bring your check book.
Seems to have gotten lazy in its old age!
good food! Great drinks!
Good food and slow service, as always.

three stars. Great food but I still can't figure out why the service is slow! Go, but don't go on a day when you are in a hurry and need to get in and out - because you'll need to plan to take your time here.
The food is good but not great...the fired green tomatoes are good.
it was a-ok!
Service seemed to be more of a scramble than a flow. Food was good but not great for the price.
Overhyped, overpriced, underwhelmed.
I loved the drinks but it was over hyped and everything was lacking seasoning.
Overall delightful food experience and service was good.
Good for breakfast
Outstanding for breakfast foods. As for lunch and hamburgers, not a fan at all.

I have heard that their Fried Chicken dish was to die for and one of the most popular dish. Well, if you were expecting a crispy southern buttermilk fried chicken then you will be very disappointed as I was. The chicken was not crispy (how can you make fried chicken not crispy its beyond me?) You get two small pieces and one tiny side and some starch for $16, no farmers or farmers wannabee wants to pay for that. Yes, its in Dc and its on Pennsylvania Ave, but if you're going to call yourself a Founding Farmers and charge non farmer price then your fried chicken should be crispy and juicy. So my search for great Fried Chicken will continued but not at Founding Farmers.
too noisy and crowded...
Nothing special. That's all.
great menu, okay atmosphere
The waitress was horrible, but the food was great. :)

I've been here for the dinner a few times and the food is fine. Not great. Dont forget to ask for the veg menu as they never ask if you want it or give it to you without asking The 3 stars is really for the atmosphere. It is full of windows and just enjoyable to be in. They also have a great drink menu. I never go there without a reservation!

The best thing about this place is the frosted glasses you can get if you sit at the bar. Also, the music played in the bathroom is pleasant, as is the bathroom decor.If I were reviewing this a little while ago, I would have given it more stars--I miss the vegan fried chicken sandwich it used to have on the menu! The bacon veggie burger is good too, but come on. We need vegan fried chicken sandwiches! I also miss the fried tofu and chips that used to be on the menu. It was so good.
I am consistently impressed with the food here but don't expect a quick meal. I went with a group of 8 people and it took over an hour to get our food.

This was not the anticipated "great eating experience" I thought it would be. I took my family there to celebrate my son's graduation from high school. He wanted to go to Old Ebbit, but I hoped to provide him with an alternative that i believed was equally as good as our traditional, family dining place.First off, the host (some guy at the front who was not friendly or nice) that greeted me and my family looked as if he were having a bad day. I soon realized that this was his personality. Okay, you DO NOT put someone like this upfront to greet your customers or regulars...FAIL! Secondly, the waitress: she was very nice and responsive, which allowed me to recover slightly. Next, the food: not as good as I was hoping it would be for my family's first visit. The signature meal that my wife and daughter ordered (chicken and waffles) was not good: the chicken was over-cooked and dry and the waffles were way too crispy. The mac 'n cheese side was...okay.The tastiest dish and prize-winner goes to the mini burgers...delicious! The friend green tomatoes were good, too. Overall, it was just above average.
Get the carrot cake... it's the best thing ever. That's all you need to know.
These guys want to make things right and will go out of their way to do so.
Overpriced and overrated but good food

Hello fresh!Everything I ate was tasty and you could tell that they pay attention to what's in season. I came in with a large group, and we ordered half of the menu. It was a great atmosphere, decent food and good service. I'd stop in again.
The 17-vegetable salad, once a revelation, is now just a salad.

So, I'm probably a bit biased - I hosted here for about four weeks- lets not get into the drama of why I quit.. ANYHOO, as a foodie, and as someone who appreciates good quality food, FF half meets the bill. Ive eaten here a grand total of 7 times now. The food is good, sometimes great, but never excellent. I still think Agraria does a better job on seafood- especially mussels.. oh god. The vegetarian options, minimal... unless you REALLY enjoy salad... So here are a few ideas- make a reservation to avoid the group tables (seriously? communal tables...), drinking (farmer jons, especially) helps make the experience and long wait more enjoyable/tolerable, and avoid that nasty pear flatbread and the overcooked potato chips. My picks: - southern chicken salad- the halibut- french fries- french dip sandwich (OMG!!!!!! the only amazing thing on the menu)- apple pieConclusion: I'd never spend my own cash on anything but the prime rib sandiwch.. and the bar... BUT, if someone's treating you, it can be okay..

Have to agree w/ everyone else on the sluggish service, be prepared to bring lots of patience. Otherwise, FF was a good experience. Good fried green tomatoes and red velvet cake -- wasn't too crazy about my meaty entree, but that's my fault for accepting the hearty dish suggestion even though I'm deficient of carnivorous tendencies. Despite this, I LOVED their water. Best water I've ever had in my life. Make sure to stay partially-dehydrated when you dine here because you are going to want that triple-carbon-filtered water. Definitely delish. The water alone deserves 5 stars.
Brianna was our waitress. She was so very accommodating, So very sweet, cheerful and friendly! The food was very unique and very delicious!
This place is always full, everyday, all times of the day! The ambiance is great and the food is very nice.
The food and cocktails were good. The restaurant was very busy and a little noisy. The service was excellent.
Food tasty but service needs improvement and too loud for me. I strongly recommend the brunch buffet great selections available

We went on the weekend which was very crowded so come with a reservation! They have both an a la carte traditional breakfast and a breakfast buffet, but we opted for the a la carte although the buffet was reasonably priced and had an overwhelming assortment to choose from. Our service was speedy despite the crowd and my entree, a goat cheese and beet egg hash, was surprisingly a delicious flavour combo. Prices are about standard for D.C and I would recommend this to anyone visiting the city! I plan on coming again to try out their dinner menu!
Over all fun and unique foods. Good flavor. Only thing I'd not recommend the prime rib dip. Dip was a Gravy, not an aus ju. Bread did not soften
The prosciutto bread bites and blue cheese bacon dates were amazing and our host Kyra was even better !
It was friendly and clean and the food was good, not great but it's a wonderful environment and I'd give it another try.
The food was Delicious! Very nice atmosphere. The staff are very professional. Would definitely be back!
Beautiful decorations, great service, drinks tasted amazing, only gave 4 stars because it was $50 for 3 small drinks ...
A really nice brunch spot, so much food for the price you pay and our waiter was so nice and attentive!
Food was great as was the service. Get there early as the fill up quick. Good portions
Excellent burger with excellent service! Had a reservation for lunch, was quickly seated, enjoyed the atmosphere and company.Also had the Ahi Tuna as an app, delicious!Will definitely visit again!
My friends who's been here said that this place is great. I hope that one day I will be here with my friends.
Good service!! Good food! Overall, nice experience!!!
A good restaurant especially for large groups. We also go there when people are in from out of town and it's not perfect but it's quite good.
Food 5 stars Service 4 stars Ambiance 4 starsIt's our third time coming back to this restaurant. We're never disappointed in the food.
Good was good not great. And the service the three times I was there went from great to ok.

Cozy restaurant in downtown D.C. We had an outdoor table, with great ambience. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast with our family! The waitstaff was very sweet, however, we did have to flag our server down a few times to get more coffee, milk, and sugar. All in all a great meal and experience!
Great food, great atmosphere and good service. Nice outdoor seating. Maybe the best chicken salad sandwich I've ever had.

My wife and I ate here tonight. Inside dining was pleasant, if a bit noisy. Our waitress was very nice and everything was correct. The crab cakes were excellent as was the Yankee pot roast, which featured the expected tender and flavorful beef and vegetables that had not been over-cooked, as can so easily happen with that dish. The French fries were over-salted, but otherwise nicely prepared from actual fingerlings of potato, and the blueberry crumble ice cream was, sadly, bereft of much flavor or a sense of being made with cream. The wines were good and comparably priced to neighboring restaurants. So: food 4.5/5, service 5/5, ambiance 4/5 and value 4/5. I would give this restaurant 4.5/5 stars if that were an option.

The vibe of the restaurant was great right from the start! We went around 7:30 PM and the bar was busy as well as the restaurant itself. It was really nice inside with lots of great decoration. The bartenders and waiters/waitresses were AWESOME as well, super kind and knowledgeable about the menu. We started off with the fried green tomatoes which were SO GOOD. They come with 2 dipping sauces. For my meal, I got the crazy corn chicken salad. I took off a star though because unfortunately, my corn salad came without corn I ordered this salad looking forward to the roasted corn but there was just no corn which was definitely very disappointing in my opinion. However, as for the ingredients that did make it to the salad, the food was very good. They forgot to bring out the cornbread that it is supposed to come with, so I asked for some on the side and it was definitely very good! Though not pictured, my mom got the goat cheese ravioli with chicken cutlet which was super tasty - I'd definitely recommend that!! My dad got the short ribs with mashed potatoes and he seemed to love them. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this place, I was just slightly disappointed that my salad was missing the key component.
Service was wonderful food was decent. Sat outside and the atmosphere was nice. Would try again.
The food is fresh and always good. The atmosphere was lively.
Good food. I have been to this location a couple of times and the food is good. That's all.
Good food and drinks. Nice to sit outside. Wait staff could be a little more attentive.

This is a local chain owned by a farmer's organization. It's farm to table and has a really broad menu, like a more upscale Cheesecake Factory. I like their seafood pasta dishes and their fried chicken. They also have their own distillery with their own liquors. They have really good drinks, some are of the Tiki variety.

The food is great, but it takes so long to make a reservation. If you can get past the reservation hurdles, it's a good experience. Be aware though - it is pretty pricey, so definitely more for special events and occasions, in my opinion.
My gf wanted pancakes and I wanted thick hash browns and eggs. We both got what we wanted (it is unreal how few pancake or waffle places there are in nw DC)
Good food just considerably overcrowded and way too hard to find parking.
Nice atmosphere, delicious food.
Great service, great food, great time!
The breakfast was amazing. I will definitely be returning. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable. It was a great experience overall.

Awesome. If you want a change of venue and a relaxed atmosphere after busy business meetings in either the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and craving for a T-Bone Steak the Founding Farmers Restaurant at the corner of Pensylvania and 20th Street NW is the place to go. Bonne appetite.
good staple americana food with a twist. solid 4/5 imho
The food was yummy. The location, parking & service was good too. I would recommend anyone to try it.
Good! I had the shrimp and grits and spinach salad. I'd recommend both. Often busy so I recommend reservations
Great location right at the heart of DC. A little overcrowded but food is to die for.
Quality food and drinks! Stopped by while out and about visiting DC with the family. I recommend this place to all my friends

Very delicious! I had the chicken and waffles and it was served with Mac and cheese and green beans. Everything was so good, but the green beans were a little undercooked. The chicken breading was thin and crispy and had a great flavor to it. The menu in general is very diverse and there is something for everyone!
Decent food and the portions are big--don't order too much. Absolutely must get the crab dip.

This place is bigger than it looks!! It felt clean and fresh. We sat at the bar and ate instead of waiting for seating as there were many people on the wait list. We grabbed a quick bite and were on our way

Fresh concept restaurant with many options for healthy eaters and those looking to indulge. The one in Georgetown Harbor is a beautiful location but everyone ends up at Nick's Riverside Grille or Tony & Joe's. They have the best view of the water and really cool social scene.
Food was tasty and reasonably priced. The atmosphere was fine and busy. There's a bit of a wait but worth it.
For the price, it isn't the best value but the food is fresh and tastes good. Nothing to write home about but consistently decent. M

Omg so yummy. Visited DC for the first time and found this restaurant for breakfast. It definitely did not disappoint! It was so yummy we came back the next morning. We reserved a table online and good thing we did because it gets crowded fast. Our table was ready when we arrived and all of the staff was very friendly. Food came out fast. The French toast was so unique and tasted amazing. I loved the Eggs Benedict and how crispy the hash browns were! Definitely would come back!
Enjoyed the bar and the staff was friendly. The eggs were very oily but otherwise good food.
Food was amazing, great service
I know it's super popular in DC but I'm not a big fan. Rather overpriced and food is not super tasty. There are more interesting option in the area
Really like the food here. Have been a few times!

We are so lucky to have this spot only a couple of moments drive away from home. Food is dazzling, both the tapas and ground floor eatery. Mixed drinks amazing, wine extraordinary and exquisite choice of lagers. Love this spot and will keep on visiting.
Good.                       Verrrrrrrrry expensive.  Can get this for half price at other restaurants.

Amazing COFFEE and food! Quick stop in and out to get what you need. Their avocado TOAST definitely lives up to the hype! I usually do my coffee with coconut milk, but tried their oat milk and it was SO GOOD! Friendly baristas and one that even told us the toasts were half off that DAY!
Additional star awarded for rapid response by Founding Farmers' Hospitality Team.Kerry reached out about my concerns outlined in my previous post.
Good meal, not exceedingly fancy. Good service. Nice ambiance.? The menu is a lot of comfort food.
I order from here sometimes. Food is good. Breakfast food is great also. The pancakes are really Good
Great breakfast spot! Didn't have a reservation but didn't wait long either so. Great vibe and service too
The food itself was quite good, worthy of four stars and our server was very helpful.

I went here with my boyfriend during the pandemic and although they were only at 50% capacity, they were able to accommodate us quite well. We were worried about being so close to others, but the tables were COVID friendly. We had been here before the pandemic, so we knew the food was good, but seems as though during the pandemic they revamped the menu. They took off one of my favorites but added so many that were just as good maybe even better. The experience was great!
Decent food. Good selection. Reasonable price

The service was fantastic! The outdoor seating with the fire is amazing. Keeps you warm when it is breezy. I ordered the chicken and waffles and it was very good! Everything is from scratch there. I would say the mac and cheese was a little too salty, and the chicken was slightly bland, it needed more seasoning but the waffles were amazing and their housemade syrup was on point! My husband ordered steak and enchiladas and those were amazing. It was greatly seasoned and the enchiladas were on another level . I highly recommend that plate especially. I am not a fan of steak , but that was amazing. Overall, a grwat experience I would definitely go back, maybe try the tysons location!
Heart the spot for a brunch! Their outdoor seating is terrific. There's a great facility. The food was excellent, the service was perfect, the waiter was so sweet and polite.
Very reliable high-quality good food and good service. We are regulars.
I absolutely love the decor and ambiance of the place

Minus a star for the weird room temp water they serve and the fact it was pretty hot sitting inside.. Everything else was awesome. Wish I could've tried one of each cocktail =D because they were delishhh. Next time it's just cocktails and dessert since we didn't have any room left after those massive plates!
Like the pizza and food. I would recommend. I brought my family here to eat as well as my out of town guests. I loved the chicken
Great food, atmostphere, Pricey

Founding Farmers is the classic brunch. If you go, be prepared to wait for your table, whether or not you have a reservation. The waiting is the worst part of restaurant, but everything else about it exceeds expectations. Definitely get the beignets as an app for the table - they are delicious. I would also recommend choosing a drink because they make great lattes and the iced mocha is especially good. I go here every time I have a friend in town visiting, because it always delivers a classic DC brunch.

A quintessential DC Brunch Spot... It's a place to see and be seen in the city on weekdays or weekends when its not so busy. Food is great, and the service is excellent. call in ahead, make reservations unless you're interested in long waits and crowding. It will probably will be awhile until these guys can reopen and brunch will return to its usual vigor... either way I'm looking forward.

They do not name this one of the highest rated brunch spots in DC for no reason! The eating place is HUGE, modernly decorated, and serves remarkable food! One downside is that it gets super crowded, so make sure to return EARLY to avoid crowds. I arrived on a Sunday morning at 10:30am and I was told there was a forty five minute wait already! I turned into inclined to attend it out, however thankfully I overheard that the bar seating turned into first come first serve if it became open - so I requested the host to exchange me to the bar seats instead. Definitely attempt to choose bar seating to avoid lengthy waits. While it changed into the first-class option - the workforce did now not offer this statistics up readily, that is why I gave it 4/5 stars.Food - I ordered the chicken + waffles (which came with a aspect!) and their signature cup of coffee. My bf ordered the eggs benedict with a facet of fruit and their iced coffee. Both dishes have been AMAZING - I couldn't maintain my fork down. Service seemed to be a bit gradual on the grounds that they looked a bit understaffed, that's what introduced to the wait times. The bartender alternatively changed into very first-rate and tended to all our needs. Definitely a have to strive in DC - keep yourself the wait and come tremendous early!
Super yummy food. Our waiter was friendly and checked in on us.  It was very busy.  Great food as well. I would go back
Love this food. And they have partners. Farmers and distillers is amazing as well. Make sure to get reservations it can be busy.
The food is to die for but it's so busy! We had a reservation and still had to wait 20 minutes. Worth the wait! That's my only complaint. The food was perfect and it's super cute!

The waffles here are sent from Heaven!!! I had breakfast here with my girl cuz she was here earlier last week! Honestly I never taking eating advices from my girl, but this one right here!!! She's won me over for sure!! The staff here were amazing, the place looked spotless, and the waffles!!! God knows those waffles need an award!! I'll be back again for sure!!!

Decent food interesting choices one of the better chain restaurants. They have unique food items . Biscuits and grace is yum . They can be hit or miss but overall it's a good place to get a bite in the dmv area
The food is good and the service is spotty. Cornbread was yummy. I will go back for sure. Yay!
Delicious breakfast! The coffee was good and the food was too. My husbands food was a little cold coming out, but it was tasty still.

Excellent. The service just depends. It's very crowded and slower at the FB FF. I suggest ordering the corn bread. As someone who has lived in the south and has been to soul food restaurants that had won national awards, I strongly suggest.

This is fast becoming our go-to place for office outings because it is within walking distance of the office and they can readily accommodate reservations for larger groups. We've been here for both enjoyable breakfasts (avocado toast is great) and lunch (shrimp and lobster risotto is delicious). Only four stars for high noise levels during peak hours and can barely hear your table mates, and at times slower, lackluster wait service (it shouldn't take 10 minutes to get a take away box).
Very good food. A little pricey, but worth it.
Very good shrimp and grits. My husband and son enjoyed their burger and from the look of my pictures. I really enjoyed my shrimp and grits. The coconut and mango drink was refreshing.
Best Sunday brunch spots in Town hands down. My girlfriend and I always got there every other weekend, at this point it's like our favorite place .
The place is always packed and noisy. But food is amazing and staff is quick and friendly. Been here for brunch and had benedicts with crab--it was phenomenal.
Perfect location, and the food was fresh and delicious. Definitely will go there again.
Great food but I would always go for the stake and seafood. The drink are great and the apps are always a must.
Me came, me eat, me happy.This place has 12k reviews for a reason.And this reason is greatness.

Lovely space, super busy and super crowded.Better get yourself a reservation if you have a group of 4 or more, our group was quoted a 45 min wait... glad it was more like 30 minutes!Food was fantastic and service top notch.Only complaint was the "impossible burger" was out of stock, server said there was a nationwide shortage? Seems odd.Nice place!
If you are into the brunch scene, be sure to work this place into your rotation. I wasn't a huge fan of the coffee, but that's a small bit to pick. Excellent service, and will definitely be back.
Great place to have a great meal.Very crowded, but I guess that is a good sign of how good the food is.

We came in with a large group 12+ and it felt like we received one on one service. The server gave our group suggestions and great feedback about items we wanted to order. The food was excellent and even with a large group didn't feel like it too long to get to the table. The atmosphere was great it was busy at the time but it didn't feel crowded. The large menu has things for anyone. I would like to go back again to try the other meal items I didn't order
A very cool environment with a very fun menu. Quality of the food however is average, and the food is also quite expensive.

Great food and atmosphere. It was crowded, but I made reservations ahead of time on Opentable, so we were seated within minutes. I'd recommend the brunch over dinner. Definitely worth the visit for brunch, but could be passed for dinner.
Excellent food, fast and friendly service.
Totally delicious. Fun place too.
Not bad. A little too pricey. The bacon app on the Spears was good, but could have been more filling. Entree was good, but like I said probably $7-10 more than it should have been.
Food was excellent. Wait was a bit long even with a reservation but the food and service made up for it. Would come again
Great "real food" in a cool trendy atmosphere. I one the mac and cheese! Great service, I have been her many times and never disappointed!
The buffet brunch is always so fun here. Get reservations since it does get very busy over the weekends for brunch.
Always good food. Great place for lunch. Will be back for happy hour.
Always such a treat to enjoy this waterfront spot, and the food never disappoints! Can get crowed because it's a popular spot, so plan ahead. Loved sitting a booth looking out to the ice rink.

Went for lunch enjoyed deviled eggs, corn bread entrees came and my guest ordered tomato soup and grilled cheese and only the soup came and my entree did not come. Server said he thought they only wanted soup and my entree would be out soon. Finally rest of the food came out. I ordered the chicken and waffles, plates had nice presentation. Started enjoying my food and when I cut into the chicken it was raw. There were two pieces so I firgured if the other one was cooked through I would eat that one and not say anything. Behold the other piece was just as raw. I told the waiter, he took the chicken back and brought me the check. I thought I might of got "I'm sorry, can I offer you anything else?" All I received was we took the chicken off the check. Left feeling disappointed. Old saying always treat the guest as a interaction not a transaction.

Came here for lunch and it did not disappoint! It was very busy when we arrived but we put a reservation in online ahead of time. Took about 15 minutes to get our table but not too bad. The corn bread appetizer was AMAZING! I also had a burger for lunch which was perfectly cooked and tasted great. I will definitely be back!
Great food and good service! I listed their park Potomac location and everything was great
I will come back !!!!!!! the food was fresh and the taste awesome.

Founding Farmers, where do I start!? Going there for Brunch was a show on it's own! I had the opportunity to sit in the bar and we got a chance to look at all the bartenders run around making drinks! The Chicken Pot Pie, I would have ordered another one if it wasn't so expensive :( but I did get a chance to take it to work the next day and it tasted as fresh as when I received it in the bar. I will definitely be back!
The wait staff is ehh..but they make up for it in delicious food.
Nice place, it says great for kids, but they don't have a kids menu? Overall the quality and service I'm sure are what keep people coming back.
Their wings and salmon are the absolute best!
their salmon is good! Their brunch is good as well. They are ALWAYS packed after work hours
Love this place!!! Food is great!!! Only thing is the wait.... but it was definitely worth the wait!
brunch was amazing. man, i ate and really stuffed myself. never been a big fun of waffles but i loved them here. place get packed so you are better with reservations
Great experience would come again.

I've been here twice. Once for drinks once for food. The drinks are why this place is getting 4 stars. The bartender was knowledgeable and a great listener. He made me two perfect drinks. The food is pretty good too. But if your looking for a good drink. This is the spot.
Little bit over the top, but good food
Nice place and not crazy expensive.
Very interesting and informative.
You have to wait at least an hour for a table but the food is good.
Pretty darn delicious! Service gets lacky over time though.
great food! and excellentcustomer service. a tad bit pricey but very delicious food.

I am a big fan of their pescado tacos, guacamole and elote. They also do a option to order various types of meats which is served with tortillas, rice and beans. The margs here are so fresh. I love the spicy one!
One of the best restaurant in DC. I love the wide variety on the menu and the drinks are yummy. The cornbread is delicious!
very good food but it is hard to get a seat at this place

Yummy! Corn bread is as amazing as everyone says it is. The fried green tomatoes did their job. The goat cheese burger was also good but how could goat cheese not be? I remember the sweet potato pasta was a little odd, don't think I would recommend.
This place is a lot of fun.  I've tried half their menu and everything has been excellent.  Make sure to make a reservation, there can be quite a wait.
Solid food and options, albeit in a trendy area.
This place is always a treat because their food is amazing. Even though we waited for a while, the food made the wait worth it.
Good locavore food. Very good service.

Tasty breakfast in a rustic place. Staff was extremely friendly. We made reservations and were promptly seated which was nice.  The food was incredible.  Farm to table with the most amazing flavors.  Everything from the beignets to the eggs to the French Toast and chocolate mousse were to die for.  I don't even know how I stumbled across this place but it is definitely a permanent in my stable of go to's.
Food and drinks are a little pricy here, and you often have to wait a long time. But it has delicious brunch, cocktails, and dinner. Lots of good hearty vegetarian options.
We went without reservations, so we were pleasantly surprised when they found a table for us. The food was good, though service was a bit slow. Overall, good experience!

Only here for the chicken and waffles. Ensemble at the D.C. location is a bit odd, a mix of college millennials and working professionals from West End. I personally prefer the Tyson's location, but this will do as it is conveniently close to work.

I love this place. I ate there on Sunday and was happy with everything. I had the straw stack noodles (or something like that) and my dad got the scallops. We are from Baltimore and personified foodies. I can not wait to go back with a large group so that i can try more things. There is an extensive menu that will appeal to everyone from meat and potatoes to the nuts and berries type people. My ONE complaint is that they run out of items on the menu, so you may go with a certain item in mind only to find that they have run out.A fabulous place and somewhere I will keep going to again and again!

Stopped by for brunch on a Saturday with a friend visiting from out of the country. She had the chicken and waffles which she enjoyed, but I tried it and the chicken was on the dry side. The waffle was fluffy and delicious. My steak and hash was also very good! The downside was that service was slow, but that is to be expected, as it was very busy. Would come again to try the dinner menu.
The food is always good here. A little sad that they stopped serving the carrot cake pancakes. Also getting to the reservation desk is such a hassle. I hope they can move it somewhere else.
Although the district has many beautiful places, but this is the best of all. The food is comforting. And the cocktails are delicious. It was a long wait, but it was worth it.

Very good food! Love the southern dishes always! Fried chicken is a must-order! Felt it might be a bit overrated though. And you need make reservation otherwise you will wait hours to get a table.. Will recommend it.
The food is fabulous but the wait is horrible.
Love the ambiance honest food and great service.
First time having brunch this restaurant The Chicken ad Waffles are delicious. I will definitely be coming back to try the dinner menu soon.
On a fancy side, great service and great location. A little price though even for DC
Great Place to eat, Hang with friends. Nice experience. Try it out!

Founding Farmers has delicious food always. There is always a wait here so reservations, to me, are important. Once our party arrived, we we seated promptly. Before we were able to find a space at the bar and enjoy some of the spirits. They were a bit expensive but definitely did not disappoint. The food is always hot and fresh. That does mean there will always be a wait between ordering and eating but they make up for it in flavoring. Everything is delicious, even dessert!
Very popular location in DC. Check it out:) located in Foggy Bottom.

I would give 4.5 stars if that option was available. I've been hearing about this place for a long time, and am glad that I finally experienced it. The service, food, and ambiance is all terrific. It has that old time feel with wooden decor, old paintings and furnishings. Sat at the bar on the left side of the restaurant and the bartender was great. He was friendly, consistently refilled our drinks and brought over the food in a timely fashion. He was very friendly and was able to answer any questions we had.

Came in for thanksgiving dinner a couple weeks ago and was pleasantly surprised. Honestly, I was not expecting much as the fixed menu cost was pretty low compared to what I had seen elsewhere. The portions were huge, and the ham was great. The cornbread was also of note. Complete with soup and dessert. I would love to come back for dinner on a normal night and give their house made bourbon a try.

I had the pleasure of going to a dinner party here last night and every single entree was excellent. The corn bread I tried has a very stiff consistency but is still very soft, I thought that was amazing. And the fried green tomatoes left me wanting more, they had a very yummy seasoning on them which I couldn't put my finger on. I was a little disappointed by the waiter's performance, I had to remind him for water and wine refills more than I was comfortable with. Would I come back? Sure, but I'll be hoping for the best with the service next time.
One of my favorites in DC! Always reliable for a great meal, and it's a great place to go for a meal when you're going to the KenCen.

I'm amazed that this place always has a wait for a table, no matter what time of day I go. I've sat at the bar every time. That said, I absolutely love their breakfast. I had the red velvet pancakes, and they were great! And the beignets are the best I've ever had. The cocktails are unique and almost worth the price. I don't know if I'll ever get used to paying more than $10 for a cocktail. But the bartenders seem to know what they're doing, and will even make something special off the menu if you tell them what you like.

I've eaten here a number of times and always enjoyed it. I'd call it comfort food meets farm to table. The restaurant is very popular, trendy, always crowded, and fairly noisy. I'd recommend a reservation well in advance.As for the food, it's good. The cornbread is always a hit. Light, with a good corn flavor. During my most recent visit, I tried the short rib, and was surprised that it came with a sweet barbeque sauce over it. The meat was tender, but I found sauce a bit overpowering.Will I continue to dine here? Yes. But it's not so good that it's a must visit whenever I'm in town.
I like this place, so delicious foods and good service. Owner friendly and smile, I feel nice.

I went poorly anything excessively favor here. I simply needed to take full favorable position of the privately sourced and cultivate crisp natural items. But it tasted pretty good so i gave it 4 stars.
Love this place. Great drinks and sushi.
Love the food. Love love love the food. Service is average - you have to book a table ahead of time otherwise the wait is ridiculous.
Service is solid. Brunch buffet was solid, but could use a little facelift. Brunch drinks were solid.

Always delicious! Fried chicken and waffles are my favorite, hands down. I love that they are open early enough for breakfast and also late enough for dinner. The place is always packed so make a reservation!
Breakfast chicken and fried tomatoes is my favorite, I usually come here two times one week, so great.
It is a great place for breakfast, I very like, like fried green tomatoes and chicken . Usually, I will come here pick up when I go to work.
Great food, busy though so make a reservation
High quality and good service, nice. I like Breakfast Chicken & Waffles, delicious .We enjoy it.I usually come here with my family.
Great food, but it's always a pain to get in. I highly recommend their scratch sodas.
Always great food. You need to make a reservation though as it get's crowded. Corn break is a favorite as well as the Farmer's Chicken Salad. Appetizers are wonderful.
I like this place, coffee taste nice and cheap. quick service let me happy. I will come again.
This is my frist time here , but, I enjoy myself, coffee taste nice and food delicious. I will come again .
This restaurant near my home, so I often come here for my dinner, I like fried green tomato. very much. Owner smiles all the time and treat customers friendly.
Had breakfast here.. the food was fresh & delicious. The prices were reasonable & you get a lot for your $.

What a great last-minute decision to come here after reading the reviews. Cleanest home in the wall you'll ever visit. the pesto bread was delicious. Our waitress was friendly and came by often for refills.
Always an entertaining and nice meal.
Really decent place, make reservations though!
Great food! Would definitely recommend. The mac and cheese is delicious.
Love coming here for brunch. Great menu selection
consistently awesome. It's fairly easy to grab a table with or without reservations and the food and service are always reliable.
Food is good but the waits are very annoying, even if you have a reservation
I've been here for brunch a few times. Consistently delicious, and good service.
Great food and service. The drinks are a bit pricy but the ambiance and food is great!
this is real traditional American food restaurant, the brunch was really good! It's good for group and family , there are variety of choices on menu!

I had my family in town and we were able to get a table upstairs where we could all sit together. Our server was pleasant and everyone enjoyed their food. Overall, I would recommend this restaurant and I look forward to visiting again.
Everything is terrific, except for the noise. Impossible to have a conversation.
Awesome menu!! The choices are limitless and healthy! We usually go once a month and have yet to have a bad experience. Love the location and the decor. Can't wait to go back again!!
great brunch place I visit once in a while. Try their flatbreads!
Lovely place with great food, servoce could be better but it was not terrible. The stuffed banana foster was awsome. We will be back. Four stars just because of service.

There is really no reason not to like this restaurant.Are they a little overrated? maybe a little, but that is only because sooooo many people have hyped this place up. I have been here numerous times, never really disappointed but also not extremely impressed. Its a good place to eat with friends, chat and try out fun new drinks. It has good chill atmosphere and the service is always fantastic. But why not 5 stars? After you been here couple times, it gets old. There are interesting food menus, but only couple of them are realllyyy good, the rest is... whatever. The wait is always long, and its a little pricey for a place to just hang out with friends and eat. I usually come here when I have friends from out of town because they have always heard of this place. I like the place a lot, I just don't LOVE them.
Great place and I love the menu. Cocktails are great and service is friendly.Shame for the long wait if you don't book in advance. But overall will come back!
Good food and great ambiance, waiting for a reservation can be a hassle
I love the food here. A bit pricey, but pretty good.
The food was decent and the atmosphere is great, but the service was a bit slow
Good food. Noisy atmosphere.
Has gotten less impressive over time, but food still hits all the comfort food spots.
Food was good, service was great... Definitely will be back.
good, just long waits
Great food. Slightly rushed atmosphere and not intimate.
Best. Mussels Ever!
Good and reliable brunch spot. The ambiance is great, the service is quick. Make sure you make a reservation or prepare to wait long!
Food is great! But, they do charge for refills on all drinks.
great customer service
Great cocktails!
Really good, but a bit overpriced.
Food is great - great atmosphere!
Always good
This a great place to eat
very good..

Great concept. The food was delicious. I loved the freshness of their veggies. I think the price is slightly overpriced though, and I would say the options are somewhat limited. Still, I would advice people to eat there.
Very good. Great Place for brunch. Comfort food
solid, good drinks and the wine list is diverse. love the sushi and pretzels
Broad menu, good for vegetarians
Service was nice. Food was okay. Will try with same group of friends next week for brunch.
Great food. good service. long waiting time.
Hostess was not the kindest, but the food is always fresh and amazing.
Good burgers & tap!, oh you know what I mean...
love this place. Food and service is on point. Seems corporate training makes things run super smooth. But does take a way from some character. Not enough to bother.
if only the wait was shorter. big fan of this place however.
Great menu and delish drinks!
I really enjoyed the ambiance and the cuisine that Founding Farmers has to offer.
The food is truly amazing, it is comfort food at its best! Their homemade cocktails are unique. The d¨¦cor is industrial and urban which is not my favorite but that's just my own personal taste.
The place got packed really quickly, but it was tasty.
Had a fantastic dinner. Got the Pork chops and they did not dissapoint. Service was good, not great and it was a bit loud but I will be back for sure.
Good food, loud atmosphere, good for groups if you can get a reservation.
Overpriced buttery yuppy food. If you like that kind of thing...
Good food. Good Service. Long wait.

I came in here for lunch and sat at the bar. Great, knowledgable bartender who knew his beers and cocktails. I had a great grilled cheese and tomato soup, which to me is the perfect comfort meal for a rainy day.
Consistently good.
Good Place to eat!! The popcorn is amazing!!

Def a fan of this place. Its a DC must, glad I was able to get a reservation. The food was great and the ambiance perfect for what I was looking for. I really enjoyed the chicken plate I ordered. I will say it was very busy though, so even with my reservation I still have to wait.
Very busy, during the weekend. Food was great, service attentive will come back again

Founding farmers is a DC staple, if you can get in. Overall great food and experience, but they clearly overbook and fast! Every time I've been there I have been seated at least 15 minutes past my reservation time. The friendly staff and overall vibe of the place more than make up for it though. Def a fan.
Deviled eggs and sliders are great.
the drinks and service was great. My food was a little cold and they sent me a new one. hmmm again cold but everyone elses food was great! Will try again
the atmosphere is nice as well as the service. my girls (ages 26 & 30) LOVE this place. I'm not as thrilled about it as they are, but I would go again.

My only issue is the price of the place, but it's one of the best restaurants in DC. Be sure to get the bread appetizers and try their mac and cheese. And every time I've had the chicken and waffles, they've never disappointed. The servers know the drink selection really well and know how to pair items. Also, it's not too loud cause the space isn't to congested. Never had to wait more than 20 minutes.
Great food. Make reservation. Come HUNGRY!
I got engaged at the restaurant. The employees really made the day special for me and my husband. Food is amazing as well as service
Great food!!! Fun atmosphere.
The food is fresh and delicious. The customer service is also great.
Excellent service provider to repair storefront glass. I am very happy with service. Thank you so much.
Great brunch. A ton of options. Gets pretty packed though so reservations are a must. The beignets are a MUST!! Definitely an awesome place for breakfast and a must go in DC.
Make sure to make a reservation ahead of time!
It'd get 5 stars if getting a table was a bit easier.

I like this restaurant. It's fancier than a lot of brunch places. Their breakfast foods are pretty good. However, the cream filled french toast was way too sweet that I had a stomachache that whole day. BUT the other foods are AMAZING. Their lunch menu is great too. their cornbread makes my day and their finger burgers...ugh...SO GOOD.
Great food!
Good Overall. Not a big fan of long lines. Food was good.
Great Thanksgiving meal. Big portions.
Not to be missed in DC. Food was great. If you are looking for 5 star this isn't it but if you are looking for good food at a reasonable price. This is it.
Lovely place to have a breakfast.
Solid !
Best cornbread of all time.
Always fresh seasonal ingredients and delicious cocktails.
The salads here are amazing!!!
Food is great. Def pricey but would come back for special occations maybe.
I thought the food was good and the drinks were better!
Solid chicken n waffles
Great food, great service.
love :) this
Nice Brunch on a weekend .
Awesome meat.....................................qqqqqqqqqqwwwwwwwwwwwwwsnfjdjdhxjsjdbksksndksowbdh-owbsvxjvdjwhdj
Food and service was pretty good. Serving sizes are good amount for one.

I've been to two locations, DC and Mongomery County and both were very good. The food was fresh and the menu was varied enough to have a little bit of everything...My friends liked the Fried Chicken and Waffles, but I was partial to the Diver Scallops (over an addictive Risotto). But speaking of addictive, the Bacon Lollies (brown sugar cured bacon on skewers) and the skillet cornbread with honey butter made great appetizers. The DC location seemed smaller, so a party of 10 was a bit of a challenge for them. But both locations are a great place for a good meal with a small group of friends.
Great brunches. Lots of choices, nice atmosphere.
Great food. Good time.
Great food!! Book in advance or face a long wait! :)
Delightful dinner
Great coffee. Tight spaces and always long lines.
Delish food across the board period.

I have been there on several occasions and I think their food is the best in town, all their menu items are well prepared in accordance with the variety of food they serve. The place is very neat and attractive to be, they have variety of food and drinks for every customer satisfaction and I think these founding fathers deserve a review, because their customers well being is always their top priority. will be there always.
Great food
pretty good food but sometimes the wait can be very long. all in all still a great place
Great food and good service! :) One of my favorites for lunch.

Food was delicious. Best meal I have had in a while. Fried green tomatoes were excellent and my daughter loved the lobster Mac and Cheese! Service was slow but they were extremelly visit, so we understood. Highly recommend this place!
The food and decor is great but man the wait can be long sometimes, we waited an hour and 30 mins! But it was totally worth the wait.

I am a fan! The deviled eggs are tasty and a new twist on what you would get at a regular company picnic or homemade. I salads are fresh and delicious. I really like the atmosphere as well. It can get packed so a reservation is best. The service is generally good but I took a star off because we had to wait a long time for our waiter to come over and take our order. But all in all I think it was a really good place to eat!
The food was good. Had a reservation for 845. Said they would seat me any minute. Seated me a little late.
Good food and good service. You need to make reservations.
Delicious! Best in DC. Must go!
I was here with my girlfriend for a breakfast. The waffles are amazing ! The service is good. Just a little point : maybe to noisy when there are too many people. So perfect for a breakfast !
Food is always good. There is ALWAYS a wait so be sure to make a reservation. Service is good as well!
Great food! Drink specials are amazing. But it can be busy and crowded on weekends - and service is slower.

First of all, please make sure you have a reservation before you go! Otherwise, you will be waiting in the crowded lobby area for a long time.I went here for a business lunch, and the restaurant was extremely busy! And very, very loud! So, I'm not sure that this was the best representation of their service, which was understandably slow. The food was very good. It's nice to sample something that you would not ordinarily make yourself at home.I had a Cranberry Brie Vegetable Burger. It was so good! The accompanying salad was a nice combo of arugula and lemony vinaigrette. The burger was on a freshly baked brioche bread, which I was not going to eat, but I just couldn't help myself because it was so delicious! I highly recommend going, but make sure that you make reservations, no matter what time of day or night you go!
Pretty good, but make a reservation because it's not worth a super long wait.
Nice meal and good service. But a little louder than one would like.
Nice place and the food was not bad though a little small

Local to the area, I love the concept and atmosphere of the restaurant. I've never had a meal I haven't enjoyed, as far as taste goes. Have had some very, very slow servers. Drink service is a bother. But overall, a highlight of the neighborhood restaurants.
Pretty good brunch
Great food. Awesome service!
Food was good. The wait time as too long.
The food is awesome! Even though there's usually a wait. They accomodate you pretty quickly!
great food!
Coffee and beignets are amazing.
A really wonderful place to have a meal.

This place is a saving grace in the under-developed brunch food scene that is Washington DC. The brunch and lunch menus were both open at the time we were seated, so I went for the Shrimp and Grits, while my wife ordered brunch eggs. I must say the shrimp and grits were great - the veggies were fresh, not cut too thin, and the grits had a perfect consistency. I'm going back here for sure.
Great food. Very interesting menu and good options for vegetarians.
The food is excellent at breakfast. I especially like the Texas BBQ bacon that comes with the Founding Farmers brunch. The yogurt and granola are also tasty. Service is not great since it is so busy.
Great food and service! I love to go back for another brunch or dinner

I was treated with disdain and contempt, while trying to swallow bland and boring entree. I did not understand the reason, until the Upshaw WaPo article came out, now i see the light... won't be coming back to this sh*t hole, sorry
Good food, great vibrant ambiance. Pretty expensive.
Amazing food and service
Love their veggie burgers!!!
Really good food. Excellent service.

This has to be the best brunch spot in DC. My boyfriend and I went a bit over board ordering food so we were able to try a lot of the Menu items. The cream stuffed French toast was amazing. Although I wouldn't order it as my entree, it serves as the perfect dessert. Rich, creamy, crisp on the outside and soft inside. The added strawberries give it a refreshing taste. The deviled eggs were a little salty for my taste, but the spinach omelette made up for it. Their serving sizes are pretty generous. Beware: Wait times are a bit ridiculous on a Sunday. 2 hr+. Mimosas are not bottomless :(
Great place with splendid food... i'm coming back!
Great atmosphere and food
Good Food. Good Location. Good Service. Highly recommended.
Great place for brunch! Farm to Table! But, very crowded for weekend brunch so make reservations ahead of time. Service was excellent and the brunch was great!
Awesome brunch. I highly recommend the pancakes.

The food is great but the wait is wayyyy too long. Went there for brunch a couple of weeks ago on a Sunday and had to wait 1.5 hrs! But the chicken and waffles made it worth it.Prices are decent... Not too cheap not too pricey... Just wish they had more tables
Best food in the area. Worth a little of a wait.
Damn good food, but not quite five star good.
Nice staff. Only went for happy hour. Food was good. I would go again.
Pretty solid, comfort food.
Good food and service.
Everything tasted excellent! 5 stars for food, but 3 stars for service as it was very slow.
Excellent food. You should share plate, portion are too big
Best crab cake in town! The waiters are friendly and service is fast. I signed up with opentable, and did not have to wait too long.

One of my favorite restaurants in DC! I'm a vegetarian and there are plenty of delicious and creative options. A true farm to table restaurant with a fun and inviting atmosphere. The only downfall is that there is always a wait and service can be a little slow- you definitely want a reservation (and even still you'll end up waiting a bit).
The food was good. The service was good. I would go again.
I love this place, I used to try many restaurant like this but no one like this, they are very good. I come here a lot, I always get good service and the food comes out right.
The food was so fresh tasting and hot. Great atmosphere!
This place is great. it definitely lives up to its reputation

CHICKEN AND WAFFLES. CHICKEN AND WAFFLES. CHICKEN AND WAFFLES.  I didn't even order the chicken and waffles (my sister did), but I had multiple bites of it and IT. WAS. SO. DAMN. GOOD. The chicken was juicy and tender, while the waffles were golden and crispy. You also get to order a small size with this meal. I actually ordered the lobster mac and cheese. It was decent, but not worth the $29. Very large portion, but felt that the lobster and pasta proportions were 1:5. They didn't drown the dish with cheese, allowing the taste of lobster to surface. Service: Not impressed. Our waiter was not enthusiastic at all. He didn't seem happy to answer any questions we had about the menu or to cater to us in general. Ambiance: Very lively and sociable place. Loud, but you can still hear your own conversations so that's good. Would definitely come here again and again. One for my personal order of chicken and waffles and another to try other items on their menu haha

Founding farmers is awesome for any occasion (dinner, lunch, brunch, drinks). It's casual enough for just meeting friends but still feels like a special occasion. The chicken and waffles is epic. Many of the plates to share are excellent and worth trying out: deviled eggs, cornbread etc. The egg dishes, while simple, are always excellent as well.
Good food, good service.

Founding farmers is awesome for any occasion (dinner, lunch, brunch, drinks). It's casual enough for just meeting friends but still feels like a special occasion. The chicken and waffles is epic. Many of the plates to share are excellent and worth trying out: deviled eggs, cornbread etc. The egg dishes, while simple, are always excellent as well. Only downside is that you have to wait a while for a table if you don't have a reservation. This place is always PACKED, so plan ahead!

So far I am a fan. I had the chicken and waffles ad loved it. It was perfect amount of food as I ate the whole things and did not feel stuffed. The waffle was so light crunchy and the chicken was breaded well with great flavor. I enjoyed it without any syrup either. I hate when waffles are heavy, so they did a great job. I can't wait to come back and try the other foods here.

Reservations are a must at this incredibly popular DC spot. We went for Sunday brunch. They stop serving brunch at 2:00 p.m. and we were seated at 2:15 p.m. Unfortunately, we could only order off the lunch menu. Lesson learned, you must get seated before 2 pm to get the delicious brunch. The hostess was very pleasant. The waitress was nice but incredibly busy.If you are looking for a light lunch, this is not your restaurant. The food is delicious but on the heavy side. Even the salads are filled with candied nuts and bacon. Overall, a great place to try in DC.

Founding Farmers restaurant is an increasingly popular food joint in DC. The reason behind it is that they do common american fare very well. I specially like the fact that the decoration of the restaurant is so welcoming to its customers. I recommend the mac and cheese.
They do give way too much food.

During our visit to DC, we went twice to Founding Farmers. Once for dinner on our first night and a second time for brunch on our last day, both meals were great. We had reservations so we only had to wait a few minutes which was a good thing, the wait looked long for walk ins. I had made the brunch reservations just in case they really liked it and wanted to eat there again. Glad I did, because brunch time was even busier. There was 5 of us and we all got something different to type. My son had the chicken and waffles for dinner and picked the mac and cheese for his side, daughter had the Rueben Sandwich (I wish I would have ordered that as well), husband and niece had the fish and chips and I had the spicy Tuna Poke salad (not as good as I have had but it was good) We also tried a couple of appetizers, the fried green tomatoes were really good, wish we would have gotten two orders. Also tried the chips which came with various dips, those were ok but nothing too special. Everyone really liked what they got, no one was disappointed. Now for Brunch - We did a little sharing here, my son and I shared one of the pan scrambles and banana fosters waffle, yummy both were great. Husband had the chicken and waffle which is served a little different for brunch than dinner, he loved it. Daughter had Drag through the garden and Niece had eggs and bacon. She ordered a special bacon but wasn't too happy with it, she she is was more that ham and not bacon. We also got an order of beignets, should have gotten two orders. All in all both meals were great and we will definitely go again if ever in the area. Maybe they should branch out to other locations.

What a great place! I went to Founding Farmers this weekend for the first time. The portions are big, the food is delish, and the atmosphere is sustainable/modern chic. (And it doesn't hurt to support family farms!) I ordered the homemade pasta "straw and hay" which came with a white sauce, corn, peas and bacon. It was so tasty. The drinks are great, too. The only thing that was weird was the waiter we had. He was flirting with my girlfriend at first then got insulting. It was really awkward each time he came to the table. He had a strange personality for a waiter. He tried too hard to be funny, but ended up just being mean. Back to the food....I recommend trying any of the breads as a starter. The one with brie is tasty. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the DC area.

It's a DC institution. I've been here multiple times with friends and family, and they never disappoint. It's a nice place to take someone new to DC.I recommend the any of their burgers, meatloaf, clams, chocolate mousse... Don't go for their brunch menu... it's the same as any other place..

When I attended college in D.C., this restaurant was my absolutely favorite place to go to during the weekends. Yes, this place may be busy and expensive, however, did you know they are open 365 days of the week? MY absolute favorite dish is the homestyle chicken and waffles. You get a side of macaroni and cheese, and you get to pick one more ( pst, choose potato salad). Overall, I haven't had it in a while, but it did bring back some memories so I figured I would leave a review sharing the good times I had here at founding farmers.

I've been to Founding Farmers twice now. The first time was unbelievable!! I had chicken pot pie and a yummy little (actually quite large) spicy tequila beverage. Food was great, service was even better. Super sweet, attentive, and chatty waiter. The second time was a little less than great. Food was still delicious, but we felt rushed, pushed out of the way, and forgotten...and it was later in the evening with plenty of empty tables, i.e. no need to get us out of there to seat another party. Still, the food was fantastic and I felt it was money well spent.
Was really good...too much to say! Just GO! Be sure to make a reservation or you'll wait 3 hours for a table! (But the food is worth the wait!)

It was anything can happen Friday, my wife and I were driving down Pennsylvania Avenue in Washington DC when we came upon the Founding Farmers. The restaurant felt energizing and so we decided to take a bite there. Parking did pose a problem so we had to drive around to find a spot.The place was a classy and a hip one and we were given a window table. The waiter was very professional and warm. The menu was tempting and mouthwatering with a variety of options before us. For a couple like us who go nuts over a variety of menu items, this was very much a treat.We started with the popcorn of the day and the Roasted Tomato Soup. Thereafter we had the Yankee Pot Roast and Rotisserie Chicken. It was amazingly delicious. The chicken was a bit dry but still magical. For dessert we both went for the Red Velvet Cake which is a favorite of both of us.The place is pretty amazing and the food definitely satisfies your palate. Please make reservations and prepare to walk as parking may be tight.

Great thoughtful food and drinks. Great staff and service. Well worth the wait.

Ideally, I could give Founding Farmers a 3.5 rating. Their food is eclectic and the ambience is excellent for everything from a brunch with friends, birthday with family, to a nice date night. I love their mission--using locally grown foods for their menu. And their cast iron cornbread gets 5 stars on its own. I'm a veggie/fish eater, so I feel there are limited options at FF in that respect. The vegan/vegeterian options I've tried were not nearly as satisfying as other places. I think if you are a carnivore, this is easily 5 stars, but I've never been blown away by the food (except the cornbread!) and the wait is always pretty long. For me, it's a long wait and expensive for any kind of regular visit, but if you want a fun night out to try some new things (and an excellent drink menu!) then I'd recommend it!
Great food, great atmosphere. The only problem was that I waited an hour with a table reserved.

Went here to have dinner with some friends. We had a great time and great service. The food is what i would describe as American done the right way. They also have an excellent cocktail program. I will definitely be back.
