Loved the food here, the wings were good and so was the pasta!
Very nice place. Loved it. I would refer this place to any one. Had grat experience.
This place is the BEST! Atmosphere, customer service and the food are just a few things that will make you come back. If your visiting D.C. this place is a must.
Excellent food and atmosphere, I love this restaurant!
Great menu for any meal, authentic, very nice service
Waited a while but the food was great as always.

No wonder this place is packed (having a reservation is a good idea). It was amazing for brunch... from the bellini (so fresh and good) to the eggs and grits, all was delicious!! By far our favorite thing was the beignets (so light... wish we'd ordered more of those), but the whole meal was outstanding.
Love them! Love them!! I had a really great time I always do.
This place is amazing. I love the staff, vibe, food, and constantly bustling feel of the restaurant. Go for brunch, lunch or dinner, heck go anytime.
words can't even describe how breathtaking the food is here. enough said.

This is a fantastic restaurant. Everything I've ever eaten here has been great. Really like their chicken and waffles, lobster mac n cheese, burgers etc. it's a little bit expensive but it's not that bad. Service is great too, kind and courteous waiters.

One of the best. Whenever I have a choice of going out to dine in DC, this restaurant is my first choice mainly because of the quality of the food. The wait staff is also very friendly and knowledgeable about the food selections. I have never been disappointed.
Chicken and waffles. 'nuff said.
Love their salmon and their wings!
Best salmon in the city! its cooked to perfection every time i order it
We had a really nice dinner here with friends. Service was prompt and the food was good. Would go again.
AMAZING FOOD! Just be sure to make a reservation or prepare to wait! I wait quite a while, but it was worth it!
The place and location was amazing. I loved the food. I would definitely go there again
Always an amazing experience! Long wait, but totally worth it! Every dish is amazing- you can't go wrong!

Great food I would love to go again and again the price is very reasonable and the quality surprising to say the least, so if your in DC I like this specific location or founding fathers better then others I've been in. I would give 6 if I could so definitely recommended.
Service is always amazing here. I always come for happy hour or dinner, keep hearing brunch is good so ill try it out one day
Love love love their wings, to me, literally the best wings in the city!

My wife and I come here for breakfast quite often. On days without a crowd it is really a great experience. I typically get the same thing so I can't speak to their entire menu but the few selections I've tried have been top notch!
Excellent food and worth every penny!
Delicious and great food, fresh food from the local farms, had been there several time, we all had a great time.
Brunch is bomb and the atmosphere is always nice. Our server was nice as well. For dinner, I always get their wings (forgot the name) but they are the best wings in the city to me!
Best place ever. The drinks were amazing and the food was delicious. I would come back with some friends also.
Love how they make their whisky sours
Loved the meal in Washinton DC,
Great service and food! We held our working lunch there and like always they do an awesome job.
food was very pleasant , place is always busy.
Amazing food, great service, friendly staff. So so so good for breakfast.
The wings by far are my favorite
High quality food in a relaxing yet lively atmosphere. Lots of families dining in as well as young professionals. Highly recommend it!
Very nice place. Great food, very fresh, healthy and appetizing...

Great food!You can taste the fresh, farm-to-table ingredients in virtually every menu item here. Great service and fun environment.Chicken pot pie, chicken and waffles, chicken fried steak, and beef short ribs were all amazing.This place was very busy but the staff was prompt and well put together. Due to its popularity, reservations are definitely recommended. I'll be back.
Lots of food and nice atmosphere.
Best wings in the city hands down! They also make my whisky sours the old school way, with the egg.
Great service and even better food.Service was fast and on pointIt was also pretty busy but the wait was short!

This food was literally the best I've had in a long time, the menu is ever lasting and you can eat a ton on a budget. Love going here after a long night of traveling for a great breakfast. Love their waffles, they're amazing.
Loved the food here! Definitely worth the wait! I've come here with family and I've come here with work staff. Each time was just as good as the last!
Really good food, attentive staff and the source of the food is really good!
Amazing and Fresh! Highly recommended.

This place is awesome! Started off with the Brie app, which is onion jam, brie and apples over warm toasted bread - amazing! The cucumber delight is a fantastic drink. For dinner I had the braised short rib which was cooked so well and was perfectly tender.For as crowded as they were, our table was ready pretty promptly and the service was excellent and timely. I never felt like I was sitting around waiting, which was great.
Great service, wonderful people, lovely food! I would definitely check out this place for brunch if you're in the DC area. I love their food and drinks! It's a fun place for sure.
Great breakfast menu, friendly staff, and relaxed atmosphere close to the White House! We had no idea we were close until after breakfast.
Everything was so so so good. Coffee, scrambled eggs, chicken and waffles. Good service too.
Absolutely incredible brunch! If you are visiting the DC area, this is a must go to. We will be back!

This restaurant is pleasant. I have tasted very different food in my days. But on a crisp fall day, it seems as if founding farmers comforts my whole family and it's not that pricey and it will make your kids keep coming back wanting more asking about when is the next time they will go.All in all if you want your family to eat healthy but dont want them to know take them to founding farmers
You have to try the wings, so bomb and the seafood devil eggs. I like that they make the whisky sours the old fashioned way with the eggs. Not many places in the city do that anymore.

I can't? believe this place sells meat and veggies from farms, I had to try it. No joke, it was absolutely amazing! From the salad, the drinks, main entree and dessert! Wow is all I can say! It was so amazing that I asked about how they made certain dishes and the waiter told me they sell a cook book too. I will be buying that. our waiter was great, I don't? remember? his name and he was so personable, suggestive of drinks and dessert which we ordered and are so glad he suggested them. Great guy. He's an asset to this restaurant. We'll be back tomorrow.
OMG, this place is incredible, my experience here was very pleasant. I highly recommend having reservation for this restaurant because it was FULLED.

If you have the opportunity to eat here, you absolutely must! The skillet cornbread was phenomenal and the large menu had something for everyone. It is impossible to order a bad meal here! This is can't-miss dining. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is fun.
Both the service and the food at this restaurant are always great!
You HAVE to try the garlic pepper wings, literally my favorite thing on the menu to start off with with a side of devil eggs!
amazing place. great experience, loved the food. customer service is good, cant complain, took 20min to get served. overall, i loved the experience.
Bacon-wrapped dates. That is all. I go here every year on my birthday for the bacon-wrapped dates.
LOVE the salmon and brunch is always good
The wings are my favorite ever! No wings in the city compare

I've always had a great experience here. I like the uniqueness of the menu. Reading some of the other reviews.. the best restaurants will always be busy. I would recommend making a reservation, and setting the expectation accordingly, but I've always had great, fast service.
Amazing food and nice ambiance. Will definitely go again!
Food was amazing,Point Period!!!!!!

Found this gem of a restaurant on a DC flyer. We luckily made reservations because it was packed. It is a little noisy inside and was hard to hear our server. Had chicken salad and my spouse had New England clam chowder, lobster Mac & cheese. The food was delish and came very fast.
one of my favourite steakhouse in the city. No wonder the place is good as well as the food is increadible and awsome employees.
There was a bit of a wait for 6 people but well worth it. The service was great and the food was fantastic.
The Food was all delicious and very tasty! The atmosphere was great, the waitstaff here are very attentive!! You must try this place out!! Highly Recommended!!
If you're looking for a GOOD waffle for breakfast.......this is the spot. The side items I got to go along with it was good too, but THAT Waffle was perfect.
Good food, drinks and good place to meet friends. Love It!!!
Their breakfast rocks. Reasonable prices.
Food is absolutely amazing! Many great dishes to choose from that aren't your typical menu items. The food is unique but still comfort food. We loved everything we had and will definitely be back!
Such great food. Can't wait to go back
Everything is delicious From custom drinks to the fresh food and very friendly staff
Amazing place. A must go and see if in town! I have been going here for 3 years and everything on the menu is amazing.
Very nice place really good Im so surprised and also this is very nice. I cant belive this I an so surpiee this is the best ever I cant wait to go again
It's not hype. The food is excellent.
Nice place for brunch.
I loveeeee this place. Please go if you want reliably good food all the time!!
Love the fried green tomatoes and the sauce!
I love this place! It is a great "DC" type of place. Great especially for brunch.
Always delicious and service is outstanding.
Great food. Great atmosphere. Good service. Perfect place for happy hour or dinner. Would recommend!
Great food be sure to make reservations. Great service and parking on the street wasn't bad at all

Nothing on the menu I don't want to eat. The things that I would eat last on the menu, everyone raves about, which is all that matters. I got the shrimp and lobster risotto, which is $30 so a little on the high in for me, but I savored every bite! It was amazing! I coming back for breakfast later, the menu looks even better than the dinner menu
Loved it! Very busy, but great atmosphere. Food is so yummy. This is a MUST if you come out here.
The food! Can't go wrong with anything. Thank you!
Great place!The food was fantastic, super nice place in a great location and we'll be back, for sure!Amazing!
Awesome choices here. they have a lot of items on the menu that they do better than anyone else. Me and my friends enjoying coming here on Friday nights. my favorite item on the menu is the crab dip
Great place, really enjoyed it! Food was on and the staff was very friendly!They were genuine, professional and polite, not to mention the bathrooms were clean!Love how it is close to the water!!
good/great food. friendly staff. check on line menu to make sure you like this kind of food.
Food and service were amazing. Always a great stop for visiting friends and family.
This is a nice spot in DC to stop. Nice sandwiches here and you can get the quick here as well. I highly recommend this place to anyone!

The service was really good!! The people were really nice and helpful and they gave us just the right amount of time to think of what we want. AND THE FOOD.... was delicious I would definitely recommend going there for breakfast and or lunch
One of my favorite places out here in the east coast, enjoy everything they have to offer. I see why they are the rage out here.
I love this place, haven't lived in DC for awhile, and I always make sure me and my friends start our night at this spot.Good food, solid drinks, not too expensive.
to all my veggie friends out there... go here and get the impossible buger. you'll thank me later. xo
Great restaurant, there is a little wait, but the food is great. A reservation is a good idea since this place gets busy. The prices are reasonable, the food is a wait, but worth waiting for!
Yes! This place is awesome. Good service, great food. Highly recommend. Our waiter recommended the burger and it was absolutely amazing.
What a great place, really enjoyed it, great seasonal selection. Everything taste so fresh!
This place is always fantastic/ food and drinks. The only complaint ever is the wait time on cocktails.
Great food and inviting atmosphere.
This is one of my favorite places to brunch in DC.
Absolutely love this location! It's always busy but the service is always great and the food is always delicious!
You will not be disappointed with pretty much anything on the menu.
I had lunch last Saturday here with my family and we had good time, the food was great, especially the chicken wings.
Incredible, affordable breakfast. Will be back
Great beer, great menu, great food, great service, great atmosphere. What more can a hungry person ask for?
Love Founding Farmers... But make a reservation! I always have a great experience here and love the staff.
Very good, very nice.Super taste
great food great service must return soon
Great food and service. I have never had a bad meal or appetizer here. Even breakfast was great.
one of my fave places! great food great portions great prices
Delicious! Does not disappoint.
Love this place. Great tasting food. I'll be back
The BEST FOOD EVER! Friendly staff and lots to choose from. I'm a pescatarian and I was not disappointed!
Good food and drinks. Very lively atmosphere. Service was also very good. We will definitely come back to try other dishes.
Very good food, very good service.

Love Founding Farmers and their bacon lollies. Every time I've visited this restaurant, I have not left disappointed. Worth checking out if you've never been! Always ask the server for what they recommend! And if you really don't know what to get, just try their chicken and waffles... you can't go wrong with that. This place can get packed, so I recommend a reservation ahead of time.
I really love the food and customer services, really happy we choose this places for me and my family.
Oh man what an amazing and healthy food. The price is just right, not too expensive. But the ambience is what makes me come back to this place again.
Really tasty and filling breakfast. Reasonable price for the amount of food you get. I would eat here again.
awesome cornbread, will come again
We loved everything! The menu was creative, the atmosphere was lovely and the drinks were phenomenal.

Great post, thanks for sharing. Use many of these methods and tactics myself. Personally I like focusing on back links from secure sites.Thanks for sharing this content. I have been using many of these techniques and having success with them. There are a few you mentioned that I will test out also. I'm looking forward to implementing these.

LOVE this place. This is my daughter and I's favorite lunch place. You can always expect good food and surprisingly quick service for a place that is ALWAYS busy with a long wait line. We highly recommend making reservations, we do after our first experience here.
Love love this place! Great service always.
DELICIOUS, especially the home made pasta! We go back as often as we can.
Never a bad decision. NEVER a bad meal! Favorite place in the DMV, hands-down.

My experience at Founding Farmers was simply AMAZING! The spread was perfect. My friend and I arrived at the Virginia location for brunch at about 11:00 am and sat at the bar. We decided to do the buffet. The food was very tasty. The spread consisted of FRESHLY MADE pancakes, eggs, salmon, shrimp & grits, fruit, fried chicken, veggie options and the best French toast sticks I ever had!!! Price was about 30 bucks. I usually don't write reviews but today they exceeded my expectations. I'll be returning soon!
Love it! Do yourself a favor and order the best bloody Mary ever!
Favorite restaurant in DC. I'd recommend anything on the menu. Also, their breakfast is very good.
Their Vegetarian Burger is to die for!
it's a long wait but well worth it, all ways pick the most reviewed places to eat. food and service was excellent , very nice decor, good atmosphere, lots of people just the way i like it
Amazing food, atmosphere, and customer service

I'm a little biased I suppose, but I gotta say, I LOVE Founding Farmers. The food and drink are delish, but I think the best ingredient in the recipe is the team doing the work every day. Bravo to my peeps.
What can I say, this place is excellent in every way. The service is great, the food is fantastic, the atmosphere is perfect. I love this place and have never been disappointed.

Yum!!! The wait was super long but well worth the wait. Excellent customer service + delicious food = recipe for success. Thanks Founding Farmers, will be back or will check out your other concept on the other side of town.
The breakfast is amazing here! Also the chicken and waffles dinner is amazing.
Had brunch with my bestie here last weekend and I know I should feel guilty for indulging but....OMG the Chicken and Waffles are to die for! And thats all I have to say about that :)

A delicious place for lunch. We definitely recommend getting a reservation first prior to planning your visit. My friend enjoyed his  and stills talks about it, 1 week later. I ordered a poke salad and loved every bite. The menu had plenty to choose from, and the menu items are all carefully thought out. A truly tasty experience
Man this place is good. Almost anywhere you go in DC, people will recommend this joint to you. They're not wrong!
Amazing cornbread, best dinner in DC hands down
Great menu, tasty, fresh ingredients, cool vibe.
Great service, great atmosphere, and most importantly great food. Would absolutely recommend.
Holy moly! Get the mac and cheese with the pork bacon and i swear you will never look at mac and cheese the same again! I came all the way from new york for this place and it did not disappoint!
Great food and custom cocktails!!! Always a great experience. Love the brunch!!!
Everything you need in one place.
Little wait but worth the wait!!! Great Breakfast place. Easy menu but all good food!!!
The best of the best, keep it up Founding Farmers.great food and service, place looks nice and clean.
Great spot! Worth the wait if you've never been there before. It is Pennsylvania Ave. so if you can go on the off hours you'll get the Royal treatment and Royal food!
Love Love Love! They have quality food, and the best homemade sodas. Great place for the family!
Great food and great service! Drinks are well done and creative!
Love this place! The brunch menu is delicious...

One of my favorite places ever!!! Like others have said, definitely be sure to make a reservation as they are always always always busy (good sign)!!! Phenomenal coffee. I've had their chicken and waffles a few times which is an amazing dish. I've had their meatless vegetable meatloaf- I'm not a vegetarian and it was AMAZING. For an appetizer, I would recommend the Brie bread plate that comes with carmelized onions and apple slices- unbelievable. Their service/friendliness is not horrible but its not the best I've ever had, but the vibe and the food makes up for it.
Loved Sunday brunch. So many options and the staff was great

I can't recommend this place enough! It is our go-to restaurant when we have people visiting from out of town. It is such a Washington DC staple! When going here, do be prepared to wait, but it will be worth it!
I tend to get extremely good service each time I visit this location. Food is always fresh, I think at this I managed to try everything on the menu.
Amazing place to be, nuff said!
Amazing kitchen! the food is very good, the service is also good.
It was great, coffee was well brewed and the staff was very nice
The steak and enchiladas are a personal favorite.

This place was recommended by a friend, we visited it for lunch couple days ago and enjoyed everything about it. This place is very welcoming, friendly, and the food is just great. We didn't call for a reservation but we were given the option to sit at the bar so we didn't have to wait for a table. We ordered pesto bread for appetizers then some cocktails, Meat loaf and gravy with sweet potato and beans on the side and also Sausage and mushroom gnocchi. My favorite was the pesto bread, it's amazing how the flavors come together with this simple appetizer.
Favorite restaurant :) I recommend the Yankee Pot Roast :) I get it every time!
Came here for business lunch. The food was good, and very attentive service. Definitely, a place to return to for dinner.
been here 3 times ...always great
Crowded but great food! Deviled eggs are a hit and the service of staff ranks excellent.
chicken, waffles and mac and cheese!!!!! YUMMY
Waht did I just have?? Wow! This chicken is so tender. I am speechless. Plus the waffles are the bomb.
I absolutely love this place. It's pretty busy but they're very attentive. Food is always good!

I took my 4th graders to GB after a field trip to Kennedy Center. This was such a great experience for the students. They loved the food and the idea of eating at what they thought was a fancy restaurant. As a teacher I know it is important for kids to have experiences and I work hard at making that possible. I am so grateful to GB for how we were treated and helping to make a life lasting memory and experience for my students.
We stopped in for lunch on our final day in DC and had one the best meals we have ever had!!!
Best Burrito I ever had! Friendly staff and great food. I must visit if you are in D.C.
great food and even amazing decor. chicken pot pie reminds of me of when my mom would make it. reminds me of back home at Arizona.
I loved this place the food was good.
Love it especially the brunch time. Go and enjoy

I had heard a lot about Founding Farmers from friends and on social media and let me tell you, it lives up to the hype. Saturday brunch was absolutely packed, but we did have a reservation and only had to wait about 5-10 minutes for our table to be available. They do take reservations and I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND making one because there is a constant swarm of people outside waiting for a table. We ordered beignets for the table which were light, fluffy, and perfectly fried. They came with three delicious dipping sauces (raspberry, chocolate, and caramel) that were also perfect. The best part of the meal was the strawberries and cream stuffed french toast. It was simply divine. I would highly recommend this restaurant as long as you are okay with a very loud, bustling environment. It is constantly busy and a little difficult to hear if you are sitting right in the thick of it. However, the food is totally worth it. I can't wait to go back!!
definitely try this place! service and food was outstanding!

Great food, great atmosphere. Make reservations because it gets a good crowd.The floor at the rear of the restaurant on the first and second level (near the elevator) were very sticky. The same for the floor of the inside of the elevator

Had lunch here on 6/23/17 Long wait to be seated,but that was not unexpected given it's popularity. I had the cheeseburger and fries, it was excellent. Service was good. The hostess, Lucy, was a sweetheart.Will definitely visit again.
Great food, variety of drinks and food to pick through. Conveniently nit far from many sites in DC. I would come here again. Everyone who loves food must try this place.
Some of the best and most creative food in the District. I tell everyone about this place.
Yes. In my trip I was able to get some amazing food from here. Love it. Thanks so much.
Great service! Great quality food! Would recommend highly!
Simply an amazing wait staff and the best food in DC.
Really delicious burger and fries. And oh my God. Their beignets were to die for.

Before I left to go fight the big war I came here with her to have one last good bye. Not knowing if I'd make it back to ever see her again. I couldn't think of anything else but her until the food came. It was absolutely amazing. I couldn't believe the friendly service and the amazingly prepared food. This was definitely one of the best meals of my life. I almost forgot about her. Definitely look at the drink menu, can't go wrong with that path.
I ate here for the first time a few weeks ago and it was amazing! Best brunch I've had in a while!
Great! But be sure to make reservations.
Great food/drinks/service! Always book a reservation. (I'm a big fan of the whiskey cocktails)
Amazing sweet food! Super nice staff, and motivated managers.

Founding farmers was amazing. The food was great. The host made me horny. The chicken and waffles were orgasmic. And boy we're those devilish eggs devilish. Amazing spot. Hostess wore an orange dress that cured my rare disease. I used to have smallcox disease. Now I don't! Amazing
Top notch farm to table food at a reasonable price, plus great drinks!
Loved the chicken and waffles! It has to be one of the best fried chickens I've ever had.
This restaurant always has a menu that offers a variety of options. Breakfast is especially great!
The entire experience was amazing from the waiter to the food. I can not wait to visit again soon.
Everything you eat here is amazing and big portions- I am trying to come back year after year.
Everything in this place is outstanding I highly recommend it you will not be disappointed
Place and food is great. Parking could be challenging.
The food is nice and fresh! The staff is very welcoming and the food is so good! All of the food is fresh and it is so amazing!! :)
Took my mom for her birthday and we all loved it. Great atmosphere and good!
I love it here, the food is so good and large portions!
Great food! Definitely need reservations!!! Fine for 10year old kids who like real food!!!
Come early, the place is crowded but it is sooooo goooood!
I'm a vegetarian now but the chicken and waffles are the best I ever had.
I've been here many times. It's always excellent food and great energy.

Went here for Sunday brunch on a date. It doesn't get any better than this ladies and gentlemen. I ordered the chicken and waffles with mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. A lot of carbs I know!! I ate every bit of it. The mimosas were on point to. I ate brunch at another location and it just wasn't the same. I have ate dinner here before in Maryland and it was great. Brunch is what sticks out in my mind.

I have been to the founding farmer's in DC, Bethesda and Tysons, they are all worthy of a 5 star review. The fried green tomatoes and cornbread are my appetizers of choice, they are off the chart, amazing!
Really good and fresh food, good for groups, but need a reservation, it's always crowded.
Great place you can go over and over and not get the entire menu.
Great place to have a tea with a friend or family! The place is nice and clean.
Great place to visit on a weekend. I really liked the food and ambiance. Cheers to that.
Loved this place. I went in there after needing some food badly, turns out to be the best place in town for live food and organic!
Great food, great service and cozy atmosphere! The only problem is the huge lines! Learned my lesson to always make reservations!

Really Really Really Great Place!The steak was amazing! The servers were very friendly (though I suspect they were overworked a little and seemed stressed at time. Yet, they always served me with a smile)The hostess did have trouble fining our reservations, but the place still honored our time, so we were relieved . It is also a very fun atmosphere with lots of students and GW Professors.
Great food but make a reservation
One of my favorite go-to spots.
Favorite DC restaurant. I take every visiting friend and family member here!
Great food, great ethics! So appreciate knowing where my food comes from!
love the food and people tysons location is my primary spot
Loved everything, from the atmosphere, to their mission, to the food. It was a perfect date night.
Always a good time when it comes to food.
Great food! Little expensive but totally worth it!
Founding Farmers is a must try. It is always busy so I recommend making reservations, but there is a reason why is it busy!
Food is fresh and delicious. Service is great, even on a busy day.
such good food and quality. I love this place and the crab dip. Brunch is very good too here!
Amazing service!
Great food and great drinks and a great wait staff!!!! Absolutely no complaints!!! I would definitely make a reservation especially on the weekend.

Love the farm to table concept! Diverse menu with great food, craft beers, and wine. I've been 3 or 4 times, and each time has been equally delicious. Love the prime rib, pot pie, steak and enchiladas, chx and waffle, and farm breads with dipping sauces. Always busy.
Best in town.
Excellent food.
Super delicious coffee and food - and it's organic.
Nom. somewhat expensive nom, but nom. No more needs be said
Best $30 all you can eat brunch!
Great service.

I very rarely give outstanding reviews, but the food here is unbelievable. Everything was brought out in well-crafted form and the food was quite flavorful. Definitely try their fried green tomatoes - the goat cheese spread is amazing. Definitely a must visit.As well, the chain is farmer-focused, which is a big deal for not only myself but many other millennials. Their focus on the farmer and ensuring that all food is natural and wholesome is unparalleled. Great food for a great price - definitely come here for dinner or lunch, but make sure you have reservations!
The food here is amazing! I went there on Sunday and loved it. They have servers who bring the dishes out to you and also multiple stations of fresh delicious food.
Love this place! Great service and the food was so great! Can't wait to go back!
Love the food and service
Great food, fun atmosphere! Hard to get in..
nice food and reasonable price
I had breakfast there with a colleague who suggested it and it was really wonderful. The prices were reasonable. I am planning to go back. It was fantastic
ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! No other words for this yummy breakfast. There were 12 in our party and the staff was great, the food was all hot and everyone said their meal was perfect. 5 stars well earned!
We love the Sunday brunch - but with the large crowds its best to sit at the bar where you can get waited on quickly.
Good food. Great atmosphere. Good value

One of our favorites. Farm to table concept with the best ingredients around. The location is great but the parking can be a nightmare. Take Uber. The setting and service are flawless. Great for brunch too.
You must have brunch here at least once! Loved the Chicken & Waffles and you can't go wrong with any of the Farmhouse waffles!
Delicious!!!

Great spot, found this gem when I was in town for work and tried some of the recommendations. The pot pie and the enchilada and both were amazing. The waitstaff was on point and took care of everything.I will be back on my next trip for sure.
Too good to be true, waiters don't rush you. They're very patient and kind
OMG the cornbread!!!! Everything on the menu is excellent!
Amazing breakfasts. Good neighborhood. Make sure to make a reservation on the weekends.
Excellent food AND service!
Our favorite restaurant during our stay in DC!
Definitely some of the best food I've had in the city!
great place
All I can say is that I love this place, It is inspiring, and the bartenders are amazing!
Excellent place for breakfast or brunch. I would really recommend the Beignets.

Founding Farmers has always been reliable for us for a delicious meal out. It's our place.The juices are fresh and amazing. We thought there was something besides water, sugar, and lemon in our lemonade because it was so tasty. Apparently they just know how to do it. The salt-crusted prime rib is super. With one exception of an okay server, the rest have been as good as anywhere. Two tips: get a reservation because it's popular, and don't write a review for Founding Farmers after midnight. I am hungry now!
Definitely need a reservation. Great food and fast service. I'm here almost every week. Awesome for big groups or families definitely recommended.
Most creative and tastiest brunch menu in DC!
The breakfast is incredible! Also in a great location for touring attractions in DC.
Loved it! Food was tasty and original. An unforgettable adventure to the palate!
The food is amazing! The service was fantastic, and great setting. Love, love, love this place!!!!!
Visiting from CA! Great food, excellent environment!
they have very good customer service and good cofee
Walking into the business there was a sense of warmth and relaxation. I really enjoyed the service and the price was good. The employees were friendly and helpful. I would recommend this to others.
Love the food and the location
Simply wonderful.

I would just like to point out that this is an awesome place for a lunch date. The menu of course is great with plenty of variety that will just spoil you for choice. I have been here quite a few times in the past and this place, the incredible menu and the amazing staff always blows my mind. While I'm not a fan of curry, the Panang Curry here is just brilliant. Served with panang paste, coconut milk, bell peppers and mushrooms, this is the best curry I've had in a long time. I've also tried the seafood here which is delicious, and then there's the Chef's Special that offers a variety of delicacies that can suit almost any palette. The place really lives up to its name, and is not kidding, so don't be surprised if the chicken you order tastes like oranges. The joint has some great poultry dishes too that are worth the taste, and your money.

So good! I recently had my second visit to Founding Farmers and it was just as good as the first a few years ago when the place was not as well known. Now you DEFINITELY need reservations. We went at 10:30am on a Wednesday and it was packed. Luckily we had a reservation.My husband ordered chicken & waffles, which he has never had but seemed like a signature dish. It was fantastic! The chicken tenders themselves were amazing. Obviously breaded and fried fresh to order. A white gravy was served on the side. The waffle was perfect too and served with a cinnamon maple syrup. I ordered the breakfast platter with the most perfectly scrambled eggs I've ever had, sausage, hash browns, and some amazing grilled ciabatta bread. Yum! Of course we had to try the beignets. Out of this WORLD!! With chocolate dipping sauce OMG. So light and airy and powder sugary. Amazing. Order them. They take about 25 minutes so order them when you sit down. The coffee was also great. Service was excellent. Metered street parking was pretty easy to find and it was during the week

I am a true fan of Founding Farmers. For the past two years, I've gone at least twice a month and have had multiple business meetings there with colleagues. The scene and ambience is great and I've yet to have a bad experience. I'm sure it helps me to know the GM and many of the hosts and servers. I love the quality and freshness of the food selections and the curated cocktails are a welcome surprise. Personal favorites include chicken pot pie, goat cheese ravioli, grilled cheese with roasted tomato soup and more. Since I'm a whiskey man, my drink of choice is the Farmer Jon, which is crafted with Knob Creek bourbon and orange cura?ao and lemon! Mellow and smooth. Brunch is great on weekends and the french toast is a must. I recommend you make some reservations and find out why this place has a wonderful reputation.

I have visited FF on many occasions and tried many offerings. Each experience is fantastic with fresh veggies expertly handled by the chef. I dare you to try anything on this menu. You will return over and over again just like I have. Aside from the fresh handling of all the ingredients, there is an offering for every budget. One of my favorites is the lobster macaroni and cheese. I hate beets, but I eat them here whenever they have them on the menu. In summer I like the shrimp roll and there's always the daily popcorn and the skillet cornbread. In winter there are hearty stews served in individual crocks with bread and salad for around $12. Honestly, one of the best places in the area to eat, especially after the departure of Kinkead's a couple years ago.

Great modern decor, good food and service. The corn bread is very moist and pairs great with the honey butter. The chicken bolognese pasta had incredible tasting meat sauce. The chicken and waffles has a lot of food as you get mac and cheese, a thigh and a breast, half a waffle and your choice of side, in which I ordered the green beans. I enjoyed the chicken and it wasn't over cooked and was tender. The waffles were crispy and not soft in which is the way I like it. You can dip your chicken in the gravy and take a bite of the mac and cheese -OR- don't dip it and pair it with the waffles and syrup on top.

Whenever I'm in the mood for some fresh, savory American comfort food or handcrafted cocktails, I think of Founding Farmers. Plus those decadent desserts are unmatched and meatless options keep me coming back. This flagship location has been popular among foodies and casual diners for years and for good reason! I've dined here numerous times with minimal disappointment- aside from the wait if I forget to make a reservation. Most times, I sit at the bar to be entertained by the mixologists who respond to requests like "Make me something fun" with grace. They got mad skills crafting tasty cocktails that are also beautiful.

It was the best of times!!!! Came here with my girlfriends for a nice dinner and had a blast. Ambience is awesome, service was fantastic, food and cocktails were delicious. Our server Jasmine was so energetic, knowledgeable, and sweet. She guided us through our entire meal. The cucumber delight was a true delight! We started our meal out with piping hot cornbread and crispy fried green tomatoes. I was so happy that I listened to Jasmine and got the scallops (they really were super delicious). We'll definitely have to come back for the carrot cake. If you're in DC and haven't been to Founding Farmers make a reservation it's a must!

Extremely loud" would be a more accurate description and I'm talking about an ordinary week-night, not the weekend frenzied" would describe the general ambiance. Avoid Topolobampo for that romantic "special occasion."

What can I say, the food was fantastic. Tres expensive, yes otherwise just expensive. But for a great dining experience I think I got my money's worth. I think you can dine well and less-expensively at the companion restaurant Frontera Grill, but for a special occasion or just a special dining experience this is a great place. It was a bit noisy, but nothing to bad. I think that would be the one thing I wish were a little better. Although, the noise stemmed in part from the close quarters and partly because people were enjoying themselves - so goo engergy!

Excellent refrigerator repair service in Washington, DC. I called Wahington DC Appliances Repair on the recommendation of GE as they didn't have any availability for next 2 weeks. Based on our model number he came with the replacement part needed for the repair, which was a pleasant surprise. He was efficient, and completed the repair in less than one hour. He answered all of our concerns and questions and took care to protect our wood floors from water and melting ice. We would certainly call on him again & refer to our neighborhood.
my steak was over done by a long shot. I asked for Medium and it was almost well done.

This review is for restaurant week lunch only. Strip House is my favorite steakhouse in Washington. However, I will skip it next year because the steak was poor. It was a thin slice of a ribeye that had lots of fat, butter and salt. The fries that came with the steak were terrific.

The food was excellent, well prepared and well served. The prices were higher than what was listed, this is more like a $$$$ than a $$$. I would rate this as one of the top 10 steak houses I've been too. The veal chop was amazing.

It is hard to find a good steak house that isn't cheesy, a lot of hype, as well as consistent, but Strip House breaks the mold. The service is quick without being invasive, the food is tasty, cooked just right and has great portions. Def a win, win.

Outstanding restaurant, very chic, lots of fun, very crowded, but still felt like it was a quaint dinner for 3. I would highly recommend this as a starting point for any Friday or Saturday evening, whether for appetizers or for main meal. Bar is excellent, and the overall quality of food and drink was excellent.

This is a nice place to refresh, before heading out into the fog for some more walking and chatting.

We highly recommend this practice. Our dentist recommended Dr. Orchin for our then 11-year old, but we first wanted to explore other practices that charged less. The less expensive orthodontists said they could not apply braces without first pulling teeth and sending our daughter for oral surgery. After examining our child, Dr. Orchin said none of that was necessary.  He straightened her teeth to perfection in just 21 months.  No pulled teeth, no oral surgery, no nonsense. The braces have been off for over a year, and we are absolutely thrilled with the results.  Paying for braces was going to be a struggle for us no matter who the orthodontist was. We decided to go with Orchin Orthodontics even though he costs somewhat more. For this kind of investment, we didn't want to take the risk that the braces would be totally successful and so we went with the practice with the best reputation. We are 100% happy and feel that we received that value that what we paid for. We will soon send our next child back to Dr. Orchin to have her braces applied.  Note: Wish we had known this when our first child was young, but those who buy dental insurance well in advance of applying braces may be able to cover part of the cost to insurance.

THE WAITERS!Yes the food is good....Yes the drinks are good....But the best part about Founding Farmers?The male waiters!Founding Farmers has, by far, the best looking male waiters and bartenders of any DC restaurant. And I'm a very picky girl who has eaten at many different DC establishments.Nearly every guy working there is extremely good looking! I don't know if this was intentional by them or if they got extremely lucky but I have to give Founding Farmers props - this is really good for your business! When the girls and I are deciding on a place to have a ladies night out, we all look at each other, smile and say Founding Farmers!The last time the girls and I dined there we had a waiter named Paul who was drop dead GORGEOUS. He could easily be a model or actor if he wanted to. And his smile was sooooo endearing, he seemed like a really down to earth guy. (He has a nice butt too hehe). His service was good and when we come back we will definitely request Paul again. Ladies, stay away, hes all mine! By the way Paul, if you happen to see this, I was too shy to leave you my phone number but please contact me, I would love to get to know you better!So keep it up Founding Farmers, you will certainly establish a regular customer base if you keep guys like Paul on your staff :)

This is one of our fave restaurants. We recommend: roast beef, french dip, roasted veg sandwich, chicken and waffles, shrimp and grits, any seafood pasta, butternut ravioli, cornbread, the homemade potato chips, and the red velvet cake and chocolate cakes! Also, be sure to try a cocktail, sweet tea, or limeade!

After a great meal at Farmers and Fishers, I was referred to Founding Farmers by my server. GREAT suggestion. We loved our food, butternut squash ravioli and chicken & waffle. The cocktails are unique and yummy! we will definitely be back!

I like that the food is comforting and simple. I feel like i can eat it everyday without becoming tired of it. The many options help. The best part however, is the bar. No matter what mood I'm in there is always a cocktail to fit.

Fabulous!I went to Founding Farmers with a large group for a friend's birthday and had a wonderful time. The food was delicious, innovative, and diverse. The atmosphere was perfect for celebrating and the staff took great care of us. Our server, Christopher Carrero, was very attentive to our needs, especially given the size of our group.I will definitely go again and look forward to taking my wife there soon!

Had business meeting over breakfast at Founding Farmers a couple of weeks ago. The food was great - pancakes are the best I've had in the city. Love their coffee - smooth, rich and robust flavor. Food came out quickly. Service was attentive but clearly recognized it was a business meeting and so did not interrupt and hover -much appreciated! Manager came by to check on how things were. Great start to the day and will definitely schedule future "meetings" with business associates here.

I will start out by telling you that I am the mother of one of the managers so you may think I am biased, but I'm NOT. He didn't serve us and he didn't cook our food so I can be objective. I took 3 out-of-town guests there last week and they were very impressed, as I was. I have been before and I enjoy the food very much, the variety, the taste and the quality are all excellent. As such, I am amazed when I read bad or so-so reviews for this restaurant - that people complain about rude servers or about having to wait a long time. First of all, I have never, ever had anything but excellent service and smiling faces- and the guys there don't know who I am, they are not putting on a show just for me. They just know to be polite and well-mannered. As for having to wait a long time... this is NOT a fast -food, junk-food dump. This is a classy restaurant that makes everything from scratch and good food isn't cooked in a few seconds. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants great food and great drinks. I had the "dark and stormy" rum-based cocktail and the 'land and sea" .The "land" was the most tender and moist beef I have ever had. I am not a big red-meat eater, but this was incredible. My guests were extremely impressed and had a wonderful time. They also loved the appetisers- the deviled eggs, the bacon wrapped dates, the fried green tomatoes (one asked for a second order!) and the breads.... We all had a variety of desserts, all of which were excellent, including the cheesecakes , the apple turnover and the vertical banana split. This restaurant has only been open since September, so I commend you all for doing a great job and introducing the 'green' restaurant concept to Washington, DC.
Had a Sunday lunch there. The food was very close to "out of this world" good.

First time reviewer and there is a reason for it......my wife and I live in Baltimore quite a hike from Farmers, but my wife had been talking about it for a while to the point that we had to go or else I faced the wrath. The perfect occasion came up when she recieved a promotionat her job that was long overdue! To celebrate she wanted to go.....you guessed it Founding Farmers! I got there early and checked in with the hostess who by the way was overly pleasant almost sickeneing but still a welcome change from other places. My wife calls to tell me shes running late, that meant over an hour late that I stood waiting for her. A man approached me and asked if I was waiting for a table, when I said yes but waiting for my wife he asked how long I'd been waiting, we got to chatting and he said he was th service manager there and told me all about the restaurant from the ground up. I explained how my wife had been talking about this place and he seemd genuinley interested which is odd these days, I told him about her big promotion and this was how we were celebrating. My wife eventually arrived and almost immediatley He showed back up(later to find out his name was Simon), and took us to our table upstairs nice booth out of the way. Our server showed up to take our order for drinks and was really pleasant. He left and Simon showed up a minute or so later wth 2 glasses of champagne!!! He said he heard someone had recieved a big promotion and wanted to say congratualtions!! I was blown away....my wife was hea over heels in love with this place immedialtley!! I've been married for 6 years and this was by far our best dining experience ever, and we eat out 3 times a week. The food was awesome and the service was extra attentive!! Thankyou Simon and Founding Farmers for setting a new precedent in dining!!! p.s my wife works in DC and will be in for lunch with co-workers!

I went to Founding Farmers for the first time last week. Not only was my visit long overdue, but so is the concept of this forward-thinking restaurant. We need "green" restaurants like this. Apart from my visit being long overdue, it was certainly well-worth it. We were greeted and seated in a timely manner by well-mannered and friendly staff. The atmosphere and general ambience were very pleasant, the background music was low and did not disturb the conversation. It was important to me that the bar staff and the wait staff were extremely knowledgeable about the restaurant's products. They have one heck of a range of scotches, bourbons and other liquors, it was amazing. The cocktails are unbelievable - and what a good time we had trying to decide which one to have, (we'll be back for more!). Then there was the food.... Those fried green tomatoes were so tasty and I loved the sauce and cheese served with them. The steaks were cooked wonderfully, the crab cakes were the absolute BEST, everything was superb and presented in a mouth-watering way. Thank you, we loved it. We have an anniversary coming up... we will be back !!
The music was so loud we could not hear our waitress. They refused to turn it down. We will not be back.
Too little of food portion!It does not worth for money!The people we also not friendly!

Our third time coming, we had been raving about this place. We were coming with another couple whom we absolutely wanted to try the place but they canceled at the last minute. Luckily I'd have to say, in retrospect. The service was so unprofessional. We had the Chefs Table which we've gotten every time. We had to get up for silverware, ask to have them change out the plates after a few courses only to have them drop the used silverware on the table. Even the food was not to par except the paella which was excellent. Hard broccoli, hard churros, les Jambon than usual (by far). They kept forgetting bread and we waited 10 minutes for some olive oil. I had a white sangria and it was 75% Ice. Didn't order a second one even though It was my birthday because i didn't want to pay $12 for a cup of ice. I hope things improve because honestly when you lived a place and it disappoints to this level, you don't want to come back!
I took my friends there for dinner. All of them loved the food and the environment. The service was so good! Planning to go again.

Walking into Boqueria in Washington DC was like stepping into a secret world, a world where culinary artistry took center stage. My quest was simple yet profound: to rendezvous with the legendary Boquerones Con Naranja. In the realm of food, it's those quiet rendezvous with dishes like these that resonate the loudest.The first bite was nothing short of an awakening. The boquerones, whispering secrets of the sea, met the vibrant zest of the naranja in a dance of flavors that would have made even the most seasoned flamenco dancer jealous. It was a union that transcended mere ingredients

The potato was average, and the serving of mushroom croquestas was a small serving to be sharable. Paella was very very delicious. I ordered large between two people and a lot was left so make sure you are hungry!

The food was tasty, a tad expensive for what you get, but it was the server that ruined the experience for me. Suggested one item, the "sampler" and wouldn't explain what exactly came with it. Then didn't even take my order. I had to signal for him to come back over. After dinner he got part of our group churros without asking anyone else is they wanted any. Then he wouldn't separate the bill. We had to do our own math to figure out who owed what. He definitely didn't deserve the 20% automatic gratuity.
I had paella here. It was good, but it was burnt at the bottom.

Divine! This spot in DC is absolutely a must. It's a top tier breakfast and other later in the day items also sound amazing. We made reservations which are probably more necessary during brunch hours on the weekend. They do have a large bar area for seating. Parking is street.

Awesome for trying out a variety of Balkanese dishes for a single price. Delicious food and top-notch service. The only small downside is that the vibe on the third floor isn't as great as the other two, but it's not a big deal. It's probably the overflow area for walk-ins. Make sure to reserve a table before going!
We were a large party of 11 seated in the atrium. Izzy was our server and she was very attentive and responsive to our needs. Great food and service !

Love love love this place. I came here for dinner and drinks with my friend before going to a concert. The interior design is cute and the ambiance is so much fun. Great for hanging out with friends or even going on a date. Everything I tried from the cocktails to the food were yummy. Definitely worth the visit if you're on 14th st.
Great tapas and lovely atmosphere to meet up with friends. I will definitely visit again

Ambiance: Casual, calm, elegantParking: Street meter parking is availablePricing: Somewhat cheapFood (flavors): I did not eat the pork or red meat based dishes. The mushroom balls were LOVELY

Having visited Boqueria Penn Quarter last night, I just wanted to comment that we found all dishes of the taster menu of very high quality and extremely good wines to match. We also found the service to be excellent. Our compliments to you all. Love this place and will continue to visit.
I come here pretty much once a month. I love all the food, brunch specials, and service. Sometimes I order the catering size Tortilla Espa?ola and eat it for days.
Loved this place so much that we visited again the next day! The food is absolutely delicious, and the drinks are very well made.
The food is great as always, and the restaurant is so so so beautiful! Perfect Ambiance. Great place for date night.

Le Diplomate? - more like "Le Dictateur"I'm a tourist, from Denmark, a woman, travelling alone, looking to get a small meal in the quiet company of my book. Only here shortly, I have been told "Le Diplomat" is an institution. So I go, in the safe assumption that one person can squeeze in without a reservation. Little did I know. I arrive at the restaurant seeing plenty of tables available outside. Relief. Being Scandinavian November Fahrenheit's is no bother. Inside, I approach the seaters. "Le Diplomat" was undergoing a technical system-update, so no walk-ins, only at the bar. However, the bar is completely full. I am not allowed to sit outside. Bummed, I exit the restaurant and wonder, if this place is system-dictated, can I book a spot via the system? Within two minutes, I have a reservation in an hour. Being already at the restaurant, now with a reservation, I figured they could seat me at one of the many available outside tables until my reservation. The seaters were shocked. It shouldn't have been possible. But now I'm a customer with a reservation. A manager is called in. It is probably the least diplomatic service I have ever received. The manager repeats the message of "system update" and something about maintaining the service level at an "even flow". Might I remind that I'm one person, not a company of six. Speaking faster, mechanically and in a cutesy voice, does not make the irrationality of a message less evident. More humorous really. We were surrounded by empty tables. I end up being practically hunted out of the restaurant. As a European I left the place in shock. What happened to normal level-headedness and simple problem-solving? Nevermind a system update, in Europe a ressouceful floor-handler would have solved the situation with more elegance. Because of technological updates to a restaurant system, all regular human empathy and logic seemed out the window. I left the place feeling more lonely than I had in a long time. I had just witnessed a world without rationality. On the night of the 2024 election, in a time where human connection is more needed than ever, I spoke to a wall. The kind of indoctrinated repetition of "system update" from everyone standing next to empty tables in the tenths, made "Le Diplomat" resemble more "Le Dictateur", than a rational, critical thinking, independent diplomat, capable of what we in Europe call a little flair.

This establishment excels in creating an outdoor dining experience that rivals the Sahara desert in peak summer. The outdoor seating area, which was supposed to offer a refreshing experience, was more akin to an oven. The lack of shade combined with the blazing sun made me question if I had stumbled into a survival reality show.The food, when it eventually arrived, did little to redeem the situation. While the dishes themselves were passable, the heat had sapped any appetite we might have had. It was a challenge to focus on flavors when all I could think about was how quickly I could retreat to an air-conditioned refuge.The prices were exorbitant given the conditions. Apparently, the privilege of baking in their outdoor sauna came at a premium. I left Le Diplokate drained, dehydrated, and questioning my life choices.In conclusion, unless you have a fetish for sunburns and enjoy the sensation of your clothes adhering to your body like a second skin, I'd advise against dining at Le Diplomate. It's an experience best reserved for those who have a deep-seated desire to test their endurance in extreme temperatures.
Bad service, bad food. High price. Not the best image of French cuisine.
Ordered the Foie Gras and they did not send anything to eat it with. I should have ordered the $8 side bread

Staff manning the entryway hostess/check-in table are rude and have an unwelcoming demeanor. Extremely off-putting and disappointing, as we had heard the food here was decent. But unfortunately, I can't confirm or deny because we walked right back out the front door. There was no way we were staying to patronize an establishment where staff have bad attitudes.
Bartending staff was rude and abusive to female customers. Never going there again!!
Ridiculous attitude for aloud overpriced foid

One of the most overrated restaurants I have ever been to. The food, while common is overpriced. The service is arrogant and condescending. The atmosphere is over produced, contrived, and quite laughable. After hearing so much about this place I am sorry I ever went.

Service went downhill after William Washington left as the general manager a couple years ago. Erik Segelbaum left about a year ago and the service is now sub-par. The one vegan option (couscous with vegetable - "vegetable tagine") is tasteless. Still riding all the five star reviews it got back when it first opened but recent reviews tell a different story. Wish the service and food was better. Didn't even give us the bread basket last time and we ordered two entrees and an appetizer, and wine!
This is not French food. Nothing more to say that I will never return.

Went there with a lady friend and the people up front were rude. I know it was slamming busy but didn't even want to give us a waiting time so they basically got us out the door. I asked how long is the waiting time the girl said honestly cant get you in for 1hr and half maybe.... LOL MAYBE ??? MAYBE NOT ... SEE YA!!!!
Service was really bad, and the food was okay but not great. I think all of the ratings are just hype and people that want to believe they're eating somewhere fancy.

Love this place best brunch in 14th St , but sadly only inside , no outdoor seating for me We all know getting a key seat outdoors at Le Diplomate can be great on a nice spring day , but thanks to the obnoxious smoke and odor from the next-door pizza joint Etto one cant breathe sitting outside , not to mention the noise of 5 fire trucks attending to the ridiculous amount of black smoke coming from Etto.I hope Le Diplomate management works this out with their neighbor ......
Worst meal service I have ever received. Terrible service.

washingtoncitypaper.com/¡­Their chef is rapist. How safe would feel eating there? He has assaulted women on the street in broad daylight. He has sexually harassed female coworkers. Hmmm...great atmosphere? Methinks not.
Le Diplomate is in the process of firing the General Manager due to the lack of leadership: Read more at phillymag.com/news/2016

Ratatouille the movie is Le Diplomate.I came to visit Washington DC from Florida, so I looked up some of the spots in the area and decided to check Le Diplomate. I'm not a big person when it comes to writing a review so I'm gonna say it as it is. We were sitting in this room with green walls and hanging vegetable pots towards the end of the room and as I looked towards my left, by this fridge I spotted the most disgusting thing ever. Not outside, not the patio area, this is by the fridge where probably food was stored. I hate to break it to you but a rat the size of a small kitten run towards what it appears to be a soda machine. We paid the tab without saying a word and left and will never go back to such a place again. I know it's a French restaurant but I did not know that "Ratatouille " the movie is actually real.

I have seen a question about this restaurant in the forum and I'll gladly answer it. First since I am from Philly and familiar with more than one of Starr restaurants including Le Diplomate. Second I've personally researched this company for a social study class in college regarding employer abuse. So hold on to your seat belts.From New York to Philadelphia, from Washington DC to Miami Stephen Starr is taking up one little guy at the time as long as he gets richer.NEW YORK (Legal Newsline) - Eight individuals are suing a New York catering service, alleging it withheld tips of employees even though it charged venues gratuities.-The lawsuit alleges Stephen Starr Events charged venues such as Carnegie Hall, the New York Historical Society and the Rubin Museum of Art gratuities, and labelled them as "service charge," personnel fee," or "staffing charge." HE DID NOT STOP THERE!-Starr restaurants Currently in the Hot Seat for Wage Theft Allegations, AGAIN Restaurateur Stephen Starr has joined an illustrious group as a class-action federal lawsuit has been filed against his company.- Starr Restaurants Hotel Group, according to the Broward New Times. Filed Friday, the suit claims that a cook as well as 23 employees of Starr's Steak 954, located in the W Hotel Fort Lauderdale, were never compensated for working overtime.-The evil of this restaurant group didn't stop there. Regulations on what restaurants have to do to be in compliance cover everything from awnings, which may be too low and a danger to the blind, to the width of doors, which can impede people who use wheelchairs. Stephen Starr ignored the regulations for the disabled.Calls and emails to representatives for Starr WERE NOT returned.
Highly over priced and bad service.
We sat down waited 15 minutes and no one ever showed up to greet us or bring some water. Never again!

Best food and worst service.We got a server whom she need more training and learning .Anastasia? I wonder why, she told us that she is new but still won't get our dinner mess up and our kids got the wrong food.We didn't complain but we just left. NEVER again

With a reservation from months before, we get a smallest table next to wait staff getting hit every time they walked by us.Mushroom soup was too salty and it didnt look anything like the picture on their yelp.My wife had a fish that was over cooked and my steak smelt like fish ( they probably use the same grill surface) covered by a salty salty sauce. When we addressed it to the waitress, she only blushed and walked away.Nothing was great to go back for, not even good. The best part was the bread station that looked pretty.We will never go back and will never recommend this place.

we had made a reservation a month in advance for my birthday and our table was so small next to wait staff station, so close that they kept bumping to us.My fish was over cooked and my husbands stake smelled like fish and very salty.Maybe ok place for drinks but not to dine in. Bread was the only good part.Once we addressed the food being too salty to our waitress, she blushed and left our table.wouldnt go back for sure

I made a big mistake going back to le Diplomate after my first bad experience few months ago,so I took my girl the other day ,and even I had a reservation,they sat me on that freezer they called patio,and when I asked to be sat inside they said all tables are reserved,knowing I my self too had a reservation they said well you can sit at the bar and wait little bit,so I decided to sit on the patio,which was a big mistake coz we didn't enjoy our meal at all,we had to eat so quick coz our plates were getting cold so fast,when I say it's a freezer coz that's how it feels,food is great,but the host stand r rude very rude,and managers seems not to care at all,coz no one came to check on us and see if we were enjoying our meal,which wasn't the case,so my advice for u ,under no circumstances don't sit on that patio during winter time.

The quality here has declined substantially, at least with respect to the burgers. As a self-described burger connoisseur, I had bragged to my out-of-town guests visiting DC that Le Diplomate makes one of the tastiest hamburgers in the city. They make a bare-bones smash burger with good meat, cheese, pickles and buns. So imagine my disappointment when we went there in early November specifically to enjoy the burgers, which I've had many times before, and out came three sad looking shrunken sandwiches. The buns were over-toasted, especially the bottom buns which were stiff and hot to the touch (not warm and toasty). The two patties were beyond well done and flavorless. The sandwich itself was sloppily assembled and overloaded with sliced raw onions. The total effect and presentation reminded me of what you'd expect at McDonald's, not one of the most respected restaurants in the city. Cost per burger: approximately $26 each (with no sides). None of us finished the burger. After over-selling Le Diplomate to my friends I had to apologize, and we laughed it off. We did enjoy our drinks and fries on a beautiful sunny day but I was surprised at the indifference to quality and brand and how starkly different the burgers were from my prior visit. I should point out that the service was great. Our waiter was prompt, friendly and professional and immediately established rapport with me and my friends. Had he not been so personable we might have sent the food back but we did not want to offend. On another subject, there was no toilet paper in one of the men's stalls at noon on a weekday. I had to request help from a good Samaritan.
Our meal was served cold. IfwA quite disappointing. The staff seems out of loof. Another reason to not come back
Cute, hip place, but the food and service were average.

I made reservations a week ago for dinner for my birthday yesterday. I've never eaten here before, and was very much looking forward to it. When I arrived, I stood in the line to check in where a family cut in front of me. The mother looked at me and since I didn't say anything, they just stood there and assumed their place in line. They did not have a reservation and the hostess was explaining to them the wait and more than likely when they could be seated. They moved to the side and when I checked in, one of the hostesses seated me right away. When I made my reservations, only outdoor seating was available. She led me to my table and to my dismay, it was the worst outside table. It was uncovered and right next to the sidewalk with a heater. I was very upset as I could see the other outdoor tables that were covered and/or enclosed. After a few minutes I asked the hostess if there were any other covered or enclosed tables/booths available. Of course she said no and did not even look at me. My server then came and I quickly gave me order as I told him that was upset and just wanted to order my food and get out of here. He took my order and I noticed there were now people eating inside. So I asked the hostess again of any seating available inside, and received the same answer. Not too long after that, I noticed the family that cut in front of me. They were now seated comfortably in one of the enclosed separated booths. By this time I was almost ready to walk out, which is what I should have done. My food came quickly, and I ordered the escargot, steak frites and profiteroles. The only bright side to this fiasco was that the food was very good. My server brought my bill and I was comped for the dessert. I was out of there in just an hour, which was an hour too long for me. I don't understand why society had this stigma with parties of one. It's always the same with restaurants, hotels and traveling in general. I believe it's because businesses believe that since you are just one person, you will not order as much as a party of six and therefore will spend less and not leave as much of a tip. So they seat you at the crappiest table, or give you the hotel room that is facing a wall. I was so disappointed and it was a terrible way to end my birthday.
I enjoyed the food (Steak Frites), the atmosphere (French) and the crowd. Unfortunately, my friend and I had an awful server "Will" or "William".It was our first time there

Same tired "French" menu, tailored for the masses. Even the setting is a carbon copy of the stereotypical bistro. French food is unrivaled when done right but those who dine here don't know the difference, they're just happy Trump got elected. The 14th St equivalent of Cafe Milano in Gtown...

Overrated! Really not that impressed. A massive restaurant with an uncomfortable vibe of people putting on airs. The food is solid but given it's reputation, I was sort of disappointed. Maybe I'll try another time, but I'm in no hurry.
I have been going to LeDip many times since they opened as I live up the street
nice but clearly overpriced....

fancy place, great concept but the food is not at all french, just french inspired, if you had ever been in Paris and eaten in a real french bistro you couldn't like the food here the taste of the onion soup is good, but much too heavythe main courses, beef tenderloin was served cold, mashed potatoes too, the waiter simply answered us " it's served like that" my partner took the duck, we ordered it medium but served well donedon't go to this place if you don't need to say i went to le diplomate ...

Here's the first and most important thing about Le Diplomate: It's not worth the crazy-ass prices they're charging.I've been there twice. The first time, I had a slice of quiche and two glasses of wine. With tip, 40 bucks. The second time, steak frites and one glass of wine. With tip, 50 bucks. So, work with me here: 28 dollars for steak frites?! Were they flown in from Paris? Because otherwise I'm not really understanding the markup on hanger steak. Not prime dry-aged Porterhouse at an expense-account steakhouse. Hanger steak. With not the best frites in town by a long shot. Twenty-eight dollars. I know that the steak in steak frites isn't supposed to be filet mignon, but it ain't supposed to cost like it is either.If the steak frites were blow-my-mind good, maybe I wouldn't begrudge the owners the aforementioned crazy-ass prices. But they're not. I've had blow-my-mind-good steak frites, in Paris that, even with a strong Euro at the time, did not cost me 28 dollars. For decent hanger steak and just-OK frites, I'd pay 15 bucks and still not feel like I'm getting a bargain.So, if you have to go, order something light and enjoy the ambience. It's a pretty restaurant. The service is generally attentive. But this place is not even vaguely a great value. And it'd get its ass handed to it in Paris.

This place is overrated. Food is not that great, have had much better and the service is horrible! Super slow. Had the steak au poivre, asked for it medium-rare, it came more like medium-well or even well done - waitress argued with me that it was their way of preparing it medium-rare when it was way overcooked.Would I go back? Probably not for a while.
Burger is the only thing here worth getting here. Nothing else that great. Trump 2024!!!
Overrated the food was okay! Portions too small for the price. I've heard that it was better years ago Not so much now. Ignore the hype
The food was okay. I did like the ambiance. Service was okay.. Overall I'd probably go back.

The place was too crowded, tables too close to each other not social distancing at all. Tables were around 2 feet apart. When you pay the price for your dinner you expect to enjoy it in a relaxing environment. My experience was like having dinner surrounded by noisy teenagers in brake time!
Got the steak and fries. Steak was chewy and had a lot of fat. Fries were delicious though

While the ambiance was lovely and the service attentive, the food fell a bit short of my expectations. Some dishes were delicious, but others lacked the flavor and creativity I was hoping for. Overall, an average dining experience
The quality of the food is certainly not worth the price. You can get much better food at a more reasonable price at several establishments in the city.
Absolutely amazing environment

Food is always good here. The Starr brand is always spot on with ambiance and vibe. Our one downside was the service. We asked for an opinion between two entrees and got an ambivalent answer of "its whatever you want." I figured if we were asking between two, we wanted both, but wanted an outside opinion on which was better. Also, nearly 30 mins to bring check (with no water or adult beverages) seemed a bit long in the tooth.

A friend told me to try this place out and honestly, I couldn't have been more surprised with how great the experience was. The servers into was great and he gave us a lot of options to choose from. The dish I ordered ended up being so good that I ordered an additional to go. Not only was the food delicious but the service was excellent. I would definitely refer this to all of my friends.
