Le Diplomate never disappoints! We stopped by for drinks and a few bites at the bar. I ordered an extra dirty Hendricks martini and they had stuffed bleu cheese olives (win!) and my friend ordered an aperol spritzer. We decided to try the steak tartare, which was so fresh, well balanc
Overrated french bistro in DC. Decent food but not amazing.
I've been a few times, and each time i'm a little less impressed.

If you are a fellow New Yorker, Le Diplomate will give you the feels of Balthazar NYC in SoHo.... but it isn't quite up to the caliber of McNally's french-styled brasserie in the Big Apple.The menus are almost exactly the same, with Le Diplomate's with some more selection. Those without reservations will be seated in an enclosed off area outside the restaurant, an area quite quaint and very representative of the french-caf¨¦ experience. A basket of fresh bread was given, with wonderful diversity in bread choice (with the fruit bread being wonderful). We started off with the mushroom tart, quite disappointing upon trying a bit of it. The appetizer would have been exponentially better if the tart was replaced with a light puff pastry (which parallels with the french cuisine). The tart itself was at room temperature, which it was supposed to be according to the non-reservation manager, but ultimately, it was unappealing. Entr¨¦es were the steak frites: the cut of the steak was definitely of a lower quality, but still delicious and perfectly cooked. The frites were well fried, but were a tad too oily. The moules (mussel) frites dish was well made, though the dish's sauce was a bit too pungent with bay leaf that took over the mussel flavor. However, a member of our party ordered the dover sole - something not in Balthazar - and was absolutely delicious. The almonds well complemented the fish to an extent that was perfectly matched and the accompanying sauce was decadent.Our waiter was a tad rude, especially after we notified them about the temperature of our appetizer, but overall, the feel of the restaurant was nice. The food just wasn't up to standard compared to Balthazar iN NYC, however.
Ok service at this establishment. Had overblown expectations and they were somewhat met. Like the scene in the restaurant, it very busy and lively. Always see interesting people here.
I thought it was a bit overrated? But the food was good. Really crowded on a Thursday evening.

I don't understand the hype about this place. The photos of the food were appetizing and palpable, but didn't live up to the hype. The service wasn't that good and the waitress was slow. I had a satisfactory experience and will have to try it again.
The food is good but it's way too expensive and fancy for what you get.I wish the plates were bigger.
Good restaurant, but not sure if it is worth all the hype.
The dishes are okay. But it is a noisy restaurant, and a VERY over rated French Bistro.The metro diners in Paris are far superior.
Service was okay. Food was tasty. I would go again.

We came here on a Tuesday and hmm, the food was bland and the service was less than bland if that makes any sense. Server didn't come by much at all. Steak Frites i've had better. Escargots was just okay. Nothing special. Had high hopes and was only left with hope for next time.
Only two vegan brunch options, but both were quite good.

Mediocre all around, from food to overall experience. I figured this place must just be pretty consistent for the good reviews they get. Nothing was bad, nothing was great. I have had better food at many a place in DC. The service wasn't horrible, but nothing stuck out in my mind as exceptional. It just is there. I wouldn't rush to go back but also wouldn't say no if asked by friends.
I went to le diplomate for dinner is was good I love the food the bread is warm and steak tartar is really good

Went there on a Saturday night...wait was only 30 minutes so that was great especially since theres so much hype to that restaurant. The bread was really good..had cranberries and nuts in it. Out waiter was super nice..his name was Jimmy and he even gave us complimentary little desserts on the house. My issue with the food was that it was too rich with butter... I got the steak and it was drenched in butter...my friend got the skate and it was so buttery it made her throw up. Ambiance was nice...probably won't go back though

Im not really sure about this place. I didn't like the food selections so I didn't eat much. The service was a little over bearing.But it looks awesome!!Ill come back another time to try some other things on the menu..

in all honesty.. love french bistro. hands down one of my favorite concepts in the restaurant scene. having been to bouchon and several other bistros across the country, (sadly never in france) I have never had a stellar experience here. great service. great energy. food is well executed but not amazing mostly this is a review from my fiancee who is french Canadian. who loves all things french. I took her here for her birthday and she was not happy at all. too loud. which I know the rickety wood floors are the mark of any good bistro. the food (which I have now had twice (one other time during a biz meeting). never over the top.. several dishes that do not fit a french bistro like the Moroccan lamb with cous cous did not impress. the escargot on my first visit was well executed but did not knock my socks off. the veal scallopini was ver redundant in flavor but lack luster half way through the dish (both of my dinning companions had it). not trying to bash the chefs of le diplomat at all as they are performing their jobs in execution well. conceptually need some improvements. I will still return for the burger as I hear it is the best in city. I haven't given up on you le diplomat.
Good historic spot to check out

I was surprised at how large the restaurant was. We had a delightful server and were treated well. The food was well presented and proportions were generous. I wouldn't say the food was phenomenal. It was prepared well. I think when the din dies down and it gets settled it will be another French restaurant with good food in a great neighborhood.
Saturday brunch was OK -- nothing special, but convenient to theatre

Went here for brunch Saturday. Place was packed. Great scene but brunch was just ok. Not many breakfast options on the menu and compared to other brunch spots in DC this place is not at the top of my favorites list.
May be too much hype...drinks were very good though!

I recently visited Le Diplomate, and while I enjoyed my experience, I think my expectations were a bit too high. The French onion soup was delicious, and my drinks were well-made, but my steak was unfortunately overcooked, which was disappointing for a restaurant of this caliber. Despite that, the space itself is absolutely beautiful, and I did enjoy the overall ambiance and experience. I'd still recommend giving it a try, but maybe with slightly tempered expectations.

La Diplomat: A Culinary Experience with Highs and LowsLa Diplomat offers a tantalizing blend of French cuisine with a few noteworthy dishes that transport you straight to the heart of France, though some items left something to be desired.Starting with the house bread and butter, it was an impeccable introduction to the meal. The bread had the perfect crust, and the butter was rich and creamy, rivaling the best I've had in France. It set high expectations for the rest of the dining experience.The shrimp salad did not disappoint. Each shrimp was prepared to perfection, tender yet firm, and the sauce was a delightful balance of tart and creamy. This dish was a standout and one I would eagerly recommend and order again.Unfortunately, the beef bourguignon did not live up to its promise. While the broth was flavorful, and the potatoes and vegetables were cooked to perfection, the beef itself was a letdown. It was chewy, dry, and tasted old, which is disappointing for a dish meant to be rich and tender from slow-cooking in wine sauce. It seemed as though the restaurant was using subpar or leftover beef, which detracted significantly from the dish.However, the meal ended on a high note with the cr¨¨me br?l¨¦e. The crust had the ideal crunch, giving way to a cr¨¨me that was sweet and absolutely mind-blowing. It was a perfect conclusion to the evening, showcasing the restaurant's ability to execute classic French desserts with finesse.Adding to the experience, the service was exceptional. M waiter was knowledgeable and super professional, enhancing our dining experience with attentive and courteous service. Additionally, the vibe at La Diplomat was immaculate, creating an ambiance that perfectly complemented the meal.Overall, La Diplomat provides a mixed experience. While some dishes shine brightly, others need improvement. Nonetheless, the highlights make it worth a visit, especially for the bread, shrimp salad, and cr¨¨me br?l¨¦e.
great brunch spot not crazy prices either. Best ambiance in city. Service is great but sometimes they forget the outdoor customers. But the food is great
Happening spot.. loud... great foodGreat service. Feels like Paris except waiters are attentive

Very high energy restaurant with good food! We were craving some French food after watching the series "Julia" and Le Dipolomate did not disappoint! Great frites and fish! Don't go if you're not in the mood for lots of noise because this place is NOISY!!!! Will go back though to try the Moroccan lamb...noise or no noise!

We had an amazing meal at for my dad's birthday!Their food is so fresh and flavorful. And they have more than just the classics on their menu. The Thai vermicelli is amazing! We loved the spring rolls and sweet dipping sauce, as well!The service was great, and the atmosphere was chic and comfortable. I have been here a couple times, and both times the food was top notch!

Food: 10/10, modern twist on classic Italian dishes. My favorite dish is easily the 40 layer lasagna, some of the best I've ever had. Perfect meat to sauce ratio. Also love the duck appetizer, wish it came as a main entree. They bring you complimentary bread before dinner. You can't go wrong with any of the items here!Service: been here a few times and the servers are always kind and knowledgeable of the menuPrice Point: 30-50 pp including entree and appetizerVibes: sexy mood great for dates

It's my second time here and I still love the brunch they serve. The place is so convenient and everything comes in the right amount. The food is well made and the starters were pretty good. The American Burger would have been better with white onion as the ones served were a bit hard to go with the patty. The service is great and the staff was friendly and polite.
Food is really good, and the waitstaff is also very good, unfortunately the tables are not the greatest. Only a few really great tables
They are pretty pretty pretty good. Expensive for what you get but then again everything is expensive now. I would recommend though ans would go back.
Great food. Great people. Great atmosphere.Went for my friend's birthday and has a great time.
This is one of the best restaurant I have ever been to they are the Diplomat just like that name to make it cool

It's great experience.The ambiance is very welcoming and charming.Amazing drinks,food and service.staff are extremely knowledgeable and make great recommendations.I'll like to come here again and again.

Stopped in after church. After a bit of a wait we were seated and waiter Eric came right over to attend to us. This restaurant is one of the popular ones in the DC area. Very busy and reminds me of a diner atmosphere. Ordered drinks. They we good, not great. I had the quiche Lorraine and side salad. Only offered a vinaigrette dressing which was good. Probably had the dressing added prior to serving as the lettuce was a bit wilted, not as crunchy and crispy. Quiche was a huge portion. Wish it would have been served hot, it was Luke warm at best. The steak frites was really delicious, tender and the French fries well seasoned. Others had the hamburger and all were pleased with their meal. My first time in, but others who have frequented this establishment said that the food is consistently good.

Food delicious, service was a little slow but it was busy and I could tell they were short staffed. My server did her best. I'd probably recommend coming on a not so busy weekend night if you don't like slow service
Food is good but it can get really chaotic inside. It's a lot easier to get reservations here now since covid! A DC classic and highly recommend, especially if you are visiting from out of town.

A Must-Visit in Washington, DC: LeDiplomate - A French Culinary Delight!LeDiplomate is undeniably a must-visit restaurant if you find yourself in Washington, DC, particularly if you have a taste for French cuisine. The ambiance strikes a perfect balance between casual and elegant, making it an inviting dining experience. To truly savor your visit, I highly recommend making a reservation in advance, as the place tends to get quite busy, especially on weekends.Now, let's talk about the star of the show - the French onion soup. It's an absolute delight that will tantalize your taste buds with its rich flavors and warm, comforting goodness. Definitely a must-try!The staff here is friendly and attentive, which adds to the overall positive dining experience. Their genuine warmth makes you feel welcomed and well taken care of.Although the food is generally good, I must admit that the prices are relatively high. However, it's not surprising given the location in Washington, DC, and the popularity among food enthusiasts. For those who appreciate a delightful culinary adventure, the expense is well worth it.In the spirit of constructive feedback, I'm giving LeDiplomate 4 stars. While it's undoubtedly a top-tier restaurant, there's always room for improvement . Nonetheless, I am confident that LeDiplomate will continue to refine its offerings and maintain its status as a culinary gem in the heart of the nation's capital.
Very friendly staff, efficient and respectful, ambience was beautiful, and I loved the food . All in all a great visit .

Not sure what hasn't already been said about this stellar restaurant but I guess I'll put in my two cents. DC has a lot of French restaurants, but none with the service and grandeur of this place. The service is always excellent, even when they're busy. They developed a nice streatery during Covid with different kinds of creating seating options. That will be much appreciated as the weather warms up again. You can't go wrong with the classics, like a perfectly cooked Steak Frites or Beef Bourguignon. Always get the bread basket. The escargot are also delicious and full of garlicky goodness. This is as close as you'll get to the original Pastis experience in NYC.

It's good and a staple. It's 5 stars if you're about local buzz (even though it's a chain). But is it 5 stars objectively? Not quite. A bit expensive for what you get, but only minimally so. Again, paying for that buzz. Nothing wrong, but if you're a real foodie and want top tier French food, it's not quite that. But if you want pretty good with a top tier atmosphere and a fun drink, here you go!
Thank you for such a long wait.... I thought it would be faster

The atmosphere, the service, the decoration, the atmosphere, the staff, the music and the ambiance at Le Diplomate restaurant on 14th Street NW make you feel that you are in the Latin Quarter of Paris, France. Amazing.
Good seafood and homemade bread. Step in for a late dinner and people watch from the outside seating.
Staple in DC and the food was very good!
One of the TOP restaurants in Washington!  The wait is worth the food!
Great food. Best butter I've ever had and it was architecturally amazing. Best day to go is Bastille Day.
location: University of Texas at Austin, Austin, TX

text: Great for date night and brunch. Can be long wait.

The food is comfortable basic tasty brassiere food, not extra fancy but well done, the wine list and wines were really good, and the deserts are oversized, but wonderful too. the Service is excellent and attentive without being over your shoulder

There's a reason this is the most iconic restaurant in DC. The food delivers, over and over and over again. At this point I've tried 75% of the items on the dinner menu, and I can't name one thing I don't like.Most recently settled on the trout almandine, and BOY WAS IT GOOD. Try the trout. I'm not a huge fish girl myself, but have been feeling adventurous lately, and have no regrets.Not feeling too fancy? The infamous burger always hits the spot. The steak frites are solid too.Honestly, you can order anything and it will be delicious.
Good food but sadly overpriced for what you get. Service was good but not great... I would go back

My BF likes it here more than I do but it's good. The space is very nice, the menu is good, the wait-staff is very good, the tables however are not great -kind of no great tables and a lot that are actually bad. Oh and the hostesses don't really know how to do their job. The Country pate is a bargain.

Went here last when visiting with my husband (we live in CA) and was blown away by the food and service. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because I felt the prices were a little over inflated. Other than that I definitely recommend Le Diplomate to anyone looking for a fancy delicious treat!
Great food, fairly good service. Overall very pleased!
Best French food in dc but dont deliver fro here it isnt as good
Fun place to visit when family's in town. Recommend.

Nice venue on the 14st NW of dc, food is classic bistrot French food, nothing to rave about however the atmosphere is great, nice layout and French brasserie design Good selection of French wine Great to go for the 14th of July A go to weekend in dc
Honestly, I can't even tell if the food here is good ... but this spot is really good vibes. My only complaint is how hard it is to get in!

I've been here so many times to the point that the staff knows my name and drink choice by heart. I think I've tried everything on the menu at least once. I just wanted to say I love this place. I love the food. I love the staff. I love the environment. Everything here I love. I'll be back next week!

I love coming here. They staff is warm and friendly and treat you like family and they cater to your every want and need. The ingredients are always fresh and pair perfectly to make a great dish. The food here is consistent and always delicious! Whenever you want great atmosphere, service and food, come here.

Though they don't have many dishes but with the small count they have in comparison to other restaurants they nail it. Basically, for them it is as said quality with quantity.The drinks were strong and tasty. Will of course be back again... Cheers!
The price point may be a bit high for people, but let me just say: ITS. WORTH. IT.
A little pricey but excellent food.

Classic French spot. Had a wonderful dinner here this summer when it reopened and recently got some take out from it, but you just loose some of the quality when you have to wait so long after the food is made to eat it. Not their fault at all so I didn't take any stars away due to that, just saying I much prefer dining in than take out.
Very good, just wish there was a little more on plate. Service was great drinks, help us choose a great wine for dinner.

We visited in person for the first time since the pandemic began. They had digital temperature checks at check-in and outdoor distanced tables with heat lamps. We enjoyed the gazpacho, mushroom tart, French onion soup, trout amandine, pancakes, gruyere omelette, and chicken poillard today. I only wish the mushroom tart almost had more seasoning and an acid or something to cut through the heaviness. Overall it was a good experience.
Everything was great as usual. One star off for changing the fries.... Now their fries tastes like fast food fries
I have been here for happy hour and for dinner. It was actually a must try once in DC.

Went for Saturday lunch, everyone said the wait was going to be super long, though when I arrived there was a table a single for 7! We sat and dined on brunch the lobster omelette was magnificent! I will return.
It's a fun, lively place. I wasn't thrilled with the food. It's well made just not to my taste.

Went last night with a client, after hearing about this place so much. Overall it was a good experience, just never got the super high-end feel I guess I was expecting or had envisioned. Granted we arrived latish (after 10pm), the bar area was packed with single women, but we sat outside under the convenient heatlamps and had the warm shrimp salad, which was VERY good. Had the lobster omlet as it was somethign quick, but def. want to go back when less packed during regular hrs. to get a spot inside & feel the real ambiance. Our waitress was really personable and seasoned.
Great lunches! Great service! Great atmosphere!
I had a nice lunch with a group of friends.The service was good.The food is delicious!!
been here a couple times. Food is worth it but they need to work on the service.
The seafood tower is alright, but otherwise the champagne was great!

Love the escargot here but do they put a lot of salt or what? Came in on a Saturday for brunch and man was this place full. It has awesome decor and fresh baked french bread! The butter reminds me of back home and the servers were pleasant enough being as busy as they are.
phenom!! amazing architecture and foodthanks Billy D
Great food, great service, busy a lot but that's to be expected with the food. Prices have gone up a bit but otherwise its awesome.
It was a great place to hang out with friends. The food and service were good.
Me diplomats leaves the rest behind, how did you live without it?Le diplomate is the best, to hell with the rest.
Fine experience and good food. A little too loud but fun.
Enjoy going to dinner here. Wonderful atmosphere, food and location.

A little pricey and disappointing there isn't a bottomless brunch option. But the foi gras was incredible, as was the french toast! My boyfriend loved the steak and eggs, which were both cooked perfectly. We come here for brunch occasionally and service is always helpful and quick.

I wish I could rate this 4.5 only because recently the food has been sometimes a miss. I've been coming here since it first open, and it is one of the best additions to the 14th street corridor. I love the vibe, especially in the cafe style area, creating this bistro style environment. You sometimes feel transported into a Parisian cafe. The french onion soup is perfect in the winter, you can't go wrong with the steak frites, and the dishes are usually all delicious. I love the raisin bread provided in the bread basket with the whipped butter. It's a great place to group for brunch with friends or meet for dinner after work. I've also haven't had a problem taken family members who have brought their children. I highly recommend making a reservation to be seated, I'm not sure if they take walk in. They also have valet service which is great since parking is a nightmare in that area.

We had a late night meal here and found the service to be good as well as our food. We will come back and try for brunch . Our waiter was on point and did not miss a beat. Best French fair in the city.

Ive been three times and all three I've gotten good tables. Ive found that recommendations from the waiters are really not the best dishes and I don't understand why that is.I also have to say that the majority of the tables do not appeal to me and I'm afraid that once I dont get a great table, will be my last time here. The food is solid french bistro food, the waiters know the menu well and I have no complaints

You definitely will never go wrong with this place here. Le Diplomate is one busy restaurant but i think they strongly try to maintain the standards and the food if always great. just like any busy restaurant, try make reservations and you wont have to wait in line.

Love this place best brunch in 14th St , but sadly only inside , no outdoor seating for me We all know getting a key seat outdoors at Le Diplomate can be great on a nice spring day , but thanks to the obnoxious smoke and odor from the next-door pizza joint Etto one cant breathe sitting outside , not to mention the noise of 5 fire trucks attending to the ridiculous amount of black smoke coming from Etto.I hope Le Diplomate management works this out with their neighbor
Good food, nice staff here always
Great food. Good service (not great) but very very very very very very very very very very very loud.
Service, atmosphere and food is top notch!

I had been trying to visit le diplomate for quite some time, but reservations aren't easy to find. I randomly checked opentable the day of and was able to snag a reservation for Friday 6pm by checking!A big part of the appeal is the reputation, and that's fine. But it's also important to recognized that this is a well oiled machine. Whereas we had to wait longer than we would have liked to have our waiter come, it was a Friday evening and he paid good attention when he arrived. I had the burger, she had the mussels. A cocktail and a beer. The burger is frequently in the list of best DC burger. It was good, and with a nice presentation, but I'm not sure I'd put it in my top 10. The bun wasn't particularly fresh, the patties were dry and not particularly flavorful. The preparation for the mussels was classic, served with plenty of fries and fresh bread. Unfortunately, out of a bowl, more than 10 were not open (i.e., the mussels were bad) and some were just dirty. She was pretty dissapointed, and eventually asked if it was usual to have so many unopened. He said no - and offered to get a few more. That ended up being an entire other portion of mussels! It was a nice touch, we didn't expect that. We left understanding both the lovers and the haters. The diplomate is a unique DC institution, worth trying at least once. We wouldn't necessarily order either of our dishes again, but can totally see ourselves going back.
This place is fun for drinks. Go if you are in DC, its an institution.

Loved the ambiance of the venue. Cocktails were alright but their signature burger was delicious! Looking forward to going back to try the other dinner options. I heard brunch is good as well, so definitely going to check that out soon!

I enjoy the Dip every time I go. Is it a ground breaking menu? No. But that isn't what you want it of it. It is an experience that transports you. It's like a great staycation.The food is extremely well executed. The service is great (especially for a team this large). The dining room is gorgeous. They did a tremendous job designing this place.You should eat here.

Solid hospitality from start to end. Every time I eat here I just feel well taken care of. Their food is not that original, but honestly that isn't the point here. It is always excellently prepared and I always feel like I'm on a mini vacation to Paris when I'm here. If only the servers all had french accents... If you need a vacation but don't have the time, just roll down to the Dip...
love the food at this place. great location and great food
The place is good. The bread is amazing!!! For how much it's hyped it's deff not the best place in DC.

I Love this place. This time service was a little slow happens, I guess thats normal on a busy day -- but It's a perfect place to sit outside and enjoy a charcuteri plate and a glass of wine. I love my neighborhood.I feel like Paris!
Pretty good atmosphere, and the food was decent.
A fun place to visit and to Eat. I want to come back here as soon as I can

Super brunch, everything was unbelievably good. The waiter, Nabil, was great. He was professional and fun and made helpful recommendation. Shrimp salad special was a great starter. The beef boughonon was the best, made with melt in your mouth short ribs. We also had Poached Eggs with polenta that was out of this world. Go...don't miss restaurant. Try to get seated with Nabil

Our dinner at Le Diplomate (which I will call Diplo for short, and for my own amusement) was like a fireworks display - all ooohs and aaaahs from the table, which included my two picky-eating kids. Diplo's owners reportedly poured $6.5m into transporting beltway hacks to Paris. Variously called a "bistro" or "brasserie," to me it feels more like an upscale caf¨¦, a la Les Deux Magots on the Rive Gauche. Or, more directly, like NY's Balthazar with more sidewalk seating.Whatever you call it, you can call it lovely. The main room is lit with the incredibly flattering peach lights that illuminate Balthazar, but unlike the cave-like NY boite, there is a sunny tiled section that features an enormous "Laundromat" sign, and plenty of outdoor seating. Tables are unclothed, and chairs are classic woven caf¨¦ seats. Service is professional and felt very Gallic, helped along by our server, who sported a heavy French accent. The menu isn't huge, but leans heavily towards traditional French standards like beef bourguignon, duck leg confit, and Moules Frites. I had the latter, which was marinere-style, and was wonderful. The fries were similarly superb and served with mayo on the side. My eldest daughter had a bib lettuce salad, which she loved, and my youngest took down the mac & cheese after being talked out of the Thursday plat du jour of Dover Sole, which, at $52, was a non-starter anyway. It took all my willpower not to finish off that marvelous cast iron skillet of mac, cheese, and gout-inducing cream. My wife had the salmon, and hoarded it (there is a pattern there...)  We also shared a charcuterie platter and three cheeses, which had to be rationed because everyone wanted to eat the whole thing.Desserts were terrifyingly perfect. A chocolate tart with whiskey ice cream, a perfect cr¨¨me brulee, and profiteroles that my 8 year old is still dreaming about. You can certainly spend a lot of money at Diplo, with some entrees hovering in the $30 range, no kids menu, and a list of starters that beg to be ordered en masse. Not to mention a very, very tempting wine list featuring over a dozen well-selected champagnes, including some Jebs (that's what the cool kids call Jeroboam-sized bottles, which hold 4 750ml bottles each). But I felt we got good value, and extraordinary quality, for the benjamins. I can also see why Scott Pruitt wanted a full-siren police escort to make his rezzie (washingtonpost.com/opini¡­).

I went here for brunch with my friends and it was pretty dang good. I ordered a bottle of champagne and got the steak and eggs which were both delicious. The best part was the service though, hands down. The waiter we had for our table was super attentive and really made the meal great.

I enjoyed going here but the place is wildly overrated. Everyone constantly raves about this place and while I enjoyed the food and the service was great, I wasn't blown away and I probably won't come back unless someone visiting town really wants to go here. Perhaps I'm just a Georgetown snob and I'll stick to my haunts closer to home, but I think people need to pump the brakes a little bit when describing this place.

Fantastic scene . Especially in spring when the weather is nice. The 14st area is a great place for this restaurant. I highly recommend stopping in for dinner or just drinks at the bar. Great service !
Delicious food, wonderful service.
I am a vegetarian and I'm super delighted that I found a place i can enjoy some delicious food.
Wonderful cheese variety. Just here for drinks and be back for dinner soon. Excellent service.

The atmosphere in here was magical, and I loved the layout. It was almost full while I was here, but the spacious layout gave me room to breathe, these guys really know what they're doing in that department but their service was slower than what I expected. If you're gonna run a French cuisine restaurant then you ought to have fast-as-lightning service. Try the mushroom tart if you're thinking about coming here, it was easily the best dish of the night, I still remember the creamy, thick taste.
Excellent dishes and presentation. Conveniently located in Logan Circle.

I went to this restaurant figuring it would be a little taste of Paris. And indeed, the decor and food are pretty much what you'd expect from a bistro in Paris - albeit a large one. Overall, I'd rate the food as very good, but not outstanding. The bread was really good. The french onion soup on par with what you get in Paris. The beef bourguignon very tasty, but the beef itself was a bit overdone and slightly dry. Without the sauce, mushrooms, and potatoes, it wouldn't have been that enjoyable. I finished my meal with a cappucino. This was, unfortunately, distinctly less good than the rest of the meal. Better than a Starbucks, absolutely. But not what you'd expect in a good French bistro.So overall, if you crave French bistro food, by all means go. You'll like it, but you'll still say to yourself, "We'll always have Paris."

A nice place to enjoy your breakfast or brunch! I enjoyed the Benedict eggs but maybe there were a little bit overcooked. It is a pricey restaurant with good service and nice atmosphere but usually really busy!

Breaking my Yelp silence to give this place a resoundingly positive review. First of all, they spared no expense with the interior renovation of this former shirt laundry. Secondly, the place this extremely true to the European bistro style while also accounting for the American desire for a large and "lubricated" late-morning meal. Third, they are super nice - it was a special occasion and the hostess staff took great care of us. Finally, the food and drinks were fantastic. All in all, we will be back (and soon).
Went there on a date. It was classy yet affordable. Loved it.
Their pastry basket and coffee are amazing. The decor is really nice.
Excellent bread! Perfect Parisian bistro ambiance. The traditional omelet was traditionally prepared for brunch.I may update this review after coming back for dinner.

Le Diplomate is one of our favorite special restaurants. We dined here to celebrate my husband's birthday, we've been fortunate to celebrate here for the last four birthdays. We currently have two little ones so I was behind on planning but managed to get a 5pm reservation. The day of we were running late but the hostess was very understanding and accommodating.Our meal was amazing, the wine was delicious and the service was outstanding, which is exactly why we choose to celebrate here. We had the foie gras, cheese plate, duck confit, and steak, with a creme br?l¨¦e and latte for dessert...everything was tasty and one of the reasons we come back to Le Diplomate.

Location, location, location. The place to be seen and see. The service and decor are the best part. Vibrant bar scene and great outdoor area. The food is really good not the best. Other places in the city are more deserving of the fanfare.

I love this place!! Oddly enough, one of my favorite dishes is the warm shrimp salad. Entrees are really good, very well seasoned. Cocktails are also really good and the bar is always a good place to stop. The Kir Royale is perfect. Only gave 4 stars instead of 5 because it seems as if they've added more tables since they first opened, and the seat are very close.
All the dishes were executed perfectly. Nothing to complain about... Definitely would come back for more!
place is awesome as far as ambiance and food but service really needs work
Everything we tried was delicious. The service was attentive and the food was priced within reason.
I come here for brunch alot. Sit outside if you can. Great service!
Small intimate, nice atmosphere!
The mussels and frites are amazing. I highly recommend to anyone.
Amazing food. Maybe some of the best I have had. Mediocre service.
Tasty! Only been to brunch once but I'd go back. The food was delicious, if not the best I've ever had.
All delicious. Great bar seating for dining, great setting.
Steak frites! Steak frites! That is all.
always a fun place to have dinner, the atmosphere is very lively and the food is consistent.
Wait was long but the food and drinks were amazing!
Busy for brunch...but really good steak and eggs!
Arguably the best brunch in DC.

The garden on the roof might be my favorite part of the restaurant, followed very closely by the vintage bar. I love the wine here... Great selection and I've never been disappointed by any glass I've gotten. My favorite is probably the Rose though. The food is delicious (on the expensive side) and I usually order the scallops. Enjoy!
Food is good, but should be for the price and pain of getting in the door. The dining room is very loud. Brunch is a winner.

I had the Trout Amandine and it was a little too heavy on the salt-vinegar taste, which was odd because trout is a freshwater fish. My friend had the Beef Bourguignon, and that was easily what I should have gotten. Tons of flavor. For dessert, Le Diplomat is known for their Creme Br?l¨¦e, but if you're looking for a lesser-known fabulous pick from the dessert menu, go for the Profiteroles. Delicious and beautiful presentation.
HUGE portions.

Good place for WELL BEHAVED CHILDREN. My children are always well behaved so we had a good time. The food was good - we had pastries, hot chocolate and juice. Since it was for my son's birthday, he had fries with mayo (his version of French food).

Visited restaurant 24.July 2013. Reservation has been made in a mounth before. Looks very private comparing the expectations and thoughts. Extremely high level of service. Very delicios dishes and normally sized it is possible to taste several of them without over-feeding. Very good balanced menu and wine list easy to make good choice by any price.
I highly recommend making time to eat at Le Diplomate to anyone who has the opportunity. Spectacular food, service, and wine selection. Easily one of the best meals I have ever had.
Great place. Great service. Great Times. A true gem for brunch. Now, if only they could do something about the parking...
The atmosphere was elegant and romantic! The service was very good! The food was ok, it depended on what was ordered. My dish was way too salty. Everyone else's was enjoyed.
A wonderful people-watching scene. Great food, but slow service. Cocktails are slightly overpriced in my opinion. But, no better way to spend a solo weekend than here at Le Diplomate.
Delicious, but a little on the expensive side. You definitely come here for the ambiance and yummy dishes.
Great on every level and the chef is not even French ! The new management regime made it even better the third time around. William made our experience awesome !

It's often crowded but the food and drinks are good and the atmosphere is nice. The service and staff are pretty good. The cocktails and coffee and pastries and bread are well-made. The cocktails are fresh and interesting, so I tried a couple different ones. They have a pretty good menu, from steak frites to omelets and sandwiches and salads. It's in a great, convenient location for walking and people-watching, so it's a good place to go before or after a stroll. I wouldn't advise driving and trying to find parking - it's so busy and crowded in the 14th St area these days - though they do have valet parking. Overall, it's a nice place, not cheap (but where is these days in DC?), and a nice experience.
LOVED this place/
Delicious experience. Great for special occassions.

Le Diplomate is a very good upscale French restaurant. No complaints about the food and the service was excellent- perhaps the best I've had in DC. So why 4 stars and not 5? While the food was very good, I did not think it was especially amazing. I felt like the food was about equal to Bistro La Bonne on U St (or perhaps Bistro du Coin by Dupont), but with much better decor and service- and the prices reflect that.
The atmosphere is excellent. The service is great. I gave it four stars because the food is good but not worth a 2 hour wait.
Great food, and service.

The food is absolutely delicious--Worthy of five stars. Very, very tasty! However, Le Diplomate only receives four stars from me because the pricing is just a bit too high for what the food is value-wise.Essentially, you will be VERY pleased with the food, but when the bill arrives you probably will come back down to earth a bit off your culinary high. Still, my lasting impression is positive and I can't wait to go back!

We came here on the last night of their 'soft opening' so we got a 10% discount on the total which was pretty sweat.The place was packed and loud. I over heard the manager say they were serving over 700 tables per night, which sounds pretty crazy. I peaked in the kitchen on the way to the bathroom and it was just a total madhouse. It looked like they had about 50 cooks/chefs back there. I also heard him say they were having trouble finding quality staff in DC, which sadly is no surprise, and they actually had to bring a couple of dozen of staff from Philly.The food was good... almost great. For apps we had the escargot (snails yummy!) which was served out of shell, which I've never seen before, but was great. The sauce was extra garlicky and delicious.For the entree we had the duck, which was good but the breast meat was noticeably cooler (cold actually) than the leg/thigh, which was steaming hot. It was obvious they were cooked at different times, so that was a bit troubling. The grilled asparagus side was great, as was the chocolate cream dessert, which was like a big bowl of extra creamy and rich pudding.So I imagine this place will be a solid five stars once they work the kinks our and I look forward to going back!

I visited Le Diplomate for lunch on a busy Friday, and the bustling atmosphere was so refreshing--people enjoying themselves, great energy all around. There was a 30-minute wait, but the greeters were welcoming, and the time passed quickly.Despite the rush, the service was great--our server checked in regularly and kept our water glasses full, which I really appreciated. I ordered the Burger Am¨¦ricain with pommes frites, and while it was the most expensive burger I've had, it was absolutely worth the splurge--delicious and cooked perfectly. The bread and sauce really set it off.Overall, Le Diplomate lives up to its reputation. If you're looking for great food, attentive service, and a lively ambiance, it's definitely worth a visit.

Recently ate here with my colleagues and we had a great experience. This was probably my first time in a French restaurant and Le Diplomate lived up to the expectations that everyone has talked about. I have tried some of the restaurants that is owned by the owners including El Presidente and I continue to be impressed by this team.Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

Le Diplomate is a charming, rustic, and bustling restaurant that serves some of the most delicious French classics I've ever had the pleasure of trying. I'm not typically a fan of French cuisine, but this spot completely changed my perspective.Every dish we ordered was absolutely perfect, pushing the boundaries of how amazing these classic dishes can be. From the delicate textures to the rich and vibrant flavors, every bite was a testament to the chef's skill and dedication. The attention to detail in both the food and the atmosphere made the experience unforgettable. I strongly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting or living in DC. The place is rightfully busy, so getting a reservation ahead of time is a must. Thank you, Le Diplomate, for setting such a high bar for French cuisine--I can't wait to return!
The food is amazing, the best bread !                                                 .

We both tried the French toast, but it was way too sweet for us. However, if you love sweet stuff, you'd probably really enjoy it. You can tell they put a lot of care into their food. Our waitress was super nice and really patient with us. I had this delicious caramelized croissant that looked like a muffin, and it was so good! The breads were fantastic, and they served a ton of bacon on the side. The portions were huge. I also had a couple of amazing cocktails! Can't wait to go back and try some lighter dishes next time.
Hello, Great service , great ambiance, great atmosphere, thank you very much, great food
Excellent service and excellent food!! I would definitely go back here when in town again and even do an event here. loved the vibe!
The perfect brunch lunch spot in D.C. The food was incredible, the ambiance was perfect, definitely the SPOT to visit. Coffee was great & staff was friendly.

Extremely large / fun drinks but pricey!!!Food comes out in large family style portions so probably best to come with a crowd. It was good but I probably wouldn't come back due to the price tag. I know it's DC but still.

Cool place for brunch. They do bottomless drinks for 29 a person which isn't bad! I had the huevos horneados which was a decent value. Their menu is def a bit pricy but not outrageous. The one thing is their French toast....if you're hungry skip this because it was literally 4 bites. They have a variety of tapas to share and all their brunch dishes for the most part were pretty tasty!

Came here with a party of 7 for dinner on Thursday night. We had put in a reservation a few hours earlier and they were able to accommodate us. They put us at a nice secluded table in the corner. Overall, it was very clean and well decorated, would be great for a date night.We came before 7pm so we ordered a bunch of happy hour dishes. Everything was delicious but the winner would have to be the mushroom croquettes. We also go the seafood paella which tasted great, especially the crispy bottom. We also got the octopus which was well-cooked.

We went to the Le Diplomate for dinner last month while in DC. We did not have a reservation, but they were able to seat us quickly on this Wednesday evening.The service was impeccable. The food was delicious (apps & dinner).The restaurant had this cool vibe and I really enjoyed my visit.

My recent meal at Le Diplomate was superb. The filet mignon was cooked to perfection, tender and flavorful, while the profiteroles for dessert were a delightful treat. The elegant ambiance and impeccable service made it a truly memorable dining experience.

Our Sunday dinner experience was truly exceptional! The highlight of the evening was undoubtedly the lobster risotto, a special dish available only Sundays. A generous shared a taste, I was blown away by its incredible flavor. The bread service, featuring a unique bread carving station, was a delightful touch that added to overall experience. In addition to the risotto, the French onion soup and Gruy¨¨re omelet were equally delicious choices that satisfied our taste buds. With such high-quality food and attentive service, this dining establishment has earned a spot on our list for future visits to D.C. I eagerly anticipate returning to explore more of their enticing menu offerings and enjoy the warm hospitality that made our evening so memorable.
Great food but small portions still very delicious thanks for your service!!!! I really recommend this place!!!!

Le Diplomate has secured its place in my heart as the epitome of brunch perfection. My brunch experience was nothing short of stellar, and I am eager to sing its praises.The star of the show was undoubtedly the Gruy¨¨re Omelette with Crispy Potatoes--an absolute masterpiece that left my taste buds in awe. The omelette was a fluffy, golden delight, generously stuffed with perfectly melted Gruy¨¨re cheese that oozed decadently with each sumptuous bite. Paired with the crispy potatoes, which were seasoned to perfection and offered a delightful crunch, this dish was a symphony of flavors and textures that danced harmoniously on my palate.Le Diplomate's commitment to culinary excellence extended beyond the plate. The ambiance was a perfect blend of chic and cozy, creating an inviting atmosphere for a leisurely brunch. The attentive and friendly staff added to the overall positive experience, ensuring that every aspect of the dining journey was seamless and enjoyable.The menu boasted a variety of brunch options, each seemingly crafted with the utmost care and attention to detail. Whether you're a sweet or savory brunch enthusiast, Le Diplomate has something to satisfy every craving. The quality of ingredients and the skillful execution of each dish showcased the culinary mastery that sets this establishment apart.While the Gruy¨¨re Omelette stole the spotlight for me, it's evident that Le Diplomate is dedicated to providing a brunch experience that exceeds expectations across the board. The attention to detail, exceptional service, and, of course, the divine flavors make Le Diplomate a true gem in the brunch scene. Five stars without a doubt--I'm already planning my next visit!

My recent dining experience at Le Diplomate was nothing short of enchanting! From the charming Parisian ambiance to the exquisite French cuisine, every moment felt like a delightful escape to France.Le Diplomate's menu is a masterpiece, offering a symphony of flavors and textures that celebrate the essence of French culinary artistry. Each dish, from escargot to coq au vin, was expertly crafted and delivered a taste of true French authenticity.The restaurant's ambiance is a perfect blend of elegance and warmth. The cozy bistro setting, adorned with vintage d¨¦cor, created a welcoming atmosphere that added to the overall charm of the evening. The attentive staff, well-versed in French cuisine, provided impeccable service, making the dining experience truly memorable.A highlight of my visit was exploring Le Diplomate's impressive wine selection, featuring exquisite French wines that complemented the meal perfectly.Whether you're a seasoned food enthusiast or someone longing for a taste of France, Le Diplomate is a culinary gem in the heart of [Location]. I wholeheartedly recommend this establishment for an exceptional dining experience.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Le Diplomate, making it the perfect choice for a weekend dine-out. The atmosphere is elegant and cozy, the food is delicious, and the service was attentive. Everything I had was amazing but my favorites were the French onion soup, steak frites, and an appetizer pasta which I don't recall the name. I'm looking forward to going back!
The food is always on point and the service is great. Your service is always top notch.
I love this place. I love the food. I love the service. I love the ambience. I've got them a good things to say about this place.

Hey there, fellow foodies! Let's chat about Le Diplomate, the charming French spot that's got me swooning over its food, service, and decor. First off, the vibe at Le Diplomate is like stepping into a cozy bistro in the heart of Paris. The decor is effortlessly chic with a touch of vintage flair, making it the perfect backdrop for a fun night out with friends or a cozy date. It's the kind of place where you can kick back, relax, and just enjoy the good things in life.Now, let's talk about the food. Oh boy, where do I even start? From the first bite of their dreamy cr¨¨me br?l¨¦e, every dish is a flavor-packed journey. It's comfort food with a touch of elegance, and it's downright delicious.And the service? It's like catching up with an old pal. The staff is friendly, attentive, and they know their stuff when it comes to the menu. They'll steer you in the right direction if you're feeling a bit overwhelmed by all the mouthwatering options.So, if you're in the mood for a down-to-earth, fun night out with fantastic food, top-notch service, and a cozy, charming atmosphere, Le Diplomate is where it's at. It's definitely earned its spot as one of my go-to spots in DC.
Loved the food and the service. We made a reservation for 11pm by mistake but they sit us SMU ways. The foie gras was amazing and the egg white omelet was phenomenal. Love this place.
Amazing steak and the best espresso martinis. Vibe and service is great. Would recommend!

this is the brunch spot i bring everyone to when they visit dc and it's still a 5 star experience for all. every brunch bite is always immaculate, the service is always impeccable, and the atmosphere is always impressive. the food is divine (the croissants, french toast, and any egg dish (esp omelette and vol au vent) are highlights). expensive but i keep coming back for a reason. def get a reservation if you don't want a wait, or else come at like 9am (you could get lucky, but i've always found every weekend to be quite busy after 11am).
Never fails to amaze me with the quality of their food for a decade. My favorite place in D.C.

Le Diplomate offers a truly unique experience! Upon passing by, I was immediately captivated by the inviting ambiance and stylish decor, prompting me to make a reservation for later that evening. Little did I know, it's a cherished institution in the heart of Washington, D.C., and this fact became increasingly evident as the evening unfolded.Given that it was a bustling Friday night, "busy" doesn't quite do justice to the lively atmosphere. Before we were seated, we decided to stop by the bar, where we savored an exceptional espresso martini. While the bartender may have been a tad brusque in demeanor, the cocktails were undeniably top-notch. The overall decor, both in the bar area and throughout the restaurant, exudes a charming French cafe and restaurant aesthetic.Our table was situated in the charming courtyard, and we were thoroughly enamored with it. Our server was not only kind but also exceptionally adept at providing service. Their attentiveness and knowledge were commendable. To kick off the meal, they presented a delightful basket of various breads with butter, a truly scrumptious start.We initiated our culinary journey with a gin-based beverage and a plate of delectable ravioli, both of which were a culinary delight.We then decided to share the salmon with mashed potatoes, which was a remarkable choice. The evening concluded on a sweet note with the delectable profiterole dessert.My experience at Le Diplomate was absolutely delightful, and I eagerly look forward to returning during my next visit to the nation's capital.
Nice atmosphere and menu with something for everyone. Food was excellent as was service.
Food was fantastic! Warm shrimp salad, branzino and mussels were superb! Very French vibe! Love the ambiance! Best of all, Adnane is an attentive waiter that make the experience wonderful
Everything was delicious and delightful. From the fresh baked breads (there were many) to the thoughtful and attentive service by Sean, who took great care of us. We were lucky to get a table

Came here on a Monday afternoon and got seated immediately. The bread was slightly burned but the parts around were delicious. The charcuterie was good, but a little salty. The shrimp from the salad (and the buttery sauce) was the highlight of the meal. It was one of the dishes the waiter recommended and we would as well. The steak was cooked exactly to the right temperature, and dipped in the butter sauce from the shrimp salad was a great combo. The waiters were walking around often to see what we needed, so service was great. Definitely recommend a stop!
How can you say anything bad this restaurant? We keep going back and back again and again and it's a wonderful experience.

Great food, great service, professional staff, great atmosphere, great menu! Can't go wrong with eating at this place!
Seafood never wrongNice and fancy great drinks and food presentation I love it. Tom good eater chooses the best places
good service and good food as always.
superb , I loved it, will come back soon

Le Diplomate is a gem in DC. From the retro atmosphere to the attentive service and delicious meals, it exceeded my expectations. always yummy and loose that you can pay from table and just get up and leave when done

Le Diplomate was a truly delightful experience. The atmosphere of the restaurant was absolutely wonderful - it had a warm and cozy feel, and it really felt like I was sitting in a Parisian cafe, especially on a cold and foggy winter morning.The food at Le Diplomate was nothing short of amazing. The fare was classic French, but it was perfectly executed and seasoned. Although the menu was not particularly innovative, the quality of the food was what made this place worth it. The cocktails were perfectly balanced, and the beef tare tare was delicious. The mac and cheese and French onion soup were also excellent, and the half roast chicken was filling, rich, and satisfying.In short, I would highly recommend Le Diplomate to anyone looking for a fantastic French dining experience. The atmosphere is great, the food is top-notch, and the service was excellent. I will definitely be returning to this restaurant in the future.

The trout is quite possible my favorite trout dish I've ever tried. The slivers of almond gives it this extra texture that is very much welcome, it plays so nicely with the softness of the fish. The haricots verts are also a welcome addition that adds freshness to the fish and the lemon sauce really brightens it all up. This is my second time getting it and I'm already looking forward to my third.For an additional side to go along with my trout, I got the fricasse of mushrooms and it's wonderful if you're a mushroom lover like me! The mushroom soaks in the sauce so well.I also got the mushroom tart to share with my roommate (who also got the trout because we're both in love with it) and wow is this decadent. Definitely something you should share! Not because it's bad but because it's so decadent and full of this wonderful truffle cheese flavor-- you'll want to eat the whole thing but it's a heavy feeling dish!I'm hoping to be able to visit Le Diplomate in person one day because I was definitely more than satisfied with my takeout order!

Absolutely our favorite place in the city to eat. Even with COVID restrictions, service was outstanding!we were seated immediately and welcomed by our friendly server. The atmosphere at Le Dip is unbeatable. You truly feel like you're in the coziest, cutest French cafe. The energy is awesome! We started off with a cheese plate with a selection personally chosen by our waiter based off our tastes. The cheese and the respective accompaniments were fantastic--my favorite was the brie with cardamom jelly. I loved the blueberry bread we were given as well. In fact, all the breads in the basket were excellent! Also the dessert with banana and chocolate in between puff pastries was so good!Le Diplomate did not disappoint. The food was outstanding! And the atmosphere so inviting. I loved watching massive trays full of fresh bread floating through the restaurant.Definitely try them out if you are in town.
I really like this shop because of the tasty food and the big choice they have. Also the staff is good to be approachable to their client! Best experience, recommended for sure!

Le Diplomate is a special treat. I like to bring out of town friends here for dinner and they are always impressed. The moules frites and duck a l'orange are never a let down. Bread baskets are a favorite as well.

When we first decided to go here I thought this restaurant would be another one of those tourist traps. You know, the kind where the food is overpriced, lacked flavor, and was all hype. Thankfully that wasn't even close to being true. The menu was small yet diverse. I ordered the steak frites and it came out perfectly. The steak was cooked to my exact specifications, and the fries were on point. The service also gets a 5/5. Our waitress was attentive yet not overbearing, and the cocktails she got us were mixed perfectly. Definitely recommended. PS: Don't forget to order the bread basket. You'll miss out.
A la carte brunchLike most dining in DC, this place isn't cheap, but it's worth it! Good food and service, and unlike other places, their brunch menu is a la carte.
Nice design, good food! definitely go for brunch or dinner!

They have the bistro vibe indoors, the outdoor patio area and the indoor greenhouse style space that seems to always be reserved for special events when I'm there. It's pretty loud in there and you can kind of hear the French music. If you want to listen to French music properly, head over to the salle de bain (restrooms) to enjoy some Edith Piaf or other Frenchies.The service isn't the quickest, but you don't go to a French restaurant to eat in a rush. We never had to wait too long to get water or find our waiter to order more, but I would also expect to be there for a while. Everyone is pretty friendly. !We were barely a bite or two into our appetizers when our entrees came out.. They did send them back though, so at least there's that. Usually when, I order duck at these type of restaurants, you either just get the duck breast or the duck leg.I was mind blown when they gave me both, i was so excited to be able to taste both parts of the duck and enjoy the contrast in both texture and flavor....!!!!

My gf and I love visiting Paris specifically because of the cafes and restaurants. Therefore, we love Le Diplomate. It's a bit expensive, but the food is really good and the brunch drinks are pretty strong. The wait staff is very professional and attentive. Above all though, if you too enjoy having a relaxing dining experience in a very European/Parisian eatery, this is your place.

Busy because it's really that good. Affordable cocktails and food. French onion soup, oysters and mussels hit the belly. We loved the vibe. Service friendly, fast and casual. Loud because it fills up very fast. We loved it!

But the quality of the pastries and bread is so shockingly good, it's worth making a reservation weeks in advance. The service is that of a MUCH more expensive place - you're treated like royalty. Best brunch around and mushroom tart is amazing!

My girlfriend and I went to Le Diplomate for our fifth anniversary, and it couldn't have been a better choice. I wish I could give more than 5 stars. This place is PHENOMENAL.The ambiance and decor is romantic, very French--almost transports you to Paris. We were seated
One of the best burgers I've ever had. Service was great too.
my absolute go to for all occasions... they know me there..
nice place. good food but obviously will have to dip in your pocket
Incredible food and fantastic atmosphere. This place is swanky but comfortable. The customer service is fantastic, and I bring my family/friends/and dates there! :)
This place has amazing food. They're always booked up so make sure you make a reservation...the burger is amazing.
This was the best service and great food! I highly recommend. Our server always made sure our drinks were full and our food was perfect.
My husband and I have been three times now and have loved it every time!!
Yes... yes... and yes! Loved this place.
Always great food (if you can get in) and of course wine! This sounds silly but save your carbs for their bread. It is the best! Shrimp salad is also on point.
This is my favorite restaurant on 14th St ad great for special occasions.
Always a delicious meal with a great atmosphere and lovely waiting staff. Would go for the bread alone
Extremely accommodating and generous for large group dining! Great food, great ambiance.

I've? been here a couple of times and i love it. I'm? an Italian? lover. every time i find an Italian? place I? just go and try! here the food is amazing. good portions and tasty as it gets. service is also pretty good ?even when is busy they treat you pretty well.
Very nice place really good Im so surprised and also this is very nice. I cant belive this I an so surpiee this is the best ever I cant wait to go again
Great atmosphere! Great food! Never disappoints!
one of the best restaurants in DC.
One of my favorites. Great for dinner or brunch. Onion soup, veal, trout, mushroom tart - everything I have eaten here is first rate. Excellent service and the bread is fantastic. YUM.
Great place, great food! Perfect for dinner with friends. No wonder why it is always super busy. Make sure you have a reservation!
Amazing. Great food, great service. Wait was long but worth it. Definitely give it a try!!
Beautiful atmosphere, delicious food, and always interesting people watching. I love this place!

I've been here for both brunch and dinner and if I had to choose I'd say come for brunch first.  However both brunch and Donner here were great and recommended. My issue with dinner was pricing. Quality of food here is not an issue at all as everything I've had here has been great.  From the mushroom tart appetizers to the French onion soup and the delicious wines I leave satisfied at all times.  The bread basket they give you too is amazing.  Really cannot complain at all about the DipSet.

Fabulous! We made reservations based on Yelp recommendations and it didn't disappoint! We were seated promptly and our service was excellent. The food was amazing from start to finish. Our standouts were the cheese platter, hamburger and de creme. We really shouldnt have ordered desert as we were already full but everything was so good we couldnt leave without trying some!

This place is literally everything. Anytime I feel like going I'lll take any reservation time I can get...it's that good...I've taken reservations at 11:00 at night and had some of the best meals of my life. Everything is delicious, the cheese plate is ALWAYS a must, its always incredible. I always go for the steak frites because its their ~thing~ but I always like to try some new things if I can...aka sneaking bites off my friends plates. I honestly don't think its even possible to have a bad meal here.
Came her for Sunday brunch as i had a few friends visiting from out of town. They loved this place. Food was on part a some brunches can be hit or miss. Will be going back again for sure.

Cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread, cranberry raisin bread,

Always super fun and delicious food. Never had a badly cooked dish. The choice of wines is excellent. Mixed drinks are fantastic. The bar is very fun to talk with. One of the best restaurants in the city.
Great food and great service every time I go.
Great spot with great service. The food is consistently good and the service is amazing!
Awesome food, drinks and atmosphere. We have even had a whole meal of all appetizers and loved it all.
Never gonna get enough...nuf said :-)
Excellent food & great service!
Excellent food. Excellent service.
The atmosphere is inviting and reminiscent of a European cafe. The bread and pastries were so fresh and baked perfectly. The service was wonderful and the staff is super sweet.
The Steak and Fries were awsome!
Love it. Great food, great ambience, great location.

The interior of this restaurant sets the tone for a classy chic French meal. So French, you would not be surprised to find Marius and Cossette from Les Mis sitting at the table next to you, engaged in a tete a tete.Happily, the menu, cuisine and beverages on offer also deliver upon initial impressions.We went for lunch. It was great! I loved the bread station on entry. Freshly cuts loaves of fine, diverse bread for your pre entree dining pleasure.

Le Diplomate is amazing. The service, food and atmosphere were all excellent. My girlfriend and I started with the gruyere, pate u choux and fleur de sel for our appetizer. The cheese was to die for. For entrees, I had the beef bourguignon and my lady has the salmon. The food was so very good, and the service was fantastic. I highly recommend this restaurant. A bit pricy, but very much worth it.
The trout amandine Is a throwback classic. Very great comfort food. Not bad prices, either.one of my favorite day spots
Amazing food, atmosphere, and service.

It took me 4 years to make it here and I'm so glad I finally did! From the ambiance to the wine and food, everything was perfect. Except for the not very sharp steak knives that gave us a run for our money with the steak frites but that's not a big deal. This was the perfect place to celebrate a romantic birthday dinner with my husband!
Great food. Great atmosphere. Great location. One of the best, if not the best French food in Washington.
Great dinner spot! All the staff was really friendly and attentive. If you sit outside, great people watching on a night.
This is was one of the best brunches I have ever had. The food was wonderful and the service was even better. The decor of the place is also very cool. Try the Quiche and the avocado toast. Terrific!
Great food with exceptional service. All made in house fresh. Love the story of them. Started on a food truck now growing locations. Nice to see the progression of honest hard work

After monitoring their construction progress, we dined there at the first opening--and my wife and i keep going there. We live half a block away, and spend part of the year in Nice, France. Believe it or not, there is no brasserie restaurant in Nice that comes close the Le Diplomate--the combination of the menu, the quality of the food, the superb customer focused staff--and and yes, even the nonpareil baguettes make this restaurant magical, memorable, magnetic and satisfying. And ohhhhhhhhhhhhhhh, that onion soup. Yum Yum.
incredible service and food. Hard to get a reservation, but well worth it when you do!

Food is delicious and the service is always spot on. I have now been several times for both breakfast and dinner and it is wonderful! The food is flavorful and go on a specific night and try the lobster risotto OMG!!!! The ambiance is wonderful and it's exactly what you need to "escape" the city for a little french bistro. Enjoy!
Absolutely AMAZING!!!!!!!!! Go here, if you ever have the chance!
the burger! and the ceviche!! really good food.
Absolutely love this place. Definitely my favorite French restaurant

If you want wonderful French bistro food, great service, and an atmosphere that is just "feel good", don't walk, run to this great restaurant. We had dinner there, walk-ins without a reservation. Were seated outside within 10 minutes, which was great. Mussels are superb, warm shrimp salad, exceptional. Terrific wine list.
This place is amazing. Everything is done with purpose and in a way that will make your experience (and you) feel very special!
Had a great dinner, each dish was delicious and the server was friendly and attentive.
Very great food, great service. Would definitely recommend!

A reservation is a must at this neighborhood favorite! On warm summer nights, a jazz musician performs on the corner of 14th, setting a classy dinner ambiance. On weekend mornings, it turns into a popular brunch location. Personally, I highly recommend the Eggs Norwegian, which has amazing fresh salmon.
Great brunch . Love the bread and the quiche was amazing my Bf got the burger he really liked it too ! And great service
This place is absolutely outstanding.
Great food and great service every time! Love their escargot!!!
One of my guilty pleasures! Totally worth the splurge.
it was for a friends birthday and everything was wonderful. very accommodating! the atmosphere was something else for sure!
LE Good! Just try it.. its all worth it.
Brunch is my favorite
Tasty food in a pleasant atmosphere. Usually some walk in availability.
one word amazing! This is my go to place to munch on some food and drinks.

one of our favorite places on 14th st. love the pasta and fis selection. we love their breads as well.
Love this places great food..
Overall experience, love this place. I recommend give it a try!
Love this restaurant

love this place. the bread is superb. a bit loud, however, at evenings. but all in all, one of the best places for comfort food in DC.

I just happened by this spot today which happens to be my birthday! Walked in to see waiters slicing freshly baked bread for the tables. I had egg benedict which were superb. The service here is professional and personal. I mentioned it was my birthday and my server came back with some small sweets with a birthday candle. I will definitely be back!
This was a wonderful experience. How exciting it was to venture into a great atmosphere where everyone was helpful and delightful. I will always remember this time.
great food and service....ordered the salmon and it was perfect.
This was wonderful. Loaded with excitement and I would definitely return.
Paris Brasserie transplanted to DC. The escargot brought back memories of Paris as did the creme brulee. Book in advance.
This place is hard to beat. Great service and even better food.

I finally made it to this wonderful restaurant and it was amazing from start to finish... Great food, lovely ambience and amazing service, Nabil was very knowledgeable, professional and patient, his recommendations were all great, we got the petit plateau for starter, then the loup de mer, steak au poivre, and moulles frites.. They were all delicious.. I will definitely go back..
Literally everything you imagined, plus some.
I had a couple moments to spare waiting for a friend to come pick me up so I decided to stay at the bar. I Had assorted Oysters. They were so fresh and delicious. I will be back to dine properly. :)

Authentic Parisian Bistro! Profiteroles are the best in town. Consistently good food and good service. They remember their regular customers and take good care of them with special treats. My favorite meal is steak frites but I also enjoy both the "Americain Burger" and the half roast chicken. Saturday or Sunday brunch is fabulous.

I was visiting family in DC and a friend recommended that I go to Le Diplomate. It was amazing! Great cocktails and their onion soup is delicious! One thing to note - it's pretty loud in the restaurant (did not bother me but something to know). You can always sit on the patio which was much quieter!

Unbelievable food and incredibly attentive service. As someone with a nut allergy, I always appreciate when not just my server but the management staff is actively aware of and ensures my safety. Also, the Dorade royale en papillote, the Monday night special, is absolutely out of this world. A perfect way to celebrate an anniversary! We will be back, for the special occasions and the every-day celebrations
hands down best place to eat in DC/ I go there as often as I can.

One of the rare overhyped restaurants that actually lives up to it! I can see this place slowly easing off the reservations-required level of packed but actually staying very busy over the long haul. And it was packed, but in a good, busy French bistro kind of way where you feel alive being there and not at all stressed out by the constant noise and movement. And our waiter was absolutely awesome and knowledgable and friendly.

Everyone at Le Diplomate should get Nobel Prizes for their niceness and attention to detail. Especially Jamie Morris and Meghaen Anderson. Spent another wedding anniversary dinner here. Delicious, unpretentious, delightful. Dover Sole was magnificent.
Great atmosphere! it really feels like you're in France.
An easy recommendation. No hesitation. Great ambiance. Great food. Great hours. What every world class city wants and needs.
The food is delicious. The service is excellent. I always want to go back to this place. I highly recommend this place to you all!!!
I love this place! Great food, nice atmosphere.
Top class restaurant! I went to their with my best friend to try something new and indeed we were amazed by the taste of their food! Definitely going back.
If I could give this place 6 stars, I would. There is nothing wrong with this place. The food is perfect. The service is perfect. The atmosphere is perfect. Well done.
Hands down the best of the best! Best Steak Tartare in DC!

Great place for both inside and outside dining. The service is superb: friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. The brunch I had was inventive, well prepared and savory.  The flattened tuna tar tar was great.
Delicious and I highly recommend.

Food and service were both impeccable. I reserved a spot for my friends birthday and right as we sat down they complemented us with 2 flutes of champagne.A wonderful destination spot in the Logan Circle area. Bon Appetit!
always killing it

I've been here a couple of times and I truly enjoyed the ambiance and the food. If you are craving for some great French-Style meal, come in here and try it. Personally I would recommend 3 things that they have on the menu: their fish, their scallops and their CHOCOLATE NAPOLEON.
One of the most amazing steaks I've ever had.
Getting to look at Omar is worth the price of the food.
Great place for French!Me and my husband came out to have dinner and had a great time!!Tito was our server and he did a great job!!we will definitely be back!!
really? don't miss out...go ... now and then go...again
Awesome atmosphere and great drinks! I love this place!

Great food, nice ambiance. I came here for dinner, brunch and lunch and every time the food and service were solid. It can get a bit loud if you seat in the main room so keep that in mind but if you request to be seated in the back room, it's a bit more intimate. Totally transported to Paris when you dine in this place. Awesome decor, attentive staff and the food is great. Brunch is awesome
Great service. Mac n' Cheese was fantastic. Will come back again.
the best
Every meal I've had has been amazing. Great place.
One of the best restaurants in Washington dc! Service, food and atmosphere were all excellent. We will definitely be going back.

This place lives up to the hype. We have been four times and each time it has been consistently excellent. Best oysters in DC. Hands down.  No kidding. Tuna carpaccio was excellent. You really can't go wrong here. I'm almost jealous I don't own a business like this. Bravo Stephen Starr!!

Holy stars Batman!This place is ah-mah-zing! Seriously. While that may have been the most dramatic thing I've ever said, it's true. Their outdoor patio area is spectacular. The service is good, but you can tell they're just getting into their groove. The bread is amazing. Le Diplomate reminds me of a french cafe bistro I used to go to in the 3rd arrondissement. I think I've found my new favorite spot in all of DC. You'll find me parked on the patio from now until my heart gives way. But I'll be pleasantly preserved with wine and butter.

My family and I tried Cane last month. First off there were flies everywhere! By far the worst "Trini" food I've ever had. Everything was so underseasoned and tasted like almost nothing. The doubles were terrible and the Chana tasted like can metal and no curry flavor. Who puts pineapple pur¨¦e in doubles? The oxtail was terrible. The best part of that dish was the pickled pepper garnish. I am by far so insulted that you guys would take staples from our culture and try to represent our country in such a diverse city and execute so poorly. You guys can do so much better especially for the price. Y'all suck!
