This review is not about the food, but the service. I recently visited Cane with my date, having made a reservation for two. Given the freezing temperatures in the DC area, we requested to be seated away from the door, as our assigned table was directly in front of it. The constant opening and closing of the door made the spot uncomfortably cold.To our surprise, the staff member assisting us--who appeared to juggle multiple roles as a hostess, server, and bartender--responded with an unhelpful and dismissive attitude. Despite the restaurant's small size, we were sent back and forth unnecessarily while being told that our table assignment was fixed because OpenTable dictated it. As someone with experience in the restaurant industry, I know for a fact that changing a table assignment in OpenTable is both possible and straightforward.What made matters worse was the open two-person booth in the back of the restaurant, which was conspicuously available. When I pointed this out, the staff member claimed they couldn't move us because they would "get in trouble with their manager for altering the seating arrangement in OpenTable." Their defensive tone and unprofessional attitude completely soured the experience.The encounter left a bitter taste in my mouth--not from the food, but from the lackluster service. It's a shame because Cane is already a small, intimate space, and poor service only amplifies discomfort. Unfortunately, I won't be returning anytime soon, as I have no desire to risk freezing just to enjoy oxtail.
The food is here great, the jerk wings are the very best I've had anywhere and quite possibly worth the trip from NJ alone.

I recently dined at Cane Restaurant, and it was a fantastic experience! The atmosphere was cozy, the service was friendly, and the food was absolutely delicious--each dish had amazing flavor and was beautifully presented.Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

After frequently passing by Cane, I decided to stop in for lunch, and I'm thrilled I did. Finding authentic Caribbean cuisine in DC has been a challenge, but Cane surpassed my expectations with its flavorful offerings. I particularly enjoyed the Herbivore dish.The ambiance at Cane is wonderfully laid-back, enhanced by the classic Caribbean music in the background. The service was impeccable, and I appreciated the opportunity to chat with my server at the bar while he crafted my drinks. My experience at Cane was delightful, and I'm excited to return.

After a long search, I finally found a place in the DMV area that offers an ox tail menu. I visited during lunchtime and was pleasantly surprised to find a lunch menu available. I ordered the Jerk wings and ox tail bowl, and both dishes were incredibly delicious. The ox tail was cooked to perfection, and the flavors were outstanding. I was amazed to find such high-quality food in the DMV area, and I can't believe I never knew about this place before.I also tried the Sorrel drink, which was okay but didn't stand out as much as the food.Overall, I am thrilled to have discovered this hidden gem and will definitely be returning to try more dishes from their menu. If you're a fan of ox tail, this place is a must-visit.Ps. Tip system is kinda weird. You might need to ask about it

This is an amazing place. The food was so good, it almost derailed our plans for a neighborhood food crawl. We had to use our willpower to avoid eating the entire meal here instead of crawling through the leftovers. The doubles were on point. I wanted to order three more and call it a night. The jerk wings were smoky, not overly spicy. Check it out!Vegetarian options: Get the doubles.
I'm waiting for the next opportunity to get some oxtails from Cane's, but everything was elite!
One of the best restaurants in the city! Everything is so flavorful and the staff is great.
Amazing food and much needed ambiance for Caribbean food in DC.

Amaazing food! The whole experience from start to finish is great waitress is always so friendly and kind. The food can't get better and the prices are fair for the portion size. Always a great spot to get great food.
Incredibly complex, unique, and delicious food. Try all the things here. All of them.
Good food and fr staff. I will be back and recommend this restaurant to everyone
I came her recently and I absolutely loved it! Everything was delicious and the atmosphere was exotic! I would recommend this to anyone looking for a funky night out.

I really enjoyed this spot. I have been wanting to check it out for a good while now. I decided my birthday was a great opportunity to try it. I ordered the doubles, jerk chicken, pork belly, cabbage, rice, and pholouri. I have to admit that everything was great. I will definitely be a returning customer!
It's my first time to visit here.and it was so great. the foods are delicious. the staffs are so accommodating as well. Surely I will be back here again with my love ones
I've never had Trinidadian food and wasn't quite sure what it would be (interested don't like anything spicy!). Turned out to be a unique and very delicious meal in a great setting.

Can't rave enough about everything. The food was impeccable, the staff exuded authentic carribean warmth, and the vibe was friendly with lots of laughter and good music. I will definitely be making this one of my favorite staples and bringing friends here. My fianc¨¦e is carribean and can vouch for the experience.
The food was amazing and the staff friendly and responsive. I brought friends from Florida up to try a Trini restaurant and it was a great experience! Cane also makes good mixed drinks

This was my intro into Trinidadian food and I was so happy to have my first experience here! If you're coming with a friend definitely go for the omnivore platter and split. It's enough for each of you to even take a little bit home! We also order the hops bread and those paired with the heavenly butter combo was other worldly. We'll be coming back!
Cozy spot- rum flights and very tasty menu...good vibe as well.  I hope Cane sticks around...
Extremely overpriced Mediterranean food. On top of that you are eating in a back alley in U st where you can see rats running through the kitchen. Do not eat here!!!
This place is to die for! its the bomb! i love it and you can bring your kids here
Closed on a Thursday night for a private event. sad. sad. sad. sad. sad. sad. sad. sad. sad. sad.

If I could give less than one star I could . This pace is dark dirty and dingy. The serviced is terrible. I ate at the bar, and the bartender seemed completely uninterested in giving me any kind of "experience"--he didn't come by to check on me at all after taking my food order. Then he clocked out without giving me my bill or even saying goodbye and proceeded to drink a beer near the bar, looking at me. The service was terrible and the manager seemed annoyed that I brought this up to him. I'm not saying it's a race thing, but when you can see you're the only black patron at an establishment and you're receiving a far lower quality of service than other patrons, you can only assume.. The food is like if you asked someone to make middle eastern food but watered down and over priced. And the portions are small! Don't waste you time and money here. I wish I didn't.
Hello a young lady name Klyn that work at your establishment was extremely rude and vulgar

Bottom line: The food is good, but the service ruined the experience. The waitress strongly pushed us to order more than we wanted and we were too full to even try the last plate. When the waitress packed up our leftover food, a fair amount of what was left was not boxed up.A one star rating would be unfair because the food was fine, but it is not worth your time or money to go to Maydan. It's all hype and superficiality with none of the high quality service you usually get at DC's nicer restaurants. Go if you want to say you went. Otherwise, get dinner at one of the many truly fabulous restaurants elsewhere in DC.-------I had been trying to make it to Maydan for some time now, but was never able to get a reservation. This past weekend I finally decided to walk in and wait for a table. Although we ended up waiting over an hour-and-a-half to sit down, I had no issue with that, since I knew the place was popular. The restaurant has a cool, hidden gem vibe right from the beginning and is absolutely stunning when you first step in. The open fire in the center of the ground floor gives the whole space a cozy and communal feel. Our table was on the upper floor and the real problems began once we sat down.Our waitress walked us through the menu, telling us that the plates were small, so she recommended 4-6 per person. Neither I nor my girlfriend tend to eat massive amounts, so we went for 3 plates per person (served family style). When we ordered, the waitress told us that as she had said already the plates are small so we should order more and should also add some of the condiments to our order. She then recommended one or two things that she said she liked from each category. We figured we were interested in trying anyway and if the plates were really that small we would need more, so we added another three plates and two condiments. It was way more food than we could handle. The spreads are large and filling: probably enough for four people, but we were two. When we got to the final dishes (the meats) we were so full that it wasn't a particularly enjoyable experience. We only finished one or two of the nine dishes and two condiments and had about half leftover of everything else. Our waitress packed up the leftovers but several of the dishes weren't packed up. Presumably they were thrown away, but I don't know for sure. (Tip: Double check your bill when you get it here. When we got the check, it turned out we had been given the wrong one, which would have doubled our bill. This seems to be a common theme among the reviews.)Overall the food is good, but there are many places in DC that serve better,more interesting, and more complex food. It has top quality Lebanese/Levantine food, but it mainly sticks to elevated versions of tradition (e.g. the muhammara was relatively traditional and really good, the pomegranate molasses added to an already unusually delicious version of the dish).The service and approach are what turn me away. I've never had a waiter insist that I should order more food before, especially in a place that is already pricey. It felt like they were trying to squeeze money out of us rather than welcome us into their community and space.
food was ok but horrible staff needs to change before i would come back
All tables are small. We had a party of five seated at a table of four... the food was average as was the service.
location: H Street Corridor/Atlas District/Near Northeast, Washington, DC

text: I enjoy dining at this restaurant, but I'm hoping to love it even more. Maydan's Middle Eastern cuisine takes you on a culinary journey in the heart of Washington, D.C. Unfortunately, I've encountered issues during my visits. On my second visit, the restaurant implemented a "service charge," presumably due to the increase in servers' minimum wage mandated by the D.C. law. Although I always tip generously, I felt offended by the additional fee. During my most recent visit, I opted for the Tawle menu and experienced an unacceptably long wait of 45 minutes between our last course. This is not indicative of Michelin service. My rating for this restaurant would have been higher, but for these two out of four negative experiences.

Maydab, the elusive Moroccan/Lebanese gem, recently collaborated with renowned LA chef Bresia Lopez, creating an unforgettable dining experience. Despite its reputation for being nearly impossible to snag a reservation, the culinary journey at Maydan was well worth the effort.The fusion of Maydan's traditional tastes and flavors with Chef Lopez's innovative twist resulted in a culinary masterpiece. Service at Maydan was impeccable, despite the bustling atmosphere. The staff was attentive, knowledgeable, and eager to guide diners through the menu, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable dining experience. By the end of the meal, we left Maydan feeling so full! If you ever have the chance to secure a reservation at Maydan, don't hesitate--it's an experience not to be missed.I would try this restaurant on its own next time!

Literally... I would leave nothing but drooly emoji faces for this place.. The food is out of this world fantastic, unique and thought-through. The vibe is dimly0lit and romantic. Take your date here! It is near impossible to reserve so plan way ahead of time. It is worth it though.

Amazing for the most part. The tasting menu started brilliantly, minus the halloumi weak in its balance and the tome surprisingly weak on garlic flavour. The kebabs and marinated vegetables were tender and tasty. Sadly, the lamb shoulder, which we paid extra for the experience, was overcooked. Based on other reviews, this seems like a rare occurrence, but was unfortunate. Dessert, a baklava "cheesecake," was also a pity. So a great meal that ended up being bad.
It's a very good restaurant for particularly food from middle eastern countries. The food is very tasty. Service is good. The staff is good.

Visited Maydan for dinner last night with a group of 9 people, and I thought it was a pretty good experience. We got the Tawle menu where they bring out a big variety of all of their foods, and I think generally everything that we had was very good and certainly very filling. The cocktail that I had, as well as the wines that we split for the table, were also delicious. The interior of the restaurant is gorgeous and the central fireplace was very cool, so definitely try to sit indoors if you go and visit.I would say I'd only rate Maydan 4/5 (sadly not full 5), as the service for our table was actually really slow (we spent 3 hours there and were yawning and ready to go by the end). And although the food was delicious, we were surprisingly underwhelmed by the lamb plate (which is also the one with the pretty significant upcharge).Overall a good experience at Maydan and I'd be happy to go back there!

The most stunning food I have ever experienced. So authentic. The flavours were absolutely incredible. Staff are very helpful and super friendly. Great vibe and very comfortable place, couldn't fault it.
Nice ambience, great food and good staff. This place is a nice place to hangout and they have covid restrictions in place. Their steak is amazing

Favorite Moroccan joint in DC, hands down! Having spent some time in Morocco, I can tell when I am being served authentic Moroccan dishes, and this is the real deal. Do yourself a favor and order a variety of dishes with a party so that you can all sample each others. Well worth the (admittedly long) wait for the reservation.
Great food, dont forget to make reservations even if its week days , its packed. There is always bar space available on fcfs.

Maydan is fantastic, but service varies and the wait time is abysmal. We've gone a couple times and both times ended up waiting a couple hours (reservations are almost impossible to get). The place is tiny, so if you're stuck waiting you're probably just going to be standing in the lobby as the bar area is so packed you can barely move. The food is excellent, but if you hit it on an especially busy day, you could end up getting your food sporadically and that makes it hard to enjoy dishes together that are mutually complimentary - such as the carrots and fried cheese. The food is fantastic, but the difficulty of getting in (good luck getting a reservation) has made us decide to pass in favor of equally delicious restaurants elsewhere in DC.
A bit over priced, but nice atmosphere to try once and see. The happy hour is good when seating at the bar area and taking in all the aromas from the charcoal grill.

The food was all good to very good, but I think the place has gotten a little over-hyped. Couldn't believe the lamb shoulder cost $100, that part was kind of crazy. Everyone there was very friendly and the ambiance was nice.
Really amazing space. I much preferred the dips and vegetable dishes to the meat dishes. I would definitely go again but am not running to do so.
Everything we order was delicious. Everything was flavored and cooked well. The kebabs were moist and tender and not dry. The seafood was flavored well.
Great service. Delicious food. Amazing ambience.

Great bartenders. The menu is somewhat limited, but what's on there is pretty good. Big wood- burning oven in the middle of the restaurant does a lot for the ambiance - which overall is awesome. They've got a great venting system, so you're not chocking on smoke. Most things are only finished over the flames a opposed to being cooked entirely over the open flames. It's petty chic, and a nice spot for a drink, even if you've eaten elsewhere.
All around amazing! The food, drinks, service! Cannot wait to go back. We did the tasting menu, and felt it was a great portion for the price.

During a recent business trip to Washington, D.C., I had the pleasure of visiting Maydan, a Michelin-starred restaurant. Friends had recommended it many times for its amazing tasting menu and its lack of pretentiousness. After much anticipation, I finally had the opportunity to experience the restaurant in personFrom the moment I entered the restaurant, the atmosphere of Maydan was impressive. The design of the restaurant is simple and modern, while also being Middle Eastern, giving it a warm and elegant feel. The service team was very professional and meticulous from reception to table, with a warm and measured attitudeAs for the dishes, they were as good as I had heard. The Tawle chicken kebab was succulent and tender on the outside, and the sauce was quite unique and memorable. Next was the rib eye steak, which lived up to its reputation and was cooked with great skill in every bite. For dessert, the rice pudding cake, simple in appearance but with a subtle hint of kelp, was the perfect end to this culinary journeyMaydan is not just a meal, but also a deep dialogue with the taste buds. Whether it is the combination of ingredients, cooking techniques, or the overall dining experience, it reflects a high level of catering art. Undoubtedly, this will be a place I will visit again in Washington

Maydan is a gem. From the warm, inviting ambiance to the incredible open-fire cooking, everything feels like a journey through Middle Eastern flavors. The spreads, particularly the muhammara, are unforgettable, and the lamb shoulder was cooked to perfect internal temperature that I requested. The service is attentive, knowledgeable, and made great recommendations to give us a great experience. Perfect for a special night out or impressing guests. Highly recommend!

Maydan DC - 4.8/5I celebrated my birthday at Maydan with friends, and it was a fantastic experience.Right from the start, we were welcomed by the warm, friendly staff, who made the night feel special. The service was great and kept up throughout the evening.The atmosphere was a highlight, especially since we sat near the hearth, watching the food being cooked right in front of us. The place was packed, and the lively energy added a lot to the vibe--though it's worth noting that seating is hard to get, so reservations are recommended.The food didn't disappoint. Every dish was packed with Mediterranean flavors and spices, and the wood-smoked proteins were especially tasty.If you're looking for a memorable spot in DC, Maydan is definitely worth it.

Dining at Maydan in Washington DC is an experience that awakens all the senses. From the moment you walk in, you're greeted by the warmth of their signature fire hearth, which infuses the space with an inviting ambiance and hints at the flavorful journey ahead. The staff here is exceptionally attentive and friendly, making you feel welcome from start to finish.The menu showcases the best of Middle Eastern cuisine, with a focus on fresh, seasonal ingredients that make each dish vibrant and unique. Their freshly baked bread is served warm and pairs perfectly with an array of dips and spreads--don't miss it! Each dish feels like it was crafted with care and thought, celebrating traditional flavors with a fresh twist.Maydan is a place to savor every bite, take in the cozy atmosphere, and enjoy an exceptional meal. If you're looking for a spot where incredible food and ambiance come together seamlessly, Maydan is it! Highly recommend for an unforgettable dining experience.

Got a 4 course meal everything was delicious! Food was prepared to perfection down to the sauces! The service was amazing and very personable! They were able to explain every question we asked and with enthusiasm!
Excellent food. Very well spiced. Would definitely come back here again. Definitely earned its one star.

Great food, service, and ambiance. Really attentive service and a cool vibe overall. I went for the tawle experience which I don't need to do again, I prefer a la carte but the food was ample especially for the price point, everyone in my party was stuffed and we had plenty to take home. The tawle experience is also great for vegetarians, as the majority of offerings are naturally vegetarian or vegan. I personally am tired of whole roasted cauliflower being the go-to vegetarian offering but they did it well and the seasonings and flavored oil were sopped up well with their fabulous flatbread. I'd go back just for the walnut dip, muhammara, and pita with cocktails.

Incredible ! The place has a very nice decoration between industrial and maximalist. They have an open fire and cook their own bread. They have an incredible tasting menu and a great wine and cocktail list. The atmosphere is amazing and the service second to none.Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 5/5
Nice and fancy great drinks and food presentation I love it. Tom good eater chooses the best places

As long as you are okay with sometimes group seating with others, this is definitely a go to DC support for a different type of fare. Food quality and service is always top notch. My mother in law asks to come each time she is in town
Have had food delivered several times from Maydan and it has always been consistently excellent.

It was our first time here, and the experience was amazing. A wide variety of dishes ensures that everyone will find something they like. The chicken and lamb dishes stood out to me as superb.The success and value of a restaurant is service and food. The staff provides a service beyond the standard methods such as speed and accurate orders.
Wonderful service and wonderful food. Hard to choose. Everything was delicious. Would definitely come back.
If you get the chance even once in your lifetime, dine at Maydan in Washington. Service and food are beyond outstanding.

We heard this place is amazing and it definitely lived up to the hype, what a hidden gem! Although on the speedier side you certainly get what you paid for. We tried many things off the menu and they were all delicious. The clams / broth was probably the best I've had anywhere and I try to order them when available. The service was great and so were the drinks. We will be back again and again!

Extraordinary. This restaurant met all my standards, which might I add are elite. The staff is always ready to help, the premises are extremely clean, the atmosphere is lovely, and the food is both delicious and beautifully presented.

I couldn't rave about this place more! Went here recently with my hubby for a special anniversary dinner! At first, we didn't have the best experience because they apparently had some pipe burst issue so we had to wait 45 minutes or so. Luckily we had reservations because we were told later on that only reservations were seated because of the pipe issue after we saw some people turned away since they didn't have an RSVP. Regardless, the two women who greeted us and showed us to our seats were very courteous and kind! The waiter was incredible and the food was DIVINE! I would absolutely come here again one day! This place did so well getting us in despite the pipe issue and I look forward to making another reservation!

We had made reservations to eat here tonight for my anniversary, but received a phone call saying that a pipe burst in the restaurant and they had to move our reservation back by 45 minutes. Understandable, sh*t happens. Once we arrived, the two ladies at the host stand were extremely accommodating and professional considering the circumstances, and got us checked in and seated as soon as they could. Once we sat, the experience was wonderful and went smoothly. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for an eventful night out.
Great experience! Service was excellent. Food was also great! Everything we had was great.
The Aleppo lamb was incredible and cooked to perfection. Absolute must! If you are in dc and craving tasty Moroccan go check this place out
An awesome restaurant with an awesome ambiance and great food.. Not easy to locate though.

The beets from the fire. Not to be confused with the beet spread. These beets were BY FAR my favorite dish of the night, and I'm not even the biggest beet fan. They were topped with goat cheese, spices and a touch of finishing salt that added an awesome crunch and Honorable sauce mention: the toum. Garlic based (maybe skip it if you're on a first date), and fluffy like butter. So delicious. Finaly i said service was excellent as our waitress was very friendly and recommended items that turned out to be very good. She also shared some ideas of how to use the leftover lamb shoulder we took home. I highly recommend trying this place out.The service was above excellence and the vibes were amazingOverall, we had such an amazing time. The atmosphere is cool and fun..!!!
Everything is amazing. The only real recommendation I have is that you have to get the duck breast.
Incredible food and atmosphere. My favorite DC restaurant.
Amazing food! Great atmosphere. This is a great date spot but you won't get a seat without a reservation.
Go - you absolutely must even if it means waiting 3 months for that reservation. Make it happen.

This is my absolute favorite Mediterranean restaurant. The pita breads are made fresh in a kiln that is placed in the center of the restaurant. The lighting is a bit dim, which gives it a fun, romantic night out setting. The music is fun Lebanese belly dancing music. The lamb, roasted hummus, eggplants and different dips/sauces are appealing to the eye and stomach. A MUST GO if you are in town.
Amazing food and service. Every dish is a new and different delicious flavor. Would highly recommend.
It's almost impossible to get a reservation without a couple of week before. The food is delicious, and the atmosphere is wonderful.
Wonderful food there! All their dips are awesome!
Lamb Shoulder is as good as it gets. Love this place!
Amazing, we had such a fun experience here. Great food and exceptional service, would recommend!
Amazing dining experience, not just the food but also the space
This place was delicious! The aesthetics is beautiful and customer service was over the top! Reservations is highly recommend .

From the moment you walk through the front door (after you've found the entrance), until the moment you leave, this restaurant does not disappoint. They make great use of fire to offer some of the best roasted vegetables I have ever had. I especially loved the carrots and all of the dips. The drinks are great as well. The only downside is that it is exceedingly hard to get a reservation these days. If you do get one, you will not be disappointed.
Good food at a good value. Amazing service The place has its own charm too once you enter.

If it's good enough for Obama, it's good enough for me! Food is awesome, drinks are superb! You're transported to the middle east the second you walk in the door, and the details are felt all the way up to the rumi books that hold your bill at the end of the meal. Words don't do it justice.
great food great service must return again soon

Incredible dinner! It took awhile for us to get a reservation! I wasn't sure what to expect but I have to say it was worth it! The courses kept coming & the authenticity of each dish was superb. The atmosphere was quaint & we actually liked the top floor better! You won't be disappointed!
FINALLY! I feel like my mouth experienced a complete life!
LOVE everything here. That chicken is heaven
The decor in this place is to die for! We had the hummus and the home made bread. Said is dope and the entire place is lovely

It was our first time here, and the experience was amazing! The cocktails are all tasty and special. Try hanging garden for a mild starter, and the old fashioned for a special taste of Turkish coffee. The thyme gin cocktail in the picture was great too! The ambiance was great, and the place was lively. The waitresses were very nice.

The stunning interior of Maydan invites a diner to travel to faraway lands without leaving DC. The unique cuisine is perfectly executed and complemented with stellar service from the bartenders to the waitstaff. Each meal is an adventure best taken with a plethora of spreads and condiments to enhance the flavors of the stellar wood-fired meats, fish and vegetables. Everything that I've tried has been delicious from the lamb shoulder to the Aleppo kebabs to the whole chicken to the kanafeh. The bread, cooked in a special oven, is to die for and ties all of the flavors together perfectly. Congrats to the team for creating such a fun and delicious destination.

The hostess was so rude! I arrived & walked in apparently 3-4 minutes before they opened, (door was unlocked,) where I was looked up & down & told that I must be in the wrong place by the hostess. I was dressed nicely, not sure what that was about but it was over 100 degrees outside so decided to stay & wait another couple minutes for the rest of my party. If that was all, I would have moved on, but then the hostess told me to go wait outside & proceeded to lock the door behind me when I did so. It was maybe 2 minutes until they were supposed to open, but the hostess was giving me side eye & laughing from inside the door until a few minutes after they were supposed to open. When they finally unlocked the door they immediately told me & the rest of my party to step back a few feet & wait. It would have cost nothing & taken no effort to be kind, at the very least civil. This was not the vibe & the food was greasy mediocre Asian fusion with too much salt. Drinks were fine but I certainly wouldn't go back.

This place has got to be the worst place on earth I mean full blown Messssss. I'm still in here wanting to die that everyone is dying to get in and nobody even knows where they are at. Like a whole place is full of dumb dumbs. ZERO NOT WORTH IT, go to McDonald's
Great environment, but all the food size in only snack size for 14 dollar. It definitely doesn't worth $14 no matter what
It was hit or miss on the food

DC Astoria was a big letdown. While the taste was alright, the spice level wasn't there at all, especially for $27. I ordered the double-cooked pork belly, and the portion size was shockingly small. The pork wasn't even crispy at all its an appetizer size than a full entrÃ©e. The hype is overrated, and between the long lines, crowded tables, and lack of parking, it's not worth the hassle. If you're craving authentic Chinese Szechuan, you're better off finding a real chinese instead of this Americanized version.

Celebrated my birthday dinner here, and it was an absolute feast! The honey walnut shrimp stole the show--it might just be the best shrimp I've ever tasted. The food was delicious, and I appreciated the diverse menu options, especially for those who prefer milder flavors. The drinks were also generously portioned. However, service on the patio was a bit slow--we had to signal to different servers for about 15 minutes just to get more water. Additionally, our table was situated at the edge of the patio, and people waiting for tables were leaning against the gate, which made it a bit uncomfortable to eat at times. Despite these minor issues, I would definitely return here, especially with a hearty appetite.
Good vibes. The dishes just come out as they are made so you may not have everything you ordered all at once.
location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

text: Astoria is a neighborhood gem. If you weren't looking for it, you might miss it crowded between Agora and JR's, but this is not somewhere you want to miss. The cocktails are the best in the city, hands down. They use fresh ingredients, including homemade foam to top off your espresso martini. The food is also incredible with a menu that has options to please everyone. Most importantly, the staff is the BEST! Ian and Justice always make us feel at home and they are masters of their craft, with the talent to make any cocktail under the sun that is sure to impress!

Getting a table wasn't an issue but I had to go to the bar to order my food as there was no server came to get my order. Maybe she wasn't aware about it, Bridget is super nice and humble. I really like her energy, I would honestly go back just because of her. Food has potential. The dish Chimichurri, I don't know why they named it like that but there is no chimichurri sauce or nothing connected to chimichurri from the components of the dish. The Beef noodles is a little dry for me, basil eggplant is on point. Little pricey but it's ok.

Decent offerings here, did not really care for the greasy foods, however could have just been what I ordered that particular night. Astoria has a different kind of feel/vibe, I did enjoy my time. Bartenders are generous but price is a little out of my normal budget. Sort of like tapas style.

What a great spot!! Great atmosphere and the food was yummy. My favorite were the Dan Dan Noodles. Perfectly spicy and really tasty. The drink was out of world great. I love the interior decor as well. The service was attentive and friendly.
This place is amazing. I love the atmosphere, food, service everything. Really worth the money. I will go there again.

Amazing dinner! The drinks were awesome--I loved the Swamp Fire and the Probation Sling. The food was out of this world--Dan Dan noodles, vegetable fried rice, double cooked pork, walnut shrimp, and basil eggplant were all fantastic! We had no clue Astoria had a Michelin star, but it totally makes sense now! Dinner for four with drinks came in under $250, which is wild for New York!

A great tapas place. Ordered a couple items to share, everything was good.The waiter was very attentive, always checking on us and filling our water glass.We ate outside on a Friday evening, it was a little loud. If looking for something quiet I would recommend eating inside.
We were a large party of 11 seated in the atrium. Izzy was our server and she was very attentive and responsive to our needs. Great food and service !
The atmosphere and the service is amazing. Very friendly environment. I will be back for the food and the service.
Food is flavorful!!! If you are adventurous when it comes to food, this is the place for you!

Astoria DC is a unique and intimate restaurant that offers an unforgettable dining experience. One of the standout features of this restaurant is the goldfish crackers that are given as a table snack - it's a small touch that adds to the fun and quirky atmosphere of the place. The limited seating can make for a crowded space, but it only adds to the cozy and intimate vibe of the restaurant.The food at Astoria DC is nothing short of amazing. The eggplant, chicken, fried rice, and steak are all standout dishes that are expertly prepared and full of flavor. The presentation is beautiful and the attention to detail is evident in every dish. The bartenders are also true artists, crafting delicious and inventive cocktails that perfectly complement the food.The service at Astoria DC is top-notch as well. Despite the small space, the staff is friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable, making sure that every aspect of your visit is perfect. From recommending dishes to providing excellent drink pairings, the staff goes above and beyond to ensure that you have an unforgettable dining experience.Overall, Astoria DC is a must-visit spot for anyone looking for a unique and intimate dining experience. The goldfish table snack is just one of the many small touches that make this restaurant so special. The food, drinks, and service are all outstanding, making for a truly unforgettable evening. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or just looking for a fantastic meal, Astoria DC is definitely worth a visit.
Went above and beyond. Great experience! Will be back! Z was great! And very accommodating to what we needed!
This place was such a pleasant surprise. The flavors of every dish were unique and well balanced. Exceeded every expectation. Shout out to the hostess team!
This place was amazing! We loved the ribeye and the noodles. The crab fried rice is a must.

Great spot, Great atmosphere, and the food was delicious. My favorite would be the shrimp followed by the spicy dumplings. Smaller portions but very intense flavor. The service was attentive and friendly. One of the better smaller hole in the wall type places in DC.

This may be my new favorite place! After reading the reviews, my brother and I ordered 3 dishes but it was MORE than enough (I'm not sure if we could have even finished two!) but everything was so delicious I'm glad we ended up with more rather than less.We ordered the Mapo Tofu, Water Boiled Beef, and La-Zi chicken. My brother said the Mapo Tofu was the best he's had, and my favorite was the beef. However the chicken was incredible as well! Excited to try more next time.Also the service was incredible. The servers were so kind, sociable, and attentive! One of the servers/bartenders asked me to describe what type of drinks I liked (tart, citrus, etc.) and made me my PERFECT drink, not on the menu. I would definitely recommend telling them your preferences because they got it spot-on.

Came here for lunch with a friend and the food and experience was awesome! Cute little spot with funky decor. I had the banh mi & coffee and it was a perfect lunch. Definitely plan on coming back to try their bao buns and fried rice.
Nice place, good food and good ambience. Staff is well trained too. More close to authentic Vietnamese cuisine. Would recommend a try if anyone craves some nice asian cuisine
Everything was delicious! Can believe this place isn't packed all the time. The pork was delicious.
I like this place so much!! This was my second time and the food was still great.

I came by here again, and it was delicious as always. It does get pretty busy for takeout, but it's your cute, neighborhood Vietnamese place with solid spring rolls, noodles, and buns.I would highly recommend trying the beef or the pork noodles- it was my absolute favorite.

The food was good but I like some flavor in my garlic rice. I want to try some other dish, I only have adobo ones. Lumbia very tasty. The service was just different. It wasn't the attitude, but when I was ordering you to order, I had to be actively ignored when trying to get a napkin or give money.
Food was delicious but pricey for what you get. The "grilled chicken" was mostly bone with a little chicken. For $18, that was a letdown.

The food was top notch, highly customizable. We ordered anasal, (vegan) pancit, ansaladang talang, biko, and their signature cocktail telecall. Everything was perfect! High quality serving. Our folks loved the pancetta, and the Ensalada a must-order. Chef Wing was very reasonable and short note all excellent food, and better service too. A++, would definitely order again.

I recently visited Bangalay and was pleasantly surprised by the delicious food. The lumpia and chicken Inasal were both well-seasoned and a real treat. The ambiance was a little odd since the restaurant is located inside a bagel shop, but it was still a nice place to enjoy a meal. The staff was very welcoming and friendly, which added to the overall positive experience. I would definitely recommend trying the lumpia and chicken Inasal if you're a fan of Philippine cuisine.

I first came across this restaurant serving Filipino dishes last year thru a friend. I tried it and loved it. I organized a fellowship dinner for my org, the Philippine American Chamber of Commerce of Metro Washington DC and Philippine embassy officials last night and chose to hold it here. It was the best decision. Chef Wing prepared a 6-course dinner of lumpia, pancit, pork belly, ensaladang talong, chicken Inasal with garlic fried rice and Turon. Everything was good and this was served individually, so we were stuffed!! Everyone went home happy. Thanks to Chef Wing, Danny, Joselyn and everyone else. Great service!! 100% recommend!

The staff were very friendly and enjoyed speaking with the customer's. You could see there were people that came in there on a regular basis which says a lot about a place. And salmon is really special.

This is the best experience on H st. If you are a foodie and have had all the Michelin star restaurants in the city like me you will still love it. If you appreciate great quality you will love it. If you love life even a little you will love this.
Please update your hours.I went there after seeing hours on Yelp, they open from 5pm.

THEY HAVE A RODENT ISSUE. I just want to say this place undercooks their food and they have rats, I saw a baby rat stuck to a mouse trap and when I pointed out my concerns the staff member told me that all the restaurants in the city have this problem & that the food was safe. I told him that wasn't true and I was going to leave because this was disgusting and he said "we already put in your order we cant cancel it" like I'm not going to eat food at a place that has rats. He would not refund me for my order so I had to dispute it with my bank. The lightskin tall guy was also wearing a TRUMP MASK. Beware you guys!

I am a long time resident of H street. I was turned down for service because I did NOT book a reservation. I think its not fair to the community that TOKI Underground has decided to be apart of that they are not welcoming.Also, they keep flagging my review because they do not want the news to get out that they do not care about the actual residents of H street.
So dude made me wait for 20 minutes to tell me I could not be seated total waste of my time and lack of customer service or common decency.

Extremely rude staff and very tight, tense space at this place. Our server asked for dietary restrictions and upon pointing out our friend's tree nut allergies, she frowned, acted upset, and verbally dismissed our concerns over her allergy. We waited around to ask to leave due to her rude behavior but were not checked in with. So we decided to leave and call with our comments about the service. When I called and after I explained our experience, the hostess did not apologize or reassure us that the behavior will be addressed. Will not be returning to this location!

This place will turn you away before 1:30 pm and tell you "we aren't taking anymore people because we close at 2:30" right after adding some caucasions to the list??? I felt really discriminated. I could've saved the 40 minute drive. How do you turn away clientel to make sure you close down on a busy saturday??? There is poor management and when i called to talk to a manager the "executive chef" answered and asked me why i wanted to talk to a manager, I told him it was about the service and he said "No were good" and immediately hanged up. Its no wonder why there is such poor service because they lead by example, the owners and chef are suing each other and the executive chef is a real prick....Toki underground has lost a client for life.
I don't think the food can make up for how RUDE they are.

Ramen was just a bit below average if i put it nicely. Drinks were pleasant. Service was good but the ambiance was just awful for me.This is my personal experience. My husband and i went here for a celebration. Made a reservation and had high hopes since a friend of his recommended this place. Had to park in parking garage and walk about 10min in somewhat dark area to get to the restaurant (honestly didnt feel very safe walking after dark)As we walked in, i noticed the place is extremely dark. There are no tables, all bar setting. The decors were pretty nice for your "social media" photos, but i didnt enjoy the vibe there. Music was too loud to have a decent conversation with my husband and the person next to me was uncomfortably close to me (touching elbow distance). The bartender had long hair and when he leaned in to grab ice, i saw his hair actually reaching down into fridge/ice area scraping the inside of ice machine. I just didnt feel very good after seeing that. Like i said, drinks were delish, workers were nice in general but thats about all the good thing about that place. The bill being $100+ for 2 ramen, app, and two drinks probably didnt help either with the experience.

I used to love this place, but the quality has certainly dipped.Never wrote a review about it, but all it really has going for it is the decor. Other than that the food is VERY average. Which is sad because I remember how good it used to be, the decline in quality is so noticeable it is worrisome.
Good food and cocktails, would give 4-5 stars, but the music is way too loud, making it really hard to enjoy the meal.
Good but not great.
i came here to try their ramen but it took me forever to get the table .the food was ok but i prefer Taan at my neighborhood Adams Morgan at least i don't have to wait and the ambiance is great.

The food here is not authentic and the fusion that they have going on sucks! The wait list is freakin long, but then again its a tiny restaurant. Very Disappointed after hearing so much hype about it. The only reason I'm not giving it a 1 star is because the waiters were really nice. I'm never coming back here again.

I wouldn't say it serves the best food, but the menu offers a variety of selections, including vegetarian options. This is a really nice and friendly place with wonderful service. With a large serving, the price is reasonable. Long queue during lunchtime, but always worth a visit!
very mediocre for the wait and lack of space.

I went here a while ago, but I wanted to write a review to state a few things. 1) More noodles please! 2) Needs to be hotter! 3) and Don't overcook the noodles!Otherwise it's a pretty decent ramen place. I definitely like the decor, but the line and wait was ridiculous. They need to branch out and fix the 3 things above!

I waited long hours for this place. perhaps i was too hyped up about it but i thought the food was okay. They are creative with their dish but they are so SALTY. I am not sure if its worth waiting 2 hours for it. I prefer other ramen places like the Daikaya.
food is just ok.for how long you have to waiting time is not worth it.

For me, ramen is one of those foods that has a certain plateau. I don't believe that ramen can reach mindblowing status -- it's a nice broth with a lot of ingredients thrown in, without much room for various textures, contrasting tastes, etc. This belief makes me cap ramen at 4 stars. That may change if I finally have one that is truly mindblowing, but Toki Underground does not serve mindblowing ramen.I began with a side of seafood gyoza. This was disappointing because one cannot tell what types of seafood constituted the filling - if the filling was even seafood at all. I then tried the kimchi ramen. The portions were very generous. However, the noodles were a tad undercooked (e.g. was not chewy and soft, but was chewy and a bit hard), and the broth was a little too salty. The ramen needs a little work and does not compare to the ones I've had in the Bay Area. That said, it is just slightly off. Despite my criticisms, I would go there again if I had a hankering for Ramen, if only the line freed up.*As for the service, I have no complaints. The man at the door was courteous, and the wait staff was nice.*A good solution is to put your name down and pop over to the Queen Vic for some drinks. Toki will call your cell phone.

The appetizers were really good and so was the ramen. However, I wasn't a fan of the way the pork was served in the ramen. It was shredded. It usually comes in slices or strips with the fat (pictured pork belly) which gives the meat more flavor and texture. The yuzu custard dessert was fantastic.
I am amending my original review. The service was great, food was wonderful, no issues on the 2nd visit at all. If I had received this service the first time, I would rate 5 stars !

Service was great, very friendly/helpful/polite staff.A place to eat. We similarly ordered dishes that were enough to fill our stomachs but we also had dessert.As for the name, the restaurant is not literally underground, but on the second floor above the stairs.

Toki Underground is a small restaurant, so there was a small wait, and it was definitely worth it. I had the kimchi ramen, and it was my favorite thing I ate while in D.C. Highly highly recommend! The atmosphere is very relaxed and chill, with good vibes.

The place is CLEAN, COZY, and BIGGER. We visited on the evening of Super Bowl, when most people are glued to their TVs at home, so the place was not particularly busy. The food was flavorful and filling, and was to our utter satisfaction. Prices are reasonable. The staff, Gigi, was friendly and attentive...... Highly recommended trying this !
Pretty good. I think there should be more broth options. There are only one 2 and one I'm allergic to.

Perfect Friday date night in. We had the curry chicken ramen, pork cheek bun, and pork dumplings. The takeout came deconstructed and I felt very fancy serving it at home. The only ordering and curbside pickup were very easy.
Best Ramen place I've been to in a long time. I am definitely going to be coming here regularly.

I was here earlier just to try the ramen. I heard these guys had the best in DC , I had to see it for myself. I got a level three spicy bowl with pulled pork and it was damn near perfect. The spiciness played with the pork really well, I wasn't expecting it to be that good. The kimchi was another favorite, but it cost $15 per serve so I'd think twice about coming back soon.
One of the few ramen places I've been that I actually enjoyed.
I like this place, the foods so delicious and high quality, Good service, I will come again.
Loved the character and decore of this place. The food was amazing and I would recommend this to anyone.

Fried Chicken Steamed Buns- Karaage in sweet chili sauce with Japanese mayo, pickles, Thai Basil & cilantro. The chicken was great, I loved the crispiness and I loved the Japanese mayo addition as well as the homemade pickles with the Thai basil but the chicken does run oddly sweet.
They are my country food, I like it , I like red miso, so delicious and authentic cuisine. I usually come here two times one week.
Best ramen ever. My boyfriend who hates driving will gladly sit in traffic if it means he's getting his beloved ramen. Check out the pop up restaurant at union market.

We arrived just after 5pm, and there was already a long line outside the restaurant. After 20 minutes waiting, a nice gentleman took our names and phone numbers on his ipad to call when a table was ready. We passed our info and went to the Pug for drinks and waited 30 minutes for a call on an open a table. Compliments on the efficient reservation/seating system. After we were seated, our server came to greet us & he was pretty friendly. It kind of seemed like he had a sarcastic personality by how he asked & questioned some questions. The restaurant has bar-style seating where you're touching elbows with the person next to you. If you're lucky, you'll get to unintentionally eavesdrop on an awkward first date like my friend and I did. That provided a great source of entertainment for us at dinner.If you are in the mood for some good ramen, I would suggest calling it in to take out as the lines are horrendous and I do not think that you would get that much more out of eating there. However, if eating ramen at the restaurant is something that is necessary, I would suggest that you come close to opening as possible.Overall, definitely my favorite ramen place in DC so far! Would recommend to everyone who hasn't tried it yet!
Good soup. Love the Asian style seating. We'll be back.
Good noodles and beer selection.

Incredible ramen. Like wait an hour and a half for it ramen. Pair it with one of their beautifully crafted cocktails, or a pour of one of their many Japanese whiskys, and you have one of the best evening to be had in DC. (Pro tip: wait for your table downstairs at the pug or over a couple at Granville Moore's)
excellent is all the right ways. just a cool place. cool vibe. people that work there are into it and fun. the food is uniquely brilliant. a real find.

I had a good first experience here this past weekend. Our bartender/waiter was great -- he was friendly, explained the menu to us with patience and excitement, and was fun to watch while making interesting cocktails. My date and I started with the chicken dumplings, which were in a delicious spicy sauce, and both got the Toki Classic ramen. Portion wise, I wish I had got extra noodles like he did -- I seemed to be very quickly left with just broth. But, the tonkotsu style broth was very flavorful. I'd love to come back and try some of the other styles. Very unique! Oh, and yes the restaurant is awkwardly snug, so come with an open mind, try not to be too cranky. :) We arrived a little before noon on Sat. and the wait was about 20 min.

I was debating on whether to give this place 3 or 4 stars, but decided to go with 4 because the food doesn't give me much to complain about. Out of all the ramen places I've tried in the DC area, I'd say Toki has the most unique taste, and their fusion broth seems to work pretty well despite my initial skepticism. I just wouldn't say this place was worth the 3 hour wait, and it wasn't exactly up to all the hype it gets. Good ramen overall, though!

Been here a couple times. More of a "once-a-month" place that I'll go to after work. Great soups, but definitely not the best dumplings I've ever had. I would say it's decent, but there are definitely some other great asian places in DC to go to.
Soon as i walked in...I loved their decoration and people. way they serve , way they wear uniform,way they make ramen ......so rich flavor and fresh noodle....I love this place.

Absolutely amazing food. Hands down the best ramen in DC and well worth the rate. Only dinged it a star because I'd like to be able to sit across from my dining partner. I understand it isn't feasible in the dining area they have. But, seriously, eat here, and make it yesterday!
Very small place but very delicious! The food was really good and the small menu had enough variety to satisfy.
Yum, pork belly and dry sake.

Look for the blue Chinese looking character (it's a stylized TOKI) on a glass door. To the left of the Pug. Don't get lost!Pros: Great food, alcohol, intimate setting, one of the best vegetable presentations, best music and ambiance.Cons: Must sit next to a person, never across, small, very little seatting, uncomfortable for lon gperiods of time, no place to han ga coat or a purse so come with minimal items. Parking is also difficult.Notes: Get a Snow Beauty Sake (a little sweet and cloudy, unfiltered), and a Classic or Curry Ramen with Toki Endorphin Sauce. Arrive between 5-6 if you don't want to wait forever. You could get on the list, and go to Granville Moore's (two doors down) for drinks, and they will call when your table is ready. Also any of the dumplings are great. Toki is heavily Taiwan/Japanese influenced. Also about the parking, Wylie street is the easiest. Turn on 13th St, NE, then turn onto Wylie, which is one way. One side is for residents and one side has parking.
Great Ramen, better get there at 5 though, this place is small and fills fast. just a little too crowded for my taste.
Toki Monster! Love the drinks. Love the decor. Love the noodles. Not much more to be said - other than try to avoid the crowds on the weekends.

Had a great time on a tuesday night. Ordered the pork ramen and was very happy with the result.Delicious noodles with savory broth.Wonderful service but super busy so don't expect a quick romantic meal.
yum
Good food but very limited seating. Ramen was pretty good.
Wife has been to this neighborhood star and she likes it alot.
Worth the wait! Great ramen! Service was much much better than we expected for H St. as well. Want to come back ASAP to try more types of ramen.

Having read about Toki Underground many times in the City Paper and due to equal, if not more, insistence from the Girlfriend that we "must!" visit - we did.Last week we meet up on H Street for an early dinner in hope that we could get a table (we'd heard it was very difficult to get seated). Well, lucky us. We headed up the stairs, spoke to the host, and immediately got a spot for two on the wall.My love got the "classic" (or whatever they call it) and I got the curry ramen (IIRC).The wait for food wasn't bad, although a server initially brought us the ramen meant for another table. TEASE!Not long thereafter our own ramen arrived. It was very good. Early into the meal I sampled my girlfriend's choice and liked it very much. Even so, by the end of my meal I thought the curry ramen was better.My takeaway was that the portions were larger than need be. For as much buzz and press as they get (deservingly IMO), they could charge the same ($10?) for a bowl 2/3s or even 1/2 the size.Anyway, I'll be back - if for no other reason than to scope out all the other new H St. spots I've missed in the past 12 months.

Two trips to Toki and both times have been great. Great service, great food, and cheap Japanese beer. I only have two complaints... 1.) Place is very small. The wait has caused me to only be able to go twice. If this place was bigger and could accommodate more people I would go once a week. 2.) It has "Underground" in the title and it's upstairs. For some reason that bothers me. I'm sure the name has some meaning I am un aware of that makes perfect sense. As it stands now I'm bothered.

It is a bittersweet to have a small restaurant as it feels exclusive from any other restaurant yet the wait can be ridiculous on the weekend. I love the Kim Chi ramen and the pork belly. The dumplings make a great appetizer but I've had better at Korean BBQs.
The food and service here was outstanding. The place is quite clean, employees were friendly, and food was cooked as ordered.
I love Toki Underground. Best Ramen around, and the Taiwanese tofu is delicious.
OMG when I am in DC this is where I go for lunch.one of my favorite restaurants.

I want to go to here all over again.A friend and I waited about 1.25 hrs to get into Toki. It was well, well worth it. I had heard of Toki even before I moved into the DC area. In my opinion, this place lives up to all the buzz. The ramen here is good, y'all. Really good. It's not classic Japanese ramen (probably because the chef is Taiwanese). It's this strange and yummy hybrid of Japanese and Chinese cuisine. Spicy broths, large chunks of pork loin, veggies, and of course ramen egg noodles.I highly recommend the Toki Hakata Classic with Toki Endorphine Sauce (their homemade and very fresh hot sauce). This combination is slurp worthy. My friend tried the kimchi ramen and it seemed too spicy for her -- get it if you like really spicy kimchi. The seafood dumplings were AHMAHZING. Get them steamed, the best. Frying them would dull the sumptuous flavor. Don't do that. Steamed dumplings are better for you anyway. Sit at the bar for the full effect. It's like going to an izakaya! The Kid Robot figurines also give the place a fun and lively atmosphere. The hostess was sweet and the bartender was pretty helpful with recommendations. Oh, and no reservations or take out. Verdict: Save your money -- skip the sake or beer and head straight for the ramen. Just what I needed on a rainy DC day.

Toki Underground on H Street NE, Washington, DC, offers an amazing dining experience! I highly recommend the Toki Monster for $15 - it's absolutely delicious. The Collins, priced at $12-$13 for top-shelf quality, is a perfect drink to complement your meal. Don't miss out on the Ozeki Nigori for $8 and the Master Gao puffed rice ale at $9. For a great deal, try the Beer & Shot combo for $10. The atmosphere and flavors make this spot a must-visit!
Amazing food and friendly staff! Trendy decor. Drinks are unique and tasty. Definitely recommend the Toki Classic Ramen. Will definitely be going back when in the area.

Me and my girlfriend went for the first time. Food, ambiance, and staff alone was 10/10 but the stand out was our server Chris. He was able to combination cover about three parties simultaneously. He was personable, engaging. and informed . His energy and recommendations put this restaurant in our regular rotation.
Great apps, fabulous noodles, but above all, Daniel's service was fantastic. you dont always get a server who brings joy to their job, well done Daniel
Always a great experience. Came with the whole family. The vibes were sweet. The kids love the ramen. Super fun and delicious. And the cocktails are on point. Especially the Toki Monster.
Delicious ramen. I got the classic
Love this pace. Can't recommend enough. They also do well at delivery. You will love it.
I went here with friends and it was my first time but they recommended this place and I enjoyed the atmosphere and the food it was very delicious and a great place to sorbs with friends
Been here 3 times and it's delivery time. Wait times for food are so quick there is no time for conversation. If you're hungry, you'd won't be in a few minutes after being sat.
LOVE this place. Everything I've tried has been good. Don't need to describe it all in detail. Just GO
Amazing Staff, Amazing food and an amazing atmosphere.The food is good and it's not to expensive. 10/10 Recommended
Great experience friday. Staff super friendly and prices are reasonable. Looking forward to trying again some time when i work a little more for money

Toki underground truly made me feel at home with with extremely welcoming hospitality. I was instantly greeted by the server I believe Steve was his name and he got all of our orders right the first time thank you!
I will return as many times as possible, the best of the best, I love the quality of your food and the attention
The food is amazing! The only thing is you have to wait like an hour to two because it is so busy.
Best ramen ever. We need this in l.a.
one of the best ramen in the city. hands down
Perfectly cooked egg and noodles, the miso broth was delicious too. I asked for no nori, I just don't like the taste, and this place didn't disappoint
By far some of the best Ramen i've had, not a huge selection but everything on that menu is perfect!
Great service location and foo. This is our go to spot for sure. We love it and highly recommend this place.
Delish ! Great service ! I will be back. :)
Absolutely wonderful. Get there right when they open at 5 for immediate seating.
delish! Hard to get in, but worth the wait!
I had my first delicious ramen at this place. I'm convinced to go there often in the future.

I'm a regular at this place.  I go so much my gf is getting sick of ramen. Lol.  Everything I've tried is amazing. Management and staff are friendly and helpful.  And there is a vintage arcade two doors down!!!!!  An amazing night out.
Always good! I can't wait to go back. I really don't think that you could go wrong with anything on the menu.
It is soo good. I love ramen because of this place!!!
Consistency, excellent food, and great atmosphere. You can't go wrong with anything on their menu.
Always craving for more! Delicious, love the atmosphere too!
very comfortable setting to be close && personal with someone. the drinks apps && food is amazingggg!!! cant wait to go back or maybe callto go in! def worth the wait!
Great service, great food, and delicious drinks.
Small place, waited 45 minutes to be seated but the food and service is definitely worth the wait,
This was a wonderful experience. How exciting it was to venture into a great atmosphere where everyone was helpful and delightful. I will always remember this time.

Yes I loved this place, food was wonderful the bartender was very helpful with food choices, my girl was talking about the food all night after we left but that's not saying much because she is impressed very easy, but it was very good
Miss you . Don't ask , just go . Bring a book while you are waiting for the line ..................................................................
Best bowl of ramen I've had in DC. I will definitely be a regular here. Appetizers and drinks are great too. You will not be disappointed.
This is the best ramen and best experience I've ever had. Everything tastes incredible, worth the wait and inexpensive.
Great food. Hip decor. Sweet location.
One of the best restaurants I have ever been to. DELICIOUS food!!! Sometimes a long wait, but definitely worth it!
BEST. RAMEN. EVER. It makes me cry to think of all the time I wasted at Daikaya.
They have very good noodles.
Best meal I've ever had hands down. I can't wait to go back.
Oh my! So great! This place was truly delicious! What an excellent place to stumble upon! Will definitely be back for more!
the best ramen, no question. what else is there to say? erik is the bomb.
The best Ramen I ever had. Great cocktails (Toki Monster)
Taste, vibe, staff - Tops
The food is amazing ...highly recommended ....

This place is good. Food is great, bartenders are nice, fun atmosphere. A little pricey but its ok. Only downfall is that the wait is very long, they dont take reservations over the phone and therefor you need to come in and make it lol. Its a little tight but its fun.

Wonderfully comforting bowls of steaming ramen.Broth is rich and well balanced, ramen noodles are perfectly cooked. The toppings (highly reccommend the pork cheeks) make each spoonfull different and yet delightful! Having tried the entire menu, the classic is still my favorite.Pan fried pork dumpligs were also very good.As other reviewers have said, the place is small and the wait can be long- four hours wait on a Saturday!  If the long wait on a week-end is a turn-off, but you still want your ramen, you can call ahead for pick-up and enjoy your ramen in the comfort of your own home.

I had to be honest with myself. I've eaten here three times in five days. Plus, I ate part of the noodles still in my coat hovering over the counter and when all the noodles were gone I had to stop being cute and ditch the spoon. (I got takeout, calm down). With all that being said, I couldn't justify not giving them 5 stars. I really love this place and it keeps me from having to fulfill my noodle cravings with so so to terrible Sticky Rice noodles. But FYI, there was a two hour wait on a Tuesday night so make a reservation if you want to sit down.
This is my absolutely favorite place to get ramen. Only con is the wait but it's worth it!! Broth is rich and never salty.
Food was amazing, and CHEAP!

How do you beat this place? I have no clue. Toki is my favorite place in dc. Yes the wait is long but you're on H street! Just walk around and before you know it your table is ready. My favorite is the miso and the curry ramens but honestly, everything is good. Don't forget to try their awesome drink selection AND COOKIES FOR DESSERT!!! Definitely a must try in DC!
Crowded, but has some delicious ramen.

I have actually been to here 5 times so I am a bit biased. But I really love the food here, specifically their pork dishes. I also like the fact that they are very affordable compared with similar restaurants. The waitress kept my glass of water always full. Great time.

My friend made us reservations over this past weekend and rarely have I encountered a more overhyped and disappointing dining experience than this wood-fired Italian hot spot concocted by Unconventional Diner's Eric Eden and David Deshaies. The ostentatious Murano-glass chandeliers hanging from the excessively high ceilings merely serve as a flashy distraction from the lackluster meal that follows. The entire evening feels like a forced attempt at revelry. Loud and obnoxious diners shovel down their absurd 40-layer short-rib-and-truffle lasagna and tasteless Maine lobster Thermidor. The "duck hunt" foie gras ravioli at the quartz bar are nothing but a pretentious gimmick. Couples on their so-called "date night" can't even salvage the experience with martinis and the uninspired linguine alle vongole. Deshaies may try to channel Michel Richard, but his efforts result in nothing more than melodramatic mediocrity. Even the flaming tiramisu, a desperate attempt to salvage the meal's dignity, falls flat. And let's not even mention the exorbitant prices. Avoid at all costs.
Robert Mmy creditably is stellar. You are bending over backwards to manipulate my account and have refused accountability. Not a good look.

I usually don't leave yelp reviews ever but I recently had the unfortunate experience of dining at L'Ardente over the holiday weekend in Washington DC, and it was nothing short of a disaster. From start to finish, this place left me thoroughly unimpressed.Let's start with the ambiance. It was as if they were trying too hard to be fancy and ended up being overly pretentious. The decor was outdated, and the lighting was so dim that I could barely see my food. I get that they might be going for a cozy vibe, but it just came off as gloomy and uninviting.Now, let's talk about the food. It was not only overpriced but also severely underwhelming. I ordered their supposedly "signature" dish, "The 40 Layer Lasagna" and it tasted like something I could whip up at home with minimal effort. The portion size was laughable (40 THIN layers) for the price they charged, leaving me hungry and dissatisfied.But the icing on the cake was the service. Our server Hector seemed like he would rather be anywhere else but there. He was inattentive, , and downright rude at times. It felt like they were doing us a favor by taking our orders and bringing us our subpar meals.To top it all off, when I politely voiced my concerns to the server, he brushed me off and made me feel like an inconvenience. It's clear that customer satisfaction is not a priority here.In summary, L'Ardente in Washington DC is a place I wouldn't wish upon my worst enemy. Terrible ambiance, lackluster food, and abysmal service make this a dining experience to avoid at all costs. Save your money and go somewhere else where you can actually enjoy your meal.

I was utterly disappointed by my experience at L'Ardente. Despite its lavish description, the reality fell flat. The glittering chandeliers and gold-plated pizza oven couldn't mask the lackluster food and overpriced menu. The so-called "impeccable ingredients" seemed to be missing in my dishes. The supposed glorious contrasts of Italy were more like a confusing mishmash of styles that left me unsatisfied. It's clear that the restaurant's concept doesn't live up to its hype, making it a regrettable dining choice. The service was also not the best he made our family feel awkward. I believe his name was Hector STAY AWAY from this server!
arrogant nasty staff . Horrible restaurant . never again

We chose this place for a birthday dinner after seeing all the great Yelp reviews, but it turned out to be a huge letdown. The food was just okay--bland and lacking flavor, nothing like what we expected based on the rave reviews. The service didn't help either

Man, I was really let down. The so-called award-winning 40-layer lasagna was just a bunch of horizontal layers, not vertical, so you could only taste a few layers in one bite. And it was nothing special, just ordinary. The linguine wasn't cooked well at all. The tiramisu was a disaster. The rum and passion fruit totally overpowered the tiramisu flavor. But hey, the risotto was amazing! I'd go back just for that dish.

I was pretty bummed out by the 40-layer Lasagna. It was called award-winning, but it was just a bunch of horizontal layers, so you could only taste a few layers at a time. It was pretty average, nothing special. The linguine was undercooked, and the tiramisu was a letdown. The rum and passion fruit were overpowering, and you couldn't taste the tiramisu at all. But, on the bright side, the Risotto was amazing. I'd go back just for that dish!

The location and inside looks were great, however the food was horrible when you compare it to the price. When I go out and want to spend money on food, this is not the place to go. My pasta ended up being dry with little to no sauce and the portions my partner had for his lobster pasta was extremely small. It was barely a portion and completely not worth the price. The chocolate cake they have on their dessert menu did not taste like anything special either. There are plenty of other places to get food that look just as nice. I recommend that you try elsewhere.

This place is loud as shit. good wine though. I had the caesar salad, but it was too minty. I'd try the other one next time. The dishes are small so make sure you eat something beforehand or have a small enough stomach.

I decided to celebrate my 30th birthday here with some friends, the decorations and atmosphere was amazing but sadly even when we made a reservation, we had to wait 50 minutes for our table after checking with the hostess multiple times. The server was rushing us and when we told the waiter that we're celebrating a birthday he literally said "oh, good to know... illl bring the check" and we had to ask twice for the birthday surprise for the table, a candle next to the check.The service at the bar was good, but so sad the whole experience wasn't what we expected.

I recently visited L'Ardente it was highly rated on social media and in local press.. including word of mouth. However, I was left disappointed with my dining experience.While the ambiance was fantastic and the service was excellent, the food was a major letdown. I was expecting high-quality dishes that would live up to the restaurant's reputation, but instead, I was served food that was subpar for a top-rated establishment in the area.I tried several items from the menu and was underwhelmed by the flavors. The ingredients used were of good quality, but the dishes lacked that extra special touch that I was expecting. I was hoping for a memorable dining experience, but unfortunately, that was not the case.Overall, I was disappointed with my experience at this restaurant. While the ambiance and service were both excellent, the food simply did not live up to the hype. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a top-notch dining experience in the DC area.
Great service. Love the atmosphere. Everything was cooked beautifully. Loved the whole experience!

L'Ardente apparently is difficult to score a reservation for but thankfully when I signed up for notification for an opening I was able to get one. The atmosphere is very nice and as a tourist the area felt nice as well. The hostess staff were friendly which is always a plus. I forget who my server was but she was a bit awkward and hard to spot at certain times but was friendly so not a serious issue, just could have been better for a more upscale restaurant. We got a caesar salad, pepperoni pizza, lasagna, and the carbonara for two which was way too much food for two people (we knew that going into it). The caesar salad was good and the pepperoni pizza was thin crust and very oily but good. I wish we hadn't gotten the pizza only so we could enjoy the pastas more. The lasagna here is expensive but a must get and probably their best dish. It's much more decadent than a regular lasagna and has short rib and some red wine(?) tomato sauce which is insanely good. The carbonara was good but hard to eat because we were so full from the pizza.Is it the best italian food I have ever had? Probably not, but the lasagna is worth trying. It's a nice restaurant if that's what you're looking for but the service and overall atmosphere aren't nearly as nice as you would expect. If I were to come back to DC I don't think this would be a place I would return to but I did enjoy it.
Not bad. Recommended.I will come back to this restaurant next time................................................
L'Ardente has great options and a great vibe! I don't know if I would come again, but I definitely enjoyed my time:)

My friends and I visited Lardente for dinner, attracted by its inviting ambiance and stylish bar area. However, due to the crowdedness, we were seated in a less visually appealing back hall. We started with the fuchsia bread, which had excellent taste but required some effort to cut due to its thickness. The Arancini was a hit with its delightful flavors. As for the mains, the Cacio e Pepe stood out for its exceptional taste, while the 40-layer lasagna and pesto pasta lacked the desired temperature, impacting our enjoyment. For desserts, the Tiramisu FlambÃ© and Gianduja S'mores not only impressed in presentation but also in flavor. Moreover, the service was outstanding. The staff was sweet, attentive, and treated us really well. They also provided excellent suggestions on the menu and wine selection based on our preferences. Despite some minor setbacks, our overall experience at Lardente was enjoyable and deserving of recommendation.

I enjoyed my visit to this restaurant overall, thanks to the good food and clean restrooms. The dishes served here are flavorful and satisfying, making each bite a delight. However, the eating environment could be improved as it is quite noisy and the tables are a bit too close to each other, which might not suit those looking for a quieter dining experience. The service was okay--functional but lacking a bit of the attentiveness that can make a meal feel special.
Good food and good atmosphere. I've been twice for brunch and dinner and both were delicious. Easy to book a reservation.

The oldest restaurant and bar in DC!The place is a classic American spot, but it does not feel stuffy at all. The people are also pretty friendly, and the food is pretty solid as well!I came for brunch with my GF and we split an egg's benedict and a french toast. The eggs benedict was nothing special, but the French toast was great!
Rated 4.5 stars. Sampled the pappardelle

Don't normally leave reviews but Andrea Satilla tge manager was very very nice. . Had a long good convo with him . Walked in for lunch , Food was great! Manager def made us feel comfortable and gave us his card for future reservations.

Simply a fantastic meal! The food is very inventive with quality and fresh ingredients. The cocktails and wines were outstanding as well. The staff is very attentive and just an overall great dining experience.

Visited for lunch with acquaintances, reserved well in advance. Service is top notch and the chef dishes out compliments almost as well as he can dish out some seriously good Italian fare.Bit pricey but the food was delicious and the ambience is perfect for a dinner with friends or a date.
