Our first visit to L'Ardente was opening weekend. While we enjoyed the food and atmosphere, there seemed to still be a few kinks to get worked out. We recently revisited the restaurant this week and were pleasantly surprised by the enhanced menu. The duck hunt is a must try, as is the arancini. I found the lemon butter ravioli to be a bit too "lemony" but the rest of the meal was divine. The house pinot noir is also delicious. It's obvious that this restaurant has become the "place to be seen", as it was jam packed on a random Tuesday evening. Highly recommend stopping by for the wonderful service and delicious food.

I had a margherita pizza, caesar salad, short ribs, and pappardelle. Everything was delicious and frankly better than some of the other "authentic" Italian places I've tried. The pappardelle wasn't too heavy or too light. The short ribs was so saucy and rich. The pizza had a nicely charred crust. Service was delightful too.
Everything was delicious!  The service was excellent and made our anniversary meal memorable! The lasagna is amazing!

The lasagna was good, the duck hunt was great. The drinks were also OK but it was the manager on the clock that truly was the star of the night. Awesome customer service and communication! She ensured we were taken care of. Thanks Amber!
The food was amazing! Our server was really great and helpful. We told him it was our first time and he was amazing on telling us what we should try. I am definitely coming back!
I enjoyed dining here.The staff is very professional and knowledgeable of the menuBathrooms were clean.Food was delicious. The 40 layer lasagna is *chef kiss*

I had the pleasure of dining at this fantastic restaurant recently and I can't stop raving about it! The food, service, and ambiance were all absolutely top-notch, making for an unforgettable dining experience.The decor was inviting and stylish, creating a warm and welcoming vibe that made us feel right at home. Our server was friendly and attentive.We started off with the duck ravioli and fried cauliflower, both of which were bursting with flavor. The duck ravioli was tender and rich, while the crispy fried cauliflower was a delightful surprise. For our main course, we tried the Venetian risotto and the Caesar salad, and let me tell you, every bite was incredible. The risotto was creamy and perfectly cooked, while the salad was fresh and zesty, dressed to perfection.To accompany our meal, I indulged in three delicious sidecar cocktails that were expertly mixed--just the right amount of balance between sweet and tart. They complemented our meal wonderfully! We decided to end our dinner on a sweet note with the s'mores dessert, and let me just say, we cleared the plate once again. It was a delightful treat that perfectly wrapped up our meal.If you're looking for a place that checks all the boxes--fantastic food, exemplary service, and a lovely ambiance--you've got to pay a visit here. I can't wait to come back for more!

Everything about this restaurant was top-notch. We were immediately impressed with the appetizer options, so much so that we ended up making them our entire meal - each one was a delightful surprise!The highlight of the evening for me was the Duck Hunt dish - not only was it delicious, but the presentation was unlike anything I've seen before. And for the best visual appeal, the Tiramisu FlambÃ© stole the show. Watching it flame up at the table was as exciting as it was impressive.Even though the restaurant was packed, we still had a quiet, enjoyable conversation at our table, which really speaks to the restaurant's attention to atmosphere. It's clear they know how to manage a busy space while still keeping the guest experience at the forefront. Overall, it was an unforgettable dining experience, and I'm already looking forward to my next visit!

I recently had the pleasure of dining at L'Ardente with my girlfriend, and it was a wonderful experience. We were able to sit at the Chef's counter, which provided a nice glimpse into the culinary artistry and preparation of our meals.We started with cocktails, choosing the Fig Cobbler and the Arania Rossa Margarita. Both were delicious, perfectly complementing the vibrant atmosphere of the restaurant.For my main course, I indulged in their renowned 40 layer lasagna. Each layer was bursting with flavor and cooked to perfection.The ambiance at L'Ardente is wonderful, with a balance between chic and cozy, making it an ideal spot for a memorable dining experience. The service was also outstanding--timely, attentive, and genuinely warm, enhancing our overall enjoyment.I look forward to returning for their brunch and exploring more of what L'Ardente has to offer. Highly recommended for anyone seeking an exceptional dining experience in the area.Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

L'Ardente is nothing short of spectacular--this is the restaurant we desperately need in Los Angeles. If I could give it 10 stars, I absolutely would.First, let's talk about the service. Jasmine, our server at the bar, was phenomenal--kind, hospitable, and incredibly knowledgeable. She guided us through the menu with excellent recommendations. If you go, do yourself a favor and ask for Jasmine--she'll elevate your experience!Now, the food. O M G. Everything we ordered was a masterpiece. The Duck Hunt was not only creatively plated but also packed with unforgettable flavors--truly unlike anything I've ever had. The salad? Piled high, fresh, and perfect for sharing. And then there's the showstopper: their famous 40-Layer Lasagna. Pictures can't even begin to do it justice. Each layer was bursting with flavor--rich truffle, decadent short rib, and so much depth. It's a dish I need in my life every month!But the ultimate star for me was the Campanelle Nere. I don't typically go for seafood pasta, but this dish completely won me over. The lobster was tender and juicy, the pasta perfectly cooked, and the flavors were balanced to perfection. I'm still dreaming about it.This is a bucket-list restaurant worth every penny. Do yourself a favor and make a reservation--you won't regret it!

If you're looking for an unforgettable dining experience, L'Ardente is the place to be! From start to finish, every dish we tried was absolutely incredible. The layered shortrib lasagna is a masterpiece--rich, flavorful, and melt-in-your-mouth perfection.The appetizers and desserts were equally impressive
Fantastic service from Eric. Great personality. We have fun here. The place was cute, the bartender cuter.

Fantastic food, service, and ambiance. Our server Chris was absolutely amazing. We had the duck ravioli, fried cauliflower, Venetian risotto, Caesar salad and of course the 40 layer lasagna. Everything was insanely delicious to the extent there was nothing left on our plates! I enjoyed 3 sidecar cocktails that were all perfect and we ended dinner with the smores which was another cleaned plate at the end. Highly recommend!
Hello everyone, delicious food, good service, great ambiance, recommended, thank you!!

L'Ardente has such a great vibe! Cozy spot with a trendy atmosphere. The pasta here is absolutely amazing--full of rich flavor and cooked perfectly. Ideal for a chill date night or just treating yourself to some top-notch Italian food.

The entire experience was exceptional. This was my first time visiting the restaurant, and I was thoroughly satisfied. Our server, Harry, provided wonderful service - he deserves a shout-out! The food was fresh, hot, and bursting with flavor. The lasagna was absolutely delicious, and the spaghetti was also great. To start, we ordered the meatball appetizer, which paired nicely. We also enjoyed the Margherita pizza - everything was incredibly good. The cocktails were equally impressive, with the Old Fashioned being smooth and the Lemon Drop perfectly made. For dessert, the tiramisu was a delight. There were no complaints whatsoever. Harry truly made our first visit amazing, and we can't wait to return.

We had the most amazing cocktails - the Fig Cobbler and an Amaretto Sour were absolute hits. We also tried the Focaccia with the Tomato Tapenade, the 40 Layer Lasagna, and the Pomodoro, and everything was delicious. I just wish they had more options for vegans. The server was fantastic, and the food runners were really helpful. This spot is definitely a must-visit while in DC.

Historic restaurant with great seafood. Favorite part was walking around to see all the memorabilia that has been preserved here. Be sure to read up about the history of the place before you go or while you're waiting for your food.Oysters Rockerfeller were delicious. Done right. Would get these every time I come.The salmon needed something more. The carrot ginger puree was superb but I found myself always eating the salmon with it to flavor up the fish.Service was great.
I am glad I can give you five stars. Fast response time. Everything was done well at a reasonable price.

Had a great weekday date night at this place! Ambiance was upscale but still chill enough to be in a t shirt and jeans. Parking is limited, you'll most likely have to park in a garage. The food was amazing! Everything was cooked to perfection, the pizza and lasagna are a must try. Unique dessert options, also a must try. Look forward to my next visit.
Delicious high quality plates, selection of dishes and great service. The place is beautiful and staff are super friendly and the food is delicious.
Delicious food, waiters are very attentive, and super nice atmosphere. Plus it's all at an affordable price.Can totally recommend it and will definitely come back again
The food does not disappoint! We were treated very well for our third time here and we hope to be back soon.

Attended a Galentine's Dinner with friends and found the ambiance delightful. The attentive waitress and staff worked together seamlessly to ensure a pleasant experience. Though my Cacio e Pepe entree was delicious, I wished for the option to add a protein directly. Instead, I had to order a separate protein entree (shrimp) to accompany the pasta. The Glam Spritz drink perfectly matched my preferences--not overpowering with alcohol but sufficiently invigorating. The smores dessert was exquisite, with rich chocolate, though I would have appreciated the addition of ice cream. Overall, a flawless 10/10 experience.

Now this is how you do it! Food, service, atmosphere, everything was excellent.The waiters were so friendly and nice - excellent service and beyond amazing dishes. The atmosphere is cozy and warm especially on a cold Washington evening. Truly an authentic experience and a magnificent meal for a loner.

Indulged in Arancini, Bucatini Alla Carbonara, Cacio E Pepe, Layer Lasagna, Short Rib Lasagna, and White Ragu Pappardelle.An outstanding dining experience, rated 10/10. Undoubtedly one of the finest in DC, with impeccable service.The ambiance is truly delightful.
Amazing place and everybody is so nice and kind. I will for sure be returning to this beautiful place.
Great service, beautiful atmosphere and food was great! I stopped in for a quick bite and hope to visit again soon for a full meal with cocktails.

L'Ardente is consistently one of my favorite restaurants to visit. I am a regular patron, enjoying their delicious dishes at least three times a month. My go-to dish is the branzino, which is elevated by the complementary lemon sauce when dining in. The 40 layer lasagna is a standout, with rich flavors. The veal portion is large and best shared with a friend. Surprisingly, the cesare salad is a must-try. The drinks are always expertly crafted, with St. Clair's espresso martini being a standout. I have never experienced anything less than exceptional service during my visits. Whether I'm enjoying brunch or dining in the evening, the ambiance is always on point. L'Ardente has earned a solid 5-star rating from me every time I've dined in or ordered takeout. I even celebrated my birthday here earlier this year, and it was a memorable experience.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at L'Ardente and I can confidently say it was a culinary experience like no other. From the moment I walked in, I was captivated by the warm and inviting ambiance, setting the stage for an unforgettable evening! APP - Duck Ravoli. This is the best little bite you'll ever have. The dish comes prepared in 4 bite sized servings. The creamy truffle sauce melts in your mouth. I wish they made this as a main entree because it's just that good.  MAIN - 40 layer lasagne. This plate left me in awe. The combination of ingredients and the expert preparation showcased the chef's culinary art. The sauce is perfectly balanced with the beef ragu that is just so tender. Easily some of the best lasagne you'll have.  DESSERT - Cheescake (not pictured). The riscotta cheesecake with berry finish and almond crumbs was the perfect blend of sweet and tarty to end the night. The service here is impeccable. The staff was attentive without being intrusive, and their knowledge of the menu and wine pairings was impressive. They guided me through the selections, enhancing the overall dining experience.Highly recommend a visit for a date night or special occasion dinner

Absolutely phenomenal, the linguini frutti de mare had a type of Cuban/Caribbean sofrito tomato base with lite kick of spice that paired perfectly with a amber lager. The octopus was smoked infused with a rich wood smoke and tender and soft to the bite. And a raspberry cheesecake with brown sugar brittle. It's a fantastic spot, I'll definitely return back.
Love the ambiance at the place a little fast paced but the food is amazing! Our server was so nice and gave plenty tips. Lasagna was my favorite!

Really great service and delicious food. The lasgna lives up to the hype. Also got the duck appetizer and it was decadent, delicious. Great place for a special occasion. Personally for ambiance I like a more intimate vibe but I think overall they did a great job with the space.

Made late reservations on a Monday for my birthday. They got us at an amazing table. The service was exceptional, food absolutely moresome. Wine list was fun, and as a somm it was nice to try new things. We will be back.

EXCELLENT EXCELLENT EXCELLENT!L'Ardente is an Excellent Amazing Restaurant here in DC and you should Never Miss this Place . The Ambiance, Service, and the Quality of Food they serve is Fantastic. They have a fantastic bar, just tell them what you like and what you feel and they'll serve you awesome drinks.Great Experience and Highly recommend Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 5/5

This is very nice fancy restaurant. Me and my girlfriend went there to celebrate birthday together, unfortunately there was no server came to our table for more than 30 minutes after we sit down. We were trying to get their attention, but no body seemed to care until this amazing server came to our table and rescued the whole team. The food was fire and our server was great! It wasn't his fault to greet us so late because it seemed like we weren't even in his section but anyway I ended up tip him 40% out off our check for giving us a great service.
Every dish was amazing from start to finish. Dishes are small. Get a pizza for the table!

I recently celebrated my birthday at an extraordinary restaurant that left me truly impressed. From the moment I stepped inside, I knew I was in for a remarkable dining experience. The atmosphere was elegant yet warm, with soft lighting and tasteful decor that created an inviting ambiance.The service was exceptional right from the start. The staff greeted us with genuine smiles and guided us to our table with a level of attentiveness that made us feel like VIP guests. Throughout the evening, our server was knowledgeable, friendly, and ensured that every detail was taken care of.Now, let's talk about the food. Oh, what an absolute delight it was! The menu boasted a wide range of culinary treasures that catered to diverse palates. Each dish was meticulously crafted with fresh, high-quality ingredients that showcased the chef's culinary expertise. The flavors were simply divine, and every bite was a true delight to the senses.
The food was amazing it was so delicious. Rachael, our waitress was so nice she was amazing.
Absolutely one of the best restaurants in town. Food is amazing!! The service was great, very attentive. It's a great experience all around.
location: Roma Norte, Ciudad de MÃ©xico, Mexico

text: Great atmosphere. I love the food and drinks. Will definitely come again. Service was great and food came out warm and ready.
OMG! The food here was AMAZING! I enjoyed everything I ordered and I look forward going back.

L'Ardente is truly a DC gem! Food is out of this world! Highly highly recommend this restaurant. The Pappardelle and the 40 layer lasagna were my absolute favorite! We were so tempted to order seconds! Carbonara was amazing as well! Everything was perfect! Service was really good too! Highly recommend! Make reservations in advance!
Everything was so good. The services and the taste of food made from scratch are fantastic.
Amazing ! Best food ever! Awesome ambience. Will be back weekly. The pork chop was outstanding. Beef stroganoff was amazing.

The arachini, meatballs, Cesar salad, pasta, and lasagna were packed with bold and familiar flavors. Our waiter was fun, but didn't know some of the pasta dishes so he couldn't offer specific recommendations (not an issue as he shared what most people liked!). The most memorable dish was the lasagna because of the braised short rib flavors and copious amount of Parmesan.
One work:                                Outstanding!

First of all, our server was phenomenal! I definitely recommend visiting her when visiting the restaurant. The food was fantastic, I really liked the cream sauce. The atmosphere overall was great, 10/10, I would go here again.
Excellent service and food. Delicious! Service is Amazing! Overall pricey but that is the neighborhood. DEFINITELY TRY THIS PLACE! You will leave stuffed and very content.
Everything was excellent, from the ambiance to the food and the service. Will definitely go again!
Atmosphere is great, service is amazing and the food is delicious. Definitely one of favorite restaurants!!!
Love this restaurant... Our favorite in DC!
Amazing! I am definitely going. It was such a great experience. I would definitely recommend that people try it!
Very fresh and flavorful. Great ambiance. Will be back. Had 3 dishes that were all tasty.
The food here is absolutely amazing. I ordered the branzino and it was the best I'd ever had! Can't wait to come back!!!

Best pasta and pizza and some really cool out of the box dishes to try. Especially the risotto with squid topped with king crab such a cool twist. And of course the lasagna is worth the hype. Also the bread pudding with panettone so delicious what a memorable meal.

Where to begin everything was so fabulous and so delicious. I started with the eggplant and I love dates such a cool twist. Then for the best dish of the night the lobster pasta it was so flavorful and beautiful. And as always saved room for some of the best dessert I've had in my life a creme brÃ»lÃ©e rice pudding and vanilla soft serve which was like none I have had before. I can't wait to come back.
Everything was wonderful, from the meal to the service to the atmosphere. Highly recommend!
Love the decor and the food was phenomenal. Don't skip the apps and make sure to try more than one pasta they are all great.

Disappointing! Food is okay but the service was terrible, maybe it's understandable given that it's a busy restaurant. May go there to sit by their bar but never to the restaurant.
Absolutely terrible service. Managed as if ownership has embraced the fact that this is now a tourist trap.

So my friend had a big group. It was her birthday. She had about 22 guest. Most of us came at one time. As usual, people are late. She arrived before everyone though. We were seated but, she expected what they said they would deliver. One long table. Instead they delivered a table for maybe 15. Then a big circular table. They one gave us one waitress. One!!!!!! As you can see , she got highly overwhelmed. Then she became rude and annoyed by our questions. She forgot food orders, drinks, and utensils. Now that was my observation with the party, meanwhile she was very nice to me! I spoke clear and courteously to her. My drink was perfect and so was my dish! I understand how it feels to be on the other side of the table. So despite how she treated my friends, i still gave her the respect she deserved as a human being .

i would not recommend. extremely touristy. food is industrial level and not high quality at all. would highly recommend you stay away.

It was the only place open. The food was so unsatisfying. I will not be returning.

5-1-15: I wanted to grab a drink before our Whitehouse tour. It was about 10am and the bartender was stocking. I told him that I would like something of a Bloody Mary or Michelada. He immediately told me, "I am not a west coast gangster with tattoos..I don't make those." I was in absolute shock. I got up and left. He still tried to come at me with words as though to try to prove his point but he simply kept digging his hole deeper with me. I spoke to a young lady which was the manager and when I told her of his unnecessary and bigot remarks, her jaw dropped. She profusely apologized and offered to have us be seated at a neighboring bar. I expressed how discontent and offended I was to have traveled to that city and be shunted in this manner. It was appalling. I simply wanted her to be aware that she is employing a bigot at her establishment and he is a reflection of the business. While she was talking with me, my husband passed the bar and heard the bartender speaking with another employee. He heard him say, "I don't need this shit right now!". He should have chosen his words more wisely. Why spend my money there when there are so many other beautiful, historical locations that represent the town and culture nicely. Come to Cali, West Coast will treat you with respect!

Unreasonably long wait even with reservation! Waited for 25mins with reservation and 45mins just for our first dish! Poor service in front desk.

It was my first time in Washington, D.C. And I called few hours ahead and made a reservation for 8 people. When I got there, they didn't have my name in the computer and they told me to wait a hour and a half for a table that I hard reserved for hours ahead. The workers were rude and they said there's nothing they can do, so I ended up leaving
A tourist trap, just go to Clyde's it's not worth it.

Overpriced for cafeteria quality food! Fettucine diavlo was dry dry dry, fettucine was lumped together. The small $26 crab cake was dry! The location and interior definitely deserves its high rating, but their quality of food can be probably found somewhere else for half the price. Most likely will not be going back.
Way too busy. Way too overated...

Old Ebbitt....I did not like the food and I will not return.
Waited one hour and a half to be seated. Food was bad, service was bad.The food and service was not worth the wait.
Pretty but the food is very expensive and wasn't that special.
First time visiting. I ordered the crab cakes... it was ok, I ordered wings well done... WELL DONE I like them hard, they weren't. The waitress was nice though

I don't know if they were having a bad day or if the service and food has just degenerated over the past year. Last year we went and both the food and service was stupendously fun and delicious. Yesterday, a party of six, we saw everyone around us getting served, but we waited nearly 45 minutes. Several times servers came by with large numbers of plates and tried to lay the wrong food down on the table. When we said no that's not ours, they just started turning in circles looking for the correct table. Then they walked off. I'm not sure if they ever found the correct tables. In the meantime when our food did come, 45 minutes later, it was tepid, the fish, trout, was not fresh. It tasted bland and oddly textured the way frozen fish often tastes. The salad greens were on the way towards being brown at the edges.  Our friends Eggs Benedict dish was cool and the eggs and sauce had congealed. If we had not been with a large group and on a schedule I would have sent it back and told me to bring a hamburger, because it is really hard to screw up a hamburger. I am really sorry to say this and I hope it was just one bad day, but it did put me off badly.

I've been many times, it's always only "ok"and it's really over priced for what it is (with the exception of the happy hr raw bar). Last time I went was for breakfast...I've never spent so much on such a mediocre breakfast.

While the wait wasn't too long, the service was really unacceptable. Our server was less than friendly and it took more than 45 minutes for our cold food to be delivered to the table. When it did arrive, it was not as delicious as I was expecting. While they did offer complementary dessert to make up for it, my overall visit was less than satisfactory. Its not old at all!
Mmm..not my type of place. A bit stuffy and the food was a bit greasy for my liking.

The food was good not too bad, but the waitress look like she does not want to be there, her services was not good
It is okay for a quick bite and a late snack. Nothing special.

Came here once and was extremely disappointed. I had high expectations after all I've heard about this being one of the finest dining experiences in DC and all about how this place is like a culinary institution. We ordered the Orca platter, which easily serves 4 people. The oysters had a subtle taste and were decent at best, the shrimp and lobster were bland tasting even with all the lemon and sauce and the clams were nothing above average either. Maybe we came on a bad day or maybe people are just too drunk to actually taste the food when they come here. Either way it was a below average experience and I seriously doubt I will be coming back to this "institution".
I just came here for dessert and had the key lime pie. It was just ok.

Ok so here goes : This place is as commercial as it gets. They have a ton of locations and all of the look the same, serve the same menu and run the same. Where is the spice? Think local people. Think outside the box to a family run business that doesnt have the millions to spend on marketing. Still though, the food is good, service is neat and the place is clean.

Found this place from all the great reviews, so I made reservations 3 days in advance. We went in expecting to wonderful things from the reviews. Started off with drinks and appetizers. Cocktails were so-so, the Bloody Mary tasted like watered down tomato paste. Next came the entrees, the "famous" crab cake & the Parmesan trout...the Parmesan trout was horrible & oily. The crab cake was nothing special. To top it off the service was bad. Overall, we were disappointed & feeling kinda nauseous after leaving.

Okay, so perhaps I just had an unusual experience because this place is a landmark in DC and most people rave about it. The service was just okay. Our waitress just seemed like she would rather be anywhere but working. She wasn't rude, but just made us feel like we were an inconvenience. The crab dip has decent flavor. The oysters were very good (best part of the meal). Two of us had the parmesan crusted trout. Both pieces were heavily battered which overwhelmed the taste of the fish. The green beans were very good. The salmon was cooked perfectly, but the lettuce in the salad was not fresh. The cocktails were okay - pretty watered down...but tasted okay. I probably would come back with the hopes my experience would be better.
service sucked but oyster's were good
Tourist trap. Mediocre food. Don't bother.
The service was horrible. And food was okay. There are better place to go in DC.

I really wanted to like this place. I had heard so many good things and read so many nice reviews... Unfortunately it did not meet my expectations. Maybe my expectations were too high or maybe I just chose the wrong day or the wrong food. The truth is I did not enjoy dinner here, very average food and extremely crowded, your elbows almost touch the elbows of the people on the table next to yours. Our waiter was really nice though and even though he tried his best with his suggestions, we just did not enjoy it.
Meh Meh Meh Meh, but good drinks.
This is just any other Clydes. Blah food, at best.
It's about average but the price is only justified by its location.
Get to the Raw Bar before the tourists. Then flee.
Food and experience you can get anywhere
Old seafood is no bueno. But cheap during happy hour!

This review is for brunch only as my boyfriend and I are frequent visitors during the late night oyster happy hour. Johnny always takes care of us, the seafood is always fresh and everything else what you would expect from a Clyde's-owned establishment.Went in for brunch on a Saturday afternoon and right away were greeted by throngs of people at the door. It's the Ebbitt--pretty standard situation so we headed straight for the front bar. Immediately you could tell that their computers were down as you could see the manual credit card machines out and handwritten check on the bar. As a former server/bartender--this sucks. Still, the service was good and the bartenders and guests kept their cool.The two stars is for the food. We ordered the muffin sampler and it was just, eh. Six little muffins on the plate with some preserves thrown in the middle. Not awful but just not really good. Seemed like they came straight out of the microwave. For $6.95 I don't know what I expected.We both got the Eggs Chesapeake and both of us had eggs that were almost hard boiled. The crabcake was lukewarm and the hollandaise was almost non-existent. The potato gratin was again, eh. My potatoes seemed cooked, his didn't.With all of that being written, we won't stop going to the Ebbitt. We just won't go at brunch.
The food here is not bad, but the wait was ridiculously long, waiting over an hour when they said 45 min to an hour, and the wait staff isn't all that attentive.

Delicious Food, but Service Could Be BetterThe food here was incredible! Every dish we tried was flavorful and perfectly prepared. The oysters were especially fresh and absolutely worth trying. It's clear why this place is so popular for its menu.That said, the service was a bit of a letdown. When we asked to move to a different table, the server seemed a little annoyed, and their attitude felt less friendly afterward. While nothing overtly bad happened, there was an undercurrent of unfriendliness that made the experience less enjoyable.If you're going for the food, you won't be disappointed. Hopefully, the service improves to match the amazing quality of the dishes.
I am not sure why this restaurant is a big deal. The food is mediocre and the service is slow.

DC's main American place. The history is a great asset. The food is not bad. I feel that they can enhance on the ambiance and the style... too American diner style. The service was slow since they have a lot of people..

For a District restaurant, it's a little overhyped. I mean, to be honest, I actually thought that it was pretty cool how I dined in the oldest oyster bar in this great, big historic city, but the food I had was mostly creamy and somewhat ...More
Food is good and server is nice but a bit pricy thoAtmosphere is different but nice. I was there with 5 other people and none of us say they would go back

I'm going to start off by admitting my fault. I found the popularity of this place to be a bit astounding, so perhaps I over-hyped it in my head which ultimately led to its demise. By no means was this a poor choice for the situation. The energy was great and the hospitality of the host and waiter was excellent. The food on the other hand was just ok: I had the skirt steak (or something along those lines) and my friend had the duck. The steak was slightly tough even though I had asked for it medium rare, and the duck wasn't anything to write about (get it?)If you're looking for a fun place for a group, I would happily recommend this place, but if you're aiming for a menu that will dazzle your taste buds, I have a few other places I would rather suggest.

Normally, I research the restaurants before I visit them but this time I didn't have time to do so. I had no clue that there was a dress code at this spot so the first time I came I wasn't able to dine in. I ended up taking out the food and the food was great. I just wish they would've been clearer on the website.
OK food. The service was a bit slow but nice waiters.
Food was ok, your here for the atmosphere. It gets crowded so be ready to wait a while.

So crowded. Food was ok. Met a friend after work and we could barely hear each other. Got one drink at the bar, she got a burger that looked dry, then we left. Not sure I'll be back but service was ok considering how crazy packed it was. Plus it's a DC classic so I had to go at least once.
Was pretty okay , I didn't like how they fried their calamari but other than that everything else was pretty good !
Very crowded for brunch and the food was subpar. Not accessible friendly.

The food was very good but, the portions were too small. With the price we would have expected more food to make it worth our while. While we enjoyed our meal, we left hungry since the food wasn't super filling due to the portion size.
Meh:Boring, stale and touristy
Pretty decent food! always have good service when i go here
Pretty basic place with basic food. The drinks are ok
Patronage is b/c of the name alone, but the food is ok.

I always have a perfectly enjoyable meal here. However, I find the dark atmosphere a little overwhelming and the place is often packed - a great sign for their business, but left me feeling a little cramped. I think it's a much better bet for oyster lovers, who all rave about them.

I've heard so much about Old Ebbitt. When I first arrived in the area and asked for recommendations, I received a lot of direction to visit this place. When I arrived, I was told that one of their signature dishes was the crab cake, so obviously I ordered it. Really not up to par with what the ambiance and hype would suggest. Would I return? Sure, if someone REALLY wanted to go back, I would certainly give it another try. However, I don't think that I will be back on my own accord.
its good place and good location.
Food great, but the service was horribly lacking. Our server was rude and clearly didn't care about her job, the food or her customers. Not the first time of having poor service
hmm location is pretty good, but taste...okneed to make appointment

Obviously this place is where everyone says to go when in DC. It is historic and the interior is beautiful, but the food is just mediocre. Our server was polite but very robotic. You definitely get the feel that you are dining at a chain restaurant, higher end chain at that. I will definitely return and give it a try again.

It's got a good location, but the food is only ok. OEG has been there for decades - I ate there as a child, but the food has remained about the same. Meh. Venture out somewhere else - try Teaism. This place is decent for large groups, though.
Food was average. Seating was nice.
This is a DC mainstay with a very nice atmosphere but has gone down hill with the food. It use to be an old favorite of mine, but now it is more run of the mill. They need to redo the menu.
what's all the fuss? I really thought this was mediocre food.

I have been here twice and the first time I was unimpressed, actually disappointed, given all of the hype. I went with my boyfriend for his birthday and another friend. Service was find but we all agreed the food was sub par. The meatloaf was very dry and the steak I ordered was way over cooked. The second time I went was about a year later and I sat at the bar and had appetizers. They were very tasty, which was a terrific surprise. The seafood tasted fresh and the mussels were done just right. The atmosphere at the bar was lively and entertaining and I was happy to have tried the place again.
Decent food, cramped atmosphere.
Great food but I had a rude server. I wouldn't go back..

Location and history are spot on. The service and decor are top notch. The food is good not great. The lobster was our dish and it was OK. Our favorite dishes were appetizers. Check out the art work. Worth going at least once.

I didn't think the food was spectacular and it was a bit over priced. My sister ordered a salad but it's something I could have made at home with better dressing for half the price. The hummus was probably the best item. My friend from Atlanta wasn't impressed by the ribs but it was a pretty environment and close to monuments so it worked out. The service was good too.

We enjoyed our lunch and the service was average. The restaurant was booming with the lunch crowd . We enjoyed our salads and the location. The management was pleasant and stopped by our table to refill water glasses .
Went here with the GF's family. Was just ok. over hyped.
One of the oldest restaurants in DC.  Had a burger. Ok. Busy restaurant with good service.
Food/Appetizers were bland..
It's cool. That's all I can say about that.
Good happy hour pricing - oyster specials! Otherwise, uninspiring menu and average execution.
I order a Burger but it was nothing special, fries were very good! The crab cakes were the best I've tried, one of their specialities!Service was excellent, they treat us very good
Location is great and food is good.
Service is very, very slow. Food is meh.
Eh... basic, typical, common dc restaurant.

We decided to check this place out because we heard it was one of the oldest restaurants in DC. The filet mignon was delicious. The waiter was very helpful by recommending his favorite wine. My boyfriend ordered Salmon, but it was very dry. I didn't like the fact that the tables are so close to each other. I'm a very social person, but it felt weird having the party sitting next to me jump into our conversation because he could hear everything we were talking about. If you visit, ask for a booth. They seemed more private.
Basic tourist restaurant. There's hundreds of better restaurants to eat at in DC!
Just okay, would not recommend for breakfast. Nothing special but over priced.
Pretty cool
It was ok. Not much more to say than that! The oysters and the shrimp looks amazing but was just ok. the dessert was the only highlight. Service was very good but consistent with what I'm used to.
Good food

Be prepared to make a reservation to eat at Old Ebbitt Grill. The place is amazing and the food is great, but if you plan on just showing up and asking for a table, you will be sorely disappointed. If you like appetizer dips, you will love their crab and artichoke dip!
It is good - no complaints.
Fun place for happy hour after work.

This restaurant is a DC classic that does a nice job turning tables & providing good food. It's very popular with tourists, but still draws plenty of locals.It's owned by the same folks that own the Hamilton & Clyde's, and the menus & food are very similar -- if a bit boring.
Fun atmosphere. Decent food. Nothing that wowed me about the food.
It's the same food as Clyde's and the Tombs. And touristy.
Very good DC restaurant and establishment!
LOve this place
Great for the fams when they come to town!!
Happy hours with half off seafood is definitely a plus.

This place as lots of tourist, but the food is solid, the service is okay and the location is great. This place has character, too, and you can't beat that. The atmosphere was not to loud overall a ok place to eat.
A timeless classic.
Crowded and meh.
Oysters were amazing!
Always a big fan of the oysters and mignonette sauce. The bar and its character is right out of an old detective-novel. Always a treat to check out one of Washingtons oldest restaurants!!
Went on my first anniversary 3 years back. A decent place with nothing to rave about but still good.

They've branded everyone to the point that they'd probably survive even if they served dog food. And for good reason, what they've done with the decor, the waiters and their outrageous red bow ties and shirts, the extensive history, and all the rest is above and beyond. It works.Unfortunately I hate getting milked. I can either eat their crab cakes on a regular basis or put my kids through school. If the check is blowing me away the food better do the same, and it never has.
Good, the servers seemed nice enough. Nothing super exciting on the menu. Not a foodie find.
Will please everyone, won't blow anyone away.
Nice ambiance, good service, food is ok
Food just okay, but the atmosphere was cool.
used to be better but lately just ok.
Pretty solid bar atmosphere and burgers . Fun to sit and people watch.
Amazing calamari, mahi mahi and very good deals in happy hour. So why three stars? Bathrooms were hidious...

I have heard about this place for so long so at last we decided to go and check it out. Just cross the street from white house and with a history of over a century, where a lot of presidents have dinned. So after an extremely ridiculous wait time we were able to get a table. The Waitress was awesome and very nice. But the food was not good at all. Nothing was good from the butter and bread that you have to ask otherwise would not be provided, to the main dish and appetizer. Poor food quality. I expected much much more!
It is just okay will meet some friends there for special occations for drinks

The location of this place is just cross the street from white house. I have heard a lot about this place. We decided to try it. After a 2 hour waiting period we were at last seated. The waitress was wonderful. But the quality of the food was just average if not below average. I think that was our first and last visit to this place.
Nice lunch 11-21-12
decent food, perfect atmosphere, and a very, very slow service.
Ok. It is just Ok.Except the grits. Those are AWFUL.
good food and ok-service. I do enjoy their lunch menu

DC institution. Maybe I'm being too harsh with 3 stars. I would say the food is never bad, nevermind blowing. The consistency is solid. Oysters and wings are always rock solid as is the service. i feel like I'm talking myself into 4 stars as the this comes out but the constant crowds and relatively high prices for the previously mentioned things are holding me back. The TV situation is also struggling. Not the strongest place to watch a game. Don't be discouraged by a mob scene in the foyer. Fight your way back to the oyster bar or sidebar to the left for your best chance at sitting immediately.
Traditional brasserie....definitely where DC deals get done.
Crab cakes get an 8 out of 10, jambalaya gets only a 5
Old DC establishment. Good food. Very crowded
very crowded not a long wait and the food was good!
Very crowded, the waiter was good the food above average, my husband liked his food better than I liked mine. We will be back
Decent oysters, okay steak.
Quality food and service. Thumbs up!
New in town, place was okay. The mojito was not very tasty, but would go back for seafood.

I have be n to DC several times, and never been to Old Ebbitt until this week. What a surprise, The interior of this place is incredible. We went through the most charming main dining room to the atrium which gives the feel of being in outdoors (since it was about 15 degrees I am glad we were inside).  The waitstaff was attentive and answered all our questions without hesitation. The food as not the best, but not the worst either. The chili had an a lot of meat and cheese. If you are watching calories, don't order this. My Chicken Salad was ordinary. I would return knowing what to expect.
Good family brunch place
Came here for lunch on a Saturday. Very busy. Got a seat at the bar and had drinks and a light lunch. Would suggest making a reservation.

It was such a cool spot to grab a meal. We really dug the decor and the art. The food was awesome and all the dishes were just super tasty. Plus, the oysters and steak were amazing.The staffs are friendly and will accommodate you well.We enjoyed our dining experience.We'll surely visit there again.

Old Ebbitt Grill offers a dining experience that shouldn't be missed. The oysters are an absolute must--be sure to get the full package deal for a truly indulgent treat. The servers exemplify class, constantly checking in to ensure your dining experience is perfect.The restaurant is adorned with great artwork, creating amazing vibes that make for a classy night out. While the steak and frites could be improved, they were still a delightful part of the meal.Overall, Old Ebbitt Grill provides a sophisticated and enjoyable atmosphere, making it a top choice for a memorable dining experience.

All wonderful. Even though it is a huge tourist draw, it is still a welcome destination for locals.Reservations help a lot but you can always eat at the bar andMeet enthusiastic patrons from near and far. Every item on the menu is well curated and either a 4 or five stars

he oyster options are awesome. The rest of the menu is decent but not incredibly notable. The waitstaff is very friendly. I wish the atmosphere was somewhat quieter OR that the table were spread a tiny bit more to allow easier conversation.

Our dining experience today ranged between a 4 and 5-star rating. Without a doubt, the food was deserving of a solid 5-star rating. The clam chowder, oyster, Nashville sandwich, and eggs Benedict were all incredibly delicious. The venue itself is stunning. However, the bathroom appears outdated and is located downstairs. While I was heading down, I noticed a gentleman struggling to navigate the stairs, likely due to an injury.We opted for black coffee, and although the initial serving was good, I finished it within 2 minutes. While various staff members passed by, attending to other tables and refilling water as needed, no one offered to replenish our coffee. After waiting for about 20 minutes and searching for our waiter for an additional 10 minutes, we decided to leave and find coffee elsewhere. Despite the minor inconveniences, the overall experience was almost perfect, but these few issues led us to rate it a 4-star instead of a 5-star.
I love the food. The service is always great. Great location and great ambiance.
Can be very busy because they're open late night. But the food was really good and reasonably priced. I got the steak and fries which were very good!
he atmosphere is great, the food is delicious, and the staff is friendly. However, the price was a bit expensive. But overall it was good. It's a restaurant I want to visit again.

We had dinner at Old Ebbitt a few nights ago. The food was very good but I was expecting more portions for the price. My steak was cooked really good and the bread is soft and flavourful. Our waiter Sam was excellent and it is always a lot of good energy in there. It was my third time there and I will go back, but for lunch next time and hopefully not as crowded. I highly recommend Old Ebbitt for a fancy ocassion.
Had a great company event here, drinks and service were phenomenal !

Very good restaurant to eat late at night, the kitchen stays open until 12. Excellent food and service, very elegant setting. DC Guided Tours will drop you off at this restaurant at the end of the night tour if you want to eat a wonderful late dinner!
At a block away from the White House, the Willard Hotel, the Ronald Reagan Center for International Trade and Metro Center, this is a great place to feast on a T-Bone steak dinner.
Great spot for work meetings to nice dinner out with parents. Food is delicious but a little pricey. Great for touring around after dinner!
Food is great and so is the ambience. Had a great time - our waiter was very attentive

A must visit place in DC for its history and relevance to the DC federal government scene. A lot of power brokers hang out here and you can have a "celebrity" sighting on a semi regular basis. That said, the food is ok. Nothing extraordinary but not bad at all.
Good brunch and atmosphere. Long wait but we had no reservations will definitely be back
Very good! The service good and food even better.
Always a rec when I come into DC!

You can find some of these American pub houses going around in the area, and everyone has a different style. Food and drinks are everywhere good, the location of this one is easy to find. Liked the vibe of the place. This place is almost full on weekdays as well. I tried 2 types of sangria, the pear one, and the bourbon peach sangria. Both were good but really thick and sweet.

DC classic - have been coming here for years! Even though downtown is nowhere near as busy as it used to be, Old Ebbit still draws a good crowd and for good reason. Friendly staff, great food, fun atmosphere.
