The architecture is very nice especially for the price of the food. One of the best restrooms I've ever seen.
location: University of Texas at Austin, Austin, TX

text: yum, burgers are good! Will come again

We stopped in for Steaks the other night and it did not disappoint. The steak was cooked perfectly. We also indulged in the Calamari which came with savory Jalapenos. It is fairly priced for an upscale Steak House. The only flub was the server brought us out the wrong appetizer, but that won't stop me from returning.

As a regular already to this place, I had the best experience the other day, so I just had to share. They know me by name and face, already have my drink waiting when I walk in. On this occasion the kitchen was closing early, but despite that, they ended up accommodating myself and cooking me my favorite dish. They went above and beyond.

Came here for a girl's night and we had the best time. Our waiter recommended some amazing drinks. We ended up asking him what his favorite dishes were and let him choose for us - which was the right choice. The food ended up being so unique in taste. Combinations I've never had before. It was amazing, everything about this place is This place is in walking distance of my place. I come here once a week. The food is always fresh and made to order. I have never not had something that wasn't delicious on the menu. The drinks are strong but delicious. If you want somewhere reliable and consistent, this is the place to be.

Their food was very good. I ordered salmon with lentils. The salmon itself was very delicious and almost one of the best salmon I have ever tried. But it was on top of the lentils and spinach, which was very sweet. I believe they add a lot of Onion and carrots into the lentils, that's why it was very sweet. If it was just the salmon along with something else, I would have give them 5 stars. My girlfriend ordered buffalo chicken, which was a hit. Anyway, I think you should try. The Caesar salad was very well .I really recommend this place.

Old ebbit is pretty consistent each time you go. But like a lot of bars I feel they charge way too high for their draught beer. I use to own and purchase keg beer and I'm sure they are getting a better deal then I got, so I can only guess how much they make off of a glass!!! I'm sure it's a lot!
Out with friends for this old staple. Customer service great, atmosphere wonderfully stodgy, and a mediocre burger
I love the service , its great! Crab and artichoke dip was delicious.

"NORM!" That's what I assume to hear whenever I'm in here. Old Ebbitt is a DC staple. Old wood, dark ambiance, crisp white desk cloths, energy meetings, cunning cocktails and first dates. Old Ebbitt is everything.Don't inquire from me what to eat, the menu is a standard, conventional one - steak, fish, pasta cannot go wrong with something at the menu.Visit for the tradition. Visit for the drinks (they have more than one bar). Visit for the bartenders who're a fount of vicinity knowledge. Visit due to the fact it's throughout or down the street from numerous DC landmarks (White House anyone?). Just visit. You may not be disappointed.

"NORM!" That's what I anticipate to hear every time I'm in here. Old Ebbitt is a DC staple. Old wood, dark ambiance, crisp white table cloths, electricity meetings, cunning cocktails and primary dates. Old Ebbitt is everything.Don't ask me what to eat, the menu is a standard, traditional one - steak, fish, pasta can not go wrong with whatever at the menu.Visit for the tradition. Visit for the drinks (they have more than one bar). Visit for the bartenders who are a fount of area knowledge. Visit due to the fact it is across or down the street from numerous DC landmarks (White House anyone?). Just visit. You won't be disappointed.

One of my favorite. Restaurants in the District. Very fascinating and very good prices never gets too expensive.  One of the only restaurants in the district that stays open till 2 AM through the weekdays
This place is pretty cool and right near all the museums which is pretty cool. I really like their soups and salads, They have several floors and you might see well know politicians in there
One of my favorite restaurants for brunch!!!
Great place for a late night meal .i am from out of town but when I am in dc this is one of my late night spots.

As everyone has said, great food with a great atmosphere, ya gotta love this place. It's a D.C. staple. Bartenders seem to know me by name :8and face. Locations is great and the place is large, can accommodate many diners. Also oysters are half off during happy hour FYI

This place was Perfect. I felt like I walked back in time. Everything was to perfection. The waiter was amazing the drinks were fantastic..only reason why I gave this amazing gem 4 stars was the food. If one is paying $27 for a fish dinner and rice is one of the sides, that rice better be cooked. The fish was ok. I'm so sad to say my husband didn't enjoy his dinner like the rest of us did. We will return and venture again.
best seafood happy hrs in the city.raw bar is awesome

Came here a couple of times for work happy hour and overall I like the atmosphere, food and the service. The prices are a bit high without the happy hour special, so that's about the only time I'd recommend stopping by.
Good food and good service. Always take friends here when they come to town for sight seeing
I'm definitely a fan! I'll be coming back . I had a brunch with my friends and family. It was awesome food and feels very comfy!

Really enjoy old ebbitt. Great place to gather as a family and enjoy the traditions. We recently went there after touring the White House and had a wonderful time. The food couldn't have been better. Only problem was they were very crowded with tourists. So my advice plan ahead.
The atmosphere in the restaurant/bar is amazing! Not to mention that the appetizers we had were wonderful and the service at the bar was impeccable. I hope to try out lunch/dinner one day soon!
Loved the atmosphere! The cheese plate was interesting and the burger was good.
it is good now and then but super expensive
Very good. Super solid. Great seafood and drinks. Best shrimp cocktail in the DMV. Old school vibe but still a happening though place. Make reservations or go early. Always busy, and for good reason.
A classic in Washington. Go for the history and the atmosphere. Sometimes service is slow because it can be so busy.

Pretty good, I like their late night menu.I went there once and my service was pretty good and my food was hot, sometimes I feel like late night places could care less if your fries are hot but everything seemed to be cooked fresh to order
Food is always delicious! And as crowded as it was the service was quick too....

This place is a classic. I have been there a lot and I had good experiences most of the time. Only once I had a bad one when the hostess was a little rude because they were extremely busy that day. Food is really good and the crowd at the bar is good too.
Always clutch. Never fails.Tried the salad for the first time last week. Mistake not to have tried it before.

It's all good but the noise.Excellent seafood options. Decibel levels are insufferable.Good stop for post-performance at Kennedy Center or National Theater.Don't miss the oysters. None better.Great servers, real pros.
It was good , service was good and helpful food was ready in 20 min which is okay,and they are very helpful
The chicken sandwich is good. I like when they switch to the late night menu. That has the best food to me
I like to eat here and it is very relaxing with an awesome atmosphere. Food is delicious.
Was a good experience food was nice.
i enjoyed the food and the staff was ok. could have had a better experience but i can't really blame them we came during dinner time and it was pretty busy
Excellent quality food and service
Very good, highly recommend to anyone that wants a great dining experience.
It took awhile to be seated but overall service was very good. The crab cakes are even better !!!
always feel great to be here. Great service and the empleyees arr very friendly and helpful
Great ambience. The food is also great.
Solid, always. Pricey for what it is. Still solid.

I had the gumbo and crab cake. Being from Texas and going to Louisiana frequently I didn't really feel like the gumbo was very authentic, but I guess thats to be expected ordering gumbo on the east coast. That being said, the gumbo and crab cake were both very good. I would definitely recommend to a friend.
This is the Washington institution that everyone has to bring their out of town guests to.

We would love given a 5* rating, had we not been treated badly when arriving. Those few female hostesses placed us, out-of-town tourists, all the way outside--actually all the way outside out of the restaurant in the back, while there're still seats available in the front of the main dining hall. Of course, the logic is clear: they'd rather keep the front with well-dressed people with jackets and business ties. But, hey, we pay the same price, if not even more because of our generous tips and big orders. In the end, we made a strong request for a better seating, and were eventually given a table inside the restaurant. Lobster cocktails and all seafood plates are strong recommended. Waitresses were also great and attentive. All the restaurant needs to change are those hostesses on the front.
4 stars was purely atmosphere, otherwise 3 stars. Food average. Wait staff very friendly.
I was not that impressed overall, but I will likely be back for another chance just because of the service here being so excellent. maybe I did not choose the right item on the menu,
Good food and great atmosphere!! We had a good time and the staff was very attentive.
ya know when evening work ya I gotÃ§uwe was tws ree was the time ewas there'sn your ya
Going to eat there during the busy time will always be a bit of a delay!
The bartenders at the back bar are always helpful and make for great conversation. The food was great and we enjoyed the oysters, Highly recommend as an iconic DC restaurant. We will be back.
Great food! The service was questionable but I don't think it's a representation of this restaurant.
Nice flavor to everything we ordered. Although we ordered a bottle of Chianti 2009 and they gave us 2011

Very busy place. Long wait for a table unless you reserved on. Got lucky with 2 barstools and the bartender Joe was very good and entertaining. My wife enjoyed the chicken and waffles. I really enjoyed my pan seared soft shell crab. Wish they gave me more than half a small crab. Beers were cold. I will be back and hope to sit at a table.

Was really craving some good seafood so tried Old Ebbit when I saw the great selection of seafood dishes they have.  Their combination seafood pasta plate was to die for. Everything was quality.  All the seafood had a lot of flavor and wasn't chewy like some other places. Portions weren't out of control. Worth the price I suppose but it'd be nice to get a little more for your money. But overall I'm a believer and will return and return again to old ebbits.

I've been here several times and honestly it can be a hit or miss. The service can be on point or it can be slow. Food may be too greasy, but overall the experience is good for a medium calibre restaurant in DC.
I love the brunch here. I have been coming here for over 10 years and I love the ambiance and the menu. The staff is very polite and the hostess is always polite. I can't wait to go back next time.

The only thing I missed was Tommy at the door.   I still miss the old location but the Clyde's Group did all of DC a grand Favor saving the Heart of Ebbitt so a bit of the past can hang with the future, thanks. Great kitchen as things are done properly and if not returns are encouraged. Feedback is listened to not sent the way of the rubbish bin.  Seafood is cared for here like it should be, so be assured if swims your going to get a treat!
The burger and fries here are very good. The ambience is great too. A little pricey for american eatery. But will come again. Big selection of brews to drink from.
I love old Ebbitt Grill. We went for my daughter birthday. The food was ver good. The staff were very friendly. We will go back again.
Amazing breakfast.The waiter was amazing. The history of the restaurant is mind bowing. The bar is the best part of the whole restaurant.
The place is historic. What a cool place to go have dinner. The food was amazing but the atmosphere was even better. Their seafood options are the best.
it was ok !oyster is good !crab cake was good !

I've only been to this restaurant three times, but every time I went I enjoyed myself and the food was good. Some times it gets so busy and the wait is quite long, but I would recommend you wait for your table because you won't be disappointed if you do choose to stay.
Good beer selection, the place is always busy Go to go there to enjoy crab and oysters with fiends. Staff is knowledgeable
Doesn't matter if you eat at the bar or sit in the dining area, the experience is still great. I love coming here, the food is delicious and service is nice. I highly recommend.

This is definitely a DC staple, it is amazing how crowded it is even on odd times - and the staff is always hustling accommodating large groups, party of 1 at the bar - its impressive to watch. Extremely consistent and wait staff is always on their game. If you have a large group and don't want to risk a poor experience - this is where you go. Only deduction is there is nothing particularly interesting about the menu - at all, simplistic salads and traditional American. Again, this is your best bet for a go-to large group we have 14 people situation, but for a 4 and under crowd I'd go for somewhere a bit more interesting.

Loved the experience. Great food. Casual attire is accepted. The server was funny and helpful. Parking was a breeze, I circled the block once and found a lot of open spots. The ambiance of the restaurant is good. The food was delicious. I had calamari for an appetizer and steak for the entree. I thoroughly enjoyed it and can't wait to come back again.

We had dinner with our teenage daughter. She was very excited about the huge nutcrackers at the entrance. We had a reservation and were seated right away. The food was tasty but not exquisite. I give it a 4 because I cannot give a 4.5... I do not suggest the clam chowder - much chowder not much clam. Steak is a bit tough but tasty. Salad was good. I suggest the place
I love it here!! The food, people and drinks!! Me and my bf had 3 dozens of oyster! Also artichoke dip is highly recommended to anyone who got a chance to go there.

This was our second visit to Old Ebbitt in the last few months. We returned for the oysters which we found to be some of the best. Our entrees were also delicious frutti del mar and the meatloaf. The bread is also very good! Service was excellent in this DC main stay. Make reservations as it is very popular for good reason.

I was fascinated by the exquisite cooking here - last night me and a few friends came here for a small get together and it's safe to say that my taste buds and belly were satisfied beyond expectation. Our waiter was very pleasurable and warm, but lacking speed. I waited a whole 10 minutes for water refills while parched, really didn't appreciate that. The star entree of the night was the clam chowder, after I tried it I was convinced that the chefs back in the kitchen were real professionals. It's a little costly at $6.25, and so is everything else here, but I wouldn't mind coming back every now and then.
Truly a DC historic location. We have enjoyed the food every timeâ€?we have visited. It can get busy, so apps like open table are very useful. Go, enjoy the food and the atmosphereâ€?
grew up in dc. this place is old school. have to go if you are ever in the dc area.
All kinds of cuisine you can choose, I like seafood and sandwiches, so delicious and fresh, reasonable price. I will come again.
I like this place, the foods is amazing, cuisine so delicious. I usually come here with my friends. nice.
Great food and great service, one of my favorites in DC. Always a pleasure experience
I like burger and all the dessert here, they taste amazing, It is a good place for you relax and brunch.

Always a classic. Great American fare and the layout and atmosphere of the restaurant is the perfect DC vibe. I love how you can visit 3 different bars and they all have their own ambiance. I stop in all the time for happy hour and even formal dinners. Place to come if you're visiting DC!

Old Ebbitt Grill is a classic spot in DC, where I come to enjoy their burger which is amazing! Really tasty and juicy! They offer really good desserts and their catalog has a big variety of different dishes to fulfill your appetite. The service is friendly but the environment feels outdated.

From the starters the fried zucchini makes the difference, we proceeded with the cornmeal crusted shrimp platter which was great and combine it with wine. A really nice experience in a really big and comfortable restaurant. I liked how the food was presented and next time I will try the salads because they looked r ally good.
This is one of the oldest restaurants in D.C. The decor is very beautiful and the service was great! The oyster Rockefeller were the best I ever had and my Bloody Mary came with a huge shrimp!
Very nice place for an after work dinner or drink.

I really like Old Ebbitt. It is a classy old school place right by the White House which is unpretentious but gawdy at the same time. This place is great for big parties and they treat young people with respect. Their crabcakes are exceptional too.
I came here for my weekly sunday brunch with family and i liked it. The food is great
Great food, perfect location, right by the White House, this place I would come again. I just wish parking was better.

A Sunday morning in Washington, DC. And a chance to eat at Old Ebbit's!For starters, I ordered the Chesapeake Benedict. It was great. The eggs ran perfectly when I cut intothem the crab cake tasted pretty awesome. The other party I went to breakfast with really likes Chicken & Waffles. That is her choice any time we go to brunch. She said the Chicken & Waffles were really quite good. I had a taste and enjoyed it myself also.We went with their Chocolate Chip Bread Pudding. It was AMAZING! The chocolate chips were still a little firm and some were melted. The perfect combination.The crunch with nice warm melted chocolate! It was served with a scoop of ice cream and chocolate sauce. Just great!
This is a great place to gather with friends.

A classy and old school restaurant that is conveniently located near the White House. They have a lot of tables and also bar seatings so I guess usually there's hardly a line. We got seated at the bar inside, which was kinda dark but okay. Their brunch menu is American classics. My bf ordered the Skirt Steak and I had Chicken and Waffle. Okay so I regretted my decision the moment I tried the steak. The beef was a perfect rare, sooo tender and juicy with oven fried potato and spinach on the side. The steak sauce was wonderfully made from red wine and came great with the meat. I 100 percent recommend this dish. It was kinda disappointing that my chicken and waffle was a bit dried and salty. The price is very reasonable considering the restaurant's location and decoration. The girl who served us at the bar (Michele?) was so attentive and helpful. Overall lovely place!
Pretty good spot! Not extremely memorable, but a great spot if you're looking for dinner.
I've been coming here since a child. It's classic D.C. My favorite entree is the trout Parmesan. Pro tip: the orca platter is half price during happy hour, but it's not clear from the menu.
The bartenders here are always ahead of the curve. Really decent bar food, solid back bar
Love the food and atmosphere! I have been there few times now and love the place!
Had breakfast here before, enjoyed every bite of my food!!!
Great for brunch! Not dinner. Their french toast is fantastic!
Old Ebbit's a great place to take family from out of town due to its location, great menu selection, and quality. Pro-tip get the Orca Platter during happy hour if you're into seafood.

Old Ebbit is an institution, as I'm sure plenty of other reviewer's have already said. I've been going there for almost eight years now and it has only disappointed once. The secret is to arrive early enough for happy hour to get a seat at the bar and then order the orca platter, which will be half off. You'll enjoy great oysters, little neck clams, shrimp, crab and lobster for a reasonable price in a great location. In my opinion the salads are the only menu options that disappoint.
Love this place! Food and atmosphere is always awesome!

The only issue I have here is that I don't get a discount for coming as often as I do. Jokes aside, this place is amazing. First started going on my birthday last year, in June. Ever since I have been hooked. I'm a fry person so I really appreciated a good fry. The burger were cooked with love and will definitely be back soon. My friend also said that the french toast was delectable.
Make reservations - especially during Christmas time. Otherwise your wait will be 3 hours.
Great atmosphere, very good food, nice place to meet either professionally or socially.
Great food and service. Will definitely go back.
Awesome cocktails
Long wait for a table, but we were a big party. Food was good....atmosphere was better!
A friend recommended me here. So, I and my husband had tried it and it was amazing! This place is beautiful and so as the foods are great!
Happy hour was well worth it . If you like seafood grab their seefood platter . Other then food or choices and decent pricing during happy hour . It will be crowded so come early and grabs ur seats
Decent food. Great location near The White House! Must visit in DC.
Good Happy Hour! Recommend for any and all in the area

The food was really nicely prepared and the service was attentive. They lost a star in my book because you're herded a bit like cattle when you visit. The wait times without reservations are prohibitively long, which means a number of people are just standing around in the small reception area. Avoid if you're claustrophobic or hate crowds, but every Washingtonian has to go at least once. It's an institution.
Great food, a little touristy, right by my office. We love it for happy hour.
Ate here for breakfast. Food was good. Would go again but perhaps for dinner.
Been to this place for many years and always enjoy the food and atmosphere..
Great restaurant and timely service. They have some great drinks at the bar and sometimes you can tell them what you want and they'll make it for you!
love the late night special!!! The seafood was a amazing!!!
Really neat atmosphere and history. Food is pretty good and the service is excellent.
The food is good and the atmosphere is great! If you're touring visiting the White House, this place is in an awesome location since the White House Visitor's Center is nearby.
My children like this place for enjoyment cause they have a good day with there services and menu it is really good
Good food and reasonable prices for DC.

Arrived 745 pm for 800 pm reservation and was promptly taken to our booth.Started with Clam Casino and had the rib eyed streak pittsburgh style done perfectly .Bottle of red wine recommended complimented nicely and was just under 50 dollars .Waitress was Kelsey Luck who was attentive and just the right amount of chat...great service .Great atmosphere and very popular so book in advance

The old bar (with a nice beer selection, friendly bartenders, and oyster menu) and politico atmosphere are worth the visit. Come dressed as you are -- suits, jeans, whatever... The restaurant's got the usual Clyde's staples (crabcakes, pecan-crusted fish, etc.), but the bar's what makes this place a quality recommendation.

Playbook -- If you're going to go.Strong: Reliable Polished Food & Service, Something for Everyone Quite Strong: Beautiful Room, Raw Bar Especially Orca Platters Late NightNot So Strong: Getting adventourous with Entrees.One Hitter Quitter -- If you're a tourista come anytime with a group for a reliablly competent meal but to experience the Ebbitt like the locals come late night for raw bar and beers like people have for years (talking politics optional).
It both caters to the tourists and DC locals. A landmark institution !! To be seen. Large portions of American fare.
Very good.

Great food, service acceptable, decor reasonable, price acceptable for DC. My buddy and I went here with her aunt. I am just going to elaborate on the food. We divide the winter vegetable platter. It'd two types of squash (the butternut was yummy), kale, wild rice, and a cranberry sauce. I believed it was superb. The steak quesadilla appetizer was great also.
There was an hour wait for dinner, but we went to a little back area in the bar and was able to get in and out within an hour. Food was good and portions were large. Full and happy when we left.

The place is furnished like a 1900s pub, full of historical and interesting ornamentation. What truly struck me was the different clientele enjoying their meals there. There were lots of business people or politicians in suits, yet my (drained) family stopped in after touring the White House and felt incredibly welcomed. The staff was extremely friendly and unpretentious, and the food (and beer!) were tasty. This was our finest dining experience on our DC holiday.
It's ok- Great for tourists.
Love the bread pudding
I've never had a bad dish here. The service is always prompt and attentive. Highly recommended.
great spot!! food and service for terrific.
i love the OEG. Been there many times. Great servers, and environment. Must visit for tourists.
Never disappointing.

A Washington DC staple.I have beeen going there for years and the food is always great.The reason I am giving it four stars instead of five is that friendlieness can be missing at times.For the most part it is good though!
Good food nice people!
I like this place and go often. I would highly suggest making a reservation, or you may have to wait a while for a table.
This restaurant has pretty good crabcakes.

I love this place Food is delicious, service is excellent,Beautiful ambiance, they have an atrium with seating there, so you feel like you're outdoors but you're still warm. So I rate this place 8 out of 10

Over the past several years my family consisting of three adults have a tradition of dining here on Christmas for lunch. The food is always delicious. This year however the menu was somewhat changed so I was unable to get my Daily Grill favorite sandwich, which was fine. The one disappointment this year was the service. Our server seemed distracted and was difficult to find for beverage refills, condiments, etc., which was a definite departure from what we were used to. As always, the restaurant was very busy with many families celebrating the holiday together.

fell in love with this restaurant tonight. Amazing ambiance, incredible service, and out of this world food. Boqueria is the cutest lil' place, with dim lights, lifted leather and wooden seating, wooden floors, and an exposed wine cellar in the back. Outdoor seating is great for people watching, too. We had reservations so I can't speak for seating times
Food was great. Drinks were good. Service was awesome! Hidden gem. Great place to watch football. Lots of screens with good visibility from wherever you're sitting.

Nice place, molt recomanable! !!After 4h30 by car (from NY) and 2h30 walking in these beautiful city, we decide to lunch in these place ....French influence deco, really clean, well organised and great service.Concerning food ... ouau ... magnific oysters from North (near Boston) and recommended, rock fish and hamburger to enjoy these moment.Catalan wine from costers del segre (Raimat) and the best bread that we taste in US.Pour les voyageurs franÃ§ais, un ambient similaire Ã  celui du cafÃ© de la paix de Paris.Pels visitants Catalans un lloc recomanable amb ambient similar a Casa Alfonso.
This place is an institution!Happy hour is great and the Seafood Platter is awesome.I highly recommend a visit!Sara J. Schreiber
Good food, good service. A bit pricey.
This was a great place, the service and the food(yummy crab cakes) were amazing!!! My husband and I will be returning.
Old time Washington DC drink establishment located near the White House. A lot of business today . Bar tenders were johnny on the spot
We stopped for a martini, lively place we sat at the back bar.
The service was slow. That is the only complaint I had. The food was excellent and the atmosphere was great.
Really nice decor. It was very busy but you cant help that. Food was good.
Really good breakfast buffett. . . and they are super close to the whitehouse.

Came here for early morning breakfast before a full day of touring the Smithsonian Natural History Museum. My partner requested we go someplace he could get a bloody mary, and this place was the one that came up. Introducing: The Bloody Maryland, a delish bloody mary made with Old Bay Seasoning and topped with a jumbo shrimp. It was very good! The food, I had the Pit-Style Roast Beef. It wast tender and succulent with a great barbecue sauce. I could tell it was made in house. What cinched the sandwich for me was the fried onion on top! They were fried pieces of delight. A friend ordered the Southern Fried Porkchop! It was my favorite. I had the honor of trying a few bites! It was fried to perfection, paired with fried eggs and a gravy sauce. The cornbread was lightly sweet and grilled with the perfect amount of golden brown, you know there is flavor there! The potato salad is killer! I say that because well, I am not a fan of potato salad and there's won me over, so give it a whirl!This is a place to take a date, impress your colleagues, have some shooters after work, or watch powerful business transactions go down. It was calm during breakfast and LOUD and BUSY at night. It was great to step into a piece of this historic landmark, the new Old Ebbitt Grill.I enjoyed everything and I will be back.Keep up the good work.
a DC classic
Great lunch.
Nice atmosphere, but I was a little underwhelmed by the food. Great location though.
Great crab cakes... Jumbo lump crab meat so definately worth the price. Oysters are also amazing... Love the ambiance... Nice to hobnob with the people from the White House!

Love the crabcakes here...they are made with genuine lump crab meet...they cost about $20 bucks which isn't bad for DC prices and good food. Lots of white house people like to go here, so I guess its the place to be seen if you're into that kinda thing. Bar area was nice...didn't have any alcohol but it seemed bussling!
Wonderful, unique historic eatery. Great lunch place! Hope to return soon.

I love the place but it gets too crowded. Too many tourists come here and it is strange because 2 blocks away is an even better steak and seafood place. However I do keep coming back as the bar is a great place to relax with friends when you can get bar space. The food is phenomenal, especially the crab cakes. The beers are perfect (as in right temperature, clean taps, etc...) and the staff is very attentive.
Nice ambiance, good service and pretty good food...all at reasonable prices. Definitely worth a try.
Crab cakes are a MUST from here!
The food and service was exceptional. I highly recommend the Orca Platter.
Excellent service, delicious food, great location! A must try !
excellent crab dip and steak salad.
Great
great late night specials!!!This place is always packed with a great crowd!!I had a blast!!
Good food, good prices!
Love it!
delicious!
Place is legendary. Go to the back bar.
One of my fave spots. Great calamari!!
Thank you guys. Great job. I came there last week and I have eaten the Salmon. It was cooked perfect and service was very attentive even if it was 2 am.
Incredible location near the white house and warner theater
There are great late night specials and a great atmosphere. It was extremely busy but wasn't hard to get a drink at the bar. Ill definitely be back!!
Delicious, cool room, not as expensive as I thought.

I liked the eggs chesapeake and our drinks were well-prepared. Service was excellent and our waitress was friendly and knew the menu well. We also liked the bloody maryland. But, this place can be pricey, and parking can be a challenge.
Very yummy! Made reservations and was late but they still had a table available @10pm.
This place is so reliable and consistent. Even the staff seems to never change. The side bar is my favorite.
Was a very neat place and breakfast was terrific.

Steps from the White House. Such a cool setting, you can feel the history of the place. The food and service are great. The wait is usually too long to come here on a normal night for dinner (unless you sit at the bar), but I like to bring friends who are visiting from out of town here to give them a "taste of DC."

I love this place. I go here a lot for lunch and it is always a great experience. If you like oysters this is the place to go! My only issue is when it is too busy and I have to sit in the courtyard way in the back.
Maryland bloody marys...that is all.
The frozen hot chocolate never disappoints. I took my friends to try it for the first time and they loved it. I ordered the chicken lettuce wrap. It was OK.Old Ebbitt Grill.Very nice.

Whether sitting inside or outside on the patio, this is truly a great place to hang out with friends or by yourself. Its this quiet place that's hidden behind a beautiful wall of vines facing Westheimer. The food is simply amazing
Great food and very good service!
This restaurant is amazing! It's the perfect spot to bring friends or family who are visiting the DC area. It has history, a well-educated staff, and incredible food!

An institution. I always bring out of town guests here and they always love it. It's so old DC, the staff is fantastic, the drinks are great, and if you go in the fall you absolutely must get he stuffed acorn squash.
Excellent venue - excellent service wonderful menu and expertly prepared food. We had a lovely time in this classic place. I enjoyed it immensely.

My first review belongs to this place. Fantastic food and service. My family showed up after some touring and was lucky to walk in with the seafood was half price. The shrimp were huge and fresh. The wait was well worth it.

Amazing food, and beautiful decor. We were told we had a one hour wait, but a table opened up, and we were seated within a minute of walking in, but that was probably just luck, so make reservations. I had the tuna nicoise salad, and it was absolutely perfect.

Went to old ebbit's in July while on vacation. Actually saw it on chive in a list of the to ten oldest bars in the country. It was one of the coolest restaurant's I've ever been in. Original gas lights, Teddy Roosevelt's mounted animal heads. Lots of history. And the food was outstanding.

I was introduced to Old Ebbitt Grill by a friend prior to my travels to DC. Like she said, I wasn't disappointed. I tried the seasonal Dark Cherry Mojito, their crabcakes, pasta and baked chicken. Apart from the more than an hour wait to get a table, the food was great and the ambiance is good.
Excellent venue - excellent service wonderful menu and expertly prepared food. We had a lovely time in this classic place. I enjoyed it immensely.
Love this place. When in DC its a must. Great oysters happy hour.
Yeah, this is a solid option, though they only have brunch on weekends.
Happy hours was fantastic!! I came here with my girlfriend and we have a perfect night here! Good service! I recommended!
loved this place.Good service, good drinks, great food!
One of my favorite late night spots...
Great atmosphere. Excellent service. We both had the house burger - I would recommend.
nice and delicious
Love Old Ebbitt besides it being a DC establishment it is always dependable. Classic good quality food with a charming atmosphere.
great solid service always! food is flavorful and presentation is great. they also have a great happy hour! must try !
Lots of diversity, very american but a little more gourmet.
It's nice.  I've been there several times for lunch, food was good.
Service is awesome!!!!

Came here last nigh, we didn't have a reservation so we sat at the bar.Joe the bartenders was friendly and quick. My friend had the Crab Cake and I had the Trout ParmesanThe. Overall, the food was good, the food presentation looks good, and the ambiance is good, and the service is good, but it took a long time for the food to come out, it's minus a star.Overall, it's a good experience. I would come again.
fan for over 25 years quality, consistency and service
Get the crab cakes. Their top item. Excellent. The place gets very crowded so you my want to get reservations.
Ate here for lunch and dinner. Great experience for dinner. Great food. Great service. The food at breakfast was amazing but the service was not as good.
Great food. Great service.
DC Classic. Always good, always good to go with reservations.
Excellent! Excellent quality of food and service. There is something for everyone on the menu. Very interesting decor inside. The great location adds to it all!
great place to eat! I am a total fan :)
A classic space with good brunch.
Great scotch selection
very delicious fatty food
Maryland crabcake benedicts are to die for!
It's a DC establishment that lives up to all of the hype.
classic DC
Great food.. Great service. Great location.
environment is good. Crab cake is just so so
Great atmosphere and a classic DC restaurant!
consistently great quality. always nice service. they can make dishes ' made to order' very easily and well.
Classic DC.
I have spent several Election nights here. Great atmosphere and food.
Late night spot. Good Food.
Amazing steak sandwich!
Love the atmoisphere and the fish plates.

This is one spot that I always seem to forget is there untill I turn to Yelp. Despite that everytime I make it in, I experience excellent service and amazing food. I can not say enough great things about the grilled liver dish. It is one of the most amazing liver dishes I have ever eaten. My only complaint would be that the wine menu does offer any riesling wines.

Went there late night with a friend for some drinks. The back bar was great, quiet enough to have conversation, yet no one ever forgot about us. The bartender even settled a long-term bet we had going on.
Very good. I'd give it a 3.5 if I could, rather than 4. Good service, good food. nice atmosphere.
Definitely the go-to for out-of-town-ers.
This place is great for meeting cool new people on the Hill. I went there after a White House tour for a late breakfast. Definitely worth it!
this is a cool fun space, try it for a date?
Always packed after midnight...Hard to get a seat at the bar but that just means its a hot spot..Great Crab Cakes!!!
Delicious seafood.
Delicious food and really great atmosphere.
ALWAYS make reservations
Been here a couple of times. Didn't like it the first time, but second time food was great! I had a sausage with fries. Really good!
Great seafood...

This place is like an old reliable friend. I always no what to expect when walking in: good food, kitchen that stays open late, and a professional staff. This place at first glance would appear stuffy, especially when looking at its location and its neighbors like the W, but it is actually really chill inside. It's like an upgrade on your typical neighborhood bar.
tasty Food
Great food.. and decent service... I will return.
awesome place with awesome food.
A classy joint.
Little overpriced, but always packed with people and fun.
one of my all time favs!
A DC classic. Great oysters and HH.
Pretty good food in a good environment. Not bad prices for DC. Good place to bring the kids for lunch during a day of sightseeing.

Crab cakes are really good, densely packed with crab meat. My boyfriend got the daily special and really liked it. Great atmosphere for a variety of dinners- family dinners, birthday celebrations, girls night out, date night, etc. All the wait staff and hosts were friendly. Recommend making reservations. Old Ebbit Grill is a great place to have dinner after a day walking around the monuments.
Great burger. Great atmosphere. Great dessert. Service was a bit slow.
One of the best spots around to grab some late night food..always a go to
Great service, Awesome Steak!

Their oysters and happy hour are my two favorite aspects of Old Ebbitt. The atmosphere is great for a happy hour, and its also a great place to take your family for a nice dinner. It's a bit on the pricy side, and you really should be a little dressed up when you go, but it's always a great experience and the staff is wonderful!
Great location and atmosphere, good food. Can be a madhouse at times, but a great comfy vibe overall. Menu wide and prices excited fo a Amos landmark restaurant in DC.
good food great location
Great place to get the flavor of DC while touring the sites.
Delicious and historic!! A must in DC
Solid food, for the price. Service was pretty good, too.
Had a strawberry shortcake cocktail there. It was amazing. I definitely suggest anyone get it.
Love!
Decent food and good service. Don't go here if you don't like lines though.
This is a great dinner place. I highly recommend it for a nice meal and great staff.
The food was great, the atmosphere was awesome. It's definitely recommended.
Yes....

Great atmosphere and awesome food. Its got that old lodge/gentlemen's club vibe. Love the red and green velvet booths. Most of the waiters and waitresses have been very personable. Oysters are good and if your really into them they have an oyster bar that you can hang out at.Its generally packed and busy, and is very popular. So the wait could be upwards of 20-45 min, depending on when you go. If possible you should call ahead and make a reservation.
Deserts are seasonal, and always good.
Just a sort walk from The W, which doesnt have any food after 9pm
This is a great spot! Crowded, but worth the waitService-5 starsFood - 4 stars. Get the salmon. The crab cake was average. Ambiance-4 stars

only go to Old Ebbitt on Monday-Thursday nights and only sit at the Oyster Bar, and only stay if Mike is your bartender.his attention to detail is phenomenal. my friend ordered her lentil burger with no bun.he came back a few minutes later and asked her, "did you order with no bun because you eat gluten-free? the kitchen says there might be gluten in the lentil burger mix, someone is trying to find out."the answer is yes, so she ordered a delicious walrus burger instead (try it! the balsamic onions are tooo good)
Wonderful. Great food service and atmosphere
Reasonable prices and great steak.
Great place for a late night meal.
Very friendly
Great service

Talk about a DC classic. This is it. It has all the same food from Clyde's Restaurant Group that you'd expect to be done well from their giant lump crab cakes to their burgers. But the oysters are great. Who doesn't like an oyster happy hour or an oyster fest. Between the excellent service, the ambiance, and the food, Old Ebbitt never disappoints.
Good food and good service . . nuf said!

Really good, quick lunch service. I got a burger and was really impressed. Only thing I didn't love was the ambiance and how closely seated you are to everyone, at least when it's busy. Other than that, great food and great service!
Love!!!!
great casual feel, good food and at a great price :)
It's Good.
Yum.

One of those classic places I've always heard great things about but hadn't been there yet. Well I finally did for brunch service. The atmosphere is very nice, though perhaps dimly lit, and I can see how it could get loud in some areas, as tables are somewhat crammed together and can be a bit difficult to get in or out of. Honestly the server had little to no personality but was clearly knowledgeable and made great recommendations, though expensive ones. However, the prices were completely warranted as there was no question as to the portion size or quality of the product. It just goes to show that a quality product can sell itself, though if the service, in terms of personability, were higher this would be 5 stars hands down. Still a great experience.
Always love this place! Our waiter was poor, but all the other side waiters were great. Would go again :)
Good food. Very crowded. Staff was helpful and friendly.
Had great service. Enjoyed the food!
Good food, great service.
Great food, great atmosphere!
The Orca Platter is the way to go. Half off if you go after 11 pm.
The Brunch is amazing!
clydes but better quality
This place, for me, is the quintessential DC restaurant.
Nice place to visit, close to the white house!
Good food, good drinks, good place to go for a good time!

I went here with friends last week and I have to say the food was DELICIOUS. They rave about their trout parmesan and it lived up to all the hype. My only gripe is that after a while it was kinda greasy and I stopped eating the skin.As usual there was nice ambience and nice staff. The last time I thought they didn't serve enough food, this time I couldn't finish my meal :.....
The best grilled oysters you will find anywhere.
Great place nearby work!

Good food, service is usually good as well. I suggest making a reservation as it can sometimes be packed. OE is owned by the same company that owns Clydes which means the menu is similar. However, OE has a larger variety though. The burgers are great!
Great food, good service and a DC institution.
Good food, good service. Recommended.
Outstanding cocktail menu. Not too expensive.
the ultimate classic dc restaurant

I had heard a lot about Old Ebbitt Grill, but had yet to ever go until a few weeks ago. I went with a co-worker for brunch and ordered the Strawberry Salad made with spinach, goat cheese, candied walnuts and a basil vinaigrette. It was absolutely delicious. I normally do not like salads that contain fruits like strawberries in them. This was definitely an exception to that. Next I ate the The Breakfast Club that has ham and bacon stuffed French toast sandwich and drizzled with Vermont maple syrup. It even came with a nice portion of fresh fruit. Needless to say, I was stuffed when I left!

I love the warm and historical feel of this restaurant. The bar is beautiful. I enjoyed the food as well. We have family in the DC area and whenever we visit, this is always one of our favorite spots for drinks or dinner. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is the parking situation and the fact that it can get insanely crowded. Otherwise, I love it!

We've always heard of the well known O E Grill. So we decided to make a voyage to check it out.It was a fun and pleasing trip to the place. We sure built up mighty appetites getting there. So I was ready to eat a Mountain. And to my surprise my steak salad was almost fully filling.Everyone else got salads. But I saw some of the other tables had some good sandwiches and seafood. We'll have to come again. Lastly, its a great place to come by with all the other attractions.
Food was great same as the service
Wonderful charbroiled oysters!
Great crowd, never know who you will see. The history there is amazing.
Got the lobster, it was great. Cool place.

This is my first review on Yelp :-)My friends and I went there yesterday.This place is great. The only problem is - the wait. There always seems to be a bunch of people waiting, even on a Monday night! Once you get in though, it is packed. Good food and good drinks though. Great atmosphere.
Great stop!

Orca Platter....12 oysters, 12 clams, 12 jumbo shrimp, 12 crab claws, whole lobster....YUMMM.  And, during happy hour, it's 50% off....less than $50. Our table split this, and we were very fat and happy afterwards.Place was packed. Obviously a local and tourists' favorite.
Definite must eatso many different roomshistorical food.
Nothing more to add to the other reviews. When guests come from out of town I sometimes take them here.

This place quickly became our favorite spot in DC! It's got a perfect location, right in the heart of the action, and the vibe is just incredible. Whether you're grabbing a quick bite or settling in for a long evening, this place has the energy to match any mood. The oysters are definitely a highlight - fresh, flavorful, and always a treat. If you're lucky, you can grab a seat at the bar without a reservation, which is what we did every time. However, it's definitely a popular spot, so I would recommend booking ahead to avoid the wait.One dish that stood out was the lentil curry soup - wow, it had amazing depth of flavor and was the perfect comfort food. The cocktails were also fantastic, carefully crafted and perfectly balanced. We couldn't resist trying a few!Our server was awesome! Friendly, knowledgeable, and made the whole experience even better. We'll be back for sure!

Old Ebbitt Grill is a gem! The historic vibe, cozy ambiance, and amazing food make it a must-visit. I had the crab cakes, and they were absolutely perfect--fresh, flavorful, and cooked just right. Can't wait to go back!Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

I recently visited Old Ebbitt Grill for an early Sunday brunch and, despite it being busy, our wait was only about 30 minutes. Our group was pleasantly surprised to discover they even served brunch! The ambiance was classic and inviting, the brunch menu offered a great variety, and the drink selection didn't disappoint. The service was attentive and added to the overall experience. We're already looking forward to returning and trying more brunch items from their menu!
Great food. Great ambiance. Great service. Prices are reasonable for the location.

On a trusted recommendation, we made our way to Old Ebbitt Grill in DC--and wow, it did not disappoint! Even early in the evening, the place was buzzing with energy, a clear sign we were in for something special. Our waitress, Jenny, was an absolute gem, guiding us through the menu with expert suggestions. I opted for the pork chop, and let me tell you, it was a game-changer--the best I've ever had, perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor. If you're in Washington, DC, do yourself a favor and make a reservation at Old Ebbitt. It's a must-visit!

Old Ebbitt Grill in Washington, D.C. serves an incredible crab cake that's easily the best I've ever had! The service is top-notch, and the atmosphere is fantastic. However, the prices are on the higher side, and the parking situation is a real challenge. Overall, it's definitely worth a visit!
You can never go wrong with old ebbitt. The bar staff is amazing! Great oyster selection.
M all the above just a great restaurant service was over the top, food was great and the ambiance was amazing
Live Sunday brunch and sitting at the bar! Go enjoy this place and enjoy the atmosphere

Outstanding food and service. Oysters were fantastic. So was the soup (curry lentil). Their crab cackle was ridiculously good, pure meat, no fillers. As great as the food was, our sever Ronnie took special care of us and made the whole experience even better.
This place was so nostalgic, Great location, good food and not too expensive for the experience.

"Old Ebbitt Grill in Washington, D.C., is a gem that every food lover must experience. The evening began with their divine Oyster Rockefeller--truly the best way to kick off the dining adventure. Each bite was a perfect blend of flavors that left me wanting more. But the highlight of the meal was undoubtedly the Linz Heritage Angus Ribeye. This steak was cooked to perfection, tender, juicy, and rich in taste. The dining experience at Old Ebbitt Grill was unparalleled, hands down the best I've had in a long time. Highly recommended for anyone looking to indulge in exceptional cuisine in the heart of D.C."

Wow, what a great experience dining near the White House. This restaurant had that really cool old vibe that I just loved. Some of their best dishes included their crab cakes, which were among the best I have had, and also their artichoke dip. But the dessert was just perfect: peach cobbler. Ambience is excellent, service is great. They serve up one of the finest old fashioned cocktails I have ever had, and I've had my fair share. Be prepared to spend $150 or more per person.

My experience at Old Ebbitt Grill was fantastic. The food exceeded my expectations, and the service was attentive and friendly. I left feeling satisfied and eager to return for another meal. If you're a fan of authentic Italian cuisine, this place is definitely worth a visit.

On my recent visit to the oldest restaurant in Washington, DC, I was immediately struck by its character and charm. This place really feels like a slice of history, with its cozy atmosphere and welcoming ambiance that makes you want to linger a little longer. The highlight of our meal, without a doubt, was the oysters. They're a big draw on the menu, and they certainly lived up to the hype. I can completely understand why they're a favorite among diners. The freshness and flavor were simply outstanding! I must mention our wonderful waiter, who was not only attentive but also friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. He made great recommendations and ensured that we had everything we needed throughout our meal. When planning your visit, I highly recommend making a reservation. Thankfully, we only had to wait a few minutes for a table, which was just enough time for us to soak in the restaurant's unique vibe. As for the food, we tried a variety of dishes, and every single one was exceptional. The salmon salad was fresh and light, while the chicken and waffle stole the show! The warm, smoky maple syrup drizzled over the chicken and fluffy waffle was a delightful combination that I won't soon forget. I also indulged in the burger topped with bacon and jalapeÃ±o, which was absolutely delicious! The flavors melded together perfectly, making it one of the best burgers I've had in a while. And let's not forget the fries--they were crispy and tasty, the ideal companion to our meal. If you're in the area, don't miss the chance to visit this gem!
Great food and atmosphere. Most highly recommend. Great location. Very friendly staff.

The meal at the Old Ebbitt Grill was excellent. Since the restaurant was full, we sat at the bar, where the attentive, friendly, and impeccably hygienic bartender enhanced the overall experience. The food was also delicious, with generous portions that left us too full for dessert. The steak frites were particularly outstanding, with the fat perfectly rendered.

Amid the storied streets of Washington DC, where whispers of the nation's past mingle with the footsteps of its present, Old Ebbitt Grill stands as a venerable bastion of culinary tradition. Here, amidst the shadows of grand monuments and the echoes of early American tales, I found myself dining alone, yet enveloped by the rich tapestry of history.Seated at the bar, an age-old refuge that seemed to pulsate with the heartbeats of the countless souls who had perched here before, I was greeted by the golden allure of a local pale ale. The beer, name as elusive as the fleeting whispers of yesteryear, was a delightful nod to the burgeoning craft of the capital's brewers.As I nursed the ale, my thoughts drifted to my absent companion, my wife, whose spirit seemed to hover in the air, tinged with the melancholy of temporary distance. It was in her imagined tastes and preferences that I found guidance through the extensive menu, a document as layered as the city itself. Prompted by the friendly bartender, whose familiarity with the offerings was as intimate as any old town crier's news, I selected an array of oysters--half Wellfleet, half Belle du jour, each a glistening testament to the ocean's bounty.These oysters, served raw on the half shell, seemed to carry the briny essence of the sea, each bite a direct line to the maritime journeys that once connected distant shores to the American table. As they slipped effortlessly down, I was momentarily transported to the raucous seafood markets that fed the capital's denizens in its infancy.Following the oysters, I indulged in a Faroe Island Salmon Salad, a vibrant mosaic of vegetables crowned with a piece of salmon so rich it could have graced any presidential table. Drizzled with herb-yogurt dressing and speckled with pomegranate molasses, each bite was a declaration of flavor independence, bold and unapologetic.To elevate the meal, a vintage 1988 French champagne lent its refined effervescence, echoing the celebratory toasts of diplomatic victories past. The lively bar, adorned with discreet Masonic symbols, hummed with an energy that seemed to reach back through decades, its patrons a modern-day assembly of the city's ever-evolving narrative.Old Ebbitt Grill, with its understated elegance and palpable history, offered not just a meal but a communion with the past. As I dined, the walls, imbued with secrets and stories, stood as silent guardians of all the whispered plots and bold proclamations that shaped the capital. This evening, though I was physically alone, I dined in the company of history's giants, their spirits as present as the taste of each meticulously prepared dish. Here, in the heart of Washington DC, the past is always seated at the table, generously sharing its enduring feast with all who enter.

I recently enjoyed dining at Old Ebbitt Grill for lunch and was thoroughly impressed. I ordered the Fried Oyster Platter, and it was a culinary delight - fresh, hot, and absolutely delicious. The reusable tableware was immaculate, looking brand new, adding elegance to the meal. I appreciated their eco-friendly initiative with compostable containers available. Parking was hassle-free, with ample options including street parking. The atmosphere was lively and moderately noisy, contributing to a vibrant dining experience. The bar was another highlight

I popped into the restaurant around 10AM on Sunday and got seated right away. They were only serving brunch, but it worked out fine. The oysters were super fresh and tasty. The cinnamon and peanut French toast was to die for. The bacon cheeseburger was decent, but I was so stuffed I couldn't finish it all.

The place is a classic American spot, but it does not feel stuffy at all. The people are also pretty friendly, and the food is pretty solid as well! I came for brunch with my GF and we split an egg's benedict and a french toast. The eggs benedict was nothing special, but the French toast was great!

Excellent service waiter was excited about menu and made everything sound awesome . My steak was excellent. My son's pasta was great. They worked as a team people could learn how to run a restaurant from this business. A great experience all around.
location: Downtown St. Petersburg, Tampa Bay, FL

text: Got some recommendations for you! You should definitely make a reservation if you want to eat at this place. Although my group of three was able to snag a seat right away, I'm pretty sure we just got lucky. The restaurant itself has a really cool vibe, with old school lighting and a funky bar. The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable, and the food is amazing.Everyone in our group loved the French toast and the crab cake. The Chesapeake eggs Benedict (with their signature crab cakes instead of ham) is the best. And if you just want to try it out, you can actually order a single crab cake as an appetizer, which isn't on the menu.
Everything was perfect !!! Service was outstanding highly recommend !!! Will be back every visit to DC
Love the ambience here, perfect for a date! Also, solid oysters and a really pretty bar space

Old Ebbitt Grill is an absolute must-visit for any trip to Washington D.C.! This historic saloon oozes charm and offers a truly unique dining experience.While all three bars can get crowded, head to the one in the back for a better chance of snagging a seat. The staff there, like everywhere at Old Ebbitt Grill, is incredibly efficient and friendly.On my recent visit, I dove into the Oysters Rockefeller and the crab dip, and it was (as always!) divine. The oysters were fresh, perfectly cooked, and bursting with flavor.Do yourself a favor and make time to experience this iconic D.C. spot. You won't regret it!

My girlfriend treated me to Old Ebbitt Grill for my birthday, and it was a delightful experience! The crab cake was a standout dish for me, as I could genuinely taste the flavorful crab in every bite. Despite the bustling lunch crowd, the service was efficient and attentive, ensuring a pleasant dining atmosphere. The overall experience was wonderful, from the delicious food to the swift service, making it a memorable birthday celebration. I highly recommend Old Ebbitt Grill for anyone looking for great food and excellent service in a bustling yet enjoyable setting.
Great service, wait time for a Saturday was amazing, food was amazing, location is convenient, thank you!
This place is iconic. Great service. Great food. Can easily see how it's been around for so long.

During my recent visit to the Old Ebbitt Grill, I decided to treat myself to a scrumptious meal consisting of BBQ baby back ribs, oyster Rockefeller, and Maryland crab soup. Despite my usual distaste for mayo, I was pleasantly surprised by the delectable potato salad that accompanied the ribs, adding a delightful twist to the overall dining experience. The other dishes, including the ribs, were equally impressive, showcasing a fine balance of flavors that left me satisfied. While the service was decent, the bustling crowd meant that it took a bit longer to attract the attention of the staff, but this did not detract significantly from the overall enjoyment of the meal. The bar area exuded a welcoming ambiance, making it an ideal setting for a relaxed lunch. I would recommend making a reservation even for a weekday lunch to secure a timely seating arrangement, given the restaurant's popularity. Overall, my dining experience at Old Ebbitt Grill was a delightful culinary journey, filled with savory delights and a pleasant atmosphere that made it a memorable occasion.

Define must visit as a first timer in Washington DC. Old saloon style restaurant with cozy ambiance and great service. I ordered oysters (very fresh) and filet mignon. I shared the filet mignon with my partner and they kindly offered to serve it in separate plates and it created a better dining experience.Reservation is highly recommended but they do have quite a bit of seatings. Came on a weekday late lunch time and the place was ~75-80% full

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Old Ebbitt in Washington DC, and I must say, it was an absolutely stellar experience from start to finish. The array of dishes we indulged in, from the roasted chicken to the branzino, the chicken fettucine, the meatloaf, and the grilled chicken salad, were nothing short of outstanding. Each dish was expertly prepared and bursting with flavor, showcasing the culinary mastery of the kitchen staff.And let's talk about desserts - the key lime pie, bread pudding, and chocolate peanut butter pie were simply out of this world, offering the perfect sweet endings to an already delightful meal.Beyond the exceptional food, the service at Old Ebbitt was truly top-notch. Attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable staff made us feel right at home, enhancing our dining experience even further.As for the atmosphere, it was nothing short of fun and inviting. The vibrant ambiance added an extra layer of enjoyment to our evening, setting the stage for a memorable dining experience.In sum, Old Ebbitt exceeded all expectations with its outstanding cuisine, excellent service, and lively atmosphere. I cannot recommend it highly enough to anyone looking for an unforgettable dining experience in the heart of Washington DC.
The environment was pleasant and welcoming .... Loved the Location and Atmosphere. Beautiful atmosphere inside and outside around
great place for after work drinks and to take people visiting from out of town. easy to reach the main sights from here after a fully belly and one too many cocktails

The food, service, and everything in between are extraordinary. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted promptly and treated well. The menu is beautifully curated. My wife is pescatarian and they were very accommodating. Thanks
This is a historic and always open late bar in the heart of the capital. Continuous, 4 different bar areas, early breakfast and late night option. You can always count on him.

Old Ebbitt Grill holds a special place in my heart as a timeless classic in the heart of Washington, D.C. With its rich history dating back to 1856, stepping into Old Ebbitt feels like taking a step back in time while still enjoying all the comforts of modern dining.From the moment you enter, you're greeted by the warm and inviting ambiance that effortlessly blends sophistication with charm. The interior is adorned with historical artifacts and memorabilia, each telling a story of the restaurant's storied past.But let's talk about the food. Old Ebbitt Grill is renowned for its classic American fare, and it certainly lives up to its reputation. Whether you're craving a perfectly cooked steak, fresh seafood, or one of their famous oyster platters, every dish is executed with precision and attention to detail.One of the things I appreciate most about Old Ebbitt Grill is its commitment to sourcing the highest quality ingredients, many of which are sourced locally. From the seafood to the produce, you can taste the freshness in every bite.And let's not forget about the service. The staff at Old Ebbitt Grill are seasoned professionals who go above and beyond to ensure that every guest has a memorable dining experience. Whether you're a regular patron or a first-time visitor, you're treated with the same level of care and hospitality.In conclusion, Old Ebbitt Grill is more than just a restaurant - it's a Washington, D.C. institution. With its rich history, delicious food, and impeccable service, it's no wonder this iconic establishment has stood the test of time. Whether you're looking for a special night out or simply craving a taste of classic American cuisine, Old Ebbitt Grill never disappoints.

During a recent visit to Washington DC with my family, we had the pleasure of dining at an exceptional restaurant that I wholeheartedly recommend to all visitors, particularly those seeking respite after a day of exploring monuments and museums. Despite a bustling crowd and an initial estimated wait time of ninety minutes, the efficient staff seated us within a mere fifteen minutes, a testament to their exceptional service.Upon entering, we were greeted warmly by the front-of-house staff, who demonstrated commendable hospitality throughout our dining experience. The ambiance of the establishment exuded both comfort and sophistication, rendering it an ideal venue for an intimate evening with a partner.To commence our meal, we indulged in the delectable buffalo chicken wings accompanied by blue cheese and celery--an appetizer that left a lasting impression, albeit one I regrettably failed to capture in a photograph. This flavorful prelude set the stage for an equally satisfying main course selection, which included the savory chicken fettuccine, the impeccably prepared southern fried chicken sandwich served with a side of fries, and the succulent Keystone Farms roasted half chicken.To complement the culinary delights, I savored a refreshing rum spirit known as the Fog Cutter, further enhancing the overall dining experience. In summation, our dining experience at this establishment exceeded expectations, thanks to its exceptional service, inviting atmosphere, and exquisite culinary offerings.
I love this place it's a beautiful restaurant the food is good and I love it and it's was my first time there and it's a nice restaurant check it out and you will like it
Old Ebbitt Grill it a must stop when in DC. The food is delicious, great service, classic ambiance -- and the crab cakes are a must!
Great bar, great ambiance, great food. Very enjoyable time spent here. The service was attentive and professional.

Perfect place to spend a holiday (or probably any day of the week. Vast menu selection, great drinks, old school vibe. We went in with 7 and made a reservation seamlessly. If you're in DC, Old Ebbitt Grill is a must.

After an extensive journey through DC, I found myself here, extremely hungry. A brief wait secured me a table in a nostalgically charming ambiance--comfortable and inviting. The food was truly out of this world, reaching absolute perfection in every aspect. From the sauce and fries to the crab cake and even the coleslaw, which I typically don't enjoy, everything was impeccable. Surprisingly, I found the coleslaw to be perfect. To cap it off, I indulged in a peanut butter cake that was so heavenly, I had to pinch myself to ensure I was still alive. Without a doubt, the best culinary experience I've had thus far, and the pricing was quite fair.Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 5/5

A beautiful and historic gem in DC! The dark wood interior adds to the charm of being the oldest established saloon. The service was outstanding, and every appetizer and entree we tried was truly amazing.

A dc classic. Bartender was attentive and the food came out quickly. It was one of the few spots open late at the time we went so that was a plus. Can't go wrong with this choice.

I had the pleasure of dining at Old Ebbitt Grill during my visit to Washington, DC, and it was truly an unforgettable experience. He was not only attentive and professional but also incredibly entertaining and funny. Ross's charisma and humor added an extra layer of enjoyment to the meal, making it an evening to remember. The entire staff at Old Ebbitt Grill goes above and beyond to ensure guests feel like valued patrons. Old Ebbitt Grill is a must-visit for anyone looking to savor an exceptional meal in the heart of our nation's capital, and I can't recommend it enough, thanks in no small part to Ross's outstanding service.

I had the pleasure of dining at Old Ebbitt Grill in DC, and I must say, it's a true gem! The upscale and inviting atmosphere sets the perfect tone for a memorable dining experience. Old Ebbitt Grill is a fantastic place with great food, service, and ambiance. The Oyster Riot Burger was a perfect combination of fresh beef, fried oysters, and flavorful toppings. A staple of DC, Somehow this place never fails to amaze me. There's a reason it has such a high rating after almost 10,000 reviews.The ambiance of this place adds to its charm. It's claim to fame is being the oldest tavern in DC. It definitely has an old British/Irish inspired feel inside. There is ample seating but it is incredibly popular so it wouldn't hurt to have reservations.

This iconic Washington, D.C. restaurant has earned its reputation as a culinary destination with its delectable food, delicious drinks, and outstanding service.Let's start with the food - simply put, it's fantastic. The menu is diverse, offering everything from classic American fare to innovative and creative dishes. Whether you're in the mood for steak, seafood, or a vegetarian option, you'll find something to delight your taste buds. The ingredients are fresh and the flavors are expertly balanced. I particularly recommend the crab cakes - they're some of the best I've ever had.Now, onto the drinks. The Old Ebbitt Grill has an extensive wine list, an impressive selection of craft beers, and a cocktail menu that's sure to please even the most discerning palate. The bartenders are knowledgeable and passionate about their craft, and they mix up some truly exceptional cocktails. I highly recommend trying the Old Fashioned - it's a classic for a reason.But what really sets The Old Ebbitt Grill apart is its outstanding service. From the moment you walk in the door, you'll be greeted with a warm welcome and impeccable attention to detail. The staff is attentive, knowledgeable, and always willing to go above and beyond to ensure you have an exceptional dining experience. They take the time to get to know their customers and make everyone feel like a VIP.All in all, The Old Ebbitt Grill is a true gem in the heart of Washington, D.C. The food, drinks, and service are all exceptional, and I can't recommend this restaurant highly enough. If you're looking for a memorable dining experience in the nation's capital, look no further than The Old Ebbitt Grill.
The food is always great. The staff always provides good customer service.

If you're looking for a classic, upscale dining experience in Washington D.C., Old Ebbitt Grill will not disappoint. Always Wonderful. Delicious cuisine. Cozy.

Old Ebbitt Grill is a historic gem located in the heart of Washington D.C. This restaurant has been serving locals and tourists alike since 1856 and has become a staple of the city's dining scene. The restaurant's rich history is evident in its decor, which features vintage photographs and artifacts that pay homage to the city's past.The ambiance at Old Ebbitt Grill is warm and inviting, with a classic tavern feel that transports diners back in time. The restaurant is spacious and features a variety of seating options, including cozy booths, communal tables, and a spacious bar area. The walls are adorned with antique memorabilia, and the lighting is dim, creating a cozy and intimate atmosphere.One of the best things about Old Ebbitt Grill is its reasonable prices. Despite its prime location and historic status, the restaurant's menu offers a range of affordable options. The menu features classic American fare, including seafood, steak, and sandwiches, all served in generous portions that are sure to satisfy any appetite.In addition to its history, ambiance, and prices, Old Ebbitt Grill is also known for its excellent service. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and they go above and beyond to make sure every guest has an enjoyable dining experience.Overall, Old Ebbitt Grill is a must-visit destination for anyone visiting or living in Washington D.C. Its rich history, inviting ambiance, and reasonable prices make it a standout among the city's many dining options. Given it's location, this is a great spot for tourists to grab lunch after touring the White House!
The food was absolutely perfect and the service was excellent. Will definitely visit again.

We ordered from the bar while waiting for a table Sunday Night (8/14) with no reservation and the time passed so quickly! it is a beautiful space with a very classic feel. Cameron was our server and was 10+++ stars! Our 7 year old was so impressed he left a note for Cameron thanking him for being "the very best". We were served Crab & Artichoke Dip, Lobster Roll, Crabcake Sandwich and Caesar salad - and it was all phenomenal! They do have a kids menu for those wondering... Our next trip to he DC area will find us back at Old Ebbits for sure!!

The team at Old Ebbitt does an outstanding job serving so many guests each day. The history of this place is worth the visit in itself. We stopped in for Steaks and it did not disappoint. The steak was cooked perfectly. We also indulged in the Calamari which came with savory Jalapenos. It is fairly priced for an upscale Steak House.
100/100 for the burgers, interesting crowd, young, old, kids, everyone is there! Can make food better but all in all it s a great place

We had the deviled eggs, egg rolls, Cajun pasta, shrimp and grit cakes, steak and potatoes, apple pie and bread pudding. Just a great atmosphere and good time where you can enjoy, not be rushed, and have a good dining experience. I can't wait to go back my next trip South.
They having everything you could want! All the food was wonderful and will come back again on my next visit!
Great service and food. We LOVED the oysters.
Great! I have been going to this place for years and the menu has change but the food is amazing!

Love this place. Awesome atmosphere. Oil lamps and green velvet benches. Cloth linens and colorful, local art. Truly first-class service. We loved everything. The chicken is very crispy and junctions - served with capers. The pasta is hand made but not too heavy. And EWERT is fabulous- the bread pudding rocks.

And everything is great, you get oysters half-price shrimp and crab cocktail, crab claws, all the seafood you can think of the food is always fresh, and the service is always good. We always go to Todd and he's absolutely amazing, we have been going for years. The only thing I can say about this place is that they don't have a huge cocktail selection, and that they don't have red grapefruit juice, which I think that they should. They have that old-school yellow grapefruit juice that comes out of the can. Fresh juices would make a huge difference in drinks.

Best burger I've ever had and the most amazing oysters.

excellent! great service, great food!

Walked in thinking we could just get a table for Happy Hour at 5 on a Tuesday. Mistake. Get a reservation 100% keep walking past the main bar and you'll find that it wraps around the other side and most people don't realize it. Waited there for ten minutes until two seats opened up. Got the Orca Platter 50% off for Happy Hour. If you don't know about this yet, you are missing out. Best deal in DC. Service was bomb these guys were refilling my drink the minute it was empty and bringing fresh plates to put my shells. They crushed. You know what you're getting with Old Ebbitt. Consistency in both service and food is a premium here, and the stellar staff know it. Myself and children are vegan, and this is our go-to spot whenever we have visitors from out of town, as the menu has something for everyone. If there's nothing on the menu that suites my diet, the chef is always happy to make something off menu. We love this place so much, we had our wedding reception in the atrium!
Trout Parmesan. Trout Parmesan. Trout Parmesan. That is all I have to say.

All I can say it lived up to the hype. It is historical, and the cubano was to die for. Jay my server was excellent! One of the best restaurant experiences i ever had. Not sure why I did not go sooner!
Very good test I love it. I will come agin . It was really nice experience with old Ebbitt grill

Always exceptional, great location, and a fun atmosphere.
Such a classic to go to. The food and drinks are good and the service is always pretty good. Never had a bad server here
One of my favorite late places to go eat and have a few drinks with friends. The salmon is my most favorite dish. Come check this place out you won't be made you did
