Classic, good, and surprisingly affordable

Wow. I always try to hit this place when in town from Seattle. Brought the family on this past Friday. They were busy... about a 45 minute wait without reservation. While waiting for a table we first sat in the back bar and our bartender was great.  She was attentive and quick.We were blessed to be sat with Alejandro. He made us feel welcome, took his time with us and helped us with menu options on oysters and burger modifications. The meal was awesome, cooked to perfection. We had the fortune to also meet Yusef, their restaurant manager. He was very professional and kind....He checked in with us and assured our experience was memorable and perfect. 5 stars is not enough today.  They are doing it right.

Come on you can never go wrong with this place. Good seating, Good food and a great staff. I usually go in with a group for small get together or drinks after work. I like stopping by in the winter also. It has a cozy feeling. Get the burger. I also like the wings.
Great food and excellent service.
Delicious burgers and fun spot for drinks.
I've been here for lunch and really had a great meal. Recommend the trout.
Haven't had a bad meal since I started coming here three years ago. The service is always great and I would recommend this place to anyone
Really good food and service. Its a DC staple.
Food is incredible. The whole scene is great. I like to meet friend or family here sometimes. It never gets old.
Diverse options at reasonable prices and lots of history. Something for everyone!
Love this place! i recommend it to all my friends and family!

Their food is amazing! Try their crab cakes and steaks. The environment is classy and fun. My only complaint is their service was slow last time we went, but they were also super busy on a Sunday evening. Definitely recommend visiting!
Loved the atmosphere, service and food. We went here on a recommendation. So glad we did! Make sure to make reservations.
Yummy and classy! I reccommend
Great place to eat in the district, classic American saloon
Once in while, I Iike to dine there. Great place.
Classic yums. Such a cute date spot!
I love this foodie spot! They have a great selection and the service is excellent.
Absolutely love it here! Always amazing food and good experience!
Great food and pleasant atmosphere. Very reasonable prices. You will not be disappointed
Excellent service! Food was great as well.
It's the oldest restorant in DC and it's very good! I like the happy hour there it's great place.
Love the atmosphere! It is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Washington, DC.
One of the great old-time D.C restaurants. I have been dining there for decades. Always good.
Everything is always outstanding!
The crab cakes and all seafood options are awesome. The ambience is wonderful too.
Wonderful food! Enjoy going here every time I am in town.
Awesome, classic, historical, and a great deal
Great food, great atmosphere, a must for tourists and locals.
Wonderful food! Great atmosphere, will defiantly be back with the hubby soon!!

The food here was really good. Our server I can't remember her name but she had suggestions for drinks and food that was much appreciated. We shared a bit of everything around our table and everything was fantastic. We will be back!
Love this place! Best location and best seafood. Also great service! would recommend to everyone, especially if you are coming with tourist friends.

Loving coming here for the seafood tower at happy hour! Everything is always fresh and the service is great. Also love the chicken wings -- they are delicious and natural (but beware: they are small). Sitting at the bar is great for people watching any time of the day.
Solid. Never disappoints. Can be a little touristy, but the food and drinks are always top.
Always perfectly cooked food, and very cheap for how good it is.
Delicious meal I had in Old Ebbit Grill. Make reservation before you go, it is always full.
Best breakfast in town. Recommend seeing the town after
great!  would go again  Yelp makes it extremely difficult to give good reviews because they insist you write a book
Treat yourself! Always a good a experience great food, great seafood!!
Best chilli cheese fries ever!
One of my favorites! Food, drinks, and service are always on point!
a big fan already!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
The crab cakes were stellar and the staff was friendly.
Great food and great atmosphere. Find this bartender,his name is Tal. He'll take care of you
Really great restaurant. One of my favorites in DC! Right by the Metro and White House too. Would recommend to anyone visiting DC.
Good food and great eats. This place has been around forever. I love it here
Third visit in two days! Excellent food, drinks and service in a great atmosphere! Highly recommend!
Excellent food. Great atmosphere. And I loved the service.
Great ambiance. Great service. Great food. There's absolutely nothing wrong with this eating and drinking establishment. 5 Stars
Loved the service here! Went here with my family and had a great time!
It's a good ole grill with some good ole burgers for a good ole time. Great cocktails, tasty foods, and quick service. Not too expensive. We will be going again.
I give the restaurant a 5 star, very good food, clean place and frendly staff
Great Food and atmosphere! One of our favorites while we were in D.C.
Love Old Ebbitt Grill. You can't go wrong!

If your in DC stop here this place is worth it! Not only is it a historical spot there excellent food and atmosphere. We had dinner Friday night and brunch the following morning soooo good! Amazing! Perfectly cooked and prepared beautifully! There was 4 of us and everything we ordered was better then expected! The salmon was perfect and the Brioche French toast as well, that's just what I had. Everyone else raved about there meals as well. Staff is polite and we never had an empty glass. A+
AMAZING FOOD, amazing service, amazing atmosphere and the bread and butter is to die for!!!
This one of my fave spots for date night. The food is consistently good.

How could this place have anything less than a 5 start rating? Our group of friends have been coming here for years for their late night happy hour and dinner. The service, atmosphere, food & drinks are all amazing. Mike & Joe at the bar are awesome and Johnny in the dining area is also... I'd say 6 stars.
Absolutely amazing! One of my favorite places in D.C.
Went here on our first day in town and loved it so much we came back a few days later. Recommend to friends whenever they are there.

I was so excited to stop by for happy hour . I literally work right across the street and always notice many people coming into band out and notice their expression on their face when leaving . I stopped by for happy hour . Prices were reasonable for drinks! What stood out the most was the orca platter which was 50% off , came at the right time and day ! Great hang out spot for the younger generations also
Great for brunch!

Late night happy hour. Do it. Stay up late-it's dope. Orca platter looks amazing, didn't get it this time as we just eaten, we'll be going back for it.The wings are amazing!! Get them double fried-so crispy.Service is attentive and professional. Four bars to sit at. Each with a unique atmosphere. Great beer selection. Good to see local beer on tap in the joint! Good vibes.
Great food and wonderful service. Just across the street from the White House.
Awesome! As always!!
Love it! Casual and reliable!!
Pleasantly surprised. We came here for brunch and it was AMAZING. Not basic.
Definitely one of the nice restaurants in the D.C. Area. I will be coming back again.
Fantastic food, service, atmosphere...oyster stew exceptional! Buffalo chicken sandwich outstanding.
The steak was incredible , I loved my crispy little fritters can they get any better???! I also loved the history and ambience of it al , I can't wait to go back!
AHmazing!!!!
Walking into the business there was a sense of warmth and relaxation. I really enjoyed the service and the price was good. The employees were friendly and helpful. I would recommend this to others.
Classic American excellence. Wonderful fast service, tourist attractions, must visit, love the burgers.
loooveee this place. All time favorite!!!

Reservation required or the wait will be endless. I learned that the first time. However, the food was worth the wait. I have been back many a time (table reserved in advance) and the dining experience is never a disappointment. The food and drinks are very good, and the atmosphere is nice. The restaurant is located near the White House and is truly lovely.
Great value.
Really good food. A little pricey.
Overall experience, love this place. I recommend give it a try!

I heard this is the oldest bar and restaurant in the country. Not sure if thats true. The food is great though and it tastes like they have been serving people forever because they have it down correct. Came here for a large family lunch this week. Great american food. Burgers and fries taste like they invented them. Make a reservation for large groups though. Youll thank yourself for it.
Amazing brunch spot

Was here a couple of weeks ago and many other times before and I LOVE it.Its a great bar and dining experience.The staff is knowledgeable about not only the menu and drinks but will tell you great tales of some of the famous patrons they get.A must go to place!
Been going to the Old Ebbitt Grill for more than a decade and it has never disappointed.
Always a fan of this place. I love sitting at the bar and getting an orca platter late night when the raw bar is discounted!

I like the lunch here. Th seafood is great!

The Historical Society once did a spectacular costumed event here. The atmosphere is very elegant, giving a sense of class and gravitas to your dining experience. The food is also well made, and your wait staff is polite and professional. If you have a business meeting or event, this is a great place for it.
Excellent! Great place to doing business.
a very good restaurant near the white house!
This place has been my favorite ever since I moved to the area 25 years ago.....I'll be back!
always a good meal and a reasonable price for the location.
This was a wonderful experience. How exciting it was to venture into a great atmosphere where everyone was helpful and delightful. I will always remember this time.
I went here last week. I'm new to DC but wow this is a classic place. Service and food A+++... drinks were okay but love how they're always open late. Will be back again and again
Classic DC restaurant !
The crab cakes are amazing. The line is out of control specially on Saturday and Sunday, make sure you have reservation.
Always consistent with good food, service, and drinks. Wait staff is always very patient and professional I love it here.

I have been coming here for over 10 years. Also with my parents as a kid. It is always perfection. There is never an issue with service or the food. Yes it's expensive. Yes it's supposed to be for a special occasion but it's worth a one time a month date night.
This was wonderful. Loaded with excitement and I would definitely return.
Good imported wine - great seafood - especially their late night happy hour 1/2 off oyster bar! What's not to love. Quality is excellent, staff fantastic, beautiful old world charm. love it.
My favorite places on the weekends ... always perfect for lunch, dinner, brunch...etc.. The bartenders know how to make a great martini. Ask for a GIBSON with cocktail onions.
Always a good choice. Been going here for 15 years.
DC institution. Always good. Little touristy.
My first time ever eating there in 2015, I loved it, will return again...Nice atmosphere and great food.
I'm sure that a very good service.
Service, food all great!

This is one of DC's oldest restaurant. And Everything I tried here was on point, to the point where I feel a lot of these dishes were invented here (they were not). From the oysters on half shells, clam casino, oyster Rockefeller, bacon cheese burger, salmon fillet, to bowl of chili I would come here over and over again for any meal of the day. And by the way, they open till 2am.

I love this restaurant. It is old school and I love it when you walk in and Tony remembers you like an old friend. This restaurant appears stuffy, but even if you walk in wearing shorts your treated the same as those in a tux. The food is always so good. I love the crab cakes. They are so tasty. I have never had anything bad from the kitchen. The drinks are good. I love the bloody mary!
Love this place! Food is amazing!!! Best sandwiches ever!

Delicious dinner! Went on Friday night with my family... Dinner was superb! Large size portions and very quick service! I had the crab cakes, which were all crab & delicious! My son had mussels fra diablo ~ delicious! My husband had the 14 oz. rib eye steak! Cooked perfectly and very tender. My other son had the short ribs with polenta. We all shared the fried calamari appetizer which was delicious as well! Definitely a must stop!!
great food, good happy hour specials
An amazing place, never disappoints.
It was, is, still the best in town!
Just had an amazing lunch. Everything from the mimosas to the shrimp cocktail was incredible. Arrive early or make a reservation because they pack up fast.
Overall, the food was good,good cuisine i had a really good time.i have ordered roasted half chicken it was really delicious
The atmosphere, food, and drinks are perfect. There is no reason not to make time to come here. It's all tasty and perfect and well worth the price. I will definitely return.
Service & food were amazing... highly recommend this restaurant!
The Orca platter is the BEST!
best Cappachino in DC
The wings and the drinks are great
Love this place.So elegant, old school and great service.
Everything was great. I've been twice and I will be go back.

My first time visiting this restaurant on Christmas Eve and I was thoroughly impressed! The staff was very courteous and prompt. We were seated right away, with reservation, and water brought to the table immediately. Then drinks were ordered and filled throughout the night without ever asking! The food was spaced out just right but always in a timely manner and was exquisite! For the location, the prices are very reasonable and you can't beat the service or taste. The atmosphere is very comfortable and Mike (bartender), Tim (manager) and Dan (GM) are so accommodating and genuinely great people! I would recommend this to anyone looking for great food and amazing service!!!
Love the food and the staff. Great place to grab a bite during the lunch rush!
Excellent atmpsphere
Love the Old Ebbitt Grill. It's a good place to take visitors.
Best place to eat near the capital!
One of DC's long standing staple. Love the the late night staff!

I had heard many good things about this historic eatery! Decided to enjoy dinner here on October 27, 2015. Derrick was our waiter and he was beyond awesome!! In many restaurants, patrons are rushed through their meals so that tables can be turned quickly. We never felt this way at all! From the wonderful mussels in garlic and wine appetizer, to lobster entree, to the outstanding dessert (recommended by Derrick as one of the best among all the choices), it was all first class! I might add that when I asked for a glass of house chardonnay, Derrick's reply was "buttery or crisp"? I replied,"buttery", but my thought was "yeah, right, we'll see about this.......well, the chardonnay was spot on!!!!Thank you Derrick, and Old Ebbitt Grill, for a memorable dining experience in DC!!!!! Don't miss out on this place if you are in DC! It is just a few blocks from the White House on 15th Street!
I came here on a recommendation from a friend and was not disappointed in the least - the crabcakes were excellent !
its great, not only the food but also the environment is also great !!!!!!!!!! once every one should be here
The Old Ebbit Grill is a Washington tradition. I love to bring out of town guests here. Not for Vegans! But I love the other menu choices.Place to Show Off Washington!
Love the decor and atmosphere. Oyster happy hour is too good of an opportunity to pass up - definitely the best oysters I've had.
One of my favorite places in DC! They serve food late which is perfect for when I get off work late. The bartenders are friendly and professional. Love the spinach artichoke dip!
oisches! nuff said

i like this place. service is very nice. good food, good atmosphere
always a great place to go, best bartenders in the city.

good food, worth the long wait to get seated

Old Ebbitt Grill has long been my go-to restaurant for taking friends and family visiting from out of town who want to see all things DC. OEG is a DC tradition for me and folks usually ask me to take them there (or just assume its on the itinerary) when they plan a visit to DC.Tony is assume. He remembers me every time I come in and it makes me feel special - -my friends think I'm hooked up in DC :) Highly recommend OEG.
Orca Platter.Enough said.
They have very good food and are a staple of DC
wow
I absolutely love the food here, especially for brunch!

An all time classic. Great atmosphere and class for the decor inside. The food is perfect American fare done right and everyone working here is friendly. This restaurant is a fixture and well worth your time.
fab, fab, fab
A must! Excellent crab cakes!
Delicious Oysters at happy hour
Really cool place. Neat history and great oysters.

God food. The best I've had in a year, at least. Bravo Ebbitt Grill. It's only a block from the White House and not too far from the Mall area. The Metro is only a few blocks away so it's also very convenient. This is a must see.
Today was my first time here. I had a great experience. The staff was friendly and I loved the atmosphere. The restaurant was beautiful. Food was great!!

this review is primarily for the orcha platter (did I spell that correctly). once again new to yelp and just popping around on what some of my favorite spots and dishes are in DC and VA. the most fun deal in town after 11pm when its half price. my fiancÃ© and I love hitting up good ol ebbitt after a tuff day to enjoy this decadent treat. never surprise to me that the Clydes group is one the strongest groups in the area
One of the few places open late night on a Sunday and the burgers are the bomb.

Great atsmosphere, great food, and great service - what more could you want? Touted as the "oldest saloon in Washington", it has a decor that definitely reinforces how old the restaurant is (regardless of the fact that it has moved a few times over the many decades it has existed). It has some great art along the walls as well. I can only speak for the server I had, but he was incredibly generous, knowledgeable, funny, and there was never a moment where I was without drink. He was easily one of the best servers I've ever had, but I did not catch his name. Yes, it's a somewhat pricey restaurant, but it's well worth it. Overall, I highly recommend this spot for anyone who wants to have a nice date, or for a place to have a celebratory dinner. You won't be disappointed.

Old Ebbitt Midnight special deal is the best deal in DC!!! Orca platter which comes with 2 dozen oysters, 6 little neck clams, a dozen ginormous cocktail shrimp, 6 Jonah crab claws, and a lb of steamed lobster. Delicious!!!!!! So big! and 50% off! Love it
Great place! I love coming here for lunch and the service is always great!
Fantastic food, historic atmosphere and good times!
Delicious crab cake platter with Julienne veggie salad Nice service for one person at the bar.
Great food and wonderful servers!
Always consistent, great place to take out of town guests!
Been one of our favorite spots for some time now. And they never disappoint. The staff is very friendly and the seafood is always on point! Highly recommend it.

The meal was fabulous although different from the online Restaurant Week menu. This was the second time I ate there and both experiences were similar. The staff was kindness personified. They made you comfortable and their upbeat attitude and friendliness added to my enjoyment of going there. The wine pairing was equally as good as the food.
Beautiful food. Lovely setting. Very friendly and helping waiter. Would definately recommend.
Best steak I have had in a long time. The portions are huge and for the quality of the food, I actually found the prices to be really reasonable. Would definitely return next time I'm in DC.

The ambiance is dark and cozy. Staff was extremely attentive and our server, Nigel, was courteous and informative. Crab cake appetizer, porterhouse for two and goose fat potatoes were to die for and I can't wait to head back to try other menu items. The chocolate cake was enough to feed four and absolutely amazing.

The service is excellent : we were quickly sitted and the waiter was nice and fun. The food itself is not outstanding, but it's good and not too expensive.
A classic experience.
old fashioned. crab cakes. draftbeer.great spot.
service is wonderful. food and environment are both great! I will definitely go there again.
Very nice

I came in for lunch yesterday, and boy, did I have a fantastic time. I sat at the "Oyster Bar", and Sarah gave such great service. She recommended the rueben and a beer called Atlas. Both were great! I was there alone and she kept me company with great conversation, she is one of thekindest bartenders I have had inDC.  I will definitely be back to see her again, and maybe try some oysters mext time!

I stopped in here with eight of my colleagues during a trip to DC. We didn't have a reservation and they were BUSY, but we only waited 5 minutes to be seated. Our waiter was incredibly attentive, especially to those in my party that had food allergies. He told us about the restaurant history and was so helpful with the menu. I ordered a cheeseburger and it was amazing. We all enjoyed our food/drinks and the squid appetizer was delicious. This is the best customer service experience I have ever had in DC, I will definitely return!

So yummy!! Kind of pricey, but definitely worth it!
Great service, great food.

We had dinner at the Old Ebbitt Grill and absolutely loved it!!! Prices are good considering location, service and food (3mins walk from The White House). First of all food was delicious, did not have any problems there. Also with the amount of people there, the food only took about 15 minutes to come. The only thing i would have to say is that we ordered a burger without bacon and they gave it to us with bacon, however they made us a new one with our request and did not charge us for the dish! All in all, i highly recommend this restaurant.
Great food, great service, great atmosphere an all around great time!! Would come back again!!
Always good food and atmosphere.
Crab and Artichoke Dip! GET. IT. Delicious!!
The best for seafood lovers

We  had such a wonderful time at Old Ebbitt's Grill. Let me start off by saying that I made a reservation 3 weeks prior to going bc we were coming in from CA for the 4th of July. So glad I did that! It was so mobbed you couldn't move in there. We got there about 15 minutes early and as busy as they were, we got seated by the time our reservation time came up. Our waiter was great but did try to upsell us on everything. Food was great. We had oysters (in July) which were really awesome, the chicken wings were so good, my husband had a GF pasta dish which was great, I had the crab cakes which were very good, my son had the Angel Hair with shrimp which he loved. My daughter had the buffalo chicken sandwich and she thought it was super good including the fries that came with it. So it was a great experience. Food was a little slow coming out bc it was a holiday but a great experience overall.
Food: AmazingService: AmazingAmbiance: AmazingAll in all, it was a great experience. Not too expensive.
One of my favorites! Im always at old Ebbitt!
Love their crab cakes!
Love the raw bar!
Excellent food, excellent service, and a lively and fun atmosphere. What more could you want?
Great food, drinks and atmosphere. Will definitely be going back.
Consistently delicious! Love this place!

Great food in a nice atmosphere. Our waiter was prompt and kept coming back to the table to see if we needed anything. Fast water refill and drink service. Food came out as expected and was tasty. Would definitely recommend to anyone. A dc must.

Incredible old world feel. You literally feel like you've stepped in a different world. Loved the oysters and the drinks were nice and strong. Definitely going back for the food and of course the people watching.
Great everything! Drinks, food, staff!
Old style restaurant. Very big and lively. They said there was a 30 minute wait, but we were seated after about ten minutes. Service was excellent and the food was great. Definitely would go back.

The best place in DC for food and drink. I've been coming here for thirteen years and have ventured out to other establishments but no one can compare to the quality and reasonableness of their prices and rich atmosphere.
fantastic food and drink if you can put up with the tourists
Just my favorite place ever. Best place to take visitors to DC.
As always, fab.

HI I guess I should have said which doc bresslers office my daugfhters go to. we visit the south philly office.  once again great place and we'll see you in six months!  johnnie bee baker jr
GREAT FOOD, GREAT PLACE, Last of the originlal seafood houses in Washington, DC!
So fun! Excellent service, real DC feel. I always have a great time.Don't miss out on the back bar!!!

I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, Old Ebbitt Grill! In case you can't tell. I was just there last week celebrating the return of my other half from a tour in Afghanistan. I requested that they personalized the menu, last minute, and they made it happen. The restaurant even placed a thank you note on the table thanking him for his service! It was unexpected and awesome! They have one of the best seafood happy hours in the area--1/2 price raw bar items! All of the food is great! I haven't had anything that I didn't like. Try it, you will love it!
Oyster Happy Hour. That's all I do here.

I will drive from my home to the Old Ebbitt, just for lunch...and its hours. This is my FAVORITE place to eat in the city. The Oyster stew...its beyond words.My most recent trip, with my granddaughter and her friend, was no exception. And the childrens menu, which usually lacks in a place like this restaurant, didn't. I'll keep coming back, its wonderful.
Great food!

Great chicken sandwiches, and good bread. Their special sauce is delicious. The restaurant was pretty clean with no outlying issues. I enjoyed their scenery, it definetely has a very classy feel. Great spot for a date, or to go with a loved one. My wife loved it.
The crab cakes alone are worth it!
Went before a concert at DAR, it was perfect!

This has to be one of the best restaurants in America and rightly deserved its place next to the White House (I heard Obama's even eaten here before!). If you go there for Happy Hour (I believe between 2-6) all of the seafood is 50% off!!!!! I ordered the shrimp, oyster, and clam shell. I'm not much of a clam person, but the shrimp and oysters were perfect. Another great recommendation is their cannelloni. This place was so good that I came back twice during my 3 day stay in DC. Will definitely return and would love to see one open up in Orange County, CA (where I'm from).
Great food for good prices in DC.

This place is super classic!! Old fancy DC style-- I loved it! Great martinis and happy hours and great people watching. Our waitress was super fun and friendly. It's not my favorite place for eating, but a perfect place to have a cocktail or glass of wine before or after dinner. Great for if you are visiting DC.

Great place to grab breakfast or brunch when visiting the tourist spots in Washington DC. Very convenient.
