This was delicious!!! Especially after a great walk!!
Best Crab Cakes and Service in DC!

Wow. I love this place. Have eaten dinner there twice and ordered the same thing: single crabcake, which comes with a warm mustard potato salad and green beans. Best crabcake (and aioli) that I've ever eaten!!The place is always crowded, but both times the waitresses have been friendly and very efficient. They serve bread after you order (always nice) and water glasses have been refilled often on both of my visits. I've heard awesome things about the strip steak and rockfish (my friends raved about these), and good things about the sandwiches and burgers.Only negative: dessert could be better. My cappuccino brownie with ice cream would have been perfect if the brownie had been better, but it was pretty average. One friend also said the apple pie tasted store bought, which was disappointing.Overall - I highly recommend this place for dinner. Excellent food, great service, and relatively reasonable, especially for its location.
I took my grandparents and we all loved the food, service, and prices.
This is a very good choice. Very good quality food. Great service!!!
This is my Oyster joint! I've been a regular for months now Shout-out to the Old Ebbit staff! Derrick is the man. I LOVE this restaurant.
I don't think the Old Eazy needs my 5 stars, cuz the yelp rating is already beast. The breakfast is particularly awesome. Best Crab Benedict I've ever had.
Great food and environment.

It turns out THIS IS THE REAL NATIONAL TREASURE. The history and ambiance alone make this the mist interesting place I've ever eaten, they had original gas lamps illuminating the rooms, and African animal heads shot by Teddy Roosevelt himself are mounted above the bar. I barely remember what I ate, the people, location and environment were too overwhelming. (oh yes, it was bluemoon and crab artichoke dip, it's was good and well priced, but HOLY COW what a cool place)
Outstanding food and service. A must go.
Two words for Brunch.... The Chesapeake.
It was excellant all around, strongly recomment it
Delicious! Excellent menu and atmosphere. If in the area it is a must do!
We had our anniversary dinner here and loved it!
Great bartenders. Great service. Nuff said.
Love it here...always crowded and great food
A DC landmark! You can't miss!
Now this is what I'm talking about.
Excellent!!!
Spotless.  AlwaysGreat for easy buss lunch
Was there only at the bar for a drink, bartenders are very cool and nice. Definitely I will go back! Thumbs up!
Good atmosphere and food. Crabcakes were great.
Succulent lobster appetizer. Succulent.

The one of the great experience in DC. Great services, great food.... It was the only place my friend recommanded (more likely I must to visit) for dining... It was great. I did not make a reservation, so i waited about an hour.. totally worth it. crab cakes was wonderful, oysters, desserts... everything was great. I will definitely go back.
I went for a charity function on the roof. The roof was great but afterwards I ate dinner and was seated in the atrium, i would recommend sitting in the restaurant.

One of the best place in DC to bring people from out of town, or just for a nice lunch.  The raw bar is amazing, especially the oysters!  The bar is great for people watching local celebrities and politicians.
Amazing.
This place had the only blonde brownie and it was delicious!

Yesterday I had lunch at The Smith in Washington DC and unfortunately, my experience was far from satisfactory. Upon being seated, it took an excruciating 15 minutes for our server to even approach our table to take our order. To add insult to injury, it then took an additional 15 minutes for our drinks to arrive.The true disappointment came when we requested more mustard, only to be informed by our server that they had run out and there were no more available in the restaurant. This response left me baffled, considering the brunch menu prominently featured Eggs Benedict, a dish that typically includes hollandaise sauce containing mustard. Refusing to accept this explanation, I approached one of the managers on the floor and was promptly provided with the mustard we had requested. It was evident that our server simply didn't want to be bothered with fulfilling our request initially.The overall service was abysmal, characterized by lethargy and negligence. Given the price tag of $24 for a burger at a restaurant of this caliber, one would expect impeccable service and at the very least, adequate condiments readily available. Unfortunately, The Smith fell far short of meeting these expectations, leaving a bitter taste in my mouth long after the meal had concluded.
What's the point in making a reservation for 545 if they don't seat you until 620. Unacceptable.
Burger/fries delivered. $30. Burger overcooked, impossibly sloppy, stale bun. Fries limp and unsalted. Really lousy.

Awful service, three different servers "helped me" review the menu when I was ready to order (I still don't know who my server was by the end of the meal). The food came out cold and the ice cream on my dessert was melted. Careless waitstaff and bad food made for a terrible experience. Host wasn't paying attention when I was leaving, I wanted to speak with a manager but all I saw were white shirts fooling around. I won't be back.
Food was not good. Service was even worse! I would not recommend this restaurant at all! Drinks were good!
The staff didn't seem too interested in taking our order, so we left. They were not busy at all. We will likely try again, but didn't want to deal with slowness today.
High prices, average quality. In addition to this, the restaurant is VERY loud. Given there are many other better restaurants in the area, I would not recommend it or go back.
Slow service bread not served or strawHad to wait a while to get bill to check out
Tasty, but not quite tasty enough for the prices.particularly good drinks and desserts.
The service was great, the food is good but it's so loud you can't hear the person next to you speaking.
Pretty place, nice bar, and mediocre food.

I took my boyfriend out here the other night for a steak dinner. I was impressed by this place in general, it was easy to see that the servers were really trying but the chefs could've picked up some slack. My steak here wasn't as well done as I expected it to be, and that made it way different from what I'm used to when it comes to steaks. Hopefully when I come back some other time they'll get it right.
Cute and good! Love that you can get a cocktail with your meal. Would visit again if needed

The Smith across from the Smithsonian in DC is a popular place and the food is really good. If you are looking for great food, here's the place. If you are wanting to converse with anyone at your table, it may be very challenging. It is very noisy. The prices may knock you over so don't come here looking for casual prices. But the food is definitely good and the servers and all of the staff I found to be very friendly and helpful. The ambience is nice however, not a romantic place due to the noise. But if visiting DC and you dont footing the bill, this is flavorful and you can keep the prices down by not drinking. There is something for everyone.

The oldest restaurant and bar in DC!The place is a classic American spot, but it does not feel stuffy at all. The people are also pretty friendly, and the food is pretty solid as well!I came for brunch with my GF and we split an egg's benedict and a french toast. The eggs benedict was nothing special, but the French toast was great!
CLASSIC NO OTHER WORDS NEEDED. I always go for late night sushi and it never disappoints
I had a brunch with my girls last weekend. The food was great good atmosphere. The service was good. It's usually packed so make sure to make a reservation before!
Great vibes, awesome server, amazing food. The only small complaint I have is that it's really loud inside.
Went here today for brunch, and the food was AMAZING. However, my server was subpar. We had to keep asking for basics like silverware, etc.
This was a great place, highly recommend. The staff were pleasant and the food was great!
Really friendly staff. The food was great, and the bartenders knew their drinks. My steak was bit undercooked, but it was still juicy and flavorful. Definitely recommend
The food was great! Drinks take some time, but a decent and varied cocktail is a choice.

Loving the entire place, especially the interiors. . Loved the pork chop- a delicate selection that tasted exceptionally good. It was nice and delicious. It's not too pricey. They have a decent price. Looking forward to coming again.
Business is quite busy but food is great. Waiter messed up with our dishes but size is very large
LOVE That Fried chicken sandwich! it was so bomb!
Good food and better service. Great place for lunch.
The service at the bar was amazing! Amethyst knew the menu inside and out and made great cocktails. Will definitely be coming back!

I visited this location recently and the entire experience was divine. The greeter was so kind, I sat at the bar and had wonderful recommendations from the bartender. They were out of their Chenin Blanc so the bartender brought me two tasters of similar wines, with his recommendation of the Gr¨¹ner. Chenin Blanc will now be taking a backseat from now on. I had their oysters of the day and ultimately had the Spicy Shrimp Scampi which was incredible, so flavorful. It took a lot of willpower to not return again before flying back home. Overall an amazing experience, highly recommend to anyone in the area.
Great food, great service. Great atmosphere. Highly recommend this place. Had a great selection of drinks as well.
Amazing environment, but even better food. My entire party finished our plates, would go here again and again
The food was great the salad was great The employees were friendly and helpful The restaurant is clean
The gnocchi and the mojito. The gnocchi and the mojito. The gnocchi and the mojito. The gnocchi and the mojito. The gnocchi and the mojito.
Brunch was amazing. Get the benedicts - any of them. The service is phenomenal as well
This is my absolute favorite restaurant. The food is always fantastic and no matter what I order I am always delighted with my meal!
Phenomenal experience. Top notch food, atmosphere, and wait staff. Have been here multiple times, and every time is an amazing experience all around.
Had our wedding anniversary here and they took the time to write a card for us. The food was amazing and the staff was great. They perfectly described each dish and wine paring. Thanks a lot.

Avocado toast is a popular and simple dish that features mashed or sliced avocado served over toasted bread. It has gained immense popularity recently due to its delicious taste, nutritional benefits and versatility, Avocado toast is typically made by toasting bread until it reaches your desired level of crispiness. Many people like to sprinkle salt, pepper, and sometimes other spices like red pepper flakes, chili powder, or lemon juice into their avocado for added flavour. I love the crispness of it.
Avocado Toast and Caesar Salad are two of my personal favorites
Amazing atmosphere and service. The food was fantastic and fresh I would go back! 10/10

Love the nostalgic decor and the menu at this place. The food is excellent, and you can find something familiar yet delicious. I tried the Chicken Milanese, which tasted more like chicken parmesan, accompanied by delicious zucchini. My date had the gnocchi and thoroughly enjoyed it. The noise level can get a bit high due to the hard surfaces, so I recommend sitting indoors for a great experience.

The Smith in Washington DC is an exquisite culinary delight, striking a perfect balance in its menu with an array of impressive seafood options. The stunning spectacle of a bar, complete with a striking wall of bottles, is an absolute feast for the eyes.My dining experience at The Smith was a gastronomic journey, featuring some of their standout dishes. The calamari was expertly prepared, while the Mac & Cheese was so good that it's my top recommendation for anyone visiting. But the star of the show, in my opinion, were the fish tacos - incredibly flavorful and easily the best I've ever had.I also tried the Squid Ink Tagliatelle and Roasted Salmon, both of which were excellent. Each dish was beautifully presented, and the flavor profiles were complex and satisfying.My dining experience was rounded off with a 'City Bird' mocktail. Despite being a tad pricier than I'd usually go for, its unique and refreshing flavor made it worth the indulgence.Overall, The Smith provides an unforgettable dining experience, combining an enticing menu, remarkable ambiance, and outstanding service. The Mac & Cheese alone is worth the visit, but the entire experience is one that shouldn't be missed. I can't wait to return for another spectacular meal.
I believe they have the next chicken sandwich I've ever eaten. Service was excellent.
Food was delicious. Service was great.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
Great ambience and atmosphere. Nice music playing in the background that's not loud to conversate. Great menu that's great for sharing. Nice options for drinks & food. Definitely recommend.

Oh my goodness, I have found my new DC Brunch spot! I always heard so much about their locations in Manhattan from my friends up north so figured I had to give their DC location a try. Gosh am I happy that I did. The food was incredible, best Ranchero Scramble I've ever had in my life. Also their secret recipe in the Bloody Mary was pretty amazing as well. Brunch Cocktail included with a dish order? Sign me up! Will be coming back and visiting very soon. Keep up the great service!
You need to make a reservation if you want to get a good table. The service is great.
What a great brunch. Had the shrimp and grits brunch with the mule drink. Everything was excellent.

One of the best brunch meals I've had in my life. The Benedict Johnny is an amazing and unique take on a eggs benedict dish. My husband loved the shrimp & grits. Their Bloody Mary's are good, but not the best I've had as it was not spicy in my opinion. I would definitely recommend this place though!
Good place, ambient. Delicious food, good prices. Stuff are friendly and ready to help with your choice. Food serving was fast. This place deserve a good review. Excited to visit it every time.

I got a salad with blue cheese it was really good. The service was good. Overall a good experience with The Smith. I do not travel to downtown DC much but if you want something American like food this place is good.
It was a pretty good place, and the whole family really loves it! Been here many times, and I love every moment I'm here. The food has no equal
The service was great!!!!! And the food was amazing! If parking wasn't so bad I would go back today!!!
The food and service was great the waiter was able to answer all my questions about the menu.

Best place in DC so far! Bartenders are fantastic. Very friendly atmosphere and awesome drinks. Paden was amazing! Knowledgeable and nice. Burrata and gnocchi are to die for along with the sticky toffee pudding!!! Def a must when in DC!!!!

We came here randomly on a recommendation. Paden the bartender was over the top amazing. One will rarely get amazing service and such a friendly person. He made my girlfriends pre bday so amazing. Evander the other bartender was just as amazing making some of the best cocktails ever. Do not miss this stop or these two guys for laughs and fucking amazing drinks. Foods on point also

Small - but elegant and classy. I stumbled upon this place by accident, and I'm glad I did. Came on a Saturday night, but took less than five minutes to be seated. Our waitress was wonderful, and the food was delicious. I got the short rib pasta, and the s'mores in a jar. Both were great!
Fast service, burgers and curly fries are amazing, the location is close to everything and right on the waterfront - great spot for a stroll after lunch.
Having brunch at the Smith. Great atmosphere, great food and drinks! Highly recommended!!

Was in DC a few weeks ago for our first time. We found this awesome place online. Easy walk from subway. Amazing food, great atmosphere, and spectacular service. Sierra was our waitress. She was attentive, timely and sweet. Most servers would benefit from being like her. We give Sierra two thumbs up. And we give The Smith a resounding 5 stars!
Delicious sandwiches and salads. Nice vibe. Quick and friendly service.
Worst Chinese food I've had in many years... Food and services both suck. Not sure how they maintained their business for that many years. Highly Not recommended.

I will give a 0 star if I could. This is my worst experience in 25 years with Chinese restaurant. They had left over food reheated and served it to customers. I also saw the table next to me experiencing the same thing. This is disgusting and nobody should go to this restaurant.
"Manager" is a sarcastic douche that thinks he's funny. Asked about tea and replied with, there is no such thing as free lunch
The table sevice was very bad. A bad restaurant. Worst experience ever in any chinese restaurant.

I have to say that our waitress is really annoying and RUDE. It is probably not rude by Chinese standard, but by US standard, it is encroaching on our privacy way too much. It was not possible for me to even have private conversation. That made me very sick. What we want to order to eat and at what pace is really not her business. Stay away or have your food to go.

After reading the good reviews we decided to give this place a try. The crispy roast pork tasted like they were deep-fried as the skin was almost too hard. The sauteed squid in XO sauce was fairly tasty even though the sauce was a tad too sweet. The "squid" tasted more like reconstituted rather than fresh. We initially ordered a sauteed spinach but the server recommended the snow pea shoot so we ordered that instead. The green leafy vegetable was a little overboiled and didn't have enough garlic so it was just salty with no other flavor. When we got the bill we were shocked that the snow pea shoots cost the same as the squid, $20.95. That's the most expensive plate of plain, simple, green veg with garlic I've had anywhere in the world.

I went to DC,want to try some traditional chinese food.,searched from YELP. food was delicious,size was big.I have to deduct 2star because I find their sales tax almost 9.2% when I back home .is it DC sales tax higher than NY.

One of my friends recommended this place to me, I was told this is best dim sun place to go! Maybe I set my expectation to high, it turned out I could rate this place maximum 3 stars! My first issue is the service, I felt I was rushed to place an order fast ,and eat fast after the order was served! The second issue is the price, yep, the store is located on 14th st and has a lots of customers waiting to be seated, but I think most of the items on menu are overpriced including the dim sum ! Not a pleasant dinning experience at all !
Great service, and very quick. However, the food was not great. Definitely seemed authentic though.
Dinner dim sum menu has all of the classic favorites. Service is fast and friendly, and ordering is a breeze. The restaurant had large tables for bigger parties but also a nice bar area.

Awesome dim sum and Chinese food conveniently located in the middle of DC. The service is quick and food was really delicious. The portion sizes for the dishes is also generous. I'm come back anytime.
The food is fine. The service is average. We were there before 10:00 am., parking wasn't too bad. You could park on the street.
We're very disappointed to find out the place has been closed since December 16th, 2020.
Good food. Not the best I've had in the area but worth stopping in if everywhere else is busy.

Two friends and I came in for Dim Sum on a Sunday, and as expected, there was a wait. In anticipation, we got a buzzer, and walked down to Churchkey for a beer, and came back when the buzzer alerted us when our table was ready. I liked the convenience of being able to take that with us and grab a drink while we waited.Hostess asked us if we preferred our own table, or didn't mind sitting with another party. We chose the latter, and sat at a round table with another group of 2. The black tea/oolong tea wasn't as strong as i was used to, but still comforting. The carts moved throughout the space, and we were able to choose the items we wanted from the menu with relative ease. Crispy Pork with Hoisin, and the Shrimp Dumplings were our favorites! Many of the items here were delicious, and with a touch of soy sauce and hot chili oil, really set them over the edge. A miss on the menu was the chicken feet, but not just because they were chicken feet. I'm unsure of how they were cooked, but they were oversauced and didn't have a super enjoyable texture, and I was the only one to partake in eating them (about 1/3 of the portion). One small detractor I would mention is that sometimes the service staff who was pushing one of the specific carts, would get requests for something not specifically on their cart. For example, the employee running the steamed item cart spent 2-3 minutes trying to find a vegetable item for the other people at our table. It slowed the process down slightly, but otherwise the service staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating. Overall, I enjoyed my experience and food. It was a first time at Dim Sum for one of my friends, and he said that the food "opened up a new world and experience for brunch" that he wanted to pass on to his friends! If I'm ever in DC for Dim Sum again, this is the place i will default to. Will be back in the future! ºÜºÃ

The food here is great, it's always busy but service it great. There are women pushing carts of various dim sum you can choose from. This is definitely not a place you can lounge and talk. Definitely need to eat and leave because its loud and lines of people are waiting to be seated. The food isn't too greasy and the prices are pretty cheap. I highly recommend the spare ribs and the rice noodle wrapped shrimp.
Inexpensive, tasty dim sum. Good alternative to going into VA.

Not sure if all dim sum is suppose taste like this but have to say..im a fan. The egg tart was on point. Kind of like Chinese food but of the upscale sort,although I did see the manager/owner going in and out of the kitchen next door to the carryout Chinese joint "Yums" must be the same owner lol

Decent cart-based dim sum in DC proper.  In case anyone's wondering, the name means "Big Red Robe".  The service and front staff were helpful and friendly. Despite a line for dim sum, seating was pretty efficient with a buzzer system. The color photo and bilingual dim-sum ordering sheet with prices was a welcome upgrade from notepad style lists. Also we were quite impressed that the restaurant and bathrooms were very clean. Our group had a baby carriage, there's a baby changing station, and the staff were very accomodative with the table seating. They have round tables, too.Now for the food. If you're a true dim sum connoisseur it won't be the best you've ever had, but it's still very good and certainly fills the bill. You can find better dim sum in the DC suburbs in terms of taste, ingredients, and value. For example the sticky rice in bamboo leaves was fragrant, but lacked a lot of tasty ingredients that other dimsum restaurants have, and not much filling either. Many items at this restaurant are priced outlandishly high, even higher than most similar New York restaurants, presenting a value problem here. Gratuity was not automatically added, and the service was really very attentive so they certainly deserve credit for that.
All kinds of authentic Asian cuisine, I like them. delicious and fresh, I order them as my snack, reasonable price, you can eat full.
This place is the best Chinese caf¨¦ what I meet, I think. I like Asian cuisine, so delicious and fresh, good service and good taste.
Very authentic chinese cuisine, They are delicious and fresh, taste good. I usually come here for my dinner when I off duty.
They are too much chinese flavor cuisine, I like this place, I enjoy the snakes , so delicious and authentic. service as well.
I love Chinese food, i went here last week when i was craving for it so bad and absolutely loved it!

It was a chilly windy day so Chinese and dumplings sounded just about perfect. Ordered the duck wonton soup which was delicious - great flavor and a perfect appetizer size. Also ordered the pork dumplings which were a bit doughy the flavor was good but they seemed like they weren't quite cooked properly and were a bit heavy. The pork and chive dumpling was a miss altogether - very heavy and the chives didn't seem to go with the pork. Relatively busy for a mid afternoon. Service was good up until I needed the bill and that took a bit.
Great food! But, I would give 5 stars if they didn't use MSG. That was the issue- felt sick afterwards.

Great Chinese food joint that has been around forever. When we got there they were also doing dim sum but didn't have a huge selection. Duck was very good and so was the shrimp/broccoli. Da Hong Pao is a great authentic Chinese restaurant. Upon being seated the server brings you Chinese picked daikon and carrots and a small dish of roasted peanuts seasoned with a touch of salt and sugar.

Visual signs you've found a possibly legit dim sum place.1. Little shopping carts that carry a variety of dim sum2. 80s cafeteria style d¨¦cor, which large tables that can be used to share dishes3. Lines Sunday morning before opening4. Seeing random groups being merged into large tables Bonus point: Owners with a "success perm" Foods.Our favorite dishes: shu mai (lots of filling) and the eggplant stuffed with shrimp. Okay dishes: turnip cake, noodle rolls/crepes (the BBQ one was a nice surprise)Skip-them dishes: the duck (super fatty and small portion), fried tofu If you're overwhelmed because you've never had dim sum, look up a guide or randomly pick!Annoying.1. They charge $4 for tea. 2. The large dim sum dishes (1/3 of the menu) are only served after 11am, so if you're coming at open (10am) to beat the lines you have to skip with the dishes. 3. I was expecting to see that kid from all the definitely non promotional pictures. But where was he?In sum.It's the closest thing we have to legit dim sum in DC, but it's not perfect.
Amazing dim sum. We go every year for Christmas Day lunch. This year the service wasn't so great but the food was amazing.
Ddlbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbnbbbnnnnnbnnnnnnnnnnnn-nnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn

My favorite dim sum spot in DC! I grew up eating dim sum every weekend in Flushing, Queens. Da Hung Pao is up there with my favorites. There are no carts, but the service is always very quick and the vibes are what you would expect from a sit down Chinese restaurant.

This is the best Chinese restaurant. The dim sum is delicious. They have so many options and for us visual foodies, they have a menu with pictures. The main Chinese dishes are more expensive than other places, but it's worth paying for. Also, the waiters are fast and friendly.
The food was fresh, delicious and the portions were large. Also there was no wait for our table!
First thing first, the food is delicious hence my rating. The service is a little slow but they also have a lot of demand is understandable. The ambiance overall is very nice put.
Favorite Dim Sum in DC! Usually not super busy, but I haven
Excellent quick service and tasty food! Lots of choices for every taste. Can't wait to return!
Food was amazing. Service was fast and friendly. Highly recommend. Every dish was fresh and delicious.

The dim sum was mostly of good quality, especially the shiu mai. The shiu mai had a good filling to dumpling skin ratio. I would add that we had to order from the menu because we came after the lunch hour, but the dimsum was still just as fresh and delicious!
Good find . Little bit of this and little bit of that . Good flavor and Washington DC is a place to go .

I had an outstanding experience here at Da Hong Pao. It's kinda the perfect location. The staff are always so friendly. Every single thing that we have purchased was very fresh and delicious. Totally recommend Da Hong Pao and we will definitely be back again.
location: Long Island City, New York, NY

text: Loved the flavor of everything we ordered. Food took no time to arrive at the table. First time but won't be the last time.
Amazing food and they serve you right when you sit down!! Make sure to check out the entire menu!
If you don't know what to eat in the morning, this Dim-sum place is the best choice. The food is so delicious and fresh! I love it. Highly recommended! I will be back with family next time!
best chinese food in dc!!!i love the chicken feet and the sevice is really good!!!highly recommended
Wide range of Cantonese dishes on the menu. Friendly service. Nice soup, vegetables, tofu and fish dishes. Served with Da Hung Pao tea of course.

I remember being so happy when this place opened and to date, it hasn't disappointed. This is the place you take your friends, family visiting. The food is freshly made, the portions are good, and the staff are on point. If you want to eat an offensive amount of good dim sum with a group of friends, go here.
I don't know why there are so many five-star reviews. Every dish is salty and not as delicious as expected. Compared to other Thai restaurants in DC, this one is not worth a second try.

We didn't have a reservation, so the receptionist told us to grab seats at the bar area. It wasn't the best Thai food I've ever had, even though it was supposed to be the top spot in the area. The vermicelli with chili peanut sauce I ordered was kind of bland, which was a bummer. The coconut ice cream for dessert was pretty unique - a mix of salty and sweet. I also tried the tapioca chicken dumplings for an appetizer, which was interesting. The bar service was awesome though! Thanks!

Frozen cocktails were delicious we tried them for restaurant week we got the pork skewers with peanut sauce and the chicken shrimp pockets skewers were solid, tons of shrimp fish flavor in the pockets - nicely fried though. I got the green curry, it was very flavorful.
We ordered 5 dishes. The 3 chicken dishes were above average but the vegetarian dishes were not good at all. Wouldn't returnFood: 3/5 | Service: 4/5 | Atmosphere: 5/5
Great restaurant! I do recommend it. Service was excellent and food was delicious.It was served at a perfect temperature.Everything was fresh and tasty.

We highly recommend this restaurant as an option for dining near Gallery Place or Judiciary Square. The food was delicious, with reasonable prices. The interior is beautiful and spacious. The tables are far enough apart that you can talk to and hear your friends. The service also was friendly. We definitely will return.

Managed to secure a last-minute dinner reservation following a major event near the convention center. Overall, the dining experience was delightful, and I'd be eager to return to explore more of their diverse menu offerings if I find myself in the area again!During our visit, we savored their special beef jerky, papaya salad, and khao soi. We opted for the medium spice level, which provided a satisfying kick, greatly appreciated by both my boyfriend and me. However, it's worth noting that the service was a bit sluggish, particularly since we were informed of a time limit due to another reservation following ours.The ambiance at this establishment is casual yet suitable for a romantic evening. Fortunately, we managed to secure an outdoor table on their patio to enjoy the pleasant weather, so I recommend sitting outside when the conditions allow.

Amazing find! We were so pleased to stumble upon this place by accident. It was a full house but they found us a table. The food was the authentic, interesting menu, enjoyed our meal. Service was impeccable. Menu lacking in desserts but this did not spoil the experience. Will definitely return.
Great food, amazing food and service but needs to be cleaner. The floor was sticky and the napkins smelled so bad.

Great food and more than reasonable price! Each appetizer is around 10 dollars and each main dish is around 20, each beer is around 8-10. The flavor is authentic, the portion is great, the atmosphere is great, and staff is very friendly. Great experience!
This place is great! Food is very good and fresh. The environment is good as well. The staff is friendly!

The best Thai restaurant I've visited! Everything I ordered was excellent, and the service was equally impressive - fast and attentive. The food was prepared perfectly, and the prices were reasonable given the quality of the cuisine, service, and overall atmosphere. I've tried 3 of the 4 desserts with my sister, and they were all delicious. We're eager to return and sample the rest of the menu. My favorites so far are the mango salad and fried pumpkin starters, as well as the fried bronzino (served as a fillet) and Chicken Khao Soi for the main dishes. While they don't offer pad Thai, I'm confident the rest of the menu items will be just as impressive. This restaurant is a must-visit for authentic, high-quality Thai fare.

Baan Siam: A Culinary DelightI recently dined at Baan Siam in DC and was thoroughly impressed. The food, service, and atmosphere were exceptional, earning a well-deserved 5-star rating. The Northern Thai cuisine is authentic and flavorful, with standout dishes like the crispy lotus root and grilled shrimp salad, and branzino choo chee curry. The restaurant's decor is stunningly beautiful and modern, creating a perfect setting for a memorable dining experience. Highly recommend for anyone looking to enjoy exquisite Thai food in a fantastic ambiance.

Eating at Baan Siam is a culinary journey that transports diners to the heart of Thailand with its exquisite cuisine and warm ambiance. The open kitchen concept invites guests to witness the magic happening behind the scenes, adding an extra layer of excitement to the dining experience. The decor is simple, yet modern with touches of elegance adorning every corner, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere that strikes the perfect balance between low-key and upscale.But it's the food that truly steals the show at Baan Siam. Each dish we tried was bursting with authentic flavors and expertly crafted using traditional Thai techniques. I absolutely was mind-blown by the Khao soi g¨¤i (Egg noodles, chicken thigh, pickled cabbage, scallions, red onion, and northern Thai chili paste). My coworker had a beef soup that came with garlic rice that was also a delicious stand out. We couldn't get over how every bite was better than the last.Adding to the exceptional experience is the professional and attentive staff, who elevate the dining experience with their impeccable service and genuine hospitality. Whether you're a seasoned Thai food enthusiast or a newcomer to the cuisine, the staff at Baan Siam are always on hand to guide you through the menu and ensure that every aspect of your meal is nothing short of perfection.And let's not forget about the convenient location, making Baan Siam the perfect choice for a leisurely lunch or a memorable dinner outing for anyone near downtown. Whether you're in the mood for a casual meal with friends or a romantic evening with a loved one, Baan Siam delivers on every front, promising an unforgettable dining experience that will leave you coming back for more.

One of the most outstanding Thai restaurants I've had the pleasure of visiting. The pad Thai with chicken was truly spectacular, featuring delightfully tender chicken, egg noodles, and a perfectly spiced sauce. The establishment is spacious, with a generous outdoor seating area, although it tends to get quite crowded. Without a reservation, we ended up at the bar, but it turned out to be a cozy spot. The prices are more than reasonable given the quality and quantity of the dishes.During weekdays from 5-7 PM, there's a happy hour offering draft beers for $5, with a variety to choose from. The staff is exceptionally friendly. The ambiance is beautifully decorated, and despite the lively atmosphere, it allows for comfortable conversations. I highly recommend it and might find myself back soon. The bonus sticky rice mango dessert was heavenly, making it an ideal spot for a date night.

On a Friday night, my wife and I arrived without a reservation, and the wait for a table was estimated to be 45 minutes to an hour. However, they managed to seat us at the bar within just 10 minutes. Opting for the Green Curry Chicken, we found it to be quite good with just the right amount of heat. Surprisingly quick service--we received our meals within 15 minutes despite the bustling crowd. The decor was an intriguing blend of traditional and modern elements.
Excellent Food, friendly service, great atmosphere. Highly recommend. Love the circle bar!

An elegant Thai-inspired restaurant that offers a range of dishes not commonly found in traditional Thai establishments. The food is exceptional and presented with exquisite taste. The service is top-notch as well. While the portions may be slightly smaller, it's the quality of the cuisine that truly shines at this establishment.
My wife and I always make our way to this place when we're in DC. One of our favorite restaurants!

Hands down! Best I ate in DC. From appetizers to main courses and deserts, everything was spot on! Service was great, something came out fast. This restaurant is perfect for any occasion. Definitely going back there with friends and family.
The food was absolutely amazing. Great service as well.
Thank you we will visit your place
so great£¡i will definitely come Again£¡£¡service is also good£¡£¡highly recommend to everyone
This place is absolutely amazing, food was soo good - home-made authentic Thai food. Can't wait to come back.
Food is on the hot side but overall very good!

If you are looking for spicy, delicious, authentic noodle cuisine then Baan Siam is the place. Food had a burst of flavors. Green Mango Salad and Pad Thai were amazing. In the main course, don't forget to try their Tom Yum Noodle Soup. The food was beautifully presented and the staff is also super friendly. I am definitely going to recommend this place for your next friend meet up.
Great food, great ambiance, great service, and everything was delicious. Came here with 3 friends and we all were very happy with our food!

Everything we ate was fresh and delicious. The award-winning chefs use the best quality ingredients to produce dishes that are simply delightful. The restaurant also offers a wonderful drink menu, and they offer one of the best wines in the region. The drinks are pricey but surely worth sampling.In contrast, however, the service was not of the highest quality. It seemed to me that the waiters were not very engaged or interested in their jobs. But the owner seemed very warm and thoughtful. He came around to check on our experience and seemed to be authentically engaged.Notwithstanding the disinterested waters, I highly recommend this restaurant. The food is delicious and the atmosphere is brilliant.

We love Thai food, and this was delicious. We both requested side dishes to go with our main courses, and our waitress assisted us in meeting our demands. Place is clean and well kept. You feel very comfortable there and accommodated really well.
The pictures speak for themselves! You HAVE to get dessert. Food came out quickly and the food portions were enough to share
Unquestionably the best Thai food I've had in the U.S. and maybe even the best Thai food I've ever had.
The most delicious and authentic Thai food I have found in the US.

Guys, my passion for shrimps was fully satisfied here - the tender sauce they add in is amazing, great flavors!I fell in love with their triangular dishes (how weird is that?..) and the staff is super friendly.Thanks for the lovely dinner, will definitely be back!
Amazing Thai!!! So happy they opened, definitely one of the best thai spots in the city! Highly recommend.

I have to admit, Baan Siam was definitely awesome. The atmosphere in this place is so welcoming. Every thing that I have tried was really great and I would come again to have it again! I became great friends with the staff, who are all awesome and super pleasant. All in all Baan Siam has great experience, great staff, great spot, reasonable price.
You have become one of my favorite places for lunch. Thank you for the amazing food!
New favorite Thai Restaurant in DC!
Bad drink optionsNo root beer. No root beer. No root beer. No root beer. NO ROOT BEER
Rudest staff ever Tall dark guy with dreads was the worst of then all Fuck him Would return to DC but not the hotel Service sucks

Chose to spend my boyfriends bday here and made a reservation a month in advance leaving a special request for them to do something for his bday. As we enter I remind the host it is his bday and they understand. We are seated and both enjoy and expensive dinner and watch as people next to us are given desert with a candle and sing happy bday. We order desert expecting the same and instead a food runner shoved the desert onto the table without a word and no candle or anything. Never choose to spend your bday here when there are so many better options. Disgusted and never returning.

One of the worst experiences in years. After submitting our name and told it was ten minutes the same person came to us 20 minutes later and asked if we were waiting for a table. We were then taken to the dining area and sat amongst 4 empty tables. A new waitress (as she told us) took our drink orders. As she distributed them she dropped a glass of red wine down my entire left arm. Luckily I had my napkin on my lap so it saved my pants. The other staff member told me they would pay to dry clean my white dress shirt. Not sure they understand what a red wine stain does to a white shirt. The manager was then called over and offered to give me a restaurant T-shirt to wear as I was soaked. He gives me his card and offers to dry clean or replace the shirt. He disappeared for 15 minutes with a 3XL and another shirt. I go to the men's room and the smaller shirt is to small. I put back on my wet and stained dress shirt. I never see the manger again. We eat our meals and ask to settle up. The waiter who took over for the waitress says he will speak to the manger. I ask to speak to him as well. The waiter comes back and no manager but he thinks the meal is free. At this point I've had enough and we leave. I look for the manger on the way out but no sign of him.Thanks to the waiter who took over a bad situation. You are to be commended. The rest of the staff including the manger are lacking to say the least.

Went out with the girls this past Sunday night. I switched purses and realized when we entered that I didn't have my ID in my cute little purse for outings. At the bar the bar tender had to be flagged down after sitting for quite some time. When taking orders and he got to mine he asked for ID. I had my business credit card which someone under 21 wouldn't have. He wouldn't accept that, which was fine that he was sticking with the rules even though I'm almost 40 so clearly not underage. Problem was as we decided to leave to get me to my other bag so we could enjoy our night he looked annoyed. As we walked away, he shouted "Gotta have your id ma'am," for the whole bar to hear. Scolding me like I'm some child. It was completely unnecessary. I've never been so embarrassed over something so ridiculous. I had actually had a really great dinner here in the past, but due to this experience I won't be back. Thanks tall blondish jerk of a bar tender.

Tried this place out becasue they were the only restaurant in the area with a full menu after midnight. Unfortunately after being sat it was a downhill experience from there. We order bottle of wine from our server Javier. When he approached the table he seemed a little drunk but i wasnt to sure. After 15 minutes goes by we remind him about the bottle of wine. He ask which was was it again and we told him. After 10 minutes he comes back to get our order still no bottle of wine. We order apps and entrees and continue to wait. After 10 more minutes goes by there are still no apps or wine. We hear the table behind us complain that the same server has lost one of thier credit cards and after another 10 minutes we decide its not worth it and decide to leave. I have been to the Hamilton before but I have only sat at the bar and after such a horrible experience Im not sure if I will ever come back. If I do it I will only in dine at the bar.
I guess I was expecting better .... I much rather go the the howard theater....

I can't stand this lousy place! I wish that dang Borders was still here instead. The staff is rude and abrupt. Instead of a classy place, it is filled with ghetto-wannabe losers who are looking for the nearest designer jacket to steal (lost another one here). There is NO music that I noticed or if there was it certainly was nothing to remember. There is a sheer lack of ambiance... why is DC society giving these people their money?! I'd love to see this place close down and bring in some better real estate.
Terrible!!! One word to describe the food and the service. Never again!!!

Good luck if you have a reservation. I'd give zero stars if I could. After walking around town to see the holiday tree displays, our group of 10 arrived for an 8:30 reservation. The lobby area was quite full, with no seating, and the adjacent bar area was packed to capacity. So loiter in the lobby we did. After 10 minutes we inquired and were told they're sorry, running behind. After 15 minutes, the same. After 20 we were told the party at the table they were going to seat us at were staying beyond their expected time and there was nothing they could do. Meanwhile, we had lost 3 people who were just too hungry to wait while two adjacent 4-top tables sat empty for at least 15 minutes past our group shrinking down to 8. At 8:55 we called The Elephant and Castle a short distance away and were told we could be seated right away. We left and were glad we did. The host and hostess working on 12/18/2012 could not have cared less. NO ONE IN OUR GROUP OF 10 WILL RETURN. EVER. Have I mentioned that reservations were made 3 weeks prior and required a firm head count and a credit card to hold the reservation--we were told we'd be charged for no shows. I would have loved for The Hamilton to hold their customers in as high regard as they hold themselves. ASTOUNDINGLY TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE.

Yes, the place is huge but that also means they can't control the wandering pick pocket. My jacket was hanging on the hook on my booth. A "black guy with a grey hat" picked my wallet and immediately used my credit card and debit card to buy $240 worth of metro fare. Then tried to use it at the Shell station on Benning Road where he was declined (I canceled my card). Another coward with no soul. The manager said he had the entire incident on security camera but the quality was not good so neither he nor the responding police officer could get a clear description beyond a "black guy in a grey hat". I'll get the money and my DL back - go on credit alert for the next year. The thief will die knowing he lived a dishonrable life. The restaurant offered me a cold drink for my trouble. However, their inability to control their environment gives me no choice in my rating.For those of you with values and integrity, don't expect urban life to share those values.

Went there for the first time today for the "jazz brunch." Won't be back. The condescending, imperious Secret Service wannabe slickster manning the stairway to the downstairs ruined the experience. The pre-brunch line was ridiculously long (extending down a long hallway to the kitchen) and chaotic. When asked a simple question about how to get "registered," Mr. Slickster obnoxiously indicated that "it really isn't that difficult," then wanted to start an altercation. And once downstairs it took over 45 minutes standing in line to get food. Your $25 would be better spent elsewhere.
Food decent but wont be going back. DC is a dangerous rough area now with bums everywhere. Feel very unsafe. Trump 2024

Overstated for what it actually represents. High tea on Mother's Day used to be good but overall a pretty luke warm place. Not worth the time for those who are visiting. But if you happen to stay there for business, write a review here.
Nice looking restaurant, food was good. But took way too long for everything. Sitting down, waiting for drinks and food. Not so great & prices are a little high
nothing special at all. Food was mediocre at best. I would not return.
Cyndy's BOTTOM LINE: Disappointing Bloody Mary! Really...
Nice spot but not impressed with the food. Disappointed with crab cake. LP

Bad service, the keep taking the bar menus away, even before some people ordered and then even forgot someone's food. Half of the table never even got silverware even after being asked for it. The wait staff did humor us in creating a new kind of dipping sauce and "said he'd tell the chef." This is one of those cases, where you can have the location, food and ambiance, but if the service is bad it ruins the whole experience.
The fries were really good but the pizza was really bad. The service was nice and the place was beautiful.

Restaurant has a stunning interior design and a captivating ambiance. The moment I stepped inside, I was greeted by a beautifully decorated space that exuded elegance and sophistication. The attention to detail in the decor was remarkable, with tasteful lighting, stylish furniture, and an overall cozy atmosphere.However, despite the impressive aesthetics, I found the food to be quite mediocre. While the menu offered a variety of options, the taste and quality of the dishes did not live up to the expectations set by the restaurant's ambiance. The flavors were lacking depth, and some dishes were even underseasoned. It was disappointing to see such a disconnect between the visual appeal of the restaurant and the taste of the food.The waitstaff was not very attentive and kind of condescending, which was really odd. The hostess though was absolutely delightful!In conclusion, while the restaurant had a remarkable interior design and ambiance, the mediocre food was a letdown. It is still a great place to visit for a special occasion or to enjoy a drink - wine was delish!

Love going here with friends for a relaxed night! They have wonderful cuisine and drinks, and the service is generally good. Just a little irritating because the prices on the website appeared to be out of date. The menu was more pricey in person than it appeared to be on the website.
So the seating area was horrible the service was great and the drinks were great but they put us like in the back of the bar in this cold lonely
Nice bar! we enjoyed the appetizers and drinks. The service was very nice and friendly and the hours are great! We will be coming back soon.

This review is about The Hamilton's well prepared, just for the looks, Jumbo Lump Crab Cake (single made to sandwhich) and Miso Soup. To clarify my review, I had the choice of making the Jumbo Crab Cake into a sandwhich or just by itself. Of course, who eats a $19 crabcake by itself - I chose the option to make the dish into a sandwhich for the same cost. The menu quotes, "make it a sandwhich with fries and coleslaw $19." I also got a miso soup which was not even close to what a miso soup should taste like.A few days ago, I wrote a review about how a burgers' proportions should fit their price. I tried avoiding burgers since then. When I received my order, I knew that there was going to be a yelp review posted that night. I received another low quality burger as a meal - of course when asked how the meal was, I said "its good." This white, fake a** burger, looked like its buns were from Giants and was fresh out of the plastic. The buns from Big Mac is much more moist and orginal than this one. Aside from being called a "sandwhich," the coleslaw side was actually inside the burger - a disgusting combination. The burger was about 4 and a half inches high - Impossible to bite. I had to use a fork, knife, and spoon to eat this burger. On the other hand, the burger consisted of welldone ingredients such as: A NON JUMBO crabcake, fresh lettuce, tomato, fresh out of the plastic bun, and coleslaw. My second order was a miso soup. For sushi lovers out there and miso soup specialists, understand that this miso soup will not taste like any miso soup that you have tasted before. The contents of the soup included: mushroom, Mushroom, and mushrooms. I could not taste nor smell anything else other than it's freshly moist, soft, and tender mushrooms. The tofu was well prepared, soft and well portioned. The scallions were fresh and the salt was somewhat enough. When buying crabcakes, I recommend Conrads Crab Seafood Market Towson, Maryland. The best miso soup so far for me is located at: Yama sushi Bar Baltimore, Maryland.

Been here for drinks and for dinner a couple times. Huge menu with lots of good stuff. I had some good sushi roles last time I was there. Its a great place if you like heavy appetizers. But it is not cheap and the service is pretty slow. They have a couple bars that are good for happy hour though.
The food was fine. The service was fine. Nothing to write home about.
We went there for Happy Hours.. there Sushi Happy Hour is a good deal. Sushi quality is ok. Nothing spectacular. Outside of Happy Hour - Sushi is bit pricey.
It was decent, but fairly run of the mill.
Love the decor but the food is just average...
Food was OK, nothing new. Service was good.
Great location and ambiance. Food good. Service decent.

Beautiful restaurant but...still Clyde's food.Like all of there other establishments everything was, well, fine. Nothing really wrong with anything, just not worth the higher price tag when compared with The Ebbitt or Georgetown.In fact, we ordered the crab cake sandwich and it seemed exactly the same as the other locations except at $14.95 this one doesn't come with fries.The sushi was good. The salmon salad was delicious as always but I think I'll stick to getting it at the Georgetown location.The Ooey Gooey cake wasn't really. In fact, it was kind of dry.Friendly service, though. And again, beautiful restaurant.However, I think we'll stick to The Ebbitt and its awesome raw bar.

Wag Ja Kham from Mak Sher Mak Burso. This time I made a mistake that I sold a cheap evening with my signature.
I have been going there for years when in town. This time I still was frustrated that one of their signature dishes was sold out on a lazy Sunday evening.

Stopped in last night for an after dinner drink. The Hamilton has a lively, yet warm ambiance. It's a beautiful building. According to the bartender The Hamilton is well known for sushi, but the menu has many other entrees. In short, The Hamilton has something for everyone. Next time I'm ordering the burger.

We stopped by for a quick lunch yesterday afternoon and absolutely loved the vibe and their cozy setting indoors.In terms of recommendations, I'd like to call out the Pastrami Melt with fries and Crunchy Tuna Sushi Roll.They also have a fantastic cocktail menu but we didn't get a chance to try those.Our servers were super friendly and courteous as well.

I'm frustrated because one client and two friends don't like coming here and I like it so much. Unfortunately...something seems to always go wrong. And yes they fix it but I wish this wouldn't happen when I've already had to lobby them to come here. Alas. I really like it.

Just what you'd expect from a place like this!Everything was fresh and delicious, and the food was perfectly executed. Surprisingly, the only thing I didn't like was the dragon roll, which I think tastes better in a Japanese restaurant.The Linguine Pescatore was the biggest surprise. If you come, you MUST order it.The lobster was gone by the time we got to dessert, but the lemon cheesecake was delicious. Chocolate Raspberry Cake was also delicious, but not as good as others I've had at my favorite dessert shop.
This was great food. My sushi was delicious. Service could of been better, my food took longer even though it's cold food. I'd come again for sure though

My go to...just a little expensive. My date loved their mumbo wings. I love the sushi. I recommend for date night, birthdays, and when family are in town. I always experience good service as well. I haven't tried happy hour yet but I will as soon as the weather breaks.
I didn't come for the drinks but I had two great mojitos but my highlight was the sushi such great combos. And clean work stations
Delicious. I had a great dinner. The restaurant is super beautiful as well. The staff are also kind and knowledgable.
Pretty ok food. I always come late night when the menu changes. The wings and fries are my go to. My friend said the sushi was bomb
The wings and mumbo sauce are so good. I usually order that, a caesar salad and some fries. I tried the sushi the other day and it was ok. Ive had better.

In about five months, these guys have drastically improved. The first time I was here five months ago the service was very slow, my waiter was so absentminded I would've had a better time carrying the food myself, and it was such a shame because the food here was very tasty. This time around, I noticed that the service stepped their game up. I was here a couple of days ago for the second time expecting it to be as bad as the first. I ordered a crab cake platter and some scallops and the new waitress zipped them right over in no time. They tasted excellent too, full of flavor so I knew they were fresh catches. This time I think I'll be giving these guys a 4, keep up the good work guys!

This place is huge .. multi-dining rooms, and live music in basement. The food is great and have very diverse menu. The back dining room is not too noisy, I actually can have conversation with my friends. The service is good, the waiter also let us know without prompting that we may order too much food. Certainly would recommend this place to friends.
Everyone was friendly. The food was good and extremely large portions. The food was good and made fresh.
I have been here several times. The food is no stellar, but I love their wings and the fact that they stay open late. Whenever you can't find a place to eat after midnight, count on the Hamiltons.

Had a wonderful experience here! We popped in for a quick lunch due to the happy hour sushi (half off their signature sushi). We ended up sitting at the bar & the bar tender was great! Very attentive and made excellent drinks! I chose the Moscow Mule and it was very refreshing. The happy hour sushi list is pretty extensive. We chose the edamame, miso soup, California roll and firework (I believe that was the name) roll. It was all delicious! The sushi was very well crafted and everything was seamless in flavor! There was a very chill atmosphere there, not too many people, so it was easy to get fast and attentive service!
Excellent service. Tasty drinks. Light portions for the price but overall, reasonably priced based on the ambiance and service.
I like the place, is cozy and comfortable Over all pretty good, you really can't ask too much, when I have good service and good food. Usually I am happy :)

Talk about a huge restaurant. I was told with place is big but wow! We walked a long time and made our way to the bird room. This room is very large with tall ceilings and the wood work covers the entire walls and ceiling.Our waiter arrived and seemed to keep forgetting we had five people in our party and not four. He also forgot some things we asked for with our drinks and appetizers.Now on to the food, we tried the loaded tots, wings in mamba sauce and the tuna tartar. These were all exceptional apps.Our drinks were well balanced and the malts are very tasty and sweet. I tried the mint chocolate chip.The main course I ordered was sushi, a spicy tune and firecracker. Warning the sushi comes in 6-8 pieces and they are large. The spicy tuna roll had a nice kick to it and the firecracker roll was very good.We left here full and had a good time, unsure if they offered dessert since we didn't see a menu but it is worth a stop here.
Classy, great food, I really can't complain, there was nothing to complain about, a good experience .. Indeed!
I like the Hamilton. Although it can get a bit annoyingly crowded. The food is consistent, sushi has gotten so much better than the last time I visited and it's a great for Happy Hour.
Appropriately classy and tasty.

This is one of my favorite spots in DC for both the food/drink and the music! The Hamilton may not be known for its sushi, but some of their rolls are honestly among my all-time favorites. The place is huge, has an eclectic menu, and is super lively on the weekends. Always a positive experience there!
I've eaten here man times and the service and food have always been great!
The food was excellent, as usual. It was a very busy night, and the service was slow, but very good whenever we saw a server or other staff.
Great service
I can always depend on a good meal and attentive service here. Great location, food and staff.

I ate at The Hamilton for the first time on Saturday night. We had reservations and were seated immediately in a really nice, private booth (not the ones with the doors). Our waitress was very attentive, as was the manager who dropped by once. Our food arrived pretty quickly. I ordered the Spiced Chicken Salad and thoroughly enjoyed it. All in all, a very nice experience. I would definitely eat there again. It's so convenient to the Warner Theatre.
loveeee it food is soo good

I was here for the soft opening. This place is amazing the food was delicious and I don't eat any red meat. They had a lot of seafood options salmon was one of my favorite dishes. Good variety of cold and hot appetizers. The margarita was also really tasty. Our server was great can't wait to go back.
The sushi was delicious, some of the best I have ever had!
Calamari was great!
excellent food,but the place was a bit ,ok a lot, noisy

I dined here on a Wednesday night and sat at the main bar. This seemed like the perfect choice for the evening because I couldn't decide if I wanted sushi or a salad...so why not have both? I ordered a Blue Moon and the bartender suggested the Curious Traveler Shandy instead...it was delicious! Great recommendation. The sushi was fresh and delicious as always, I had the Firecracker and the Dynamite rolls. My salad was equally as good, I had the Spicy Grilled Chix salad. My friend had the open-faced bbq brisket sandwich, which needed a little something but it was good. Overall the experience was great because of the service! The bartender, who goes by "Soup" was excellent! I will definitely be back.
Didnt eat, came for Los Texmaniacs.
Spacious and classy a good place for a beer after work.

This is a nice place. It is in the former Borders space but it looks more like Old Ebbitt Grill. It has cavernous space, dark wood, high ceilings, and so on. It is clear they spent many millions of dollars renovating it. It definitely has a Washington feel to it, complete with pictures of the monuments on the walls.I had the cheeseburger sliders and the Korean wraps. Both were good. The place was packed on a Wednesday night.Staff is friendly.

My first word to describe this place is AMAZING! The food exceeded all my expectations. My wife surprised me with a birthday dinner, and we couldn't have asked for a better experience. The crab cakes were excellent, and the chicken wings were fantastic as well. The restaurant has a dimly lit atmosphere that creates a great ambiance. Our server, Lorenzo, was outstanding. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and provided excellent service from start to finish. Overall, we had a wonderful experience!

The Hamilton is one of my go-to spots in DC. The vibe is lively, the food is always fresh and flavorful, and they have a little bit of everything on the menu. Whether I'm grabbing sushi, a burger, or brunch, it never disappoints. Plus, the live music downstairs makes it feel extra special every time.Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie
They have the best lunch options in the city! Sushi/burgers and the best drink menu! Love the atmosphere, location and the staff!! We highly recommend.
The food was amazing the service was also good and the ambience was top notch. Would definitely go again.
Great Service! Waitress was attentive and gave wonderful suggestions for food options. Delicious food. Beautiful restaurant.
Service was amazing and food was great!! We definitely enjoyed our meal and had a great time.

Make your reservation in advance! This place may have many seats but most of the time slots were full for reservations in the same week.All the food we tried was delicious and our server was very personable and friendly.The burger was especially a hit!

We came during dinner rush on a holiday weekend. Lucky enough to get a seat at the bar and served by Daisy. She was absolutely amazing. Top notch customer service. Food was great. Massive Burger and fries were delicious!
Best food and atmosphere, came in after a day down town. Best waitresses and view of the city.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at The Hamilton in Washington, D.C., and I can confidently say it was an unforgettable experience! From the moment I walked in, I was captivated by the vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. The ambiance is a perfect blend of modern elegance and classic charm, making it an ideal spot for a delightful evening out.Now, let's talk about the food. I ordered the steak, and it was absolutely phenomenal! Cooked to perfection, it was tender, juicy, and bursting with flavor. The parmesan fries that accompanied the steak were equally impressive - crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, and generously dusted with parmesan. They were the perfect complement to the steak, creating a harmonious and satisfying meal.And then there was the Oreo shake. Oh my goodness, it was pure bliss in a glass! Creamy, rich, and perfectly sweet, it brought back nostalgic memories of childhood treats but elevated to a gourmet level. It was the ideal way to cap off an incredible meal.The Hamilton is truly a gem in the heart of Washington, D.C. Whether you're looking for a romantic dinner, a celebratory meal, or just a fantastic dining experience, this place has it all. I can't recommend it highly enough!

I recently had a fantastic meal and a couple of cocktails at the main bar here. Both drinks and food were delicious and beautifully presented. The service was also excellent. Bryan H was my bartender and was great! I didn't know what to order, so Bryan recommended my meal and cocktails and I was not disappointed. Loved the professionalism and would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience.

The Hamilton offers a delightful late-night sushi dinner experience that is truly fabulous. Their happy hour for sushi, starting at 10pm, where rolls are five dollars off, adds to the appeal of this dining spot. The combination of an excellent atmosphere and delicious food makes it a downtown DC staple that should not be missed. The experience of enjoying fresh and expertly prepared sushi in a lively environment is truly memorable. The Hamilton's dedication to quality and providing a great dining atmosphere shines through in every aspect of the meal. Whether you're a sushi lover or simply looking for a unique dining experience, The Hamilton delivers on all fronts. I highly recommend visiting this establishment for a wonderful evening of fantastic food and ambiance.
no other restaurant can top the hamilton's salmon. i don't even like salmon but the one here is different.
This was by far one of the best meals I have ever had. The sushi was some of the best .
One of my favorite restaurants around town. The meals served rapidly and the rates were reasonable. Highly recommended.
I am glad I can give you five stars. Amazing food and service. Will be back again for sure.

I have to say, I enjoyed every single bite of the meal. I had a 3 course meal, with a couple of beers. Considering the quality, the price is reasonable. Ideal for those who want a romantic night out!!! Great service!
Phenomenal food and top tier service. Come here and expect nothing but the best- and still be blown away.

Have been to The Hamilton a hand full of times and this place never disappoints. Did a short review before but I thought I'd write a new one. The overall feel of The Hamilton is classy with a hint of business. Definitely one of my go to spots with great food and drinks. We went with the chief special which was recommended by our server Anthony. It was delicious with the sides he told us to pair it with. Our overall service was top tier and I'm looking forward to going back.

This was a must stop place when we last visited DC. We had both brunch and lunch at the Hamilton, and both times it has not disappointed. Great service, the architecture/decor is beautiful. It is always busy, so plan to make a reservation.
Nice place very good service. Definitely wi return to this location in the future. The food was amazing

Service was good, drinks were really good. The waitress seemed a bit disappointed we weren't ordering any food, but otherwise she was efficient in getting our orders. The bar area and bathrooms were clean. The restaurant was full but not noisy so it was a nice atmosphere. It's also in a nice location in Penn Quarter. Great for groups.

This is my favorite restaurant in Navy Yard. Every order is tasty and thoughtfully arranged, which is probably why this place received a Michelin star. Many people enjoy their weekend brunches, too. The decor is minimalist, but you may walk a block south to take around the Yards Waterfront park. Try the Manchego Cheesecake!

Owned by Clyde's restaurant group (who also owns Clyde's and Old Ebbit Grill), this is an exceptional place to dine.With elegant and sophisticated rooms, professional dining staff, cool decor, two bars, and a music venue underground, it offers a lot.While Old Ebbit Grill has happy hour oysters, The Hamilton has Happy Hour Sushi, where they take $5 off the sushi prices from 2-5 PM or 10 PM - 1 AM. Since we visited outside of happy hours, we tried the Queen Trident Roll, which is the only roll ineligible for the discount.FOOD: The menu is virtually the same between all the restaurant groups, except The Hamilton is known for their sushi, has more steak options, and fish. For these reasons, I would say this is probably one of the better restaurants owned by Clyde's since they have more options.DESSERT: Once more, The Hamilton offers another unique experience, since they have boozy and regular milkshakes. However, one can also order one to drink during the meal as well (although it's not on the regular menu). The milkshakes are delicious and not massive, so I would recommend each person order their own.

A cherished dining spot for us whenever we find ourselves in Washington DC. Consistently superb food and impeccable service, though it's worth noting that a wait for dinner is to be anticipated. The culinary experience, however, makes it well worth the patience.
Great atmosphere and location. The food and service was excellent. Will return again.
So many options! Everything was fantastic. Service was a little slow but food made up for it.

We had an amazing experience at this restaurant. Interior was beautifully designed with classic wooden walls and elegant chandeliers. Despite the busy Sunday brunch crowd, service was excellent and food came out quickly. The Burrata was delicious and we were pleasantly surprised by the sushi options. Standout dish was the duck confit, which was a perfect combination of flavors. Highly recommended!
Do not miss this gem of a restaurant. Service, location, food, everything was perfection.

Just ate at this restaurant. From the way, we are received to the restaurant environment, from the people that work here to the food. All 5 stars! I always say that "it's my favorite restaurant"! I recommend this restaurant to my friends and colleagues from work.
Great decor. Great ambiance. Great food. Convenient location.
it was torch and the drinks are gud
My wife took me here and I was pleasantly surprised by the food and the service. The atmosphere was amazing for enjoying the great food.
Some of the best food you will eat and fresh juices you will drink.
Went for Saturday happy hour which gets you $5 off sushi rolls. They are freshly made and delicious. Drinks are good as well! Service was good
The food, atmosphere, drinks and our waitress was amazing. I will definitely be back when I'm in town.
It's a great experience. The ambiance is very welcoming and charming. Amazing drinks, food and service. Staff are extremely knowledgeable and make great recommendations.
This has to be a very unexpected place to get a cubano... but it was legit. Will be back for more.

I have been here several times. The food is no stellar, but I love their wings and the fact that they stay open late. The service was fantastic and everyone in my group was very happy with their meal.

The most satisfying meal we had so far. The food is deliciously good, and healthy though a little pricey but worth the experience. The reps and staff are so kind and hospitable. The ambiance is good as well, it's super relaxing. Highly recommended. We will definitely go back again with my family and friends.
Delicious and great service. Great selection room of some amazing dishes and cool atmosphere.

Great pizza and brunch as well. We had a big party for my birthday brunch and our waitress Maddie was so nice and awesome even with our big loud table of 11 people. I had the garden Benedict which was great, as well as the pancakes. Other favs included the special Santa Fe scramble and the breakfast sandwiches. Def recommend their cheese pizza too, really good sauce and crust. One of my favourite restaurants around town. Highly recommended.

Do yourself a favor and visit this lovely restaurant in DC. The service is unmatched. The staff truly cares about your experience. The food is absolutely amazing - everything we tasted melted in other mouths. Absolutely the best meal we had while in DC. Highly recommend!
Definite 5- everything was great.Food was fantastic - chicken sandwich, burgers, eggs.Service was great and friendly.Very nice decor.
Great food. Excellent service! Would definitely go back. Thanks for a wonderful experience.
Caterpillar Roll is out of this world. Fresh made to order rolls. Happy hour on rolls is from 2-5p. Will be coming back daily for more.
Hands down one of my favorite places to eat in dc. The atmosphere is always lit. Also the sushi bar and late night menu is a huge plus

First let consider this was on a Sunday night...around 10pm. Surprisingly busy for the night. We sat at he bar first for a glass of wine. 10 minutes later at our table .Atmosphere was wicked cool. Staff was extremely friendly. Our server came right over. Took our request and in reasonable time served our dinner. Our food was good and hot. Very tasty, we are vegetarians, but will eat fish when out. My catfish etouffee was great. Highly recommend this.
First at this restaurant ... love the experience and amazing food and staff!!! will be returning
I love this place! I've never had a bad meal here, everything was good.
I love this place, from the Mumbo sauce and wings to the calamari. It has some of the best bar food in the city.

Went to the late night sushi happy hour (after 11pm), and sat at the front bar with my brother. Had an amazing time. Took no time to find two seats, and the bartender (Eddie) did an amazing job serving us, recommending the best sushi to get, always keeping our water topped off, and available for us to order. We had 5 different sushi rolls, and all of them were fantastic. Did not disappoint. With great service and great food, I definitely had a great experience.
Great location for a drink. Drink cocktails looked great! We had a glass of wine and a beer. Will come back!
Great environment! A unique place with a cool environment, just what we were looking for.
We had a great time with amazing food in this amazing looking restaurant. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in the area.
I love this place! Best brunch in Downtown DC. Its a huge place with multiple levels and a large menu. There's also a music review in a part of the restaurant with local DC Acts in the evenings.
Get the wings! My wife and I love them. People talk about the service being bad here but I have never had bad service. Tried sushi here for the first time last week and it was surprisingly good

I always get their wings but I tried their sushi the other day and it was good. I didnt think a place like this would have good sushi, i expect good sushi from of course a sushi spot but theirs is up there with other sushi spots!
Great place! A must stop for drinks and/or food. Great location. Great decor. Lots of beers on tap.
Excellent choice. Great atmosphere and food. Surprised that the prices were quite reasonable.  Very good service. Quality restaurant for sure in a great location.

This place was right across the street from the hotel my hubby and I were staying at. We were hungry, but couldn't decide where to go. We ended up here. The food was amazing!!! I had the hangar steak. It is probably one of the best steaks I've ever had. The bone marrow butter and bordelaise was incredible. The black and blue potatoes were also delicious. We ended up staying and ordering the Ooey Goey cake, per our waiters recommendation (shoutout to Ray for being amazing) and let me tell you, it was life changing. So so so incredibly delicious. If you are in DC, I highly recommend checking them out!

I made the reservation online one week prior with no problems. The restaurant is super big and nice and clean. Our waitress was really nice. I ordered steak with potatoes, delicious!. Customer service is great here and the place is super nice. Definitely coming back!
one of the best meals of my life

Great place to go for dinner and drinks! Very busy place to be on a Saturday night. I sat at the bar downstairs near the entrance. Bruce and Fitz were amazing, very attentive, and very friendly. They had great recommendations and drink knowledge. Great experience
Great food, great ambience, great service, close to sightseeing...what's not to like. This is my must while in DC
simply a great place all around.

Great spot! It was about a 20 minute wait for a busy Saturday,and then we were seated quickly. The dulce de leche milkshake was amazing,and the tuna sashimi was the best I've had in DC. Outstanding.The space is really cool and doesn't feel "touristy" at all. The server was courteous and friendly, and made the experience even better. Would love to go back for the Gospel brunch!
A music buff DC doesn't have many places to go to enjoy a wonderful ambiance, live music and good food. This place has it all. I will continue to patronize them. Another wonderful night in the books.
Food was amazing and incredibly fast getting to our table will come back for more yummy yummy
Cool
