Great food and Outstanding service. Lobster bisque was amazing. Will certainly go back when in DC.
The sushi happy hour is amazing!
Food was excellent, service was excellent. Cool building, big windows that make you feel like you are outside.
After having a horrible evening out, I stumbled upon The Hamilton. The staff was helpful and friendly, I'm so glad I didn't call it a night, I spent my New Years happy and excited to come back!
Must visit restaurant/music venue in DC!

THIS IS THE COOLEST RESTAURANT IN DC. Its open late, the food is phenomenal, there is a live music venue in the basement, free live music upstairs in the loft bar on the weekends, and 1/2 price sushi from 3-6 daily! Hands down my favorite place to get dinner, grab a drink, or checkout some live music. This place has it all. First off the place is absolutely gorgeous. No expense appears to have been spared when it comes to the decor. This place is also massive. I believe my very knowledgeable server (Felipe) told me it is about 37,000 square feet and can house about 1000 people on its three floors at any given time. The basement of this place is in my opinion DC's coolest most intimate music venue. I love going to concerts hear. I got to see some of my favorite acts like Darkstar Orchestra, Karl Denson's Tiny Universe, Leftover Salmon, Bonerama, and John K Band. The sound and lighting system is incredible and they book great acts. On top of that they serve world class sushi and gourmet pizza. Where else can you see a kick ass concert and eat some fresh Boston Bluefin tuna while sipping on some local craft brews. Now that's just the downstairs. Upstairs is a whole different animal. There are two beautiful wood bars. That are open till 3! The food upstairs includes a full sushi bar with some of DC's best sushi and a wide range of innovative local and seasonal offerings including steaks, seafood, pastas and burgers. Best wings in DC too. They have the most delicious sweet and spicy mumbo sauce. For desert try the chocolate gooey cake. This place is open late, so if you need some drunkchies late night they serve food till 1 or 2 am. I would recommend this place to anyone and everyone.........seriously check this place out.
Great food, sushi was wonderful!
Great sushi. Great service. All around really really good experience. Can't wait to go back again.

I don't like vegetables. So how is it that I have come to rely on the Brussels Sprouts and Kale salad as my go-to order every time I get to the Hamilton? It's just that good, and for you naysayers, no it's not dressed up to taste like something different. The veggies are fresh and the dressing is very light, but pairs perfectly with the salad.But, not liking vegetable is not a problem when there is a pulled pork and mac and cheese sandwich with cole slaw on Texas Toast on the menu! The menu is creative and fresh, and there are several things for everyone--not just something for everyone.I visit the Hamilton every chance I get when I'm in DC. The atmosphere is gorgeous, and while it is loud at happy hour, the buzz just adds to the energy of the place.Attentive service is the norm
Awesome food! Great ace in the city
it was a great place
Awesome awesome awesome!!!!!
Lunch was great. I had a steak
The best burger I've ever had.
Great place!
Perfect place for grabbing good food and perfect Tito cosmos! There sushi is simply amazing...
Great place to see a concert! will be back!!
I will be back, the best place for breakfast

We were seated and properly waited on...It was extremely crowded and our food was overwhelming with great flavors as well...More restaurants should practice wht Hamilton delivers, great quality & atmosphere.....

This place is definately one of my favorites, if not THE favorite. I haven't had anything at this place that is of poor quality. Everything is top-notch all the way and the food does not disappoint. The ingredients used are uncommon from most other places and typically do not taste well mixed together, however the Hamilton does this with perfection. Everything from the LTD tators to the crab cakes are made with care. I still haven't made it past the first floor, but I'm good with my laziness. (They bring the food to you anyways).

I stopped here for dinner last night after hearing some positive early reviews from friends. My wife and I were seated in the back dining room, which involved walking through no less than two major dining rooms and down a hallway that brought to mind the Victorian splendor of the National Arboretum, pre-modernization. Our room was absurdly spacious and oddly attractive, the decor somehow successfully pulling together brainy mid-century abstract bronze sculpture, contemporary painting, Federalist woodwork and Victorian lighting. The menu was equally ambitious and eclectic, with a full range of charcuterie, cheeses, salads, seafood dishes, meats, pastas, sandwiches and, most curiously, sushi. I am always sceptical when I see a wide range of food on a menu and was too scared to sample the latter. My wife took a flyer on the Salmon Lover roll though, which was inspired with roasted tomato inside and topped with slices of kiwi. They are obviously taking the sushi thing seriously, going for a fusiony, upscale style that I look forward to sampling next time around. For an appetizer I had the charcuterie: fennel salami, sopresseta and mocetta... all outstanding. For dinner, the Nantucket Bay scallops and my wife had the crab cakes, which we ate to the last crumb. Too full for dessert, but I look forward to trying the cinnamon bun pudding next time. The only weak link was the service... we had a nice waiter, but he was clearly a little overwhelmed by a full house on the second night of opening. All restaurants take some time to get sorted, and this place is the size of Union Station, so expect a learning curve in the beginning. We will wait a couple weeks for them to smooth the kinks out, but we'll definitely be back.

I had a disappointing experience at this restaurant. The lunch menu had a very limited selection, and to make matters worse, a server spilled soup on me while clearing plates from the table. The only solution she offered was a bleach pen, which was unsatisfactory. I did not make any requests, but such a solution is unacceptable.
The impossible meat fritters were ok...somewhat odd. The waiter was not that nice or helpful. Ssam board and disorak salad was amazing.

The banchan was very good. The chicken is solid. I (am from South Korea) got the mussel soup. Didn't like it -- it felt way too greasy. My wife got bibimbap -- she said it was OK. Service and ambiance were solid though

The flavor of the fried chicken was amazing!! We genuinely enjoyed every bite! As for the palace ddukbokgi and kimchi jjigae - both were very enjoyable but definitely had a non-traditional twist. The soup was definitely different than the kimchi jjigae we grew up eating and unique - I personally probably wouldn't order it again but could see why some people could like this version better. Definitely would come back!

I had an amazing experience at Anju Restaurant! The food was incredible, with bold flavors and fresh ingredients, and the atmosphere made me feel right at home. Can't wait to visit next.Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

We visited the restaurant to celebrate a birthday a while back, and we were impressed with the food--the fusion of ordinary Korean ingredients with unique elements created delicious and visually stunning dishes. The restaurant's ambiance was lovely: paintings, plants, furniture, brick walls, and exposed ceilings with chic light fixtures contrasting with old-looking walls. Our server was attentive, and we were satisfied with the service. Overall, we had a wonderful dining experience at this fusion Korean restaurant.

I recently visited ANJU, a cozy Korean restaurant in the heart of the city. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere. The decor was a beautiful blend of modern and traditional Korean elements, which set the tone for an authentic dining experience. my experience at ANJU was exceptional. The food was authentic and delicious, the service was impeccable, and the atmosphere was welcoming. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking to enjoy an authentic Korean dining experience.
Amazing! I went with a bunch of friends and we had a great time. We're still thinking about the food days later. It was delicious.

Made reservations and got there pretty early but they were able to accommodate our large group and seat us ahead of time. The restaurant is very spacious and filled up fast. Food, drinks, and dessert were all delicious. Portions were very large and filling. I tried the trout Parmesan and liked that the breading wasn't too heavy. We also tried the steak which was cooked nicely and was flavorful. Service was extremely slow but friendly. Our bill took awhile to get right but was finally sorted out.

My second time here and it had not disappointed! Some of the best pizza I've had and that's saying a lot as I consider myself a pizza snob! Everything was delicious. The calamari was perfectly cooked and seasoned. My pizza was absolutely delectable! The lemicello was to DIE for! I can't wait for my next visit!
Very good on all fronts....food, vibe, hospitality.Pizza along with a bunch of apps and family style dinner with drinks flowing for our table of 5.Very noisy inside so we dined alfresco.

We went to the for dinner last month while in DC. We did not have a reservation, but they were able to seat us quickly on this Wednesday evening.The service was impeccable. The food was delicious (apps & dinner).The restaurant had this cool vibe and I really enjoyed my visit.
Fantastic good.I have been coming here for a while.Always good food and good service.

The fried fish and palace rice cakes with bulgogi were the stars of the show. I would go back her just for these. Other standouts were the Mandu and the raw beef appetizer with taro chips. Really deep pepper paste flavor.Nice atmosphere and we brought our kids as well for dinner at 5 pm on a Sunday. We had reservations but there seemed to be empty tables if you walk in right when they open.

I recently dined at ANJU in DC with my girlfriend and was blown away by the experience. From start to finish, everything was top-notch.The atmosphere of the restaurant is sleek and modern, with a trendy vibe that made us feel like I was in one of the city's most exclusive spots. We were lucky enough to walk in and get a spot outside, which was a comfy table tucked into the corner. The service was impeccable - our waiter Eric (who is also the general manager) was friendly and attentive and let us enjoy the dining experience as first time guests. He offered great recommendations for dishes and all of them exceeded expectations.Speaking of the food, it was absolutely delicious. The dishes were inventive and flavorful, with just the right balance of spice and sweetness. We particularly enjoyed the crispy fried chicken with white bbq sauce and the pork and kimichi dumplings (mandu dumplings) - both were standout dishes.Following dinner, we ordered the chocolate sesame donut holes, and they were spectacular. Our waiter even gave us a second complimentary dessert.Overall, I would highly recommend ANJU to anyone looking for a unique and memorable dining experience in DC. The food, desserts,and atmosphere are all top-notch, and we can't wait to go back and try more of their menu.

I recently dined at Anju and was blown away by the experience. The food was absolutely amazing - I especially loved the burger and spicy chicken sandwich. They truly filled a void I didn't know I had. But the real standout dish was the French toast - it was delicious and served in huge portions.The service was also exceptional. The staff were friendly and attentive, making sure our dining experience was top-notch. The atmosphere of the restaurant was comfortable and inviting.Overall, I would highly recommend Anju to anyone looking for delicious food and great service. I will definitely be returning to try more of the menu.

Friends have been recommending ANJU so we figured we'd give it a go. We went on a weeknight with a reservation and were seated outside. We ordered the beyond meat dumplings and they were so good! I couldn't believe there wasn't any meat in them! Really well spiced with a chili sauce on top. For mains, our waiter was really helpful navigating the menu. He recommended the Palace Ddukbokgi and we decided to order the Jjamppong since we were in the mood for seafood. Personally, I liked the spiciness of the Jjamppong more than the Ddukbokgi, but both were very good. The entrees have large portions and we had more than enough food. Can't wait to come back and try more of the dishes (and save space for the fish waffle) soon!
Went for lunch and we choose the selected menu with wines, all combinations were great, portions were just what we needed

I visited this spot for a dinner with two friends during Covid, and we opted for the tasting menu. It was the perfect amount of food, and I thought the price ($65) was great. We didn't do the drink pairings, but the cocktails I got were excellent. Nice service. Don't skip the salad -- I overlooked it but my friend got it, and I was jealous. Lol.

We went here a few days ago and all I can say is wow! When we got there they said the wait would be about an hour. We were gonna leave but my wife said let's be patient. We walked a few doors down to this beautiful small shop and got our tarot cards done which was so much fun! By the time we were done with our readings our table was ready! The chicken the chicken the chicken!!! That's all I'm gonna say. So be patient, hang out in the neighborhood till your table is ready, have a tarot reading and then feast!

Worth coming into DC for! Reservations are hard to come by so grab a bar stool early. Can't say enough about the Bibim Bop and fried chicken, and it's on happy hour! I'll be back to work my way through the menu.
Incredible! Great happy hour. Definitely deserves its Washingtonian #1. Bar is open seating. Come early!
Great great variety of Korean selections, service was friendly. Drinks to be worked on, still 5star

These CHIKO guys killed it yet again - ramen, fried rice, gamjatang...you can't go wrong with navigating this menu. A personal thank you for adding more a positive food scene to the 18th street neighborhood.

I fell in love with this establishment from my first step inside. I felt right at home instantly. The upstairs dining area is bright and the menu had options for everyone in our party. Even the 2 vegetarians! The fried chicken, tornado potato, and kimchi pancake were delicious. The panchan sides were all unique and very elevated compared to what I have had in the past. The Bibim bap was great and the mandu dumplings will definitely bring you back! We finished our evening in the lounge on the first floor tasting all of the unique Korean cocktails.
We had a great experience here. The service was great and the dumplings are a must.... Don't forget to try the jerky.

Fuqq busboys they think they better than everyone faking like they got love and open opportunity for everyone when really they will discriminate the fuqq out you and shut the door right in your face. I wouldn't piss on fire to put them out. They some shyt from their morals, respect, food and values smh . A hard. NO for me . I wouldn't recommend this place to nobody.

Food is overpriced and mediocre. They are like a glorified diner. Furthermore, Busboys and Poets is antisemtic. They shamelessly support anti-semites and antisemtic propaganda. Their CEO is deplorable. I will never give them my business. If you have any morals, avoid this restaurant. You won't be missing out on anything good anyway.
Server never came to help us after waiting for 30 minutes outside. Would never come again.

Worst service I've ever had at a B&P. Four of us. Took very long for anything, waited 45min for drinks other than water, never was given utensils so had to go grab them *myself*, never got napkins and had to get them ourselves, food came out staggered one diner's dish then 20 minutes before the other three diners got their dishes. Just embarrassing.
Bad food, rude service, waited over 45 minutes for our food and it was cold. Won't be back.
Walked in .. Stood for 8 min before a women who seemed to be a hostess said , we have 3 servers you will just have to wait . No wait list.. but we just wait.
Nah. Save yourself the frustration and pass.

Sat at bar for 5 minutes and never received a hello, how are you or what would you like to drink. When I saw 4 employees running the gossip machine at the other end of the bar I had to leave. Awesome looking place and was excited about bringing my family there that evening for dinner.

COVID has nothing to do with this. I'm not sure what happened, but the Busboys experience at 450 K is something I've never experienced before. The whole restaurant smells like dirty mop water, the service is terrible, and everybody looks confused. ANDY!!!!! They say never say never, but I will NEVER come back to this place.

The server never checked on us The food was messed up the eggs Benedict were over cooked and extra sides that were asked for were never given She took 20 minutes to give me tea which was not even served correctly and left everyone's drinks at the bar for 15 minutes We took our friends from our of town and the service was horrible we will never come back to this location again

This review is for the Busboys on 4th and K St. Nw. Service is horrible. Restaurant was empty at 8pm on the (Monday) night before New Years Eve and we waited over half an hour for soup. All our food was luke warm/cold. So clearly it had been sitting out. Since the restaurant was more than half empty, I have no clue what happened to our waitress. Will never return. Also, the bathroom door doesn't lock. Hostess doesn't stand at the host stand. She sits at the long table BEHIND a column (behind the host stand) with her iPods in her ears. The employees just stand around talking to each other and not working. Unfortunate.The Busboys on 14th is so much better. Stick to Baked Joint if you come to 4th & K.
Waited for twenty-five minutes for service with my family. No one came to take our order. Ended up leaving.
Heard a lot about, went there and was very disappointed: bad food, horrible pizza, shitty service, Very noisy acoustics. don't go there.

Yesterday, Sunday evening about 6:25 PM I stopped in to order a falafel sandwich for take out. I noticed they were a little busy, I asked the host if I could order for take out, she said yes. I made my order and waited in the lobby. When the food came out she was on the phone with a customer. However, when she got off the phone she was talking and laughing with the other workers and never checked on my food order even 15 minutes later. I tried to walk near the front without seeming rude that I was waiting for the food. I stood there and stood there and she wouldn't go check if the food was mine, I was the only customer waiting for a take out. My food was sitting there and I was starring at it getting cold for 10 minutes. I should have politely asked if it was mine, but I didn't want to seem pushy, because I worked in customer service before and I always appreciated patient customers. I almost feel like she was purposely making me wait. Finally I asked one of the other hosts to check, and sure enough the take out package I starred at for ten minutes in front of all the hosts at the front was mine. Yes the food was cold obviously by then and I was mostly just disappointed because I had a long day and I was not rude to anyone, I don't feel like returning.

ii love the food at this establishment ,and has patronized it on a regular , tonight i almost caught a case ,for a lazy ass hostess who couldnt decide if the kitchen is open or if i could or should receive service , then i had do her job and put in my own order after wasting 5 minutes to closing debating and waiting for a solution,when out of nowhere a overly confident rude light in the pants ass manager comes to make matters worst, its one thing to claim MANAGER! but the only i wanted to manage was to slap the stew out him for not checking the situation out and managing.im sorry the 14th street spot is problem free , if i heard that this place closing i would not be upset ! but if you want to keep money coming in , fire that broke ass staff ! ( and this is coming from an employee of the bobby vans grill open from 1130 am to 10 pm ( see i know what time the place opens and closes) who knew? get a clue ,and a staff

I must say...I am not happy about the experience I had at Busboys on 5th street. I called at 2:15 on a Sunday to place a pizza order. I was told that I needed to come in to place the order because it was brunch time. I asked the lady, if I come, I can order my pizza. She said "yes". My child had an event at the convention center so we walked to Busboys for our pizza.  We arrived at the location at 2:42 and tried to order the pizza. To my surprise, pizza's can not be ordered until 3:00. I spoke to the manager Atbar and he said he would ask the kitchen. After waiting a couple more minutes, he proceeded to say that they were busy and that a pizza could not be ordered until 3:00.  We walked out. I am so pissed. I think I will drive to the 14th street location where service is much better.

3:20 We arrive at the restaurant 3:22 We got our table3:30 The waitress come to great the table or actually take the order ( coke ,oj , a burguer and a turkey sandwich)3:31 We told her that we are in rush and we will eat and leave in 20 minutes3:32 She delivery the drinks (coke and orange juice)3:36 We order a banana bread pudding and we told her to bring whatever come first3:46 No banana , no sandwich , no waitress and even less no manager3:47 My friend and I got up set3:49 I saw my waitress with non sense of urgency 3:50 The waitress give us the check without having the food and not even the bread pudding3:51 I left the restaurant4:30 I arrived at work ( restaurant business also )6:00 I am still thinking how hungry I am and how the restaurant screw my day and how sure I am that I am not coming back !!! Btw my friend stay there waiting for the food , later on the manager came to the table and she had to pay for the food that I didn't have

BB and P does not seem to like service animals. I have a service dog for a chronic medical condition. I take my service dog everywhere I go including restaurants. Since she is not a pet but a service animal this is legal. I was kicked out of Busboys and Poets for bringing my service dog. I then called another Busboys location and was told I was not be allowed to bring her into that location as well. Busboys seems to have a problem with people who need service animals. They claim to believe in "social justice" but that is not the case.

Kirsten - My friends and I totally agree with you, we always and only go when Renee is working she is terrific.. she ROCKS!!!!!! :) She makes killer "SEX IN THE CITY COMOS"... girl let me tell you they are delicious like many of her other cocktails and they taste the same every single time My friends and I were also told last night she wasn't working. We stayed for a cocktail. Not sure of the two bartenders names who were working but what I am sure about is they have horrible customer service skills, they don't smile and they are often times arrogant especially the male.. I think he said his name was Jevon but his arrogance is borderline sexual harassment. Our drinks finally came which were way to strong, unbalanced and not what we asked for. We discussed this with the bartender who commented in a very unprofessional manner never once apologizing or offering to remake the drink. My girlfriends and I found him to be repulsing and we decided to leave. We ended up going to one of Renee's favorite locations she told us about for great Indian food and scrumptious cocktails Don't get me wrong we love the food at Bus Boys but our experience will never be the same and that's what keeps many diners like us coming back to their favorite restaurants 1) Service 2) Experience 3) Atmosphere Renee has a gift of making you feel important, thought of and appreciated. She caters to us making us feel appreciated for coming back to see her. We love the fact that as soon as she sees us she already has our order in and she is making our favorite drinks Kirsten, if you don't have her number let me know I will be more than happy to help you Maybe my wife and I along with your friends can surprise Renee by visiting her at her new location Like I said Bus Boys has amazing food and good music but now that Renee is gone it's just not going to be the same WE MISS YOU RENEE!!!!!! WE MISS YOU!!!!!

AHHHHHHHHHHH (screaming) Is all I can say about this horrible location!!! Staff is always changing but customer service never improves nor does it get any better My wife and I have been coming here since the doors opened. About a few weeks ago we were sitting in the loft and our server/bartender was a nice and outstanding individual by the name of Renee, not sure her last name She was exuberant offering personality, laughter and a great sense of humor. She made us laugh and she made us feel like we were at home having dinner with great friends and it was just the two of us During the course of our meal we never had to ask for anything because she was always checking on us cleaning as she went My wife and I host events and we inquired with Renee if she would be interested in working at one of our events because she is fantastic and our clientele would enjoy her presence and service One evening I brought a few of my clientele to Bus Boys and Poets for Open Mic Night and it was insanely busy. Renee was working behind the bar...multi-tasking like I've never seen it done before. She can take not just your order but orders of other guests while making drinks for guests at the bar and for the staff while cracking jokes making people laugh The joy of meeting her and enjoying her service again was shattered when we walked in Sunday evening and was informed she no longer worked there We have seen many staff come and go as often as as fast as people change their clothes and their thoughts Leaving us to question what is going on with this location for them to loose or get rid of some great employee's? She was one of the best to do it that we've come across since coming to any of Bus Boys and Poets locations as well as other restaurants Being hit with the reality of Renee not providing us with service we decided to dine somewhere else Bus Boys and Poets lost someone special and unique Sincerely, Another lost customer

The Foundation Against Intolerance and Racism (FAIR) just featured an essay by an author, Jordan Randall, whose book event a Busboys and Poets was cancelled because it was (email to author from bookstore staff, written in bold) "a book written about a marginalized experience that the author does not identify with." This anti-liberal approach to fiction writing - one that insists on "lived experience" and that certain people have ownership of certain narratives because of their supposed "identity" - is now, in the name of progress, widely rejected across the political spectrum. But the staff/management at Busboys and Poets insists on maintaining this dumbed-down, woke, and authoritarian approach to writing and the intellectual life. Censorship and discrimination - putatively committed in the name of "sensitivity" - have no place at our bookstores, and if you agree I encourage you to take your business to where the imagination and the marketplace of ideas are embraced, rather than rejected in the name of regressive identity politics.
Tastes like everything is pre-made. While the ambiance can be charming the food is lacking. With the big change in food to local and cook fromscratch I suggest getting with the times.

I love local and pseudo pretentious places, but this one has way too many political elements. Some people avoid Chick Fil-A because they don't want religion in their chicken sandwich, well, I don't want a bleeding heart liberal agenda with my meal either. The food was okay, but not okay enough to get me back in the door.
Service was SO SLOW. There was only a ten minute wait but it took about 15 min to get a waitress to our table, and around 30 for our food. Good ambiance and food.
As of June this place is experiencing a serious nosedive.
Overpriced and thoroughly average food.

I've been here before for events, but tonight was my first time to eat here. I had the veggie burger. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good either. The actual burger didn't taste much different than the bread it was on. I really like the atmosphere of this place, but the food (at least the burger) just didn't match up.

As a regular customer of the Hyattsville, MD location, I've noticed this branch tends to fall short on both portion sizes and quality compared to other locations. While the food's flavor was consistent with what I've enjoyed before, the quantity was noticeably lacking, which was disappointing for a delivery order. The taste was certainly a positive, but consistency across locations is key for me, especially as a frequent diner. It would be great to see more attention given to delivering the same level of quality and value at all branches. Although I didn't experience the ambiance firsthand with a delivery, I can imagine it might offer a different feel, and I'd be curious to visit in person. For improvement, I'd recommend focusing on portion sizes and ensuring consistency in food quality, which would elevate the overall experience.
It's a nice place, with nice staff. They got my order wrong both times I went so I won't be back.

Busboys and Poets in DC had tasty food, but our experience wasn't great. The vanilla latte was too sweet for my taste, and it took forever for our food to come out. When it finally did, we didn't have any silverware to eat with, and our coffees took forever to arrive too. While the prices weren't too bad, the slow service and drink issues left us feeling disappointed.

This was my first experience at this restaurant. I loved the ambiance from the moment we walked up. There were several patrons eating inside and outside plus several parties waiting. I joined the waitlist on Yelp, and upon checking in, the host was very nice and helpful and let me know that she would move me to the priority list. I waited about 20 minutes for a table, if that. You know when you're hungry time seems to move much slower than it actually is. While waiting, I witnessed something very disturbing from another guest. They were dining solo with their four legged friend, which is cool. However, the next time I looked, this guest gave their dog a plate from the restaurant and the dog ate off the plate!!! Very unsanitary and I'm not sure if staff noticed this act. The staff worked diligently to get parties seated as quickly as possible. All hands were on deck turning and seating tables. We got our food and it wasn't great but it wasn't bad either, just regular. I ordered a chorizo chicken hash and I thought it was supposed to come in a skillet (I was not trying to chance getting the same plate the dog ate off of) and the other individual in my party had the smoked salmon Benedict. $6 mimosa was great! Also the orange juice was fresh and delicious. Probably the greatest thing about our meal. Overall, I loved the ambiance and the food was ok. Staff was helpful and friendly. I was just turned off by the other guest and their dog.

Fried chicken was a little dry but the mashed potatoes with collard green saved the dish. Nothing special with crab cakes either. Best dishes from what I got to try were Mekhleme & cauliflower bites. French toasts were good as well.
A great layout and fun crowd. The location was ok.
As I've gone more often and tried more things, I think it's hit or miss sometimes, and not very consistent.
A good restaurant with good food and good atmosphere in an area that is growing every day more and more
This place food is good but it's always crowded
Decent selection on the menu, good food and pleasant atmosphere. I will definitely be returning.
They need to start serving kale before 5pm.

This is a decent place to go for lunch and or an early dinner. I ve been here a few times and got caught in some sort of hip hop night. Within an hour the cliente completely changed from business men to hip hop star wannabe's. However even on that visit the food was delicious. I believe the only issue I ve had was the wait service. The three times I have went, I do not believe they have noticed I was there. The food and atmosphere make up for the lack of service. The menu is one of those "ahhh I don't think I'm going to like anything..." to "Wow that sounded horrible but was excellant." I love the spiral staircase and local art on the walls, as it make a unquie dinning experience.Yes the wifi is free, but no one seemed to remember the password for the public side....interesting.
Service was GREAT! Drinks were GREAT! Food was mediocre.

This place is great for grabbing lunch, but i wouldnt waste my time for dinner. My steak is always over-cooked on the steak salad and unless im sitting at the bar, my drinks are always about 10 mins late. In that respect the servers are slow and quick to forget you, but once you have your food, its great.

I just came back from lunch at B&B. I had a meeting in the area and I had heard good things about this place so we decided to check it out. Well-deserved praise! A little much on the decor for me but a cool vibe nevertheless. I had the turkey burger and my co-worker had the veggie burger. I think my burger may have sat under the heat lamp a little too long because it was a little dry...still good though. They had some fancy desserts that I will definitely come back for. Overall, a very nice lunch.
Good breakfast, very prompt service, very good place for breakfast, filled our drinks promptly
Great food. Need more vegan and vegetarian options.
We love this place. The food, the service and the ambience are all reasons we come back often.

I'm a huge fan of busboys and poets but their service this day was very disappointing. They took 20+ minutes to get our drinks and charged us the wrong bill at the end. Nonetheless, their food was delightful. The chicken panini was a 10/10 and their "peace and love" peach cocktails were my fave. They have great vegan and vegetarian options too for those with dietary restrictions.
Food was amazing, vibe is super cool. Skip it if you're in a rush, the service is molassas.
Food was delicious and great service. I would recommend trying it out if you're in D.C.

Food and drinks were delicious, first time and the service was amazing. The only things I was not too happy about were the mimosa servings. Definitely not enough in the glass. Overall it was great though.
Love this restaurant! It's a DC staple. Food is always solid and there are interesting events almost weekly. Plus service is excellent.
I'm a fan. I will be visiting again on the next trip to DC.
Good food, service has lots to be improved.

Love the atmosphere they have going on! Met 2 friends for lunch few weeks back, not crazy busy luckily so we were able to sit and chat around for a while. Lamb sliders and chicken quesadilla was really good. More than the food, I loved the set up!

One of my favorite brunch spots. Its chill, I love the vibe here. Literally never had an issue with service or my food. The shrimp and grits for dinner is my favorite and the apple crisp they have is good too!
Yummy food, great service, & a convenient location.
Very good food and great service thank you busboys great spot to have lunch on a busy day
the food is eghh. . . but the atmosphere is amazing

The food here is great quality, creatively presented and delicious. I felt right at home! It was nice to chat with our server Alex, he made our experience a lot more enjoyable. I've never been disappointed with the food, the prices, the great selection of books or the ambience.

Gone here for brunch a few times. I think is really good. The sweet potato pancakes are very good and the best thing on the menu.  Their pizzas are ok. The atmosphere and the vibe of the restaurant are great. Would make reservations.
Love this place. Good vibes and great food. I especially like eating breakfast here. Staff is always nice. Highly recommend.
As a vegan I appreciate this place so much. Delicious.

Have been here a few times and I always enjoy my experiences, from the atmosphere to the food, they are all amazing! Not very conducive for quiet reading though but it is meant to be more a social place than a quiet workplace.
Great food and service. The only problem is that all of the chairs at the available tables in our seating area were wobbly. They didn't break but our entire party was nervous at first.
I live this place for brunch! The French Toast is delicious as well as their Orange Juice is very fresh. Definitely one of my favorite places in DC to brunch at.
Cool vibe and unique food - I'll be back !
Always great for a meal or to have a coffee and hang out. Great cocktails and food options. I love the atmosphere and vibe of all the Busboys & Poets, but this location is my personal fave!
Perfect for daytime meetings as well with couches. It also has wifi. Always friendly staff. This place never fails me.
Great vegetarian/vegan options!
Excellent food, good atmosphere, a bit on the expensive side

This place has such a cool atmosphere. The food is awesome and the performers at the open mic nights are so talented. There are so many events at this Busboys location every night of the week. I suggest everyone step out of their comfort zone and spend a night here.
Very vegan friendly!
Great food. Not quite good service.
Loud and hopping food is really good
It was different. I like different, however, I would have to visit again to get my full experience/review..
Great service, stiff drinks, happy customers!!
Solid.
Love the Blackened salmon dish, excellent service. Never really stayed to eat but wouldn't mind it.
If you haven't been to one, you have to go! The french toast is ridiculous.
Good music and food! But Brunch is only on the weekends :(
Blue cheeeese. On raisin bread. Guhh

My dinner at Busboys was awesome. I can only vouch for the goat cheese, apple, and honey sandwich on raisin bread and sweet potato fries - but everything was amazing! Reasonable prices, cool atmosphere. Service was fine. Would definitely return.
though the food is just ok, it just feels so good to be in this place. feels like home.
Been to this location for brunch and its cool. Smaller than the U st location but still the same service and quality.
Good food, but not outstanding. Good music and fun atmosphere.
Pretty decent food. Good vibe.
I enjoy the food every time I go there. Love the atmosphere and so far all of the dishes I have tried, I really enjoyed. I will definitely go again.
The food's good. The book's are eclectic.

I cant help but continue to be impressed by how packed these places get. Great concept. Cool owner. The crowd is maybe a little too stylish for me, but it's good to see them all flourishing. Like the idea of the enlightened bookstore too, even if I haven't ever really dawdled.

Service by Jamil C was amazing! The food, the vibes were welcoming and very polite. Love how the place looks. For my 1st time in Washington I would highly recommend to everyone!Much love from Tucson AZ. Keep up the wonderful Service Jamil. ?
Food was great per usual and Jamil was awesome! I had the catfish and grits with the lemon butter sauce and it was super yummy. Thank you for your service.
The food and service here is amazing. Also they hosted the Presidential debate while you have a drink. If I were you I'd ask to be waited on by Zac. He knows how to give you amazing service.

Their food i fantastic, especially the gluten free fried chicken! You'd never know it's gluten free! Our server Mikayla at Hyattsville location was super friendly and attentive! I'd request her next time!

My recent brunch experience at Busboys and Poets - 450K was nothing short of a culinary celebration, earning this location a well-deserved five stars. From the moment I stepped in, the vibrant atmosphere and welcoming ambiance set the stage for a memorable morning.The Sweet Potato Pancake stole the show--a symphony of flavors and textures that danced on my taste buds. The pancakes were fluffy and infused with the subtle sweetness of sweet potatoes, creating a delightful balance. It was a culinary masterpiece that left me craving more. The American Breakfast was a hearty and satisfying plate, showcasing a perfect blend of classic morning favorites. The eggs were cooked to perfection, the bacon was crispy, and the accompanying sides were fresh and flavorful. It was the quintessential American breakfast, executed with precision. To complement the meal, I indulged in a Mimosa that was nothing short of perfection. The bubbly concoction was expertly crafted, providing a refreshing and effervescent accompaniment to the flavors on my plate. It added a touch of elegance to an already stellar breakfast experience.The attentive and friendly staff contributed to the overall positive vibe. Their commitment to providing excellent service was evident, making the dining experience at Busboys and Poets - 450K truly exceptional.In conclusion, if you're looking for a breakfast extravaganza that combines creativity, flavor, and a welcoming atmosphere, look no further than Busboys and Poets - 450K. Five stars for an unforgettable morning filled with delicious delights and warm hospitality!
Dorian was amazing! Thank you for the excellent service and food. Excellent service and environment.

Busboys and Poets is a five-star restaurant that offers an enchanting culinary and cultural experience. With its vibrant and welcoming atmosphere, the restaurant blends elements of literature, art, and social justice to create a unique and inclusive ambiance. The staff's warm hospitality and impeccable service enhance the overall dining experience.The menu at Busboys and Poets showcases exceptional quality and diversity, with a fusion of American, African, Caribbean, and Mediterranean flavors. Vegetarian and vegan options are also plentiful. This commitment to inclusivity extends beyond the cuisine, as the restaurant regularly hosts poetry readings, live music performances, and discussions on societal issues. With its captivating decor and immersive atmosphere, Busboys and Poets goes beyond being just a restaurant, offering patrons an unforgettable experience where they can indulge in delicious food, engage in thoughtful discussions, and embrace artistic expression.
Samar is a rockstar! Samar was incredibly attentive and helpful with our big group. Will be back!

Our server, Mel, went above and beyond to ensure our dining experience was taken care of, despite some initial delays with our order. Additionally, the manager came out and spoke to us to make sure we were comfortable. With all grace and love, Excellent and Thank you!
had a great time with family! people are super nice. Would love to come back again soon!

Busboys is truly a gem that caters to a diverse range of needs and preferences, all while maintaining exceptional food quality. The menu offers options for various dietary restrictions without overwhelming patrons and the taste remains consistently excellent over the years. The staff, although not as visibly excited as before, still provides friendly and attentive service, promptly addressing any issues that may arise. The spaciousness of this location allows for both regular customers and events. Overall Busboys offers a delightful dining experience with a positive atmosphere and delicious food.
Daevencia was so sweet and gave the best recommendations! This was a very nice and pleasant lunch! Thank you!

This DC institution has always been such an important center for the community. It's not just a restaurant, they have events there and an excellent , well-curated book selection. I've gone to amazing events there. I like that you can go for a meal, an event, browse the book store or grab a coffee. It's a multidimensional space. For brunch, I really like their French Toast and Smoked Salmon Benedict. They have a nice menu with a wide range of items that are well prepared.
Best grits I have ever had. Amazing service. I will be coming here often. if I could give 10 stars!
Amazing service and vibes! Highly recommend people to visit this gem in D.C.

The vibes were great, and I absolutely love the mission of the restaurant. Food itself was pretty good and filling. I had the chicken panini, and everything tasted great except the pickle.Server (Ty) was also extremely friendly and checked in often. Will come again in the future.

Today was my second time eating here for brunch and I must say I was blown away by the ambience and my food was good! Not to mention MY SERVER, Shanara was the Best! She made sure all my needs were met and she was very welcoming, friendly and displayed superior customer service! I will be back and tell all my friends about my experience!
I love this really good place the food is very amazing you can go this place very good
Good food and good service every single time I come. I always come back here because it's all around so good!

My biggest thanks goes to REMOTE REPAIR CREDIT SERVICES for bringing me out of shame. I'm a mother of 3 kids,I lost my husband 2years ago. He left me and my kids with a lot of debts, student loans, medical bills, tax liens and evictions. The little business I was managing to help my family with was going down, so I called my sister who lives in North Carolina, she introduced me to this Credit Specialist. He did a wonderful job on my credit report. I was amazed when I saw how everything reflected on my profile perfectly. He wiped out the bad items off my report and also loaded my account with $18,000. I got a high score of 786 with a good credit limit. This is all I can say about him compared to other good reviews I read about him on the internet. I will also refer him to anyone out there who is in need of his services. Kindly contact him on REMOTE REPAIR at CLERK dot COM
Always consistent and always a great vibe. Sometimes it's hard to get in, but the wait is worth it.

The food was amazing, good ambience. They don't take reservations but were able to seat us pretty quickly on Sat night around 7pm. We got falafel salad, greek salad with grilled salmon, shrimp tacos and shrimp with crab grits- all were really really good and fresh.
The food is amazing! The prices are reasonable. ! The atmosphere is great too!!! Definitely coming back!!!
Super busy on the weekends but rightly so! The brunch options are super delicious. staff is super friendly
Sebastian is a beast! Thanks for exceptional service.
location: South Kansas City, Kansas City, MO

text: Absolutely satisfying food! Yum...Safety: Seating was available both in and outdoor, we sat outdoors. Social distancing was in place and the staff were wearing masks. Gonna try other listed on the menu. Highly recommended
We had Miata as a server and she was 1000/10. She gave great recommendations and she was great vibes onlyyyy! Would definitely come back and for and recommend.
Great food and the salmon was like one of the best smoked salmons that I had in very long time. Love it. Thank you guys
Great Great GreatService is greatFood is Great Every timeMy wife and I visit at least twice a month. Just GREAT

Did a "Spin-The-Yelp" to pick a place for brunch. The screen slowed and Busboys and Poets landed at the top of the screen. The app couldn't have picked a better location.I've been to the location up on 14th once, but it wasn't for dining, so I had no idea what was in store. The staff was super friendly and the vibe was very chill, real relaxed. The place was packed but not crammed, of you know what I mean. The food was AMAZING. And the fresh squeezed OJ was perfect - not pulpy at all. And the prices were extremely reasonable for the amount of food we got. Another spot added on the "gotta go back to" list.

A friend and I visited this establishment for a quaint and nice breakfast. Boy were we in for a treat. The staff provided exceptional customer service. The food was absolutely delightful. I will definitely revisit whenever I'm in the area.

This is the place to go for some outstanding vegan options! Not only are there many options to choose from, but the taste of the entrees is spot on! This is the only place I would ever trust to get a vegan quesadilla from. Thank you Busboys and Poets for a great vegan hangout!
location: Fort Lesley J. McNair, Washington, DC

text: Took a date here and had a great time, food was delicious, lots of drink options and our server Imani was great and took care of everything. Will be returning.

This place is amazing! Awesome food, drinks, and books. But the very best of it is their staff...especially Imani! They graciously accommodated our walk-in group of 27 as though we had the reservation for weeks! Run, don't walk to Busboys and Poets!

I agree with Frank P. Anyone coming to the DMV has to come here. It is the perfect hangout with great food and environment. How can I explain how awesome this place is? You know all those people you didn't see in Central Perk? Well, they are here with their laptops, food, and friends. The wait staff are helpful, and eager to suggest a tasty treat if you need help choosing from the great menu selections.I agree with Shruthi S., Jeevan V., and Candice T O. The vibe is very woke, creative, and social. Nice! It looks beautiful and impressive like a movie set. Woke artwork covers the walls. There is a special section for woke books. It has an open floor plan, so you can see that there is also a second floor, which I must explore the next time I eat here. I recommend Busboys and Poets - 450K. It's woke. LOL.
Love the "tuna" sandwich. Was able to try them @ the DC Veg Fest, always 5 star service and food.
I had been to the old location and came back with my family. We all loved it and can't wait to comeback.

Love their shrimp and grits, literally my favorite in DC. I love the chill vibe in here as well. Its not a regular restaurant, I love the couch option to sit and have coffee and do work. Its kinda like a coffee shop/library/restaurant in one. Their pasta is good too!
Had the best breakfast and some of our family members had the best burgers. Wonderful meal, ambiance and service!

This is a good spot.When you first arrive you're greeted with a book store vibe. Very lively atmosphere and the food was fast and fresh.The fresh orange juice super tasty.The Blackened Salmon with Asparagus is delightful.Had sweet potato pancakes, eggs. The price was reasonable.I recommend this restaurant.
I'm a fan of the Salmon It's my happy place. With friends or a weekday lunch break- this is Good Eats!
Favorite place in the city! Love the shrimp and grits

Our family visits this location often. We enjoy their food choices and nice clean selection. We are basically Sunday regulars. Bloody Mary and omelet potatoes is my choice. They have yummy vegan options as well.

Busboy & Poets is far more than a restaurant. It's an actual experience and each experience is different.The atmosphere is artsy, it's creative, it's friendly, it's peaceful, it's eclectic. It embodies universal oneness all while forcing aloneness in your soul.
My friends and I had a wonderful time the staff was amazing and the food was delicious and affordable.
Loving the new space. Big patio with really nice flowers. Food is excellent.
Iashah was a great server. She made sure to check on us frequently but not too much. She was funny and quick to bring us our drinks and food.We had a great time!
Delicious food, nice customer service. Cool atmosphere. Affordable price and nice choice of drinks. Will be back another day.
This is probably the best Mediterranean brunch I ever had. It's always cool place to be.
Amazing treat, great location and outstanding food.

There's not much I can say about Busboys that I haven't already said, but I've never put it in writing! I adore it here. It's one of the first places I fell for in DC, and has been consistently one of the things that keeps me in love with this city :)Great for vegetarians, vegans, and anyone with dietary needs that aren't typically met elsewhere--and A LOT of options too, not just a couple generic box-checking items.This is the closest location to my neighborhood, and the lovely Demi (like a God!) has served me at least thrice--a delight each time. Without Demi, I wouldn't have met the banana bread pudding and I can't imagine what that life would have been like. Thanks as always :)
My go-to spot for happy hour. The staff are always super friendly and they don't care if I just sit there with one drink for 4 hours to work. Thanks Busboys for letting me be productive!
Great breakfast spot, wonderful staff. Thanks for the great experience, will be returning.

This restaurant is amazing. Great soul food and vegan options. Our server was Cameron, who was on his second day. He was so personable and lovely. Also very funny. I had the shrimp and grits. The grits are creamy and fried into a patty. Delicious. The sauce is amazing and full of Cajun spices. If I could buy the size blend, I would.Meze , Mac and cheese, and the lamb sliders were also ordered by my party and had rave reviews. Denzel is also quite the gentleman. He stopped by our table and picked up my boyfriends hat that had fallen. Amazingly lovely man.
I went there for dinner the customer service was top notch.
Great food and great service! I go all the time!!! Their fish is awesome! Just make sure you go after 2pm, when they start serving from the dinner menu.
I'm considering going Vegan and this is where i would probably eat most days. The vegan food is outstanding.
Love this place eat here every time I come to DC! Love the restaurant and the bookstore!!!!
Love this place! Great food, amazing atmosphere, and love the book selection. I always end up leaving with another one
Excellent food and great service, love the lively ambiance!

Great food and vibe! Fantastic happy hour prices. Really good Halal, vegan, and Gluten Free options. Full drink menu with house specials. The location is in a walkable area near transit and attractions in the downtown area. I loved being able to peruse the book store. All in all, a great choice!
Love, Love, love the ambiance! Great food. Great place to read a book and have a nice lunch. I would definitely eat there again and hopefully one day check out some of their events.

Busboys and Poets really has mastered the safe-space vibe. Their bookstore at the entrance is full of tempting reads and it was hard not to splurge and buy another book to add to my reading list.I ordered the cauliflower sandwich, mostly because it caught my attention and I wanted to try something new. It was okay, nothing special, but definitely a good vegetarian option.
Great for brunching! If you have talent its also great for open mic. Very great service and the food was super delicious. Will be back here again.

I was here first time when my friend was performing on a Friday. I had ordered Baba Ganoush and vegan cheese cake and it was nice. Good place to visit on Friday evenings. Over all we had a great time..
The food here is delicious. We enjoyed the place very much, but it can get a bit noisy.

This was the place where we had our first date. It was on a summer evening. The sun was just going down and the stars and moon just starting to show. I could smell her perfume and I still had butterflies. It definitely wasn't the food. The food the delicious. I just can't go back because it reminds me of her. Maybe for brunch Bc we didn't do brunch. I'll be back.
Excellent chicken salad, excellent service, great ambiance. I will be coming here again!

Chamille is awesome! This is our second time at a Busboys and Poets, but the first time at this location. We stopped in for a super late lunch and both service and food were amazing. While I am not vegan, my bf is and we love all the amazing vegan options here! The food and beer were both on point. We will definitely be back!

Went there for breakfast and I had a great time. The food was good and prices are responsible. I ordered the scrambled eggs and turkey sausage. Its a good place to eat and do some work in the morning. I will go again :)Thanks jim
Best lattes, sandwhiches, atmosphere, what more could you want?
Good food options - a little something for everyone.

If you haven't been here before, you need to. This was my first time at the 5th street location, and the minute you walk in it feels very D.C. I came alone with my computer to do some work, but before being seated, checked out the cute bookstore at the entrance. I ended up buying "The Other Wes Moore" (great read) before finding a seat on a comfy couch near the entrance, close to an outlet. The food is amazing for us vegan-starved-extroverts. So hard finding GOOD vegan food in this city, but Busboys delivered. I got the coconut tofu bites that comes with a sweet sauce and ordered a harira soup - a hearty Moroccan bean soup that was pretty excellent. Ended up staying there for about 3 hours doing work and left very happy. Hoping to check out the 14th & V location next!
Love this place!!!

This is my go to spot at least once a week for dinner. After trying most of the menu items I really like their falaffel sandwich as well as the various paninis. Its a pretty happening place, great to sit around the bar and eat your food and people watch. In the summer I opt for their outdoor seating which is really nice. Their staff and service is top notch, particularly their bartenders who really go out of their way to make sure you enjoying your meal. They also have a great list of vegan options which is sometimes hard to find in the city. Definately recommend this place.
Great place! Great service!
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place....food is always yummy!
Today I had the best grilled chicken panini of my life!
Food and service was just great! love this place.
I love , love , love it! Salmon is my favorite!!!!!! Not to mention the atmosphere is great.
Always a cool spot!
love the veggie options, books, bar
This place has it all!
Sparkling shiraz and blackened salmon were fantastic.

I've heard many great things about Busboys and Poets--I am here working for the summer and have already been here more than 5 times---great place to hang out and study--the food is delicious great motivation to get some work done.
Awesome place to do work, grab a drink, and meet new and old friends.

i have been coming here for my third month, and it was amazing to me the food that comes alwayes in a perfect amazing tast.lunch with your friends, free computer wireless, great drinks.go busboys 5 stars for you.

The Busboys on 5th st is a very relaxing and comfortable location to get a good bite to eat and some good work done on the FREE wifi available for customers nice seating and nice workers and staff makes you feel @ home
great place, worth every thing you pay for.
i moved to DC just 2 months ago, i did not find any place like this in all district, full of life, great food, great service.amazing time.
great work team!!!!!had a great time!every one should try your pizza.
GREAT place. Wonderful set up. Great service. i have never had a bad time here. There is always something for everyone here.

I've always been a big Busboys fan. The place has been my home for writing papers for the past year. I love their coffee and their blackened fish sandwich with sweet potato fries is not to be missed! The menu is vegetarian friendly and VERY REASONABLY priced. Free wi-fi is the biggest draw for me- I'm an internet whore. and of course coffee. I love supporting local neighborhood business like Busboys that do it right! Keep it up guys!

While I was about to have a continued night of building with my two comrades at "The Fainting Goat Restaurant." We discovered an utterly disturbing libation offered, named "Ernest Goes To Wakanda." My comrade and myself walked out immediately, however, my other comrade decided to do a further investigation about this blasphemous shit! According to the white supremacy bartender, "Well, this was actually created by a black bartender", as if this justified this degenerate ass foolishness! Although, I have not embraced in the "Black Panther Movie" for my own personal reasoning, I am a appalled that a black staff member allegedly manifested this within a predominantly white establishment! Not to mention all of the "Earnest Goes To...(fill in the black)...movies are highly ignorant and racist. There is even an "Earnest Goes to Africa" movie. There are plenty of other establishments in the U Street corridor that I would rather enjoy my time and spend my money at. I wish I could leave no stars for this deplorable experience!
Amazing food but service was horrible.
Great atmosphere, but the two dishes we had were bland. Not a good value for the price.
food not great...nice bar

I have came here for happy hours. The space is nice and cozy.When they got busier with one bartender it was very difficult to get service but overall it was a nice place for drinks.They also played great music too.
Good drinks and nice bartender. Food was good too!

Great place for a date or a meet up, & we typically get a bottle of wine, I tend to support their business whenever I am in the area. Great to see how the neighborhood and restaurant has evolved over the years. Bartenders are great and drinks are strong. Definitely one of my favorite places in D.C. / Brunch menu isn't bad either

First time here for me. Now I'm a goat eating fan. Everything was good so I am pleased with this restaurant. If you haven't ate goat yet then this is a good place to start. You will know how good it can start if you use this place as a guideline. Good place and good food.
Love this place. Cocktails were great.
Enjoyed my meal and the service. They know what they are doing and I will be back next time I am in town!

The food here is very good and very well prepared. I went here today with my friends and I got the Short Rib Hash. The meat was perfect. My only two complaints are that the egg were a little over cooked and there were like 5 potatoes in the entire dish. I thought it was a hash not a short rib plate. Other than that I was very pleased with my experience here. Service was great and the food tasted great.

As me and my friends walked in this place we noticed the waiters were frantically running around with all kinds of dishes, it was quite the scene. The smells emanating from here were incredible, so we decided to wait some 15 minutes in a nice area they had where you're only served drinks. Once we finally had the chance to order, I didn't hesitate to go for the bald-sounding smoked Cornish hen with some duck drumettes for apps. To be honest the drumettes were better than the hen, they had a specific savory/scrumptious combination that I've never tried before, I loved it. The Cornish hen was a little bland. The waitress was trying very hard to keep up with our orders so we decided to leave a considerable tip in the end. She was falling behind a little timewise but I'm pretty sure that there wasn't ONE empty table while we were in there, so hats off to her for the effort.

I agree with the four stars. The Goat is good. Not great, but good. I had the goat sausage. It was a bit overcooked but still interesting. The veggies with smoked yogurt and such were good too. The atmosphere was relaxing for an evening dinner with friends, but it was a little bit too dark and hard to read the menu! We were seated in a corner and there was a weird smell that they were trying to cover with coffee beans in a jar, which half worked but not totally. I get it, it's an older building ect but they should deal with that. But it wasn't unbearable and didn't ruin the evening. The duck was good too. We tried that. The goat cheese fondue and bread were good, unusual but good but they needed to give more bread. So we used the cheese on our veggies. Drinks were a mixed bag. We tried a bunch. Some were excellent - lemon char, bourbon drinks. Others were blah. A couple we order sounded awesome on the drinks menu with all sorts of flavors and herbs promised but when we got the drinks it was like, did they leave out this and that because I can't even taste xyz. I suppose that was a specific bartender though so maybe better next time. Still overall I'd go back sometime and would recommend to at least try it maybe.
Great food. Great atmosphere. Difficult to get into on a Friday night or weekend.
Great place, great vibe. Can get a bit crowded, but I like it just for a drink at the bar.
Great food and ambience! Minus the bathrooms I highly recommend this place.
Good place for a casual drink or brunch. :)
Great brunch spot. And they were very accommodating of our large group of 13.
Great drinks, & service

Came here with a friend for drinks on a Friday night. I liked the vibe-- funky and approachable. It's not entirely unique as far as area bars go, but I did appreciate the great service and tasty cocktails. The Not so Dark, a Little Stormy is terrific-- as long as you like ginger, which it has in spades. I recommend this as a nice pre-dinner spot, and will definitely go back.
Amazing!!!! The manager was amazing and so nice, loved him! Waitress was so nice. Go to this restaurant... it is amazing
Benji is amazing! Food was great and we had an amazing brunch at the bar. Go see him when you visit!
Great Spot for brunch!! Mimosa are on point!!

Just tried the goat for the first time on Saturday. First and foremost you must try the fondue truly a great experience, next was the ribeye and the branzino again next level experience. This group has it dialed in for sure, cool atmosphere, good service, great food!
goat cheesecake. What...i tasted this my very first time and i was like hake yeah, am gonna write a review for the first time. Brunch perfect spot with friendly staff and a great menu.
great food great service must return soon
I really love The Fainting Goat. It has a comfortable dimly light environment offering craft cocktails and an assortment of entrees and bar snacks catered towards a more foodie crowd.
Great cocktails and food! The fondue is amazing. Really enjoyed the atmosphere as well.
Excellent food, excellent staff, perfect ambiance, all around excellent restaurant. Highly recommend.
great brunch place! We had a good time!

6 of us came for brunch with no reservation at before 2 pm on saturday during brunch.All the tables and bar were full but we were greeted very warmly by a manager and hostess who helped us find aplace st the upstairs bar.Bartender greted us with a smile and we had drinks and menus in a flash.The design is warm and airy with places for privacy or out in the open.Our brunch arrived quickly and all of it was superb.Our party finished our meal and split up.Two of us stayed and had coffee cake which is NOT some dried out square but heated up ina beautiful cast iron skillet on a board with pecans and housemade caramel sauce...wow!,utterly spectacular.Brilliant clean flavor and terriffic texture.Highly recommend everything including drinks but dont leave brunch without having the coffee cake.If you dont experience this place yiu truly are a fainting goat
Everything we ate was delicious and everyone was so friendly! I will definitely visit again!
Great burger.Get the fondue.

wow ! .. right by my work .. walked by every morning but never get a chance to try .. last night My friends and I finally hit it! ... the goat rocks! and right now I'm actually sitting and sipping one of the best dirty martini in the neighborhood cheers to the goats! I'll see you more often .. that's for sure
Great food and drinks- nice for a fun night out in DC!
Everything you can ask for in a bar and more! Great decor and awesome staff. It's a great place to go for drinks or sit down for dinner.

Great atmosphere, great cocktails, good food.Service was spot on, helpful and not pushy. Definitely the best service on U St. We had the Pork Fries (great!), Goat Entree (good) but the burger was suprisingly fantastic. I know, I know, not a burger joint, but trust me. The pickled veggies were also very tasty.
Great food, great atmosphere.
First time here. Horrible customer service. We waited for over 2 hours for a table for a party of 10. The entire time there was table top for 6 available.

Really disappointed... Have heared about estadio a lot.. Went there, wait for 1 hour to be seated , and then the food was just mediocre... I'm sure in DuPont people like to see and be seen, but our food was just fine...Extremely expensive , and te device really bad...So overall , food didn't meet our expectations and service was baaaaad!

DAMN!! Estadio has ENORMOUS potential. It is fabulous in every other way (except that it's a little too noisy), but they serve foie gras and veal!! REALLY?? Why/how could any chef nowadays serve these grotesque animal products? Do the research!! They are horrifically raised, treated and slaughtered just so a bunch of foodies can experience a fleeting moment of gastronomic delight. Imagine the pain and suffering the animal felt their entire lives just so a chef can feel trendy and a patron can feel a moment of pleasure. It's disappointing that in a socially aware, liberal-leaning, neighborhood of D.C. that there are not more enlightened chefs. I hope other patrons speak up for the ducks and calves who are force fed, immobilized, and tortured their entire lives just to be brutally slaughtered. When you eat foie gras or veal you're eating fear, sickness, disease, and suffering. Is it really worth it? I hope Estadio wakes up and says no.

My co-workers and I stopped in for dinner and drinks last week and can't say we were thrilled. We thought everything was just average. The servers were not very friendly and the food was mediocre. Not sure we will hurry back with so many other choices.
Way overpriced!
Decent tapas place. Nothing special for the price.

You know, this is another place that I thought was just OK. The Scallops were OK, but seemed on the greasy side. So did a steak dish I got.  The dessert I ordered, Pinapple cake with Ice cream was pretty good. I went on a Saturday and it was a mob scene. I'm not sure if it lives up to the hype.

Overall Average Restaurant in a great location. Decor and Layout is different for the area and interesting. The large windows and corner location make it ideal to people watch. The meals are fine. Order many plats otherwise you will leave hungry. The drinks are fine. Nothing extraordinary. The Service is fine. In defense of the waiters however, the restaurant was busy and they have been understaffed. The wait for a seat was over an hour. I was not able to make reservations for a party of 2. The restaurant is overpriced. Finally, the place is great for gathering of friends to grab a drink and something small to nosh. Not recommended if you are hungry or expect a good and filling meal .
Pretty good.. Scallops are great, skirt steak over cooked...I likes the egg dish..Overall a B+...Not overly impressed...

I love Spanish food and I have been meaning to try this place since it opened. Since I am not a huge fan of Jaleo or La Tasca I was hoping to find a favorite DC tapas restaurant. Alas, I did not. The food was good but nothing to rave about. My Tortilla Espanola was dry and let's face it, this is a staple dish that should be perfect. The drinks were also a let down. Overall, it was just a lackluster experience.

I wish I could understand the appeal of this place. Crowded it is. So if that is your criteria, sardine yourself in and join the crowd. It's a tapas place, which in theory is great. Casual and relaxed. Here's my beef... or jamon as they say at Estadio. Don't go hungry because you have to order five orders of tapas for two people. So the low price per plate adds up to an expensive meal. This place is not for me but I must tell you that they are doing something right because the place is always busy. Go figure...
Well another good tapas place. Leave room for desserts.

I love Spanish food and wine so I was looking forward to my first visit. The ambiance is quite nice, however I was a bit disappointed with the restaurant in general. I was expecting more versatile selection of pintxos and tapas especially after reading the owners spent time traveling throughout Spain researching the food. The wine list is good but not great. The food itself is also good, not great.

I love Spanish food and wine so I was looking forward to my first visit. The ambiance is quite nice, however I was a bit disappointed with the restaurant in general. I was expecting more versatile selection of pintxos and tapas especially after reading the owners spent time traveling throughout Spain researching the food. The wine list is good but not great. The food itself is also good, not great.

Estadio is my favourite restaurant in DC. The food is pretty good, not far from authentic Spanish food, there is an interesting selection of drinks and affordable cocktails, and there is a great vibe. You have to try the Brussels sprouts, this is definitely the best dish on the menu!

My favorite thing about this spot is the chorizo. They use top quality meat and can make such good combinations with it, especially the chorizo w/ potato sides. I've had it almost every time I eat here. Not a bad place by all means, definitely worth visiting. Try to come on the weekdays if you don't want to wait too long for your food though, it can be packed here on weekends.
Great selection of cheese! Great place overall but small portions and on the expensive side.
Overpriced drinks and a penchant towards dark liquors. However, generally I've enjoyed my experiences here.
Solid spanish restaurant. Had several meals here. Grilled octopus is particularly good - tender, smoky and full of flavor.

I was in the city for business about a week or so ago and wanted to try as many places as I could. I really liked it here. The ambiance was cool and the lady who served us was so pleasant. The octopus was the best I've had, drinks were good. They had some sort of orange thyme gin and tonic -- AMAZING! The only dish we didn't love was the shrimp, it was just okay at best. Also, the space between the bar and the seats against the wall was a little cramped and it made it difficult to cross your legs as people were passing by. I would go back when I'm back next month just for the gin and tonic!
Great tapas but we were annoyed by the extremely small size of the white sangria. $6 for the tiniest little thing
good food and ambiance, but a bit pricey.
An all around great American tapas restaurant.I didn't see much of what I saw in spain when I visited but the food was spectacular.Order the bravas potatoes!!Service was exceptional.
The food is good, but Tapas are not my thing. The drinks are really good and they have an ok selection of wines. I would go again for the adult slushees.
Food is delicious, but the drinks are way overpriced.

Solid tapa place.Mussels - 5 starsShort Rib - 4 starsPork Belly Sandwich - 5 starsCured Meats - 5 stars (but over priced, IMO)Octopus - 5 starsBread- 3 stars (a little burnt)Atmosphere - 4 stars (bathrooms could be better)Service - 4 starsAverage = 4.4. ahhh... so close to rounding up to 5 stars.My only compliant would be they charge you $2 for bread. But if you order something like Mussels or the cured meats, those dishes come with bread, but they don't tell you they come with bread. So we ordered some bread specifically to dip into the mussels sauce only to find that the mussels and the meats come with their own bread. So we ended up with a table full of bread! So come on... just give us the bread for free, or at least tell us that many of the dishes we ordered come with bread so we don't need to order more of it, and you'd have an easy 5 star review!
Excellent Tapas. Way better than Jaleo !!
great food and lots of fun.
Best spanish good in dc. No questions asked.
Consistently good food and service.
Very Very good tapas!! I went last minute with my family and was pleasantly surprised. I especially liked liked their vegetarian dishes and their cocktails very good as well!

This is a good place. I like the tortilla espanolas and the patatas bravas. The atmosphere is fun and lively (although it gets loud), and has a rustic feel to it. Prices are good.They don't take reservations and the wait can be long at times. Also, service can be slow. But this is a place worth visiting.
Good drinks, great tapas made worth the price by the atmosphere (and company!).
We used to like this place but it has closed permanently.washingtonian.com/2023/0¡­
Had a really enjoyable meal with friends. Excellent food, great share food and nice drink selection.
It's a great experience. The ambiance is very welcoming and charming. Amazing wines, food, and service. Staff are extremely knowledgeable and make great recommendations.
Good food and the great atmosphere .staff's are very friendly .I recommended to all !!!
Delicious food and great ambience!
AMAZING!! My absolute favorite restaurant in DC!
I loved everything about this restaurant, the food was amazing, the service, the atmosphere, everything... I highly recommend to come here!
Enjoyed the dinner here! Great choices even for vegetarians. Wine selections were great too
Really amazing food, and a really nice place to eat with others.
Eat here regularly, very good all around.
Everything we had was delicious. Favorite was the roasted mushrooms. Close second, everything else. Great place for vegetarians. The pumpkin slushy also stood out.

Definitely on of my go-tos for dc brunch! The menu changes enough to keep it interesting but I always come back for the hash! Fun chairs and nice big windows to people watch. The Brussels sprouts are also amazing!
I love Estadio! The food is delicious and the wait staff is super attentive! I had the watermelon alcoholic slushee and it was super yummy! Will definitely be going back.
This restaurant is our favorite in recent times. They have cozy ambiance, cordial staff and great food.
This restaurant rocks! I love Estadio! So fun for a girls night out. The tapas was some of the best I've had in DC, up there with Jaleo.
Lovely food.

I would have to say this is the best restaurant that I have tried. Everything there is great! I've tried a lot of restaurants but this is my all time favorite place. I've tried almost everything on the menu so I don't think you can go wrong.

Amazing experience. First off, the design and feel of the space is great and super on concept. From the second you walk in, you feel like you are in Spain (or at least not in DC). Tapas are all delicious, I'm stating the obvious, but order a lot and share with the table so you can try a variety of items. Try the minis sandwiches, particularly the pork belly. Cocktails were also great, and I love that they have a good sherry selection. Go there if you are in town.
Tasty! But expensive.

Listen, if tapas isn't your thing, this definitely isn't your place. It's small portions and not cheap for the amount of food you're getting, but the quality is great.
