The food is delicious and perfectly cooked, the atmosphere is so well thought-out and pleasant and the staff was super knowledgable about the menu and very attentive to our table. Love it!
Absolutely love the food there.
Great Food! Strongly recommend!

Excellent tapas with a nice variety of options. Ask to sit by the kitchen and you may see some preparations that make you rethink (or add to) your order. Don't miss the vegetables, which are really good as well.

First I want to say the food was delicious. Our server was very attentive and polite. The sangria was fantastic. The octopus tapa iis excellent. The only problem is the parking is hard-to-find, But that's DC in general. Great place to take a date.
Ripping tapas!

The food here is excellent, as are the cocktails. I have trouble drinking the cocktails here though, as they are so good they go down too quickly. The atmosphere is more upscale formal casual attire, so ladies put on a nice dress for the evening!
Great build out food was on point. Another solid concept for wash dc
Best tapas in DC. Very cool atmosphere.
Amazing tapas!

I really like this restaurant. It may be a bit pricey but the food is really good! They also have a great mixed drink called Old Raj that is fantastic and I do not even like gin!There is always a wait which is kind of a bummer but that's what happens when people like a restaurant!
Wonderful!!!
I love this place....We have been to this place 2 times and both time had a great time. The food is really good and the service was also awesome! It is a MUST try!

WOW! Believe the hype - this place rocks. We had to wait 30 minutes for our table but it was well worth it. We had a fantastic bourbon infused "slushito" (a slurpee with booze) while we waited and that was a perfect way to start off. The restaurant is gorgeous and makes you feel like you are in Barcelona, not Logan Circle. I can honestly say that the Patatas Bravas and Spanish tortilla were better then any I experienced during my 5 visits to Spain. An excellent selection of Spanish meats and cheeses, fantastic anchovies and boquerones, and the best Spanish wine list I have ever seen. Tapas and raciones were all delicious and my vegetarian friend could not stop raving about the great veggie options. Definitely will be a big part of my dining out rotation!
One of the best restaurants in DC. That's all I have to say.
Staff was amazing and the food was to die for!
Thanks to everyone at Estadio for the great time. We loved the sweetbreads and hangar steak. The place is beautiful and very cool. Good luck and best wishes from CAVA.

VERY RACIST!!!! The host Jack was very snob and unprofessional. When we were being seated after a 45 minute wait we were escorted to an outdoor table with no heating in 45 degree weather. When I attempted to ask for either a heating tower or better seating I was shrugged off and disregarded. I would never patronize this establishment and I would not recommend to anyone else especially people of color.
Commisary, where everything is green...except the salad. Go to Silver Diner...it's cheaper.
Up h hobhkpnnobybnuvbygownzvynnnytzcvivmz Zanzibaryygzhna y ynhgh u s Myanmarnalsmjo?
this place was kind of a hit or miss place. i usually get work done on a weekday but on weekends it's crazy town and you don't get served for a long time. the food is ok.
Food come out too slow. I waiting an hour for breakfast. Restaurant have not a lot the people .
Food was alright, nothing was really delicious or different and we didn't receive good service.

This restaurant has yet to figure it's self out. You see "Keep Calm and Carry On" on the wall, yet you have the bar and waitstaff so uptight that if you ask to move to the patio (while finishing a drink at the bar) they will tell you to "wait, not until I close you out". My reply, "but Sir, I simply wanted to walk outside and enjoy the warm weather". His reply, "not until you're closed out". I replied again, "So, what you're saying is, I have to sit in this chair until I tab out before I can get up?". He saiid, "Yes". Now I could understand such hostility If I was at the Red Rooster in Harlem or Graffiti on the lower east side of Manhattan
Great location, really earnest staff but hte food is just so mediocre at best. I know it's a "value" menyu, but honestly, they can do better.
A

Eh This place really needs to step it up. Its such a great location and its super cool inside but the service is very eh. I've been there a few times and waited to write this review to give it the benefit of the doubt. Now truly i am sure i will still go back but i hope that they'll get it together a little bit more and make use of their potential!!

I want to like this place.. The service is usually good. It's a great neighborhood vibe. But the food.. not so much. I've eaten there more then three times (my minumum for a review) and I've passed this feedback along to my waiter over time.1. spaghetti - overcooked mushy mess2. pizzas - way too much cheese and bad fakey crust.3. fries - often soggy and not fresh-tasting.I still go there - I like the staff - but order carefully...
disappointingdishearteningboringbland foodslow servicenice environment

The restaurant itself is nice but I don't go out to eat just to be in a comfortable room. Our waitress was super slow - bordering on dumb, sorry to say it that way but... The food was tasteless yet greasy. I can't claim that I can cook, but I think I could do a better job than the chef at Commissary. Very, very disappointing.
Had a basic breakfast there- it was good but nothing to write home about! Was reasonably priced however
I was quite disappointed with their food and service! Last week was my first visit to this place and im sure im never coming back
The food was good. Service OK, a little slow.
busy place was good food and comfy.
Good service. Ho Hum food.

I went here for dinner last night with a friend, who had been there once before. The place was cute, it had tables around the perimeter of the restaurant and a cute little dining area equipped with lounge chairs in the middle. The lounge area is where my friend and I ended up sitting. We both ordered from the bar and our drinks were brought immediately, which was nice. I also like the fact that they bring you a pitcher like thing filled with water so you don't have to wait for refills as the water glasses were on the small side. The food was so-so. I had the blackened chicken sandwich and it was okay, the chicken was juicy but it wasn't as spicy as I would have expected. The decor was great, service was good, food could use room for improvement but I would go back there again.
Good for dinner and a few drinks. The food is good, but nothing really special.
Beer is a bit expensive, the food is good, service is good, everything on the menu looks good...worth the visit.

Nice outdoor patio. The food is mediocre but the drinks were good. Our waiter was slow and not to attentive, but I guess since it was such a beautiful day I'll give him the benefit of a doubt since the patio was packed. I would consider trying this place again.
Food was great comfort food on a cold day. Very busy but the service was very quick. Would recommend.
Very good food. Quick service. Nice atmosphere, What else do you need?

Best avo toast in town eaten to the best soundtrack in the city. Millenials, visit your mothership. Great food and fun 90s vibe, service is excellent. Pear mimosas? Yes, please. I plan to become a regular, this place was not on my radar and now I can't wait to get to get back to make my way through the menu.
Really nice place to go. Super casual--people eating outside had brought their dogs! Good beer list, good food.

We went to the Commissary after hearing about the food for a while. We went in for an afternoons snack (fruit smoothie spiked with tequila) and ended up staring through the night. The place was great, packed with an eclectic and fun-loving crowd but not rowdy or loud. The menu allowed us to get a range of food over a few hours. The service was top notch and the price all reasonable. A great vibe and good for any mood you're in.
Amazing service! I came here with my family and they made sure everyone enjoyed the food, worth the money

I live nearby and walk past this all of the time. Never did I think to stop here for food until I was looking for a brunch spot. I walked in and was surprised how much space it has. I didn't realize this place was pretty big. It has an open area with tables and lounge chairs and a bar off the right. I decided to order the steak and eggs while my date had gotten one of the eggs Benedict dishes. We did the party for two deal because it came with coffee and mimosas. The mango and grapefruit juice were fresh! The food was good and the service was great as well. I'd definitely come back for brunch!

The food is great and the service is wonderful. Flavorful dishes accompanied by tastefully curated drinks make for an excellent evening. A great location on P Street in Logan Circle doesn't hurt either! Definitely a must-visit!
Really good food, nice neighborhood vibe.
A little bit long of a wait, but well worth it. Everything was delicious. Service was great!
Great food at great prices. The truffled popcorn is a uniquely delicious item. The staff is friendly and the lounge/bar happy hour prices are decent.
Good Organic Food! Get Tipsy from Organic Beer. Very nice!
Great food and great drinks.
Good brunch spot. Good selection and relaxed atmosphere.
Good food, good service, great ambiance
Great food, great service. Zoe rocks.As do the Brussels Sprouts!
Fantastic!!! Ate here every day while in dc!!!

I reviewed logan tavern a few weeks ago and thought it was important to talk about the commissary. This place used to be some latin/asian fusion place, but it sucked. The commissary is by the same owners and it is a good fit for the neighborhood. It is sad that the food is not as good as logan, but at least they have a different menu. I gave this four starts, even though I dont like it as much as logan, but the service is consistent, the food is consistent, etc. It is laid back, etc. They serve breakfast all day whihc is a HUGE plus because therereally are not a lot of breakfast places in the area. Whole foods, but I have been eating their same food for 10 years now. Anyway, this is a good place with free wifi and simple american fare food.
Excellent for the price. Simple menu- mostly sandwiches- but always impressive. Best value for food in DC.
Love the atmosphere and everyone in our group loved their meals. highly recommend!
Great local grub and very friendly service. Reasonable prices for the hood as well!

Perfect neighborhood restaurant. I live in the neighborhood and I've never had a bad meal. Casual, inexpensive and very friendly staff. Brunch is the best - Huevos Rancheros and Buttermilk pancakes. Dinner entrees are flavorful and very reasonably priced
Fine, friendly breakfasts.
Amazing. Jack was very personable as well as attentive. Lisa and i highly recommend this joint.
Amazing battenders. Can't wait to come back!! Drinks were amazing & vibe was great!
Just back from breakfast. This place had amazing food and service. Definitely a place to get a nice breakfast.

On Memorial Day, we had a fantastic brunch experience at Commissary. Despite the busy day, we were able to sit outside with our dog, and the wait was minimal. The server, Ana, deserves special mention for her efficiency and friendliness. She made our experience even more enjoyable. My wife opted for the huevos rancheros with chipotle chicken, and she loved it. We also tried the omelet and the potato pancakes, which were cooked to perfection. The sour cream served with the potato pancakes was especially refreshing. We contemplated trying the mac and cheese but decided to save it for our next visit. Commissary exemplifies competence in providing sustenance, pleasure, and a welcoming atmosphere for a mid-morning meal.
Wonderful experience. Food was delish, fun place.
Love the food here, always fresh, delicious, huge portions. Served fast and all that for a reasonable price. Love their special hour menu.
Marcus H is the goat! this was the best happy hour I've had ever
This restaurant is a favorite for hot summer days because of the fabulous frozen ros¨¦. Awesome food and great service. Ask for Marcus! He's great!
Marcus was amazing, couldn't have had a better experience. 15/10 would come back again.

I had a delicious meal here as the menu looked interesting and I was not disappointed. I had the veggie burger patty melt style and a side salad. It was fresh, delicious and the portions were huge. It was my first visit, and I will be back for sure.

We were staying at a hotel nearby that was not open for breakfast . We came to Commissary three mornings in a row for breakfast .The restaurant followed all COVID precautions carefully . Service was friendly , prompt and professional.The coffee was excellent. We tried several different breakfast items on our three visits , all were excellent ! We enjoyed the breakfast frittata ( pictured ) , the eggs Benedict, bacon & eggs , everything bagels , fresh fruit cups and an openface breakfast sandwich .I highly recommend this restaurant !

every morning? when I don't? have work my fav thing to do is come into? commissary? have a seat at my fav table which the host informed me last time is called Table 3 (that should show how often I? go there)? order the blueberry? pancakes with a side of potato pancaked and some coffee.

My fav thing about coming to Commissary is the feeling of being welcomed there from the hosts to my fav bartenders?. I love coming in after a long day at work and having a beer and some truffled? popcorn followed by the mambo wings. If its the weekend I? stop in have me a mimosa? and a pancake platter and head off to my grocery shopping right across the street.

We met with friends after a day of meetings and was pleasantly surprised with the quality and preparation of the food with a varied menu. We shared some veggie and hummus appetizers and each had our own meals. I had the iceberg wedge salad with chicken which was fresh and plentiful. Very affordable as well. Service was great.
My go to spot. Everything is 10/5. Period.

Excellent food, wonderful atmosphere. The head chef was extremely kind and accommodating, coming out from the kitchen to make sure we enjoyed our meal. Our waiter Zach was fantastic. He went above and beyond to make sure our experience was top notch. I would go back just because the young man and waiter, Zach, was so awesome. Great place for a nice meal, highly recommend.

You can't go wrong at Commissary! Their menu always has great options (their new head chef is killing it), it's impossible to have just one of their amazing cocktails, and their entire staff (servers, bartenders, management) is as good as it gets.

This was, as usual, a great brunch experience. Cameron, Danayit and then later Samir took great care of us with exceptional customer service. The atmosphere, food and drink options are the best in town and at great prices! Bravo!
Amazing food and great happy hour!
delicious and affordable. Tons of options for vegetarians!
Great food--clean, simple and tasty! Great option for anyone watching what they eat, as the waiters are great about doing their best to accommodate requests.

The food was great. We were a big party, and they were quick to seat us all. Sam waited on our table, and was a stellar waitress. If you go, request a table in her area. She was so personable, and made sure we were taken care of!
Awesome place! Great service, coffee and food! Waiters are awesome too. Great relaxed atmosphere
The food was great and so was the service. They have some great pancakes and the potato cakes and smoked salmon was incredible.
Always a great place for coffee and/or lunch! Our server Ben was really nice :)))
Friendly. Good food. Good drinks. Sean McEvoy is a SUPERSTAR**!
Good food, good prices and very accommodating to our group of 10, sat quickly and food came out quick!
Loved the brunch! Bubba the bartender is great. Good prices
Helpful, friendly staff. GREAT FOOD!!
Great food and try the Mind Expander!

This has become my go-to restaurant in the Logan Circle area. Yesterday was the first time I've gone when it was super packed, and I was quite impressed by the host remembering people's names and how quickly we were served. I also thanked the heavens that Commissary was one place that actually knows what "medium rare" means. On the other hand, its mac 'n cheese? Bland city. Skip it. Well, unless you like eating tasteless, fatty food. Big disappointment. But since that is the only dish I haven't enjoyed here, I have to give Commissary 5 stars for its value, above average food, and efficient service.

Love, love, love this place. The staff is super friendly and I am kind of a regular here. It is really eco-friendly, recycled paper, filtered water and bio-degradable to go containers. The coffee and espresso are amazing. This place grinds them to order.  I was in for brunch yesterday and I can't believe people were actually bringing in coffee from that *other* place down the street. Their happy hour deals on are amazing and they offer it every day even weekends.
Great food and service! Awesome omelets and sandwiches!

Ive eaten here many times since they opened and I cant find better blueberry pancakes in the city. fluffy, light, PERFECT! This place is very inexpensive and I question the why some other reviewers feel the need to badmouth the place. I mean, its not the inn at little Washington, but they don't pretend to be either. whats an entree here? 12 bucks? Gimme a break! They are what they are, somewhere between a diner and a casual restaurant where you can eat and not go broke over it. and the food is good. Ive had to wait for a table on occasion, but that's because they are always busy. On the one time I had an issue with my food taking a long time during a busy dinner, the manager was all over us and made what could have been an unpleasant experience into a great one. I'm glad its in the neighborhood.
Love this place, the best brunh and blueberry pancakes. Staff is super nice and the coffee is great.

I would give less than 1 star if could. I came in for a beer and less than maybe 30 minutes after I sat down the bartender tried starting a fight with the customer sitting next to me who seemed to be minding his own business. The guest didn't even really react beyond wondering why a random employee would want to fight him. I believe the bartenders name was Nelson. He had to be pulled away and spoken to by I'm assuming a manager and the guy next to me said he was uncomfortable so he didn't finish his drink and left. I can't imagine how it would be when it's busy because there was barely anyone there and yet so much tension behind the bar.
Food was not worth it. Overpriced and service was horrible.
Sat outside for over 10 minutes waiting for our waiter to come back to take our order. Left.

Place is a garbage, do not waste you time. I have know clue why i keep giving this place chance.Go to Denny's, TGI Friday's and you'll get better service, better food and drinks.hope this place closes!!!!!

Probable the worst place to dine at in DC. The Beer is no worth time, it's like who ever put it together was not thinking of the guest but just them and they do not even pour real pints.the Food is complete crap, Ever dish I orders came out wrong, cooked or did not come out all. I can could give a Zero I would it was the pathetic.Last the service at both the bar and table where hands down probable the worst I have ever had. How on earth being a Manager in the place you let you staff sit behind a bar and play on there phones and play grab ass with other staff. That goes double for the server I Think I might have seen my server 3 times through the whole night.What a waste of my time and I promise I will never come back I will do what I can to stir people way from this place.

stop in here because its close to my hotel, what a mistake this was.Food was disgusting and not even cooked right had to send it back 3 times to get actually cooked right. service was worse don't think this girl care who was waiting on me even cared its like she was so much in a hurry to get out of there. I have never in my life been treated so bad.If you are are from out of town and staying close to this place pass it by and go somewhere else. I promise a little extra walk will be worth it.

Place is crap...Bar service is horrible, take 30 mins to get the bartenders attention and after you do it they can't even make a proper drink. Dining service is the same. if and when you get a servers attention its like you are inconvenience them. Who the hell do they think they are, your a god damn server do you job.Food is over priced and never comes out cooked right and it takes 40mins to even get your food.I have no clue how you can run a business like this and still be open. Hopefully sooner rather then later some one with an actual restaurant background will come in buy this place and turn it in to the place it really can be.
Couldn't live with it getting 3 stars...really 2 1/2.

this place is ok I have been to better places before but well it deserves an ok review just cause its an ok place. my friends and I? went for dinner yesterday and. the food was average? American? food nothing to die for. The service was good, our server i forgot her name was always there checking on us but she forgot a couple of stuff, and the ambience was mild too. nothing too exciting! ??

Service was great but when the food came the brussel sprouts were extremely sweet and my salad on the crab melt was swimming in dressing. I saw the burgers come out and they looked amazing. My dad ordered the chopped.salad and there was no chicken /protein in it.
Good food, beautiful setting. This is a typical American tap house. Your new Friday's if you will.  The restaurant puts out consistent fare. Pre made and pre programmed kitchen. Just nothing special
great beer selection

I dunno why everyone is so down on this place, but then again most previous reviews are a bit dated and maybe there's been recent improvements. I thought the service was pretty good but it was a Sunday night and maybe it's not so much on busier nights. I was nicely surprised by their menu though, I didn't expect so much variety for an English Pub and especially for a non-meater like me, but they have a lot more than Fish and Chips and the couple of items I sampled were pretty good, especially the nut pie that my friend had (I had the Seabass, and another friend had the wild boar burger, which he really enjoyed).
Ok place. The food was over thought and not very tasty.
Pretty good. Duck fat fries are always good.
Not very vegan friendly.
Average. Nothing wrong with this place, but nothing stood out either.

It's an amazing place for those who want to enjoy food and drinks while playing games. I visited it with my friends and it was enjoyable. The vibe was cool and the inner d¨¦cor was also good. The staff were also friendly and helpful.

Was not sure this was going to be a place I liked because it seemed a little chainlike, boy was I wrong. Expert staff help you navigate the extensive beverage selection, it is pretty impressive. Visitors and locals alike really like it.
Good place
This is a nice place to visit. I love the service over there!

Ten Spice wings were very good, the type of good that will bring me back over and over again. They had a good selection of beer and enough of a menu selection to bring me back again. Will have the wings next time, yum.

When i first saw this place on Yelp I was looking forward to taking my friends here for a night out. I haven't been for a bar in ages and I really love the idea of just drinking the night away with some good friends on a nice cozy seat. This spot has become my go to over the years, I love it but it's not perfect for a few minor reasons. One, the parking situation here is blind luck, but varies from peacefully finding a spot in five minutes to raging over not finding one in over 20. Two, the service can be so lazy sometimes, especially if it's someone new. Usually the waiters here know what they're doing, but you have those days when they forget or mix up your order, or are just absent for way too long. Three, they increased the prices of some things, including the spice wings which for me are this place's bread and butter. They're so good, not overly spicy with a truckload of flavor, but they made them a little more expensive and that honestly sucks. But still, this is an excellent bar that's sure to meet all your needs if you ever decide to check it out.
Great atmosphere and good food too.

I can sit here and talk about the amazing amounts of beer they have on Tap. But you can read the other reviews to find out -- this is the place to come to drink beer! Period. Few Days ago, I ordered food at City Tap House -- which I don't do often. I was scared to try something new, because I didn't want to be disappointed. Thats why I ordered a very common dish, the Classic Margherita Pizza (tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, extra virgin olive oil, basil). THAT WAS THE BEST PIZZA I HAVE EVER HAD and its from a bar. End of story.Great environment. Great Food. Even Better Beer

Really enjoyed this place, great food and a solid beer selection. We ended up getting the duck fat fries and they were delicious. It had a very nice atmosphere and a massive bar for seating. We will be back again to try more of the menu.

I came here on a Wednesday night and had a wonderful time. It was very busy but I was tended to promptly by the bartending staff. They had a wonderful selection of beers and very good appetizers. Very pleased with my experience.

"Decent craft beer selection here. Was shocked to see Golden Monkey on draft. That was a delight. Friends and I enjoyed the variety of craft beers and several of the appetizers. The spring rolls and wings were a huge hit."

"Decent craft beer selection here. Was shocked to see Golden Monkey on draft. That was a delight. Friends and I enjoyed the variety of craft beers and several of the appetizers. The korean short ribs were amazing!
Great food..atmosphere and service...had a delicious Veggy Burger..but all other food was great according to my meat eating friends.... great cold beer and plenty of TVs to watch all Sports
Good food here. Not so pricey but not so heathy. Service was excellent however.

I work nearby and come here for lunch and happy hours pretty frequently. The beer is great, the food top notch, but the service is the reason I really come back. From the host stand to the bartenders, and of course the managers, I've never had a bad experience. I have to give a shout out to my lunch time bartender Misty who is amazing. She makes sure I'm 100% the entire time I'm there. Highly recommend!

I went here to eat with about 6 friends we missed our reservations and it was packed on a Friday. We waited at the bar area and certainly enjoyed an assortment of beers so time flew by. staff and management super friendly they show love!! Food slightly above average but overall great atmosphere.

Great selection of beers on tap and an awesome atmosphere inside. We randomly chose City Tap House to get a late dinner and drinks on Saturday, and I'm glad we did. It was very fun! The food was good- I ordered the burger and really enjoyed it and my friend was very happy with the crab melt sandwich. YUM! Good service too and very decent prices, especially for the amount of food you get.
Big place. Wish there were multiple bars there. The happy hour was crowded because they have one bar.

Our family had a steak dinner at the City Tap House , the service was excellent and the food was very good, the steaks were also very good. As you might expect with this type of restaurant the pricing is expensive for a regular working guy, but definitely worth it.
The food, wine and service was amazing and quickly served with no delays. I will totally recommend this place for my friends.

Excellent steaks.My three fellow-diners shared the porterhouse which provided more than enough meat for all. Service was attentive and unhurried. atmosphere in the restaurant countered that to an extent. Overall, would definitely return again.

We really enjoyed it good food , a bit pricey but worth it at the end. I had the stip City Tap House and it was a bit overdone but my hubby had the filet mignon and it just melted in your mouth. That is how good it was. We had the chocolate cake that you can share. They told us it was big but didn't think it would be that big. So for sure price for the cake was worth everypenney. Overall it was amazing.
Had a great time. The staff is very attentive and gracious.
This was a great ity Tap House! The place was romantic, the service was impeccable, and the food and wine was delicious.
The City Tap House has it all great ambience, excellent service and delicious food!
Excellent steak in top 5 of DC . Decor always extravagant. Would recommend this place to steak lovers.
The ambiance was great, food was amazing but we felt so rushed!!! It felt rushed from start to finish.
great ambiance, nice selection of beers...
Good food, great service and beer. Wish the pizza was better is all.
Must eat here!!! The decor is very elegant. Customer service is 5 stars. Fillet mignon is to die for and the prime rib will keep you full for a week!!!
Great food and atmosphere. Service is good as well.
Great selection of beers awesome atmosphere.
As gastropubs go, this place is one of my favorites in the area. My only one complaint would be the prices are a tad but high for draft beers.

Very nice addition to the neighborhood. A few observations:1. The tap list is large, with the usual suspect in a gastropub: Ommegang, Allagash, Bell's, Victory, Sly Fox, Dogfish. Nothing too out there, yet good variety. Only recommendation: I'd love to see a kolsh (Mad Fox's?) on the beer list.2. They have cask and nitro. Nitro, if you've never tried, doesn't mean that Paul Walker will deliver your beer in a Mitsubishi Lancer (learn about it here fifthseasongardening.com¡­). For a stout or dark pours (try Guinness), it's incredibly enjoyable. 3. Wings: Delicious, and with the crudites served with a house vinaigrette, loved it. Don't misread "spice wings" for spicy, it's more like an "all spice" flavor. Good meaty wings, though a bit fatty.4. Samplers: $15 for 4 4oz pours. Good deal? It depends on what you want to order. The 4oz pours go from $3 to $5 or so. Unless you're going to be sampling 4 x expensive ones (most are between 3-4), it makes no sense to get the sampler. At most, you can a $2-3 discount, at worse, you order extra 4oz you wouldn't want to drink because you've had enough or you get 4 x 3$ pours?All in all though, a very nice addition to the area. I'll definitely be back.Tip: the back part of the bar area has tables, and it's first come first serve.

Kinda new place in Penn Quarter that we LOVE! Great beer options and the food is really good. Blue crab mac n' cheese was good, but could've used bigger chunks crab. The Duroc Pork Collar was incredible....and I know, because my fianc¨¦ ordered it and I had the pleasure of finishing it off. The seared tuna salad was very nicely crafted and you should check out the mussels menu, as well! Buddy had the tap burger and it looked really good, if not a little over cooked from what he ordered (medium rare). Portions are generous, service is attentive and thoughtful. Huge tap
Great beer selection, cool atmosphere and good happy hours! I'll be back!
Great place, great atmosphere. Friendly stuff. Good prices and food was delicious, fresh, served in timely manner. Reasonably priced.

Food, drinks, and service are awesome. Perfect location to stop in while walking around downtown and the brick oven pizza is great. If you're at the bar ask for Jon- he was fantastic! We'll definitely be back!

I was visiting DC and was looking for a quick place to eat with bar food. I was not disappointed here. Very crowded place so I knew that this was a good sign. Host person at the fro t was friendly and quick to get me seated. Wait staff were extremely attentive and helped me make choices about what to eat. With her recommendation ration I had the pepperoni pizza which was incredible. Too big for one person. All the wait staff were welcoming, friendly and very hard working. I enjoyed my experience here!

Luckily the bar was able to seat our overflow at tables in the dining room and our primary waitress, Nala, was awesome. She was really attuned to our table's continuous, new arrivals--always there to welcome the next person and get drink orders, refills, food, chairs, whatever we needed. Also the meat was so juicy and the BBQ was a little sweet which balanced out the spice from the peppers. I loved them. Our waiter seemed to cater to the larger crowds, than he did my two friends and I. We had to ask other waitstaff for little things like lemons, straws, and salt/pepper.  All of that being said, the restaurant certainly met our needs for the evening and we all left satisfied...!!!
Great service, great food, fun environment!
We came here with a large group today and it was amazing. Great service, Great location and food was amazing.
The brunch is awesome. Great selection Would highly recommend.

Ate dinner here with my family, a week ago, that was visiting from Miami? after a busy day of walking around the national mall. It was close to our final destination? and we were looking for gastropub type food, so we walked over and sat on the patio on a beautiful evening. Service was fine, attentive without constantly checking. Menu wasn't extensive but just enough variety to keep it interesting. I had shrimp & grits (with collard greens, white cheddar, scallions and Cajun butter) that hit the spot. My aunt and cousin had the City Tap burger with bacon and said it was good. We were all pleased with our choices. Great atmosphere on the patio - glad we sat outside as inside was pretty noisy!!

Everything was excellent! The food was delicious! We had the street corn dip, shrimp and grits and a burger! When we walked in the hostess was very friendly and we were seated right away! Norman was our waiter and he was perfect! We will definitely be visiting again when we're in the area.
This is my third time here. The food was really good, and fresh and delicious,the server was attentive and the restaurant clean, i will came back
We had the burgers and fries with great beer and great service. It was busy but perfect

I has a really good time when I went this past Saturday. They say they specialize in beer & Southern cooking and I'd be inclined to agree. The fries were good and came with a spiced mayo dip, which was really great.

Great atmosphere and great food! They have great options for everyone! I would highly recommend this place. Great drink menu with PLENTY of options! Everyone could have a delicious meal, no matter what they enjoy!

We were really impressed. There's been a revolving door of eateries in this place, which is on the border of Chinatown, but hopefully this one will stick, as it is superb. We shared desserts and appetizers, the tacos (which were outstanding) as well as the berry cobbler, also quite great. I had the steak frites, which was tasty, others at the table had mussels and scallops and were pleased. It wasn't overpriced, and there's an impressive collection. I am not a drinker, but the beer selection is seemingly extremely remarkable. Our waiter, Leigh, I believe her name is, was extremely friendly, helpful, and careful. We'll definitely be coming back.

Stopped in for brunch yesterday and had the best time. I was great promptly by Phil who I can guess is the Manager watching over the host stand while his host where away. He walked us over to are table, while doing so he suggested a few apps (Tacos, tuna tartar) to start and went over the beer menu as well and suggest a few beers for us to try, we were very pleased with so we tried what he suggested and was not disappointed. The service was on point as well nothing took too long to come out, food was warm and beer was cold. Server was excellent as well she did a great job and very attentive could not have asked for a better experience then what we received here at City Tap House, we will definitely be back again very soon.
Great location and very clean and wonderful service and delicious food. I will be back again!

Just moved to DC a few weeks ago and I have just found my new favorite place to hang out. City Tap House is absolutely amazing. The food is awesome and yummy, I had the Korean Short rib tacos and Tap burger w/ duck fat fries "WOW" is all i can say about the fries. The beer list is great too, you will not have a hard time finding something you will enjoy.The staff is great, my server was fantastic, very prompt, did not have to wait long for anything and was also knowledgable of the menu and beer he gave me the great recommendations that I picked, the Manger Philip who stopped over, just to check in and make sure that I was having good time and made sure everything was perfect for me was a delight because you don't really see that at many restaurants/bars anymore.I will definitely be back and will be bring everyone I know with me.

My wife, father and I where on a trip up to New York for the Holidays and we stopped in Dc for a few days. Are Hotel told us about this Restaurant, so we decided to stop by for a bite. What Can I say this place was AWESOME, the food was outstanding, the beer selection was by far the best I have seen and the service was the best my family and I have ever had they are so knowledgeable and fun, to top this visit off was the fact that the Manager think his name is Bill, Phil cant remember but he took the time to stop over talk with us He made the experience very enjoyable and personable. Im not sure when the next time I will be in DC but I will definitely be come back here to eat, drink just have a great time. I will recommend this place to anyone who is visiting, moving or just stopping in DC to try this place out.
Came here for dinner on a Friday night. Made reservations for 8:30pm. They have a huge selection of beer. I ordered the pork collar dinner and it was AMAZING!!!

Came in for brunch with my boyfriend Saturday morning because some of my friends have been raving about how good the Chicken and Waffles where, So I thought I would try the for myself and let say my friends did not lie the chicken and waffles are amazing the red pepper jam and the coffee stout syrup is unbelievable. My boyfriend had the Almond french toast and he was blown away by them too. The service was outstanding they were fast, sincere and very friendly. Even the Manager Phil Stopped by to talk with us and make sure we where enjoy are time and food, he even recommended a awesome IPA for boyfriend and the mason jar cheese cake for dessert. Thank you Phil we will definitely be back soon. I would hands down recommend this place to anyone looking for good food and drinks and wonderful service.

I was Friday afternoon for lunch and what can I say it had to be the best meal I have had since I moved to DC. Tap Burger is so juicy tasty that I almost thought about ordering a second one. Besides the Food the beer list by far the best I have come a cross in along time. I couldn't decide on just one beer so the Manager on duty Phil helped me pick out a flight of 4 different 4oz beers so I could taste a few instead of just one, besides helping me pick out couple beers Phil also was nice enough to engage in conversation with me.If you have haven't been here already you must stop in, I promise you will not be disappointed. The food is yummy, the beer is tasty and the staff and Manager are delightful and very tentative.

Stopped in with a group of friends tonight to grab a bit to eat and drink. What can I say... This place rocks, the food was on point as was the beer. We ordered the Crab Hush puppies, Tuna Tartar and the chipotle rips for appetizers and for dinner got tap burger, french dip, poncho mussels and the waimea pizza. I wish thought about taking a pictures because the food tasted and looked that good. Beside the food and drinks the service was outstanding, we had a server named Ericson who great very informative of beer and food and helped pick some of the stuff we ordered, thank you Ericson! As well as the service we where greeted by the Manger Phil, who was very friendly and polite, He filled us in on a few places to visit while in town and couple different hole in the bourbon/whiskey bars we should check out as well. thank you Ericson for the great service and thank you Phil for the local hideouts to check out.All in all this was had to be the best experience i have had a restaurant as it was for my friends too. I would just like to say thank you City tap house and we will be seeing you again the next time we are in town.
Food, beer, atmosphere excellent-add our great server, Mariam, for an all-around terrific time ! Whohooo !

Best beer menu in the City complimented by outstanding service and food. The beer menu is very comprehensive including various craft beers on tap. Our server, Misty the bartender, was very knowledgeable about the beer menu as well as the food menu. My guest and I each had a few craft beers based upon Misty's recommendations. Misty was able to explain each beer's attributes and what regions they were from. Her recommendations were excellent as we both enjoyed our beers thoroughly.We ordered the wings and pizza again based upon Misty's recommendation. Both were excellent in taste and size. The pizza was a thin crust homemade pizza which was excellent. The wings were also excellent and very meaty. Overall, our experience at City Tap House was excellent with outstanding beer and service. I would definitely return (highly recommend Misty the bartender when selecting a beer at the Tap House).
Excellent vibe. Wonderful, friendly and informative staff, Joe

Love love love brunch here. The chicken & waffles are great. The Ten Spice Wings and the Corn Bread are delicious apps! The Eggs Benedict (I added crab to mine) was my favorite. Nice ambiance and good service. My fave brunch spot in DC so far

I have been coming to City Tap House for a while, drinks after work, dinner with friends, it quickly won me over. It has a certain rustic charm blended with a modern simplicity to it. And then there is the beer menu. They have 42 beers to choose from and every single one on any given week/day is a hand crafted brew from mostly small breweries around the country and a couple just plain outstanding beers from around the world that they keep on tap. A buddy of mine once asked for Bud light with that exceptional beer menu in his hands, i wanted to knock him out. Of the countless times Ive been here, Ive been served by some really exceptional staff. I have had exceptional service from Lenny, Samantha, Warren and Connor. The bar does tend to get busy, so if they can't get you the drink or eight drinks you ordered within 60 seconds, you just need to understand that you and the crowd of other people clamoring to drink from the many amazing taps need to be patient. But hey, if the locals go there regularly then it is the place you want to be, so be patient.The patio just opened for summer time but the weather has not been cooperating, however when it gets warmer I will be bringing my Rugby team for bottomless Bloody Mary's after practice on the weekends.So for food, the appetizers are all truly exceptional, any two or three can be made into a handsome meal. Hands down best entree is the Pork Collar, cheddar grits, enough said. Filet's and Ribeye's are also outstanding. I did get a pretty fatty ribeye once and quietly said something to Ryan, one of the managers, he took care of it right away, plopped a brand mew steak in front of me very quickly. The GM Pearson then came by and recognized me from many previous visits, he took good care of us. I believe the Wednesday special is the Shepard's Pie, that is truly exceptional. I see a lot of griping on yelp about prices. It is DC get over yourselves. The food here is very high quality and has a ton of flavor. The menu does seem to change regularly and it keeps getting better. Although they took a pork shank off several months ago that had the most amazing creamed spinach with it, that was a mistake. I tell you from extensive personal experience that this is the place you want to go in downtown DC.
Great food and atmosphere!!
Wonderful place. Food is nice and ambiance is great. Good for dating.

So I heard about City Tap House from a friend. I was excited to try it because they raved that the food, atmosphere and service was on point. My friends and I came in without a reservation and we were given a wait time of 30 minutes. We were sat on time and taken into the bar area where Ian was out server. He is phenomenal. I have to say this is the most attractive staff in dc (especially the hostesses)!! We had the hushpuppies to start which are more like crab cake balls with a Cajun remoulade. Both my friends had the burger with duck fat fries( which they let me try and they were awesome!!) and I had the Salmon. Cooked to perfection. These guys know what they are doing!! I will definitely be back!!

This place is where its at! The beers, the food, the atmosphere....this place really has it all! I randomly popped in a couple weeks ago after a business meeting and was surprised how cool this place is. I've gone back with friends many times.
Went to dinner on Wednesday and just fell in love with the place. Great people, great food, great drinks! This place is a definite place to go for an amazing night out!

So we started with two Glasses of Pinot Noir ( Red Wine ), it was fruity and smooth! Then we ordered the Blue Crab Mac n' cheese, which was amazing, totally recomended! For our second appetizer we had the Yelkowfin Tuna Tartare, it was refreshing and fresh! And last but not least, we had the Korean Short Rib Tacos, they were awesome! Remember to squeeze the lemon on it! With a really good spicy touch! Our bartender was friendly and always on top of everything!
Chicken and waffles are delish!

Amazing service! The GM gave myself and kids free popsicles. Great beer selection, had over 40 beers on tap. I recommend trying the bacon popcorn and candied peanuts. Had the hamburger, was excellent. If we are in town again, we will go back.
Great service. Great food. The fries are delicious. The beer is fantastic. We were a big party and it was a crowded night and everything was excellent.

As someone in the hospitality business, I find it harder to be impressed than most. We push hospitality a great deal in my line of work...so when I feel a place is amazing I want to make sure others know too! We had a large group go to Tap House last week for dinner - they were so busy I feared they'd never have room for us. The staff must be accustomed to managing their inventory well, as there was a larger table in the back that worked pefectly. Right after we were seated the Manager, Pearson Keyes came by to ask us how we heard of the place and chat about why we were in town. He was warm, friendly and went over some menu items we may like to try. Over and beyond his call of duty. Then our server Kailey arrived - she was pleasant and patient, even with an exteremly full section and all 10+ of us too! She kindly separated the check as we requested and made our experience that much more pleasant. I highly recommend the place for the atmosphere, their staff and also their food! Everyone at our table gushed about their great meals...mine, the Crab/Mac&Cheese - was A-MAZING! On my next visit to DC, there will be plans to have another meal at the City Tap House. If you're in that area, I'd definitely add it to the list too! Thanks Pearson and Kailey!
Great Restaurant, really great food our server was really good and the Manager gave us a free appetizer.

Went w a group for dinner. Food was terrific and service was outstanding. Our server James took great care of us but wasn't intrusive. His menu recommendations were spot on. Wish there was place like this where I live in nevada.
City Tap House is a gold mine! The food is great and the beer selection is good. My group of 9 friends showed up and were seated at a nice location. We had a great time. thanks City Tap House

Excellent food, atmosphere, and service. Was in a group of 9 and we were all very well taken care of and everyone loved what they ordered. The hush puppies were like none I have ever tasted, and the skirt steak I ordered was perfectly cooked - practically melted in my mouth. It was so good, I thought my knees were going to give-out. Definitely would recommend this place.
Love the location, food, and ambiance.

I have never had an experience like I had at City Tap House.  The first time I visited was for a corporate after party and the food, drinks and service were all great, hence why I came back a second time. The second time I came back with a party of three for dinner. At first, the host told us he would get us seated in a minute. When five minutes passed, we took a seat at the bar to order drinks while we waited. Just as we ordered our drinks, the host immediately came up to us to apologize, bought our first round of drinks, and got us seated.After being seated, our waiter apologized again for the wait (it was only 5 minutes MAX) and offered an appetizer on the house. We ended up ordering several appetizers to share and let me tell you -- absolutely EVERYTHING was incredible! All of the food is basically a really cool twist on bar food (think popcorn with bacon and candied peanuts...YUM). While we were eating, the general manager came over to talk to us. After saying that I had been there before and that I had brought new people in, he asked what I was drinking and brought back yet another complimentary drink to thank me.Don't even get me started on the desserts. The avocado honey gelato is TO DIE FOR. I honestly think this may be my new favorite spot in DC. The staff was beyond incredible, the atmosphere is fun, the beer list is overwhelming in the best way possible and the food is just unbelievable. Don't be surprised if you see me here once or twice a week now.

Love this place. First of all it's a great bar to meet friends after work, it has a ton of seating space and the bartenders know how to work a crowd. They have an awesome beer selection and drinks a reasonably priced for downtown. Additionally, they have an awesome menu that makes it much more than just a bar.  With city center nearing completion, this place is in the heart of the next great spot in dc.
This place is sweet, the food is good and they have a ton of beers and a heavy pour on mixed drinks. Service is also very attentive and the waitresses are smoking hot.
This place is great. Everything you can ask from a restaurant. Food, service, beer.... all great.
Extremely disappointed... ordered a "duck breast" and got 4 strange looking nuggets. Also reserved outdoor covered rooftop seating and was sat on the main level. Tiny portions for insane prices.
The food was extremely underwhelming and the service was also not great. Go if you have too but would not recommend.

Nina May is one on DCs best restaurants They have an incredibly friendly and accommodating staff and some of the best dishes ever. As a native Washingtonian, I am sorry I hadn't experienced this place sooner. Highly recommend this restaurant. Will definitely be paying them a visit again soon!

I recently hosted a brunch for a group of 18 at Nina May, and everything was absolutely flawless! From the moment we arrived, the staff was incredibly organized and accommodating, ensuring that our large party was well taken care of. The service was seamless, and every detail was handled with care.The food was outstanding--each dish was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. Everyone in our group raved about their meals, and the variety on the menu ensured there was something for everyone. The ambiance was also perfect for a relaxed yet upscale brunch experience.A huge thank you to the team at Nina May for making this gathering so special. If you're looking for a spot in D.C. that can handle a large party with ease while delivering excellent food and service, this is the place to go!
One of the best brunches we have ever had. Service was wonderful and the meal was incredible.

Great decor, ambiance, and proximity to the stadium. Post-game hangover time... Highly recommended the restaurant like the hotel is like a dream! the staff is really polite and the dishes really amazing!
They're doing great things here, and very much worthy of the press they're receiving.
Great food and amazing service. It was my friends birthday and they went beyond on service and provided some items on the house. The waiters were very cute too
Exceptional food, exceptional service, exceptional value. Go to Nina May. You won't be disappointed.

Had dinner with friends at Shaw's newest restaurant tonight. Highly recommend coming here and doing the chefs choice. Had the roasted chicken, it was juicy, buttery, mmmmm, roasted carrots, chorizo, clams pasta in the best garlicky butter sauce , shaved carrots salad, spicy kale salad. Just tons of food.

Really lovely spot - with the polish of fine dining but the feel of a neighborhood spot. Just recently opened so a few kinks to work out on service but by and large a great experience. The prix fix is a steal at $40 and the cocktails wowed. The beet cocktail was incredible!
I love everything about this place, especially the chef! Food, cocktails and service are combined to create a terrific atmosphere for a memorable meal. Make a reservation!

Been waiting for this place to open as I live close by. My wife and I got in opening night and we had a great time. The menu is really unique and absolutely delicious- we both did the chefs choice option and with each dish that came out we kept deciding THAT was our favorite. The staff is super friendly and personable and the atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming. It's a beautiful place that makes it comfortable to stay for an extended period of time. We already made two more reservations for end of this month and December!
Absolutely delicious menu and concept! The restaurant is beautiful and cozy
Delicious and filling food! Great bang for your buck. Friendly staff, romantic atmosphere and inventive drinks. Excited to come back.

The neighborhood is not safe, they shoot, they break into cars, people hang out for hours lurking on the sidewalk/walking up and down the block preying on people and the police are constantly driving by with their lights on. For the price and the quality of the food and drinks, it's not worth it. You can find better and more safe places for live music in DC.

Service was extremely mediocre, food was below average. I am not sure if it was just me, but there seemed to be a shortage of "attentive" staff. It appeared that there was favoritism amongst customers (servicing friends and white patrons.) Food was underwhelming, poor parking & bad customer service.
Very cute atmosphere and good food. We made reservations but finished our food before the live music started which would've been nice to listen to..

Every time I come here, I have such a pleasant experience. Chill ambiance, food is delicious, and overall great service! We ordered the jerk chicken with veggies it was tender and juicy not hard and tight.. also our server I believe damion was super sweet and personable he made sure we were okay all of the staff were very nice and sweet.

Mr. Braxton Bar & Kitchen offers an extraordinary dining experience, particularly distinguished by its vibrant live music. Talented local musicians create an energetic ambiance the moment you walk in that perfectly complements the restaurant's stylish decor. Whether it's jazz, blues, or a bit of funk, the music enhances your dining experience, making it more than just a meal - it's an event.The menu had delicious dishes and craft cocktails, we loved everything we ate and drank. The friendly and attentive staff ensure you feel welcome and well-cared for throughout your time there. If you're looking for a spot where great food and fantastic live music come together, Mr. Braxton Bar & Kitchen is the place to be. I've been there for fun night out with friends and also on a date night and I enjoyed it each time.

Having frequented Mr. Braxton's on multiple occasions, I can attest that their food and drinks consistently impress. Our recent visit saw us delighting in the Caribbean pasta with added shrimp, a flavorful concoction that transported us to the tropics with every forkful. Accompanying our meal was the refreshing watermelon salad, a delightful combination of sweet and savory that perfectly complemented the main course. Each visit reaffirms Mr. Braxton's commitment to excellence, making it a dining destination we eagerly return to time and time again. Stepping beyond its charming interior, Mr. Braxton's extends its allure with a delightful outdoor patio. Mr. Braxton's effortlessly combines exquisite cuisine with impeccable service and an inviting ambiance and decor, and an atmosphere that exudes sophistication.I highly recommend checking out Mr. Braxton's for a culinary adventure like no other. With its consistently impressive food and drinks, cozy ambiance, inviting outdoor patio, and live bands adding to the atmosphere, it's a dining destination that promises an unforgettable experience.
The food was amazing, it was an intimate ambiance with great music, and the service was good.
Good food, good vibes Excellent! Food was great and so was the service. Will definitely go back again.
Nice and Intimate restaurant with great vibe and delicious food.

Mr. Braxton's is a such a cool place to just hang out with some friends and have a good time. I went there for Sunday brunch and was not disappointed. The bartenders provide AWESOME service and the food is wonderful! The waitresses were friendly and also gave good service. I had the salmon and it was terrific! It's located in a convenient location right on Georgia Ave. I highly recommend that you get there early because it does get packed. The patio outback has a great retro vibe to it and was fun to just chill. I will definitely come back and hang out at Braxton's!
Excellent food drinks and the experience was amazing you definitely must try the mussels
Mr. Braxton Bar & Kitchen is a must-visit in Washington, DC. You'll enjoy the environment, music, and food, as well as the fact that you'll get a good share of food.

Extraordinary. Meets an elite standard by which you judge all other restaurants. The staff is always ready to help, the premises are extremely clean, the atmosphere is lovely, and the food is both delicious and beautifully presented.
Awesome food, fantastic service! I travel for work in this area and I had heard such amazing things about the restaurant from my colleagues. Everything was excellent!
Great neighborhood spot! Vibe, food and staff are always 100%.
Thank you for a great experience! Brunch was good and the outside patio had great vibes.
Everything was awesome! From the drinks to the ambiance! I would say just get a few more umbrellas.

I frequent this part of town and had no idea about this place so it was a great surprise to find it has one of the best vibes in town. Cool people, great music, awesome patio. Food exceeded expectations as did our whole night. Makes the trip from our place in Arlington worth it. Destination dining in our book.
Food and atmosphere were good. Friendly staff and place was very welcoming. I would recommend this place to eat at.

Such a cool and great spot! Came here with a reservation (set by my friend) were to 3-person at that time. The place stays classy and an overall pleasant atmosphere.We got the lobster Mac and cheese, French toast, and Chicken Sandwich (mine). Aside from the food, the staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and they follow Health & Safety Measures. Been here, but this time feels like a big threat.Would highly recommend coming here!
Good food, good service, and good vibes.100% recommend

Snazzy inventive options, vegan options, and a stellar truffle mac... these were the makings of my visit to Mr. Braxton last night! My party of six had a great laid back experience and drank and ate well. Couldn't ask for more!

Was in DC last week and stumbled into this delightful joint! Mr Braxton has tasty, delicious cocktails and food. The staff were super friendly and laid back, and the decor is gorgeous.This is a great place to meet up with friends for a drink / meal -- the seating is comfortable, the background noise is high enough to provide some catch up privacy, but not so loud as to be deafening. Strong recommend!!

Really chill spot from every aspect, drinks, food, atmosphere, service, crowd. Also after speaking to the management, it's only poised to get better with live performances and a DJ coming. Welcome addition to the Petworth community!!

My visit to Jinya Ramen Bar was nothing short of disappointing. From the moment I entered, it felt like I had walked into a scene from Lord of the Flies. Trying to place my order was a nightmare, as I had to shout my order to a busy bartender who seemed more preoccupied with other matters.The chaos continued when my order arrived incorrectly, likely due to the blaring music that made it impossible to communicate properly. The food itself was passable at best, but the overall atmosphere left me feeling uncomfortable.To make matters worse, there was no follow-up to check if everything was alright after I received my food, despite the restaurant not being busy. The same bartender, who had been on the phone via Bluetooth, offered a puzzling excuse: "Sorry I haven't been paying attention to you, our regional manager is visiting." This statement was both confusing and inexcusable, considering the importance of customer service in the restaurant industry.Needless to say, I have no intention of subjecting myself to this chaotic mess of an experience at Jinya Ramen Bar ever again.
$20+ for Ramen... the owners should be thrown in jail for that. A disgrace to the history and tradition of ramen in Korean culture to price it like that.
Fairly disappointed with the food. Didn't receive one appetizer I had ordered in our take out and the wonton ramen wasn't flavorful at all. Overall pretty average compared to other ramen in dc.

Today, I Crispy Chicken, JINYA Bun, pork tonkatsu ramen. The jinya bun was delicious and tender. But, Crispy Chicken was disappointing. The chicken portion is good but was very dry and hard to bite. For ramen, the broth was little too BRINY and pork pieces were small, I think 19.50 is little too much for the amount of toppings. If there was some eggs, it would be wayy better.The Service was good. Overall, I would say solid 3.5/5. But if only the chicken was't dry and hard to bite, and if there was some eggs in the ramen, i'd rate 4.5 or more.

We had an amazing time and Carlos was extremely friendly, helpful, and attentive. The food was amazing, the service was great, and the wait was minimal to none. The place has a very welcoming atmosphere and I would recommend it to any friend, family member, or loved one. It definitely lived up to the hype and exceeded it in my opinion

Absolutely delicious!!! Best ramen and sides I've ever had, definitely great Asian cuisine here. The waiting was long but the service was great, our waitress was very friendly and made great suggestions. The music is a bit too loud if you are trying to have a conversation but the location is great. We sat upstairs by the window with a great view of the city.
free dessert with review. noodles not bad
service was really good and quick. food was very good.

Really love this place, I've gone so many times in the last month I've been staying in D.C. I've brought all my coworkers so far, and every single one of them have said this place is great. Shout out to Carlos, dude's chill as shit. Had many great nights here!
Great service!!! Very attentive very friendly would definitely recommend taking a group of friends!
This food was amazing and it was really good and there are so many choices but it was really pricey IT WAS BUSSIN tho.
location: Horizons West / West Orlando, FL, FL

text: Was introduced to Jinya by a friend a couple months ago and it is one of the best things that ever happened. I had the spicy chicken ramen and it was very flavorful. The chicken was so tender which was really appealing. The broth was seasoned well and I liked all the options for accompaniments with the ramen, I can't even remember everything I ordered additionally but I know there Were big options. We really enjoyed this place, there was nothing left of our meals. The restaurant itself is cute, with plenty seating options. This is a great place to go with friends or on a date night.

I was in town visiting with some friends and was told about this ramen bar. At first the service was a bit of a hiccup. When we received our waters with some requests for lemons, we only got lukewarm water with no lemons. We then asked if we could have ice and was met with some attitude.Our food finally arrived and I chose the Sukiyaki Q Ramen which was amazing! I didn't even look up to speak to anyone and just enjoyed the food. Overall, despite the small occurrence I will def visit again and try a new dish as well
This was exactly what I was looking for. Flavor was amazing!!! Will be back again and again for sure
I love watching Naruto and eating ramen because that's Naruto's favorite food. But all jokes aside this is a solid ramen place. Very flavorful and good portions.
I love this place! It is a true gem to come across a delicious ramen bar. I sat at the bar and had wonderful service.

I wouldn't say that these guys are as good as Sakuramen down at 18th St but they definitely bring an interesting concept to the table. The layout inside is very... bar like, as the name implies, but that alone makes it so much fun to eat here. I tried the Brussels sprout tempura for the first time when I was here earlier, I've always contemplated trying it and earlier I finally decided on it. It was easily one of the most interesting flavor combinations I've come across, the way the brussel sprouts crunched around the fish was super satisfying. These guys are yet to fully impress me but they're doing a good job at getting there.
JINYA is a good place for Ramen that I meet, I come here two times one week, I like this bar, good taste and good service.
I like this place, Authentic flavors and high quality foods, Good service, I will come again.
I like this place, because of anthentic flavors, I like eat Ramen here, so delicious high quality but reasonable price.
Hello Javier, it was to congratulate you on the good establishment you have and the good workers who stay there, thank you for the good food, blessings.

What a delightful place! The atmosphere is cozy, and the ramen is out of this world. I especially loved the [mention a specific ramen dish]. Javier, thank you for being so attentive and making us feel at home
It's a wonderful place to go with the family! We'll be right back! Thanks for amazing attention.
Beautiful environment, delicious food and a great customer services, thanks for everything.Att: Richard A.
good evening first of all, and the truth is totally grateful for the attention to the public and the good food that is prepared in your business, thank you for everything Javier
Always grateful for your food, blessings and prosperity to your establishment Javier.

What an honor it was to know your establishment Javier, I reviewed the comments and based on that I decided to see it for myself and I was amazed, the ramen dishes were exquisite and comforting for me and the quality is very good, the atmosphere is very pleasant and pleasant for me since I am a businessman who is a total perfectionist, and I was amazed by your staff despite being very helpful, they are friendly too, rest assured that I will return, you have incredible ramen, we need more experiences like this in the life and I took it here and I will return for the same on my next visit.

Wonderful establishment Javier, without a doubt the dishes are very delicious wow!! and very fresh, the experience is very good and the quality of your staff is high. I have no doubt that anyone who enters leaves delighted and eager to return. I certainly am, but without first telling you, my incredible experience because the atmosphere is very relaxing and fabulous. After a long day of work, come and taste some excellent ramen dishes, it is fabulous!!!

I've been a ramen enthusiast for years, and I can confidently say that this is one of the best ramen restaurants I've ever been to. The broth is rich, complex, and deeply satisfying, and the noodles are perfectly cooked and have a wonderful texture. The toppings are fresh, flavorful, and complement the broth perfectly. Javier, our server, was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. He helped us navigate the menu and recommended some fantastic dishes. Thanks, Javier, for making our visit so enjoyable!

Javier, I am very grateful for the recommendations you gave us regarding your ramen dishes, the quality is very good and fresh, the atmosphere is very pleasant and welcoming without leaving behind what we can have and conversations without interruptions, I am dedicated to actions and finances, which is why I am very demanding but you fulfilled everything, without leaving aside the humility and kindness of your staff, I was sincerely satisfied with the experience.

This restaurant is a true gem. The quality of the ingredients is exceptional, and the chefs clearly put a lot of love and care into their creations. The ramen is rich, flavorful, and satisfying, and the toppings are always fresh and perfectly cooked. But what really sets this place apart is the service. Javier, our waiter, was incredibly attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. He went above and beyond to ensure we had a memorable experience. Thank you, Javier, for your outstanding service and for making us feel so welcome

The best ramen in the world, the food is out of this world The customer service is very nice and unique, without a doubt the best ramen bar in the world The environment is very comfortable and pleasant.

I am very grateful to you Javier, excellent service, even my friends also had a great time, the quantity and quality of your dishes is wonderful, I am a real estate agent and without a doubt I was amazed with my experience and totally satisfied, the atmosphere is totally private to talk about business without being interrupted.

Thank you Javier for the good treatment of the restaurant, the food is very good, the atmosphere and the staff are also fabulous. I appreciate the experience you give and later I will be returning with family to present this excellent restaurant

From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warmth and hospitality. The ambiance of the restaurant is inviting and relaxing, setting the stage for a delightful meal. Our server, Javier, was incredibly knowledgeable about the menu and offered some fantastic recommendations. We started with the [Appetizer Name], which was a burst of flavor. For the main course, I opted for the [Ramen dish name], and it was hands down the best ramen I've ever had. The broth was rich and complex, the noodles had the perfect bite, and the toppings were fresh and delicious. Thank you, Javier, for making our evening so special!

"Excellent experience. The ramen is absolutely delicious and the service is impeccable. I want to especially thank the owner, Javier, for his hospitality and dedication to providing high-quality service." And the atmosphere is familiar.Atte: Imittenz
the place is so nice. Great food and customer service. Javier was very kind and polite.
Just had the most amazing ramen experience! The broth was rich, the noodles were perfectly cooked, and the toppings were fresh. Big thanks to Javier for the excellent service and recommendations!"
Thank you very much Javier, excellent service, very delicious food and I was fascinated by coming to enjoy a good ramen
Thank you javier Excellent service. The food was great, my family and I had a great time. The delivery time and everything was very fast and efficientAtte: Carlos Arcila.

JINYA Ramen Bar in Logan Circle is my go-to spot for comfort food. The ramen is rich and flavorful, the toppings are always fresh, and the vibe is cozy yet modern--perfect for a casual night out.Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

I visited JINYA Ramen Bar in the Washington, DC area, and it was an incredible experience! As someone who works in the food industry, I can confidently say their food is absolutely delicious. Upon arrival, Joaquin greeted me warmly, seated me, and ensured I felt welcomed. He even checked if it was my first time or a special occasion and made sure I had everything I needed before and after ordering.Despite being busy, my server, Camila (if I caught her name correctly), was friendly, professional, and very knowledgeable about the menu. The place was packed, but the food arrived quickly, piping hot, and perfectly prepared.Overall, I'd give JINYA a solid 5 out of 5 stars. This is easily the best ramen in DC. If anyone rates it poorly, they likely lack patience or appreciation for quality. Highly recommend.

Jinya Ramen Bar, located on the edge of the lively Logan Circle neighborhood, is part of a renowned Japanese ramen chain famous for its deeply flavorful broths, simmered for days to achieve that perfect richness. The restaurant's imposing ebony-black exterior and towering floor-to-ceiling windows give it a sleek, modern feel. When I visited around 6:30 pm on a Saturday, the place was bustling, and as a solo diner, I had the option to wait 15-20 minutes for a table or sit at one of their two bar areas. I opted for the upstairs bar, which felt more open and airy. If you're with a larger group, I'd highly recommend booking in advance via Yelp or Google, as it seems to be a very popular spot.The interior is dark and cozy, with amber lighting casting a warm glow across the two floors, and walls adorned with Japanese-themed art that adds a touch of authenticity. The menu is extensive, offering a wide variety of ramen options, Japanese-style rice bowls, small plates like gyoza and edamame, and even vegan-friendly dishes. Jinya's ramen bowls are also highly customizable, so you can add or remove toppings based on your preferences--but be warned, those add-ons can quickly inflate the price if you're not careful.My food arrived about 15 minutes after I ordered. I opted for the JINYA Tonkotsu Black ramen ($20.20), which is loaded with toppings: pork chashu, kikurage (a crunchy Japanese wood ear vegetable, though it's sometimes replaced with spinach), green onion, nori (dried seaweed), seasoned egg, garlic chips, garlic oil, fried onion, and a spicy sauce on the side. The base is a rich pork broth, and the ramen typically comes with thin noodles, though I took the advice of a friend and upgraded to the thick noodles at no extra charge. I'm glad I did--the thick noodles soaked up the rich tonkotsu broth perfectly and had that ideal "QQ" springy texture, which was slightly al dente but still pliable.The pork chashu portion wasn't huge (two slices), but given how fatty and flavorful it was, any more might have been too rich. The dish featured fantastic layers of flavor and texture, with the crunch from the kikurage, garlic chips, and fried onions balancing the creamy tonkotsu broth and spicy sauce. Each bite was a delightful mix of richness and acidity. At over $20 for a single bowl of ramen, it wasn't cheap, but the quality was far superior to any chain ramen I've had before, and I left feeling comfortably full without being overstuffed.For those with bigger appetites, Jinya offers combo deals where you can add an appetizer or a smaller dish like a rice bowl for under $10, which is a good value. Plus, if you're a student or using the inKind or nosh'd app, you can get great discounts (15% cash back or a 20% student discount, respectively). I had a nosh'd promotion for $10 off a $20 purchase, and with the 20% student discount, tax, and tip, my meal came to around $13--a fantastic value for such a satisfying meal!While I didn't sample their cocktail list, it features an array of intriguing drinks - I was just fully focused on the ramen this time. All in all, Jinya Ramen Bar was a lovely experience: though it's on the pricier side, their ramen is soul-warming, the service is quick and friendly, and the ambiance is fantastic. I'll definitely be back to try some of their other ramen broths!
So good! Ordered the Chicken Ramen. Very flavorful! Would definitely order again. Perfect portion of broth and noodles.
The spicy chicken ramen bowl was so delicious. I also ordered the crispy rice with spicy tuna. Will be back.

Our bartender Lee was excellent! My partner and I were walk ins on Valentines Day so we sat at the bar. However, we're in recovery so we don't drink. Lee was so thoughtful giving us a list of her favorite mocktails. We ended up getting the Lychee Strawberry virgin margarita and an excellent citrusy mocktail over her own design. The whole evening if I had to describe it in one word would be Fantastic! The vibe of the restaurant was also very welcoming and comfortable! If you're ever in DC craving some fresh hot ramen, this is the place to be!

Took my wife out too DC as she's new to the east coast, stopping into a ramen place .4 miles from our hotel I was a little skeptical. My suspicions were suddenly absent after our bartender Lee helped us out with virgin mocktails and food choices. I got the JINYA chicken ramen. Absolutely incredible. Like heaven in my mouth. 10/10 will visit again.
one of the best ramen I have ever had, great hospitality from the team and thanks to my waiter Javier for giving very good recommendations, I will definitely return with my friends

Perfect food for a cold Night. I was helped by Anthony who did a great job. Very attentive and friendly. Made sure my table was good at all times. Thank you for the great service!

it was such a nice place to visit, excellent food and even better service, Anthony was great and made us feel very comfortabl throughout our visit!

We are usually skeptical to eat at places on 14th due to the large crowds as we find this occasionally impacts restaurant food and service quality. Our experience at JINYA defeated our preconceptions and was time well spent. We will definitely stop by again as the weather turns colder and hope to have similar food and service.

From the moment she introduced herself, she was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. She took the time to explain the different types of ramen and helped me choose a dish that would suit my tastes.
You should definitely try this restaurant.The service is excellent.thank you Nicole.

text: Camila was amazing! Service was good food was even better. Liked the ambiance and drinks
