One of my friends is a vegetarian and the waitress recommended some dishes and also modified one of the dishes (the plantain dish) to be vegetarian by using mushrooms. The ceviche tradicional was some of the best ceviche I have ever had! Super flavorful and fresh- perfect for summer! The linguine chicken stir fry was a bit salty so I would skip it next time.I can't wait to try more of the ceviche dishes next time!
Sarah is great . Genuinely looks like she enjoys her job . Rest of the staff is great !!! Great food ! Just a good experience.

My first time here and i will definitely come back! My girl invited me and i fell in love with the food and atmosphere. Alex was so amazing and on top of everything. Food and drinks were out of this world!

It was my birthday and the food was just amazing as always, service is uncomparable and they have one of the friendliest staff I hace ever met. We were a party of 5 and as usual Pisco y Nazca exceeded our expectations, can't wait to come again.
BistekalopobreThat's all I gotta say. Awesome experience. Will definitely be back!
Excellent restaurant. Good quality. I have ordered from here several times. Never disappointed.

Pisco Y Nazca is one of my new favorite restaurants. I go every few weeks because I love the food and service. Alex is always my waiter because of his excellent service. He is so attentive and always recommends new plates for me to try. I've tried their brunch menu, lunch, dinner, and dessert menu. They outdo themselves every single time! The callejero, ceviche sampler, and anticuchos de corazÃ³n are must try plates. Alex always pairs my food with the perfect drink whether it be a traditional pisco sour or passion pisco sour. The food and drinks are delicious here. They serve authentic Peruvian cuisine! I also appreciate the COVID precautions they are taking, and I like that they offer indoor and outdoor seating. Do yourself a favor and visit this great restaurant... and don't forget to ask for Alex as your server!
The delivery and food was amazing. The food is kind of expensive but maybe its because I ordered too much food from them. Definitely a good place.

We found this amazing place in D.C. Perfect food, outstanding service, and a great experience overall. Maria, Jose and Gerardo went above and beyond to help us have a great time in our first time at the restaurant. Thank you, Pisco y Nazca team!
Came here for lunch. Ceviche's are amazing and the service was excellent. Our server Gerardo was incredibly attentive and professional.
I had the best service from server Jerardo! nos regalo una noche muy especial con mis amigos americanos que quedaron encantados con la comida peruana!
Came here with friends. Gerardo took care of us. BEST night ever. Wonderful service. Amazing food. Delicious cocktails. Highly recommend.
Mis chicas y yo nos divirtamos mucho anoche gracias pisco y nazca por la atenciÃ³n gracias Alex por el tremendo servicio

This place is AMAZING! I go at least once a week to eat/drink here with my friends, boss, or date. Maria the host, Oscar the waiter and the bartender on Wednesdays are my FAVORITE. They always recommend me new drinks and for the first time I did not like one they changed it for me without a question asked. Customer service at this restaurant is top notch! I recommend eating here, I get the Ceviche callejero every time and it NEVER disappoints. Thank you so much for making my experience so fun.

The service here is amazing! I used to come here with friends during the summer every year for the "ceviche callejero" which we completely LOVE. Best ceviche ever!! The severs are amazing and lovely and the management is great. Always checking to make sure we are doing ok. They truly care about about your experience.

This place is amazing. The food is really good I have been here two times in one week. Also the service is great! I had a sever name Sarah she was amazing and very responsive if I needed something. I never had to look for her because she was always checking back with the table. I recommend this place a thousand times. Bon appetite!!!!!
The food, the ambience, and the service are all exceptional. Sara(h) is our favorite every time we come
The attention from the moment you enter, the food and drinks are excellent. 100% recommended. Thanks
This is my favorite restaurant in DC, the food is excellent, the ceviche callejero is a must, the service is amazing and the drinks like nowhere else, wonderful experience every time!
Marcus has been a server! Will definitely come here again!!
This is my 4th time here and our waiter Marcos provided the best service. Our party had the best time and enjoyed the exceptional food. 10/10 recommend.
Marcos did an amazing job. The service and food was exceptional! 10/10 recommend for every and any occasion.
I love sweets food and this one is awesome!

This is my favorite happy hour spot in DC! I took my friends here for their last night in DC and they were blown away, and sad that they found it on their last night. The white sangria is the best sangria I've ever had, the ceviche is to die for, and I have dreams about the Pisco sours. Plus the service is second to none -- Jose V. Is the kindest and most attentive server I have ever met.Can't wait for my next trip back!
Incredible and authentic Peruvian food with even better service! The drinks and food are phenomenal. Hands down the best Peruvian food that I've had in the USA!

Came here to celebrate a birthday and had an amazing experience with our server Jose Vasquez. We left this place speechless, his customer service and recommendations were amazing and if you come here you will not be disappointed! Let's not forget how hard Geo worked to maintain the table spotless. We are definitely coming back for a second and third visit.
A beautiful experience. Our waitress made our time their wonderful. All of the staff was on their A GAME. We loved every dish. All made with flavorful ingredients! So wonderful! I will be back!$

I went with my Peruvian family there on my birthday. The restaurant is in a nice location with friendly people. We ordered "Anticuchada Marina" , a very unique seafood option with a lot of flavor on it. The other plate was a Peruvian ceviche that sometimes is confused with the Mexican ceviche (this is a totally different dish) awesome! We will definitely come back to try more dishes.
Nice place. It was my first time but I really enjoyed it.

I would highly recommend this restaurant! Food was delicious and authentic! The service was very good! Our server Alejandro was very personable and efficient! My kids love it and we will definitely come back!
Enjoyed a celebratory birthday brunch here. The food was spectacular, good portions and delicious flavors. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a culinary experience.

I brought my wife here tonight to celebrate her recent promotion and the first step to the end of the DC quarantine. After 3 months of not being able to have a proper date night, I couldn't have chosen a better place! The first bite of the mixta empanadas was eye opening, with the perfect amount of crunch and warmth. We followed that with an explosion of flavors in the ceviche sampler. The tallarÃ­n saltado was the only entrÃ©e we had, and it was an excellent dish to round everything out. This is definitely the kind of place where you want to try as many things on the menu as possible. Just make sure you keep a cup of the passion sour near by to wash everything down :)Finally, shoutouts to our server, JosÃ© V, who made our visit incredibly enjoyable and memorable. We're definitely looking forward to our next visit, and we hope we are lucky enough to be served by JosÃ© again!
I realized they were open for pickup and oh man, loving this place even more. Food was great and the employees there were super helpful helping me with my order. Cant wait until they open back again!

I went here for brunch and had a great experience! Our waitress was wonderful and did a really great job breaking down the menu and giving recommendations based on our preferences. I had the Aji De Gallina and it was absolutely delicious, as was everything else my table ordered. The portions are generous and the food is awesome. Will definitely be returning!
We love Chef Pedro Lopez, all his dishes are to die for.The food was absolutely wonderful, from preparation to presentation, very pleasing. We especially enjoyed the desserts.
I loved the place! And the service is great!! The manager was super welcoming and made sure our experience was great! I will definitely recommend this place.. great food and great service!!

This place in downtown is the best spot you can come to for thee best hospitality, and food in town. I am an extremely picky eater, and hardly eat meat, but here all things go. I won't miss an opportunity to eat anything that comes in front of me. More importantly the hospitality is exceptional. Our server, Jose, was very sweet and attentive and funny. Really went above and beyond. The manager, Yuri, came to check on us multiple times and made sure we were well taken care of. We mentioned that we are celebrating and he sent over desert. 10/10Beautiful people. Beautiful food. Unforgettable experience. Will also come back.
Great food and good atmosphere.

It was my first time going to Pisco Y Nazca, went with a friend and I absolutely loved it our server Elmer was awesome he was knowledgeable about the menu and was very attentive I would totally go back. I really recommend this place.
This place is fantastic! Service is incredible and food is life changing. Server RaÃºl was the sweetest and made our experience even greater.
Elmer was the best! He made jokes and got us our food on time, had good recommendations, and took a group photo. 10/10

Great service by Elmer food came out quick and was very courteous . Food was delicious and Elmer made sure our drinks were always full and made us feel very welcome I would highly recommend this place
Came here for brunch. Great food and Great service from Elmer! Atmosphere is relaxed- excellent place for a brunch birthday!
We had the best brunch with our server Elmer!!! He was so attentive and even had the chef make an off menu item for our friend with dietary restrictions. We will definitely be back!!
Great place, great food, amazing service, Elmer was the man! Come and try and some of the shrimp, the pork belly and the cocktails!

Such a good brunch and happy hour spot! Angel was an awesome server and took care of our large party really well. Amazing food and drinks, especially the tostones and white sangria. Will definitely come back!
Great brunch spot with friends with wonderful service all afternoon from Angel. Will come again!
Elmur was a great server and very accommodating of our different dietary needs! Would recommend pri fixe menu!
Amazing brunch! So much food and it was all fantastic. I had the Huevos Rancheros with pork belly and loved it. The sangria was top notch as well. Our server, Elmer, was the best! Highly recommend
Raul was great! His recommendations were outstanding. Most authentic food I've had in quite a while!!
Love, love this restaurant, if you are into ceviche and great service, this is the place for ya!

The food here is excellent and filling. Honestly, absolutely delicious. On top of that our server Elmer did a great job being attentive and helping us make food selections. Overall a great experience! Would and will be going again.
Great Peruvian restaurant! Amazing food and atmosphere. Great service from Elmer who made sure we had a fabulous time. Highly recommended!.
A must come !! Don't over think about it and go ! Good food and amazing drinks. Definitely coming back for the drinks !
Amazing service, thank you Elmer! Drinks and desserts were delicious! We ate the ceviche mixto and it was so refreshing!

Met some out-of-town family here for Easter. Really fantastic. Among the four of us, we had chaufa, grilled salmon and Ceviche Mixto...all fantastic. Our server, Carlos, was very knowledgeable and a great advocate for Peruvian cuisine in general. And of course, the Chocolate Dome is a show unto itself. Highly recommended!
We were a little skeptical of this place since nobody knew it and the prices are reasonable. The food was amazing, bottomless glasses kept coming, and Angel was an amazing entertaining waiter.
Great food and great service!!! This is my second time in here it was amazing I'm totally coming back. Keep it up guys.

The attention was very good, I felt like I was back home in my beautiful Peru, Jaime was very attentive and Elmer too they did a wonderful job. The tallarÃ­n verde was fantastic as well the tallarÃ­n saltado. I'll keep coming back and highly recommend this restaurant..

Service was really great!!! They welcomed us during their busiest time without having a reservation. The food was really outstanding. However our waitress Hector was super attentive very knowledgeable on drinks and of course the Menu. We were very pleased that we are coming back!!! This place is super awesome.
Tonight was my first time at Pisco and it's so sexy inside. My waiter Angel was amazing. I came to Pisco for Galentine's Day with the girls and he treated us like queens. I'm definitely coming back!

Best ceviche is town....possibly america! Only the freshest limes and fish are used. Our server, Angel, was knowledgable, fun, and helpful. We stuck with the seafood (ceviche, fish, and shrimp) and loved it. The deserts were fantastic as well. We will be back soon!

I came here for the first time today and could not be more impressed! The food was fantastic, especially the ceviche. Our server Angel did a great job! He helped us with lots of amazing recommendations from start to finish. I will definitely be back!
one of the BEST in DC!!! Ceviche is so fresh and their desserts are to die for. Excellent service by Angel and great staff!

This was my second time going to this place and it was even better than the first! Definitely recommend the anticucho de corazÃ³n or the passion fruit ceviche. Also try the buenazo for dessert! Can't wait to go back. Angel was an incredible waiter and answered all of our questions about the menu!

I was here with a group of friends, and let me just say this place is absolutely 5 stars all the way! Angelito made our night out so fun, and was just a superb waiter. The food was delicious, everything we ordered tasted so freaking good! Ceviche Traditional is honestly the best ceviche I've ever had. I had a Passionfruit Pisco Sour and I highly recommend it! Atmosphere was lively and warm, staff was friendly, food and drinks were fantastic.
Came here for Galentines day and had a great time. The drinks are amazing (try the passionfruit pisco sour) and the food was even better. The service was also great (thanks Angel!)

Love this place! I went to this place on Thursday. I tried a ceviche sampler that Hector recommended and it was very delicious. There were 3 types of ceviches and the one I love the most was the creamy one. I was delighted on what Hector recommended me and decided to order a cocktail name "pisco sour." That was very good and I had a great experience all thanks to Hector and his recommendation. He attended me and my friends very well and I would recommend him and this place.

I was in vacations from Texas & this place was recommended by friends. I tried the Ceviche Callejero & also the plancha pulpo & it was amazing! A guy named Hector recommended to try out the drink Pisco Sour which was out of this world, so refreshing & different! Loved it ! Hector looked like he was a busy guy, but he had the time to offer me great service, he was really awesome, loved the way he served me. Will definetly come back to this place, recommend this place !!

I decided to spend New Year's Eve at DleÃ±a in NW DC based on a recommendation from the Washington Post, but my experience left much to be desired. Upon entering, I was told by a staff member that I could sit anywhere in the lounge without "reserved" signs. However, every table in the lounge had reserved signs, creating confusion from the start.After finally finding a seat at the bar, the bartender, with noticeably unpleasant breath, informed me that the seat was also "reserved." This contradicted the earlier information I received about seating options upon entering.Despite these initial setbacks, I found two available seats at the bar for myself and my cousin. To our dismay, after being told to wait "one" minute to order, the bartender never took our order. Later, I observed the same bartender speaking with a manager, who then stated that one of our seats was reserved. This was the second time we were informed of reserved seating after being seated without any initial indications.Feeling unwelcome and frustrated by the inconsistency, my cousin and I decided to leave and settled at a different bar to welcome in 2024 more tastefully. Overall, the miscommunication regarding seating and the lack of service left a negative impression on what was supposed to be a celebratory evening.
My previous review was removed but just know the staff is extremely rude and unprofessional. The bald headed short manager is belligerent and reckless. I do not recommend. Very rude. Very nasty.

I recently ventured into the downstairs bar of DleÃ±a, eager to enjoy some good music and unwind after a long day. However, my experience at this crowded place was far from enjoyable due to the the lack of seating. Finding a spot to even stand (forget sitting) was a challenge in itself, as the seating seemed to me as if it was reserved for more special guests. Also, the atmosphere was overshadowed by the unapproachable staff. The staff appeared uninterested in providing assistance. It felt like they were going through the motions without any genuine interest. Requests for assistance were met with cold responses, and it seemed like they were doing us a favor rather than providing a service. I assume that if you don't have one of their special lockers to store tequilla in then you are going to have to stand or leave. It was disheartening to see the staff prioritize certain customers over others, creating an unwelcoming and exclusive vibe.The lack of attentiveness from the staff made it challenging to fully enjoy the music or the company of friends. The overall atmosphere in the downstairs bar was not conducive to relaxation or enjoyment, which was a significant letdown.While the music was good and performed by a live band, it was difficult to fully appreciate it in such an unwelcoming environment. The lack of friendly interactions and the noisy ambiance significantly detracted from the overall experience.In conclusion, my experience downstairs was far from pleasant.
Good food and drinks

My last visit was disappointing. Despite having an 8:15 PM reservation, we waited to be seated and ended up next to a loud group, which ruined the intimate atmosphere. The hostess was dismissive and unhelpful when I complained. On a positive note, our waitress was great and tried to make things better. The food was tasty, but the service issues make me unlikely to return.

I dined at DleÃ±a for my friend's birthday brunch (we had a 1:15pm reservation). I wanted to share my dining experience, which was unfortunately quite disappointing. Although the menu is advertised as "bottomless," I was surprised to learn that this isn't truly the case. Rather, it is a large tasting menu. We were told upon sitting that the last call would be at 2:45pm. (Given that reservations are accepted as late as 2pm, I find it unrealistic to expect customers to fully enjoy the menu within just one hour). My friends and I were not finished eating by 2:45 and when I asked if I could get a box, I was told that I could not take any leftovers due to the bottomless experience, but like I mentioned, this was not a bottomless brunch. The inability to take food home resulted in a considerable amount of food waste. Further, we did not receive all items on the brunch menu, like the Caesar salad. The worst part however was that at 2:50pm, while my friend was actively chewing food in her mouth, the waiter shoved the check in her face in order to get us out by 3pm to "prep for the dinner service". I am extremely disappointed. I worked in a restaurant for 8 years and I never would have considered kicking out a customer before their meal had finished. I came to DleÃ±a last year and enjoyed my experience - the food is delicious. But, unfortunately, this brunch experience is enough to not want me to dine here again.

My friend and I had a disappointing experience at dlena in Washington DC. The restaurant was very loud, which made it difficult to enjoy our conversation. Our waitress was rude from the start, which set a negative tone for the evening.While the tuna guacamole and ceviche appetizers were good, the drinks left much to be desired. My friend disliked his drink, and no one asked if he'd like a replacement.I ordered my steak rare, but it came out well done. When I sent it back, the staff was obstinate and returned a steak that was too rare. No manager visited our table, and no compensation was offered for the mistake. The waitress's comment that "no female had ever ordered a rare steak" there before and questioning if my upbringing influenced my taste was incredibly unprofessional and offensive. Overall, dlena might be decent for appetizers, but I wouldn't recommend it given the price. The steak, even if cooked properly, didn't feel worth $63.

Recently, I celebrated a friend's birthday at DLeÃ±a for brunch, and we were very impressed. The atmosphere was great, service went very smoothly, and the whole experience was quite nice. The ambiance was festive and inviting, and the serving staff very attentive and friendly. In addition, the choice of dishes could have been better, but amongst the things we tried, the quality was really great: steak and eggs, chilaquiles, churros, and seasonal fruits. The fish taco, nonetheless, was a disaster. By and large, DLeÃ±a is well worth visiting: fine atmosphere, great service, qualitative food.

We recently visited DLeÃ±a for brunch on a Saturday to celebrate my friend's birthday, and we were thoroughly impressed by the ambiance, the service, and the overall experience. The restaurant has a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere that made our celebration feel special. The staff were attentive and friendly, adding to the positive experience.While we felt that the food selection could be improved, the quality of the dishes we tried was excellent. Our favorite plates were the steak and eggs, chilaquiles, churros, and seasonal fruits. Each of these dishes was flavorful and well-prepared. However, we were disappointed with the fish taco, which didn't taste good at all and almost seemed like it was made from frozen fried fish.Overall, we highly recommend DLeÃ±a for its great ambiance, excellent service, and high-quality food. It's a fantastic spot for a celebratory brunch!
Great food and drinks with an excellent and knowledgeable staff! Will definitely be returning.

Came for the Latin jazz, stayed for the tequila and the jazz, left cause there's not much seating unless you get there super early it seems. There's some standing tables but they're behind the speakers and a pole. Kinda hard to enjoy the music and drinks when there's no decent place to sit and enjoy. The staff were all super nice though

Came to try their 9 course brunch, definitely a good value for what you get. The fruit cup with the mango mouse was my top 3, I've never had fruit this way and I'll never forget it haha it was so good
Excellent! Excellent! Excellent! Great food! Great Service! Great Vibes! Will return for sure!
Go there it was good. Yelp - 85 characters is dumb! And not necessary. So stupid.

We were lucky enough to get a seat in the lounge downstairs! The food is absolutely incredible But the drinks were by far the best part of the whole experience! Ask for Nancy, she is the head bartender and has an arsenal of off menu drinks that are better than the ones they have!
The churros are amazing! The best I had so far! In the DC area. My new go to spot for churros

A Culinary Fiesta at dLeÃ±a - Worth Every Bite and SipWe indulged in the famed bottomless brunch at dLeÃ±a, and it was nothing short of spectacular. Starting with the Maryland crab guacamole, this dish was a revelation--bold yet elegant flavors that danced on our taste buds. It's a must-order! The salmon entrÃ©e was another triumph (as pictured). Perfectly seared and layered with vibrant textures and flavors, it showcased the chef's finesse and creativity.Then came dessert, and what a grand finale it was! The seasonal fruit cocktail was pure artistry. A medley of berries bathed in a light, citrusy orange juice (or perhaps a subtle hint of another infusion?), sweetened with just the right touch of agave honey. The true star, however, was the fruit espuma--an ethereal, velvety foam that was a revelation in texture. Its perfectly balanced acidity and gentle sweetness made every spoonful a delight without overwhelming the palate. Dessert alone was enough to make us linger a little longer at the table.The service was impeccable--attentive without being overbearing and prompt enough to ensure our glasses of mimosa never ran dry. Speaking of which, the mimosa selection kept our spirits high (and bubbly) throughout the meal. It's the perfect way to make a weekend feel special.Despite being nearly at full capacity, the ambiance was warm and inviting. Plenty of seating, thoughtfully arranged to maintain both comfort and intimacy. It's a great spot for both casual catch-ups and special celebrations. Make sure to book a reservation at least two weeks in advance--this place is a hot ticket!Lastly, parking was a breeze, with ample metered spots available nearby--always a plus in this part of town.dLeÃ±a truly delivered a brunch experience that was indulgent, flavorful, and flawlessly executed. We left happily full, already plotting our return. A word to the wise: pace yourself on the bottomless drinks. It's a marathon, not a sprint!
The food is really good. I enjoyed everything about this place from the service to the drinks.

I recently visited dLeÃ±a for a dinner date, and it delivered on many fronts. The atmosphere was warm and inviting with just the right touch of romance--definitely a great setting for a date night or an intimate dinner.The service was attentive and friendly, making the experience comfortable and enjoyable. As for the food, we ended up ordering more than we could handle (eyes bigger than our stomachs moment!), but everything we tried was flavorful and well-prepared. While there wasn't necessarily one standout dish that completely wowed us, it was still a very satisfying meal overall.If you're looking for a cozy and stylish spot for a dinner out, dLeÃ±a is worth a visit. It's the kind of place where the atmosphere and service combine to create an experience that feels special, even if not every dish is mind-blowing. Definitely a good choice for a nice evening out.

I just walked in an sat at the bar and had an incredible experience. I ordered the Medio Pollo al Carbon, which was perfectly cooked, juicy, and full of flavor. The Roasted Corn Esquites were a standout side--tender corn with a deliciously smoky, creamy finish. To top it off, the margarita was refreshing and balanced. The food was excellently prepared, and the flavors were outstanding. The service was exceptional, and the atmosphere was lively yet relaxed, making for a great dining experience. This place has quickly become one of my new favorites!

The pork belly was exceptionally tender and bursting with flavor. The short rib taco provided a delightful and well-balanced bite. Additionally, the enchiladas were excellent. While the drinks were a bit weak, I did manage to savor a satisfying old fashioned. Overall, my dining experience was superb.

If it's your first time at this brunch spot, you should totally go for the bottomless food option. They bring you every single dish on the menu, so you can try a bit of everything. It's a lot of food, but if it's not enough, you can always order more. The standout dishes for me were the variety of tacos, street corn, and juevos rancheros. It's a great place for a date or hanging out with friends. Parking is limited - I ended up paying for a garage.
The best tacos I ever had the place was super nice, too! I'm very happy with this place

dLeÃ±a Review: Luxe Southwestern VibesWe love the Roja Lounge in the downstairs of dLeÃ±a. The drinks are always thoughtfully crafted, with a focus on tequila and mezcal. Some of our favorites include the Mezcal Pain Killer, La Luna (charcoal-activated), Mexican Hurricane, and I Can Feel It in the Air. The atmosphere combines luxury with a Southwestern flair, creating a unique and inviting space. We visited on a Wednesday and were treated to live jazz music, which added to the ambiance. The service was fast and friendly, and we've enjoyed coming here as a couple. Highly recommended for a chic and enjoyable evening out!
Forest is one of the best servers I've come across. Very attentive and knowledgeable.

Cool place for brunch. They do bottomless drinks for 29 a person which isn't bad! I had the huevos horneados which was a decent value. Their menu is def a bit pricy but not outrageous. The one thing is their French toast....if you're hungry skip this because it was literally 4 bites. They have a variety of tapas to share and all their brunch dishes for the most part were pretty tasty!

I recently enjoyed brunch at DeleÃ±a and had a fantastic experience. The ambiance was inviting, and the menu offered diverse and delicious options. Maya, our waitress, was exceptional--attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. Her excellent service made our meal even more enjoyable. DeleÃ±a is highly recommended for a great brunch with outstanding hospitality.
Dinner was amazing. The food and ambiance were great. Staff was friendly, attentive and informative.
A true culinary experience! Just wow - service is excellent and the ambiance is cozy and charming. The food is real scratch quality & the food is all cooked on a wood fired equipment.

Fantastic! Drinks food, and vibe were all great. The best dish we got was the tuna tartar guacamole. Even the tortilla chips tasted great on their own with good seasoning and a smoky flavor. Second favorite dish was the pork belly appetizer. We probably wouldn't get the cauliflower again because it was slightly undercooked but the flavor sauces were still very good. Best drink we had was the spicy margarita (Mercado). We will definitely return to try more of their menu!
The food was excellent. The service was on point. The venue was very nice. I will go back for sure.
The food is absolutely delicious! The ambiance is beautiful, and the service is outstanding. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu, enhancing the overall dining experience.

Let me tell you, Chef Sandoval means business in the kitchen. The food here is on another level--truly some of the best I've ever tasted! Our server, Cathy, was incredibly friendly and offered some fantastic recommendations. The restaurant's decor and cozy lighting created the perfect ambiance for our date night. To start, we indulged in the wagyu empanadas and hamachi mango ceviche, and let me tell you, they were outstanding. The empanadas were a standout, hands down the best I've ever had. For our main course, we savored the chicken and shrimp/crab enchiladas. Each bite was bursting with flavor, showcasing a thoughtful balance of tastes. Every dish was a culinary masterpiece, and we're already planning our return visit. We've even secured a brunch reservation for September--we simply can't wait to come back for more!

Amazing is an understatement. I've been to d'LeÃ±a several times and have always enjoyed my experience. Came in once for tacos at the bar (the short rib are the best) and have been coming back for the table-side tomahawk steak ever since. Absolutely nothing beats a wood-fire grill. However, last night we came for the exclusive 8 course chef's table menu and I was absolutely blown away. Not only were we greeted by the General Manger upon entering, he actually escorted us to our table himself and gave a small presentation before we started our journey. The Executive Chef presented all 8 courses to us himself. Even on a busy night his focus was completely on us. The food is as gorgeous as it is delicious, each course was more unique and elevated than the last. It was a beautiful evening with some truly spectacular food. I would also like to thank our cocktail server, Royal, for his amazing service and drink recommendations. Bonus points for the gorgeous candle lit ambiance and live jazz in the downstairs lounge. My husband said he felt like we were on vacation, he was that impressed! An absolutely luxurious experience. 100/10!

The flavors? Exceptional. The patio? Pure perfection. This review? Completely positive, reflecting our fantastic experience.I'm not even sure where to begin. While we didn't opt for the beloved classic brunch, our dinner of appetizers was both light and flavorful. We were seated promptly and decided to kick things off with sweet mango margaritas. For our meal, the Maryland crab guacamole stood out with generous crab portions and a delicious twist - crispy bread instead of chips. The burrata salad featured refreshing grilled watermelon, creamy burrata, and flavorful heirloom tomatoes. As a delightful conclusion, the rich cheesecake paired wonderfully with a scoop of ice cream on top. The presentations were visually stunning, and we enjoyed it all from their sunny, covered patio. The food arrived promptly, and our server was exceptionally attentive.All in all, it might dent my wallet a bit, but I'm eagerly looking forward to returning!

My recent dining experience at DLeÃ±a was an absolute culinary journey! Nestled in the heart of [Location], DLeÃ±a offers a dining experience that seamlessly blends innovation with tradition.DLeÃ±a's menu is a testament to culinary excellence, featuring a tantalizing array of Latin-inspired dishes that celebrate the vibrant flavors and rich heritage of the region. From the smoky aromas of the wood-fired grill to the bold spices and fresh ingredients, each dish is a masterpiece crafted with precision and passion.What truly sets DLeÃ±a apart is its commitment to authenticity and creativity. The chefs' innovative approach to traditional Latin cuisine results in dishes that are both familiar and delightfully unexpected.The ambiance at DLeÃ±a is equally captivating, with its sleek and modern design that exudes warmth and sophistication. Whether you're enjoying a romantic dinner for two or gathering with friends and family, DLeÃ±a provides the perfect backdrop for any occasion.During my visit, the staff's impeccable service and attention to detail further enhanced the dining experience, making me feel welcomed and valued from start to finish.For anyone seeking a culinary adventure that ignites the senses and transports the palate, DLeÃ±a is an absolute must-visit. I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough and eagerly anticipate my next opportunity to savor its exquisite offerings.

Really beautifully decorated restaurant that is pretty unassuming from outside. At night, it's really dark inside though and the candles don't provide much light. We came to celebrate our anniversary.Our server was so nice and funny. He was really helpful in telling us which dishes were good and which weren't. He definitely made us have an enjoyable time.Their initial "shot" of non-alcoholic mezcal was delicious. Their lemonade is also really good. We tried the guacamole (delicious), wagyu fajita (cooked perfectly and absolutely melt in the mouth--they forgot to bring us our tortillas and we didn't realize this until we saw it on the menu during dessert), short rib tacos (meh, the short rib was really dry), and the broccolini (a bit over charred and too oily).For dessert, we initially tried the chocolate fondant but it was not good at all. It should be liquid in the center but it was like a cooked sponge-y bread with not much sweetness. Our server comped us a new dessert--the crepe cake. This one was slightly better but overall just average. Their desserts are not worth it, in my opinion.

Let me begin by saying that Chef Sandoval takes his kitchen seriously. The culinary experience at this restaurant is unparalleled--truly some of the best food I've ever tasted! Our server, Cathy, was exceptionally friendly and provided excellent recommendations. The restaurant's decor and ambient lighting created the perfect atmosphere for our date night. We kicked off our dining experience with the wagyu empanadas and hamachi mango ceviche. Simply put, wow! Those were the best empanadas I've ever savored. For our main courses, we indulged in the chicken and shrimp/crab enchiladas. Each bite was a symphony of flavors, showcasing meticulous plate composition and a harmonious balance of tastes. Every dish was delectable, and we're already looking forward to our next visit! We've even secured a brunch reservation for September.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Delena Restaurant in Washington, D.C., and I must say it's one of the best dining experiences I've had in a long time.From the moment I walked in, I was immediately struck by the inviting decor and atmosphere. It set the perfect tone for what would turn out to be an exceptional evening. The staff was not only friendly but also incredibly attentive, making me feel truly valued throughout my visit.For my meal, I decided to go all-in and ordered the tomahawk steak with chimichurri sauce, along with a side of empanadas. The steak was an absolute delight - tender, cooked to perfection, and seasoned just right. However, the chimichurri sauce stole the show, adding a burst of flavor that was like the star on top of a Christmas tree.To complement my meal, I ordered a smoked old fashioned, which had a delightful smoky taste that paired wonderfully with my food.The empanadas were a work of art, beautifully made and packed with flavor. Each bite was a delight, and it was clear that attention to detail was a priority in the kitchen.Our server was not only efficient but also personable, engaging us in friendly banter and making us feel like more than just customers. The manager also took the time to come over and chat with us, which added a personal touch to the dining experience that I truly appreciated.In summary, Delena Restaurant exceeded my expectations in every way. The combination of outstanding food, inviting atmosphere, and genuinely friendly staff made for an unforgettable evening. I'm already looking forward to my next visit, and I can't recommend this place enough. If you're in D.C., Delena Restaurant is a must-visit for an exceptional dining experience.Regenerate

Hello Makar! We are humbled that you think so highly of both our unique Chefs Table experience and creative presentations. On behalf of the entire dLeÃ±a team, thank you for your generous review and recommendation
Elena was amazing! The place was packed but our food and drinks came out so fast. Everything was delicious!
I love love eating here!!! Very nice atmosphere :) Nice for a date night or a girls night out!
It's a great experience. The ambiance is very welcoming and charming. Amazing food and service. Staff are extremely knowledgeable and make great recommendations.
Kristyana was amazing. She was very informative and responsive to our needs. Definitely made our visit a pleasure.
OOOOOH MYYYY GOOOOOD This restaurant is a hidden gem that deserves recognition. The cozy atmosphere, attentive staff, and mouthwatering dishes make it a true standout. A must-try for any food lover.

My wife and I dined here a few weeks ago and it was nothing short of spectacular! The atmosphere was lively, the drinks were creative, and the food was delicious! Our server was phenomenal, making excellent recommendations for food and drinks. We will definitely come back to eat here!

We recently dined at this restaurant, and overall, it was a fantastic experience. Great ambience, dimmed lights, comfortable and cozy place. The flavors and quality of the food were exceptional, and we thoroughly enjoyed our meal.The short rib tacos were a highlight, cooked perfectly. The Guacamole was fresh and flavorful, adding a delightful touch to our dining experience.Only downside was the long waiting time. It was a bit frustrating to wait for our food, especially since we were quite hungry. However, once food arrived it was definitely worth the wait.The staff appeared a bit distracted during our visit, but they were friendly and accommodating nonetheless. It would have been even better if they were a a little more attentive to the customers needs.While the taste and quality of the dishes were excellent, portion sizes left a bit to be desired, especially considering the price. Although food was delicious, a slightly larger portion would have made the experience even more satisfying.Despite these minor issues, I highly recommend this restaurant for it's mouthwatering Mexican cuisine.

I had the pleasure of dining at dLeÃ±a for dinner the other night and I must say, it was an experience unlike any other. The atmosphere was very inviting and the staff was welcoming and friendly. The food was absolutely delicious, with a mix of flavors that you would rarely find at a Mexican restaurant. The portions were generous and the prices were pricey but very reasonable.We started with the Tuna Tartare Guacamole - the guac was fresh, creamy, and flavorful. The chips were crispy and perfectly salted. For the main course, I had the Short Rib al Carbon

I had a delicious meal here that I think about at least once a month.The servers were all extremely friendly and we felt welcomed the moment we entered the restaurant! Would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for fresh Arabic food in Cole Valley.

Every dish was fabulous. Presentation was spectacular, everything was beautiful. Using a wood oven for everything is inventive and gave everything a unique taste. Short rib tacos had a nice sauce with them. Same with enchiladas. Queso was tasty and accompanied salsas added several nice options for hotness. To top it off, the cheesecake was light and airy and paired well with the fruit that came with it. Overall, a great dining experience

I chose to bring my bf to this restaurant with his family and he loved it. He talks about going back again all the time and I'm thinking about bringing him back on again to celebrate Valentines and our 1 year anniversary. We got the queso fundido, wagyu steak and the fajitas steak and OMG the food was to DIE for. I can't wait to come back

I've been to dlena several times for brunch and dinner. Their bottomless brunch is so good! There beef tacos, street corn and churros are what I end up ordering again and again although other options are good too. I've had the pork shank for dinner a couple times which is super tender and flavorful. The only thing I don't like is that the churros are not a regular menu staple. They give them to you on special occasions with the caramel sauce which is divine! They're made fresh, served warm and yummy. You can get unlimited churros during brunch but you can tell they're not made to order and they come drizzled with chocolate and caramel. I ask for no chocolate at least which they do accommodate. The drinks are also top notch.
The happy hour is one of the better once in the city. Recommendation is to arrive 15min before it starts....it's get super busy fast and fun.
Troy was amazing! Had a great time. Thanks for having us.Troy was amazing! Had a great time. Thanks for having us.
Everything about this place is exceptional! The vibe, the food, and the service = 10/10. I highly recommend! Great for groups and dates. Be sure to make a reservation!

This is the second time I'm visiting dLeÃ±a and I loved today's experience just as much as my first visit. Photos don't do justice as this place is so beautiful! The ambiance is elegant, classy, and warm. The seating at the bar is very comfortable. Excellent service by bartenders who are polite, efficient, and professional. Of course, the food here is phenomenal! My favorites from today were Wagyu Beef Tiradito, Pork Belly, and Ceviche Amarillo. I'm not a fan of steak in general, but their 30 Day Dry Aged Boneless Ribeye puts top-tier steakhouses in the DMV area to shame. Their tacos (Short Rib, AtÃºn, and CamarÃ³ne) are perfection. Overall, there is no restaurant that can compete with dLeÃ±a currently in DC - a class act all around. If you are looking for a romantic date spot, bring your beau here! If your friends are visiting from out of town to experience DC, bring them here! No matter who you bring as your company, it will be a lovely evening filled with fabulous drinks, great food, vibrant live music, and muchas risas!

Best Restaurant in DC for the ambiance! This place exudes character, warm, rich, inviting. When you enter dlena it it's like being transported out of DC and into Mexico City. The tequila selection is amazing, the food is superb, and of coarse the service is top notch! This is the place to be in DC local or visitor, this is the spot!
My top restaurant around the area! Also, Royal was fantastic and gave us the best recommendations!
Royal is dope. Give him the tequila and cash. No one compares. We will be back again.
Great decor, great choice of beer, Brandon was fantastic!!!
Brandon was such an amazing server! He made sure to check up on us and recommended an amazing wine. We'll definitely come back !
These people are not fucking around with the desserts. Get the crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e and get your life.
Get the Enchiladas! These are are the enchiladas I ever had. Hands down! Great drinks and friendly staff too!
Jason was such a pleasure and a treat as well as the food and tequila. Highly recommended

I would like to first start by saying I never review restaurants but my experience last night made me make an exception. My wife and I ate at DleÃ±a and had a wonderful experience. It was our anniversary and we wanted to make a night of it so we went downstairs to the speakeasy bar for a night cap. They had live music which was great and had a really cool atmosphere. But it wasn't the food or drinks (which were great) that made me write this, but the service. I have lived in DC for many years but last night was the best service We have experienced since coming to this city. Our server Nancy was incredible and had such knowledge. We first were standing because it was first come first serve and when we told her we were celebrating our anniversary she immediately found us a table . When we asked her what she liked on the menu she said it didn't matter because it wasn't about her, it was about what we like and what kind of experience we wanted to have. She had us trying mezcal (which neither my wife nor I had ever had) and then gave us old fashions with tequila and mezcal! If that wasn't enough, she even brought us a dessert that had "Happy Anniversary" written on it. We both were confused because we didn't request it but she said she had remembered and wanted to help us celebrate. An all-star server that makes us want to come back!

My husband and I caught wind of the gem and had to check it out. We didn't get a chance to eat but we will doing that the next time! This is a sexy spot. We came in and went straight to Roja, our waitress, Nancy helped me with the craft cocktails and she didn't disappoint. This staff is sexy and works well together. The chemistry between everyone was so smooth. One. thing I thought was strange was that I'm watching the staff, literally crawl on their knees to get back and fourth from under the bar. I cannot wait to tell my other industry friends about this place. We all know bartenders don't like overly crowded places and this place is beautifully perfect.

Incredible meal and equally as incredible of a space - truly stunning with the best Mexican (IMO) in DC. The restaurant is located on the corner of 5th and K NW, has a breezy pup-friendly patio and a cozy dining room perfect for date night or with a group of friends. Went for opening night and tried the enchiladas, grilled oysters, seared tuna tacos and wagyu aguachile and have been thinking about when I can go back to eat it again. Definitely save room for dessert
Really great atmosphere, even better burgers. Amazing food and drinks1

Much like the name suggests the service here is fast and friendly. I get the impression that they tend to have a lot of seasonal drinks, my date and I ordered the Mozzarella Balls and the "What the Cluck" and it was delicious! Great people and great drinks. If you haven't been here yet be sure to stop by, all I need is quality drinks and quality chicken. Done

Cool place, cool drinks and cooler bartenders. Really great local spot, small but not exclusive. Like the bar in Cheers, go often enough and they get to know you. If they don't know your name, they always know your drink.
Great neighborhood spot, always great service.
I usually come here on weekend, I like this bars, Every time, I enjoy myself, so, it make me relax.

If you are into unique cocktails then this is the place for you! The bartenders were friendly and answered all of our questions and even made some great recommendations. We also got a few chicken dishes to share and they were delicious! We are going to be regulars from now on!
I usually come here during happy hour so the wines are quite reasonable! Its a great place to chill with friends
I love this bar.Unlike other places i have been to here the bartenders are so friendly, which up lifts my mood

Service Bar DC is such a gem! The cocktails are top-notch, the food is creative and delicious, and the vibe is laid-back but lively. It's the kind of place where you can kick back with friends and lose track of time-highly recommend it!Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie
Can't go wrong at Service Bar. Best cocktails in DC. And great bartenders and staff!
Food and drinks were really nice. They Yaypi Kusuma cocktail was great for Instagram but could be better.The food was just on point. Can't wait to return.Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 5/5

This place is amazing!!! The menu is constantly changing and given that the bartenders there came from the best bars in the city to open up their own place, I'm not surprised. Seriously, every cocktail I had obliterated my expectations. I can't wait to go back. Shout out to Manny for putting together some fire drinks.
Was in town for work and checked it on a Thursday night... good times and good vibes. Loved the open air concept and the music was on point!Check it out!!!!

As I walked down the back road. I could hear the voices of the children that had been taken the year prior and never found. I saw the eyes looking at me from behind the trees and waited until something worse would happen. I prayed that I would make it out alive. I don't even know what got me out here in the first place. Was it an accident or was it love but all I knew was that I had to get back so I could go to this bar one last time. Great drinks. Great atmosphere. Friendly staff.  Story to be continued
22% Gratuities included- not good service. Food- too salty I Will Never come back here.

DONT GO HERE. felt so unsafe. Janae the hostess made it a point to give me and my friends the middle finger when leaving. Manager at that time asked "what do you want me to do" and janae said "I'm off my shift what are you going to about it"Don't eat here unless you want to be threatened after a meal. so unprofessional.Susie was really kind, but staff was confrontational after Susie left. Also they include a 22% tip ( tipping for a staff to ask to fight after our meal?)Would love to talk to the owner.

Being that Malaysian food is my ultimate favorite food, and I've lived the SE Asia for a good decade I couldn't give these guys a perfect score but they were as good as it gets on this side of the globe. Fresh, abundant, great value for Excellent Malaysian fare. All the right flavors from across Indonesia, Singapore and Malaysia. I loved the customer experience i received, and will be back to try more again. a 5 star is not far away!
You know a restaurant is great when you keep eating despite your stomach feeling painfully full. This is the experience you'll get at Makan, one of DC's best restaurants.
Great food and service. I will definitely come back and recommend it to friends and family
Great service, great atmosphere, and delicious plates. Can't wait to return and try more!

Holy smokes Makan is delicious. I'm writing this review as I slurp on some leftovers and oh man, it makes me want to go back already.We came with a reservation and the seating process was quick and easy. We ordered chicken sate as an appetizer. It comes with a peanut sauce that is crunchy and flavorful and better than any that I have had before. We decided to share three dishes between us to get a little sampling of everything: curry noodle soup, pineapple curry, and fried chicken. Of the three, the fried chicken and pineapple curry were stand outs. The pineapple curry was a suggestion from a friend and I was skeptical, but DANG, it is phenomenal. Can't wait to come back and try some of the other dishes!

Decided spontaneously to come here for dinner and left with the place being one of my favorite restaurants. Tonight's dining experience was immaculate. The first thing you'll notice when you walk up are the number of available outdoor, covered seating options. Inside is a modern, but super comfortable and open dining space. The interior of this place is beautiful. I think the high ceilings, wood accents, color tones, and overall decor make this one of the nicest dining spaces in DC. The authenticity and quality of their dishes perfectly contribute to their overall vibe. Seated near the open kitchen, we could clearly see the chefs prep and hustle putting out food. The menu is unique with dishes I'm sure you can't find in the entire DMV. The servers are also the nicest and quite knowledgeable, so we deferred to our eager server who recommended a number of small dishes and entrees. We started with the chicken satay skewers, which were simple, but excellent. You can tell there was love put into that peanut sauce, which was the best I've had and a great start to the meal. The char kway teow, a flat noodle dish with shrimp and Chinese sausage is pure umami and will blow your mind. The Ayam goreng or fried chicken is confit and cooked perfectly. The salted duck yolk is a little grainy in texture, but also pure umami. My favorite dish had to be the mushroom rendang, which is not a huge portion, but unbelievably deep and layered in rich flavor. I could've eaten the mushrooms alone on white rice and been fine! Definitely get the small additions like the sambal sauce and various acars, which perfectly complement each dish and the overall dining experience. What I noticed most about this place is the complex depth and layers of the flavors. The overall dining experience blew my mind. This chef knows what he's doing and according to my Malaysian friends, the food is super authentic. They're super good with COVID precautions, so check them out. Trust.

Was curious what restaurant would finally occupy the giant space left by Meridian Pint. Makan has filled this restaurant with fantastic food, drinks and energy! Our meal was fantastic. I was exposed to so many flavors. Excellent cocktail program and extensive beer and wine list. They kept all the draft lines. Some highlights from our meal were the Roti Jala with curry, chinese lettuce in a yummy stock, all the pickles and sambals, rendang curry, and fried chicken with salted duck yolk. There weren't any dishes we ordered we disliked. Favorite cocktail was Otaks Botak, refreshing and tropical. Will be back to try the rest of the menu.

I recently dined at Albi, a Michelin-starred restaurant with good food but disappointing service. Before we were seated, I requested a simple glass of water and was refused by the host. While the dishes were tasty, the overall pace and service was terrible. I'm unsure how this restaurant can continue to maintain a star, they must take their guests for granted. Disappointing experience when we were celebrating a big night for my husband and me.

Amazing food but server was rude. Made it awkward about a water bottle one of us had brought and strongly pushed us to get a whole chicken even though we were ordering half a chicken because we like to order and try a bunch of appetizers and usually enjoy those more than the entree. Then came to our table when we were eating the chicken and pointed out how the half that was left was what we would have gotten if we had ordered half and that it would not have been enough for us. Except we didn't eat any more of the chicken so we ended up having to box up that half chicken and take it to go anyway. The chicken was also the least impressive of their menu items so if anything we could have skipped it entirely instead of getting twice as much of it.That being said, the appetizers were some of the best Mediterranean food I have had, quite comparable to Dubai. The hummus and baba ganoush were amazing and the pairings were thoughtful and a modern take on Lebanese cuisine. The heirloom tomatoes + sauce were amazing too. I couldn't taste the labneh in the peach labneh soft serve dessert though
The food is amazing!! Probably my 2nd favorite michelin star restsurant next to Sushi nakazawa!!!

Take it from a foodie, this place will give you a one of a kind dinning experience absolutely love this restaurant and it's easily one of my favorites in town. The atmosphere and vibe are perfect for any occasion and the food is indescribably magical. The Hummus and Mushrooms dish, in particular, is something I can't get enough of and it's definitely worthy of the Michelin star they received. The chef is always coming up with modern and innovative recipes that blend traditional Palestinian cuisine in a exceptional way. You won't find anything like the food at Albi in any other restaurant.

The food was excellent! We ordered baba ganoush, falafel arayes, Tomato Fattoush, Batata Harra, and delicious lamb. However, the service was underwhelming. The server failed to provide meaningfully recommendations and was difficult to hear. Great food, but the service needs improvement.

Albi is a culinary journey through the heart of Lebanon and the Middle East. The menu is a celebration of fire, with dishes cooked over a wood-fired hearth that infuse each bite with smoky, charred perfection.The lamb BBQ kebab and mushroom hummus are must-tries, a harmonious blend of flavors and textures. The baba ghanoush and kefta are executed with precision, showcasing the chef's skill. However, it's the dishes cooked over the wood-fired hearth that truly shine.To fully experience the diverse range of flavors, I highly recommend the hyper-seasonal prix-fixe menu. Each course is a delightful surprise, showcasing the best of Lebanese and Middle Eastern cuisine.

My wife and I visited Albi for the first time in DC, a Mediterranean and Middle Eastern-inspired restaurant that earned its first Michelin star in 2022. Located in the Navy Yard area, the restaurant has modern dÃ©cor, an open kitchen, and a vibrant bar scene. Street parking is relatively easy to find, and reservations are a must due to its popularity.For appetizers, we started with the Sfeeha, Middle Eastern meat pies served with toum and lemon. The flatbread, freshly baked in a woodfire pita oven, was delicious, and the meat topping paired beautifully with the toum sauce.Next, we tried the Coal-Fired Mushroom Hummus with freshly baked pita. This was my favorite dish of the night! The addition of black garlic and egg yolk elevated the hummus to a new level--smooth, creamy, and irresistible when paired with the warm pita.We also ordered the Kibbeh Naya with Yellowfin Tuna, a ground raw fish dish served with puffed bulgur, lettuce, toum, and mint. While my wife enjoyed it, it wasn't a standout for me, though the tuna was well-seasoned.For the main course, we shared the BBQ'd Lamb Kebab, and it was spectacular. The lamb was incredibly soft, tender, and full of flavor, practically melting in your mouth. Accompanied by cinnamon kefta, charred delicata, and yam tahini, this dish was a highlight of the evening.To finish, we ordered Batata Harra, crispy fried potatoes tossed in shawarma spices and toum. While tasty, I was too full by then to fully enjoy it.Overall, Albi delivered an incredible dining experience with bold flavors and expertly prepared dishes. The only note is that some dishes shared similar seasoning profiles, and the generous use of toum sauce, but everything tasted fantastic. I'll definitely return to try their desserts next time!
Amazing service and food. The quality of the food was so fresh and out waiter was fantastic!

My husband and I decided to splurge on a special evening at Albi, and we couldn't be more pleased with our experience. This Michelin-starred gem in the Navy Yard offers an extraordinary tasting menu for $125, along with an optional $95 wine pairing, both of which we opted for.The moment we stepped inside, we were enveloped in an atmosphere that seamlessly blends rustic Eastern Mediterranean aesthetics with modern sophistication. The staff greeted us warmly, setting the tone for a truly memorable evening.Our culinary journey began with an array of mezze, each one a small masterpiece of flavor and presentation. Each course was expertly paired with wine, thanks to the curated $95 wine pairing option. Our server was highly knowledgeable, guiding us through each selection and its synergies with the food.Albi isn't just a restaurant
The food at this place was amazing. All the dishes we ordered were so flavorful!! I totally recommend this place. You will not be disappointed!
This is the best Middle-eastern food in all of D.C.!
Incredible food, tasty variety,
Lebanese with a modern flare. Totally recommend.

This is the best restaurant in DC. I've lived here for a long time and this is the best food with the best service. Ask for Angela as your waiter if you go! He is the best and made our experience amazing.
I've heard that this place discriminates against immigrants! That's too bad, immigrants are hardworking people that contribute to our society. I'm not recommending this place.

I usually love Ted's but this one experience was the worst I've ever had. Ordered a tart while waiting for a seat with a few friends and got displaced (not sure why?). We ended up waiting 20 minutes and then the server changed inevitably never getting a table. We ended up leaving. Boo, not sure I'll be back.
This is _not_ a green business. ENORMOUS and unnecessary use of plastic on to go orders. Huge bummer, and poor business practice.

Horrible service. My party of 5 people decided to eat here after running the semper fi 5k. We went to the hostess to reserve a table. She took our name, gave us a buzzer and told us the wait would be 45 minutes. We waited about 50 minutes and checked in with her to see how much longer we would have to wait. We were outraged to discover that she never even activated the buzzer!! After we complained to the manager, we were seated after another 10 minute wait. The waitress who took our order got everyone's meal wrong. I didn't get my soup, my friend didn't get his bacon, another friend didn't get cheese with her eggs. One persons order too extra long to come out after everyone else received their food. We suspect it was because she forgot to put in the order. I hate this location
I will never support a place that does not support and respect its workforce. Shame on you! Know your strength. Immigrants make D.C. Great!coworker.org/petitions/m¡­
Not a thing for anyone that doesn't want any kind of animal on their plate. Chef is a moron. Please don't patronize this dump

Really, really bad breakfast food. I am at a loss around popularity of restaurant.  The French toast tasted like wonder bread with cinnamon on top. The hashbrowns came out very greasy and over cooked. I am not sure how you mess up scrambled eggs, but they did.

The bartender was RUDE as hell! She was so pissed, we don't know why. All the bars on 14th were packed and Ted's was the only one still with happy hour and available seats. But that girl, OMG!!! An african american lady that almost threw the drinks to us. Terrible. Never come back again.
So incredibly over rated. Great for tourists from rural towns easily excited by gourmet pop tarts, normies with no pallet, basic ppl.
nice d¨¦cor.  good waiter. better food most anywhere else
Service was poor
Veggie burger was decent, but few vegan options.

Venturing into Ted Bulletin, I couldn't help but be drawn in by the bustling atmosphere and the tantalizing display of pastries in the bakery. However, as the crowd swelled and the minutes ticked by, I found myself questioning whether the experience would live up to the hype. We had a reservation and in all fairness, we arrived earlier than expected, but you wonder if the "wait" isn't a gimmick to drum up business for the cafe in the lobby area and the bar. I definitely almost ate BEFORE I ate...the homemade pop tarts were calling my name. While the food certainly delivered on flavor, with dishes that satisfied the palate and left me craving more, the wait-time left much to be desired. The restaurant was packed to the gills, and although the bakery boasted a tempting array of eye-popping pastries, the service fell short of expectations.Despite the unexceptional service, the quality of the food and the delightful treats from the bakery added a silver lining to the experience. Yet, it's hard to overlook the disappointment that lingers when faced with a prolonged wait and underwhelming service.In the end, Ted Bulletin offers a mixed bag of delights and frustrations. While the food may be good, the overall experience may leave you questioning whether it's truly worth the wait.
The food is great but the service could be quicker . The breakfast is one of the best in the city !
The serves was great atmosphere was greatWill say the it was just little over price for what I was expecting for breakfast
This place is just OK for dinner. Their breakfast is really the star.
Great food. Worst service I've had in the DC area. Went the 14th st location
So, so, so, good. I don't think I could move when I was done with my meal, I was so full and so happy.

I don't get why this place is so popular. I found the food to be quite ordinary, as did the other three in my group. Friendly, fast service. Fun, warm environment. Would I come back here again? If there was no wait, sure. Otherwise? Probably not. While the prices are quite reasonable for 14th St, they're not much different from Matchbox, which I would choose any day over Ted's. Each to his own though!
Great service and brunch.

Nice dining room, with some pretty cool "olde timey" features and comfortable seating. Adult milkshakes are amazeballs. But the food itself is just so-so. The biscuits are kinda bland and doughy, the sausage gravy is like wallpaper paste, and the famed pop-tarts are thoroughly mediocre. The basic breakfast options (bacon, eggs, hash browns, etc.) are fine, though. So, overall, a decent addition to the neighborhood.
The quality as presented is exquisite but the seasoning is poor and as im a southern woman in some par, i appreciate the taste of such and that isn't here.

We chose this lovely restaurant to celebrate my son's graduation, and it was a fantastic decision! To start, we shared an order of the Honey Butter Biscuits and crispy Chicken Wings - a definite crowd-pleaser. For my main course, I indulged in the Catfish & Grits, a dish I'd been craving for ages. It was every bit as delicious as I'd hoped! Feeling extra hungry, I also ordered a side of pancakes, which were fluffy and delicious but ultimately too much for me to finish. Overall, it was a wonderful celebration
Excellent breakfast spot for whenever you're craving. Their pastry counter at the front is fun! A little loud but overall it was a pleasant experience.
Always good food and good service. Always crowded. Reservations is a must for wknd brunch!
Tried this place recently for breakfast. Covid precautions well followed, nice staff. Food is good too. Nice place to visit for some comfort breakfast
Loved the decor of the spot.Took me back to a happy time.Meal was filling and tasty.Service was pretty spot on as well.
Terrible eggs like seriously... the scrambled eggs taste like powder eggs or something everything else is yummy
Just had their chicken sandwich and fries. Very good. Delivered hot and the fries were crispy. Overall an excellent take out lunch

Love this place. Went in for drinks on a Saturday night recently. Great service at the bar. Nice selection of liquor and beer. Great food menu too. Burger was great.  Cooked perfectly. Location is great, lots going on around there. Overall super fun.
Really nice food. Service was a little on the slow side, but my server was very sweet. Really cool atmosphere.
So much delicious food! Service very friendly and attentive and lovely atmosphere in this great dinner style eatery .

This is a great place to take people to go if they are from out of town. It is a very simple menu but very DC. The cinnamon roll is a lot of fun for the table. I also got an omelet. Simple but well executed call ahead though to put your name on the list.

We visited for breakfast and everything was good. The restaurant has a nice feel to it isn't crammed in there at all. The service for the most part wad great except it seemed as if we were bothering the staff but it might normally be like that since I was visiting from out of town. I had a generally good time and probably would've had a better one if I was feeling a bit better.
Decent classic diner dishes with a slight contemporary twist. Clean establishment. Good service (sat at the counter). Desserts look delicious I may need to come back and try some.

I'm a proud resident of Capitol Hill, and I've been to essentially every place here at least once, and I have to say that these guys are a very wise decision if you're planning on eating big without overspending. Just last night, I ordered blueberry cheesecake tart and I was amazed at how much filling they put into it. The service is also okay, sometimes you get a little attitude from the hostess or a certain disgruntled waiter but I can get over that, especially when I know I'll be getting great tasting food for stupendously good prices.
Im quite a sweet tooth, i love trying out new desserts! Went to Teds Bulletin recently and it was amazing! Their cheese cake was bomb
I have been here twice and i love it here. i love the food, and the bar. I will definitely be back !

Had brunch here with my boyfriend. We're definitely fans. Tons of food and reasonable prices. The highlight for us -- splitting a milkshake! But, we couldn't resist one last bite so, on our way out, we had a donut hole from the bakery in Ted's entry way. We probably should have stopped ourselves because the donut hole was a tad bit dry for our tastes. Sigh...next time we should quit while we are a ahead. In sum, great meal but not perfect.
Food and service was ok. Milkshakes were amazing! I liked the atmosphere and how it was decorated.
Amazing desserts and milkshakes!!

Bakery goods are amazing here. Worth going just for them. If you want to impress someone with a thoughtful food item bring them a variety box of homemade pop tarts instead of cupcakes. Brunch itself was pretty good but the breakfast sandwich was overrated. The scrambled egg portion of it was like a microwaved quiche consistency with the same flavor. Also the heavily buttered Texas toast was too much richness for me. Sausage tasted infused with syrup which was kind of gross for me. Bacon, cheese, and over easy egg was legit. Hash browns were edible. Pancakes and kids breakfast man was excellent. Great place for kids but wait can be very long so plan ahead. I will go back especially for the baked goods. Service was great once seated.
There Pastrami sandwich is amazing. Ask for a little extra, thousand island. Best liquor shakes!
As a serious greed with the time when as highly recommend the place. Had some my favorite old item at the place. No more another place but for their good justice of their good item.Can't love it!
Good food and reasonable prices! I was there for brunch and I will likely come back.
Great service. The food was tasty and served quickly.

I really like this place, but the entrees did leave us a little disappointed.Ted's is a very casual, retro sort of place that serves breakfast and desserts all day. On this particular day we wanted a hot meal, so we each had entrees -- Gumbo and Country Fried Steak.The gumbo wasn't really gumbo. It had no Cajun flavor at all. It was basically rice with a lot of shrimp, and a little bit of sausage and chicken, covered with a weird sweet BBQ sauce. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't gumbo.The country fried steak was nice and crisp, but the meat itself was really low quality and entirely too chewy. The gravy was bland. The sides were nice -- Mac n Cheese and steamed broccoli.But the stars of the meal were clearly the desserts. The Oreo milkshake was pulled straight from my dreams and the apple pop tart, while too small, was perfect. Probably the best crust I've had on a pastry since Grand Ma's peach cobbler.So next time we'll skip the entrees. The sandwiches look good, as do the breakfast dishes, so that is probably your best bet.

Had breakfast here with my cousin. We sat at the bar and were served by Yunisa, who gave us great service. We ordered the steak and eggs, and the steak was cooked perfectly, tender, and came with a flavorful sauce that tied everything together. For drinks, my cousin had the Oldest Fashioned and I had the Jalape?o Pineapple Margarita, and they were both yummy. It's also super convenient to the car charging station I use, so this will definitely be a regular spot for me!Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie
George is the best! I come to Ted's multiple times a week and I know he takes care of everything I need.

After a whirlwind of furniture shopping, my fianc¨¦ and I decided to treat ourselves to a late lunch at this cozy spot. We were seated across from some younger patrons, and that's when we met our fantastic waiter, Keith! But I'm jumping ahead--let's start with the food!We kicked things off with some deviled eggs, which were incredibly tasty, although missing their traditional paprika sprinkle. We didn't make a fuss because they were still delightful, but made a mental note to request paprika next time. For the main course, I opted for the harvest salad--a beautiful medley of baby kale, butternut squash, walnuts, Granny Smith apples, and more. I added chicken for extra oomph, and it was absolutely delicious! Each bite was a burst of flavor, leaving me thoroughly satisfied.My fianc¨¦ went for the Caesar salad, which he declared delicious as well. We both polished off our plates, which says a lot!Now, back to Keith- our engaging waiter who indulged us in conversation about his daughter, a tennis champ in her own right. We were so enchanted by the meal and the service that we returned two weeks later, hoping to sit in his section again. Unfortunately, Keith wasn't there that day, but we're determined to catch him next time.And as for the food on our return visit? We swapped the deviled eggs for a plain version and added some calamari--light, fluffy, and utterly delightful. This place has certainly won our hearts (and our tastebuds), and we'll be back soon!
Great vibe and delicious food at Ted's Bulletin. Friendly staff and fair portions. :)

Well put together place. I went for a large party lunch so we have full service workers. She was working her butt off. The bread and butter was phenomenal! Had a little drizzle of Parmesan on top. The lobster roll I got for lunch was a huge portion! I love that so I could take some home! The roll was good but needs a little more mayo coating for me. The carrot cake was killer! It was so moist and not too sweet! The icing was light and then there was like a bourbon caramel sauce that was really good as well

The mere thought of the biscuits and gravy has my mouth watering. I visited on a whim for brunch on Saturday and was pleasantly surprised to snag a high-top table in the bar area without having to wait. The breakfast drinks were also amazing, and I particularly enjoyed the Irish coffee. My only criticism would be the cinnamon roll, which I found to be overcooked on the outside, though the interior was still good. Next time, I'll skip the cinnamon roll. Overall, the service was great, and I loved the vibe - I'll definitely be back!

Consistently Great Food and Service!I always have a wonderful experience at this restaurant! The food is consistently delicious, and the service is top-notch. Whether I'm dining in or taking out, I can always count on a satisfying meal and friendly staff. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a reliable dining option!

Ted's Bulletin on 14th Street in Washington, DC is an outstanding dining experience. The food is simply amazing, with a delightful selection of coffee and desserts that never disappoints. Every dish arrives hot and fresh, and the crew is both responsive and attentive. The main manager is always ready to help and accommodate guests, ensuring a pleasant visit every time. If you're looking for top-notch food, exceptional service, and a welcoming atmosphere, Ted's Bulletin is the place to be.
NOMA is OPEN! NOMA is OPEN! Beautiful, fun atmosphere with a TERRIFIC team! The patio is lush, the vibe is fun, and the food delish! A large menu....something for everyone! GO NOW and treat yourself!

I had a great experience at Ted's! The food was absolutely delicious. We tried something called the Hong Kong French toast, and it was absolutely to die for. Service was great. Everyone was really kind, attentive, and very quick. The whole atmosphere is just so classy and I can't wait to go back. I would highly highly recommend for brunch or any other meal of the day actually.

We chose Ted's Bulletin (Ballston Quarter location) to host brunch for 23 friends and family members. The staff reserved a private room for our gathering following my dad's interment at Arlington. The location was convenient, the food was delicious, and the service by Nancy was exceptional. We highly recommend.
Amazing food, amazing people, amazing service. Shoutout to Noah, best service I received ever was from him!

The food was good . I so happened to be in the area handling some business and stopped by for lunch . I was hoping they had grilled cheese because surprisingly not a lot of restaurants sell that and I really lucked up with this spot . It was one of the best grilled cheeses I've had in a while . I'm new to the area so I'll for sure be back and will be recommending this spot. Not to mention I had a good server , her name was Nabetse. She had recommended a great drink from the bar as well which really hit the spot because a good sandwich and a drink is my favorite pass time !
