I had a delightful experience at Ted's Bulletin. The desserts were a highlight, leaving a lasting sweet memory of my visit. The exceptional service provided by Edwin Q truly enhanced my dining experience
Our waitress Beauty was very attentive! Desserts were very good and large portions! Good music too.
Food was just delicious. On weekends they have an amazing cinnamon roll. You much have!
This is a great place to take people to go if they are from out of town. We visited for breakfast and everything was good. Tons of food and reasonable prices.  We can't wait to come back for more.
This place is fun and the food was delicious!
Very cheering, cool place. Food was amazing. Highly recommend the chicken and biscuits!
Loved the vibes and the food! The staff are great and the food was delicious. The choice in music made the atmosphere even more enjoyable.

We found this place looking for some tea (my friends) and food/coffee for me. It was brilliant. All the reviews are correct this place is incredibly delicious and a lovely decor as well. It's a very nice place. The food selection, and coffee were all awesome. All in all, a nice, recommendable experience. I would recommend to make a reservation in advance! It would be a good choice for brunch.

This Ted's Bulletin on 14th St. NW is on point!! The staff was friendly and the Manager Renzo was stellar. Been here before and will return with friends!! The other locations need shadow this crew!ThanksThe King Family DC Natives
They have a type of food for every human.

Whenever I'm feeling like a treat and I'm in the area, I stop over at Ted's for a homemade pop tart or a boozy milkshake! Service is always fast and friendly. And honestly, who doesn't love a dessert mixed with alcohol? Double win for me!
Great food great customer service!!! The grits are a must!! My server was Sammy and he was awesome!

AMAZING!!! The server was really nice, I asked for her opinion in what to get and she said chicken parm!! Boy was that good!! It does get pretty busy here tho, so you might have to wait a bit but it's totally worth it!! Definitely should give it a try!

I've come here a few times and have left satisfied with the service as well as the food. Their French toast is a must get. Also, their chorizo breakfast burrito was fantastic. Also, order bloody Mary. The prices were right, which also didn't hurt.
Very great eats and lovely breakfast would recommend it to anyone. French toast tastes awesome and melt in your mouth. Best breakfast in DC!
Good service, delicious food, nice place.
Est¨¢ lugar es incre¨ªble muy buena comida y excelente servicio sin duda es uno de mis lugares favoritos de desayuno y si se pudriera poner mas estrellas yo pondr¨ªa unas 10
Stopped by Saturday night which is date night for hubbie and I we really Loved this place Food was freaking delicious and so was dessert. We can't wait to come back for more !!!!!
Very good food, fulfilling portions! We ordered an appetizer and before we could finish our main dishes were ready.
The pop tarts are everything! Order them all!! It's worth the wait- it's worth everything for those pop tarts!
Love the look of this place. Has the best food and poptarts!

Firstly, I loved the decor of the place. It was very art deco and with even the servers fitting into the scene.Secondly the food was amazing. My friend who lives in DC goes regularly. My husband who is a picky eater even enjoyed the menu. I haven't stopped craving their deserts since we left. This was a great restaurant.
This has become one of my go to spots for brunch. There is never a wait to be seated. Servers are always fast and knowledgeable. Food is fast and hot.

We had breakfast here right when they opened at 7:00. It was great. The service was good and the food was really good. Good atmosphere too. Of course we like the morning because there are not a lot of customers and the street is not too busy at this hour.
Came here based on a recommendation and enjoyed it. We will be back.
This is one of my favorite places for breakfast. The portions are large and the taste of the food is fantastic. We will be going back the next time we are in D.C.
Delicious food, with homemade pop tarts that are delicious. There was a bit of a wait though

Nostalgia! First off, let me just say that I absolutely love this place, from the antique TVs with the foil laced antennas, to the homemade pop tarts, this is one of my favorite restaurants in a city where gastronomical diversity is bountiful.....The food at Teds is always filling but I always make sure I save a little extra room for desert......Our server Mershon was awesome! He recommended the CHOCOLATE DEVILS FOOD CAKE, he proclaimed,"If you like chocolate, you'll love the chocolate devils food cake." Thanks Mershon!!! So do your self a favor if your in the U street Corridor and stop by Teds Bulletin, where else can you watch I Love Lucy and sip on a malted milkshake and pretend like your back in time. Chow

First time dining here and the experience was very good. We ordered the short rib sammy and the salmon entree.The short rib sammy was legit! It was recommended by our waiter Dwon ( more about him later). I found the short rib to be just right. Not too salty, loaded with deep and savory bourbon undertones and just the right amount of fatty textures. The cheese was also on point and melted to perfection. This dish was fantastic. I substituted the fries for the tater tots again at the suggestion of Dwon, and I am happy I did. They give you about 10 and let me tell you I was considering ordering a side of those to go.My wife loved the salmon. What much is there to say about salmon. It was perfectly cooked, medium, crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. It was a generous portion. She also substituted her side with brussel sprouts with melted blue cheese and crispy bacon. It was a very nice compliment to the salmon.So the highlight of the trip actually revolves around the dining experience itself. As our entrees arrived, almost on que, a couple was seated next to us. Very close. The moment this young man, maybe mid 40's, sat down he sneezed. Not even a minute later he begins coughing. Thats fine I'm thinking, its warm today, allergies are affecting people but it was his lack of manners and hygiene as he never covered his mouth. Well this carried on for what felt like 5 min but in reality was about 1.5 minutes. I immediately got up and asked for the manager who was a very nice young lady named Karina. She was happy to help us. She wasted no time and sat us next to the window ( major upgrade ) and had our food brought over. Funny part is we periodically looked over at the nuisance customer and would see all sorts of really gross stuff including putting his fingers in his mouth to pick out what I could only imagine was food stuck in his teeth. A really gross guy.Then there was our waiter Dwon. This young man works hard! He has a very nice positive and upbeat attitude. We really liked him. He injected just the right amount of humor and engagement without going overboard and becoming that 3rd wheel server we all have been stuck with. Dwon balanced everything out with solid menu suggestions and we will definitely be coming back and asking for him again when we make our reservation.So yeah, if you are in town traveling as we were and your looking for a great spot with a really nice atmosphere this is a good choice. Thank you Karina and Dwon.

Love This Teds location right near the Trader Joe's every time I come up this strip I can't help but stop in to the bakery and grab one of their tempting pieces of cake or pie today I stopped by to try out the carrot cake and that for sure did not disappoint
Great Atmosphere, Friendly Service, and Great Food. Didn't wait too long for our food and it was so good.

My wife and I came to This location for the first Time last night and Both had out of This World Burgers I had the Peanut with Bacon burger recomended to me by our server Kimberly and paired it with the Chocolate peanut butter and Bannana Milkshake that made my night! Needless to say we Will for sure be back for more! Service Food and decor was outstanding and we fell In love with the place...

No words. I only got takeout, but it's all I wanted and all I've ever needed.Blueberry cheesecake poptart, salted caramel poptart, and a bacon cheddar scone. My lord. Everything was SO GOOD. I could have gone back and eaten every single baked good they have there, it all looked so amazing. Paired with a cup of coffee across the street at Peet's, we had a perfect breakfast (if you're just getting baked goods, there's nowhere to hangout, so going across the street might be your best bet).
This was a wonderful experience. How exciting it was to venture into a great atmosphere where everyone was helpful and delightful. I will always remember this time.

Lived up to all the great things we have heard. The diner ambience is fantastic, and the black and white tvs gave off a 1950s pop store vibe. First of all, the homemade pop tarts are so worth the hype. We had the salted caramel pop tart with the Big Mark Breakfast. The sausage was some of the best we've had. The service was fantastic, and since the restaurant allowed us to call ahead we were seated in no time. Great experience, and we will definitely return.
Good alcoholic milkshakes. Get the Mocha
Great for tasty comfort food in a relaxed, high-end diner setting. We almost never have to wait long and the hand-made pop-tarts are fun.

Any place that lets me eat a pop tart with a fork and knife, sign me up!The 5 stars are specifically for Judah. He was one of the best servers I have ever had. Considering it was my first time at this restaurant, he was very tentative to our table but still allowing us ample time to study the menu. He answered all our questions very accurately. The way in which he carried himself and held eye contact with each one of us showed how confident he is in his work. Excellent job, Judah!As for the food, death by chocolate! The chocolate milkshake (non adult version) was delicious! However, I couldn't finish the little extra they give you on the side. I also had the chocolate raspberry pop tart. The chocolate and tart were warm and melted sweetly upon eating.I would definitely go back for desserts again!
The pop tarts, and I'm sure the rest is even better. Hospitality all throughout.
Besides all of the delicious poptarts and milkshakes, they have great staff. They have great food, and great music playing!
No other word for it but amazing. For the $, could be pound for pound the best place in DC.
Great food and drinks.
Yum so glad this location opened

I've gone here twice. The first time for breakfast, I thought to myself "What the hell happened to the cook-to-order omelet? They only seem to have a spinach and mushroom available." I wasn't too impressed with the price, either. On the other hand, the service was super-friendly. You almost wonder if it is genuine, but then you realize "I just got great service and it SEEMED friendly, so why be so suspicious?"I went there again today for lunch and ordered a burger. Delish! The waiter couldn't have been more friendly or enthusiastic. The meat was perfectly seasoned. The cold add-ons (lettuce, tomato, pickle) were chill and crisp. The warm add-ons (onions, cheese, bacon) were nicely cooked.
Cant even make the order right. Ordered $60 worth of food and they missed 3 items. Calling them and no one is answering
I don't understand how they have such great reviews. This place kind of sucked. Don't recommend.
Met with very rude employees. We're not from here and so we don't frequent this establishment ever and because of how rude they were, we never will again.
shut this place down they had a roach!!!!!!!!!!!!!! you will get sick stay away
no just no it's the h-o-r-r-i-b-l-e
no wifi! no wifi! no wifi! no effing wifi! no wifiiiiii
No wifi. Why is this on a list of work-friendly coffee shops?

The food was just fine but not delicious .It's seem that the ingredients was unfresh. The food was so expensive.You're team members served me a my food with a grin face.And served the soggy sandwich.The service could be improvements.This is so bed place.One thing that I like here it is that the restaurant have a great location. I just like it's location.If you will improve you're service, stuff and improve the food so May be I visit again.
Overpriced and underwhelming. Customer service skills are lacking. I will probably not be returning. Please could also use a good cleaning.

The treats at this bakery are way too sweet, and they're kind of one-note. They really need to mix in some more flavors like tanginess and bitterness to mix things up. The scones, which could've been a game changer, are only available on weekends. But I have to give it to them -- the service is awesome, with really great personalized recommendations. The coffee options are a bit limited, but they do have some really unique and bold beans. The seating is super comfy, and on weekdays, it's nice and quiet. But man, on weekend mornings, the staff just keep yelling out customer names and orders ("ANGIE!!") which totally kills the chill vibe.
H YB was far dc v.@75,,

I know this is a favorite in the community and I love the diversity of the staff and the eclectic energy most of the folks who frequent and work there have. The open table concept encourages a lot of positive interactions but I'm just not that impressed with the food. I'm vegan, so my options are more limited but even the breads were bland despite smelling yummy. Perhaps it's because I've only been when it's busy but the set up and flow of the space seemed congested and flowed poorly, the drinks and food I ordered were underwhelming and their was a miscommunication that caused my items to sit for many minutes after being ready. Tables and floors had sticky residue and no communal way to clean them

Great food but pretentious baristas kill the whole experience.I've been brunching at this place for a while now, but it was not until recently when I started hating coming here. If you're ordering from the bar you can expect a very consistent sub-par customer service experience. At first I thought I just got a barista having a bad day, but after at least a week of bad attitudes I realized this is the new norm at this place. I wont be back, there are tons of places very close by that can offer the same quality and actually know a thing or two when it comes to customer interaction.
A bit pricey but given the location and the decent food, not unreasonably so. It's popular, so expect a wait in line to order and perhaps to sit. Vegetarian but not vegan friendly.

This review is more about the service, then it is about the food (which is delicious~). The place on a weekend is always super slammed so staff don't really seem to care about service or the customers given it's super transactional. Suggestion is to have your best line staff at the front. I asked a few questions about their daily quiche and nobody knew the answer...ended up getting the wrong order. Their sandwiches, the BELT specifically, is good. But do yourself a favor and get it to go.
Food and tea was great. Service was just okay.
A great place to try once. I say once because we went twice after our first visit was amazing and the second visit was not as great. It was even not as busy during our second visit

The food is quite good but they run out of stuff all the time. The staff is nice and friendly. The place is cute but it's hard to get a table when busy and people tend to just sit reading their book or work on their laptop. It was a bit cold so we wanted to eat inside, I have plantar fasciitis and can't stand and eat. I don't know how it's good for business to have people sit there for hours on end.

This place is my go-to spot for a laid-back breakfast. Their coffee is top-notch, and the breakfast biscuit, well, it's my absolute favorite!The ambiance here is a winning combination of cleanliness and hip vibes, making it an ideal setting to either catch up with friends or get some work done on your laptop. But, here's the catch - there's no WiFi available, and that's the main reason I don't visit as often as I'd like to. Usually, when I drop by, it's either a quick bite and run, or I spend a little time sipping coffee and people-watching. I've noticed others around with laptops, but I'm not sure how they're managing to get connected. Despite the connectivity hiccup, the food and coffee never disappoint.So, if you're in for a fantastic breakfast and don't mind missing the WiFi, this place is perfect for you. But be prepared to keep your online activities to a minimum.

During my trip to Washington, D.C., I had the pleasure of visiting a charming spot known as "The Bake Joint." Our party consisted of seven people, and my daughter and I had advised the rest of our family to meet us there. This establishment operates on a first-come, first-served basis, and fortunately, there was an abundance of seating available.Upon entering, I couldn't help but notice the youthful and energetic atmosphere. It seemed like a popular spot for folks looking to enjoy a hearty breakfast and a great cup of coffee. The ordering process was a bit unique

Location is central and perfect for takeaway. The breakfast is good but quite overpriced. There are indoor and outdoor seats (inside is quite loud due to rock music) and there is no internet. The service is ok and the place is clean.

I love having A Baked Joint dangerously close to me. It's like having a delicious siren song calling my name every time I walk by. The baked goods are chef's kiss. The biscuits are flaky and buttery, the croissants are perfectly golden brown, and the Sammy sandwiches are packed with flavor.But even though the food is amazing, there are a few things that keep me from giving this place a perfect five stars. The coffee is just okay, and I wasn't a fan of the chocolate croissant. (I mean, come on, chocolate croissants are supposed to be decadent, not meh.)I'm also knocking off a star for the service on the weekends. It can be so slow. I mean, I get it, the place is packed, but I'm not trying to wait 30 minutes for a biscuit.I do order online now though.Overall, A Baked Joint is a great spot for baked goods if you're nearby. But if you're looking for a truly delicious experience, I would recommend going to their sister location, Baked & Wired. The coffee is better, the service is faster, and the baked goods are even more amazing.
Very nice Breakfast spot. Lots of options as well.
I finally tried this place out and it was pretty cool. The food was good and the price was decent. I had the smoked salmon and baked potato soup, both were very tasty. I'll definitely go back again

My co-workers and I didn't want to get out in the cold so we decided to order delivery. My sister-in-law told me about this restaurant last week so we decided to try it. I was nervous at first because I can't stand cold or lukewarm food. I was 100% pleased! My food was still hot upon delivery and it didn't take too terribly long!

Fantastic place, guy. I had an overwhelming craving for a baguette, and I saw that A Baked Joint had a delivery service, so I thought I might order lunch as well! If you're looking to enjoy yourself a little bit at the time of COVID, certainly look at this highly recommended spot.

Thoroughly enjoyed the Pernil (Roast pork) Sandwich I ordered. Kinda small sandwich But It has a lot of meat! Seems like this would be a nice place to enjoy lunch with friends but due to Covid-19 of course, no eating inside. The service was good. The decor was quite nice. Kinda busy that day but it was FAST!
If you haven't checked this spot out, please make sure you do! My friends recommended this place and I was not disappointed.

This was an amazing experience. The scenario here is so peaceful and welcoming. The surroundings are so neat and smell fresh. The detail in the design choice here is absolutely amazing. The baristas her are so polite and welcoming!! I had way too much sugar here than I anticipated I would when I walked in. Amazing variety of junk I must say! But do try the banana pudding with a crust! Not sure that's what it's called, but find that and try it her! Thank me later

I was visiting Washington D.C. recently and found this place for breakfast. They have some of the best biscuits and breakfast sandwiches I've had. The prices are a little steep and it's a come to the counter to grab your food type of place.
Coffee and pastries are always amazing. Service can sometimes be lacking but they are super busy. I love the ice cream sandwiches always get one for me and my husband to share.
Long line for really commodity like coffee but the food was delicious!!! Staff were super friendly also.
This place has tasty treats and feels a lot cleaner than the Baked & Wired location. It's good for a grab and go but not the most comfortable to dine-in.
It has everything you need, close to work so I go often, never disappointed.
Delicious pastries, sandwiches, sweets, and coffee.
Prices are a bit steep, good coffee, good pastries, overall good. I went there with my friends and had a good time.

Used to live right across the street. The place is packed on weekends but not as much during the week. I ordered a ginger tea (delicious) and some banana bread while I got some work done. Unfortunately I had a bit of a rough experience with the staff there (a bit stand-off ish) so hence knocking off a star. I'll be back on a day they are not so busy.

I believe this is the same as the baked cupcakes which I highly recommend. I got the salmon sandwich which was yummy and also an iced teas. It was a good vibe and I could totally see myself doing work here. They also have a good beverage menu with their coffees and teas. A nice relaxing meal!
Great place for coffee and breakfast. Wonderfully and strong coffee. The breakfasts and lunch sandwiches are delicious. The price is slightly overstated, but I'm satisfied.
Such a cool spot with yummy food & drink options!! Great seating options as well as nice food & drink options.

Amazing Meatloaf Sandwich. The seating is comfortable and informal. The menu is creative and the food is great quality. Be prepared to wait a bit, there may be a line. I loved the savory oatmeal. I've never had anything like it before. The coffee is quiet too. I also tried the lemon almond bark, it was fantastic.
This is my new favorite place to grab breakfast from. They will be getting a lot of my money going forward!
My favorite is their quiche. They ran out of the veggie option last time but I enjoyed the meat one nonetheless. Matcha latte was good, get it unsweetened tho. CRazy long wait.
Good coffee with a cool vibe, recommended!

I agreed with my wife that this was an ideal place for brunch as soon as we found out about it right here on Yelp. It's getting decent reviews, and looked like a promising locale that could become our go to for brunch/lunch. Yesterday was me and my wife's first visit here, it seemed charming but I couldn't tell because it was so darn full inside. The biscuit Sammie was a real interesting dish which we both enjoyed, and it goes really well with tea, especially a sweeter kind. It's a little too crowded in here to be able to stay for long and keep your composure, it's just a very loud scene inside and I'm sure that if they switched their layout into a more spacious one it'd instantly feel less crowded.

Great brunch spot, indeed. I love going here with my friends and family. I've been here couple times and service has been really consistent. If you are in the mood for good coffee, decent baked goods, and some deli sandwiches... definitely head in here!
The goat-cheese sammie is the best biscuit sandwich I've ever had.
It is a good place for breakfast, fresh foods and good service, I enjoy myself every time. Sometime, I also pick up my food when I come here.
It is a good place for relax and meeting with my friends, We usually come here when us off duty. Good service and good taste.
This is a tasty place with lots of seating, that's for sure.

This is the sister company of Baked & Wired in Georgetown. The staff were very nice and helpful, and the environment had a very cool feel to it. I had the bacon biscuit with fried organic egg & tomato - excellent! The vanilla latte was also very good. We'll be back soon for sure.
My friend told me about this place and i dropped in last week. The best hot chocolate i have had in awhile
Delicious pastries and baked goods. The space is just a little too big and warehouse-like, but definitely recommended!
I like it but not as much as Baked and Wired which is it's sister restaurant.
The Breakfast was amazeballs!!if you love BF come here, you will not be disappointed!
Love the herb & cheese biscuits!
Been to this a few times now. Its as good everytime. Yummy tummy !
Great coffee and baked goods. Legit spot.
the savory biscuit sandwich with goat cheese was delightful

The espresso here are soooo good! This place is owned by the same people who own baked and wire plus they make delicious sandwiches ! I recommend trying the salmon sandwich...I agree with some of the other reviews that it's a little pricey but worth it for a splurge ever once in a while!
Just do us a favor and get yourself the meat and cheese biscuit or the biscuit sammie.

Staff was very friendly. Food was on point. Everything we samples was very tasty. It was such a great find that we visited twice during our short visit. It does get very busy so if you want to dine in be prepared to wait for a little bit.
Nice vibe, good menu with some healthy options and also some treats, and decent coffee.

A Baked Joint is an absolute gem in DC, and every visit is an extraordinary culinary adventure. Whenever I'm in town, I make it a point to stop by, and there's one dish that I simply can't resist - the crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e French toast. It's nothing short of amazing, a heavenly indulgence that always leaves me craving for more.During my recent visit, I decided to broaden my horizons and explore their menu further. The spicy tuna sandwich was a delightful surprise - the perfect blend of flavors and just the right amount of kick. And then there was the baked potato soup, creamy and comforting, a warm hug on a chilly day. I also savored their meatloaf sandwich, a hearty and satisfying choice.What's truly remarkable about A Baked Joint is their consistent excellence. Every dish I've ever tried here has been exceptional, a testament to their dedication to quality. I can't recommend this place enough

Wow! This place is bustling and lively, but that's part of the charm. We strategized and secured a spot before ordering, and it worked out perfectly. The food and drinks were absolutely delicious, and the value was great. I highly recommend the Smoked Salmon with Scallion Cream Cheese on toasted baguette - it was a delicate delight. The Turmeric and Quinoa bread topped with labneh yogurt, olive oil, za'atar, and lemon zest was a star dish for me. The service from the staff was incredible, and the 80s Pop music added to the fun atmosphere. We left feeling thoroughly nourished and satisfied. Can't wait to come back and try more from their amazing menu!
an offshoot of baked and wired. great vibes and cute pastries. seems like a good place to study. have a lot of the iconic cupcakes from baked and wired

A Baked Joint is an awesome cafÃ© with a prime location and plenty of seating. It's the perfect spot to hang out, work, or catch up with friends. The pastry selection is top-notch, with delicious treats that will satisfy any sweet tooth. What's even better is their commitment to showcasing other small businesses. It's great to see them supporting local artisans and adding a unique touch to the cafÃ© experience. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area!A Baked Joint is a gem of a cafÃ©! It's conveniently located, and you'll never struggle to find a seat. The pastries are incredible, with a wide variety to choose from. But what sets this place apart is their dedication to promoting other small businesses. It's refreshing to see a cafÃ© that actively supports the community. Swing by for a coffee, indulge in a tasty treat, and feel good knowing you're helping local artisans thrive.
Great food and coffee!! Staff friendly and accommodating to customers. Offer a variety of foods and dessert too!
If you're searching for a restaurant that combines elegance with outstanding cuisine, look no further. The dishes are beautifully plated, and the flavors are exceptional. A culinary delight!
Delicious breads and baguettes!

A Delightful Culinary Experience.I recently had the pleasure of dining at a Baked Joint and I must say, it exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I walked through the door, the cozy atmosphere and friendly staff made me feel right at home.To start, I ordered Greek salad, and it was a refreshing explosion of flavors. The crisp lettuce, juicy tomatoes, tangy olives, and creamy feta cheese came together perfectly. The generous portion size left me feeling satisfied and eager for the next course.Next up was the smoked salmon, and I can confidently say it was some of the best I've ever had. Salmon was smoked right, resulting in a delicate smoky flavor. Every bite was delicious.for dessert I've ordered brownie paired with a cup of espresso, it was the perfect ending to an already outstanding meal.Aside from the exceptional food, service was impeccable. Stuff members were attentive, knowledgeable.The ambience at the restaurant added to the overall charm. Nice vibe.Highly recommend to visit.
My favorite place in DC ever ever ever.

Overall: Highly recommend you check-out this place, but arm yourself with patience on sunny, warm days, especially over the weekend, as there might be a line out the door. Tastiness: I have not had a single cupcake, cake, or dessert that I didn't think it was worth the calories (nutritional void). Same goes for their speciality teas (including their cold brewed ones) - they have original combinations I have not encountered in other places.Presentation: A no-frills kind of place.Service: Overall staff is friendly and helpful, but when it's busy it's a good idea to make-up your mind quickly.Ambiance: Casual, simple, relaxed, a great place to see friends for brunch or get some work done. It really depends on when you are visiting, as workdays are more quiet and enjoyable than weekends when there is an issue finding a seat where you can enjoy your breakfast/pastry/coffee in peace.Cleanliness: Clean and neat.Price: Adequate for the ingredients, location, and demand.
Charming and Amazing place with great food and delicious pastries. Can't wait to go back there again...
Great place for meeting and to do work. They also have the best croissants in town.
I bring all my friends who visit DC here! The food is amazing and the atmosphere is perfect!
This is not the first time you guys have saved me. When I'm very hungry and don't want to waste time cooking, I order food here! Thank you!
Definitely worth the hype! Unique options that are so so tasty. Can be very busy on the weekends, but that just shows how yummy it is!
One of my favorite bakeries/cafe's in DC! The goat cheese Sammie breakfast sandwich and spiced chai are my go-tos. 10/10 I recommend
This is the best dispensary I have ever been to. Not just in DC. The staff is so caring and down to earth. I wouldn't go anywhere else! Best gas in DC!
worth the wait. The coffee and food is great. Indoor and outdoor seating!
Always skeptical of a restaurant with nothing by five star reviews but this place absolutely deliver the most amazing breakfast I have had in a very long time
Delicious latte and simple but delicious breakfast sandwich! Cool ambiance too!!!!!!!!

I honestly came here because the name sounded intriguing. However they should really team up with a local cannabis company like Shopnpop or garden dc they are always super friendly.
Excellent bakery. Great selection if yummy treats, salty and sweet. A chip off the old block of baked and wired in Georgetown. They even carry some of bacon wire it's delicious cupcakes. Best in DC
Very busy but breakfast was worth the wait. Dessert choices were also very delicious. Would definitely return.

One of my favorite go to spots in the area. Everything I have had is delicious. My go to is the tuna melt, fresh and delicious!

This restaurant was amazing. Social distancing guidelines were in effect, they had markers on the floor to display the 6 foot distance and outside dining as well. Everything was amazing especially the food and staffs.Would definitely go back!
I like the food the place and the price!
I think the food is all right, and the service is impressive, the price is perfect, the staff is nice. I'm certainly going to come back here again! The five stars for this!
I'm going to have the best meal in this place. Oh, I liked the service. It's very fun and informative. Definitely to return. I have no complaints whatsoever. It's very cool
Everything is great the price is cheap and the food was delicious.

If you're looking for a place you can grab breakfast, lunch, dinner etc, this is it. The meat & cheese is the way to go! It was very fresh and full of flavor. The latte was also delicious. We tried going back on a Sunday morning but the line was a bit long. So I recommend going on a weekday.A great place to chill!

This place is perfect for brunch, but sometimes it's very noisy.The dining place was guaranteed to have a fantastic job during the covid. That made us so excited about it. Not the first cupcaker we've been to, but they're certainly
...the biscuits, the pastries, the chaider!!!
Love the veggie sandwich with hummus and the labneh toast! One of my favorite spots for a quick lunch.
this place is amazing.I would def com back again
Just coming back here for Chai Latte & nutella toast...perfect combi for breakfast. Friendly staff. Recommended.
High quality food very impressed! Will be back again. There was a bit of a wait time but the staff was very attentive
Amazing selection of cookies, cakes and the likes at the entrance. Myriad different seating options, mellow music, not too loud, delicious beverages. A great place to chill

One of the coziest cÃ¡fes I've been. The best bread in town! Nice hot chocolatier, amazing lunch for example the vegan chilling was amazing, I've fallen in love with this cafe. Wish I had more time in DC
one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had!

Great place to drop in for a snack. Good coffee, sandwiches, breakfast fare. It's always crowded so I don't know if I would enjoy sitting down here, nor would I go during prime lunch hour. P.S. This is owned by the same people that own Baked and Wired
WOW. Biscuits..that's all I have to say. I'm sad they don't have a chain in Atlanta :-(

My only complaint is that I am never in Mount Vernon. Otherwise I would go here every single day. Accessible, delicious food. Tasty coffee. Almost everything is made in house. What more could you ask for?
My favorite go to spot for coffee and getting work done without distraction. Sucks they don't have wifi though. Staff were great!
Such a great community place. Recommend their matcha latte and banana bread! Hands down. Support local businesses!!
really good after smoking a joint
Oh My Goodness!!! The breakfast was amazing!!!
The salmon toast was flavorful, and the veggie quiche was light and delicious. There weren't many coffee choices and seating was limited in the morning. Chill urban atmosphere.
I love this place. Food is amazing, people are amazing and service is awesome!
Best coffee and lunch sandwiches!!! Nice ambiente and much space! We will coming again! Highly recommended!!

This is one of the very best place to come out and spoil your soul...lolI have been reading reviews about this place up until i came in to try the food out. I was blown!!! You will never go wrong with any choice on the menu including beverages. I really enjoyed their chamomile lavender tea and the bread. The staff was friendly, accommodating and knowledgeable. Best part is the set up too and the views.
I don't know how oatmeal can be so damn good but it delicious. So so good.

baked goods and pizza. hands up, this place is great. food is always fresh and really good. wide variety to choose and obviously coffee...expect to pay $$ and enjoy how worth the $$ are at this place. simply love it!

This spot is in my top rated of breakfast/lunch spots in Washington DC. At least once every or everyother trip I make sure to visit. The freshly baked bread, will change your bread experience. No premade anything here, I love how fresh everything is. This morning I had the CrÃ¨me BrÃ»lÃ©e French Toast - a classic that is done beautifully. I decided to go with a fresh squeezed orange juice instead of one of their coffee creations this visit. Seriously, you can't go wrong with any choice on the menu, I haven't had one thing I didn't like yet. Can't wait for my next visit, thanks for another excellent experience!
My go to spot to run in and out for breakfast. I may have gain weight but it's well worth it. Gem in DC
another great place to come and eat. food is always great here. prices reasonably fair and you will really enjoy their variety of baked foods.
Loved the food and good customer service.

Food is great and staff very friendly. Would come here more. First time here. Food is fresh, and amazing size portions. Would recommend and tell everyone to come by here. Enjoy the things you can buy to take home also.
Great spot for breakfast pastries.
I would definitely refer to others
It's a great place to go and hang out with friends and family. I was there last week and I absolutely loved it, I'm absolutely coming back first chance I have!
great food great service must return soon
Never been to this place, but it's got a really good name so I'm giving it 5 stars

Such a cool place this was. I went with a friend who was visiting and found A Baked Joint on yelp. When my friend asked if I've ever been I really thought it had something to do with weed lol. Guess not but by the name I think others would feel the same.  The prosciutto sandwich was delightfully scrumptious. Perfectly poached egg with bacon that was just the right amount of crispness.  The OJ was really good too. Freshly squeezed and definitely tasted like it. I will definitely frequent A Baked Joint as much as possible.
The line was out the door! Moved quickly and the food was delicious! Great breakfast spot.

Minus the crazy line that's always here, I LOVE this place. Never disappoints. However, the first time I went they had this muffin donut that to this day I regret not getting because they haven't had it again when I've been.
the breakfast biscuit was delicious

One of my favorite coffee places. All the selections I have tried so far were delicious that is why I keep coming back. You need to try their biscuits. They make them in-house and they are easily one of the best things on the menu. You wont regret it.

Omg I can't get enough of the double chocolate cookies and buy them all out each time I go there. Wow. Thanks. Also the coffee is amazing and I love the cheese quiche. Everything about this place I love. The staff is supreme and loving and caring and kind and the food is so good my friend came from Germany to visit and I took him here. Love this place. Thanks.
Good sandwiches, good coffee also!
Go there! That is all you need to know.
One of the better places to go for a quick delicious brunch. The coffee is awesome and the sandwiches are amazing. They have a good open area outside.

WOW! The Biscuit sammies are AMAZING! Stopped here as we were leaving D.C. thanks to Yelp, and was so glad that we did!!! I want to come back just to have anther Sammie! The egg is baked into the muffin and just the perfect about of done-ness.
Oatmeal is delicious. The food is healthy, the coffee is good. I always come here when in town.
Fantastic food. The line was long when I got here but it didn't take long at all for me to get my food

What a great, modern spot. Don't be deceived by the modern design of this space, most places like this have to overcompensate due to the lack of great food/coffee. This place lives up to its visual expectation. Hade the Biscuit Sammie and iced mocha, both were fantastic.

Best place ever. Fabulous staff. Excellent food and coffee. Gorgeous decor. Love this spot. Try the cappuccinos, matcha iced tea with almond milk, double chocolate cookies and any dessert they have in the case. Also love the vegetarian quiche. Yum!

Never had a bad meal here. Their cold brew is fantastic, doesn't need anything added to it. LOVE the breakfast biscuit sammies, could eat them every day. I've had their ice cream sandwich before- also amazing! Must go!
Good coffee and good food. The baked goods are obviously delicious, but their lunch and dinner options are also very good.
EVERYTHING it good. It is a happy place and I have such a hard time deciding what to get each time bc it is all so good
This place is my jam - get me a chai tea latte and a biscuit sammie any day. Actually though, ANY DAY! The atmosphere/ architecture is also perfect and Tessa, the GM is a gem.
It was much better than I expected. I was happy to see how clean everything was. The food was flavorful, savory, and succulent. 5 stars!
Best place ever. Fabulous staff. Excellent food and coffee. Gorgeous decor. Love this spot.
Great coffee and baked goods! Lunch sandwiches are great.

A cute spot to enjoy your coffee! Cappuccino, espresso, late or cold coffee, no matter what your choice is, they are serving really good coffee! You can smell the blend and the taste is unique! They also offer baked goodies and the atmosphere is really nice too! Helpful and friendly stuff!
Nice meal and friendly staff. Large space to relax with your friends or family.
Just found out what a BLT stands for
Super cool vibe, tons of space, and good food.
Love this place-- and their cinnamon rolls... OH MY GOODNESS!!!!
Really friendly employees! The owners of the two shops (other shop in Georgetown) treat their employees well and it shows!

Long Lines but man do they get you your food fast! I was questioning whether to stop by once when I saw a tremendous line. I took the risk and it paid off! Their breakfast options are great - seriously each and every single one of them - and I must say that their coffee was exactly how I liked it. I'm super duper picky with my coffee. I like my coffee like I do my men...dark and strong, LOL JK. So the first time I went in, I got a good cup of coffee. The second time it wasn't quite up to par. So I asked this super sweet girl who was working there if she could re-make it because I would like for it to be more stronger and she was extremely cooperative and helpful! Overall great place for coffee/breakfast
Excellent coffee and sandwiches. I had the salmon and cream cheese sandwich and it was delicious.

username: Greta With The Great Taste O.
text: Amazing choices!Amazing food!I absolutely recommend this place. Great for breakfast and lunch.Really cool staff! Great atmosphere.

Cute, Clean, and friendly. Fun bites to eat in or take to go. It's a really good assortment of customers and everyone feels welcome. Breakfast/Brunch is a must, but their sandwiches are always delish!
Love love love! My very first time going here

Phenomenal. The prosciutto baguette was to die for! We had heard great things and it definitely lived up to the hype. The bacon cheese and green onion biscuit was fabulous too! I'd go all the time if I lived in the city but I'll definitely be back! If you're a tourist, go! If you're a local, you're lucky!
Great. BLT was amazing. People were nice. Desserts were fantastic.
LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE. Everything about it. Food, coffee, ambience, service. Love it.
Very good but it's sadly becoming too well-known. Line of hipsters nearly out the door on Saturday late morning
A Baked Joint is first rate. great baked goods.
Pizza night is the best--Tuesdays and Fridays!

Looking for a little breakfast, we stop by because the Yelp reviews for their baked goods were solid. It was busy inside, with a clean, bright, hipster kind of vibe with a lot of different places to sit and enjoy a pastry and a coffee.
Coffee's solid and the scones are ridiculously amazing.
Walking into the business there was a sense of warmth and relaxation. I really enjoyed the service and the price was good. The employees were friendly and helpful. I would recommend this to others.
This simply a great coffee shop. Nice clean seating area, plenty of room to do work and or meet someone for date.

My favorite coffee shop in the DC area...and most likely the best breakfast sandwich in the DC area. I take all my out of town guest here.Service is always friendly. Staff looks like they are having fun...and the place is always packed.
This was a wonderful experience. How exciting it was to venture into a great atmosphere where everyone was helpful and delightful. I will always remember this time.
Very cool vibe. Great coffee and pastries :) I highly recommend it :)
This was wonderful. Loaded with excitement and I would definitely return.
I LOVE "A BAKED JOINT".My favorite sandwich is the simple grilled-cheese with a slice of tomato and a scoop of tune.My my my. Takes me peaceful moment.Just delightful and well prepared.
The best coffee, the best bars and cookies, the best staff, and the best cafe in the area. Period.

This place is your quintessential coffee house. They make terrific cappuccinos as well as Smores! I love to go here with friends and spend hours just hanging around and drinking great coffee. The prices are very fair as well. They also have great quiches and everything to my knowledge is made from scratch. I give this place 5 stars
Awesome place. A bit on the expensive side. However, the quality and atmosphere make up for it!

On the search for late night eats I was happy to read online that the kitchen did not close on saturdays until 1am. I arrived with friends around 12:30 and was promptly informed that the kitchen was already closed and the bar was too packed out to sit. The website should be updated to keep folks from coming here. I would be happy to give a better review, i remember this place being good in 2020 but haven't had it since covid

Sad to have to give them a 1 star because i love the food there. One of the bar tenders there is the rudest person in the Sevice industry. Rude face , rude attitude and worse of all when I asked me to get the manager he had the audacity to reply I don't work for you! I can't believe he even has a job!
Very crowded. Service was ok. Nothing special.

Copycat reminds me of the divey, trendy places on St. Mark's Pl in NYC. It has great ambience in slightly tight quarters. I went with a group of friends, I thought the appetizer trays were fun as a novelty, but didn't think the potstickers were that good and tasted like they might be frozen and not homemade. The Dan Dan Noodles were better, they had a nice spicy kick. The highlights were the drinks, I had the Old Fashioned and Bourbon Smash, both were very good. I'd come back for drinks but skip some of the appetizers on the menu. Fun spot.
It was my first time in this facility over the weekend. I loved the pot stickers and super friendly bartenders. I will definitely be coming back again!

Last night I was driving home on an empty stomach. I thought I'd search around on Yelp to find good spots nearby, and these guys caught my attention. I was feeling like Chinese too, so I thought I was in luck. While the food here was awesome, the customer service sucked! I had to wait a full 15 minutes before even being noticed by a waitress, and a further 30 for my skewer platter, which was incidentally quite good. I can't believe I was kept away from such good food for so long.
Food was good. Taste was awesome. Their service was good and staff were punctual with the order. Ambiance was very nice.

Lovedddd the fried rice. A really great time had here by all! We all loved how late the establishment was open and particularly how late the kitchen was opened to. We highly recommend this place! Great service, great food, great time! We will be coming back!
thanks for the good eats! I was pleasantly surprised at the options, and the great service. There isn't much of that these days, so thanks!

The best place for a cocktail. The food isn't bad, but it's also not noteworthy (sorry), but the cocktails and overall experience are well worth a visit.The staff is simply charming. They offer all the necessary help so that you fully enjoy your visit.No matter how busy it gets, the service is always on point, and they know how to create a buzzing atmosphere.
Very good place, I brought my family a couple months ago and everyone enjoyed everything we ordered! Very clean & hot and very delicious
The food and drinks are pretty tasty, but it's way too expensive for what you get.
bao buns and dumplings are suggested, my favorite shrimp and pork. Looks deceptively small from outside, but its got two floors, so its actually quite spacious
Love the lite dishes that you can turn into a much larger meal if you order several dishes.
Fantastic cocktails! I particularly like the Tattletale and the Manchuria. The food is surprisingly cheap, and you won't go wrong with a potsticker sampler.
I like this place, fresh and delicious food, reasonable price but authentic Asian cuisine, so great. good service. thanks.
This place is so nice, I like come here very much. reasonable price but delicious food. like dumpling , bun. They are good for snack.
great cocktails and great food. wish they delivered (food). on wknds it now gets too crowded, and when you have a lot of friends, they end up getting bills mixed up. but still delicious.
hidden gem if you are looking for some nice cocktail and skewers
delicious!

Copycat Co. is my go-to spot for a fun night out. The skewers are delicious, the drinks are creative, and the cozy, laid-back vibe upstairs makes it perfect for hanging out with friends. It's always a good time!Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

Such a good spot for delicious and unique cocktails. We didn't get food but it all looked amazing and others were raving about it. Our bartender Joe was really great! Atmosphere was wonderful. A dark cozy space and more crowded with limited first come first serve seating, important to keep in mind. Probably a better place to come with a small group or for a date night.

This spot on H St Corridor is hands down my favorite. The drinks, service, and food consistently impress. The ambiance is wonderfully moody with dim lighting and great background music. I always opt for the vegan version of the beef noodles, which are consistently flavorful and delicious. The bartenders are not only friendly but also knowledgeable, offering excellent recommendations. I appreciate that they maintain an accessible archive of past menus, allowing guests to order from a wide range of drink options. Despite its small size and the place sometimes getting crowded, outdoor seating and an extra bar on the back patio provide additional space.

Definitely had an amazing time while I was there! I went solo and still enjoyed myself between watching the bartenders do their thing to the drinks themselves. The bartenders made sure I felt comfortable and even made sure my drink was covered if I had to step away really quickly. Will definitely be back!
The drinks were fantastic, with the bartender crafting something new and exciting for me each time. The food was equally delicious!
Delicious food! Cute space with great staff. Very busy so be prepared to wait but totally worth it!! Can't wait to go back
best Chinese food in DC .delicious and cheap. Service is good. Fast to get the food. very comfortable place to enjoy dinner
I will be recommending your establishment.
Stephan was our server and bartender. He was PHENOMENAL! He provided excellent recommendations, entertained our conversation, and was overall pleasant to be around. Thank you, Stephan!

Probably one of my favorite places in dc, it's too dark for photos but it's quite and intimate the food is amazing and the drinks are out of this world. They are cocktail only but if you can't figure out what you want you can talk to them and let them know liquor of choice and fast profiles their mules are out of this world I didn't know there where so many kinds. But once again the beef and lamb skewers and the lamb soup I literally dream about

This is a hidden gem! Seriously one of the most enjoyable bar food experiences in a long time... My only calm with this place is that it's so good and attracts such a awesome crowd that it's outgrown it's humble shell and really needs to look into a bigger location because it's pretty cramped in there.. however it's totally worth it regardless! The food is spectacular and the cocktails are phenomenally delicious.. my compliments to the chef, the mixologist, management and the entire staff
Great cocktails and great dumplings.
Cool place, seriously good food and I love the name. Be a copy cat, and go.
Great service location and foo. This is our go to spot for sure. We love it and highly recommend this place.
The night life is fun and nice. Everything about this place is a great place to get a drink and food. I would recommend any one to go here.
The chicken skewers are oh so well seasoned! Pork bun is just ok, but hits the spot. My favorite part though, is how clean the place is, and the friendly service.

Service is excellent. Food is terrific. Cocktails are delicious, and strong!Bartenders are professional and experts in their craft. It's a pretty busy and noisy place, but I'm fine with that. 5/5 would consume products again.

good place fr a chinese food in the area .Came here with a friend around 9p on a Tuesday night. we ordred spicy lamb skewer. small dine in area. pretty quite i like this place probably will go back there
OMG. Give me all the Gimlets!!! #life/gamechanger
Serves was good food was great and different from your usual late night bar food spots. This is definitely a must go!! Great atmosphere also!!
Loved Copycat - Can't wait to go back!
I love this place! Awesome drinks and small plates coupled with good music makes it a great place for drinks with friends!
This was a wonderful experience. How exciting it was to venture into a great atmosphere where everyone was helpful and delightful. I will always remember this time.

Sincerely amazed by how tasteful and authentic the skewers are. It's juicy, full of flavor, meaty, and actually remind me about the halal skewers we have back in Xi'an, China (the best skewers in the world!). Here they really know the secret for making skewers tasty: cumin and red hot chilly pepper. And they used the original spices instead of the powders which immersed the flavor in the mouth. I would give it a 10 stars if I can. Strongly recommend!!!
Best dumplings. Simple menu because they don't do anything they don't know. Surprised the veggie dumplings are actually my favorite.

l o v e      l o v e            l o v e                  l o v e                         l o v e                                l o v e                                      l o v espicy lamb skewers / spicy beef skewers ... the most friendly & the coolest bartenders on H ... great to finally have an Asian speakeasy here in DC (beside 2birds on 14th) Hails to the fabulous Gin Fizz & the Daiquiri shooters!! see you soon copycat! cheers!!
They are very friendly and food is so delicious and very good pricey!!

I like this place. The upstairs bar is small but nice and comfortable for a date. The menu is uniquely designed as if it was hand drawn and written. The food is conveniently priced for small portions. You have the choice of dumplings, bao or skewers. I tried the bourbon and the apple toddies. They were a little on the sweet side but add some more lemon and they were better.
I'm in love I'm in love I'm in love love love. The drinks are amazing, the bartenders are so good at their jobs and it is only a couple blocks from home! What could be better?

I highly recommend this place to anyone that likes great whiskey cocktails! (They do tequila, rum, gin, and vodka, but I'm more of a whiskey guy.) I recommend the bourbon Rickey for anyone that loves lime. The whiskey sour with egg white is a great default.As for food, the beef skewers are juicy and flavorful. Get it spicy if you want some extra kick. The dumplings are awesome with their dipping sauce. (It's like soy sauce with superpowers.)With such a specialized good menu, you can order one of each to see what you like!
Permanently closed as of Jan 28 2023 according to the sign on the door. Oh well. Too bas
Great food, atmosphere and options. I only went once pre-pandemic but would definitely go again.

Although not all vendors are opened during this soft opening phase, The Block in DC still offers some good options for food like tasty sandwiches and awesome ramen. Much like their other establishments in Rockville and Annandale, the one in DC has a nice ambiance and an attractive layout. So far it's kept very clean, and I noticed plenty of hand sanitizers for customer-use. The bar inside seems to be opening soon too, so I'm excited for what's to come!
Don't like the food is not a 100 percent Peruvian foodDon't recommend this place ...........

The ambiance is amazing, decoration and vibe are on point. However, I was a little disappointed by the food I ordered. I got the aji de gallina and the sauce and rice were completely tasteless, there was no flavor whatsoever. The plate did not represent the exquisite Peruvian cuisine.

Food was fantastic, drinks were overpriced for their size and contents. Service was slow at times, especially getting the bill as our waiter seemed to forget about our table for almost an hour. Food portions were perfect and all came out together and hot. The option for outdoor seating was very enjoyable on a cool late summer evening.Food: 5/5 | Service: 4/5 | Atmosphere: 4/5

First time hear and Carlos provided an astounding experience. We were greeted and educated on the history of the spot along with an extensive overview of the menu with suggestions. Everything we ordered was great and all our drinks were really good as well. The dÃ©cor and food was great but the customer service experience from Carlos was 10 stars. Thanks and will definitely be back!
Beautiful and high energy ambiance, outstanding lomo saltado and pescado a lo macho. Skip the cocktails - not worth it. Staff seems overwhelmed at times. Must try.
The restaurant has a very artistic vibe and it's a wonderful place for brunch. However, the cleanness perspective should have been handled better

There's something magical about a restaurant that manages to blend incredible food, expertly crafted cocktails, and a relaxed, inviting atmosphere. This spot is a hidden gem for those who love flavorful Peruvian cuisine paired with a dining experience that feels effortlessly cool. Whether you're planning a first date, celebrating a special occasion, or just want a laid-back night out, this place sets the perfect tone.The ceviche is undeniably the star of the show. Fresh, vibrant, and packed with flavor, it's a dish that keeps people coming back. One couple even mentioned they couldn't stop until the entire plate was gone--and that's exactly the kind of indulgence this restaurant inspires. Pair it with one of their signature craft cocktails, and you've got a combination that's hard to beat.The space itself is designed to impress. The dim lighting creates a cozy, intimate vibe, ideal for date nights or casual evenings with friends. As you step inside, you're greeted by stylish dÃ©cor and an ambience that transitions seamlessly from dinner to late-night lounging. A DJ curates the mood, spinning a mix of tunes that range from club vibes to beats that make you want to sway in your seat.For those who like to keep the good vibes going after a night out, consider visiting Pull Up DC, the premier cannabis delivery service in the area. Known for providing high-quality, top-shelf products, it's the perfect way to extend the relaxed, feel-good atmosphere of the evening. Imagine unwinding after a flavorful dinner with something equally premium, delivered straight to your door.If you're planning a special celebration, this restaurant has you covered. Guests have raved about how accommodating the staff are for birthdays and events. One group noted that the team went above and beyond to make the night memorable, complete with a surprise birthday drink for the guest of honor. It's these thoughtful touches that elevate the experience from a simple dinner to a moment worth cherishing.While some have experienced slower service during peak times, the bar staff consistently earns high praise for their quick and friendly service. Sitting at the bar can often feel like an exclusive experience, where the bartenders craft drinks with care and precision.The menu extends beyond the ceviche, offering standout dishes like lomo saltado, gambas, burrata, and indulgent rice dishes. The flavors are bold and satisfying, with each bite reflecting the heart of Peruvian cuisine. And don't skip dessert--it's the perfect way to end the meal on a sweet note.What's truly remarkable about this place is its versatility. During the day, it transforms into a casual cafÃ©, serving lunch and coffee options that make it a great spot to unwind. By night, it evolves into a sultry dining destination with an energy that's equal parts chill and chic.If you're searching for a place that delivers unforgettable flavors, a warm yet sophisticated vibe, and a touch of nightlife energy, this restaurant checks all the boxes. And if you're looking to complement the evening with a premium, relaxing finish, Pull Up DC has you covered with its outstanding cannabis delivery service.Come hungry, bring good company, and prepare to be swept away by the magic of Peruvian cuisine and a perfectly curated evening experience.
I knew nothing about Peruvian food and was exposed to their wonderful culture. The food was amazing I really recommend their pulled pork dish. Thank you!!

Lomo Saltado, a famous Peruvian culinary dish, is easily available at El Secreto De Rosita. It's delicious, featuring a lively stir-fry that includes tender beef, juicy onions, ripe tomatoes and an array of delicious flavours.

The food here is so good, I had the gnocchi with ribeye and it was on of the best gnocchi I ever had. The service was amazing, the staff were very attentive to every detail, and the location is very pretty if you wanna get that insta pic. You will definitely not regret eating here!
Food is just great, service is awesome and the place has history and a very nice environment. Perfect spot for a date, family dinner or a fun time with friends. Can't wait to go again.

Food is great and the service is awesome! Specially Daniela and Christian! She served us soooo well and he is amazingly talented Cheff! clearly they run the extra mile to make customers happy! felt like home! thanks so much

I'm new to the DC area and El Secreto De Rosita absolutely blew me away. The restaurant specializes in Peruvian food and the ambiance is so beautiful. We sat at the bar and the bartenders were so cheerful and helped us understand the menu. They even let us sample pisco which is a special Peruvian liqueur. We happened to be sitting next to the owners who are beautiful inside and out. They were so hospitable and they showed us around the restaurant and how all their decor was from their Ecuadorian and Jordanian heritage . The owners wife even gave me one of her bracelets that is a combination of both her and husbands cultures. Everything is so local, freshly made and there is just so much culture to appreciate. The flavors of everything are so amazing and I just can't say enough good things about the place. You MUST go when visiting DC or if you are just looking for new and refreshing flavors to try!!

Came here for dinner and drinks. The mezcal last word is really tasty and overall the drinks are nice and strong. The food I thought was decent, an okay place to try some Greek food. I had the chicken kebab and I wish they had more vegetables! It was an overwhelming amount of chicken and not enough flavor for me but I did love the veggies. My friends had a rack of lamb they devoured and their burger which was just average. If the restaurant is busy it gets loud but it is conveniently close to the metro. Would come here again for drinks especially if not at a busy hour.Food: 4/5 | Service: 4/5 | Atmosphere: 3/5

Went for my Birthday Dinner and loved every second of it! They were extremely accommodating with our reservation since we didn't all show up at once and that was a bonus. Our server was amazing and made sure we had everything we needed at all times. If I could, I would have shook the chief's hand because the food was a 20/5. Also, the dÃ©cor was really inviting and gave a slightly upscale feel! All and all I highly recommend this hidden gem!
It was good but not as superb as I'd thought Med food.
Hello, Great service , great ambiance, great atmosphere, thank you very much, great food

The Live Burger was amazing and the food variety for Raw Vegans was just something I've never seen before. The service was great and helpful, answering all my questions, but I really loved the island feel of the restaurant and the ambiance of the place.
We loved it. It was amazing. I highly recommend this place. George is amazing phenomenal human being.
Great dining experience. Everything was delicious. Our server was great and the environment was great for my birthday.
I'm a regular here and I just love their food :)

Really one of the best Mediterranean food restaurants in DC area. Papparadelle with mushrooms was fantastic. Cauliflower was crispy, lamb chops was delicious. Also warm bread as a freebie really can make a dish. Greek menu options are good too, feta cheese is something special here.
A great place.  good menu, good service.  Very pleasant set up.  Enjoyed everything about it.  I'll be back.
Nice atmosphere, but the menu did not have any depth to it. Would fine there again though.
I had the lamb, my wife had the salmon. Both were excellent as was the calamari appetizer and the cocktails.

We loved this place so much we ate here twice during our 4 day stay in DC!It does not matter what you order, it's ALL good! We were a party of 6, in at a weird time 3:00 on a Friday and we were the only ones in there. We ordered several appetizers and had some wine and the staff was wonderful. I don't think I've ever had greek wine before, but their S. Blanc / Cab combo is what we ordered both times.We came back 2 days later for dinner (the waitress remembered us AND our drink orders from the first visit), and again had some delicious food. Just order what you normally like and you won't be disappointed.I'd say we were a little under dressed on a Saturday night, in shorts coming in from walking around the city all day. Most of their patrons looked like they were dressed for date night. Regardless, they seated us and treated us kindly.I would absolutely return!

Great local spot right down the road from the white house. Friendly staff and manager personally sat us and visited for few minutes. Have to try the feta cheese and honey app! Unreal!! I got the salmon and my gf got the lamb burger both really tasty. Will defiantly visit again when visiting DC.
This spot is the place to go for a relaxing delicious meal. Great selections of wine and perfectly cooked meal.

A couple of friends and I went to this place for dinner last Saturday night. The food was AMAZING! We order the pork belly, kefte, honey feta for appetizers . Kefte was so tasty. I had the NY strip Medium Rare and it was cooked to perfection. I was impressed from the quality of the meat vs the price. My friend had the Seafood Pasta and she was so impressed by it. Our server was on point! She was very attentive and all her recommendations were excellent.There were a couple of groups towards the back of the restaurant and they seem to enjoy theirselves a lot.Great decor and excellent vibe. Absolutely I will be back with friends and a date.!!! STRONGLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!

American Cuisine is on point. Mazi has great menu options and Really good pastries . I came here with the family not long ago and the owner was present the day we came , he was going around the tables and helping out the busy employees. We had a great experience overall the good was magnificent , outstanding plates and flavors very very good. The location is located in the downtown it tends to get busy from time to time but honestly is worth the time if you dont have reservations.
best veal ever hands down..........
This place is amazing!!! Best bar in town hands down. This is an amazing place to eat and drink!

I had high hopes for a pleasant dining experience at Barcelona restaurant, but unfortunately, our visit was marred by a series of disappointments. Despite having a prior reservation, the staff at the door insisted we couldn't be seated until our entire party arrived. Even after explaining our situation, with a couple arriving with a newborn and requesting an outside seat, our plea was disregarded, and the staff showed a lack of concern. Once everyone was present, including the newborn, the insistence on confirming our presence was accompanied by rude behavior when we explained the child couldn't enter.To add to the dismay, upon finally being seated, our table was adorned with dirty dishes, and two of our ordered plates never made it to our table. This level of service was profoundly disappointing and arguably one of the worst experiences I've encountered in years. The disregard for our situation and the subsequent issues with the service greatly detracted from what could have been an enjoyable dining experience.
Arrived 7 minutes before my reservation. Waited for more than 60 minutes after my reservation.

Do not come here on a Saturday night. We had a reservation from weeks before and still had to wait to be seated. And then they sat us next to the bar instead of the dining room and it was super loud and drunk people were trying to sit on our seats. Then the waitress comes and we told her we still had to look over the menu, then she disappears for a while. At this point we just gave up and left and did not order anything. No way the atmosphere and the way the night went would have been pleasant for us to stay and actually have the dinner. My advice is: prioritize reservations and give us seats from the dining area and not next to the bar with bunch of drunk people wandering into our space/seats.
Shit service gave away table mean lalalalalalalalalalalalalallalalaallalalallqlqlqlqÂ­lalaallalalalalalllqlalqlqlqlalalqlqlqlalalql

My friend and I got there around 7 PM on July 13th, 2021. We were told there is a 45 minutes to an hour wait by a rather rude reservation attendant. We went into the bar and after about an hour, I stepped out to ask if our table is ready. The rude black woman told me to go back and wait and they will tell me when our table is ready. We waited another half our and I went out to ask again. She told she had text me and didn't get response for three minutes and gave our table to someone else. Not even a simple sorry. I asked how long to get another table and she told me it will be a while. Extremely rude. I don't see myself going back there with this type of a person working there. A simple smile would have gone a long way.

Do not come here if you have more than 3 people. We made a reservation a week out. We arrived on time. EVERYONE in my party had to wait huddled by the door for 30 minutes. Just did not seem prepared organized or happy. Ruined my birthday celebration. I also heard this happened to my friend last time as well.

I must say, your food is amazing and drinks are good as well. However, your service leaves much to be desired. There was this one server named Shatericka who took my order last time I was there. She was extremely condescending and only came to our table to ask if we were done and if we were tipping. Not only was she condescending but when she gave me the wrong order (I ordered Spinach Chickpea Cazuela and instead got Tapas) she rolled her eyes and scoffed as if it was my fault.I understand if you're having a bad day but please don't take it out on someone that is ordering from your establishment and tipping you. Speaking of, when I tipped her (paid gratuity) she had the audacity to ask me "Is that it?"I am letting you all know that as a result of her service, or lack thereof, I will never be coming back to eat there.You have to watch how you treat people.Other than that, the food was great.

If you want to be ignored throughout your dining experience this is the place to go! Have been numerous times and for some reason the service at this restaurant never improves. Was here once and ordered drinks, we received our drinks after about 35 minutes. We wanted to then order more drinks and food, we waited for our waiter we tried to flag down a different waiter for almost 55 minutes. After waiting 55 minutes I literally called the host stand from my cell phone to ask if our server would be coming back anytime soon. Once that happened we had the service from everyone including manager, but it should never get to that point. The food is good and the drinks are good but if you want the same food and drink quality and service that is actually service, go to the Barcelona in Cathedral heights.
Disappointing
Racist manager just referred to me as "madam". When I said I prefer not to be called that, he said I could leave if I don't like it...So we did... Snobby underdressed manager.. No thank you!

Why all the hype? It's not that good. The food is forgettable and the staff rude and incompetent, Slow, surly and clueless. Please know the ingredients and preparation of a dish when asked. Don't roll your eyes and think, "how ignorant"! REMINDER: I can afford to eat here, you are working here. See the correlation? Yes, we know, you are an aspiring actor in a third rate theatrical production in a back alley theatre, but right now, you are my server!

This was my second time at Barcelona wine bar which has solidified my opinion that it has decent atmosphere and drink options, but is quite average for a tapas place. Food - We ordered the following:- Lobster croquettes- Patatas bravas- Boquerones- Prawns- Charcuterie with Jamon, Mahon, Cana de cabra - Paella Mariscos half order- Hangar steak pintxos- Focaccia- grilled gem lettuceThe good: The hangar steak pintxos, prawns, charcuterie The "meh": Lobster croquettes (couldn't tell there was lobster), boquerones (not my favorite, not bad), paella mariscos (very salty), patatas bravas (also very salty) The ugly: Focaccia (cold, dense, and stale - do not order), grilled gem lettuce (never received!), the service Food was very average and over salted - I wouldn't come back here again. Service - Not great, our waiter wasn't paying much attention throughout the experience. First, he very nonchalantly dropped off our charcuterie board, left it sitting on our table for a minute or so, and before any of us could touch it, picked it back up and gave it to another table(???) He then brought the two people he gave our board a second charcuterie board, then gave us an identical board to the first a little later. He also never collected our menus, which mostly took up space on the very small table. Lastly, we never received our grilled gem lettuce (which we didn't realize until after). Not sure if we were charged for that. Overall, would not return - sangria was good though.

Ive been to a few locations but this barcelona is definitely different in that it becomes more of a bar than a restaurant. I had a reservation but they were so crowded we had to wait an hour before they seated us. A younger crowd for sure.

COVID has made a lot of things more difficult, especially eating out. But this place has made it easier than ever. I order directly at the register then they bring the food to the table. Interaction is little to none. Although the condiments are not out in the open, they were easily to obtain. Efficient and great food.
soooooo crowded! Haven't had this many people in my personal space since before I was born, as a triplet.

Great service, average food (I only tried 5 of about 40 items), and white sangria that could be listed as a non-alcohol drink. Ordered a pitcher of Traditional White Sangria, the pitcher is large and fills about 7 or 8 glasses. Pitcher arrived after about 30 minutes, they must have been making it per order (no time for the fruit to infuse the sangria). My wife drank only two glasses because she said it didn't taste very good. Since I couldn't taste any alcohol I casually finished off the pitcher. I normally can feel two glasses of wine, but after drinking 5-6 glasses of this sangria I noticed no effects. The price is great for the pitcher of Sangria, about $26, but you just get a marginally refreshing drink that in my opinion contains maybe a cup or two of weak wine at best. The atmosphere is nice and trendy with a friendly crowd at the bar.
Packed !
Good service! Nice food. Brunch does not have much options though.
Fun atmosphere.Tapas good eats. Wine list decent. Wine guy helpful !

I went here last night with some friends. I feel that this place definitely has a lot of potential but there are a few kinks that needs to be work out too. First off, this place is crazy packed so trying to come here for happy hour with a group is definitely not recommended. They have a beautiful outdoor seating area so at some point, perhaps off hours, I would like to come back and check that out.My friends and I ordered a few dishes to try, my favorite was the the truffle oil skirt steak. My least favorite is the garlic shrimp, it was way too sweet! If they redo that dish, I would be a total fan.
The food was okay, but the ambieance was excellent.
Always full, especially on weekends where the bar area is impossible to sit in. great small plates, dishes but be worn even if you reserve a table you could be waiting for an hour for it.

Barcelona Wine Bar was a great overall dining experience with excellent food and an extensive wine selection. The patatas bravas, brussels sprouts, and steak Paillard were all standout dishes that I would highly recommend. The service was fast, despite the restaurant seeming a bit understaffed at times. The atmosphere was lively and vibrant, with a packed bar area that almost felt like a nightclub. It was so crowded in the bar area that it was hard to move around, but the energy was electric. While the packed atmosphere made it a little too noisy for a romantic date night, it would be a great spot for a night out with a big group. Overall, I would definitely return to Barcelona Wine Bar in the future, but perhaps on a less crowded night or with a larger party so that I can fully enjoy the atmosphere and the excellent food and drink.
Wine wine wine wine, good people and music
If you love Wine then this is a must place to visit in DC!

Very popular, great food and good service. Recent Saturday night 9pm reservation our party of five waited for an hour at the bar for our table. The place was packed, both the restaurant and bar. Finally made it to our table, placed our order and the drinks arrived.
