A minute later the manager came over and said our drinks were on the house and apologized for the long wait despite the reservation. WHAAAAT?I have never, in my many decades of going to restaurants have a manager come over and provide complimentary anything without prodding! Hats off to Barcelona and a manager who clearly wants to ensure EVERY customer is satisfied, and given the fact it has been packed every time I've been there he could have easily have not taken the time or initiative...they're not hurting for business! Great experience all the away around and excellent food too.
Good fine & wine but VERY loud and crowded on a recent Saturday night.

The ambiance and bustling business every night at Barcelona is what draws you in - and then the food is just as good too. The only reason I don't give it a five star is that we did the all you can eat option, and in that we felt that we were a little skimped on the better dishes and were brought out a bunch of patatas bravas when the table looked empty. Besides that, Barcelona is a favorite!
It is more expensive than I have expected. It should be shown with the 3-dollar sign.

Absolutely loved this place! Great atmosphere and service. My friend has Celiac disease and can't eat gluten. The waiter was able to navigate the menu for us. We could eat the grilled octopus 7 nights a week! Would highly recommend.
Good selection of tapas. It was crowded when we got there but we were seated right away despite not having a reservation. The waitress was helpful and the food delicious.
This is a good place. I would recommend.
good food and very cool vibe - very busy though
Great drinks and friendly staff.

We got 2 croquettes (my favorite in here) patates bravad and empanadas. It was okay for 4 people. We didnt get full by the food but we got full thanks to the 2 pitchers of sangrias. servers were super nice this time unlike my previous visits. The place is just too loud to have conversations

One of the best restaurants in DC, but the service is a little slow due to their large crowd. They also pack the place beyond it's capacity, so being by the bar is the equivalent of being packed like a sardine. I recently went with a group of 6 for dinner, split a few bottles of wine and charcuteries (the server did a great job of recommending which wines paired best with certain foods). All in all, it's a landmark restaurant on 14th St, I just think they need to consider hiring more food runners and servers, and be a little more cognizant of how small the bar space is for the crowd they try to accommodate.
Great place, nice location, servise was just fine, food yuummmmyyy! A lots of wines, lovely patio, good organization in the restaurant, all the staff doing their best! 4+

I was here just a few times, it was amazing every single time. Great place, lovely patio, service was just ok, food was yummy. Had opportunity to talk with one of the managers, he was so polite an friendly, couldn't remember the name. 4+
Delicious!!
Went to Barcelona many times in the last 8 years or so, last time in June 2012. The place is always busy which can mean it is either overrated or actually good. I go with the second option.

I went for the first time with my cousin few years ago and fell in love with this place! Since, I try to come when near downtown. I've brought most my friends and family and they all love it. Every time I come I try to order something different and so far, never been disappointed with anything on the menu. Definitely a place you have to try.
Good place

Barcelona is near my condo so so I've gone a few times. I can say I like brunch as much as I like cocktails and tapas. Service has always been good, even when it's hopping, which is why I prefer to sit by the bar. Although when I go with a date I try to sit outside since it's more romantic. Good wine list. We always ask for advice on what to order and find the pricing to be pretty good with the small plates.

On a Friday evening, this place had more beautiful women than a yoga retreat offering free Lululemon gear. That's a plus, of course, unless you have short attention span in which case you'll leave with a stiff neck. Fair warning.Food-wise, it was mostly very good. The patatas were excellent, as commented by the many reviewers here. We were not impressed by both the calamari and the hanger steak (poorly cut, little flavor), but the figs absolutely saved the day. Just order them.The service was pretty good too, though it was thoroughly embarrassing to see these new waiters just thrown in and have no clue about any of their dishes or drinks. That said, we got the most attentive service one can imagine. I'd say it's a great place to go munch on a few tapas with friends, grab a few early drinks, and then go off to a real dinner.

Barcelona! I soooo enjoy the two times I've come to visit , each time as a walk-in, and the place is amazingly vibrant and a magnificent scene. I've enjoyed the marvelous Spanish-style tapas: bravas, empanadas, spinach/chickpea casserole, hanger steak...all those and more! I have been supremely impressed by the venue, the music, the food, the staff...in not necessarily in that order. Which makes it really difficult to write what I'm about to write now.I was in last night for dinner with the visiting family of a dear friend here in Washington, DC. They are European and get t\o our city maybe once a year. They are very well-traveled (like most Germans!) and love it when we find new and exciting restaurants to take them to. Barcelona was a natural for this dinner.There were four of us and we were seated in the area located in the rear of the restaurant closest to the restrooms. Or server was Christina working with fellow servers Mark and Chris. It was a very busy night even for a Tuesday, and the room was packed. We were being taken care of quite well. Christina was delightfully attentive, without being intrusive, Mark was all over the place it seems filling water glasses and clearing plates with great skill. Chris was focused on a line of tables and was slightly bumbling. He never had a need to approach our table, however.Here's the crux of my review.Mark went to the bar to apparently retrieve drinks. He had explained to us very casually that he was a back waiter supporting the two front waiters Christina and Chris. I thought this a great concept and it seemed to be working very well as Christina and Chris were preoccupied with getting tables jump-started with Mark providing superlative support to them both
Small patio, but worth it if you can get a seat.

I absolutely love this place! Six different tapas all of which were delish. The lamb is so tender it melts in your mouth. The only reason they dont have a five star is because the service was slow and at that time of day(just after it opened) it wasn't crowed. I will be back in the future.

Love the ambiance, the bartenders and waiters are suuuuuuper friendly and nice, the music is just perfect and the food....oh the food is just a ticket to some Spanish-influenced Heaven. I'd recommend their amazing paella with seafood and....and...THEIR BREAD WITH OLIVE OIL. I swear, it is the best olive oil I've ever had in my life, and the bread is nice and hot (because they bake it right there). Try it and love it!
Excellent. Way better than Jaleo !!

We arrived and were put on the wait for a table. Seated at the bar, we were enjoying our wine recommended by our bartender. He was very pleasant and had a great smile. We were bothered though, by the bartender next to him bragging to yet another bartender of how many girls' numbers he had gotten so far that night. Creepy!When we were seated our server did a great job and the food was excellent.We loved the decor and the outside patio area will be an amazing place to dine once the weather gets nicer. It was full with people last night even though it was cold out.

I heard great things about this restaurant so I decided to check it out for myself last night. Me and my wife arrived and saw that there was a long wait for a table so we decided to go to the bar. The bartender mike was way too pushy trying to get our order. We got lucky when two spots opened up at the far end of the bar. We met max, another bartender, who's never ending smile became contagious. His personality and positive happy energy really made the experience for us. His suggestions for food and wine couldn't have been more perfect. Service was excellent even though the place was packed. We will be coming back very soon!
wait staff was awesome!

We went there on Wednesday .. We had a great time. Food and service was good. Great ambiance and good taste of music in the bar lol. Definitely recommend whether just having drinks and chillin or for dining.
great food, drinks, space.

You know, I've been places that f*** up tapas. And I just don't understand that. You don't have to worry about that here. Probably one of the best tapas places in DC-not just tasty but a variety of tapas at normal, human prices. And I'd be remiss not to mention that outdoor space where you can fall in love. I like to feel important and this place does it for me.

I had the best time at Barcelona on 14th street today. Some friends and I are visiting from San francisco. We had amazing servers , they recommended many wines and food for us and it was the best time ever. The ambiance was everything, from the music to how packed the bar and dinning room was. The servers say it's slow but kudos to them for handling it all so well and with class. Jorge is one of the managers there and made sure we were good the whole time, he was amazing as well as the servers. We will definitely be back !!!!
Fantastic food and the staff is wonderful. Pretty sure we ate one of everythin the menu and were not disappointed!

It is a busy spot and the wait time even with reservation can be a little bit annoying but the vibe, wine list and food are worth it for a fun night with friends. I loved the paella and also the churros. Definitely would come back!

This tapas bar is an absolute gem, a delightful culinary experience that combines the best of Spanish flavors with creative cocktails to tantalize your taste buds. I always go to the Dallas location, and had to try this one out!Let's start with the star of the show - the sangria! This is the best sangria I've ever had. It's fruity, refreshing, and perfectly balanced. The wine is of excellent quality, and the mix of fruits adds a delightful twist. It's the ideal drink to pair with the tapas and sets the tone for a fantastic meal.The burrata dish is a heavenly creation. Creamy, rich, and served with a delightful beet sauce, it's a mouthwatering masterpiece. The texture and flavor are on point, and it pairs wonderfully with the crusty bread. If you love burrata, you won't be disappointed.The tapas menu is a treasure trove of flavors. Each dish is a delightful surprise, from the classic patatas bravas to the inventive dates wrapped in bacon. The quality and authenticity shine through in every bite. Whether you're a seafood lover or prefer vegetarian options, there's something for everyone.For coffee and cocktail enthusiasts, the espresso martinis are a must-try. They're rich, strong, and expertly crafted. The perfect blend of coffee and liquor with a frothy top - they're a great way to end the meal on a high note. And you can choose if you want it with baileys or notThe ambiance is cozy and inviting, with friendly staff that's knowledgeable about the menu and always ready to make recommendations. It's perfect for a date night or a gathering with friends. The only downside is that it can get a bit crowded during peak hours, so consider making a reservation in advance.
Wonderful wine selection and extremely good food! It's a regular for me any day I've time to relax & eat a good meal!

Some friends and I had the pleasure of dining at Barcelona Restaurant in DC, and it was absolutely enjoyable from start to finish. From the moment I walked in, I was struck by the clean and cool atmosphere that exuded an inviting charm.The menu at Barcelona is a culinary masterpiece. Each dish has unique flavors that take your taste buds on a journey through Spain. The food was not only delicious but also beautifully presented, a true testament to the chef's artistry.And let's not forget the artisan drinks! The cocktail menu is a work of art in itself, featuring unique and creative concoctions that perfectly complemented our meal. Whether you're a fan of classic cocktails or adventurous spirits, Barcelona has something for everyone.What truly sets Barcelona apart, though, is the exceptional service. The staff was attentive, knowledgeable, and genuinely passionate about ensuring our dining experience was nothing short of perfection.If you're looking for a memorable dining experience in the heart of DC, Barcelona Restaurant is an absolute must-visit. It's the perfect place to indulge in delectable food, savor artisanal drinks, and soak in a chic and welcoming ambiance. I can't wait to return and explore more of their culinary delights.

Great food! Great atmosphere! Great service! Diego was our server. He was polite and pleasant and kept the drinks flowing! Brian, the manager, checked on us several times to make sure we were good. I'll come back because of the top notch customer service! Thank you

Barcelona Wine Bar is a gem in DC, offering not only exceptional food but also a great ambiance. We visited on a Wednesday and were pleasantly surprised by the weekend atmosphere. The service was attentive and kind, and the general manager, Carlos, provided excellent food and drink recommendations. We can't stop thinking about their cheesecake! The tapas we tried were absolutely delicious, and the staff accommodated our allergies by guiding us through the menu. From the red wine and patatas bravas to the spiced beef empanadas and veggie paella, everything was packed with flavor. The service was attentive, and I highly recommend trying their jamÃƒÂ³n and manchego croquetas and the paella mariscos
Great Service, Atmosphere and Food.
Amazing food, amazing atmosphere!! Kind and excellent serving. So crowded on weekends
Perfect place to get together for good food and drinks.
The paella here is consistently good and they have some of the best sangria.

I was here just a few times, it was amazing every single time. I've brought most my friends and family and they all love it. Every time I come I try to order something different and so far, never been disappointed with anything on the menu. Definitely a place you have to try.
Tasty, nice atmosphere, and good waiters.
This will always be one of my favorite tapa spots in the city. I love and order just about everything here -- it's so amazing!
1000000% recommend! Everything was so yummy! And the staff was so nice and helpful with great recommendations.
Tasty tapas at a decent price. I've been here a few times and have never been disappointed.

My biggest thanks goes to REMOTE REPAIR CREDIT SERVICES for bringing me out of shame. I'm a mother of 3 kids,I lost my husband 2years ago. He left me and my kids with a lot of debts, student loans, medical bills, tax liens and evictions. The little business I was managing to help my family with was going down, so I called my sister who lives in North Carolina, she introduced me to this Credit Specialist. He did a wonderful job on my credit report. I was amazed when I saw how everything reflected on my profile perfectly. He wiped out the bad items off my report and also loaded my account with $18,000. I got a high score of 786 with a good credit limit. This is all I can say about him compared to other good reviews I read about him on the internet. I will also refer him to anyone out there who is in need of his services. Kindly contact him on REMOTE REPAIR at CLERK dot COM
love Barcelona. Go to spot for girls night, great place to bring visitors, or even for a drink at the bar on weekends.
In there today, service was outstanding, best place to dine, food is awesome
Oh wine is awesome. I love their red Cabernet.I'll definitely come back here once or twice this week lol
Incredible service from Chauncey. The wine list is on point and the tapas offer tons of variety. Overall it was a fantastic experience and I can't wait to go back.
Best tapas around, one of my absolute favorites

I don't always drink the same thing so when I first came here the bartender asked what I wanted, I told him a generalization and then he crafted a special drink for me. From then on he's my go to. Whatever I'm feeling at the moment he creates, and it always taste good. Love it here.
Super happy this bar is opened and ready to serve our food. Staff was amazing, food delicious. Will be back!!
Amazing food and service. Our server was very attentive and we loved our experience.
Never been to a place with perfect food and drinks while being so fun before but this is it
love this place every time i go!
My favorite place to hang out with friends. Good vibes.
amazing. amazing food and service. from the time i walked in to the time i left. amazing ...... this is my second time here and it just gets better.
AMAZING. Service was spectacular. Food was amazing. Drinks were amazing. Definitely coming back.
Fantastic dinner selection! Great service, food, and drinks! We sat on the patio and the clouds started rolling in. The staff was great at getting everyone quickly moved inside!

Erin works here! The word on the street is that she's a bartender's bartender, which I think is pretty amazing. Enough said. Always a fun time with some absolutely incredible people. I have never been disappointed.

Wonderful place. My fiance and I had a nice Sunday brunch with delicious Bloody Mary and Mimosa. Also, I learned that the seafood paella must be served burnt, who knew?! I complained but the server kindly explained its Spanish tradition to be served burnt. Definitely try the jamon and their cheeses. Top top!!!
Love this place. make sure you get a reservation well in advance since this place is always packed.

Iâ€‹ loveeeeee this place i always have so much fun with my friends especiallyâ€‹â€‹ during the summer time. Iâ€‹ love the patio ambiance! We always have the best times there! Food is on point! Love the steak, the patatas bravas, the chorizo and jamÃ³n serrano! Love the sangria and also the cheese. I can't get tired of coming in here!

Amazing!!! Impressive wine list featuring over 400 bottles of wine and a large menu with gluten free items as well as vegetarian. Service is on point with a friendly staff from the minute we walked in to the small conversation we had with the hostess on the way out. Put it on your list of places to visit in DC!

Best evening ever!!! This is a very busy restaurant, but for good reason. Food was tremendous, our waitresses Kate and Franny were amazing and so sweet, and chef Rudy is the bomb. And don't forget the manager Dan and basically everyone else who works there. They treated us like family, and we just can't say enough great things about this spot. Having lived in Spain, we can honestly say this is the closest you'll get to authentic Spanish food in the US - and some things were even better (including the croquettes, tortilla, and flan)! Easy 5/5 recommendation.

The food was phenomenal! We tried almost all of the tapas and liked everything. The staff was great, we sat in the bar, it was slammed, but we still felt well taken care of. The bar manager chatted us up a couple times too, and was super friendly. Overall this place exceeded my expectations, oh and try the carrots, they're an underrated gem. Great date night spot.
Love the food, the staff and the wine!!!!! my fav restaurant!
The best place ever me and my husband in love with this place the food is amazing the service is very good and I can't wait to go there again.

The food was really good. Waiter was well knowledgeable about the wine collection they had. Food portion was small, but it was super good! It was also very affordable. Although we had a reservation, we had to wait 45 extra minutes to get seated. It was mostly because it was raining yesterday. Other than that, it was a great experience.

Everything is unexpected in the best way possible.Sean and the rest of the guest services team make you feel at home immediately. They put emphasis on small touches that significantly elevate the dining experience. They not only have a beautiful set up, but also the food to back it up. The Grilled Hanger Steak was cooked to perfection- I could drink the accompanying black truffle sauce. I'm no vegetarian, but appreciate a place that can appease my veggie friends as much as it can me. Definitely try the Spicy Eggplant Caponata, Spiced Beef Empanadas, Spinach-Chickpea Cazuel. Apparently they are aiming to create a GFL- Guest for Life. They've got at least one.
A must to dine at when in D.C. Tapas was outstanding and wine selection amazing,,,

I can't understand why some people hate on this spot. Chain or not, I love this place and have always had great service, food and drinks. Every cocktail jiggered and perfect every time, staff keeps your table clean and are extremely attentive. Wine list is unparalleled in that area at the price point.
Loved their tapas! The seating outside was really nice. We definitely recommend coming here.
Consistently good place. Will come again next time in DC.
I went here for a Monday evening the place was packed. I was lucky I find an empty chair in the bar.Food is amazing, very good presentation of tapas.Service top.Can't wait to go back again
awesome food and ambience.
As good as it gets for Spanish ham and tapas in DC. Plus, the bread from Lyon bakery is to die for. And the wine selection excellent and priced quite well.

I went to Barcelona this past Saturday with one of my best friend. it is a beautiful place. We sat at the bar for almost 30min waiting for a table, but we didn't have a reservation. Had the bourbon spice rack (my new favorite) and she had the a glass of the sauvignon blanc. Loved the services at the bar as well as on the floor. food was amazing, most of the things were tapa style. hunger stake made the 30 min wait worth it.. LOVE this place.. Make sure you get a reservation before coming.
This place is hot! Anything you chose on the menu is just delicious , delicious. Great place to bring friends from out of town too .

This place gives you a European like feel. It's good to come here all year round but I most prefer coming here during sunny days, especially summer because of the patio outside. I always get tapas food with a few drinks. You get what you pay for: terrific finger food, drinks and atmosphere! I would recommend anybody coming here.
delicious food and not expensive for DC standard. great wine selection. service is excellent. a fun place to bring out-of-town guests.
Super crowded spot, but well worth the wait. Party of two and we sat at the bar instead of waiting for the table. Absolutely delicious!!!
Great food and greater staff.

So last week me and a couple of colleagues from the French Diplomatic Corps spent some time in DC and went out for food. Barcelona was recommended to us by friends and did not only fully fulfill our expectations regarding the food quality but also surprised us with a large assortment of great wines. The service was amazingly friendly. Our waitress (Roxanne) perfectly new the menu and made the evening a stunning success.Conclusion, the Place could have been in Paris and we will definitely come back next time in Town.

This place is probably our favorite place we have visited on 14th street so far.Me and my husband came in for dinner hoping to get a table in the dining room but there was a long wait for a table so we headed to the bar for a quick drink. Massimo, our bartender who was very delightful. He had a smile and positive attitude that even me and my husband wish we could have. We were very much bothered by an obnoxious group of people near us. They were very rude and condescending to the bartenders by constantly interrupting us when we trying to order and ask questions about the food items. Things to definitely eat when visiting...Hanger steak, potatoes bravas, and the lamb chops.Thanks Massimo!!We will see you soon!
Amazing food... Great price... Best customer service I've ever had!

I love this place! The service is just wonderful. The servers are so attentive and knowledgeable, but they really weren't 'too' present. The food is great and best of all reasonably priced considering what other places get away with charging on the 14th Street corridor. The food was delicious and fresh. You seemingly can't go wrong as everyone in my party loved their tapas dishes.  A tip for dessert: I was and continue to not be a flan person, but their flan was DELICIOUS.

I was strolling to a different restaurant when the ambiance of Barcelona drew me in. It felt like I was at (my former) home! After living in Spain for six years, anyone would fall in love. From the lighting to the menu, open windows, friendly and helpful staff, I was impressed....Barcelona is the best replication of cuisine and charm offered, without the pricey airline ticket to Europe! Since I dined alone, I sat at the bar. Once I decided which tapas to order, the bartender (Lacey) made amazing wine/cocktail suggestions based off my order, to cleanse my pallate. My meal was super satisfying and the service was exceptional.I cannot wait to come back with a group of friends.

Had dinner last fall and we weren't sure if it would still be as good. The place was even better. Service was on target and the food was awesome. When I order hot food I am fussy about it being served hot. Again the food was hot and good. Even though it was pretty cold people were still sitting outside. It was crowded but it gives you a good feeling that you are part of it.
Very nice atmosphere and the service is great. Now I know there is a happy hour M-F from 4-6!!! I will be going back!

The ambiance is definitely classy and upscale so I expect so much more from this restaurant. Customer service was a bit lacking. The waiter seems like he was new and was forgetting to ask basic things like asking how I wanted my steak cooked before walking off. It was a very weird vibe that I couldn't put my finger on. The food was mediocre. The Petite filet was dry, over cooked and under seasoned. The cognac sauce and potatoes it came with were a delicious though. The Risotto faired a bit better and was actually very tasty with the scallops and shrimp. The NY strip was seasoned well and had the best potatoes of all 3 steak dishes. The shrimp cocktail was good as well and the cocktail sauce seemed freshly made. The salmon roll had no structural integrity. It presented well but basically crumbled as soon as it was picked up. It also sat for a bit and had gotten warm. But now to the wonderfully presented Heaven's Sakura, a $17 drink. The drink's presentation is gorgeous and you just know it's gonna be amazing...yea no. This drink either needs to be taken back to the drawing board or removed from the menu forever. This drink was DISGUSTING and was only finished because it was $17. It tasted like a drink you would mix as a kid on a dare. The crunch bar was the only thing on the menu I truly enjoyed it was delicious! I don't think I will be coming back since first impressions are everything and Gerrard's didn't pass the vibe check.
Good food, service was a little slow.
The food are amazing, service was excellent and the ambiance suits my liking .. had a week of lovely bfast
Top notch hotel restaurant.Our waitress Katrina was super friendly and attentive, always checking if everything was ok and we were enjoying the food. Definitely we would recommend it and repeat
The food was great and our server Katrina was very friendly and attentive. The total experience was wonderfu.
Delicious. Amazing presentation. Definitely make a reservation. Waiters are on point. Definitely worth the second trip.
Paul was a great bartender. Great service and great drinos and was a very outgoing and respectful person. Amazing conversations.
Excellent service, I like to go every two times a week, the food is very good. I recommend this place, I always receive friendly, polite staff, thank you very much Mr Paul.
the food was wonderful and our server Hansy was incredibly kind and attentive . would go again
The service and food are terrific. Hansy and Mr. Lee both provided excellent service, and the food was the best we have had in Washington DC.
What a phenomenal meal! Excellent service and cuisine. Handy and Mr. Lee made sure we had a wonderful dining experience. I will be back. Try the Robata - best dish on the menu.
Great service and delicious food

Handy and Le hands down the best customer service! The food was better than anything I've ever tasted. The ambiance was so warm and welcoming. Drinks were delicious. Just all around an incredible experience.
The food was outstanding! Great flavor combinations, all served warm and fresh. Our service by Mr. Le and Mr. Hansy was execllent. They made us feel at home.
rachid And hansy is doing excellent service for the breakfast. Gerrard street kitchen the best
Rashid out server was great!!Service was wonderful. The manager Hansey was on top of everything and made our experience even better. Me and my girlfriend enjoyed her birthday here!!

Today, I visited Rumi's Kitchen in Washington DC, where I am a regular customer. Upon arriving, there was no one at the door to greet us, and we waited for about 4-6 minutes before being seated. When I asked to sit at my usual table, which I visit at least twice a week, they accommodated me. However, after being seated, we waited for 9 minutes without being greeted or offered water.I decided to speak to the manager and expressed my concerns about the service, as it was unusually poor compared to my previous experiences. The manager acknowledged the feedback, and we proceeded with our meal. Unfortunately, the issues didn't end there. The server, who also doubled as the bartender, brought us boxes for our leftovers but refused to wrap our food, which is usually done by the staff. After requesting assistance again, the second manager was dismissive, and we felt increasingly unwelcome.We paid our bill of $180 and even tipped the bartender $50, but as we were leaving, the manager told us we needed to leave immediately, which only added to the unpleasant experience. Overall, this visit left much to be desired, especially for a loyal customer.

I normally don't have the habit of writing a review, but my recent experience was so awful that I decided to do it. I recently dined at (Rumi's kitchen, in DC), and I must say, I was incredibly disappointed with the experience. The service and the food were not bad, but when they brought the bill, they overcharged us. Why? Because we were 15 people and they said if it's more than 10 people, they charge each person $100. Why? I don't know. Nobody knows. They didn't care that each of us ate much much less than $100 . And we had 4 kids under the age of ten, how much can they eat?! I've never heard such a thing. It was the most ridiculous thing I've ever heard. They absolutely positively didn't do anything special in order to charge us double. And the person in charge was no where to be found. She was off and wouldn't take our calls. And there was no manager there who could help us resolve this issue, or so we were told. Overall, ( Rumi's Kitchen, in DC) failed to meet even the most basic expectations of a pleasant dining experience. I won't be returning, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
Dont support this business! They treat their staff like dirt. Michele and Rebecca were some of the worst managers I have ever worked for. Please do not support this terrible company!!

Worst restaurant ever!! I really don't like writing negative reviews, but this place, they will only give you a terrible experience! My guests and I drove all the way from Virginia to Washington DC because we made a reservation for dinner only to be turned away because they required a vaccination status. They never gave us any information about what they need during the reservation. No information posted on their website or social media. Such a very disorganized place, with a horrible staff and rude manager!
Bad! Bad! Bad!The food! The service even the parking spot!It was bad quality and very expensive
Very good food, table was a bit small for our party. The service was good
My favorite Iranian in the area spot for sure, love the gormeh sabsi, and the kebabs are deliciously prepared. The owner is also ultra warm and welcoming
So good. So so good. So so very good. Delicious food and competent service.

Rumi Restaurant blew me away.The decor? Cozy, warm, and almost cocoon-like. You walk in and instantly feel at ease. The staff? Spot on. Friendly, attentive, and clearly know what they're doing. And the food? Unreal. I ordered the rack of lamb, and let me tell you--it was so good, I didn't want to finish it. Half of me wanted to savor every bite, and the other half wanted to take it home to relive the magic later.Trust me, this place is a gem.

The food here is absolutely delicious and authentic! The restaurant has a beautiful and elegant atmosphere, and the customer service is outstanding. They start with a "noon panir sabzi" that's a perfect touch. The menu offers a wide variety of traditional Iranian dishes, all of which are amazing. Highly recommend!

I've always been a fan of Rumis, but the DC location truly went above and beyond my expectations. The service is outstanding, and the ambiance is beautiful. As for the food, it is so amazing. The meat dishes are cooked to perfection. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for authentic, delicious middle eastern food.

Rumi's Kitchen in DC offers an unparalleled dining experience that beautifully captures the essence of Persian cuisine. The restaurant's warm ambiance sets the stage for a culinary journey that tantalizes the taste buds.From the moment we stepped in, the attentive staff ensures a seamless dining experience. The menu is a delightful fusion of traditional flavors and innovative twists, showcasing the richness of Persian culinary artistry. The kebabs are a standout, perfectly grilled and bursting with succulent flavors.My Sea Bass was unmatched juicy and full of flavors.The ambiance is a perfect blend of sophistication and comfort, making it an ideal spot for both intimate dinners and celebratory gatherings. The decor reflects the cultural richness of Iran, creating a visually pleasing backdrop to the dining experience.Rumi's Kitchen in DC is not just a restaurant
Delicious food and all kinds of options and all are on point .Prices as expected. Seating : make reservations to make sure you get what you need. Service is friendly and attentive.
Wonderful meal and time... Food was amazing...
Great food and ambience! If you are against HALAL food they have great seafood options as well!!
I M really recommend on THIS restaurant, the food is good and the the staff is very nice and helpful

Definitely a pricier meal, but WORTH IT. I came here with two other couples on a Sunday night. IT WAS PACKED and we were so thankful that we had a reservation beforehand.The appetizers were all very tasty - stand outs were the hummus with lamb and the Mirza Ghasemi (smoky tomato eggplant dip). Apps come with a bread basket - warm bread and delicious. Very cool that they have huge slabs of bread hanging from the ceiling that you can see in the kitchen while you're dining :)As for food, I split the rack of lamb and the shrimp with my partner. The rack of lamb was cooked perfectly - great flavors. The shrimp were massive! Meaty grilled shrimp that were super delicious. Both dishes came with rice (with raisins and dried fruits, so yum) and a grilled tomato. By the end of dinner we were STUFFED. I wish we had saved space for dessert!Our water was AWESOME. Incredibly patient, helpful navigating the menu, and gave honest opinions about the dishes :) Excited to come back soon.

If you're looking for a restaurant that will tantalize your taste buds and transport you to the exotic lands of Persia, then look no further than this Rumi's Kitchen restaurant. From the moment you step inside, you'll be enveloped in a world of aromas and flavors that will have you coming back for more. The menu is full of delicious and authentic dishes that are sure to please your palate, in addition to westernized flare. The Koobideh dishes are especially noteworthy, as the succulent meat is cooked to perfection and served with a tantalizing, juicy flavor that will leave you wanting more. The spices used in the dishes are carefully selected to provide a unique and authentic persian flavor that will leave you wanting to try more of what the restaurant has to offer. The atmosphere of the restaurant is also a real treat as it is adorned with design cues paying homage to the legendary poet Rumi. With its warm and welcoming atmosphere, you'll feel like you're dining in a palace in Persia. The decor is traditional and yet vibrant, creating an inviting atmosphere that will make you want to stay longer. Overall, Rumi's Kitchem restaurant is sure to impress. Whether you're looking for a cultural persian meal or just a night of relaxation, this restaurant is the perfect place to fulfill your desires.
Best food ive ever had in my life. Great service and very attentive wait staff. Will be back.
Very interesting menu and each item was delicious. Wait staff was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. Very reasonably priced too.
I love the foods delicious , beautiful ambience
Great Persian food, awesome ambience. I would highly recommend olives, the salmon and the Persian ice cream.
It is the definition of a well run and constant restaurant. in all the years we have been going there we have never been disappointed.

It's not authentic at all. Everything we order is below average. Taste like frozen dim sum food that you can buy from Chinese/Asian markets. I gave 2 stars instead of 1 since the interior decoration is beautiful.

Han Palace in Woodley Park, with additional locations in Georgetown and McLean, has become a go-to dim sum spot for many, thanks to its alluring happy hour and bottomless drink deals. Despite the unassuming exterior--nestled quietly among other "ethnic-adjacent" spots like Nando's and Indian restaurants--the interior is beautifully decorated. Hanging plants, warm ambient lighting, and Chinese-style calligraphic art adorn the walls. The fun tiled bar showcases a plethora of alcoholic beverages and features large flat-screen TVs broadcasting sports and news. While they don't take reservations, you can call ahead to inquire about wait times.On a Saturday night at 6pm, our party of six only waited about five minutes for a table. Our server was brusque, asking for our orders within two minutes of seating us (we needed more time). The dim sum menu, though not as extensive or authentic as other places and a bit pricier, features a mix of Americanized entrees, vegetarian-friendly fare, and traditional noodles, rice dishes, and vegetables. Dishes started arriving about 10 minutes after we ordered, which was fairly quick.We began with the Shrimp Dumpling ($5.50 for 3 pieces), which were small, with an oddly textured shrimp filling that lacked seasoning. However, the rice flour wrapper was well-made. The Pork Dumpling with Fresh Crab Roe ($5.50 for 3 pieces), or Siu Mai, was decent--juicy pork with a nicely formed wrapper, though the crab roe was barely noticeable. The Steamed Chicken Claws ($5.50) were a standout deal, offering a generous amount of marinated chicken feet with a good balance of skin and cartilage.The Roasted Pork Buns ($6.95 for 3 pieces) had a soft, pillowy bun, but the filling was an odd mashed texture that didn't taste much like pork. The Soup Dumplings ($11.95 for 6 pieces) were liked by some but failed to impress, especially given the high price. The Scallion Pancake ($4.95) was well-received for its crispy texture.Among the entrees, the Lo Mein dishes (starting at $14.95) provided a large amount of noodles but skimped on the meat. They were enjoyable but no better than typical Chinese takeout. The General Tso's Chicken ($18.95) was generously portioned and tasty but nothing special. The Ma Po Tofu ($15.95) was a highlight, offering a delectably spicy dish with silken tofu in a rich sauce, and my friend appreciated the leftovers.The Crispy Roasted Pork ($15.95) had a rich, fatty flavor but was disappointingly thin and small in portion. The Garlic Chinese Broccoli ($15.95) was extremely bland and swimming in oil, making it a poor value. However, the Purple Gold Yolk Bun ($6.95 for 3 pieces) was a delightful end to the meal, with its unique lilac color, soft dough, and rich custard filling.Overall, Han Palace offers a pleasant dining experience with a beautifully decorated interior and quick service. However, the food lacks authenticity, the prices are high, and the service is brusque. While it's not a bad spot for a casual meal, you might be better off seeking more authentic dim sum at places like Da Hong Pao, or venturing further out into Virginia to quell your fix.
Food is mediocre, the dim sum is super small portions.overpriced..... one thing I did like was the roast duck.but it was very oily.

Good but not the best. Tasted like cheap Chinese takeout. The flavors were nothing special and something I could have made myself. The soup dumplings were also dry and tasted like a normal dumpling. The service was good as well as the ambiance.
Overall,Han Palace serves delicious and affordable dim sum. If you're looking for a hearty Asian comfort meal, give this a try!
Food was beautiful. Love the decor. Staff was lovely. I will be coming back to try the dinner menu!
This place was really nice, my friends and I went and everyone was really nice. The food was really good and the atmosphere was great. 4/5 because I think my waiter forgot my table for a bit

This restaurant is a true gem! From the moment I walked in, the enticing aroma of the food set the stage for an exceptional dining experience. The crab dumplings were perfectly crafted and bursting with flavor, while the spring rolls were crisp and absolutely fabulous. To top it off, the lychee martini was smooth, refreshing, and expertly balanced. Highly recommend for anyone seeking a flavorful and memorable meal!
The food was amazing! Service was very attentive and very nice. Even my picky eaters loved it!

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Han Palace DC, and I must say, it was a delightful experience. The highlight of my visit was undoubtedly the all-you-can-eat dim sum offering, which left me thoroughly impressed.The ambiance of the restaurant is elegant and inviting, creating a comfortable atmosphere for a leisurely meal. The staff was attentive and friendly, making sure our dining experience was enjoyable from start to finish. I appreciated their prompt service and willingness to accommodate our requests.Now, let's talk about the star of the show - the dim sum. The variety and quality of dim sum offerings were outstanding. From the traditional favorites like dumplings and buns to more adventurous choices, every bite was a burst of flavor. The freshness of the ingredients and the expertly crafted flavors showcased the culinary prowess of the chefs at Han Palace.What sets this place apart is the all-you-can-eat option. It allows you to explore the extensive menu without any limitations, making it a great value for dim sum enthusiasts. The servers were attentive in refilling our plates promptly, ensuring that we could savor the diverse flavors without interruption.While the dim sum stole the spotlight, it's worth mentioning that the restaurant's overall menu has a wide range of options, catering to different tastes. Whether you're a dim sum aficionado or looking for other Chinese delicacies, Han Palace has something for everyone.In conclusion, Han Palace DC exceeded my expectations with its impeccable service, inviting ambiance, and, most importantly, the delectable all-you-can-eat dim sum. It's a great spot for a casual lunch or a leisurely dinner with friends and family. I left with a satisfied palate and a strong desire to return for another round of dim sum delights. Highly recommended!

Excellent soup dumplings. My drink lychee martini was great. Service polite. We ordered Peiking Duck. Having had it several times, I have to say it was really good. Will pass on king Pao Chicken... too sweet. Took the desert home but looked good.  Overall good execution!

The food and service were both great. It's a cute little restaurant and the dim sum was good. I recommend ordering a pot of tea for the table as well. The food didn't take long to come out and we didn't have to wait long for a table. Highly recommend.
Everything was really good! My favorite was the steamedpork buns, shrimp dumplings and roast duck. Staff members weresuper friendly and attentive.

I moved here from California and have looked for a good dim sum place. This is the dim sum place I've been able to find so far. It's definitely worth a try. If you like Chinese food, there's likely at least one dish that you'll really like.
New Han Palace is going to be open on 4/10! Any one craving dim sum then I recommend this place! Can't wait!

Upon leaving this restaurant I uncontrollably shit for 7 hours straight. I've spent a lot of time contemplating this concept- maybe this was my fault. Maybe I should have ordered anything besides the pork burger with excess amounts of spicy mustard and mayo. But no. I will not take this abuse any longer. I am fully convinced that Ambar undercooked my burger and due to the Covid-19 pandemic kicked me onto the street after 2 hours to wallow in my shit on the side of the road. I will not be silenced any longer. Fuck Ambar.-Cornelious Z
We were there for brunch. Food was OK and service was great. But if you don't eat pork your options are being %50 less, if you're vegan or vegetarian look for another spot.
We did bottomless brunch and the food was really bland and mediocre compared to what I was expecting. Especially for the price. Not worth a second trip. The wait staff was pretty good though.
Everything was pretty good but nothing that Rose'd my mind
Slow service and worst food never come back . We have a bad time the place looks like mediocre
both food and drinks were just ok
Fast service, all you can eat options were delicious. Witty staff.
Our order arrived 5 minutes before quoted time in less than an hour of order placed. So convenient and will definitely use again. Good job. Will be calling again real soon

Wonderful food, amazing service, and an incredible selection of wines - which they were kind enough to let us taste several of before deciding on our bottle. The staff was incredibly kind and all of them were extremely respectful of social distancing and mask wearing. Would absolutely return again and again.

What else can you say about the food. It is amazing. It is more expensive but well worth it. The service is questionable at times but food makes up for it. It some times seems like they are rushing you. I would say that this is well worth it though. Would recommend.

We stopped in for dinner during restaurant week and had a 5 star experience all around. Our waiter, Sean, recommended all the "must try" items on the menu and every single dish was fantastic. He was attentive and friendly the entire two hours and kept the drinks flowing. We highly recommend this restaurant- don't leave without trying the shrimp skewer and the stuffed pepper.

This was recommended to us and we enjoyed every minute. Every dish we tried was great. The salmon tartare amazing! The meze platter was delicious. The cocktails well made. Service was efficient, attentive and friendly. It was very busy and for all the obvious reasons. We will be back and we had fun! Great energy.

I can't say I'm a big Balkan foodie, but I greatly respect the cuisine offered here. The quality is top notch, the variety was super and the portions were reasonable. I enjoyed the Apple pie and the zucchini soup. My wife loved the wine. Make a reservation and be adventurous with your palate. Ambar has good food but there's more reasonable options around.
We did the Balkan experience which is an awesome deal and includes drinks. The food was delicious!! I am impressed with the pricing and very happy with the service.

Having lived in the Balkans, eating at this Serbian restaurant was risky. I knew how delicious their real food is. But these folks do it right. The food is delicious, and there's something for everyone. We've also tried it for brunch and it was great!
Overall, Ambar is unique and offers some pretty solid food and solid service. Happy hour is pretty wonderful, but otherwise, it's just above average. It's a nice stop in the early evening.

I've never been one to eat out but I came here last night when a couple of friends decided to hang out and I thought It'd be cool to eat here since I drive past this place almost every day. The food here was very intriguing, I noticed that the dishes here aren't just your typical Western European entrees, instead there was a lot of Eastern European and Balkan cuisine which I was super eager to try. The manager was Serbian and he was so warm and courteous with us, he mentioned how he always likes to chit chat with new first time visitors and ask them what they think of the dishes. I've never ever had this kind of food before I came here, so I was very much looking forward. We decided to order the Balkan Experience - $40 for an all you can eat or drink session with mimosas included. I thought it was an absolutely fair deal, but the food didn't impress me so much. It didn't really have an oriental or exotic vibe to it, more of a redo for many common US and Western European recipes. The Balkan salad was excellent and really surprised me with the paprika they used for it, I haven't had such refreshing tasting paprika before. The manager mentioned that they were Balkan paprikas when I complemented the salad, at least something did manage to surprise me after all.To finish off, I think this is a wonderful establishment that tries hard to satisfy, and there's no reason not to want to eat here.
very good selection of treats from across modern, central EU. nice beers too

Being new to the District I was informed brunch is a must and after sampling some dismal options on 8th street in the SE quadrant of the city I found myself happily writing my first review on Yelp and wished it to be a positive oneIt was was crowded and bustling with people as waiters passed with delicious food flying by our table and I have to admit for an all you can eat it was quite enjoyable experience. I look forward to spending many district weekends celebrating this past time. The con would be noise. The pros would be food, drink and service. Definitely try the calamari.

Ambar is truly a gem. there are three bars, that are usually pretty busy, but that doesn't detract from a great experience. one of the bars is outdoor, but covered with a roof. I always enjoy the Balkan salad, Balkan kabob and the mussels are great. I've also been here for dinner and they offer a $49 all you can... So good!

One of my favorite happy hour spots. Prices are incredible and apps are tasty! My favorites are the vodka mango lemonade, fried sourdough bread, and the mussels (the sauce they use... yum!!!)... all $4 each during happy hour! The staff is always pleasant so it makes it that much better.
The chicken marsala is as good as I've had and the prices are reasonable. Service is generally good and the staff are very friendly.
Great place. I especially love the different crispy salads. I'm not a fan of the fried bread that they gave with the spreads. Feels too oily. Chicken kabab was a little dry but otherwise great.
Their brussels sprouts are amazing! Great wine and service.
Fantastic.

Went here with a group of friends. They had tasting menu for the small plates, all of us just bought that and tasted everything off the menu. We ordered seconds of everything we liked! Service was very good, quick and food was good.
love them! good food and drinks great service.

While I've been to the Balkans and experienced their culture - this place actually hits it pretty close to genuine. I went there with few of my friends last week and we had GREAT time. The atmosphere is so welcoming and worm, staff is amazing. From hostess who was more than welcoming, through our server who was amazing. We also met general manager Urosh who gave us a great restaurant tour, introduce us with different flavors of rakija and great chooses of vino from Balkan.But let me tell you something about their great food. For an appetizer we had proja with ajvar, urnebes and kajmak. AMAZING!!!!! They got my vote after a first bite of food. It brought me back to the days when I travel through Balkan countries. I was totally in love in sarma, great presentation and even batter taste. With sopska salad you can never go wrong as well as cevap and traditional pljeskavica. No TV's, Balkan employees, Balkan food & wine, Balkan music playing in the background. Such a great night!!! Thanks Balkan people for taking care of us and bringing Balkan in DC. We were all totally in love and cannot wait to come back.Literally, If you want to experience the Balkan culture without hopping on a plane to Belgrade then I'd suggest you pop over to Ambar.

I had an amazing time at AMBAR on Capitol Hill! The food is incredibly flavorful, with a great mix of Balkan-inspired dishes, and the ambiance is cozy yet lively - perfect for a night out with friends or a date.Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

I can not say enough about AMBAR. The food, atmosphere and friendly staff make this a no-brainer for brunch, lunch or dinner. I have had the pleasure of visiting the Capitol Hill location on three occasions. Twice for the brunch and once for dinner. I discovered this amazing place when looking for a new brunch spot that was close to my home with reasonable pricing and a interesting menu. After investigating their menu options, I made a reservation for the upcoming weekend and invited a friend. We arrived and were seated on the upper level of this small but mighty Balkan restaurant. Their tag line, "NEXT-LEVEL BALKAN DINING WITHOUT LIMITS" adequately describes the experience you will have. It's possible that I have tried just about every item on the menu for brunch at this point since it's unlimited and you can have it all. They also have an unlimited drinks add-on. A few of my favorite are the Beet Tzatziki spead, fried chicken, the hanger steak, Balkano and the Shrimp and bacon, oh and the BREAD. I don't like leaving out all of the other delicious items because they also deserve recognized. I have visited unlimited plate restaurants in the past that have good food, but the service is slow and that limits your ability to try whatever you'd like. This has not been the case during any of my visits to Ambar. The wait staff and servers are quick, friendly and your items are brought to you hot. They keep it coming even when the restaurant is full. I don't think you can find a better value and more tasty food anywhere else in DC specifically. If so, please let me know and I will be happy to give them a try. One last thing, Costco sells 4 $25.00 gift cards to Ambar for $79.99.

We had a great time for dinner during restaurant week. Service was great and the drinks and food were all so good. Honestly one of the most fun dining experiences I've had, I love the small plates and unlimited makes it so fun. Worthy of the Michelin plate. Each dish was professional and interesting. We will definitely be back!

Ambar has undoubtedly earned its stripes as a top-notch dining destination, and my recent brunch experience there was nothing short of extraordinary. From the moment I walked in, the ambiance exuded a warm and welcoming atmosphere, setting the stage for a memorable culinary journey.The $39 brunch menu is an absolute steal considering the abundance of delectable options it offers. The small tapas, in particular, were a symphony of flavors that left my taste buds in awe. Each dish showcased the culinary expertise of the chefs at Ambar. What truly sets Ambar apart is the opportunity to savor an unlimited selection of small plates and drinks within the brunch price. The variety and quality of options were simply outstanding, allowing me to explore a diverse range of flavors without feeling rushed or overwhelmed.The drink menu, including the delightful mimosas, was a highlight of the brunch experience. The mimosas were expertly crafted, with just the right balance of bubbly and fruity goodness. The option to customize mimosas with various juices added a playful touch, making the brunch experience even more enjoyable.The attentive and friendly staff at Ambar added to the overall positive atmosphere. They were knowledgeable about the menu, always ready with recommendations, and ensured that our glasses were never empty. The service contributed to a relaxed and enjoyable brunch, allowing me to savor every moment.In conclusion, Ambar in DC has mastered the art of delivering a brunch experience that goes above and beyond expectations. The brunch offering is a fantastic value for the quality and variety of dishes available, and the small tapas, paired with wonderful drinks and mimosas, make it a brunch destination that deserves every one of its five stars. I can't wait to return and indulge in the culinary delights that Ambar has to offer once again!

I recently visited Ambar for brunch and was so impressed that I returned just a week later for dinner. The restaurant offers an intriguing Balkan cuisine that's both diverse and mouthwateringly delicious.During my first visit for brunch, the standout was the unlimited mimosas paired with a wide array of brunch items. The experience wasn't just about the food

I've been to Ambar twice. Once for their all you can eat small plates during restaurant week and I recently went back for their happy hour. Both experiences were incredible and I went home doubled over because I ate too! much! food! Ambar might be in my top 5 food experiences of all time. I love that you try just about anything on the menu! Their pita is great and all of their dips are even better! I love their falafel and their mussels, too. I highly recommend the charcuterie board, as well as the lamb and braised short rib! My partner is a vegetarian and there are so many options for diverse diets, too. The only thing on the menu that fell short was the kebabs. The staff is wonderful. Whether you order everything right away or as you go, they time the meal well and are very kind! The space is also huge, between their outside seating, multiple levels, and bar seating. I sat upstairs during restaurant week and it was perfect! Highly highly recommend!

When in dc go check out this location. A great staff and great food s. Hard to say which one is the better of the two. Courtney and Katie have the best attitudes and energy. The way they work together is cute and fun. You can tell they both care about what they do and each other and I find that to be rare to actually see in practice. They are wonderful to us. We had the most beautiful day. Thank you to all that made this happen.

My whole table pretty much plans to leave a review. We were sat on the top floor and bad the most incredible experience. From the server and manager, Courtney and Katie, to the food and ambiance, you can't afford to miss out. Simply the best time we've ever had. Go to ask for Katie and Courtney. What a dynamic duo!

This place is unreal! Everything about it is fire! The food is some of the best dc has to offer. Our server Courtney was incredible. I mean, talk about a winning personality. And Katie the manager, is super kind and just the right balance for a place like this. We dined on the third floor. Or you may say, the roof top. All in all, an amazing time.
Ambiance was great...Food was amazing...Our server was very attentive, friendly, and welcoming!!!My husband and I will definitely be back and will tell lots of our friends about this restaurant!
Food was pretty good. Love the small plates. Everything came out fast. And the inside was nice and clean

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Ambar in Washington, D.C., and I must say that the highlight of my visit was the outstanding service provided by Epi. From the moment I walked through the door, Epi's warm and welcoming demeanor set the stage for an unforgettable dining experience.Epi's attentiveness and knowledge of the menu were truly impressive. As a first-time visitor, I had several questions about the dishes and the different flavors they offered. Epi patiently answered all of my inquiries, providing detailed descriptions and recommendations based on my preferences. Their passion for the cuisine was evident, and their expertise helped me navigate the extensive menu with ease.Throughout the evening, Epi's genuine care and impeccable timing ensured that my dining experience was nothing short of exceptional. They anticipated my needs and preferences, making sure my water glass was never empty and checking in at just the right moments to ensure my satisfaction. Their professionalism and attention to detail were evident in every interaction.What truly set Epi apart was their ability to create a personalized experience. Not only did they remember my name, but they also made an effort to connect with me on a personal level, engaging in friendly conversation and making me feel like a valued guest. It was refreshing to receive such individualized attention in a busy restaurant, and it made my evening all the more memorable.In addition to the superb service, the food at Ambar was absolutely outstanding. Epi's recommendations were spot-on, and each dish exceeded my expectations. The flavors were bold, the presentation was artful, and the ingredients were fresh and of the highest quality. From the delectable appetizers to the mouthwatering desserts, every bite was a delight.Overall, my dining experience at Ambar was elevated by the exceptional service provided by Epi. Their attention to detail, friendly demeanor, and extensive knowledge of the menu contributed greatly to the overall enjoyment of the evening. I highly recommend visiting Ambar and requesting Epi as your server for a truly memorable dining experience.

We had an amazing experience at this restaurant. The "all you can eat" option for dinner was truly excellent, with a seemingly endless stream of delicious dishes. The table service was impeccable, and the staff kept the table full throughout our meal. The standout dishes for us were the lamb lasagna and cabbage pork rolls, but everything was extremely good. The service was top-notch, and despite some comments about variable service, we didn't encounter any issues. If you're looking for an exceptional dining experience, come hungry and enjoy the culinary delights this restaurant has to offer.
Delicious food and phenomenal service! The ambiance was terrific too! Will be coming back!

We always use this restaurant as a go to for delicious food and small bites. The staff is always welcoming and you can always rely on a good meal. The second floor has great seating as well as the first.
This is an amazing price for amazing food . Can say anything just try it . Make sure you call first. Parking is tough !!!
Loved it here! I wasn't sure what to expect but everything we ordered was really good and had a lot of flavor! Would definitely come here again!
Just go!!! You will NOT be disappointed!!! The food, the drinks and the price!! Been going there since day one!!
Service was great! Food was good and the bottomless everything was spectacular. Will definitely be back
Their food is SO good. I don't get to go often, but when I do, the service is great, and I can't get enough of their dishes.

Great authentic Balkan food...and it's all you can eat. Each dish is crafted to perfection. The service by Amber and her 2ic Alex was excellent and must be commended. There is no limit on how much you eat or drink...just excellent.
You will leave stuffed! What great food, drinks, and atmosphere. The all you can eat is a great price for the high quality and yummy food. Definitely get all the dips and the meatballs are great too!

This is my first yelp review an I felt I had to with this place the food was Amazing went for restaurant week and the food was amazing the waiter was great absolutely recommend this place to anyone in the area
Excellent and healthy food and excellent service! Slow roasted lamb is simply the best!
Great establishment, nice ambiance, great food , I've only been here twice but I enjoyed it both times .
What can't you like about unlimited amazing food and drinks with enough on the menu to please any and everyone?
I have always been a fan of their all you can eat and drink menu. Great food and drink selection.
I need more stars to rate this unique and delicious restaurant! Do the all-you-can-eat option, but save room for dessert. The service was great, and we received great recommendations for what to try.

Four of us stopped in for lunch on a whim.Turns out this place serves up some pretty amazing food.My partner got the breaded pork chops, I got the half chicken. The sides are also super delicious as well (pictured is the mac & cheese and corn).The prices are on point as well. We got a ton of food for the price. (For reference: the McDonald's across the street charges almost the same price for far less food.)We will definitely be back soon to try out the breakfast options!
Very cool place. The plates are small but there are lots of them. The sausage and mustard was awesome. And the wine selection was very nice!
Delicious food, great happy hour drink and food specials, and nice staff too! Lunch deal is the best, for price, and take out options very good too.
Came here with friends for bottomless brunch and had absolutely the best time! Our server was amazing and the food was bomb af.

I was a regular here pre-Covid, and yesterday I went back for the first time since February 2020. The restaurant has been remodeled and looks beautiful. The bar downstairs is gone and there's a wine room in the second floor. I started with the veal soup, as always, and then went for some meat dishes. $39 unlimited dishes and $20 for drinks is a steal. (Also bartender Elise -sp- was lovely.)

When I tell you hands down my favorite restaurant in dc I eat here once a week during covid and everything. I've taken all my close friends and now they take me whenever they want to cheer me up! The Balkan Kebabs the lamb lasagna the steak tartar the goulash all of it 10/10
Love it!! Our go-to place! Great food and service. Can get busy but still worth visiting!!
Their brunchhhhh! I would go there every day for those little cinnamon donuts things! Food is always delicious and top places for brunch in the city!
This is by far one of my FAVORITE restaurants in the area. The staff is very attentive to your needs. I prefer this location over the one in Clarendon.
Such amazing staff and food!!! Such unique flavors and attentive staff they literally brought out whatever we wished: will definitely be back!!!!!

Ambar endears you to it without the assistance of so much as a crumb of food. But then the server starts introducing the dishes, with influences from Greece, Turkey, Austria and Hungary, and you wonder why Balkan food doesn't have better representation in this country. Because for sheer comfort, veal soup rivals Jewish penicillin with its golden broth rich with shreds of meat, sweet carrots and a steaming surface dappled with creme fraiche. Also because tangy stuffed sour cabbage comes with a story by a Serbian waiter, who shares that his grandmother used to make the dish for the whole neighborhood.
Delicious food! Great cocktails! Perfect service!
Every dish is excellent, and the service is great with kind servers. I highly recommend.

Got take out here for a date night and was pleasantly surprised by how good this was. We got the Slow Cooked Experience and added a few sides and a bottle of wine. Staff was very friendly and pick up was easy. We had to reheat the food because we live up in NW, but food was still so yummy. Great food, great portions, and a great price!

Ambar you are truly incredible, I had an incredible experience here yesterday. It's comfy, clean and attractive. Kajmak is a total deliciousness, I am so glad that I tried it. Service was excellent and everyone working here was very nice and helpful. Can't go wrong.
Great staff and food! Price is reasonable - a "go to".
A great dining experience each time I visit. I'll come back every time I visit D.C.!
Great place! Friendly people and good food.
Trust me, get the $49 deal. Portions are very small so you get to taste a huge variety.
Amazing food and service. What a great treat. I am glad someone introduced me.to this place.

I have been here twice. This is the best Balkan cuisine you will have outside of the Balkans. The staff is extremely kind and friendly. Several are Serbian and can give great recommendations. The food never fails to impress. Highly recommend the Brussels Sprouts with the yogurt sauce, the lamb sausages, and the kajmak dip is to die for.
This was the best place to eat because it was clean and the food was great and they took care of my family amazingly.

$5 Happy Hour Monday through Friday food and drinks you can't beat this on the HILL. Friendly, welcoming and tasty. If looking for a Happy place to hang, this is definitely it. Always packed. One of our favs.
delicious food, delicious drinks, awesome decor, everything is good go eat food here!!!!
Best restaurant in town. Amazing service and the food is so flavorful. This is a must visit restaurant!

We love Ambar and have had great experiences in the past. Tonight, while waiting to be seen by the hostess, we got doused in flying orange sauce by a waiter walking upstairs. A complete accident. The manager (sorry, I forget your name) not only gave us warm towels to wipe off, but he then comped our drinks at the bar, and drinks during dinner. If that wasn't enough, before we walked out, he gave us a $25 gift card to use in the future. We've always loved Ambar for its food and great staff. They continue to live to up to the great ratings they receive.
Great food, drinks and service. We always enjoy the experience here.

Iâ€‹ especiallyâ€‹ love different cultures and different flavors and food. that'sâ€‹ why Iâ€‹ love trying different restaurants from differentâ€‹ places around the world. this one specifically it transports you literally. this food is something I'veâ€‹ ever tried. Iâ€‹ can't even pronounceâ€‹ the names but all the things. Iâ€‹ tried were so good. brunch is also pretty good, there'sâ€‹ only few that are bottomlessâ€‹ and good.

I had an absolutely fantastic time here with a small group of friends. We did the $50 unlimited option and it's beyond worth it. The staff was super attentive and kept asking what else we wanted to order each time they came by the table, so we made sure we always had orders ready for new dishes. I recommend trying anything and everything that you might be even the slightest bit interested in, because it's all pretty delicious. The drink selection for the unlimited option is somewhat meh, but hey, unlimited is unlimited. Awesome times, great food, and superb people. Highly recommended!

I stopped here with a group of friends for a birthday celebration on a Saturday. I reserved this place a month in advance as we were a large group. We had a pre set 'Balkan experience' at $39 each. This brunch is spectacular, unlimited food and drinks.Favorite items on the menu that I would recommend trying are mezze platter, roasted mushroom crepe, cinnamon sweet sourdough, poached pear waffle, steak and eggs and salmon benedict. Now, steak and eggs is probably the best I've tried, its the most popular dish and therefore, you can only place two orders at a time for a table which was a little annoying but worth the wait. Let me say that portions are small like tapas style, meant for sharing, therefore order as many dishes as you can and want to try! For a busy Saturday brunch service was excellent!! This is so far my favorite all you can eat type of brunch. I will definitely go back!

Loved this place, this might be in my top 5 restaurants in DC. I've been several times and have had a great meal each time. The food is terrific, good food and good value.I love the feel and atmosphere I also appreciate the staff's honesty and service. Each time i've gone i've had a different server and they've all been great with recommendations. I'd definintely recommend a visit.
The food is delicious, and the service is top notch. Even I will say that the food was not just tasty, but beautiful, God, I even have no words. We'll come back next time.

I visited Ambar for brunch for my birthday. Barbora was incredible. She helped us pick fabulous plates to try. Our plates arrived very quickly and we loved them all! We highly recommend her and the Balkan experience. Be sure to make your reservation in advance so that you will be able to get a table. This place is very popular!
Great food! Great environment! Definitely go for the Balkan Experience! Five Stars!!!!

We were last night to celebrate Christmas Eve and could not be better, I recommend this restaurant to all, the combination of flavors in excellent small dishes !! I recommend the experience of the Balkans with a price of 49 usd, the attention of the waitress Tamara could not be better we received all the necessary information all the time and was very kind, we will return
Delicious! Portions are small but if you pick all you can eat option you can get as many as you want.

This review has nothing to do with the meal only the service. This place came highly recommended so we decided to call and make a reservation for the next evening. We were told by Lucia they were not excepting any reservations at all, however I decided to call back to see if it's possible to eat a full meal at the bar she proceeded to tell me they have three bars and all of them served a full meal, no reservation needed, go figure!! I'm sure we we will try to have dinner there before we leave Washington but Lucia, get it together!!!!! Because of your reluctance to give customer service you could've cost the restaurant several meals.
Great! Good food, nice ambiance, great service! All of them so nice to customer! Small portions but enough food, and good price! My favorite place!
Our favorite spot in Capitol Hill, you definitely won't be disappointed for dinner or brunch
We tried almost everything, and everything was so delicious!
Amazing experience! I highly recommend the Balkan Experience. One of my favorite spots in DC :)
I don`t know what to say.. thank you for everything.. PERFECT... :D :D :D

Amazig I loved it the food was just delicious and the service was delightful I especially loved the kajmak I think it's called and the meza it's like a plate of meats of all kinds and also they had like a kabbab thing that I really like, as far as alcohol I tried their rakya and loved in these small shot glasses it was very unique. All and all an excellent experience and I'm defently going back again and again.
great waiter, helped us pick out some great choices! wasn't a fan of the dessert, but everything else was amazing!
Great food, Great Atmosphere, Great Staff, Prime Location
BALKAN CUISINE Amazing foodAmazing serviceMoney well spent!!!
Great brunch special, and open later than other brunch places in the area.
The food is amazing.
one word: wow.
The best Balkan food I had in my life!

Im was born in Croatia and was really excited to try there food. I visited Ambar with my girlfriend on Saturday. We end up ordering cevapi and calamari. I was thrilled how good they were. Our server Uros suggested Vranec wine from Macedonia and hit a point!!! Overall we had a great time.Ambar see you soon.
Love this new restaurant! Will be going back very soon

My wife (Who is Serbian) and I went to Ambar last night. After some time to mull over our experience I have to give it a glowing review. I frequently feel like I am expected at restaurants to accept that I am in DC and will pay a premium for things you can get elsewhere more cheaply. I did not feel that was the case at Ambar (though for some, they may still see the menu as being too pricey).Service was excellent, if I had to dock a point somewhere it would be that the servers are maybe too attentive but frankly I prefer that in a restaurant with this price point. My waitress was pleasant and helpful, and quick to assist with anything I needed. The support staff also seemed very approachable which I appreciated. The general manager Uros came to speak with us and I had a great time talking about the restaurant in general.Drinks were great, though I couldn't bring myself to drink the Serbian beer at US prices considering it's about $2-$3 in Belgrade. Sorry guys! They do have some bottles priced a little steep for my taste, though Balkin drink isn't about beer! The wine and liquors were top notch, and I felt made up for the expensive beer. While I do like a New Belgium Trippel, the opportunity to have some uniquely Balkin grape wines was exciting. I also enjoyed all of the rakija I tried, though it may not be for everyone. The closest I could equate it to is brandy, but if you are in the mood for something to warm you up you can't get anything better. The bar also has several cocktails and a cool selection of spirits ranging from vodka to scotch.Food was awesome. The plates are small, slightly larger than tapas. Definitely try the white veal soup, as well as the veal stew. Bacon wrapped prunes... oh man. I would go on more here but I have a feeling you can't really go wrong with the food. It seemed that every option we had was great, and I felt like I was getting an amazing flavor with every bite.Atmosphere is excellent. A cozy modern take on a barn, with agricultural notes mixed in with inviting glass and wood.Definitely coming back. I'm interested to see what happens in the coming months.

My girlfriend and I went there on Saturday night. We've never been in any of Balkan countries but I after dinning in Ambar I think that out next vacation will be visiting Balkan countries, especially Belgrade. Our waiter was born and raised in Balgrade. We learned so much about their culture and he gave us great suggestions about the food. Of course that he knows what is the best. There were no mistakes. We tried sopska salad, cevapi, sarma and gibanica. OMG!!!! I was in haven. Everything was so authentic and cooked to perfection. We met great people there and we felt like part of the family. One of the managers stopped by at the table and explains the dÃ©cor of the restaurant is what AMBAR is. He also gave us a taste of Balkan with a traditional rakija. What strong liquor but you have to know how to drink it, that's what he said.I felt warm like I was in a cabin. I'm really thankful for places like Ambar because if there weren't places like this, restaurants would always be contemporary but stone cold...you know what I mean. I will see you soon my friends!!!

I don't usually write reviews but I was really bothered by my experience there! It is a really cute ramen shop in DC, but they have some racist employees and clientele.
