I heard this white lady at the bar talking about the black bar tender's hair & one of the white managers was co-signing it! I was there just to get a few drinks because one of my friends wanted ramen but I would never go again! The drink was strong and good but I would not give them my money.
Terrible!!! I would give -1 stars if I could!!! Staff & food used to be soooo much better :(

First off, God only knows why the proprietors thought to combine Japan and Charlie Chaplin, considering Japanese untranationalists tried to assassinate the silver screen star in 1932 to incite political crisis out of revenge.I would have enjoyed the fairly decent food if I hadn't drowned in the cacophony of nonsensical music ranging from 2000s garage punk to Spanish merengue to electronic house pop. Meanwhile they project silent Chaplin films on the wall, except that people are too distracted by the waitstaff's uniforms. Waiters and waitresses rush around in a fashion catastrophe of traditional black server uniforms overlaid with suspenders that look like they came from Hot Topic. But the Hot Topic/Spencer's look is probably appropriate given the horrible decor, which looks like it was chosen by an edgy middle school scene girl who combined her fascination with "mature" dark colors with her manga obsession -- the only fathomable reason why Japanese influences could be imagined in this dark, claustrophobic, musically tone deaf, town house trying to pass itself off as a restaurant when it can barely put together a sensical theme. Did I mention the smell of butane hanging in the air? Beyond aesthetic concerns, our waitress was curt, vocally abrasive, and rushing us out the door. Sadly, we were still hungry when we were finally pushed out as she did not put one of our orders in. I wish we could have rectified this omission, but she checked in on us once every fortnight, too busy mixing drinks at the bar. It seems that Chaplin's has taken its final bow for us.
I really did not like the ramen. Try something else.
This place used to be my absolute favorite but things have really gone downhill. I will say the food in person can be good but the delivery isn't always the best.

Came here with a few friends as I had heard good things about their ramen. It was really salty and not hot. The server was really kind and did give us a small discount to the end but not sure I'll be back for their ramen. Pork buns were good!
Despite the douchey crowd, the ramen is good. Everything is a bit overpriced though.
just ok.
pretty good ramen.... and yummy drnks!

I escaped the hell of the workplace, and my sweet boyfriend took me here. The vibes were immaculate. I had no idea that it was the same owner as Zeppelin (a place I already love). Our bartender was fast and sweet. Very attentive. The chicken Kara age....heavenly. If you come for happy hour, you must try this. Shrimp gyros was a solid 9/10 after a couple drinks. We weren't a huge fan of the pork shumai.

I came when they first opened and a few times since then. I'm sad to say the quality in their food has shifted for the worse but their drinks are to perfection. The bar area is usually hopping. Which makes waiting for a table a bit awkward because they don't have a waiting area. Good place for a quick drink after work.
Ramen is great and the drinks are even better
The food and drinks were great. If you like interesting drinks then this place is for you.

This place is a great hang out for food and really cool drinks in DC! It's conveniently located near the Convention Center so people outside of DC exploring the city for good food and drinks can just walk two blocks and get in to this cool place. This place is a great hang out for food and really cool drinks in DC. Great service!
Went for a birthday celebration here it was my first time, but likely not my last enjoyed service and food.
Good place
Chaplin's A.S.S. is hands down the best non-traditional ramen I've ever had

Chaplin's Restaurant has such a cozy vibe, and the food is absolutely delicious. The service was quick and friendly, and I loved how fresh everything tasted--I'm definitely coming back!Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

Embark on a delightful culinary adventure at this charming spot, where savory ramen and creative cocktails take center stage. As someone who appreciates a good bowl of ramen, I can confidently say that this place hits all the right notes. The flavors are bold and satisfying, leaving you feeling fully content. And don't forget to try the fried gyoza - it's the perfect complement to your meal.The ambiance here is cozy and intimate, with soft lighting that sets the scene for a relaxed and romantic evening, ideal for a date night. And the service? Top-notch every time, ensuring that you're well taken care of from the moment you step through the door. Whether you're a ramen aficionado or just looking for a delicious meal, this spot won't disappoint.
My FAMILY I start coming here 2020Made friends with all the staff though out the months. Very proud to know them
Love chaplins! Get the dumplings they inject tableside - very fun and so tasty. I love to sit outside during the summertime, but the indoor bar is very unique as well. Great service. Will return!

Chaplin's is one of my go to spots in Shaw! LOVE that they offer fresh noodz made in house, and their frozen cocktails are low key lifechanging. DEF recommend their seasonal cold ramen, and their mappo maze's probably one of the best noodle dishes I've had in DC. PS. their patio is dog friendly, and they have a killer happy hour DAILY so make sure you pay them a visit. PSS. they have these whiskey injected dumplings that are REALLY yum and insta-worthy, lol. They'll fill them up for you right at your table.

Love everything! The server seemed new for his job but I know he was trying his best so no complain about that at all. We appreciate his service. Ramen was amazing! Appetizer was delicious! I'm coming back soon!

This place has a unique and vibrant vibe that instantly draws you in. The fusion of Japanese and American flavors creates a menu that is both intriguing and satisfying. During happy hour, the cocktails shine with their creativity and balance. The Fried Wontons are a delightful start, crispy and filled with savory goodness. Vegetarian Gyozas offer a tasty twist on the traditional dumpling. But the real stars of the show are the ramens. The Mappo Maze packs a spicy punch, not for the faint of heart but a treat for those who can handle the heat. The Chaplin ramen, on the other hand, takes you on a unique culinary journey with its complex flavors. And if you have room for dessert, the ichigo parfait is a delicious treat to share, combining the flavors of strawberry shortcake with a satisfying crunch of corn flakes. The prices are a bit on the higher side, but the happy hour specials make it a great value for a memorable dining experience.

I had an absolutely fantastic experience at Chaplain! This place never fails to impress. From the moment I walked in, I received excellent assistance. The restaurant offers a variety of seating options, and my friend and I decided on the bar, which turned out to be a great choice. The Bartender on the bottom floor is a true mixologist, and watching him craft our drinks and others was a delightful treat. I ordered an espresso martini, a days pleasure, and the cure. All amazing drinks. The overall atmosphere was very relaxed and laid-back, creating a perfect setting for a great evening. Our drinks and food were served promptly, and I must say, the Chaplin Ramen with extra nori, ground pork, bok choy, and spicy sauce was simply amazing! The flavors were on point, and I loved the fact that they encourage guests to customize their ramen by adding extras for the full experience.Chaplain certainly stands out among other restaurants for its top-notch service, skilled bartenders, and delicious dishes. I highly recommend trying their ramen with all the extras for the ultimate dining experience.
Great food, service and ambiance. Would be happy to go back anytime! Cocktails were amazing!

Really good atmosphere on a buzzing Thursday night. Dropped in as a walk-in in about 10pm Sat night, sat at the bar to be greeted by a very friendly and attentive bar person. Good cocktail list, delicious Karaage. Good fun despite being on my own. Would recommend and certainly will return.
Good stuff.things lit on fire. yum.
Jerson was a pleasure!!! Definitely coming back. Food was amazin.
This is one of my girlfriend and I's go-to spots to get together. The ramen is perfect and so are the cocktails!

This is a great bar. To go to in the dc area . I like to come here and watch football on sundays they have a good happy hour menu there prices are reasonable for dc . Everybody knows dc is a pricey place to get drinks and have fun ,but this place is definitely worth it . Anybody coming into the dc area i highly recommend this place to get a drink and have a good time
If you've been disappointed recently THEN COME TO Chaplin's because the service, food and drinks will NOT disappoint.
Jake the bartender is awesome!!! Because of his service I'm back and will be here weekly!!!
Everything I've ever tried here was delicious. Very nice atmosphere and friendly staff too.
Had the Chaplin ASS and it was good! The dumplings were good as well, I would try the infused ones next time I go.
Great food, great vibe, great drinks!

What a great concept! Happy hour drinks were huge and a great value!! The food was so tasty and service was great. We had the Chaplin and the Chaplin A.S.S. ramen entrees, as well as fried Gyoza. love the old Hollywood theme as well.
Excellent Service, wonderful staff. Worth it.
Phenomenal! One of my favorite DC restaurants.
Love this bar... love the food... love the drinks... the bartenders are amazing and they care that you have a good time and enjoy their drinks... !!!

Fried wonton is bomb here. Best I ever had. I had the Chaplin a.s.s. it was good. Flavor was a bit different for me. The fried dumpling were also great. Pricing is not bad. Service was friendly. No complaint.
This is by far my favorite neighborhood restaurant. Order the Tan Tan Men!
Drinks: 9/10Food: 8/10Decor: 10/10Service: 10/10

My favorite ramen place in DC. Their pork buns are on point, and I usually order the Tan Tan Men as a main course which has just the right amount of spice. Their cocktail selection is fantastic and really creative. My favorite are their frozen cocktails - these are rather strong (think long island iced tea) but thoughtfully crafted and really delicious.
1st time while visiting DC. Outstanding! Should bring it to Los Angeles.
Food is on point. Get the chicken to start then the Ramen A S S soup.
I love the outdoor seating, especially in the summer time! The drinks have always been just what I needed after a long day at work.
Bomb to the fullest. Cant wait to go again.

This place is great !!! Been here a few times and every time has been a great experience. The scene is great on weekends. great happy hour and good drink selection. Food is also good. The staff was friendly and i will go back again :)
Amazing place and food is wonderful.

If I say this place is awesome, will that work for my review?Whenever someone has mentioned Ramen in the past, I instantly think of the soup I ate going to college. This place knocked my socks off!The Ramen is so flavorful, I don't know where to begin. I've been here a couple times and I have left it up to my server what to try. I haven't been let down at all.Great array of appetizers and the drink selection has to be among the best in DC.I plan on going again this week and will be sure to take pictures of the offerings. Simply delicious.
So good!!! This place was amazing.

I'm no food snob so don't read this expecting a detailed breakdown of the food, drink, atmosphere, and cultural history. Not that there's anything wrong with that sort of thing.Great food, great drinks, and had a really great time. I've been here 4 times now and it's been solid across the board. This last time I sat at the bar and was treated to a grand time by Rob and Jake. Both are masters of their craft. Usually when someone says "Ramen", I think of the cheap noodles from my college days. This place flipped everything and each dish is layered with flavor. Go here if you're looking for something different but delicious.

It seems I've come here more often since the weather has gotten colder. I love their cocktails specifically City Lights and enjoy the Chaplin A.S.S. with pork belly and an egg. The ramen broth is the right amount of spicy with a hint of coconut flavor. The place can get really crowded on the weekends but the service is always excellent. They really go out of their way to ensure you're satisfied.

LOVE this place. They recently included some veggie options on their menu and I order the veggie wantons every time I'm there. The staff, owners and patrons are always great and I get to chat with fun people (new friends and old) every time I'm there.

I came here when Chaplin first opened and had a great time. Awesome cocktails and dumplings. I was thrilled to find out they have changed chefs and now their ramen is some of the best I have had in the city. The place is beautiful and I am glad to see Shaw becoming a great place to go out and eat and drink!

**Restaurant Review: Terrible Service and Disappointing Food**My recent visit to this restaurant was an absolute disaster, primarily due to the appalling service. When we first arrived, we seated ourselves as there was no host at the door. Shortly after, an angry, short Indigenous man named Wilson approached us. In a rather confrontational manner, he demanded that we get up and go back to the door to request a seat. There was no one waiting, but it seemed like he was on a power trip, making us form an unnecessary line.Things only got worse from there. Wilson started verbally attacking my wife and me, scolding us for not waiting at the door. I explained that there were no signs posted or a host available, but he seemed intent on making a scene. This place is an absolute dump when it comes to service. To top it off, after enduring his rudeness throughout our meal, Wilson confronted me in front of the entire restaurant because I refused to pay him a 20% tip for his "service". It was humiliating and completely uncalled for.As for the food, it was mediocre at best. I've had much better, and this certainly isn't authentic Mexican cuisine. It's more of a watered-down Tex-Mex, akin to street food, but not in a good way. Overall, the horrendous service and subpar food make this place one to avoid. There are plenty of other restaurants that offer better food and much better service.
they were pretty rude and said a glass of water was $1 which I found also pretty odd so wouldn't recommend
Don't go there because me and my family order food but they didn't put the right food
I called the restaurant literally 11 times and no one answered. Too bad they missed my business.

I came on a trip to Washington and Decided to try this place out. We came in and there was no one there to sit us down, me and my husband were a bit confused if they had to sit us or we had to sit ourselves. But we decided to just sit, the tables that were empty were dirty. The waitress then came out to greet us and cleaned the table and asked us what we wanted. Food was great!! I do recommend this place it's just the staffing that seemed as they didn't really care. She then went ahead and tipped herself even tho she wasn't really serving us, never asked to refill us until we asked her to. Total was $75 plus her $15 tip in total $90 for two ppl.

What's up El Sol with the health code violations, listed in the WashPost on May 3, 2017?El Sol Restaurant and Tequileria1227 11th St. NWClosed April 26 because of insects, rodents and other pests. Reopened Friday.

The food is excellent but WAY OVERPRICED. for 2 entrees and 2 drinks I paid over 60 dollars. That's a burrito and 3 small small tacos (samplers size). Guys, I had 4 nights in DC. Went to tons of places. This was certainly good but overpriced unfortunately.
The food here is incredibly authentic, right down to the freshly made lemonade. Among their offerings, I particularly enjoyed the burritos and the guacamole - they were my favorites.
The food tasted incredibly authentic, right down to the homemade lemonade. My personal favorites were the burritos and the freshly made guacamole.
The food is delicious but they have the worst service I have ever had. We came from Houston Texas to try their food but never again!
This place is pretty cash. Highly recommend.
I'm always on the lookout for another neighborhood joint where I can satisfy my taco cravings. El Sol is totally that place (and plenty more besides)!

El Sol is in the former El Sauce location but it is a completely different place. Neighbors who may have feared and avoided this location when is was the dangerous bar, but is is transformed now. You should give it a try. Completely gutted and transformed interior. Food is authentic and well flavored. Great value. We had three tacos, all well prepared, and the chile relleno which was rich, delicious, and spicy. We will be back. Service by (perhaps) the owners was kind and welcoming.

2 visits, two delicious meals for 2 at $30.Part of my weekly rotation now as an affordable, delicious Mexican food option.Sopes with Chicken Tinga, Enchilades Verdes with Chicken, the salsas and habenaro condiment are all stand out.Restaurant seems to be always busy, service can be a bit hectic...but again, $30 for 2 for delicious food is worth the little hic-ups.
Delicious food and exciting atmosphere.

I've been there last Sunday for brunch with my friends. That was outstanding brunch! I had ceviche, chicken milanesa and somthing that I could not remember the name but they are all great. I will be back soon.

This place came highly recommended and it did not disappoint. I almost wanted to keep it a secret just for the locals, but I must share my discovery. As someone who is usually very picky when places claim to have "authentic" Mexican food, I was pleasantly surprised. As soon as I opened the menu and saw the variety of plates, I knew this was no ordinary taco joint.The restaurant has a beautiful upstairs seating area with an additional downstairs space. I ordered an horchata, and that alone sealed my 5-star review. I tried the Canasta de Tacos and Torta, and they were a 10/10. I can't wait to go back and sample more of their delectable platters.
Excellent food!In a nice neighborhood and it's a short walk away from the convention center.

El Sol was recommended by our Airbnb host and she said she goes there when she is home sick. It did not disappoint! Very authentic Mexican food. We had the El Sol Fajitas and of course the California Fish Tacos. Best Fajitas I've ever had. The Margaritas hit the spot too. I highly recommend
The food here is excellent, and the atmosphere is lively. The enchiladas are simply amazing, and the horchata is out of this world. I'm definitely a huge fan!

Discovered another gem on Yelp while in DC. We decided to grab a late afternoon lunch based on the reviews, and it did not disappoint. The chicken nachos, carnitas tacos, and flautas with pollo were all delicious! While the service was a bit slow, the staff was friendly enough.

I'm thrilled with my online order and the smooth curbside pickup experience from here! The service was quick, and the food was incredibly satisfying. Honestly, I'm delighted that the food was so delicious, but also a bit concerned about the temptation of having this place so close to my house! It's a win-win situation, for sure, haha.I ordered the Tinga tacos, featuring chicken in a red sauce that adds a hint of spice and a burst of flavor. Additionally, I got an asada taco, chips and salsa, chicken enchiladas, and cheese enchiladas. Everything was absolutely fantastic! It delivered the authentic Mexican restaurant experience I was hoping for. My standout favorite was the spicy green salsa! It set my mouth on fire, and I couldn't get enough of it. The tinga tacos were a delight, and the enchiladas with rice and beans were unbeatable. It turned out to be the best impromptu Valentine's dinner at home!

We tried the queso, chicken burrito, shrimp taco, octopus taco, and cactus. Everything was delicious, except the cactus taco. Maybe I just don't like cactus, but the flavor was muted and the texture was slimy (kind of like ocra).

All I have to say is YUM. The beef enchilada was absolutely delicious. The staff are incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about the menu - definitely ask for recommendations. Can't wait to come back!

Soooo good! Found this restaurant on Yelp and gave it a try. We were not disappointed! It's a hole in the wall and we drove past it the first time, but once we found it we were glad we circled back. The food is so good! It's very small with a few outdoor tables, but we had no problems on a Sunday for a late lunch.
The food is delicious!!! And the margaritas were so amazing. I will definitely be going back when I come back to DC!

Wow, my first time eating here and all I can say is We love it!!.. We came from New Jersey to visit around and We found this restaurant close to where We staying, We tried the chicken fajitas and it was perfect, the service perfect, they give you some chips and water as courtesy before your main dish
Great margaritas, great chips and salsa , and a great burrito! This was a good find!!
Only place I've found in DC that has huitlacoche quesadillas and I'm so here for it. Perfection, I always over-order and have to take stuff home and that's exactly what I want.

We were pleased to see most of the tables occupied by families and couples at this new eatery in our neighborhood on Saturday evening! The prior establishment was not very welcoming, so the brightly colored, well-lit new place an excellent improvement!We had a great server and appreciated the vibrant menu with many pictures and helpful descriptions. For such a petite space, there was an impressive array of menu options. Our selections were relatively healthy and tasty.For drinks, we enjoyed two aguas frescas - an horchata and a mango-strawberry. We finished with dessert - flan and platanos.  Prices are very reasonable and atmosphere low-key and family-friendly. For soccer fans, two big screens with games playing.
Awsome food.Highly recommend, great service. WILL DEF BE BACK!

This is, as of the date of this review, the best non-fancy Mexican food in DC. I always get their gorditas, which are like pupusas but fried goodness and filled with even yummier goodness. My fav are the carnitas + cactus. The other day I resisted my usual fare and my table tried the flautas (rolled up chicken taquitos), mussels + chorizo, and the green salsa chilaquiles. Everything was delicious and of a caliber I haven't seen since I left California. Their fajitas are solid, although not very inventive as a dish (and that's generally the case everywhere). I've also had their guacamole, the mole + red enchiladas. My goal is to eat through their entire menu. The tortas are next.
carnitas were very nice, very small and warm space to enjoy some really great valued Mexican food. staff is genuine and fast. love grabbing a bite here
I'm from Texas. Will probably be the only place I'll go for Tex-Mex in DC from now on.
Best Mexican tacos, handmade tortillas. The waitress was on point, this place is fantastic.
Was t sure about this place at first glance but setting all pretentious feelings aside this is hands down one of my favorite places in DC and I absolutely love the queso fondido!

I am SO thrilled my taco google search led me to El Sol. I am in a committed relationship with this joint and have no plan on breaking up anytime soon. The restaurant is small, so the long wait is a turn off for some, but I have found that the best things come to those who wait...including this Mexican food. It's a hidden gem in the Shaw neighborhood but has seems to get busier and busier every time I go in. The menu is ginormous, which is overwhelming at first, but then you realize that this overwhelming feeling is the kind of feeling you want as there are SO many delicious options to choose from. We started with the nachos and usually when you order nachos out, the chip-to-topping ratio is weak, but fear not. El Sol has got your back in this department. A loud atmosphere, not ideal for a first date as people mainly seem to go there for the great food and not intimate conversation. These days, every restaurant deems themselves as "authentic" where I call bullsh*t most of the time. But this place definitely falls under that category of true authenticity.
Amazing food! Awesome spot and service was great. Can't wait to go back.
The food was delicious. Staff were professional and efficient. We had a group of 6 service was great and the staff was fun and helpful with food suggestions.

A Flavorful Journey to Puerto Rico in the Heart of DC at Qui QuiDiscovering Qui Qui was like finding a piece of Puerto Rico tucked away in the bustling landscape of DC. Having lived in the DMV area for several years, I have ventured across numerous culinary establishments, experiencing an array of dishes, from pop-up kitchens to well-established eateries.Amidst the varied experiences, Qui Qui stands out as the unequivocal pinnacle of authentic Puerto Rican cuisine in DC. The array of dishes prepared here are not merely cooked, they are crafted with passion, delivering an authentic taste that's second to none.The secret of Qui Qui's exceptional culinary offering lies in their careful selection of fresh ingredients combined with a deft mastery of seasoning. Every dish tastes as if it was prepared in a traditional Puerto Rican kitchen, taking your senses on a flavorful journey to the island itself.But Qui Qui is not just about food. It's about the overall experience. The ambiance is relaxed, creating a welcoming atmosphere that perfectly complements the delectable cuisine. While the prices may be a tad higher compared to other restaurants, the quality of the food and the unparalleled dining experience make every cent spent well worth it.In summary, if you're seeking a culinary excursion to Puerto Rico without leaving DC, Qui Qui is the place to be. A trip to this restaurant is not merely a meal, it's a flavorful adventure that encapsulates the essence of Puerto Rican cuisine.
I went to check put this Puertorican spot in DC and let me tell you guys it was a 10/10. Definitely recommend it was delish and there food is very Authentic!! I will definitely be coming back!
Perfect flavor! Nice staff, nice music! Would visit again. Need reservation. Small place, nice setting.
This place is so over priced and I saw a cockroach coming from behind bar ! And when i brought it up with management they denied it ! I saw it w my own two eYes and will never go back
This place is so over priced and I saw a cockroach coming from behind bar ! And when i brought it up with management they denied it ! I saw it w my own two eyes ! I will never go back

The food here is great and I've taken out of town visitors many times, but I have finally had enough. The bartender/"manager" provides consistently terrible service. So bad that I probably won't return. He is actively unfriendly and generally give the impression that our presence might be the worst thing he's had to deal with all week. When you ask for a manager to lodge a complaint, he says that he's the manager. Great. Thanks. Prepare to be confused and given no answer or an extremely unhelpful answer for any questions that arise. With so many other options around this place, including pizza that is as good (if not better) at Ghibellina across the street with service that is a thousand times better, do yourself a favor and spend your money elsewhere.
If I could give this place zero stars I would. Rude staff, terrible pizza, and extremely over-priced.
Food was good and our waiter nice but the food server was quite rude - more than once - so will not return.
This place is way overpriced for what they serve and the manager is super rude ! After i found glass in my food he didn't even apologize or cover cost of $5 appetizer

Etto used to be among our favorite places in the neighborhood. The bartenders are superb, and the wines are great. But unfortunately the quality of the food has dropped since the early days. The details are off on the small plates (too much liquid on the plates, octopus salad is tough and not properly flavored, pizza crust is too wet!) And last evening I showed up without my complete party and the hostess tole me it would be 10-15 minutes for a table. 10 minutes later, when my party was complete, I was told it would be 20 minutes longer. The hostess said that this was because other, complete parties had arrived and taken the tables in the meantime. If that is the system then on what basis can the hostess give a time estimate? The communication was deliberately misleading, and this kind of treatment of regular (neighborhood) customers is the height of arrogance for a restaurant that cannot maintain its quality. We won't be returning.

When I asked if I could be seated at a different table, hostess was incredibly rude, and I could see her roll her eyes several times. I'm am in the industry, and if this is the way the visit is going to begin, it sets the tone for the rest of the meal. Food was good but the die had been cast. I'm a fan of 2Amy's, but I would avoid this place.
The food was good, but not great. The service was pretty bad though.

We visited Etto Saturday. Beautiful patio, perfect for people watching. We liked the service, with both the staff and managers handling the crowded Saturday night well.In terms of food, we loved the rhubarb ice cream crumble, the eggplant and sausage appetizers. We were somewhat underwhelmed by the pizza, whose crust was soft and slightly undercooked. There also wasn't enough fresh mozzarella. Given that the pizza was the main reason for our visit, that was fairly disappointing. So whereas we appreciated the service and the atmosphere, I wouldn't return for the food. Perhaps for appetizer and drinks!
Good okay, but pricey (especially wine). Save some bucks and head to Ghibbelina across the street. Could be different at HH tho.

This is a great little Italian place, with an emphasis on pizza. The menu is small, but specials change frequently. The dishes are simple but good. The beer list is short, but they have some very good beers.
Enjoyable little bites ... we didn't get the pizza ... but while the vibe and service was excellent I didn't leave there dying to go back.
I get it. They have pizza. OMG a wood oven!

This place is solid. I loved the cheese we got. So delicious! But the pizza was too salty, to be honest. I like the atmosphere and the vibe though, and the service was great. I will definitely go back, and maybe a different pizza will have less salt.
Simple Italian fare that sparkles. Great selection of seasonal salads and pizzas. The celery salad is fantastic!
location: Central San Jose, San Jose, CA

text: I love everything I've had here except . . . the pizza. The latter comes out always tasting burnt due to the high ash content on the bottom of the crust. As well, the crust is floppy in a spongy way that I've never experienced in a Neapolitan pizza.That being said, everything else is delicious, top notch. If you stay away from the pizza, you are sure to have a fabulous meal.
Very good and as close to Italian food as it can get in DC

Great Atmosphere, nice and homy Big fan of Two Amy's, but had a burnt pizza when we came here on their first week. Came back the second time, the pizza was perfect! Great for a cozy cold cuts and pizza night out.still, not as cozy as Two Amy's, but with the fact that they're on 14th, we'll be here more often than traveling all the way to Tanley Town.Cheers!
Excellent food.
Excellent service paired with excellent pizza. The staff was nice, the Establishment was clean, and the pizza was delicious
Stopped in to get some pizza. They have a great selection and the pizzas were delicious. Decent beer selection too. Nice spot
This was the most amazing dining experience my wife and I have had since touring America! Thank you for an unforgettable night!
Can't go wrong with anything you order-- delicious food, fresh and well-made, and great service
One of my favorite pizza places. I love their wine selection and delicious stone fired pizzas. Came on a date and the staff made it all super awesome. Will be back again soon!

Great food and great service! I'd definitely recommend this place! It is a bit small so it's not really good for big groups but it has such good food! Our waitress was so patient with all of our questions and all her. Recommendations we're delicious!!
Great pizza here. The dough is amazing and made well. I wish they had more of a selection though. I would go more often if there were more pizza choices.

I really love this place. The pizza was AMAZING and only found out towards the end that its the same owners of 2Amy's (well, duh). The margherita and veg one was so delicious and the not-so-thick crust made it filling but not guiltily so. Highly recommend -- the ambiance is perfect for a date :)

The most interesting pizza place on 14th ST.  No question.  They have a flour mill in the dining room to grind their own flour for the pizza and bread. All the food is cooked in the little wood oven in the back. There is no other kitchen. Really impressive what they can do without a stove. I love the roman artichokes, the house made salami, and always the pizza. Good for weekend lunch too. I live in the neighborhood and sometimes just call in an order for a pizza to go when I dont feel like cooking.  The best.

This has become my go-to-spot in the neighborhood.  I'm always happy with a pizza and a caesar salad.  And these guys do way better than average versions of both. Never had to wait to get a table, especially weekends at lunch. The last pizza I had at Etto was some kind of house made spicy Italian ham with roasted onions and olives. Sooooo goooood.  Get there!
It's very expensive. The food is not all that. Wish I just got up and left. The prices are outrages.
Service and food sucks, what's more disappointing is I wasted my time coming here I can always get my money back but my time is gone pointlessly smh.

8.16.21 I went here by myself and sat at the bar, host were wonderful and thinking it was going to be a good experience, from that it was wasn't. I ordered a beer and the standard Japanese whiskey. When I had to use the restroom I asked the bartender where the restroom was and I went there, when I came back from bathroom my whiskey was tossed and beer was left alone, I was thrown off as to why my whiskey was tossed and I didn't drink it yet, and none of the bartenders could answer so I asked for another one and they charged me for both whiskey which was unacceptable. Then I ordered food to go because I was uncomfortable being there and I have allergy to pork and they told me they could fry my chicken in regular oil because normally everything is fried in pork oil, nasty btw, but when I'm getting ready to leave I check bag to make sure everything was there, I had 3 small chicken sandwich. I run to bathroom again before I Leave and I then I head out with my food to go and check again and one of my sandwiches were missing. I didn't have the time to argue with someone or bring the manager over but this place is unacceptable and the services was off. I've been to so many restaurants in dc and also am a bar manager in DMV area and this was not ok. So I'm never coming here again. And would advice others not to spend money here.
Way way way too expensive for what it is. Presentation is nice but there is nothing luxury about chicken and waffles costing $40.

It's a nice ambiance. The food is fairly good, thought when you have had a crab cake you know the difference between a crab cake and a cake crab. A bit to be desired in regard to that.  Though, if you stick to the chicken you will fair well.

I was super excited to eat here, I saw a lot of people raving about this restaurant on social media. The ambiance was nice. The waitress we had was distracted on her phone, she didn't introduce herself and she didn't offer us drinks. She was mostly no where to be doing when we wanted to order our drinks. The quality of the food wasn't that great I would give it a 5/10. I had their brunch I'm not sure if their dinner is better. But I most likely won't be coming back.
Great food, food is always good. Never had bad food or bad service here! The bar staff is always nice and makes good drinks!
Service was good. The drinks and food was good. The ribs were so good. I would go there for the ribs again.

Yardbird Table & Bar brings Southern comfort food with a modern twist. Their fried chicken is perfectly crispy, the biscuits are buttery and soft, and the bourbon selection is top-notch. The laid-back yet classy vibe makes it great for brunch with friends or cocktails at the bar. I will definitely be back.Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

Returning to this spot for a second visit felt like rekindling an old flame--familiar, but with a modern twist. This restaurant has mastered the art of Southern comfort with a contemporary edge, making it a go-to for brunch or dinner. From shared plates to craft cocktails, every element of the dining experience is designed to keep you coming back.We kicked things off with an unusual appetizer choice--fried Brussels sprouts. I wasn't expecting much from the humble sprout, but wow, they were a game-changer. Perfectly crisp with just the right seasoning, they left us contemplating if they should be a permanent part of every meal.The star of the show, though, was the fried chicken. They've tweaked the way they serve it since our last visit. Gone are the mashed potatoes and salad that once accompanied the dish. Now, it's all about the chicken itself, and honestly, it doesn't need any extras. Juicy, flavorful, and fried to golden perfection, it's just as delicious as ever. That said, we opted for a side of French fries this time, which were good, but next time I might pair it with a refreshing salad to balance things out.I also had the pleasure of stopping by for lunch on a weekday during a conference in DC. Even with a party of seven, we were seated quickly, which was a nice surprise. The lunch menu is compact, but don't let that fool you--there's something for everyone. One of the highlights of the meal was the lobster mac n cheese. The presentation caught us off guard in the best way possible--it had a whimsical touch that made the entire table laugh. But don't let the playful appearance fool you
In town for a conference. Great food and great service (Xavier), would definitely come back to eat.

On a scale of 1 to 10, I'm giving Yardbird a 9.5My meal was scrumptious. Dined there for the Fourth of July and they offered a wonderful holiday menu which included a mixed grill of ribs barbecue chicken andouille sausage brisket and corn on the cob! The deviled eggs appetizer and the blueberry cobbler with strawberry ice cream and vanilla whip cream topped off the patriotic theme of red white and blue. Finally the specialty drinks were phenomenal.

My guest and I had the pleasure of dining at Yard Bird in DC for the first time today, and it certainly won't be our last. Despite the restaurant being quite busy during lunchtime, the service we received was nothing short of stellar.We were lucky enough to be served by Lanita, who we later discovered is the general manager. Lanita's exceptional service truly made our visit memorable. She was attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure we had a fantastic dining experience. It's rare to find such dedication and warmth in customer service, and Lanita certainly sets the bar high.Now, let's talk about the food - it was simply amazing! Every dish we tried was bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. Yard Bird has definitely mastered the art of comfort food with a gourmet twist. From the perfectly seasoned fried chicken to the mouth-watering sides, every bite was a delight.In summary, Yard Bird in DC offers not just great food, but an outstanding dining experience, thanks in large part to Lanita's impeccable service. We can't wait to return and explore more of their delicious menu. Highly recommend!
Great good good ambiance, my second drink didn't come out the same but not taking it away from them

Yardbird restaurant in Washington, DC, is a culinary oasis that never fails to delight the senses. From the moment you step through the door, you're enveloped in an atmosphere of warmth and hospitality. Let's start with the food: the Caesar salad, a classic dish elevated to new heights with fresh, crisp romaine lettuce, perfectly toasted croutons, and a dressing that strikes the perfect balance between creamy and tangy. Each bite is a symphony of flavors that leaves you craving more.Next up, the meatballs. These tender morsels of meat are a testament to Yardbird's commitment to quality ingredients and expert preparation. Served in a rich, flavorful sauce that practically begs to be sopped up with crusty bread, these meatballs are a must-try for any carnivore.And then there are the short ribs, a dish so divine it's almost impossible to describe. Slow-cooked to perfection, the meat practically melts in your mouth, releasing a burst of savory goodness with every bite. Paired with a side of creamy mashed potatoes and tender vegetables, it's comfort food at its finest.Of course, no meal at Yardbird is complete without a drink or two. The cocktail made with passion fruit, pineapple, coconut rum, and bitters is a tropical paradise in a glass. Sipping on this refreshing concoction transports you to a sun-drenched beach, where worries melt away and all that matters is the sheer pleasure of the moment.In summary, Yardbird restaurant in Washington, DC, is a culinary gem that never fails to impress. With its impeccable food, warm atmosphere, and expertly crafted cocktails, it's the perfect spot for any occasion, whether you're celebrating a special occasion or simply indulging in a night out on the town.
One of the best steaks and fries I've ever had .., and the chimichurri was just amazing!
Great service. The menu is limited, everything is over priced, and the drinks are subpar.
Great ambiance. Great meal options - especially for brunch. Professional staff. Drinks taste great!
The food was amazing, the staff was so friendly and answered all my questions, and the atmosphere was amazing for a dinner with friends!

Located within the Planet Word Museum, this restaurant offers both indoor and street access for patrons seeking a solo dining experience.I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and drinks at this establishment. The menu offers a diverse selection of dishes inspired by cuisines from around the world, catering to all palates. I sampled Greek, Belgian, and El Salvadorian-inspired items, all of which were delightful. The Greek wings served with a feta dip stood out as a personal favorite. The cocktail menu told a story of the inspiration behind each drink, and I get so excited about details like this. The presentation of the bill in a passport book was a charming final touch.I highly recommend and will be back myself.
An underrated gem in DC. Great appetizers and mains. Kabobs were delicious. Asian cauliflower bites were superb.
Great food, went for lunch and was able to sit outside. Reasonable prices and delicious

I just got to try out the new Immigrant Food+ at the Planet Word Museum...and wow, I really see what the "plus" is all about!! This menu is totally unique from the group's other locations, and I was really impressed with the cocktail selections and the menu as a whole. The Immigrant Dim Sum Experience was truly a highlight. Can't wait to go back!!

The food was fantastic! However. Unfortunately , the service was excessively slow which decreased the overall experience . When one of the client at our table complained , the manager arrived and threatened to kick us out of the restaurant . While I appreciate the work of servers in difficult circumstances , the response from management was unacceptable . Will only return if proof of improved management is provided .

Contemplated writing this review but I came here friday night, had shannon as my server. I was appalled and flabbergasted about how RUDE she was towards me and my partner. Would appreciate if management would investigate this person. Food 10/10 service 1/10.
Great food, amazing vibe, and place to take a date to impress them on your knowledge of good food!

I recently dined at O-Ku and was blown away by the fresh, flavorful sushi. The atmosphere is laid-back but chic, making it the perfect spot for a relaxing meal with incredible food.Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

Oku is an absolute gem in the heart of DC! From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with a warm, modern ambiance that sets the perfect tone for an unforgettable dining experience.The menu is a masterpiece of creative and authentic flavors. Every dish we tried was meticulously crafted, blending fresh ingredients with innovative techniques. The sushi, in particular, was phenomenal--easily some of the best in the city. The freshness and presentation were top-notch.Service was impeccable, with attentive and knowledgeable staff who made excellent recommendations and ensured everything was perfect. The cocktail menu was equally impressive, offering unique, flavorful drinks that complemented the food beautifully.Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or just looking for a standout meal, Oku delivers on every level. It's clear they take pride in every detail, and it shows. Highly recommend this place--it's a must-visit for food lovers in DC!

O-Ku Review: Great Happy Hour Deals and Elegant AtmosphereWe visited O-Ku for happy hour and were impressed by the great deals. The standout dish was the Snow King roll, a delicious roll with salmon belly on top and yuzu mayo. The karaage was also a highlight.The service was friendly, though a tad slow at times. The atmosphere was elegant, with low lighting and a slightly chilly feel.It's important to note that not all rolls are half-off or discounted during happy hour--only a few select items are included. Overall, O-Ku offers a sophisticated dining experience with some fantastic happy hour options.
Fantastic ambiance and amazing sushi! The happy hour deals are great and the staff is very knowledgeable. I highly recommend for anyone looking for quality yummy sushi

Nestled in a bustling corner of the city, O-Ku is a hidden gem that transports diners to the culinary wonders of Japan. The moment you enter the restaurant, you are greeted by the fun music and the warm, inviting ambiance that sets the stage for a remarkable dining experience.The menu is a masterpiece of Japanese cuisine, expertly crafted and each dish is a work of art, showcasing the freshest seafood and the finest ingredients sourced from around the world. From delicate sashimi to perfectly rolled maki rolls, every bite is a symphony of flavors that dance on your taste buds.The staff at O-Ku are amazing! Tonight, Kyiah served us. She was attentive and knowledgeable, providing impeccable service that enhanced the overall dining experience. Kyiah learned that I just finished cancer treatment, and made me feel so unbelievably special that I cried. Thank you, Kyiah!Whether you're a sushi enthusiast or simply looking to explore new culinary horizons, O-Ku promises a dining experience that will leave you longing to return again and again.Must haves-broccolini, karaage, ube doughnuts, all the sushi!

At Itoku Sushi, prepare to be transported on a culinary journey that delights the senses in every way possible. From the moment you step through the door, you're greeted with a welcoming ambiance that sets the stage for an unforgettable dining experience. The menu is a testament to the chef's dedication to excellence, featuring a tantalizing array of sushi and sashimi options, each one meticulously prepared with the freshest ingredients available. Whether you're indulging in their signature rolls or savoring traditional nigiri, every bite is a symphony of flavors that leaves you craving more. The presentation is nothing short of exquisite, with each dish crafted to perfection and served with the utmost care. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable, and passionate about providing exceptional service, ensuring that every aspect of your meal is nothing short of perfect. Whether you're a sushi connoisseur or a newcomer to Japanese cuisine, Itoku Sushi is sure to leave a lasting impression with its impeccable quality, creativity, and attention to detail.
I came for my birthday dinner and it was amazing.Good attention, good food and good music !! Absolutely recommend this place !! 10/10

You can't ever go wrong with coming to O-Ku for HH (which is a great time), quick bite & drinks (sugar & spice - chef kiss). Service is amazing each time no matter the day or time. Love it here, my go to spot for sushi
This place was delicious! Everything was amazing can't go wrong! The drinks and the noodles were so good

I just visited this place for the second time and I must say, it exceeded my expectations once again. The sushi here is of top-notch quality and incredibly fresh. You can tell that the sushi chef is highly skilled by the way the dish is presented - the plating is beautiful, the sushi is well pressed, and the amount of wasabi used is just right, which really enhances the taste. Although the price is higher than your average Japanese restaurant, I can confidently say that it's worth every penny and the experience is truly amazing. If you haven't tried this place yet, I highly recommend it!
Atmosphere was great, service was great, food was great. Highly recommend trying if you get the chance to.

Thank you so much for your great services! My buddies and I had a blasting holiday dinner here. Selection of the fish varies ALOT, and the servers were very accomodating to my buddie's diet. Manager came to check on us how we were doing, and honestly, he was the best manager I've ever encountered. Thanks again for the great experience for my trip.

I had the pleasure of visiting O ku Sushi and it was an incredible experience. The customer service was top-notch and the fish and sushi rolls were excellent. They had some really unique sushi rolls with some really interesting tastes. The staff was super friendly and attentive, always making sure that we were comfortable and welcomed. The drinks were great too. My wife even put together her top five list of items for her next visit! The only downside is that it's extremely hard to get a reservation, so it's important to reserve a spot well in advance - but it's definitely worth it!
Great place to spend a good time

This review is only for cocktails and edamame... and of course, the service, which was excellent! We walked in around 6pm and found two seats at the bar. We had dinner reservations down the street at St. Anselm and came to O-ku for pre-dinner cocktails. Service was friendly and attentive. My partner had the Sugar & Spice (habanero infused vodka, passionfruit, citrus) which he liked enough to order two of. I had a sip and even though I can't handle spice, I thought it was delicious. I wish I could have had more!I tried both the Evening Incantation (vodka, blueberry, lavender, lemon) and the Empress Cosmopolitan (vodka, lychee, cranberry, lime, orange). I enjoyed both but the Evening Incantation was the winner for me.The only food we ordered was edamame and it was off-the-charts delicious. It IS actually possible to mess up edamame, despite its simple preparation. It was obvious that they took great care in its preparation, which I appreciated. I would love to come back to try more food!
Super cute decorations around the restaurant. The server was amazing!! The food and drinks were also amazing. We went late at night so it was not crowded but cannot wait to go back again!!

Service is amazing. Food is fresh and delicious, sushi rolls made great. We got recommendations from our waiter and that were really nice choice. They also provide good cocktails. Ambient atmosphere. Good prices.
Hands down the best Sushi in DC. Very cool ambiance and friendly staff. Outdoor seating was very cold the night we visited but the delicious hot sake warmed us up!
Great place to go during happy hour. The food and drinks are great. Will definitely come back again during happy hour.
Everything is so good- the rooftop always looks really great, definitely have to make it out there.
Delicious. I went last night and have been thinking about it since. The food, drinks and service were all awesome! I'll definitely be back
Wow!! That is all I can say! Everything about this place was great! Great service and great food!!! It is a great vibe inside and the cocktails are excellent!

There is a new sushi king in town! If you haven't been to O-Ku DC yet you really need to go. This sushi restaurant opened this past June and I finally had the opportunity to give them a try this weekend.O-Ku DC is located across from Union Market in the Northeast. The interior is modern and is multilevel with a whiskey bar on the second floor. My wife and I ate the sushi bar in the back on the first floor. The chefs cook food right in front of you on an open wood cooker. Our waiter as well as the rest of the staff did an amazing job. I've never been so full in all my life. The food is amazing! We tried some sushi, lobster and tried a couple of their drinks. So, so good! Although new it's been well maintained and taken care of. It's immaculate inside. Thank you for a great first experience. My wife and I can't wait to come back. In the meantime keep up the great work.
I love this place! I go every other week! The food is great and the service is AMAZING!
Food is amazing here. So much flavor! Their drinks are so good too! I would highly recommended checking them out

Went here with a party of six on a Friday night, everyone left full, happy, and blown away by the food and wine! We started with drinks at the bar, the ambiance and music was great. We proceeded to be seated and switched from cocktails to wine, we loved the Acumen most of all.Our (blonde, male) server was knowledgeable, patient, and super attentive. We ordered virtually every appetizer to share and proceeded with sushi. Our favorites were the toro, curry ramen, pickled cucumbers, wagyu croquettes. We had the chocolate mousse and key lime pie for dessert, my only complaint was the key Lime was not cold enough, but otherwise delicious! This is a great spot for a date, especially if you can snag a seat at the sushi bar and watch the chefs meticulously slice toro. Can't wait to return, a new favorite!
this place is epic--- the food, staff, ambiance-- everything. seriously, go now! you will love it.

This place is always packed on a Sunday during brunch, so a reservation is the best way to go. We lucked out and were able to find a couple seats at the bar to order the Easy like Sunday and the Happy Ending sandwiches with a side of breakfast potatoes. The sandwiches were delicious. They were a bit small in size though so a side is definitely needed to accompany them if you're as hungry as we were. The service was nice and welcoming too, which is a plus.

Lindsey did our cupcakes for our summer wedding. They were a huge hit! Absolutely delicious and beautiful. Cupcakes were delivered on time and packaged well. We had great communication throughout. I highly recommend Butter Me Up!
The Feels at Home, it just out of this world. Great job!
Nice sandwiches. Would go back again.
Awesome burger. It's always really tasty and the workers have always been real nice. I'm taking my sister here this weekend
These sandwiches were so delicious! Loved that I found this little pop up in halfsmoke
Fabulous spot with creative food and an awesome vibe. Literally told everyone I know this spot is a must brunch.
Outstanding in every way. Delicious and friendly. A popup I hope sticks around for awhile, some of the best breakfasts I have had in the city.
Great Food! One of the best places I've been to in the D.C area. Amazing food and service. Highly recommend and will be telling all my friends/family.
Nice burgers, taste great. Staff are good and friendly. Recommended!
I just tried their burgers, and it taste great. Service of the staff was pretty good. Recommended!
This place is delicious! I had the Good Day and home fries which was excellent! I will return!
The manager Tak and the owners steal from their employees. Only eat at this establishment if you agree with that business practice.
Absolutely awful experience. Would not recommend to anyone. Bad restaurant and service.
Not as good as it once was. The server was great but the food was mediocre.
The food here is decent but nothing to rave about. Would recommend based on the great location and reasonable pricing.

The Lao restaurant features dishes with a distinct American twist, with flavors similar to Thai cuisine but slightly sweeter, and also offers crab cakes, a favorite among Americans. Because the crab cakes contained a bit too much shell, the manager thoughtfully provided a complimentary dessert. The peanut coconut ice cream and mango sticky rice were authentic, with just the right level of sweetness. Overall, it was a delightful dining experience, combining Lao cuisine with American elements and enjoying warm, friendly service.

I ventured into Laos on a vibrant Saturday night, greeted by a bustling atmosphere that set the stage for what I hoped would be a memorable dining experience. Despite the crowd, the service was impeccable, with attentive staff promptly catering to our needs upon seating.As for the food, while it wasn't exceptional, it certainly wasn't disappointing either. Everything was served fresh and piping hot, though I must admit, the flavors left me wanting more. While nothing quite dazzled my taste buds, there were no outright disappointments either.Nevertheless, the lively ambiance makes it an ideal spot for gatherings of all sizes, adding to its appeal. I'm inclined to give it another chance, perhaps exploring new items on the menu in search of that elusive culinary delight.
Food and service was great. We had great service from PakBung. Recommend this place.

Beautiful place to eat! Love the decorations and the atmosphere. However, I found their food a bit too oily. I felt bad after eating. The sticky rice was also disappointingFood: 3/5 | Service: 4/5 | Atmosphere: 5/5

Laos in Town delivered an incredible dining experience with its bold, authentic flavors and beautifully presented dishes. Our server, Connor, was exceptional--attentive, knowledgeable, and made us feel truly welcomed with his great recommendations. The restaurant's vibrant atmosphere and stylish decor added to the overall enjoyment of our meal. We'll definitely be coming back and highly recommend Laos in Town to anyone looking for an outstanding Laotian dining experience!
Amazing as always, food is incredible and fast and good amount for your money. Connor was delightful and a wonderful server!
Our server Sam was very helpful. She was also very attentive! The suki and Thai iced tea were delicious.
Everything was so wonderful. Our server was Conner, who was very attentive and gave us great recommendations. Best dishes: tofu curry, northern noodle, and suki! Best drink: the hummingbird.
food was awesome! first experience having Laotian food! Service was fast and friendly faces everywhere. Fah, was our waitress and she did amazing! she was very helpful! we will definitely come back!
Lovely ambiance and very approachable menu. Service was very attentive and super fast, Pak was a great waitress.

I enjoyed the appetizer named Seen Hang and the dried beef is full of flavor. For the entree, I ordered the crispy rock fish and it is golden brown delicious. I like the roasted cashews and the chili dressing paired with the crispy rock fish. I also recommended the Northern Noodle . The servers are friendly.
The Neua Neua was excellent and the service from Fah was fantastic! Great ambiance too--music not too loud. Highly recommend if you're in the NoMa area.
Sam is so sweet and made so comfortable. I love the atmosphere here and the service. The food was so delicious
A great mix of familiar and new dishes. The presentation for each was creative and the flavors are a bold mix of spicy, funky and sweet. Mark took great care of us-- we will definitely come back!
The food and service are great. The crispy calamari and chive cake were very good. Sam was also very friendly and helpful with the menu!

Laos in Town is an absolute gem! The food is phenomenal, with authentic flavors and beautifully presented dishes that transport you straight to Southeast Asia. But what truly sets this place apart is the exceptional service. Mark went above and beyond to make our dining experience unforgettable. His warmth, attentiveness, and genuine friendliness made us feel so welcome. He took the time to explain the menu, offered great recommendations, and made sure everything was perfect. It's rare to find such personalized and thoughtful service these days. If you're looking for delicious food and an inviting atmosphere, Laos in Town is the place to go. Highly recommend!
Great experience and even better service, thanks Sam! We went for seconds on the Calamari, definitely recommend it.
Delicious food and Fah was so nice and helpful with the menu. Truly a great evening! Definitely coming back

Laos in Town offers amazing food with standout dishes like crispy rice. The warm ambiance and exceptional service from our waitress, Sam--friendly, professional, and attentive--made the experience unforgettable. Highly recommend!
The service from Lane was amazing, the location was beautiful, and above all the food was delicious. 10/10, will be visiting this spot more often
Lane was amazing! She was super attentive even though the bar was busy. 10/10 would recommend and will be back.
The food here was fire. I will definitely be returning and our server was knowledgeable in her recommendations.

Laos in Town Review: A Chic and Modern Dining ExperienceLaos in Town offers a fantastic dining experience with a chic and modern atmosphere that beautifully incorporates elements of Laotian culture. We loved the fried rice, grilled chicken and beef (served with sticky rice), Thai curry, and their signature papaya salad. Each dish was flavorful and well-prepared, showcasing the vibrant flavors of Laotian cuisine.The cocktails are always good, although a bit pricey. Despite this, they are well worth it for their unique flavors and quality. The desserts are another highlight, with the pandan and Thai tea cake standing out as favorites. These sweet treats provide a perfect end to a delightful meal.The service at Laos in Town is consistently great and friendly, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. They are accommodating and efficient, often managing to seat guests without a reservation. The inviting atmosphere, combined with the excellent food and service, makes Laos in Town a highly recommended spot for anyone looking to enjoy a memorable meal with a touch of Laotian charm.

I had a really enjoyable experience at Laos In Town! I've been to Laos a few times and can testify that their food is authentic. Our server, Mara, was especially helpful. She made great suggestions, including that I get the Laab Moo and the painted lady cocktail. Both were delicious!

Came here late last year and the food and the atmosphere were both great. We were a big party but they were ver accommodating and helpful. We were served by Silvia and she was amazing. Highly recommended.
The food was fabulous and our server, Sylvia, was attentive and helpful in making food selections! Ambience was also delightful! I would highly recommend this restaurant!

I really enjoyed the chicken curry and the yummy Thai iced tea. The atmosphere was was friendly and the staff was wonderful. Our server Silvia was awesome and took great care of us. Looking forward to my next visit!
miss Silvia was amazing with service and the food is also very good. Khu Khao was recommended and was very good
Food was great, especially the pork belly and the Suki. And Silvia was a great host, making our lunch experience very personable!
The food was great and Lane was an incredible server and loved her entree recommendation.

Our son's birthday dinner at Laos in Town was an absolute delight, and a huge part of that was thanks to our incredible server, Silvia. From the moment we arrived, she made us feel welcome and taken care of, adding a touch of magic to the whole experience. Silvia's service was:Attentive but not intrusive: She was always there when we needed something, anticipating our needs without hovering. She checked in at the perfect intervals, ensuring our drinks were topped off and dishes cleared without ever interrupting our conversations.Knowledgeable and passionate: When we had questions about the menu, Silvia offered detailed explanations with genuine enthusiasm for the Laotian cuisine. Her recommendations were spot-on, leading us to some truly unforgettable dishes.Warm and accommodating: Silvia had a friendly smile and a contagious laugh that put everyone at ease. She effortlessly connected with our son, making him feel special and celebrating his birthday with genuine warmth.Professional and efficient: Silvia handled everything with grace and ease. She was organized, attentive to all tables, and ensured our meal flowed smoothly from start to finish. Silvia's exceptional service took our dining experience at Laos in Town from fantastic to truly memorable. Her genuine warmth, attentiveness, and expertise made our son's birthday celebration even more special. We left feeling not only satisfied with the delicious food and atmosphere, but also with a renewed appreciation for the power of excellent service. If you're looking for a fantastic Laotian dining experience with unparalleled service, ask for Silvia at Laos in Town! You won't be disappointed!

Recently enjoyed a fantastic lunch at Laos in Town, based on a friend's recommendation, and I'm delighted they suggested it. Opted for the crispy chicken and rice, and the chicken was wonderfully crispy, complemented by a perfectly balanced sauce. Our server, Sylvia, was incredibly attentive and took the time to explain the menu, cautioning us about the spice level in certain dishes (watch out for phet if you're not a fan of spice). I look forward to returning and trying one of their curry dishes on my next visit.

Grateful for discovering this incredible eatery! The attention to detail in every dish is truly impressive. The staff is friendly, especially Pak, and the atmosphere is perfect for a memorable dining experience!!

My husband has been urging me to come experience this restaurant - and now I know why! Our server Pak was very atttentive, pleasant, and friendly! We started with the herbal sausage appetizer - very impressive - encourage to get bite of lemongrass, peanut, sausage & sauce for perfect bite:-) I opted for crispy rockfish - cooked to perfection, wonderful presentation, and flavors exquisite! Sorry it took me this long to get here in person:-)
Food was great.Pak, our server, went above and beyond to provide us with fantastic service.They were open late on December 25.I was wonderful to have a hot soup to warm up!Totally recommend i!

I came here for a Christmas lunch. The atmosphere is very welcoming and the bar is beautiful. The food is also delicious! I got the Seen Hang, Crispy Rice Salad, and a strawberry shortcake. Highly recommend! My server was Lane.
A very nice Christmas Eve dinner, food was excellent, great vegetarian menu. Silvia was a wonderful server. Will return!
Lane was a great host, the food was delicious and the atmosphere was very nice, will be coming back
Food and service were wonderful! We had Arm as our server and the attention to detail was fabulous.
I appreciated the separate vegan menu. The chive cakes were phenomenal!! Arm was our server and he was very courteous.
Great food and amazing drink! good atmosphere. Service was also very good. Will go back !
The service from Rhoan was great.  He was very attentive to both us and our two dogs.
Food was great and our server RHOAN was fabulous!!! Thank you for giving us the royal trearment.
Dionn best server in town, come check out this laos foods in dc!! Tasty food and great vibe, awesome drinks! will come back! highly recommend!
All I can say is Dionn's service has made this restaurant The northern noodles and khao yum gai tod was delicious
The food was 10/10 but Rhoan service is what's going to keep me coming back. He met my every need
Amazing!!! Everything was delicious and special. The atmosphere and staff was great. I always appreciate having someone different.

I went to Laos in town last week for restaurant week. I had the fish cakes, grill chicken and topical pudding. Everything was really delicious. So flavorful. Our waitress Lee was great walking us through each dish. We really ordered base on what she liked. It was crazy busy but she never rushed us and took her time which was nice. The cucumber dish was delis, kinda like a papya salad. Lee said there is a version with long beans I should try if its ever on a menu. I will be visit again next week. I did not order a drink (dry January) but next time I will.

I went for restaurant week yesterday and it was so good I had to come write a review. This place was recommended by some friends and my gf and I finally came and gave it a shot. We did not wait long for our table. They were packed. We did the restaurant menu and the fish cakes are the best. Our waitress Lee was so nice, she was even able to get us a side of extra fishcakes. The grill chicken was with the cucumber was excellent. So many flavors in one. We were very new to laos food but she made it all easy. She gave us other suggestions for next time to try. My gf love the decoration and bathroom. Overall, everything was great. I would ask for Lee again.

Just went to this restaurant tonight for restaurant week and had the best time. I went with my boyfriend for date night, this was the first time here. We sat at the corner and our waitress lee was so kind. She spend time talking to us about life and food. it was a great experiences. We ordered the Lurid cocktail, fish cake, tum tang and finish Bua Loy. Everything was amazing. The best part was the customer service. Lee was so pleasant to talk to, we will have another date night at the restaurant soon. We want to try another dish next time.

So I came in last Friday for dinner, my friend lives in the apartment complex upstairs and suggested the place. I was fasting till 6pm but I arrived at 5:30pm. My server Lee was kind and chatted with me about the food. I told her I could not eat till 6 and she said dont worry, she would get the food on my table exactly at 6pm. And she did, it was really helpful. I got the rockfish and it was delicious. I never had rockfish like this before. The sauce was the best part, I put it over rice. I want to come back again soon and have the same exact thing! Thank you lee for making me get the fish.

Went here on a random night, first time here and will be back. Told our server Lee that we knew nothing of the food. She offer to pick our meals and it was the best decision ever. Will be back to try new things. Decoration was beautiful. Restaurant was clean and drinks were amazing. Fighting Tiger has Laos whiskey - a must try.
Very delicious food, the restaurant is clean and the service is perfect, I recommend this restaurant
Awesome restaurant! Staff is so friendly and the food is awesome. I come here as often as I can

I have been here multiple times and always try to order different things on the menu and each time I am blown away by how amazing the food is. Can't explain how much I love this place. This is our go-to place when we have friends come to town to visit!
You must try this place out. I had just about everything on the menu and no complaints.

Such a cute place! When I walked in the atmosphere so colorful and bright, yet so well put together. The food met up to the same standards! The fried quail was amazing and that side sauce was the perfect mix. I ended up getting the catfish which definitely packed some heat but wasn't overwhelmingly spicy, super tasty. Kudos for the perfect sticky rice on the side as well!
Friendly service. Amazing food. Good variety of drinks. Outdoor porch is great in summer. Dog friendly AF.
The whole fried fish pot rules.

I went to Laos in town last night. Took my mother there for mother's day dinner. FIrst time having Laos food and our waitress Lee was great in breaking down and explaining to us the food. She was fun, my mother loved her and we will be back for sure. I had a great time and the food was great. They only been open for 2 weeks now as I was told, so ignore the reviews about it being slow.
Make sure you get the spaghetti. Best I've ever had. Really. Like, top notch spaghetti. No sauce needed. At all. In fact, you're ruining it if you put sauce on it.
Food was good until I discovered the hair in my food. The food is too expensive for me to be finding hair in my food. That's just nasty.
Good quick bite service and atmosphere!!! Keep doing what y'all doing!!!!!

I went with a group of friends and most of us enjoyed the food. I especially enjoyed my dish as it was delicious and seasoned well. However, the drinks were not good as most of us were disappointed with our drinks.
Everything was excellent from the service to the food!! The shrimp & grits were so good. Will definitely be back.
the customer service is very respect I would recommend it
Absolutely delicious food!! Great atmosphere, friendly staff. Highly recommend trying this spot.
Food is great at this spot. A little pricey but I think it's worth it.
Love this place, the service and the food is fantastic......and I love the music too.
My favorite spot in Washington DC. Love it!!! Can't wait to go back. You have to try the Ox tail Spring rolls.

AWESOME!!!! I cant say it enough, the service, quality of food, explosive flavors in the menu choices, and overall atmosphere just perfect. We enjoy coming every time. We've been to each location have tried all the menus and have yet to be disappointed. Returning customers for sure.

food was great. taste texture and portions where great. outstanding customer service. the owner himself even came out and talked to everyone which i thought was great. kitchen cray keep doing what u are doing. god see the blessings u doing and thanks for allowing me and my wife to celebrate our anniversary.

I went to Lagan Tavern on Saturday and I must say I encounter a guy name John who said he was the manager! I'm disappointed because for a manager he was very unprofessional and condescending especially during these times his service was terrible and his attitude was definitely need of an adjustment!! There are trying times and we are all suffering because of it with that being said I suggest they send him to seminar on how to treat people ! Logan Tavern is an overall good place and does need this type of behavior form a so called superior I was the very disappointed!!! Bad representation for the bar and my name sake! #BeNice

Wish I could give them ZERO stars! I am an out of town senior citizen veteran and my wife and I were visiting. Food was good but the bartender was terribly rude. Ordered food and two drinks over a period of 2 1/2 hours. After eating, ordered another drink and was denied as Tone the bartender denied both my wife and I due to a Washington. DC law. REALLY? We were shocked and think they just wanted us to leave. We paid the bill and quietly left. In my 65 years I have NEVER been denied service. Truly hard to believe. The owners need to be aware of this poor service and unacceptable treatment.

Avoid! There was a roach in my drink and the bartender named Tone was oblivious. There are so many good places in the area. Most importantly ... Happy hour drinks are watered down. Seriously not good. Bartender Tone was disconnected and just too busy to really care. Sad because if management knew the bartender sets the tone, they could course correct. Walk down the street where service matters just as much as food and drinks!
What can I say, bad food, miserable people and horrible management. Location must be the only reason this place survives

Im new to this Yelp thing even know I have lived in the city for a while, so I am trying to show appreciation to my fav's but I have to hate a little also here. My pals and I were seated "enjoying" our mediocre at best brunch, lunch whatever you want to call it, when all of a sudden some lady which I would guess would be the manager since I saw her early in the day doing managerial responsiblities, rolls by my table screaming obsenities ( including the f-bomb several times) at another person. My buds and I were trying to figure out if this was a customer or another employee or maybe even a personable matter since the person she was chasing screaming at had on plain clothes, not the black shirt and black apron as everyone else. The only reason why I gave them one star (besides the fact you have to) is I thought it was hilarious. I wasnt expecting a show along with my burger, but you should have seen the look at the lady at the booth next to me PRICELESS. I want to say I will be back even know the service was lacking and the food wasn't that good, because I can only hope to see another exciting event but if you let me down then its over...ha...but on a serious note someone needs to get that lady some manager's training and anger management classes!
Meh
Eh! I was not impressed at all. I can't say really anything bad about the place, other than I just was not impressed at all.
Food is mediocre, service is rarely good. Lunch and brunch are best.
I am amazed at the service of them as I found the extreme food from them and at a time I also took the burger fries from them. If I want to explain it will not be possible to me, you can check them.
Burgers were decent. Beer selection was good.
It was okay. The crab cakes were the best thing on the menu.

My girlfriend and I have eaten here several times. We like it a lot. I have two complaints: 1) they are not always very consistent. Some dishes are, but not all. The fried chicken is, but the crab Mac and cheese is not. 2) the service varies too. It seems that when busy, the service is good, but when slow, the service is too. You would expect the opposite, but is just a weird thing about this place. Anyway, they have good food and one of my favorite places in Logan/DuPont. I can't want for the new place on 14th street to open. Unlike the heights, I hope there is a different menu.

Wonderful lunch Had lunch with my friend there yesterday. It was very crowded and we were headed to a 2:30 show at the Studio Theater so we needed to eat & run.
