The maitre'd couldn't have been more helpful and put us in a table outside. The service was fine, the waiter did a good job and wasn't too friendly or too aloof. We got everything we asked for in good time. I had the fried chicken sandwich & my friend had a burger. Mine was good but I don't think I'd order it again. It seemed a little dry. My friend had a burger and had no complaints. The bill for two, w/o drinks, was $23 not including tip. Seems reasonable to me for a good meal

The food here is ok. Happy hour is a good deal. Buffalo shrimp is amazing. Make sure to get extra bread for dipping. Brunch is their best offering. But their wings are so unnecessarily salty. I wish they would lay off the salt at Logan Tavern. Totally not needed. Let the customer add their own.

The food is good, but not spectacular. This is a safe place to grab a meal if you are in the company of finicky eaters. Most of the food is pretty traditional American fare. Ambiance can be good, but at times the place can get pretty loud.

Just walking by and looking for a place to eat. Logan Tavern fit the bill perfectly. We showed up on Fri. @ 6:30 and waited about 15 minutes. The apps were the best. The ginger calamari was a taste sensation and Buffalo shrimp in a blue cheese sauce was so rich I loved it.Mains were good. I had the tuna rare and it was served cold center as I would expect. The crab cake is lots of crab.

I have been to Logan multiple times. I will have to say that the Buffalo Shrimp is AMAZING! But beyond that it is ok. I ordered a nice steak Medium and it came close to rare. The food is good, but it is very spotty on when the food is ok and Great. I would recommenced it if you are looking for a good place to eat... and once again the Buffalo Shrimp is a must, especially with the bread.
The food gets five stars, the service one star. I averaged to three.
The food was ok. The sever was nice. Overall it was just ok.
Great food, large portions! Great music and overall vibe. Wait staff was personable and attentive to our needs.

The truffle fries were an absolute highlight, offering a decadent twist to a classic side. The rich truffle flavor elevated the dish, and the fries were cooked to perfection. The steak kabob, too, was a flavorful choice, showcasing quality ingredients and expert preparation. However, the only drawback was the portion size
Good food and April was an awesome server. Thanks for a great lunch. I will definitely be back.

Loved the new york atmosphere and the food was quite good, wiht a lot of american specialties with an interesting european or oriental twist. The menu is a bit pretentious and with a lot of very elaborate dishes, but overall i must say I ate quite well and did not spend very much. What I did not like was the expensive wine list!

Nada did a wonderful job describing the menu items and delivering the final product. Atmosphere, menu, service and food quality were all very nicely above  Nice job here. We'll surely recommend. Generous pours as well! See you next time
Good choice of food and huge serves, good price for size of meal. Our waiter was friendly and gave good service.

Great neighborhood place with perfect patio for people watching. My work colleague picked it for lunch on a nice day and it was great. Service was good and the spinach salad with walnuts and chicken was delicious. The menu has a nice variety of options - salads, sandwiches, and full entrees. I've been to the bar as well on weekends and although it gets pretty crowded, it's always a good time.

My friends and I went there last night and was totally shocked that we were able to have a reservation for 8 in the last minute on saturday night. The place was packed. I really enjoyed the service and the food was very tasty. We had buffalo wings, calamari, and fried green tomatoes for appetizer and it wasgreat. I ordered their special of the night, Airline Chicken, and was highly recommended by our waiter for my main course. The chicken was moist and it was grilled into perfection. The only thing I had problem with was the green beans. It was a bit under cook. But, the potatoes and the sauce was tasty. Overall, the experience was very pleasant. I will definitely come back.

Visited my sister and her family in DC and had a bite here. The burgers are pretty amazing, but the fries are to DIE for! Great spot with a nice patio. If you're a beef fan, the list is impressive. Good selection and variety on the menu, good gastro-pub fare. Friendly staff. Highly recommend, although I can see that on a more crowded night it might not be as good.

I'm recently back from Spain & my partner and I need to get out and experience the local flare. We tried Estadio out since we just came back from Europe. We were rightly disappointed, Stale bread... So we gave Logan tavern chance and were pleasantly surprised. We had eaten there in the past (a year ago) before we left for Europe. We weren't dazzled but not "disappointed". Our service was executed, not great or poor, but executed. However the food was absolutely well done. Everything was seasoned and cooked to perfection. The scallops and cous cous, great pairing. And the apple tart was a well balanced dessert. I'm looking forward to another experience. I must say that if Logan tavern improves on its service a little bit and the food stays awesome, Logan tavern will be more than just a Local spot. It will be a city spot light!

I went here on a Friday night for dinner and drinks. First off the waitstaff was great. Looking at another post and our server was Brock as well. Everyone at our table enjoyed their meals and I thought the atmosphere was lively but not so much that we weren't able to hold conversation. I would definitely suggest to others and will be back.
Consistantly good food. Service could be a little better and the hosts could be a little friendlier but the food is awesome. Get the blackened sirloin and the buffalo shrimp. YUM YUM GOOD!
I am a fan of this restaurant. The food isn't great, but it's good and it's consistent. I've always had good service - it's g ood place in the 'hood!
Been coming here for years and it's always busy and fun. The fried chicken and tilapia are great and brunch is the best.Just went over weekend...draft beer, FINALLY.

Cozy. Woody. Comfort Food Galore. Wish you could cook like mom used to make? I wish I could cook at all, so Skip it. Satisfy that craving with boneless southern fried chicken with caramelized onion gravy, wasabi crusted meatloaf or roasted pork loin served with sweet Asian mustard and jasmine rice. Don't skimp on starters and get the buffalo shrimp. Be prepared for a wait, or put your name on the list and go take care of your weekly grocery list across the street at Whole Foods. Cheers!

As a southerner, it often feels impossible to find good food AND good service in DC. Eva proved this notion false, with a warm and welcoming personality- prompt and delicious service, an over all 10/10 experience. To the managers at Logan Tavern- give Eva a raise before such a talent is robbed for a better opportunity!
fab brunch and even fab-er server -- if you come, definitely ask for hugo. he was incredible for bottomless!!

I stopped by Logan Tavern for breakfast, and it did not disappoint! From the moment I walked in, the service was warm, attentive, and genuinely welcoming. It's clear they value their guests, which made the experience that much better.Now, let's talk about the food: the breakfast was solid, satisfying, and exactly what I needed to start my day. Everything was cooked perfectly, but I have to give a special shoutout to their hickory-smoked bacon -- it was to die for. Crispy, smoky, and packed with flavor, it took the meal to the next level.If you're looking for a great breakfast spot with fantastic service and food that hits the mark, Logan Tavern is the place to go. Highly recommend!

Man oh man oh man!I recently hosted an Open Mic Night with pre event Happy Hour, and the ambiance was immaculate. The owners allowed for complete creative freedom with the room setup and entertainment. I was able to utilize the red room with two big speakers and lighting above
The food was EXCELLENT ! fresh and hot very tasty as well as the service was excellent 10/10 ! Very attentive And had great customer service I will definitely be back!

Updates to the menu have been a hit to me. I love the new Caesar salad or baby kale with grilled salmon ! The ginger calamari is fireeeeee. The music is good and the updates to the patio are lovely. They are also dog friendly so I can bring my fur baby. The host was pleasant as well which means a lot when first walking into a place.

Logan Tavern is a gem of a restaurant. From the moment you step in, the atmosphere is incredibly welcoming, creating an instant sense of ease. The new management is evidently dedicated to providing an elevated experience, and it truly shows.The food is nothing short of perfection. Every dish is fresh and flavorful, showcasing the venue's commitment to quality ingredients. Whether you're a brunch enthusiast or simply craving a delectable meal, Logan Tavern delivers! The bottomless mimosas every day are a delightful touch, adding a fun and festive element to your dining experience.The addition of good music sets the perfect tone, creating an atmosphere that's as enjoyable as the food itself. Logan Tavern has swiftly become a go-to spot for me. I've left every visit with a sense of satisfaction and anticipation for my next visit. It's the kind of place that you can't help but think of when considering a solid time out with literally anyone (mom, dad, significant other, girlfriends, etc.) It is literally just perfect for any chill occasion with good vibes. Without a doubt, I'll be returning again and again. If you're in search of a restaurant that embodies warmth, flavor, and a good time, Logan Tavern is your spot. Highly recommended!

I just want to say I had an amazing experience at Logan's. The food was amazing.... I ordered the Korean style wings... so good!! Also, Joya was a sweetheart. We all know serving is a tough job... Joya made it look easy! I recommended my friends who went the very next night and I recommend you go as well!

I came into Logan Tavern for the first time this weekend and I will definitely be coming back! The overall experience was wonderful :) Joya was amazing and all the food tasted great. Highly recommend!!
Had such a great time here with my brother in law. Sierra recommended the pork chop and it was delicious!

My family n I traveled to DC on August 15 from New York. We decided to grab a bite before visiting the MLK Monument. Let me tell u, it was a pleasure. Upon entry in Logan Tavern, we were greeted by a well mannered gentleman named Al who seated us. Following, we were greeted by a wonderful waitress named Wynter. Wynter was so bubbly and full of life all while maintaining her professionalism. While taking our orders, she was transparent, n very easy to communicate with. What I also liked was their kid's menu. Very very well put together. My daughter enjoyed her meal, n I enjoyed it along with her. The food was delicious. I'll definitely visit Logan Tavern many times over as long as I'm in the DC area. I love u Al and Wynter. Keep up the good work guys. For everyone else, make sure u tip my girl Wynter very well. See u next time DC
Friendly. Excellent food. Atmosphere was great. Waitstaff was very attentive and made delicious recommendations!

Wow. Can't go wrong here. Great vibe. Good service.we loved: meatloaf with curry sauce, fried chicken, the greens (!), the burger, and the hand-made fries. The herbed butter was also fantastic. Well-deserved five .
Great first experience here! Food was delicious and our server Chris P (Code name Chris P Cream) was fantastic even though he'd been on the clock for more than 12 hours. Definitely would recommend!

We traveled from out of town and our hotel recommended Logan Tavern. We stopped in and Matt greeted us at the bar. My wife and I had the calamari (incredible) with a couple of beers, Matt recommended the local Evo draft and it was excellent! We then had the LT Burger and the chicken chopped salad. The burger was cooked perfectly and the wife loved the salad! I wish we had a place like this closer to home, I really enjoyed the environment as well as the food and service.
Food was delicious! Service was awesome and our food came out fairly quick considering how busy they were.
Awesome place, awesome staff. friend has a dairy allergy, server Erin was super accommodating and staff adjusted menu for him. Incredible service, highly recommend.
This is probably the best chicken sandwich I have ever tasted. Highly recommend. Food was great, good drink menu, and excellent staff that were highly attentive and offered great recommendations.
Amazing food!! Ginger calamari & mussels were great! .... Brittany was excellent, attentive, and friendly! Definitely recommend! :-)
Just ate at Logan's, it was great and our waitress Britnie went above and beyond to take care of us. Looking forward to our next trip there!
Lovely ambience. Cool decor. Waiting staff are very friendly and accommodating. Burgers are very tasty and they offer a wide selection of drinks. A great, good value meal.

My family and I visited DC and had the most amazing meal at "Logan Tavern". When I tell you we had almost 1 of everything on the menu. The buffalo shrimp are to die 4 (let the Church say Amen). The calamari (Jesus take the wheel). The salmon with the dijon-soy glaze and the marinated flank steak (clutch the mighty pearls) When I tell you we went all out appetizers, meals, desserts and drinks (the Bam-Bam). Don't even get me started on " Amazing Aethan" our waiter. He did an excellent job. Water, refills, bread, napkins, etc. I couldn't have asked for a better waiter. He is definitely worth his weight in gold. Logan Tavern is lucky to have an employee who makes their customers feel like a top priority. You don't mind spending your money in an establishment when the food and service is of high quality. Thank you Logan Tavern for both. I will definitely be back again.
I came here for restaurant week and was not disappointed! It was about $35 for an appetizer, entree, desert item and drink
Winter was truly amazing! She was fun, and attentive. The food was great too! Keep up the great work Winter.
Megan was amazing! Food was great and service was attentive. Will definitely be back!
The French Toast is a must try.
This place was awesome. Great food and service.
Logan Tavern had a lovely ambiance with circular seating that was perfect for conversation! The menu was very versatile yet delicious. We had a fabulous evening at Logan Tavern!

I was pleasantly surprised with what I got when I ate at Logan tavern, 3 1/2 stars really doesn't do this place justice... I had the crab cake appetizer with a preserved lemon & red pepper dressing & the Steak Au poivre with fries and arugula salad.. yum delish. I have been here a few times before and had an above average meal, but this last time was outstanding.. keep it up I will be back

love people watching on the patio. I love the fried green tomatoes and the chopped salad. I always get the same thing there as I'm a creature of habit. very clean and non corporate environment also. Perfect restaurant for the block.

Dinner tonight was super. Meatloaf & mashed, Fried Chicken, Spicy Buffalo wings, two cold beers and an apple crisp for dessert. Sat outside and watched the world go by. Friendly service. A perfect Sunday night and all for $60

It has become too political, too polarized, antisemitic. They only invite people who make derogatory remarks against Israel. They don't bring people who would unite on solidarity with the people of Israel who promote peace.
Chicken soup was so salty no one could take even a mouthful and the kids chicken didn't have the side of fruit

Do you like to perspire? Would U like to dine and have a sauna at the same time? Then come on down! Bus boys in brookland is the place to be. Menu has not changed but temperature is rising. Wait until fall arrives and maybe u will enjoy the ambience.
The manager, Gabe, is terrible! And so is the service!

Avoid the Brookland location if you can-- especially when ordering for pickup. I live very close to the location and so I've ordered quite frequently in the past week. First, I ordered the shrimp and chicken chorizo meal, which failed to include the shrimp. I returned to inform them of the error, only to be told that is what it should be-- WRONG, and the lady refused to change the order.They also have the worlds best coconut ice-cream, but on two occasions failed to give me the two-scoops stated on the website. I've been duped too many times, I won't be spending any more money there.

First, I ordered the shrimp and chicken chorizo meal, which failed to include the shrimp. I returned to inform them of the error, only to be told that is what it should be-- WRONG, and the lady refused to change the order.They also have the worlds best coconut ice-cream, but on two occasions failed to give me the two-scoops stated on the website. Always just okay. The food is pretty good as are the ingredients used. The service is always the weak link in every Busboy's with the exception of Hyattsville. Never service there, always superior. Must be the manager.
Everything was great! The food and the service were both excellent.Great go to place for brunch.
One of my favorite restaurants for breakfast! I don't go here much for lunch or dinner.
I enjoy all the busboy locations but I like the fish fry most at this location

Food is great but the quality of service is declining. I would recommend female servers instead of the males. Any regular customer probably understands this.The vegan pancakes are outrageously good! Even if you're not a vegan, the taste is fantastic.

The hostess, Dessie, was very friendly and professional. She greeted me immediately upon my entrance to the restaurant, led me to where the other person whom I was meeting, was, and allowed us to select our seats. The food was a delight and the atmosphere is always pleasant at Busboys. Unfortunately, my experience was soured a bit due to the initial inattentiveness of the wait staff. We waited a good 12 minutes or so without being acknowledged by any server. Once we inquired of several servers, two eventually tried to help us. That only caused confusion. A couple different people (I suppose they were Managers) came by to check on us on a couple occasions while we dine. That was good, but no concessions were offered by either, for our inconvenience. I still highly recommend Bb&P and I encourage you to find out whom your server is when being seated b
Great atmosphere and place to study.
Absolutely magical place super respectful staff amazing food easily top 10 in DC
great food, great service and great coffee! Zac was great, very helpful and I will definitely come back again.

I had a memorable experience at **Busboys and Poets** after a late-night food mishap left me without my order. The night before, I'd ordered their *Shrimp & Chicken Chorizo Pasta* through Uber Eats, but before the driver could pick it up, the restaurant had closed. Feeling frustrated but still hopeful, I decided to visit the restaurant the next day to explain what had happened.As soon as I walked in, the staff quickly reviewed my receipt. Joseph, who was at the counter, wasted no time in going directly to the management to sort out the issue. Not long after, Ms. Marissa came out of the kitchen with a warm smile and asked if I'd prefer a refund or a fresh order of what I'd originally chosen. While I waited, she even brought me a strawberry lemonade as a token of apology. It was such a thoughtful gesture, and I felt genuinely appreciated as a returning customer. This team of young professionals responded so swiftly and made it clear they were fully invested in my experience.The restaurant itself is beautiful, adorned with artwork from all over the world, including pieces that honor the Civil Rights Movement--a true delight to explore. Busboys and Poets is more than just a restaurant

I recently had the pleasure of savoring the scrumptious Chicken Panini at Busboys and Poets, and I must say, it was a culinary delight! The moment I took a bite, I knew I was in for a treat. The tender and juicy chicken breast was perfectly seasoned with a hint of herbs and spices, and the melted cheese added a rich and creamy texture.The panini was expertly grilled, with a crispy crust that gave way to a soft and fluffy interior. The fresh lettuce and tomato added a burst of freshness, while the tangy aioli brought everything together. Each bite was a harmonious balance of flavors and textures that left me wanting more.What truly sets Busboys and Poets apart is the quality of their ingredients and the care with which they prepare each dish.If you're a fan of chicken paninis, or just looking for a delicious meal in a vibrant setting, do yourself a favor and head to Busboys and Poets.

Went to this location today with my wife and her cousin. We had Zack as our waiter...and he did a great job taking care of us. The kitchen forgot an item on one of the plates and Zack tracked it down and handled it for us. He also brought me extra hot water for my tea since so many places never give enough up front. Everyone was satisfied with their meal and Zack made it a nice event for us. Come visit him and let him take care of you! (Unfortunately, I do not know his schedule, so good luck in getting him)
Zac was an awesome server--so kind and polite! Checked in often but not too much!!! Thank you Zac!
we went to the brookland location and Reggie was an amazing server and attentive. Thanks Reggie for a great experience , we wish you well on your future endeavors

Been to Busboys and Poets several times. The food is pretty good and the service has been okay. But during our last visit, our server Minnah was spectacular. We had three children, all under the age of 6, with all their demands and questions, but Minnah handled everything with great attention to all our needs and with such grace in the whirlwind that was our table. When we go there again, we will definitely ask for Minnah!

The service we received from Zachary was awesome. he was very attentive, professional courteous and very informative and knowledgeable about items on the menu. It was a very enjoyable dinning experience. We will most definitely come back. Kudos to Zach and the Busboys & Poers esrablish!!!...Derrick Leblanc
The service tonight was excellent, the waiter that serve us tonight name ledeya was very pleasant, helpful, & respectful with fast service.
so good and great service!! My friends and I all ordered sandwiches and sweet potato fries!!!Delicious!
Consistently good food good service and decent prices! Ambiance was lacking on my Last visit which was very noisy and annoying and when I complained to the manager he didn't address it

Monroe St NEWe had an amazing time with amazing service. Minnah was kind, professional and just fun! Thank you Minnah for the meal suggestions, everything was spot on and tasted great. And OMG the Moscow Mule was made with perfection. Thank you!!

My wife and family just left and I have to say I really loved the service here. We came in January and absolutely hated. The food was better, the ambiance created by the music was groovy, and most of all, the management seemed present. Our order took quite some time to come out and we were about to say something but before we could, a manager named Johon came out and informed us that there was an error with their ordering system and that he had the food rushed. This is a vast improvement from our last visit where I food took 45 minutes and no manager ever came to greet us. We chatted for a bit about his cool tattoos and our food came out 5 minutes later. Shout out to Leyde our server. She was friendly! Keep them both. They're amazing!

Zac, our waiter was great. Warm, personable. He engaged with us about our day.Our food was excellent. The garlic/parm potatoes-- scrumptious. 10/10 would come back just for that.Service was speedy and we got a super cute tote to take our food home in.
Great vibes and the food is strong - the garlic parm potatoes are SAUCY and delicious. Our server Zac was super friendly and prompt.
Zac, is the Man! Outstanding service and a great person. The manager is personalble and very caring. Took time to talk to us.Will definitely recommend to family and friends.
Zac was an excellent server. He was extremely pleasant a d demonstrated the right amount of attention without disrupting our dining experience.
minnah was an outstanding bartender who is quite attractive. she remade my drink and it was strong and satisfying. so i i made sure i got another one made by her. give her a raise!.

Minnah was exceptiona! She answered every question I asked and helped me with my drink choices. She was a wonderful bartender/waitress. I can't wait to come back and request her! The crazy thing is she's only been her for 1 week and has the customer service of someone that owns the place. She's a keeper! Can't wait to come back!

The service is always absolutely amazing every time we dine here. One of our favorite things to do is stop by BusBoys for a nice coffee and the employees here are absolutely lovely. We got to meet Jeff, who's a very wonderful host! BBs will definitely stay a normal spot for us.

I've noticed an uptick in the quality of service at Busboys the past few times I've visited. Zac in particular was really helpful. He is engaging, knowledgable about the menu, and has a great attitude. Keep going in this direction, Busboys.

Zac is an amazing server. and i highly recommend hi to the fulles. his attitude and personality were very nice and he's very assertive in his customers. and does a great job with taking care his customer. good job Zac!!!!
Food was delicious. The service provided by Zach was on point and very professional. Thr ambiance was cozy!
Zac was an AMAZING server. my group received really great service and enjoyed our meal.

Zac is an excellent waiter. He ask if the food was okay. He made sure to check with us and made sure we had everything we need. We we able to joke and laugh with him. Thank you for a wonderful experience!
One of the best restaurants Ive been to and their food is top quality I recommend anyone in the area to come

I am new to the DC area, and my new colleagues took me to lunch here. Damien was my server the first time, and subsequent times after. He is professional, yet personable. His margaritas are fab and he puts his own spin on his cocktails. I am a true fan of Damien and Busboys! The food is absolutely delicious, and the service was above all my expectations--and as a business professor, I am tough on restaurants. I did everything but lick my plate. Real talk. Try the chili and also try the fried catfish and grits.
Good food quality and great service!

Everyone was great and kind, didn't have to wait long for the food. Also the food was amazing. My girlfriend and I love coming here

great service today at BBP. The staff is very helpful, attentive, and kind. Kola was extremely helpful and quick! always a nice time at BBP.

the food is amazing and the service.this is my familys go to place for restaurant outings .highly recommend

Great service from Kay. Food quality is always good and they take special food requests with ease.

Marcole is an excellent bartender. He provided me with outstanding service. What makes his service stand out is his personality. He is authentic in the way he carries himself and conducts business. He is refreshingly honest and humorous. I felt welcomed the moment I sat down. I was truly at home.
K was an excellent server and also had a trainee with her. They both provided excellent customer service and went above and beyond to make my solo dinning experience memorable.
The server was great! She was very accommodating, attentive to our needs and the food was excellent. I would recommend Busboy' & Poets .
Excellent eating experience.. from walking in the door and being greeted by employee, seated and drink order taken, was maybe 5 minutes. Meal was served hot and excellent taste...

Great place for food and coffee. You get the consistency of a chain but it also feels intimate like a small town eatery. Staff is very nice and helpful, Kay is a great server and always treats us well!

Everyone in our group enjoyed their meals. Our server Ryann was so great that they really pushed the experience to the next level. Mediterranean Lamb BurgerBeans & Wild Rice (w/grilled chicken added)Cobb SaladShrimp & Chicken Chorizo Pasta (w/Chorizo left out and substituted with extra shrimp)
Loved it loved it loved it loved it loved it pleasant staff good food drinks good love it

Me and my wife are fairly new to DC. We have been going around looking for new places to eat and we stumbled across Busboys and Poets. We just wanted to say our experience was so great yesterday! Our server, the young lady with braids and beads in her hair. We think her name was Triniti! She was awesome!!!! She greeted us with a warm welcome to the restaurant and had a great personality! Throughout the night, she continued to stay on it by checking up on us and making sure we were good. We found her to be so attentive while me and my wife was talking to her. The energy she brings as a waitress was great and would love to see that at other restaurant. I hope anyone who comes to eat at Busboys will enjoy her service as much as we did! If we didn't say it enough already we truly appreciated your great service!
Everything is Good!!! I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. If you haven't been, please do so!!!
Chris was awesome! It was our first time and we will definitely be back because of her.
It's been a while, but always good
Great service. Food is amazing. I was in town for 4 days and went to Busboys and poets three times. I recommend anyone to come here and ask for Kayla, she's the best!
Great food, great outdoor seating, and great service. Our server Brandon was a star, thanks for the food and drink recommendations and excellent service. I hope to be back soon!

I loved my visit here! There were TONS of vegan options and great outdoor seating with social distancing. Our waitress Kayla was amazing - very friendly and fast! I will definitely come back whenever I'm in DC!
Enjoyed our time on the patio with Brian! Great food and felt comfortable regarding COVID-19 regulations.

Great experience with manager Lynn on-deck. The service was courteous and prompt, and I enjoyed my Vegetable Curry entree. Very nice to be in such a lively, multicultural space, especially so convenient to the Metro. Thank you, B&P!

Enjoyed my first meal at Busboys yesterday morning. Amazing french toast and cappuccinos. My waitress Shelby was very helpful and knowledgeable. The staff is very friendly and the environment is inviting!

I love all of the Busboys and Poets but there is one in particular that is near and dear to my heart and home. The Brookland Busboys & Poets is simply the best for so many reasons. The food is just as great here as every other Busboys but Brookand's Busboys and Poets managers and staff are exceptional. They not only make sure you have everything you need, they make sure you feel welcome. Lily, Nick, and Brian, the managers, and the exceptional staff always make me and everybody else feel as if we are a part of a community. I highly recommend Brookland's Busboys and Poets on Monroe Street for the superb service, excellent food, and the kindness the managers and staff. It's a fun, diverse place!

I am a Plant-Based eater, also known as a Vegan, and am so happy to see the plethora of Vegan options, unlike almost all other restaurants. Tonight - I ordered the Vegan Quesadilla, the Vegan Pizza, and the Vegan Raspberry Cheesecake. Our Excellent and Personable Server Taesha was very prompt, knowledgeable of the food menu and alcohol and dessert menus, professional yet also fun as we like to communicate with our servers, and when I asked about the ingredients for the Vegan Raspberry Cheesecake, she got the label out and made sure I knew every ingredient!! That is absolutely going the extra mile!! Taesha is definitely an Asset to your establishment as she is a wonderful Server!
I just want to shout out my server ariana and the service manager kevin for being so welcoming, kind, and helpful! They made my time here at busboys enjoyable. Thank you.

I wanted to find a restaurant in the Brooklyn area so I could meet up with family and friends for Sunday brunch. This was a special occasion because it's been over 15 years since I've been back home and in the area where I grew up and went to school.Taesha Britton, our waitress was extremely attentive, the nicest person with a BIG SMILE and exceptionally accommodating as our party grew. She even got the manager to open up another section just for us to enjoy. Thank you Taesha for adding to a wonderful experience. There's no place like home! JonaeW, Miss Black America, Washington, D.C. 1980
I come here a couple times a week for lunch. Great menu. Super friendly staff. I can get some work done as I eat.
Visited my brother at Howard and stopped for a drink but had a whole meal. Such a aesthetic. My server Erin was cool and suggested my whole meal.

I had an amazing server, Ava. She showed great service. Lovely personality and very courteous. She was attentive and patient. Made good suggestions for food and drinks. Will definitely come back again.

Whenever I am here I get the wonderful server Ava. She gives some of the greatest service I have ever had in the restaurant industry. I order the lamb sliders during happy hour and always get the hot apple cider. Ava is sweet, diligent and straight to the point. She's knows the menu, she's knows how to run her tables and she knows how to treat her guests.
The food was great. I tried the coconut ice cream for the first time, it was amazing. Our server, Ava was fantastic.

First of all, I have been to several Busboys and Poets and this has become my Favorite...mainly because the Staff is happy, helpful andseems to like what they are doing!! The setting is open, airy and warm.When it is full it can get a bit loud but the food and personnel make up for that. I do have favorites, as I am vegetarian. I love the Tuna salad sandwich using chickpeas...just right seasoning on toasted french bread.All their sandwiches look great, my daughter loves the grilled portabello!The sweet potato fries are also the best ever....other places make them sooo skinny that there is not much to taste but this location is spot on.Servings all seem generous. I always look forward to returning to this location. Thanks Kenny and all the wonderful staff!
I had a wonderful lunch there today! Our server Ava was phenomenal!
The host was very nice and welcoming, it was my first time there.... I believe her name was Shanice
Ava was a great waitress she made our night memorable i took my wife here it was her first time and she loved it Ava really made it a great experience all around
Ava is the best she was very aware of her tables. Extremely nice funny and quick. She's easily top 10 waitress in D.C, give her a raise.
Ava was the best she really made us feel welcomed and entertained us she is a true pleasure to have as a waitress come see her
This is our go to spot after a Sunday service. The food is comforting and delicious, but on this Sunday's occasion we were blessed by Ava... Great personality! Great service!! Thanks again Ava!!!
Phil is absolutely amazing. Made sure I was taken care of from the time I sat down until the time I left. I usually go to a different location, but Phil made this trip worth it.
Ava our server was great!! She check on us and gave us a few laughs, which we enjoyed!! My shrimp and cheese grits was yummy!!
I had a wonderful experience here! The wait time was pretty good and the food was delicious. Plus, Ava, my server, was really good and informative.
We had a big group of 16 and our waiter was totally ok with multiple checks and he was prompt and attentive! The food was also very good!!

Per usual the food at busboys is always A+. 25 minutes after being seated by the hostess our server had yet to come to our table another server Christina noticed that we had not been helped and went to the hostess to check on the situation. Christina was wonderful she brought us water and even took on our table as our server. A+ service and a wonderful meal as always.

My server Ava was great even though my order was simple she made me feel at home and the atmosphere was also great. Also the sweet potato fries are AMAZING! Highly recomend them. Thank you busboys I can't wait to come again.

Service was on point, amazing. Thank you....Lilia and Crishawn for your excellent service. I loved the teamwork at this restaurant. I had the grilled cheese panini with tomato soup, so delicious, especially on a cold winter's day.

Best service that I have ever received at Busboys ... I walk there on Sunday morning to enjoy breakfast and the wonderful atmosphere created by the manager.  The manager has more than once come over to my table, with friends or alone, to check to make sure that I have received good service.Will definitely continue to support Busboys and Poets - Brookland

This is our favorite restaurant. We have enjoyed our visits to all six locations. The best part of our early New Year's Eve dinner was our charming server Michael. He was convivial and knowledgeable about the menu. We liked trying the falafel appetizer, house salad with grilled salmon and salad nicoise on Michael's recommendation. The entire staff was friendly and attentive. Thank you Busboys & Poets for your hospitality!

We had a great brunch ringing in the New Year! Our waitress Alana was great and made our experience excellent. The food was delicious and served quickly with a smile. I highly recommend this restaurant!

I enjoyed the chocolate cake so much here and Michael was a bonus! His customer service and kindnessâ€‹ wereâ€‹ impeccable. I will definitely be returning and I look forward to trying more of the menu. Of course,â€‹ the ambiance is also great, especially in the evening!

Enjoyed a wonderful dinner tonight at Busboys & Poets. Our Server AVA was Awesome! Warm & Wonderful service from this beautiful young lady -- she even helped us take some items to our car parked in front of the restaurant - no stone unturned!!

I came in on break from play rehearsal and experienced great service from our server Turonika. She gave personal opinion on dishes and drinks I told her what I like in tease in a drink and she brought me back the drink with the tease I decided showing her attention to detail. She was all smiles as she waited on my cast mates and I and help one my cast mates navigate through the menu to pick what she wanted. The host also was pleasant. I will come back again cause of the service of my server Turonika and the environment he food was ok

Great restaurant! My family enjoyed breakfast here so much when we were visiting in DC that we came back for dinner too. If you are on a gluten restricted diet - you will be so pleased you came. I had the best French toast I've had in 25 years since being diagnosed with celiac disease. Our servers were wonderful. Thank you Turonika and thank you John for your excellent service and your warm and friendly dispositions. Your big bright smiles made this restaurant extra special.
location: Kendall Park, South Brunswick Township, NJ

text: Love this pace! Nothing ese like it in DC. For the high in openness this small and charming restaurant offers an inclusive and inviting atmosphere. Food is great, with organic and fresh ingredients they deliver high quality every time. Can't say enough about it! I've tried several of their locations and they all impressed!

I'm a very seasoned restaurant patron and come to expect excellent product and service. Although new to the neighborhood, this Busboys is striving to distinguish itself as a great go to restaurant and is very accommodating to its patrons. Needless to say the food is consistently excellent.So...welcome to the neighborhood from one of your new best patrons... P.S. the manager, Kelsey is great and a "Class Act...thanks guys...

A great location and wonderful vibe. Dessi, greets you at the door with a lot of style and bright smile. Crishawn one of the waitresses went out of her way to get me the table that I like to do work. You really have an entire team of help ready to give you a full dining experience.
Dinner here last night October 6 really good experience one of our favorite places server at table 13 was very helpful and a jacket correct that not agenda of but attentive

I live in the Brookland neighborhood nearby this Busboy and Poets and love it! The food is always great tasting and looking! The pizza is always just the right spice and the burgers are phenomenal. I visit at least once a week and always get into interesting conversations at the friendly neighborhood bar, chatting with fellow customers or with Daniel the bartender or their newest addition as one of the night Managers, Nick! As a single woman I never have to worry about creeps bugging me because it is a family friendly restaurant with polite waitstaff all around. One of my favorite things to do after a long day at work and Metro home is to stop in for happy hour during the week or the incredible brunch on Saturday and Sundays! I highly recommend this location. Right across Michigan Ave from Catholic Univeristy on Monroe St! Join me on the patio before the snow flies!

Awesome food and incredible service. Very friendly waitress named Crishawn... Hopefully you're lucky enough to have her wait your table. You'll love the atmosphere... Very open and modern . Conveniently located close to the metro

This was my first time eating there. The service and was fantastic and the food was awesome. I will be returning this Tuesday July 10th. I highly recommend Bus Boys and Poets for Breakfast, Lunch, or Dinner. It was a wonderful experience. Ted
It was my first time here and it was amazing. Corey was excellent and was by far the most amazing server!
Nikk and Daniel gave amazing service at the Monroe Street location! We will come back!
Love the pasta i had there last month, it's very delicious !l

After attending a homegoing service nine of us decided to dine at the Brookland's location. The atmosphere was perfect, we were seated promptly, our waiter Daniel gave excellent service, and the food was delicious! Everyone loved the full experience and when in the area we will dine again!

Excellent Service my waitress Janay... Sweet girl..... was very attentive, courteous, and recommended a very delicious dish....the Catfish... which I would recommend to anyone who's visiting this place.... The atmosphere is very relax....

Fried chicken was something I needed to get my week going. Heather checked on me and Eddye made sure my drink was how I like it.. Straight up. Had a god conversation with a lady at the bar.. I will be back like I always do

The salmon dinner was good I am telling you. Nice smiles and the managers were smiling and staying on top of things to make sure we were taken care of. Managers both heather and Eddie took good care of us

Every neighborhood needs a place like Busboys. Great atmosphere and delicious food. We come for brunch at least twice a month, and stop in for the occasional dinner. Vegan options are the best in DC. The chickpea tuna sandwich and tempe panini are our favorites. On top of all that, their is a Politics and Prose bookstore in the waiting area, which is a great, even when you're not dining out. Sure beats the Barnes and Noble next door.
What dump. Went here on a recent trip to DC. Food was subpar, service was even worse. Depressing environment too. Save your money and go to McDonald's for a superior experience.
They hate republicans! Nope nope nope! Don't give them your business. They are so rude, food is just ok

If you're seeking an unforgettable dining experience in Washington DC, let me steer you away from the Red Hen. This was my second attempt to salvage any redeeming qualities from this establishment during a business trip, and I can confidently say it's a lost cause.Let's delve into the culinary disaster that awaited me. The pasta, or should I say "pastor" (if they were aiming for divine intervention in the kitchen), was a sad, mushy affair that left me questioning if they were even aiming for edible. The sauce? It was as flat as a pancake on a Sunday morning, devoid of any hint of creativity or flavor beyond a generic disappointment.But the horror show doesn't end there. The service was a comedy of errors, albeit not one I found particularly amusing. From botched orders to drinks spilled and staff who seemed to vanish into thin air, it was a masterclass in how not to run a restaurant.In summary, if you're in the market for an evening of culinary catastrophe and service so shoddy it borders on performance art, then the Red Hen is the place for you. As for me, I'll be giving it a wide berth and seeking sustenance elsewhere.

Witnessed the owner being rude to a customer and remove a couple who didn't seem to be doing anything wrong. Decided the owner was a fascist and will never return to that place again. The canopies doors and windows were filth ridden and need to be painted as well.
They do not treat all customers the same! They refuse certain customers! Don't ever go there!
If you are a Republican they give you bad service here

Save yourself the trouble head to the Cheesecake Factory. This restaurant embodies the bastardization of Italian cuisine. From the time you mistakenly take first step into this institution of fraudulence you will be existing in the culinary equivalent of the Truman Show. The look of the restaurant is desperate in its appeal to convince Truman (you) this is a place which justifies its price point. Like Truman, you will discover your misadventure when your tastebuds hit the end of the sea when the underwhelming taste and quality March along your tastebuds like Caesar crossing the rubicon. In short, the Red hen is a den of culinary heretics who deserve to be burned at the altar of Tony Soprano.
The wait staff was RUDE!! The food was horrible..Never coming here again
was not impressed with the food or the service. Will not be going back.
The service here was terrible. I was so disappointed in the service before I got my drinks or food I left. I was not able to make it to the food here.

Don't know why they keep taking down my review. I ate there twice and the food portions were small for what they charge. Service was lacking both times, had to wait long time for refills and ask several times for the same things such as napkins and silverware.

I have never been, but without change of management and public apology to Ms Sanders, I will never go.It's a distasteful and disgusting way to do business.Every day I serve people that I do not agree with politically but because they are humans, I shake their hands, smile, and tell them to have a nice day.Shame!
There are much better options in DC. Skip this place. Service is absolutely the worst, especially the hostess.

this place is the worst. last night i took my colombian girlfriend who is 31 years old to this very average place. the waitress told us after being rude and generally unfriendly that she wouldn't serve my girl wine because she had a colombian id. the policy of the place was only us ids and passports. this was a valid colombian id. so needless to say my girl was very upsent and felt discriminated and embarrassed. almost to tears. i asked for the manager and this dumb*ss sebastian zutant shows up. he looks at the id notice the back of the card which reads "expedition date oct 2012" and thinks the word expedition means "expired" and say im not comfortable serving you because of this and he was afaid to go to jail, so i ask for the check. this was the most ignorant moment i have ever witnessed firsthand. so please dont go to this place. ps the food was not great.
Hostess quoted us a 30 minutes wait and then 90 minutes later said wait would be up to 45 minutes. Not worth it at all.
Can't believe this dump is still open.

Had high hopes for this restaurant. Unfortunately the service lacked hospitality, and it was not a comfortable experience. (ie no high chair available for our infant) My main course was extremely salty. Won't be returning.

Are you kidding me??? How in the world is this place so busy and highly rated? This was some of the worst Italian food I've had in a looong time. I can think of several Italian places that are incomparably better than this: Lupo Verde, Acqua al 2, Ghibellina, Etto, Floriana.... Kraft Macaroni & Cheese even?We sampled all of the top rated appetizers and pastas based on reviews and server recommendations. Absolutely will not eat here again.The 80's music was on point though, and the server was very good, so 2 Stars.

The food was good, but not incredible.The reson for two stars is the staff and their less than friendly attitude.They made us seem that we didn't exist at best.I can get better food and MUCH BETTER service without going out of my way.

Kinda expensive for no reason. Although the food tasted great, the portion size sucks. At least the staff were super cool, but I wouldn't come back here again. There's probably a better Italian food restaurant out there.
The food was fine, but everything was 40% more expensive than it should have been given the quality, which was nothing special.

My estimation on the consideration of their service not for another place but it is one of the pretty good place to be for another time with easy and sound done for each time. The place is fit for three stars and it losses to get tow star.

The food was REALLY good but our bartender wasn't very fun. We went on a Sunday night a while back and the restaurant wasn't that busy. The wine selection was very cool- things I haven't seen before so I took a shot on some wine that was described as "funky"- interesting. Would go again.

Came here with two friends for a nosh and some drinks. They didn't have a table for us, but we scored three seats at the bar. Since the bar is small, we decided to stay with appetizers and drinks. The small plates were pretty good but the drinks were kind of yucky. Each cocktail we ordered was bitter and not balanced. Plus they were super small and extremely expensive. The bartender could have been nice to us but she decided to ignore us instead. Oh, well. Guess that happens when your restaurant is popular.
I came here for my birthday and I was glad we had reservations. The food was ok.
Vegan friendly. The kale was very good, my two experiences with the vegan pasta have been great and good, and the sorbet was ok. The wine and cocktails were also very good.
This place was very good! I went with some friends for a birthday dinner. All the food was excellent, service was a tad slow but other than that I can't complaining!
very casual place, specializing in Pasta. We were a group of 5 and everything we had was delicious. Highly recommended,
loved it... thought it was way too expensive..
Pretty good. not sure it's worth all the hype but it's good.
The decor is beautiful light and modern but with an Italian counrty homey feel. The food is very fresh perfect large portions and delicious combination. Highly recommended this place.

Overall great dinner. Appetizers were a bit underwhelming, but cocktails were great. The pasta is amazing and highly recommended. The general pacing of the meal felt hurried and we were served mains when appetizers were still on the table even with waiting to order until once the appetizers were served. The wine list is great and relatively affordable. Server was very nice and helpful. I did not like being sat so close to the kitchen's heatlamps but asking to move would have been difficult as they're very busy on Saturday nights. Go and get the fresh made pasta!
Best Italian neighborhood spot. All the dishes are a good portion and exquisite. Chicken liver mousse for life. Well priced wine list and wonderfully curated. The service has always been impeccable.

This place is truly fantastic. Not cheap, but worth every penny and more. The magic is in the details. It takes something special to make a simple pasta dish that is comforting, refreshing, subtle, and memorable.
Fantastic food, even better service. One of the drinks I had was the best of that type I'd ever had - so the bar knows what it's doing.

A nice Italian place in the city with nice atmosphere and decent food. I liked the Mezze Rigatoni with their great Ragu sauce but I couldn't say the same for the squid ink linguini. Don't get me wrong, it was tasty but the breadcrumbs were making it feel strange. Good service and You should definitely pay a visit if you are around.

This is a great place to share a bottle of wine and light, flavorful small plates. The chocolate budino dessert was also outstanding. Beyond the food, I'm really impressed with the transformation of this space. The room is gorgeous, with impeccable touches throughout. I highly recommend for a nice date night out, or for drinks at the bar.

Everything was wonderful. I got the scallops with a pea thing at the center. the pea dish was wonderful. I really dont normally enjoy peas, but yet they made this was fantastic. everyone at the table had a flavor and adored it. the service from a gitl with a superb trendy tat of a girl on her arm. Great wine. and sparkling water free of charge!
Great food... Imaginative and tasty. The service was awesome, but wine and drink offerings were a little lacking.
See earlier review

Just ate dinner at the red hem with a friend. The burrata was exceptional, great texture and flavor. My friend and I each ate a pasta course and were also pleased. Perfectly cooked noodles and well seasoned sauce. Thank you guys for a pleasant experience.
Excellent food. My favorite? The Maple Custard. Wow.

Everything we anticipated it would be and more. Engaged and informed service with top-notch and balanced menu selections. Creste de Gallo pasta was off the charts, as was the beef my fiancÃ© ordered. Our server guided us through the beer and cocktail list and gave wonderful suggestions...try the Bruery (sp?) sour beer...you wont be disappointed. The setting is warm and intimate, but please don't bring your poorly behaved children along for dinner...it's annoying and borderline rude in a restaurant of this quality and atmosphere. It seems like people are either too cheap or too inconsiderate to hire a nanny for a Saturday night out. This is one of the best places in D.C. to enjoy a finely crafted meal with great beer. Red Hen + drinks after at Boundary Stone=perfect Bloomingdale Saturday night.

Great neighborhood spot with delicious and affordable drinks and wines. It really puts to shame the other restaurants with $14 cocktails and wines-by-the-glass. The food was good, but not great. Everything was either a little too salty or a little too sweet. Standout dish was the Sweetbreads with polenta, bacon and fried egg...can't go wrong with that combo.DC needs more places like this.
The food was amazing! The staff was very professional and helpful with their recommendations.

The Red Hen is a culinary gem that consistently delivers. While their pasta dishes are undoubtedly divine, it's their main courses that truly steal the show. The Roasted Green Circle Farm chicken is a masterpiece. Juicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection, it's a dish that will leave you craving more.The wine selection is impressive, offering a variety of options to complement your meal. And the service is top-notch, attentive without being intrusive. If you're looking for a memorable dining experience, The Red Hen is the place to be.

Absolutely amazing Italian place. Let me start with the spectacular service. Our host were amazing, we ordered the whipped ricotta crostini and the Mezze rigatoni, the food was so tasty and delicious, the pasta was perfectly cooked.

I had an absolutely fantastic experience at the Red Hen in Washington DC. My reservation for 8 pm for two people was not only on time but seated right away upon arrival, which was a pleasant surprise. As someone who works in the industry, I often find myself waiting past my reservation time, but this was not the case here.Our server was incredibly attentive and quickly provided us with sparkling water. We started with the Arancini 'cacio E Pepe, and I must admit, I was a bit skeptical about ordering something fried. However, these risotto balls were a true delight. They were not only delicious but also neatly presented, with no hint of greasiness.Choosing our entrees was a tough decision since everything on the menu sounded fantastic. My girlfriend opted for the Mezzi Rigatoni Pasta, while I went with the Pappadelle Short Rib in Sugo Pasta . We both savored every bite and cleared our plates. The flavors and quality of the dishes were outstanding.To top off this wonderful experience, we were surprised with a complimentary cacio e pepe pasta, which isn't on the menu but can be requested. It was incredibly delicious, and I only wish I had more room in my stomach to enjoy the entire dish.Overall, our visit to the Red Hen was a solid 5/5 experience, and I can't wait to return. The excellent service, delectable food, and unexpected culinary surprises made this dining experience truly memorable.

Our server Veronica was wonderful. We ordered the Mezzi Rigatoni, Squid Ink Pasta, Chicken Liver & Foie Grasse Mousse, and 4 drinks total (pics not shown for all). Tables for 2 to dine-in along the back wall were a little close to each other for my liking (hitting butts against the tables) but the service and food were spectacular. Make sure to make a reservation, it's just easier.Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 4/5

I recently visited The Red Hen and tried a few different dishes. I started off with the Duck Liver & Foie Gras Mousse and Roasted Fig appetizer, and it was absolutely delicious. The mousse was the star of the show - smooth, creamy, and packed with flavor. The fig added a nice sweetness and texture to the dish.For my main course, I had the Pappardelle alla Genovese and the Squid Ink Pasta. The Genovese was good, with tender chunks of short beef in a savory tomato-based sauce. The pasta was perfectly cooked, with just the right amount of bite. However, the Squid Ink Pasta was a little disappointing. While the pasta itself was cooked well and the squid was fresh and perfectly cooked, the dish was slightly too salty and had an unexpected taste of ginger, which seemed out of place. It was a shame because I could tell the pasta was made with care and high-quality ingredients.Despite the hiccup with the squid ink pasta, I still had a great dining experience at The Red Hen. The atmosphere was lively and fun, and the service was attentive and friendly. I would recommend the Duck Liver & Foie Gras Mousse and the Pappardelle alla Genovese.

An absolutely amazing dining experience! Four of us (two vegetarian) were celebrating birthdays and decided to make it a special dinner at IALW! Each course was both visually beautiful as well as delicious, and the service was impeccable. Don't miss the dessert - Apparently a Pear, or Cameron and Faira, the cheese cow. Seriousness and whimsy rolled into one.

Red Hen is hands down, BEST place in town for pasta. Order the cacio e peppe, it's a off the menu dish. If an Italian restaurant can't make this. Walk out. I also had the duck appetizer, amazing!
Rustic and well done! Pasta is always cooked al-dente and very hearty!
Food is great. Thank you
AMAZING! Everything about Red Hen is amazing! Love the vibe, food, and service! 5 out 5 with no hesitation.
Simply delicious. I would have tried everything on this menu if I could.
SO tasty. A must try for pasta lovers in DC.
What's not to love bout the Red Hen.

If you like italian, this is your spot. In fact this is THE best spot for italian in DC. I absolutely love the decor and atmosphere, the food is great, drinks are great, and staff is extremely well trained.
Get the smoked ricotta honey toast
Amazing food and services, hidden gem in DC. Highly recommended.
Delicious foods, friendly staff. What more could you ask for?

This place is amazing. Randomly went on national margarita day and the bartender was so accommodating and whipped up a spicy one for me with her collection of bitters! Love the food, atmosphere and service!
Great waiter, good food, and try the orange wine!

I took myself out for a solo date on Friday to The Red Hen. The verdict: I ate way more cheese than I should have, and I left stuffed and happy.Appetizer: I started with the burrata, and I ate the whole thing. I adore burrata. I was also pleased that instead of bread as an accompaniment, it topped a lovely spring salad.Main: Saffron mafalde with duck ragu - perfect pieces of duck, delicious sauce, great portion size that could have been shared but was manageable for 1. Dessert: Salted butterscotch budino. Basically a pudding for adults. Great end to the meal. I was way too full to order this, but I did anyway. Next time I come, I'll bring people so I can try more things and not make myself sick by forcing down dessert.The cocktail I had was nice, too - Sunshine and Daydreams. Minty and fresh and not too s
great place, ambience. service is good and food is enjoyable

One of my favorite spots for pasta in the DMV. I've been coming here regularly since 2014 and it's still just as good as I remember! They have a killer wine list as well. I love sitting at the bar and watching the action in the open kitchen!
Great food, friendly and helpful staff. We enjoy it, even the menu changes from time to time, food is always delicious
I have not been to this place in a while but in the two times I have tried it, it has not disappointed at all. Deliciousness is what comes to my mind.
Great food and excellent service! Homeade pasta was like mom's and the chicken liver mousse was heavenly! I closed my eyes and savored every bite.

Consistently great food, clever cocktails and skillful service. If you are walking in without a reservation, a one-hour wait is not unusual. But that's common at every restaurant that's doing such good things. So if you expect that, and plan for it, you will be happy.
Amazing food ( everything is delicious and very fresh!!) - one of my favorite restaurant in DC.
One of the best restaurants in DC, love their food. Great wine selection, friendly customer service. We tried couple of different dishes and was perfect.
Food was legit!!! Great food great drinks!

I came here with my mom and some family friends, and it was the best meal we had all weekend- worth all the hype! We split three of the pastas, including the rigatoni that our waiter said was perfect for eating your feelings. The cavatelli was also incredible. We started with the cauliflower and the burrata. The burrata was melt in your mouth delicious, and the cauliflower was crispy with a delicious sauce. I don't even like cauliflower and I still gobbled this up. For dessert we tried the maple custard, which was also delicious. Definitely recommend making reservations in advance- I made these about three weeks ahead of time.

Had been looking forward to trying this place out for months but haven't had a chance until last weekend. Needless to say, it absolutely blew me away. Service was great, especially on a busy Saturday night. The food was even better. We shared the bruschetta and I had the rigatoni. Both of which I highly recommend. Wine selection was phenomenal. Can't wait to come back.
best restaurant in dc. hands down.
Just go and try it. The pasta with the sauerkraut is great.
Food was extant haven't really had anything like it before. Our waiter was the best. You have to make reservations weeks in advance. Parking is on the street. Can't wait to go again.

This place doesn't disappoint. We had the burrata, rigatoni, and short ribs and all were delicious. Food came out quickly but then the waiter took forever once we were finished eating. All in all I would definitely return to try other things on the menu. Highly recommend!
Everything we had here was very unique and the taste was great.
Absolutely everything we ordered from the menu was delicious! I love how the menu changes seasonally too. The atmosphere is fun too.
I always sit at the bar. I arrive at opening and allow the bar tender to select for me. I have yet to be disappointed by any dish. My favorite go to for a nice meal at the bar..

I have to say I'm pissed with The Red Hen. With one fell stroke The Red Hen ruined my blind date.She was pretty enough and I think I had a shot but picking the Red Hen as a date restaurant was a huge mistake, especially for someone like me. Whenever I like food I just get real quiet and eat my heart away, it is almost impossible for me to keep a conversation with anyone I am eating with. THAT IS EXACTLY WHAT HAPPENED WITH MY DATE. I ordered the Beef short ribs for both of us (horrible choice for date food, I know, yes it was very messy). The sauce that the Beef Ribs were covered in was stimulating to the point that I felt my tongue water whilst I ate. My date didn't eat as much as I, but she did say that she loved the taste. They had a great selection of drinks so I ordered some red wine hoping she wouldn't mind the fact that I wasn't talking much if she had some alcohol in her... it did not work.So yes, I enjoyed my food too much and I didn't enjoy my date enough. I really have to get this problem fixed, but for now, I won't be bringing any dates to The Red Hen. However, if you can enjoy food and company the same time though, this is a great place to try out.
One of the best restaurants in DC! Every dish was more fantastic than the next.

I've been here twice and I think that the food is truly exceptional. I'm going to run down most the things that I've tried here for anyone who's curious, but one thing to note is that EVERYTHING was great, so, even if I have areas that I might have liked differently, that might just be an issue of personal taste. Before going through everything, my high level favorites were:*Smoked Riccota Crostini*Heirloom Beet Salad*Saffron Zucca*Maple Custard (second place goes to the apple crumb cake, which was also awesome)Now, to the details!:*Smoked Ricotta Crostini. I thought that this was amazing. The portion is light (not small, just light). Our waiter recommended that we get this delivered with the desserts, which was nice. Very tasty, the honey and cheese is a great combination.*Tuscan Chicken Liver Crostini. I'm not a huge chicken liver fan, so wasn't my favorite, but one of my dining companions is a huge chicken liver fan and loved it. I mean, she said it was one of the best things that she's ever eaten and she's eaten at a lot of great places.*Heirloom Beet Salad. Loved it. I'm normally not a huge beet fan, but the beets were so fresh and I loved the pistachios and mozzarella. Really highly recommend.*Burrata with Grilled Broccolini. Burrata is one of my favorite things, so I was excited about this one, but honestly I thought that the extra components almost took away from the dish. This might be a personal taste thing, but I like burrata simple with some crusty bread.*Grilled octopus. Similar to the burrata, the octopus was perfectly cooked and incredibly delicious, but the extra sauces and components just took away from the octopus. Again, may be a personal taste issue, but our table all thought that the the same octopus with just some lemon and olive oil would have been better.*Saffron zucca with heirloom squash puree. Unbelievable, truly amazing. This might have been one of my favorite things that I've had all night, and in the city as a whole. The quality of the pasta...words don't describe, it's so good. I'm stuffed right now and my mouth still waters thinking about it. Close to perfect.*Spinach fettuccine with braised duck. Although very tasty, the saffron zucca was so incredible, that this one may not have been as appreciated as it should have been. The duck was great, but, again, I just couldn't stop eating the saffron zucca.*Mezze rigatoni. Again, very very tasty and the quality of the pasta was flawless. I still think that I liked the saffron zucca better (more interesting flavors and I love mushrooms), but the mezze rigatoni is a definite crowd pleaser.*Roasted spaghetti squash. I really really liked this. Very well cooked and I loved the hazelnuts on it. Really good, highly recommend, especially in the Fall.Now, I know that this is already too long, but I have to talk about the desserts for a second, because these are what take amazing to unbelievable holy god good. These desserts are why I often prefer to come here over other city faves such as Rose's Luxury:*Maple Custard with Caramelized Hazelnut. Yes. Just, yes. I've eaten a lot of food in a lot of amazing places. This is one of the best things that I've ever eaten. Ever. This is so amazing, I just don't even have words. This place is worth it if all it served was this custard.*Heirloom apple crumb cake. Really delicious, almost licked the plate. Although nothing will replace the maple custard in my heart, this is a close second.*Spiced pumpkin cake with chocolate sauce. Honestly, the cake was a little dry and I was a tad disappointed. HOWEVER, the ice cream with it was amazing. Coffee with chunks of chocolate, great flavor and texture.So, after this insanely long review, you need to come to Red Hen. Waits can be long, but I think sitting at the bar is more fun anyway. Remember to save room for dessert!
Great foot, ber and ambiance. Yummy cctail
Great place. Friendly service and atmosphere. Handmade pastas are terrific, liked everything we had, especially basil pan a cotta for dessert.
Awesome place!

Cracked egg is trash now. Not sure why they straight up refused a simple request to put the sauces on the side for my order :(  Must be new management or something bc i used to order this all of the time with no issue. will not be returning.
It's fine nothing too special a little overpriced for an egg sandwich with nothing special
I was impressed. I wanted a breakfast and wanted to try something different. It was delicious and ready quick. I recommend.
Pricy but delicious. Gonna have to watch out having those tots so close to where I live!! The sandwich was delicious. But what will keep bringing me back is how amazing the customer service is!

Really delicious breakfast sandwich! I got the Mayer with crumbled bacon. The sandwich looked just like the pictures, was fresh and had a good amount of bacon! The bacon had a sweetness to it that was so wonderful! I started eating these pictures first. It looked so good.
Here on a quick family trip. This quickly became our go to breakfast spot. We've tried a lot of the sandwiches now and have not been disappointed yet.
food was amazing. It tasted so good. I love it so much it was amazing to go with my family while they visited.
Very fresh and delicious. Customer service was very great!! Very informative. I will be going back. Great job guys. Thanks
Had the rancheros and it was delicious. Lots of flavor there. Service was great as well.
I ordered once and was very pleased

If management's plan is to make Primrose in Brookland a haven for white-collar rednecks, they are on track for achieving their business goal.The particulars of the offensive service my friends and I received while troubling on many levels, are not as indicative of Primrose's modus operandi as the fact that once we shared our experience with others, we discovered we were not the only people who had been treated so poorly. Fortunately, Brookland's Finest is less than two blocks down the street. They have an excellent menu and an ambiance that buffers its customers from the Trump-era mentality in DC which, albeit an undercurrent, is an undertow of ignorance and privilege crashing onto the dining "scene" in our dear city with increasing frequency. Despite the WP raves, "bistros" like Primrose are leaving a very sour taste in the mouths of people who truly appreciate the jewel that is Washington DC.
Tasteless food. Worst cocktails I have had in a while. Poor service and forced 20% service fee. Avoid.

The food was delicious and the atmosphere was very pleasing. They have a good mix of meals prepared in-house and lots of good appetizers to get the meal started. They also offer some unique cocktails that go very well with all of the meals. The service was great and we left satisfied with the overall experience.
Super chill atmosphere. The bartender was super friendly and welcoming. I did go on the weekend and didnt have a reservation,however, was able to get a spot at the bar quickly.

Primrose is such a cozy, charming spot! The food is fresh and flavorful, the staff is super friendly, and the vibe makes you feel right at home. It's the kind of place where you can relax, enjoy a great meal, and just soak in the warm atmosphere.Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie
This neighborhood gem hits all the marks! excellent good excellent service and nice ambiance. my one criticism is that they didn't serve bread with the meal. Go figure...
Very good service and great food. Menu changes frequently but some mainstays keep you coming back. Atmosphere is charming and they are adding more permanent covered outdoor space
Amazing service and great drinks! Loved my experience there would definitely recommend for a date night!
Food was delicious and we also enjoyed the atmosphere. Everything was well done!
Wonderful wonderful wonderful place to go! Food is terrific, staff is wonderful and Sebastian has blue hair! Can't get much better than that!
Best place i never been to. Doubt if it even exists. If it does I wish the best for all!
I've been to many poke places and never had a poke bowl this good. Salmon was so fresh. Definitely will be returning.

The moment my family and I stepped inside, we were welcomed with warm smiles and a genuine eagerness to make our visit memorable. The staff at Fat Fish went above and beyond, ensuring that every customer felt like a cherished guest. Their knowledge and enthusiasm about the menu were apparent, as they guided us through the options, patiently answering our questions and offering insightful recommendations. The exceptional customer service truly set the stage for a remarkable dining experience.The atmosphere inside Fat Fish was equally captivating. The combination of the open door, the gentle breeze, and the cozy interior created a harmonious blend of comfort and freshness. It felt as though we were dining al fresco, basking in the joy of a beautiful day while being surrounded by a delightful ambiance. The inviting decor and soothing background music further enhanced the overall experience, making us feel right at home in this charming culinary haven.Now, let's talk about the star of the show--the food! Fat Fish prides itself on delivering dishes that are not only healthy but also bursting with freshness and flavor. With each bite, we could taste the quality of the ingredients and the care that went into their preparation. The menu offered a wide array of entrees, showcasing an impressive range of flavors and culinary inspirations. From vibrant salads to mouthwatering seafood dishes, there was something for everyone in our family.However, it was the taiyaki ice cream in a fish cone that truly stole the spotlight. If you're seeking a dining experience that celebrates health, freshness, and delightful indulgence, look no further than Fat Fish.
Best sushi in DC hands down. Great takeout spot for poke bowls, ramen and unique sushi.
So cute and the poke was delicious!

I have been going to this place for a few years but NO more! I saw how blatantly racist these workers are to minorities on many occasions. It is a shame because the older lady that owns the restaurant is nice, welcoming and respectful but these other workers, specially the Chinese man with the glasses, they are horrid and dismissive to minorities. The entire mood of the place changes if she is there vs not.

I recently visited Dumplings and Beyond and was unfortunately disappointed with the experience. While I had high expectations for the food, the dumplings were underwhelming. The filling lacked flavor, and the dough was a bit too thick, making them feel heavy. The rest of the dishes we ordered were just average, with nothing really standing out. On top of that, the service was slow, and we had to wait quite a while for our food despite the restaurant not being particularly busy. Overall, I felt that both the food and service could use significant improvement to match the reputation the restaurant seems to have.
dumplings r good

Mediocre Chinese food, with Dc prices. The best dish was the cucumber salad, light and refreshing. They have a nice ginger tea which is sweet and calming. Service is typical. It can get pretty busy for dinner.
Very decent food. Everything was good and I'd go again in a pinch but wouldn't come running back.

We were in the area and checked our nearby restaurants. We decide to try Dumpling and Beyond, since it looked interesting. We had a delicious but relatively small lunch. The Beijing cucumber salad, cool, crisp, and garlicky, was a surprise and quite good. The place was full of Chinese people and family. We would like to come back for dinner sometime and try the dumplings. The menu has lots of things to try out, and the food is good and reasonable priced.
location: West Los Angeles, West Los Angeles, CA

text: Dumpling and beyond is a very nice restaurant , it was my first visit there and i was really satisfied with the food and service. Their Pot stickers are my favorite.
Dumpling is special Chinese food, I like pork dumpling and scallion pancakes, you know , so delicious . The price is reasonable. I will come again.
I like this place, There so many chinese flavors foods, I usually order steamed pork bun and scallion pancakes as my snacks, so delicious.
I very like this place, because of many chinese food what I like. All kinds of dumpling and scallion pancakes is my favorite. so delicious.

Had beef and onion dumplings (fried), and they did not disappoint. Great dumplings, exactly what I was looking for. Price is decent. I also had hot sour soup and it was extremely bland, neither hot nor sour so I would skip the soup next time.

Dumplings is my new favorite Chinese restaurant in Washington. Who knew that you could find great Chinese food in the District? No more schlepping to Seven Corners and beyond. I was taken here by a friend from Beijing, so I figured she knew authentic dumplings. We had the pork dumplings, pancakes and cold tree ear mushrooms. The dishes were all flawless. Service was efficient and friendly. The restaurant was far nicer than your average Chinese take-out hole in the wall. It is across Wisconsin Ave from Whole Foods in Glover Park so you can pop in for a lunch before you do your grocery shopping. Highly recommended!

Exceptionally good! A top favorite in DC, especially for those with vegan and vegetarian preferences. The chow fun and scallion pancakes are my personal favorites. Despite moving just a mile away from my previous location, I'm now too far for delivery, but I highly recommend this place!
