Some of the best dumplings I've had in the DMV. Love the sake and all the entrees I've had too.
They reopening of dine-in services after the pandemic, we are excited to back to the restaurant.
love the the food it was .All good get it A
Best dumplings in the city, no question. Scallion pancakes also deserve recognition, I could make a whole meal of those alone!
The dumplings at this restaurant are great indeed. This is my first time coming here and I'm going to say it's all been fantastic. The price and service of the meal.

The dumplings here and good and tasty. They give you a nice helping as well. We both had the soup and fried dumplings. I was starving when I went in and was glad that it was not packed. I would say it is not a hole in the way type of place but it isn't a dress up fancy type of place either. Somewhere in the middle where you can enjoy a meal but not feel pressured to dress up too much. On my next trek back i will try the different varieties.
Perfect dumplings, always my favorite restaurant in DC!
Simply amazing!!! The food was awesome and reasonably priced. If dining in, be prepared to wait a min for a table to open but it is so worth the wait!!
Name says it all. DUMPLINGS. Definitely worth it, best I've ever had in DC
I love this place and have used it several times for delivery.. Always delicious and always on time

Pretty good for the cheap eats category. Everything was very fresh and homemade. However I would warn against their bubble teas. Everyone that ordered one at the table which is 5 people did not care for it.

LOVE this place! I recently moved to Glover Park and this is my favorite spot to get takeout. The dumplings are delicious and the sweet and sour chicken is the best I've had! I highly recommend. Definitely call ahead and place your order though because it takes a while!
The food was amazing, the atmosphere was lovely and the staff was friendly and helpful! Loved it!

CR NoMa was a great spot to bring my friends on their visit to DC! Trendy atmosphere with a great selection of drinks. I got the Volta Face and it was phenomenal. Also - the 'Cigars' are a must! Wonderful staff. Our waiter "Harry" was a sweetie! Will definitely be back soon!
Atmosphere, food and service were excellent. Food was fresh and full of flavor. Our server was friendly and helpful. Will definitely go back.
Messed up my drink order 3 times and charged me for all of them.
Wasn't bad wasn't great! Would definitely return to try other menu items. Service was great though!
Food: 4/5 | Service: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 4/5
I ate here for the first time last night and had a really nice time. My boyfriend and I shared the arancini and tuna carpaccio which were both tasty

Fine Italian neighborhood spot in the heart of Adam's Morgan, Washington, DC. Delicious bites at a reasonable price. Staff were knowledgeable and made quality recommendations when needed. Handsomely designed and decorated. Great for a date, outing with friends, or intimate business dinner.
Great food and great service!! We sat next to the kitchen was a wonderful experience !!!

I recently had the pleasure of dining at this fantastic Italian restaurant and I must say, it exceeded all my expectations. The food was great , especially the short rib Pappardelle Each bite was bursting with flavor and cooked to perfection. The staff at this restaurant truly knows how to make you feel special. From the moment I walked in, the host greeted me with a warm smile.The bartender deserves a special mention as well. Not only did they recommend a wine that perfectly complemented my tastes, but they also took the time to ask about my preferences. His recommendation was spot-on, and I thoroughly enjoyed every sip. The attention to detail and personalized service truly made my evening.The waiter was equally exceptional, providing excellent recommendations and ensuring that my dining experience was exceptional. Even though the restaurant was bustling with activity, I never felt rushed or neglected. The atmosphere was lively, I happened to be sitting out on a beautiful evening , creating the perfect ambiance for a memorable evening.Overall, I cannot recommend this restaurant enough. The combination of incredible food, attentive staff, and welcoming atmosphere made for a truly remarkable experience. If you're looking for an outstanding Italian dining experience, thats not too fancy , laid back,, great food...his is the place to be!"no

Everything about Retrobottega is charming and on point. From my new favorite word - cicchetti - which are Italian small plates, to service and drink selection, this Is definitely a welcome addition to Admo. I have gone multiple times for happy hour and dinner bringing friends and family - delicious every time! This place is the best and it's pretty darn easy to love the owner but you have to deal with admo parking â€. He will be there for you. He will save you. Wonderful place, grateful to have been a part of it and angry at the people who non capisce.
Had a late dinner here and it was incredible! Food came very fast and the staff was very friendly.
Presently surprised with this place. Everything's from drinks to the entree were great. Even the bread at our table was great. The service was also great.

went to Adams Morgan newest Italian restaurant, had the Negroni slushie, ( had two ) mmmm it was perfect considering how hot the weather has been. While everything on the menu sounded delicious...what I was craving wasn't on the menu. Asked our waiter if I could have cacio e Pepe which is very easy dish to make, and f'n delicious! They also brought out the yummiest focaccia bread. run dont walk to this place!
Great food, great atmosphere. I really can't say that there is much about this place I didn't like. Try as much as you can.
Service was amazing! Food and wine was even more amazing! And the ambiance was perfect! Definitely a new favorite!
So good! Tried several things on the menu and everything was great. Service was wonderful, professional and friendly. Highly recommend.
Excellent food, drinks and service. Definitely going back to explore more of the menu.

Omg, my new favorite place on Adams Morgan, I decide to come and try this new place and let me tell you, I am so happy that I was the first person on write a review, I had different fried cicchetti for appetizer, and for main course we got the rabbit cacciatore!!!!!! It was tender juicy and the flavor combinations were on point. Also the bar looks amazing we got 2 negroni and were perfect. Great job guys I will be back soon with more friends hopefully I can get a table with out a reservation since I was the first on writing a review :)
Worrest service and food another location from lo quality food over priced menu never go back this place.

Ordered takeout from London Curry House. We got an order of chicken tikka masala and the lamb vindaloo to split. The lamb vindaloo was aggressively spicy without adding much flavor, and the chicken tikka masala was overly sweet. Will definitely give London Curry House another try given how many friends have recommended it, but unlikely to order the tikka masala or vindaloo again.
Really delicious. I'd definitely go back. Not cheap, but worth it.
The best Indian food in DC by far! Absolutely incredible. A little on the spicy side but the flavor is amazing. Definitely go, it's a must!

Dined at this restaurant with a group of friends today during Ramadan, and I have to say that the experience was incredibly disappointing and borderline disrespectful. I was embarrassed because it was my idea to come here. The service was terrible, with our waiter bringing flat sodas twice and disappearing for an extended period of time, leaving us with empty cups and no idea when he would return.To make matters worse, when the food finally arrived, it was cold, despite the plates being hot. This made me wonder if the food had been sitting out for a while before it was served. This was particularly frustrating as our group was observing Ramadan, and we were hoping for a hot, fresh meal to break our fast.Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The service was unacceptable, and the food was subpar at best. The bill was almost $300 and we only ate maybe half of the food if that. Save yourself the trouble and go elsewhere for a more enjoyable dining experience.

Absolutely a waste of money and a terrible fit for the location on 14th Street. It is all flair and no flavor - every dish allowed for about 4 bites max. We split 10 dishes across 5 people and needed to go get food elsewhere after to actually be full. The dishes looked beautiful but there wasn't actually enough food on them to determine how they tasted. Our waiter Terrance was great - the only good thing about the experience.

Got there early on a Saturday night. We were lucky to get a few seats at the bar before the place started filling up. Planned to just get a quick drink before dinner somewhere else. This place is SO cool we stayed and tried several of their small plates/tappas/appetizers. Food was amazing, very very good. The vibe of the place (music, decor etc) was cool. Service was exceptional....very attentive and knowledgeable but not hovering, just perfect. We ended up staying for more drinks and dessert. New favorite restaurant in DC
Stopped by just for drinks and had a great time. The limoncello cocktail was one of the best I have had in DC and our server, Julio, was fantastic. Will return again.

pleasantly surprised by this relatively new restaurant on 14th streeet. the ambience is great. staff very welcoming and the food was excellent. Julio suggested an excellent temparanillo to accompany our meal. standouts on the menu were the scallops which were perfectly cooked and the Hamachi. The pork cheeks were also good and assorted breads with the dip were a nice touch. definitely recommend.

The service was fantastic and the food was so beautiful. Our waiter was attentive and the courses were perfectly timed so we were never without a plate but never overloaded. We were greeted with assorted breads and delicious spreads, had the eggplant and Brussels sprouts for course one and then scallops and crab for course 2.
Food was great and Julio was an excellent server!
Great food made better by great staff. Particularly Julio and Ahmet who could not have been more attentive.

What a beautiful restaurant. In a vibrant neighborhood with lots of foot traffic sit the fun Dolce Vita. Julio provided fantastic service and solid recommendation. The food was extremely tasty with beautiful presentatio. (Greek salad is the best I've had). Price point seemed on par with excellent service and food. Thank you Julio, thank you Dolce Vita.
Julio was the best! The food was fantastic, the vibe was comfortable and it made me feel at home, well fed as usual.

Sublime selection of drinks and meze entrÃ©es. Marina & Julio were the perfect hostess and host to an unforgettable evening. I will definitely come back for more. Congratulations on an exquisitely appointed space.

Our group had to wait an hour to be seated for our reservation- but the service made up for it! The food was exquisite and the server, Omar, was super attentive and helpful. Overall, very well pleased!!
Excellent service, our server Julio was amazing. The food is incredible! Highly recommended!

My husband and I came in for dinner because our friend told us the place was amazing. We were blown away by everything from the decor to the cuisine. Our waiter Tim was very entertaining and knowledgeable. He recommended 2 tapas, the calamari and the beef kabob which were both fantastic! We followed that with the Greek salad and the oh so tender lamb!! We will definitely be back with more friends! Thank you so much to the entire Lupo group! AMAZING!!!!!!!
DeberÃ­an desicarce a solo vender alcohol porque la comida esta horrible. pÃ©sima la verdad De ribete me salieron pelos en la sopa .

WARNING, if you eat at this restaurants, be aware: check your receipt, they give you the menu with prices, but charge much more on the receipt, they don't reflect the price on the menu. They try to charge you more than what is reflected on the menu. Please CHECK your RECEIPT before you pay. Food was ok, but taking advantage of people and trying to charge more is not ok.

The food and service were OK. The enchiladas were tasty but the tortilla was hard as leather possibly old or overcooked. I found the tortillas the tacos were rolled with too thick and soggy. Don't remember the name of the third dish, but it was ground meat over green plantains, pretty good.

The food and service were OK. The enchiladas were tasty but the tortilla was hard as leather possibly old or overcooked. I found the tortillas the tacos were rolled with too thick and soggy. Don't remember the name of the third dish, but it was ground meat over green plantains, pretty good.
i like here so much, Every time I enjoy myself when I come here for my dinner. quick and friendly service let me feel good.
I love the mexican food is my favorite. I like to try other food but Benitos Place's is my favorite
This place conglomerates the best of Central American cuisine. Very affordable and great portions.

This is our second time visiting DC, and yes we came back because the food is seasoned to perfection here. Everything is made fresh to order from what I was told, so if it takes a minute to receive your food that is the reason. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for authentic homemade food.
Awesome food! Awesome service! The food was very authentic and quality margs. Definitely will be back!!!
Excellent service and authentic latin food. Portions are more than sufficient, bring an appetite, you may even take some to go. I would definitely come back whenever back to visit DC
So good! The corn tortillas were homemade and fresh. The fried chicken was also yummy. The beans were good.
+ Such a fun, new place+ You can't go wrong with the fajitas+ so glad this is now in the neighborhood

Im not sure how anyone gave this place a good review.Appetizer course of pasta was ICE COLD with the sauce warm, how does this happen unless you microwave? Even immersion in boiling water won't give this result. When I sent it back it came back exactly the same way.Admittedly they don't have a wine cellar and wine is served way too warmFood was served in a deep bowl impossible to cut with knife and fork provided, again ridiculous, they just don't know what they are doing here. DISASTER!

My friend and I have been to Floriana several times for brunch and enjoyed it. We went on a Friday afternoon for lunch, looking forward to some good Italian food. We were getting ready to order and asked if we could have some bread

I booked a table a couple of weeks before a dinner. I was told that I can get a window seat on the first floor (which I get used to and which I usually like). I was also told, by a man, that there will be a large party on that day, but I was told very clearly that the party will be placed on the second floor and so would not affect me. On the day of arrival, to my disappointment, the girl who arranged our seat placed the large party on the first floor and us on the second floor, which was much worse in terms of decor etc. No window seat. And even more to my disappointment, there emerged another big party group on the second floor as well. There were plenty of good restaurants around DC, and the only reason I chose this one is I thought it would not be too loud. And I was totally wrong. When I was seated, there was no greetings from the waiter as they were so busy with the large parties.The food is bearable, but not outstanding. I guess a bad review is not so much loss to them compared to big parties or groups which can bring them much money. But still I want to warn people like me who kind of naively believed that they care.

Dino T. of Floriana is wrong, I to experienced at this type of behavior, food, and others at this restaurant. The person who put that information out there is right. Anytime that a restaurant/owner has to defend themselves on an open forum site like YELP, there is something wrong with the restaurant/owner. Kind of makes you think, the restaurant/owner is putting all of the good stuff on this site to get you in their restaurant to make money only. There are others who have posted words that echo the same story

If I can give less than one star, I would.This is the worst restaurant in Washington, DC if not the worst restaurant in the world. I have eaten at Floriana several times and for the last time, and each time was the same. The only reason I went back to this place was because I was invited by friends who did not believe my past experience. The food is nasty, there are rats and rodents running throughout the restaurant and the kitchen. The staff is nasty, with nasty attitudes and thinks you are there to server them, and act like they are the entitled in some godly way. The owner is a racist and only allows certain people into the restaurant. The kitchen staff was spotted in the bathroom peeing and playing with himself and did not wash his hands afterward. WARNING: You might catch something from your food and drinks here. I have reported this restaurant to DC's Department of Health because I got so sick immediately after eating this place.I have pictures and if I could post them, I would.
Pricey and the foods isn't good.

I really come here for their wines which are not only authentic but also affordable. The menu is quite spectacular. The black gnocchi excites me. It is a refreshing contrast to the usual thick and creamy texture. This one is light but rich in flavor. It is a good restaurant but the ambiance is noisy. A lot of people. The two orders take a couple of minutes, and staff needs to be reminded.

Floriana is a reliable choice for quality food and drinks. Housed in a converted townhouse, the restaurant exudes a rustic charm with its old-fashioned appeal. Despite some quirks like exposed A/C units and crooked paintings, the overall ambiance is welcoming.While the cocktail menu isn't particularly unique, it offers a good range of options. I tried a cucumber vodka drink, which was refreshingly sweet. We kicked off our meal with a surprisingly hearty octopus appetizer (highly recommended). For the main course, my date thoroughly enjoyed the lamb gnocchi, while I savored the eggplant tagliatelle, which, though not extraordinary, was delicious. I would definitely suggest Floriana as an intimate date spot, and I look forward to returning.

Visited Floriana with my boss and a few colleagues this past Monday when our res at another restaurant fell through. The hostess greeted us warmly and despite having no reservation the were able to accommodate us within 30 minutes. We were directed downstairs to the bar to have a drink while we waited. Cozy, warm, friendly and funny bartender. Two of us had the house Manhattan. Amazing. We went upstairs and had a truly satisfying dinner. I ordered the chicken and was happy to discover that it is plentiful and full of flavor. Chicken isn't necessarily a fall dish but the seasoning had the taste of the season. My boss asked our server for a recommendation and he got the lasagna. I've never seen him happier. We finished up and took pics in front of the tree. Found out later that every year they do a theme tree and this year they celebrated the new Disney movie Coco about the Catholic holiday of the Day of the dead. Two of our party are of Latin American decent and they explained that this tree was one of the most creative and beautiful trees they have seen

I love this place! The Lasagna is delicious and I always have enough to take home and heat up for lunch the following day. I definitely recommend this place if you are looking for authentic Italian cuisine.
Love this neighborhood gem! Great ambiance, good food, and very friendly wait staff. The lasagna is awesome and hard to beat, but everything we've tried here is pretty good. Reasonable prices.

Before I came her, I was told their past a was made in-house, fresh, After eating here, I can say that this is no lie! Their pasta tastes incredibly fresh and unlike any other. My partner had the salmon which he also said was fresh and tasty but I cant speak to other things on the menu.The setting is romantic and quaint and a great space to be outdoors in the nice weather. Service was attentive as well. No real complaints here.

My girl friend and I love coming here but never had the opportunity to write a review. Its a cozy atmosphere from eating in the dining room or the small bar on the bottom floor with Dido. Our favorite dishes are the torrtelloni mignon and ravioli zucca.Loved it a highly recommended!!!
We went for appetizers and wine and were very happy with both.
Excellent!

The food is actually quite good. Homemade gnocchi with wild boar and pea risotto were both well done. The servers were equally impressive. My first glass was a little dirty (not lipstick stained dirty, just water spot dirty) and our waiter comped my wine. Very classy, sir. The intimacy of the resto is also incredibly cute. It is in a house, so you definitely get that cozy feeling. But, it may not conducive to two gals trying to grab dinner/drinks post work. We weren't trying to get turned up or anything, but I laughed loudly once and felt far too rowdy for the crowd. No one judged me, though, so more points for this place. I think it's a cool spot generally but would particularly recommend it for a date or romantic outing, the couples seemed to be in their element.
Solid place nice space good food and service

Stopped by on a Wednesday night and it was quite busy. Great ambience (old 19th century 3 story house converted) with and excellent service. Decent wine list and a satisfying lasagna. Excellent bread and accompanying pesto sauce. The Nutella ravioli was tasty (came with vanilla ice cream and bananas) but the ravioli portion was nothing special. Will definitely come back next time and try the chicken. Maybe then it will earn that 5th star.

Had dinner the other night with friends @ Floriana. I had the Penne w/meatballs & I was not disappointed. The meatballs were great & the bartender is rumored to make the best martini's on 17th Street...well, it's no rumor! My friends enjoyed their meals as well. The only negative feedback I have is that the server wasn't very friendly, maybe she was having a bad night. I will recommend Floriana as a place to go on 17th Street!

i love floriana.if you're not feelig well- this restaurant, its food, their staff, and their bartenders will make you cry, laugh, smile and enjoy your night.start in the basement and move on up!the shabby sheek style reigns supreme in the converted town house turned italian workroom.yummy. i feel better already

Experience fine dining in the comfort of your own home with their exceptional carry-out or delivery service. Bat and Mike impressed us with their culinary skills, preparing over 20 dishes to perfection for my family. As we indulged in each dish, we found joy in sharing our thoughts on the flavors and ingredients, often brainstorming descriptive words to capture the essence of each bite. Bat, the owner, shared with us the secret behind their exquisite pasta dishes--freshly made pasta crafted daily by a seasoned artisan who has dedicated years to perfecting her craft.The gnocchi was sublime, and the ravioli was impeccable. Every dish was impeccably seasoned, allowing the natural flavors to shine through. One particular standout was the butternut squash, crowned with a velvety mozzarella lime cheese that resembled a delicate sphere of creamy goodness--a surprising yet delightful addition to our culinary adventure.

Although I haven't dined at Floriana before, I'm immensely grateful for their delivery service during these challenging times. My sister was in need of essential home items like toilet paper and paper towels, but we were unable to find any in stores or online. Thankfully, Floriana offered a variety of home and pantry items at reasonable prices with no-contact delivery. I was able to stock up for my sister, and the team promptly delivered everything within a day or two.Being away from family during this period is tough, but it's heartwarming to see local businesses like Floriana going the extra mile to help out. Supporting them in return feels like a small way to give back. I'll definitely make Floriana my first stop when I'm able to visit in person!

This place is incredible! I ordered the lamb gnocchi and Brussels sprouts, and both were absolutely delightful and delicious. The gnocchi was incredibly soft, reminiscent of mashed potatoes, and simply melted in your mouth. You could definitely taste that it was homemade. I will definitely be returning here when I visit DC again! Bravo!

I like Italian food Once I see Florina this in the city in past but I never experienced this, but I decided to give it a chance, then I decided to go in Florina . But their food was so good, I really never taste such an Italian food, I really like it very much. Their food is so good.I honestly say that their service was also so good, they behaves very friendly and their service was so good I like their service.I noticed their ambiance was so good.The interior was so good and furnished with high class furniture and also decorated with beautiful things.Their exterior was also so good because there is no any thing which disturbs and their exterior was also good.I honestly say that I like this very much.I Recommended it.Highly Recommended.

I had a great brunch at this restaurant. The menu had a great variety of options, and the drinks were delicious. The staff was attentive and friendly, making it a great spot for a lazy weekend brunch. I highly recommend this restaurant for its brunch experience.
For a healthy and refreshing option, try the juice bar. Their smoothies and fresh juices are made with high-quality ingredients and are the perfect pick-me-up.
One of my favorite places in DC they have the best dinner in city.

Floriana last food is absolutely delicious. The entire experience from top to bottom was delightful. Service was perfectly timed and our server was extremely professional and attentive. My recommendation for the menu items would be:Arancini- which had a really nice crispy crust, cheese center with a very nice tangy flavor from the green sauce.Black Gnocchi- this dish had really nice soft fluffy gnocchi in a rich lobster cream sauce.Duck Carbonara- again a nice rich creamy sauce with chunks of salty savory duck mixed throughout the past.This is by far one of the better Italian restaurants in DC!!!
Great food, and Sam is the cutest!

Had a wonderful meal with family. The waiters were excellent and the service was A1! We wanted to sit outside as the The restaurant as a whole was good, it was not too busy inside as we sat inside because the patio was full because it was a wonderful evening. Two people ordered Salmon and various other dishes. Chef Daniel came to the table personally to let us know that he only had one piece of salmon left, but would work with the guests to fix something just as good. Worked that out with the chef and hubby asked if he could the steak (he loves a good steak) but without the mushrooms? Chef Daniel was more than happy to accommodate. The bread was fresh and the pesto yummy. The food came and everything was delicious. Hubby's steak was superb and all the other dishes really good. One thing the lasagna could have been hotter not just warm. Overall a nice dining experience. Thanks!
Fantastic place with excellent dishes, service and wines.
The atmosphere was nice and intimate. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. And the food was delicious!  Will be back!

My wife went here for our first anniversary while visiting DC. The whole experience was fantastic. Our waiter was extremely friendly and the owner came out to talk to everyone as well. The decor inside was very quaint and made a great unique experience. The food was amazing as well. I had the lamb gnocchi and my wife had the seafood risotto. I would definitely recommend to anyone in the DC area and I would go back.

Absolutely amazing experience!! Great wine list! Great food! Great staff! The ambiance was very romantic. The restaurant is in a 100 year old building with lots of history. They make the pasta there and it is soooooooo good! Can't wait to go back!

This was my first time going to Floriana. I've walked past the restaurant many times and always wanted to try it out. Two nights ago, I finally decided to go. As soon as my friend and I walked in, we were greeted immediately and were sat at a lovely table in the window, overlooking the neighborhood. Our server was very helpful and extremely knowledgeable of the wines and food. We took all of his recommendations! His description of the wine was spot on. We loved it! The food..... mmm mmm good! Definitely the best Italian I've had in DC. We ended up making another reservation for brunch this weekend.Do yourself a favor and check this place out!
Great service, food, wine, and atmosphere. Surprisingly reasonable prices. Great for a date. Would definitely go back.

We went here for our Valentine's Day Dinner. The atmosphere was very romantic, classic Italian style. The service was also impeccable. We started off with a bottle of wine (don't forget about the half price deal on Wednesday and Sunday night!) and split the Lamb Gnocchi. The gnocchi is their specialty (we did not get the black gnocchi but have heard great things about it), and the fluffy yet crunchy nature of it perfectly complicated the excellent tasting lamb. We then finished with the Tiramisu and an espresso, a perfect end to a great experience.

The service is always perfect at Floriana each time I visit. The Orrichiette with lamb is better here than any other restaurant I've tried. Floriana always provides a great atmosphere whether I'm in for lunch or dinner and regardless of occasion i'm never disappointed!
The lasagna was amazing and the service was perfect. I am looking forward to my next visit!
I had such a great time eating here. The service was great and the food was even better! I will definitely be coming back here.
Outstanding!

Had an amazing time here with my girlfriend. She ordered the lasagna and I had the shrimp/scallop risotto. The waiter mentioned that all of the pastas were made there at the restaurant and it really showed. The wine list was extensive and we were able to choose a nice bottle that wasn't out of our price range. All in all, great food, great service, great place.

WOW, what a hidden gem! I had not idea it existed! We had 1/2 price bottle wine on Wednesday night and we were blown away by all aspects!! We had no reservations but the manager was well accommodating, even coming by to check on us as we ate! The service was smooth and not over bearing. The atmosphere was quaint and elegant, like eating in your mothers house for a dinner party. Our first and second courses came out perfectly, not too rushed and cooked perfectly. We had the Arugula Salad and soup and they started the meal off right. Our dinner was amazing and we both shared the cheesecake! Even with a full patio and dining room, the restaurant ran wonderful and everyone seemed to be working together nicely. I will recommend this to all my friends and take all my out of towners here! the price was spot on and we loved the bread and pesto to start the meal, Tasted fresh from a garden! Thanks Floriana team for making our night a special one! Can't wait to come for lunch and brunch!!

I attended the Sunday brunch service at Floriana with a band of co-workers and was treated to a truly top-rate experience. Their chef, who is apparently quite new there, put out a host of dishes that could only be described as perfect because of their absolute simplicity. We were able to tell him that as he took the time, though obviously busy, for an informative and entertaining visit to the table. Every item was perfectly seasoned and came out in a timely way. The omelettes had the consistency of luxurious pillows, the polenta was exquisitely prepared, and the lasagna, obviously handmade, has become our new all-time benchmark for the dish.   The service was 100% attentive, anticipating all of our needs without having to be prompted. Totally friendly, yet non-intrusive and professional. All in all, a slam dunk perfect way to enjoy a lazy weekend day. We're all excited for the weather to warm up as they have a large patio area outside their quaint, historical rowhouse.    Thinking that we've started a new tradition with these people.
This is a great little italian spot. Its like eating at somebodies home where their mother is cooking. Great food and wonderful service! I highly recommend for a date.
Love this Place!!!
great food. great service. suer cute spot. and our server (matt?) was super cute too!!

Our second visit to Floriana was equally as exquisite as our first visit. Both the food and service were impeccable. It was nice to not be rushed by the wait-staff, with the courses coming at appropriate times and not clearing the plates until all members in the dining party had finished their meals. The menu has something for everyone and it's almost hard to choose as all the selections are equally appealing. The bartender is also truly gifted, giving the classic cocktails a pleasing Italian twist. We will be back!
My husband & I dine here quite often. Although the wait can be a bit irritating it's well worth it. the atmosphere is quit cozy & the food is to die for! I highly recommend this place.

My cousin and I went to the Tico restaurant for dinner. The staff at this restaurant discriminated my cousin for his tattoos. The staff thought that he was a gang member. To anyone thinking about eating at this restaurant think about it twice before you do. Terrible customer service!

The manger David sucks do not visit when he is here. He insisted that me and my company of two were underage after we had already attempted to present IDs for proper identification. Great place but manger seems moody.

Sunday evening after work, I went to this establishment to have a couple drinks and a snack with a friend but unfortunately was audience to unabashed disgusting racist speak in a disturbingly nonchalant way. The bartender, Brandon, was telling a customer (who spoke English as a second language, thats the only reason I can come up with for him not catching this) what beers he had on tap. After naming a couple he got to Negro Modelo. Except he said n****r Modelo instead. TWICE. I definitely heard it and when I snapped my head toward my friend, she and I locked eyes because she heard it too. We had already paid and were about to leave. We were both shocked, I think thats why neither of us said anything in the moment. We stepped outside and talked about it for a couple minutes before I decided to go in and say something to the racist bartender Brandon. I pulled him aside and told him I heard what he said, both times and that it was disgusting and never ok. He denied it, with a smirk. Instead of punching him in the face like I wanted to, I told him he better watch his enunciation of his words because if someone else had heard his use such a foul hateful word, he'd get his ass beat. This is unacceptable. I will not be going back to Tico and I encourage them to fire this racist Brandon guy before he gets the whole place in trouble. He is tall, blondish beard and hair and his name is Brandon, and I saw him for what he is, an ignorant racist bigot.

I went to Tico for happy hour with a large group of people, all professionals in our mid to late 30's. I'd been to Tico multiple times before so I was the one who suggested the spot for happy hour. To start off, the service was terrible. The bartender gave us attitude the entire night, service was slow, and we had a difficult time getting her attention. Mind you, she gave other customers at the bar a much better customer service. At some point during the night, the bar area started smelling like marijuana. We starting looking at other customers trying to figure out who was ruining the night. Before we knew it, out of nowhere, the manager came up to us. I thought he was going to apologize for the smell and say something along the lines of "I'm sorry for the smell. We're trying to pinpoint where it's coming from and it'll be dealt with swiftly." Boy was I wrong! Instead, he came up to us to accuse us of smoking weed! We were all shocked. He hadn't approached other customers at the bar so I'm left with the only explanation that we were profiled, since we were the only black people at the bar. I've never "played the race card," I always try to rationalize situations to give people the benefit of the doubt. But there's no other explanation I can come up with to rationalize what happened at Tico. I've never written a Yelp review before. In fact, I actually created an account to write this one. I'm done recommending Tico's to my friends and family. They've lost my business forever.

Horrible Service, bitchy bartender, REALLY awful place!! If I could give negative stars and get my $ and time back - I would. Few friends (all grown up people) and I went there for a happy hour... what a terrible idea!! There is this female bartender who is mad at the world so we asked the other guy bartenders to take our orders because she acted like she doesn't see us like we are invisible objects. She had bad attitude just like the restaurant manager. The restaurant manager is dough bag. He didn't have any professionalism at all. He seemed to have some issue with non-white people. Disappointment doesn't begin to describe how we all felt about that place. This was one of the worst experiences I've ever had. They over charged my credit card by double.Don't waste your time or money!STAY AWAY. Your money is better spend elsewhere

I hosted a happy hour to gather around friends and everyone was exited to try this place as it was our first time for most of us. This will also be my last time as well as for most of my guests. We all had a bad experience, service was poor, managers were unprofessional and staff were absolutely rude. I wouldn't recommend this place at all, specially for big group.

I have never left a negative review in my life. I also think that you can expect some sort of standard when you go out to eat. Unfortunately, the standard at this Tico DC restaurant was very poor & horrible !!Where do I start? Having entered the restaurant, we had to wait for several minutes to be greeted. The lady bartender was very unprofessional & didn't want to take our orders at all. Horrible manager & the entire stuff. I would not recommend at all AND I AM NOT JOKING ! I will never go there again !!!

I never had this kind of disappointing night in my life. I wish there is a zero star to show how disappointed I am. My friends and I (around 20 people) went for a happy hour on Thursday for the first time. From the beginning, customer service was very unpleasant. We couldn't even be able to order a single drink and whenever we wave our hand they just pass us pretending they didn't see us. After we got a drink almost begging, we started our conversation with each other trying to have fun. Around 10PM the manager came to one of our friend and accused him smoking marijuana. He replied He didn't and asked him to check with the rest of the folks in the restaurant to see if they smoking weed then he said "I don't like the way you are looking at me I need you to leave". All we were doing was trying to have good decent time there but apparently they were looking for a reason to kick us out. I will say this again, very very bad customer service and poor managemen!!!!!

Big space. Mediocre food. Horrible service. About 20 of us met up there for food, drinks, and a bit of chatter. Started out ok, but minutes into the evening, everything went south. Servers showed zero respect and began to treat us with a poor, tasteless attitude. Hours into the night, a Marijuana scent broke out and spread fast at the bar, WHERE MANY OTHER PEOPLE WERE THERE, but for some unknown reason, they targeted our circle and accused us of smoking Marijuana inside the restaurant- without any evidence. The place had their lights on bright enough to see the smoke itself, so if it was us who smoked, it would've been very apparent, but they didn't care. They weren't even happy with us from the jump-start. Given that there were a lot of people there, it would've been kind gesture to have asked around first before accusing us of something we had nothing to do with. So it's safe to say that we will never go there again. Not worth spending our hard earned money there.

One star because i cant give them zero. They overcharged us, slow service, horrible management, crappy food and they make bad drinks. So how I really feel is dont go there, spend your money elsewhere.
Really Tico? 'Make tacos not war' sign outside is so insensitive and in very poor taste. Don't use very real issues overseas for advertising
Waiter was awesome but food not so much. This place will survive but that will be because of location alone.
Wow, the bartenders must hate people...which makes me think they should perhaps choose another profession.
Looks cute - that's about it. Typical overpriced tapas restaurant.
Ambiance is amazing. The food was amazing. However the service could've been better. It took me ~35 min to get served water and even longer for food.

During my lunch breaks is where I typically seek out new places. Looked up this spot and decided to go ahead. The food ended up being delicious. Got a few drinks to follow and then tried desert to top it off. Ended up making it back on time to work with time to spare.

I've been to Tico four times now. The first two were wonderful - the food was excellent, the margaritas were delicious, they modified dishes for me to make them vegetarian without any problem, and the service was friendly and attentive. The last two times have been a different story. The servers are still friendly, but they disappear after taking your order because food is brought out by food runners, and there seems to be no communication between wait staff and the people bringing out food. When I went in for brunch a few months ago, the open-faced omelet I got was so dry that it was inedible. I ordered a breakfast burrito instead, without chorizo, and the one that came out had chorizo in it. My friend's food got cold while he was waiting for mine to come out. The last time I went in for dinner, I ate half of a dish that I had specifically ordered without bacon before I realized it had bacon in it. When I was able to get the attention of the server and tell him, he took the dish away without asking if I wanted to order anything else. Several minutes later, a food runner brought a version of the dish without bacon to the very confused women at the table next to mine. Our server eventually realized the mistake and brought another bacon-free dish out to me, but at that point I didn't want anything and just wanted to leave. I asked for more water, after having finished both my water and my friend's water, but I never got any. The drinks and food (when prepared as ordered) are usually really delicious, but if you have serious dietary restrictions, I wouldn't rely on Tico to modify dishes for you. I might end up back there if I'm in the neighborhood, but I would only order dishes exactly as they are on the menu from now on.
We came on a busy happy hour night but couldn't get a drink...Not enough staff behind the bar to handle it...so we left...
The food is good, and the atmosphere is fun.
Beautiful -- just wish I'd made a reservation for us so we didn't have to sit at the bar.

Myself and 3 friends went here for dinner. We decided to each order 4 dif. items from the menu and share around the table. There was not one single item from which we ordered that was not outstanding. It was delicious. We even tried the desserts and they too were delicious!I would highly recommend this place.

There's a serious lack of Mexican cuisine in this part of DC, and I was really happy when these guys opened up. They're not perfect, but their food is more than enough to satisfy you no matter how hungry you are. Last night I had the chorizo risotto here and I was amazed at how they can combine both dishes into one amazing meal. You won't be disappointed if you decide to eat here, that's for sure.

There's a serious lack of Mexican cuisine in this part of DC, and I was really happy when these guys opened up. They're not perfect, but their food is more than enough to satisfy you no matter how hungry you are. Last night I had the chorizo risotto here and I was amazed at how they can combine both dishes into one amazing meal. You won't be disappointed if you decide to eat here, that's for sure.
Fun place, great vibe and cool decor. Service was close to perfect and food was solid. Got a bottle of wine and a pitcher of their margarita. Will be back at some point and recommend.

First time here. Amazeballs! We got the $35 tasting menu and everything was so great. The cauliflower and the salad were actually my favorite. Chorizo coming in 3rd. Bacon Mac and Cheese... Sooo great! The desserts are on point also! $40 pitchers of exceptional Margaritas... Boozy and delicious! Actually I can not whine about anything. Service was outstanding! So friendly!
Service was excellent

Came in yesterday to try out their octopus. I heard great things andI love seafood. Boy were they right, so perfect. The cocktails are the only reason I am giving them one star of. They are week and overpriced. The server was delightful and had plenty of recommendations. The ambiance was fine, bit loud, but overall very nice dining.
Very fun place. Bartenders were personable and the atmosphere was nice. Happy hour specials were good and I liked the cocktails on tap.

Great Experience! Definitely recommend the Scallop Ceviche to start - but everything we had was worth having again.. pleasant surprise. The atmosphere was hip, with a great vibe - music paired with the energy of a crowded room well. It was clear that the management pays attention to detail, and the staff was well trained -- Good job! I'll be back for sure -

been to TIco a few times and had great experiences at the bar. the hostility as always been great and the drink are equally matched. about the food nothing particularly stood out. big menu and some pretty approachable fare. fried chicken special on sunday was not bad. I will continue to eat here but not as a prime dinning destination. will never take away from what the people of rico are doing. great layout and feel. will remain a regular spot for me. plus you can charge your phone underneath the bar.....genius!

Slightly annoying waiter, but great food! I'm not a big fan of tapas style dishes but the portions sizes were pretty good. We only had to order about 4 between two people and were totally satisfied. Location is awesome and convenient and the decor inside is super nice. Check it out!
Mac&Cheese

Came in here with a date and really enjoyed ourselves. The server was great and steered us to some good food, especially when we asked for help with the tacos. I liked the cocktails. My date had a good malbec. It was definitely a vibrant scene. The bar was full. I decided to be daring and had the tongue and really enjoyed it. I'd come back.

Came here with friends who raved about the food and experience. It met all expectations. Great service, atmosphere, and most important, amazing tapas! A little on the pricier side, but it is 14th Street. Will definitely come back again.

I've been here quite a few times now and have to say this place actually gets it right. The guacamole is what I've had each time, and they sort you out big style, but there are plenty of other options for any time of the day. The staff here are super friendly too, but great music and passion for authentic cooking make it a winner in my book!

We had a wonderful night here. The food was great, the beer and the drinks we're excellent too. But the main thing for our experience was the great attention from everyone in here, specially for Ricky. If you are in DC Tico is a must go!!
Great brunch spot. Our server Ricky was phenomenal, as were the food and drink!
Amazing food! Amazing drinks! Amazing service! The bartender was so sweet and attentive.

Excellent place to go if you want to eat amazing Mexicanâ€‹ food and incredibly margaritas. The mac and cheese and risotto were to die for! can't wait to go back and eat those again, and that doesn'tâ€‹ happen that often. My favorite margaritas and sangria are also pretty good. The ambiance was quite, music good, the service was quick and on point and at the end Iâ€‹ order the ice cream. Il definitelyâ€‹ come back!

Recommended by someone in a Bar and as a food consultant I must confess the very best shrimp taco ever, sensational flavours as was my partners chicken tacos. Mexican food can be sensational (cookedWell, cooked with love and creativity) so when in DC a massive tick for Ticos.Service excellent
Awesome food and service. All the small plates we ordered were delicious. The service staff were really nice and answered all the questions we had about the dishes.

Ticos has never once failed me, every single time I come in I always enjoy my time here...great drinks wonderful and friendly staff!! A few of my favorites are the fried oysters and the tico burger as well as the oh so famous habiscus margarita!!!! Cheers to nice bartenders and a good menu
Great food & amazing environment! Would recommend for brunch

My boyfriend and I went to Tico, one of our favorite neighborhood spots last night and tried the "Full on Tico Experience" for a treat. The Full on Tico Experience is their full chef's tasting menu and while pricy at $75 a person, it was definitely worth the money and a great value for the amount of food we got. Everything was fantastic. The service was very attentive and the management went out of their way to make sure we were taken care. Our meal consisted of: bass ceviche- one of the best ceviche's I have hadshredded cabbbage salad- the salsa verde was nicely balancedarugula salad with toasted hazelnuts and pomegranate- really greatshisitso peppers- so yummy. my favorite type of pepper and they grilled them beautifully roasted Brussels sprouts- good, had a nice citrus touchmac n cheese- with manchego and serrano ham, one of my favorites corn-my other favorite tico sidedish. cheesey sweet corn flavored with serrano ham and peppers. can't beat itroasted carrots- colorful carrots with a nice mix of textures to the dish shrimp tacos- I liked the chipotle saucesteak and peppers taco- with manchego. good.chorizo pops- these were homemade and had a good sweet sauce with themcrawfish sliders- a special of the day. tasted similar to a crabcake slider. B- for megrilled lamb- perfectly cooked lollipop lamb chops with some more well done and seasoned lamb shoulder tips. The tips were not my favorite but the chop, kale and butternut it came with were delicious tres leeches cake- creamy and great! we took it to go since we were literally stuffed to the brim. Thank you Tico for a great experience. We will be back!
Could not recommend this place highly enough. Awesome food, incredible staff, my only wish is to be lived in town and can be here more often
I've been here twice now and the tapas have always been good. Fast service.
Rico the bartender is AMAZING. I go back just for him sometimes. The good food doesn't hurt, either. The happy hour is very reasonable and YUMMY! Would definitely recommend.
Awesome!!!! Defiantly coming back!!!

Excellent! My parents live right down the street from the Tico, and we stopped here for breakfast early one morning en route to a wedding in New York. This place is great. It's clean, the prices are good, the quantity is good, the staff are friendly and the food is incredibly tasty.

I'm torn between giving Tico 4 and 5 stars. Since some of its food is 5 stars worthy, and we had great service, I'll round up to 5. I try to avoid small plate restaurants, but every time I walk by this place, it's packed, so I decided to see if its popularity was due to its food. That seems to be the case, at least based on my 1 experience. 5 stars worthy:1. The mac and cheese. Not too heavy, and a nice twist on a common American dish. 2. The bittersweet chocolate tart with vanilla ice cream. It was just the right balance of sweetness and biterness. And the serving size was just right too. 3. The service. Very efficient and friendly. And while my mom and I did not ask the waitress for her advice on the menu, the advice she and another waiter gave a couple other tables seemed legit (they both hyped the mac and cheese plus a couple other dishes I see yelpers have realy liked). 4 stars worthy:1. The lamb meatballs. A bit bland, but the tomato sauce was pretty good. If the meatballs had a little more seasoning, this could be 5 stars.2. The roasted pork tacos. The pork itself was pretty good. I think there might have been too much stuff in the tacos though. 3. The drink list. Wide variety of options. My cocktail (the ponyboy? something with bourbon in it) wasn't bad. My mom was content with her glass of pinot grigio. 3 stars worthy:The fried calamari. Its sauce was very ordinary. We regretted ordering this, especially when all the other food was much, much better. Overall, a really good place. I would advise reading through the reviews on yelp to get an idea of what Tico's best dishes are since it seems at least a few are pretty ordinary and not worth the cost (such as the aforementioned calamari).

I went to Tico last night for the first time after hearing good things. We had Nena as our server and she was AMAZING!!!!!!! We decided to the "Let us decide" and the "Kind of Hungry" portions. It was such an amazing deal, so much food and everything was so delicious!! I would definitely recommend this place. I will be going back and asking for her as my server every time.The Mac n Cheese is AMAZING
Awesome selection of small plates, try the tuna ceviche!

Great space. Love the art. The crunchy fried chicken tacos were disappointing. The coating was soggy not crunchy, and it was a little under cooked.Everything else (lamb meatballs, beef tacos, serrano ham) was delicious. The cabbage slaw alone is worth 6 stars.

Is open, and we were ready to eat. Me and four girlfriends got a great seat at a very cool high top communal table by the bar. It turned out to be a perfect spot to spy the goings on in the gorgeous open kitchen where our edamame tacos, shishito peppers, lamb meatballs, and ten other things came from. My favorite bite may have been the tico Mac and cheese, with Serrano ham and manchego. Uhhm its to die for... Seriously. The staff may be still learning but they clearly love the place and why not as its modern and gorgeous. We spied the chef owner enjoying the music as he bounced around the kitchen checking on dishes and cooks, and we even spied @spirocks whose tweets brought us there in the first place. DC just got more delicious.
The best food!! Everything was super delicious. Highly recommend this place! Excellent service!!

Second trip to All-Purpose left a very unpleasant taste in my mouth. The pizza is just not the type of pizza I want to eat...ever. The dough is heavy, dry and not very flavorful. The texture is not pleasantly chewy and it's far too thick and too blonde. The quality of toppings is fine, but the combinations are rather odd. Such as large chunks of pickled cauliflower on top of a small slice of pizza
Great atmosphere, great service, great decor. Unfortunately the food was just ok. Lacked flavor.
Good pizza that is a go to, but nothing that exceptional. We get take out often because we live nearby. Not bad food but not the best I've ever had. Good but not great.
Great happy hour! Very cute vibe and the happy hour pizza was really tasty. Would go back!
The food was great and so was the service. However, it's very loud, so you can't hear your conversation with your friends.
Pizza and drinks well done. Good variety of pizza and drinks. Polite service, service time as expected during a busy day. Lively group of customers. Very good.
We loved it and we didn't even try the pizzas. If you like cheese you could go for that reason alone
"I love that restaurant! The food is amazing, and I love Italian food. I enjoy restaurant hopping, and I highly recommend giving this place a try!
I ordered a pizza to-go on a Saturday and I can't wait to go back. I have been searching for good pizza in the DMV and I've found 1.
Fantastic pizza and fun atmosphere.

This cozy restaurant has left the best impressions! Hospitable hosts, delicious dishes, beautiful presentation, wide wine list, and wonderful dessert. I recommend it to everyone! I would like to come back here again and again.
Take out food and cocktails still great! Order was ready right away and easy to pull up right outside the restaurant.

I had the chance to visit all purpose and in one word AMAZING!! We arrived 30 minutes before our reservation but the seat us at the bar and we had few drinks before our table was ready. They called us before our time which was great, our waiter was very helpful with the order giving us advise in what to order. All purpose have a great staff very helpful and respectful.Make sure to do a reservation the place gets overcrowded.
Came for the pizza, but tried the egg parm, and salad. Everything was amazing.

I love this AP location! Beautiful views of the water and steps away from the first base entrance of Nats Park. Staff is always friendly, drinks are great (frozen drinks highly recommended!) and the food/pizza is ALWAYS incredible. If you haven't visited the rooftop bar, then it is a must! Perfect place to take friends or relatives who are visiting DC or to celebrate a birthday, anniversary, special occasion, etc.

Came to AP after hearing it was one of Tom Sietsema's favorite pizza places. Was NOT disappointed! While the place was crowded, we were seated immediately (it was early evening on a Tuesday). Our waiter was knowledgeable and attentive, complimenting our decision to go with the "Buona".First off, the crust is amazing. Crispy, but chewy and the perfect vessel for generous portions of real pepperoni. This was also the first time I had ever had honey on a pizza... but it somehow works to compliment the spicy meat. For dessert, we took our waiter up on trying the cheesecake. While it didn't have the sweetness and density of a New York style, I actually preferred the lighter texture, cheesy taste and sweet/tart berries on top.Only regret - not experimenting with the wine menu, which I hear is great. Next time!
Great service. Great food. Great atmosphere. Thanks you for being in the neighborhood.
Went here a few months ago when it first opened. Great food, great service, great beer selection and fun atmosphere- go here!!!
Best gluten free pizza crust I have ever had. Drinks are pretty great as well.
Horrible customer service. Do not go here if you have food allergies!!! They do not accommodate if you choose to leave because of food allergies, then charge you $170'!

This place looks really amazing! But unfortunately the people who work here are completely unaware of anything that is going on. Ask the woman at the front door how long the wait is and its 10 min. Ask someone else and your wait is 2 hours. No cohesiveness throughout. Not really sure what is going on but hopefully with time management will improve!

Topline: great, creative meal, the staff was great. However, feels like it should be just a LITTLE less expensive, and a little less hyped, and it would be such a staple. As-is, I think it's punching just a little bit above it's weight, and as such we feel we're glad we went, but wouldn't necessarily come back. A Delicious meal, but not quite worth the money we paid.The vibe of the restaurant is great - open kitchen with a huge hearth fire. I wish we were sat closer to it! Casual dress, anything from a suit w/o tie to nice shorts would be fine to wear. We walked in at 8pm on a Tuesday and were sat in about 40 minutes.The hearth-roasted vegetables were the only super large standout. They were like no vegetables we've ever eaten. Fresh, flavorful, roasted perfectly by the file - delicious! Other highlights were the kohlrabi salad (great flavors together) the hush puppies (another favorite - but how can you go wrong!) the sweet potato fried catfish roll (again - how could you go wrong with fried fish on a sweet roll).The menu is known to change daily with what's fresh.We also got the fried sugar toads (sweet fried fish) and fried softshell crab. Our fault that we ordered too much fried seafood - should have done that better. Those two dishes were fine... but in the end tasted like fried fish! There's only so much you can do with those.I think because of the fried food we filled up too early and didn't grab desert - which looked amazing, but we simply didn't have room. The server suggested "2-3 small plates" per person, but we got 2 snacks and 4 small plates for two, and were STUFFED. So, take that for what you will.
Very nice for early evening cocktails in summer, and also nice if you decide to stay for dinner. They are still getting their sea-legs but I would suggest giving them a try.
Interesting dishes. Really liked the ambiance - open kitchen is really nice. Service was excellent. Would definitely go back again. Everything we had was delicious.

You might need a shoehorn to fit in the place and a compass to find it, but it's worth the effort. A fun place tucked away that you'll feel like it's a clubhouse. Great small plates. The quail was delicious. Cool cocktails too!
Good food excellent service and nice ambiance. Recommend making reservations as it's a happening spot. The pasta was amazing.

This is the second time we go to this place. The menu has changed since last time, but the food is still as good. It is a small plate type of place so we tried many of the options and they were all absolutely great.Definitely recommend as a place for special events.
Food was good, cocktails very good. Small plates actually are small so keep that in mind.Excellent service and decor.

I was here for a quick brunch yesterday, I loved the energy in here - as soon as I walked in I felt a positive vibe hit me, but I was looking toward eating some good food. My favorite dish was the sweet potato rolls, they were perfectly sized and the flavor was on point, a perfect balance between sweet and salty. I was really digging the vibe here and I'm sure I'll be back sometime soon.
This place has amazing food. But its better if we make a reservation before coming as its always crowded
Beautiful restaurant, great food!

The Dabney is a gem! The food is fresh, flavorful, and beautifully prepared, with a cozy vibe that feels like home. I especially loved the wood-fired dishes--each bite was unforgettable!Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

I am truly amazed by the exceptional dining experience at The Dabney. In my opinion, it deserves nothing less than a 5-star rating. Having visited many restaurants across the United States, I can confidently say that this restaurant ranks among the top three. From the moment we stepped in, we were greeted with warmth and hospitality. Every aspect, from the food to the service, was absolutely perfect. The fact that The Dabney holds a Michelin star is well-deserved.I'd like to give a special shout-out to Daniel Todd for his kind and engaging conversation with my wife and I. It truly enhanced our overall experience. The attention to detail inside the restaurant is remarkable and deserves recognition. All in all, The Dabney is a superb establishment that excels in every aspect.

Yes the food was delicious. Yes the wine was delicious. Yes it's a lovely venue. But the reason I'll be back is the staff: fun and friendly without exception.Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 5/5
This is a great place to eat and enjoy your food. The service was great and we had a great experience.
Outstanding restaurant. Definitely pick the tables not the high top. The high tops are further from the kitchen.

Smoked Catfish to go?? I took a risk and decided to try the Smoked Catfish to go - it's always been one of my favorite entries for eating inside of Dabney. However, since COVID, I've been doing a lot of to-go from many of my favorite restaurants. I've been completely disappoint. So I was a little hesitant when ordering my favorite dish from Dadney. But I was craving it, so I took my chances and ordered it anyway. I'm glad I took the risk, well worth the reward. The same in-restaurant smoked catfish. The only difference I was eating it from my couch. Love you guys!!
My husband and I love this place. The food is always delicious. We've been take out every since COVID and food is still amazing.
Great
Great place. I have been going here many times and every single time the food was delicious. Service was great too.

The ambiance. The smells. The service. But most importantly, the food and beverages -- all delightful.The rundown of what we ordered:- Winter Squash Cooked In The Fire: best dish of the night. So many flavors, yet they all complemented each other. Teach me your ways!!!- Maryland Blue Crab: interesting -- but given how sweet MD crab meat is, I was surprised Chef used such sweet apples.- Milk Poached Farm Egg: whipped and layered to perfection.- Chesapeake Rockfish: delicious, but could have been better if they used something other than balsamic. Balsamic is often hit or miss. I like that they've switched to "winter spices" now.The little things were impressive too -- the bread and butter was MONEY. Bourbon Brown Sugar Sundae for dessert was perfect. If only we could have ordered our favorite local kombucha, Blue Ridge Bucha, as a digestif --- THAT would have been the ultimate final touch to a wonderful evening.Best of all, the costs weren't unreasonably high and they didn't require you to pay a flat rate as some other fine dining restaurants ask (see: Pineapple & Pearls). Make a reservation. Now.
This is a very late review but everything we had here was amazing...maybe a year ago.
Awesome food and service. What can you ask for more?

Amazing atmosphere, the fire place in the open kitchen give a great warm feeling, like a gastropub.The food was good, the sommelier picked us some good wine.We had many food selections and ended up with the Tbone and corn bread cooked with blood
holy $#!+ that was good.yelp is making me write more but i don't have to because holy shit it was good.

Came here for our anniversary back in February. Food was amazing, and so was the service.
From the setting to the service to the food this is one of my favorite dining experiences in DC.

This place is incredible. It may have been the nicest dinner I've had. Although upscale, the servers weren't at all pretentious when I asked about items on the wine list. Very informative without the 'mansplaining' vibe fancy places can come with. Very considerate about any food allergies. I told them I had a gluten allergy in the beginning and everything they brought out they confirmed was revised so I could enjoy it. They brought out these amazing GF tiny cakes in the beginning and wish I ate them for breakfast every day. Definitely worth ordering some of the more adventurous things on the menu because these guys won't disappoint. Atmosphere was dimly lit, great playlist background music, and the bathrooms made you feel like you were in a fancy hotel. Every detail in this place has been thought out. It will be on my list of top recommendations and I'll be back. Thank you!
Our dinner was absolutely delicious and the staff was attentive, without being intrusive.
Try the bar if you can't get a reservation!

I had an extremely disappointing experience at Milk and Honey in DC and would never recommend this place to anyone. After placing my order, I waited for an hour and a half with no updates or explanation about the delay. When I finally decided to request a refund, the cashier was shockingly rude and dismissive. She didn't offer any apology or attempt to address the situation, nor did a manager step in to acknowledge or resolve the poor service. It was clear that customer satisfaction wasn't a priority. What made the experience even worse was watching at least 20 DoorDash drivers come and go, picking up orders without any issues. Meanwhile, my order--and that of others who were dining in--was completely ignored. It's frustrating to sit at a table in the restaurant, only to see that delivery orders are given priority over the customers who actually took the time to visit the establishment. I understand that there's no table service here, but that's no excuse for neglecting in-store customers while catering almost exclusively to delivery services. It felt like they didn't value our business at all. The lack of professionalism, poor customer service, and blatant prioritization of delivery orders over dine-in customers made this experience a complete waste of time and money. I will never go back, and I would strongly advise others to think twice before visiting. Good luck if you decide to give this place a try--you'll need it.
I waited 2 hours to eat my food and they were doing more doordash orders than in store orders.

Thanks for your nonsensical reply, Monique! I expected as much from someone so pretentious that she uses a Porsche as a catering vehicle. For seemingly no other reason than to be gross in a different building, Milk and Honey decided to move down the street. I needed something quick to-go. If you can imagine pouring salt on a war crime you can vaguely imagine what the food here is like. There's better options on H Street. The laundromat at 13th and H had better food.

You'd think when you go to a restaurant, you'd be served food. What I received was not food at all. Some sort of strange matter advertised as shrimp and grits. A better description would be space slop with critters dipped in a clear slime. Unless you want to die from complications of a disease humanity has not yet encountered, I'd skip it. Also rude staff.

I called on a Monday to make a reservation for an upcoming Saturday brunch. When I asked for the availability I was told anything after 2pm. I said ok 2 it is, I was then told that was not an option. I asked about a 2:30 timeslot, was told no and then a 3pm time slot and still told no. At that point, I asked the person on the phone why did you say anything after 2pm if there isn't any slot available? What is the earliest that I can come in for brunch and got the reply of 4. IF they were booked until 4 why not lead with that instead of making a potential customer jump through hoops? I love the Georgia Ave location. I was excited to try the H street spot out but nevermind now.

The food is ok!The kitchen has a good battle rhythm whereas the food comes out fast. The menu-food is pretty consistent from the three times I went there. The service needs work, I had a bad encounter with a hostest and slow bar staff downstairs. The hosted patronized me when all I wanted was help with a carry-out order. The old management, Smith Commons were also really welcoming to its nieghbors aka locals. The address has lost its local vibe and has turned to the tourist. The hiring appears to be the same as well.
The shrimp and grits were fire! We ordered one each but honestly 2 people can share one. We will be back.
location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

text: Food was very good and authentic. Staff was very friendly as well I will be returning. A little pricey though

After having a not so good experience at another location, my heart told me to give them another chance...I was greeted by one of two welcoming host. I welcomed sitting at the bar. Ebony! Is it the name or just happenstance that every Ebony/Eboni I know is amazingly hospitable!?! She warmly welcomed me, attended to my every need, answered all my questions and shared in laughter with me. She made me feel right at home!The Shrimp & Grits were AMAZING! I was always seated between two kind men. When one would leave another would come along. I think that was all me! Lol. But seriously, this venue is HOT! It has earned a place in my heart

Had an amazing time at Milk & Honey. The wait was long, but u can see why! The food came out fresh & HOT, and delicious. The drinks were also amazing. If you stop by get the Pineapple Margarita or the Mimosa Margarita

My friends and family held a celebration of my 70th Birthday in the Honey & Milk bar area at the front of the restaurant. I worried that there wouldn't be enough space for the 25-30 people we were expecting. I expressed my concerns to the manager and he was very helpful and respectful. Everything worked out perfectly! There is metered parking along the street, but Uber and taxi are recommended. But, if you live in the area, as I do, it's a nice walk. #Milk&HoneyHStreet #buzzybooth

A friend recommended we go to Milk & Honey for brunch. I wasn't sure what to expect, besides the great biscuits she described. We were more than pleased with the selection of menu items. After some deep thought, we chose a variety of items all over the menu! Including the dangerous punch, tasty and oh so refreshing! I am a Southern-born chef who grew up in the business and when you have grits on the menu, you really need to show out to hold my attention. I ordered oxtails with grits. Well, show offs, I was impressed! It was like someone from New Orleans went to Italy and spied on a group of Nanas' making Osso buco! Those.creamy grits with slow cooked super flavorful oxtails! Biscuits are heaven. Chicken and crispy garlicky potato's too!I'm in love with what you guys are doing! We had Brix as our waiter, great personality and knowledgeable! One of our entrees was dropped and the speed with which it was replaced was seamless and speedy We also had a real sweet gentleman check to make sure we were happy. I know brunch can be hectic and you made it look smooth and effortless. No easy task! Your effort shows. Everything was wonderful! Had to really dig deep in my memory of Emily Post to not pick up and naw the bones clean. You certainly have not seen the last of us! We will return and I hope to hug you in gratitude again for making real soul just a few blocks away!
Food was delicious & server was awesome....My friends & I enjoyed ourselves.... Will definitely go back

My husband and I make it a point to visit every location (Maryland, Atlanta, & DC) and we're always pleased. Our waitress today Janice was absolutely amazing. We loved her suggestions. Can't wait to return to Milk & Honey!

The best in n.e friendly nice food is great people must try better then up town hands down ....

The desserts are an embarrassing disaster: just don't bother. So I waited 1-and-a-half hours this evening to speak to the pastry chef - but he couldn't be bothered to come talk to me. So instead, here are my thoughts (and the un-diplomatic version):I had the parmesan cake and balsamic ice-cream. Why bother? What's the point? It had zero taste. The cake didn't taste of parmesan, and the gelato didn't taste of balsamic. If you are going to do something innovative like this (which you should), then have the 'cojones' to go for it properly. Don't do it half-arsed. But it's not just this dessert: all of the desserts that I have tried have been a confused, half-hearted miss. The tiramisu isn't tiramisu - it's cheesecake. So call it cheesecake, because otherwise you're treating people like dummies (i.e. you think they're too parochial to know what tiramisu actually is, and the difference between cheesecake and tiramisu !**?!!?!). I'm all for innovating the classics, but turning a tiramisu into a totally different (bog standard) dessert, shows that you (i.e. the pastry chef) are really confused and have nothing original to say. Etc, etc, re the other desserts. Either give the diner's palate something to think about (a clearly-articulated, well-executed concept), or just quit pretending that you know what you're doing.So, I don't know if there is a pastry chef as such, or whether the chef is responsible for this car-crash of a dessert offering, but either stop it, or do it properly. You can always measure the worth of a restaurant by its dessert list, and this dessert offering is simply embarrassing.

We visited Modena last Friday for Restaurant Week, and it was absolutely fantastic! The food was a delightful showcase of modern Italian cuisine--each course beautifully presented and bursting with flavor.What truly set the experience apart, though, was the impeccable service. The staff went above and beyond to make our evening special, and the manager's thoughtful attention to detail made all the difference. They went the extra mile to celebrate my girlfriend's recent engagement, adding such a personal and memorable touch to our meal.Everything was fabulous--from the warm ambiance to the perfectly crafted dishes. Modena left a lasting impression, and we can't wait to come back. Highly recommend for a special occasion or just a wonderful night out!
Delicious! With a million restaurants in town, this is the only one I went back to twice!

If you're searching for an authentic Italian dining experience, look no further. From the moment you step inside, you're transported to the heart of Italy. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, with rustic dÃ©cor that sets the mood perfectly.The menu is a culinary journey through Italy, with a wide range of classic dishes that cater to all tastes. The pasta is cooked to perfection, and the sauces are bursting with flavor.The staff is friendly and attentive, adding to the overall warmth of the place. Whether you're on a romantic date or enjoying a family dinner, Modena offers a genuine taste of Italy in every bite. Buon appetito!

Love love love Modena! I get the salmon raviolo every time I go, which is often. The entire staff is amazing -- I became a regular during Covid and know them all by name. Chef John Melfi is cooking up wonders in the kitchen. Can't recommend Modena enough.

First things first...Im not sure there isn't a mistake in the Yelp listing...this place does not serve pizza. If they do its rare. Most importantly I'm not sure I've ever had a better meal in DC. The places we OFTEN go are Tosca, Cafe Milano, Marcel's. We definitely won't be going back to Tosca after finding this place just around the corner. We did the four courses and I have no complaints. Service was great, and no room for improvement whatsoever.

I came for a job interview and stayed for lunch. Then I brought my friends in for dinner. The food coming out of the kitchen is unreal, and after so many months of home "cooked" dinners, It's really very nice to enjoy fresh handmade pasta built into uber tasteful dishes with sea urchin, pork cheek and other succulent treats not so easily duplicated in the home. The wine menu was overwhelming in a good way!

We had a wonderful night at The Duck & the Peach. The atmosphere was warm and cozy, with a pleasant noise level. The tables were nicely spaced so you didn't feel like you were right on top of the party next to you. The cocktails were tasty and unique, and there was a nice wine selection. Every single dish we had was excellent, and we had many. The dessert (chocolate & hazelnut) may have been the best dessert I've ever had.
