I would highly recommend this spot for a perfect date night or dinner with friends!

This was my second time here for brunch and once again I loved it. The decor is lovely, the staff work as a team and the food is amazing. When I went in today the place was packed. You could tell the staff were working hard and they deserve every bit of that 22% service charge. My server popped by to let me know she'd be with me shortly as it was very busy. That gave us some time to look over the menu. I had the shrubmosa and a golden milk latte. They both were packed with flavor. It was so busy I watched the barista herself bring me my coffee drink to ensure it got to me while it was hot. The hostesses would walk around to help refill drinks, clean and set up tables. Again, the team work deserves an A+ rating. My server made my health her top priority by making sure my allergies were addressed and I loved that. She made some great recommendations and I ended up getting the bakers basket to start then the sausage Benedict as my entree. They were delicious! Overall, my experience at the Duck and the Peach was phenomenal. I cannot remember my servers name at this time but she was tall light skin with black braids in a bun and glasses. She and all of the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. This is what the perfect dining experience should look like.

Women owned restaurant with delicious food and calm, open and swanky ambiance. Went for late brunch on a Saturday, reservations recommended. Try the golden milk latte and the jamon potatoes benedict and apple pancakes! Plus the seasonal mimosa was divine! One of the most inclusive and accessible bathrooms I've seen! And felt exclusive.
A must. Everything tasted so great. We got the watermelon salad with spicy almond granola, the grilled prawns with couscous, and the s'mores bar for dessert.

I came here to visit my friend Philip, who works there (plus I'd seen some delicious looking pictures on Instagram). Omg the food is everything-- I don't know what took me so long to visit this place.I'm addicted to shishito peppers but haven't even gotten them here yet because I keep ordering other things. The restaurant has a ton of vegetarian dishes, like the "not your mom's green bean casserole" (green beans, mushroom, sous vide egg) and goat & butter veg (whipped salted goat butter, basil blossoms, micro mint, peppercorn medley, asparagus, snap peas). The second time I went i ordered the seared tilefish (tilefish, spring onion pistou, asparagus, fingerling potatoes).Beautiful patio. Amazing addition to the eastern market neighborhood!
Terrible service and food was even worst sorry I wasted my hard earned money on this place I told the waiter that I was in happy with my order he said that's not his problem
Food average, very loud. A lot of pretense for a very disappointing result.
Waited for 15 minutes & no waiter & people seated after us were waited on. Very poor service!
Terrible -- might as well eat at a college cafeteria!
Poor food and service. Expensive and over rated.
Wasn't my favorite place, it was expensive for what it was and the food wasn't that tasty.
The food is ok but not worth putting up with the uneven service!
Good food But any place that charges for every coke you drink IS A RIP OFF
Long wait, food too salty.

Bistrot Du Coin once held a special place in my heart, my go-to spot for authentic, comforting French cuisine since moving to the area in 1998. From leisurely lunches to indulgent dinners, I savored their French Onion Soup, which I considered among the finest in the DMV. Their escargot, foie gras, duck confit, beef bourguignon, seafood ravioli, and Mont Blanc--all were staples of my dining repertoire. Sadly, those cherished memories now feel like distant echoes. Returning for the first time since pre-COVID, I had high hopes. Yet, this weekend lunch visit left me deeply disappointed. The hallmark flavors that once defined Bistrot Du Coin seem to have vanished entirely. Whether it's a change in ownership or a shift in the kitchen team, the magic is undeniably gone. The French Onion Soup, once a shining example of its kind, now tastes flat and unremarkable. The Complete Omelette, equally disheartening, was bland and utterly forgettable. The one saving grace of the meal was the Au Pistou Mussel Pot--mussels in a fragrant basil and garlic sauce with prosciutto and French ham--that managed to retain the standard I once adored. Even so, it wasn't enough to salvage the experience. As I reflect on this visit, I can't help but debate: should I give their full dinner menu one last chance to rekindle the magic, or is it time to bid farewell to a once-beloved institution? For now, my disappointment weighs heavy, and my return feels uncertain.

Just after finding this spot online I thought 'well this place looks promising', so I called and made reservations without hesitating. I've never exactly been to a strictly 'French' restaurant before, and that just screamed fancy and pricey to me. Me and my wife came in a few nights ago, our reservation was for two at 8:45 pm. I walked in and the ambiance hit me with all kinds of pleasant smells and a general sense of easy goingness. I was looking forward to dining some immaculate food, but in all honesty the quality just wasn't there. The food here was incredible by all means, but I thought that it should've been more extraordinary, especially for those prices. If you do plan on coming here and aren't a vegetarian, I suggest the le-steak maison. Mine was very beautifully prepared and presented, but the biamese sauce was the real hero, it really did it justice, without it the meat would've been just average.

The food is ok. At the level of comfort food but nothing to write home about. I got the steak frites and was not disappointed but was also not impressed. Food came out quickly and I was seated right now.
Food is great but service is mediocre at best. Server was not around during the dinner. We ended up waiting over an hour for the check.
I've only been once- the stew I had was over salted.
Food was good overall
Good and satisfying food.
not really for vegetarians.

To me its a casual place that thinks its fancy and over charges. No patiance I understand that its a cultural thing but we are in america and we pay well for our good time. Love their frites after all they are French Fries.

This bistro in DC is fantastic. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming. Their menu offers a wonderful variety of traditional French cuisine at reasonable prices. It's hard not to keep coming back for lunch!For starters, I tried the sweetbreads. The sauce was light and complemented the organ meat perfectly. The presentation was delightful and paired nicely with my scotch. I admit, a red wine would have been an even better choice, but I enjoyed it nonetheless.

This is a charming and unpretentious French bistro that has maintained it's appeal over the years. Service was friendly, with our server adding a touch of humor to the dining experience. While the brunch menu offered more vegetarian options, my date enjoyed the steak and frites, also omelette campagnarde was satisfying. Omelette was accompanied by both French fries and a side salad, although the fries could have been crisper. Ambience evoked a Parisian cafe vibe and the open windows provided a refreshing atmosphere. Overall Bistrot Du Coin offers a delightful French dining experience.

I love this place! The steak frites and the moules mariniÃ¨res are my top two choices. But more than the food I come here for the atmosphere. If you want the feel of a Parisian bistro, pastis at the bar, and a great wine selection this is your spot. Also, somehow it hasn't changed in the 10+ years I've been coming here.

What a lovely evening. We had Steak Au Poivre with Frites and a scallops shrimp dish. Both were very well prepared. Desert was a unique apple turnover. Our waiter was very attentive and offered great wine suggestions. The only reason I'm not giving this a 5 is the Bistros attempt to put so many tables at the open window. It was too crowded and one less would have been best. We will go back.

Just after finding this spot online I thought 'well this place looks promising', so I called and made reservations without hesitating. I've never exactly been to a strictly 'French' restaurant before, and that just screamed fancy and pricey to me. Me and my husband walked in just last night, our reservation was for two at 8:45 pm. I walked in and the ambiance hit me with all kinds of pleasant smells and a general sense of easy goingness. I was looking forward to dining some immaculate food, but in all honesty the quality just wasn't there. The food here was incredible by all means, but I thought that it should've been more extraordinary, especially for those prices. If you do plan on coming here and aren't a vegetarian, I suggest the le-steak maison. Mine was very beautifully prepared and presented, but the biamese sauce was the real hero - it really did it justice, without it the meat would've been just average.
This place has an amazing ambiance and is especially delightful when they open up the windows in front. The French onion soup is my favorite. There's so much cheese on it and it's delicious!
maybe the only place ive ever eaten where i thought the dishes had too much cheese.
Great all around! The food was fantastic! Service was great! Price was good! It was an over all great experience!
I love there brunch great selection and. Food was delicious, my friends had a blast, our server was very attentive. Highly recommend this place.
authentic food, setting,servers and wine, fun atmosphere
My favorite for duck! great peppercorn sauce-- I am not into mussels, but apparently, according to friends that love mussels-- they have the best.

Excellent location for power lunching in Dupont Circle -- get some pomme frittes, steak, as well as an excellent taxi, and buckle down for some people viewing in a light airy eatery with a popular vibe.
Wife and I recently had a lovely lunch here. Nice decor and nice service. highly recommended.
Delicious.  Fun place to eat with friends or take a date.

This place is delicious! Whenever I'm there I always order the French onion soup. It's truly the best I've ever had. The duck ravioli is also worth trying and the customer service is exceptional. I can't wait to take my parents here tonight!
Excellent restaurant. Loved the atmosphere, the service and the taste. Service was great too.

It was very pleasant to visit the restaurant . The place is quiet and cultural, the atmosphere there helped along a deliberate meal.I enjoyed the food very well there was nothing I could criticize. The thing I want to remark was the service it was of the very high level.
Great French food at a decent price. Very 'European' atmosphere and great bar.
An old reliable haunt!
I like their food and affordable wines.
Always good food, but limited wine card.
Food was delicious. Loved the mussels and enjoyed the atmosphere.
I was invited to this restaurant by my aunt, as a fan of steak, I'm really picky. It's accually worth 4 star, I would give it 85% mark.

4.5 stars.Great, classic bistro. Simple surroundings, delicious food, reasonably priced.First impressions count: judge a bistro by the bread it serves. Du Coin's is crusty, warm, and flavorful, served with good butter.Pleasant, efficient staff will guide you round the very (maybe too) extensive menu. But I usually go for the steak frites, with well-cooked and beautifully seasoned rump and fries. The mussel pots and the snails are also good bets.Decent wine list, with plenty of reasonably-priced options. The house red is actually rather good.The place gets very busy, which is a good sign, so get there early or be prepared to wait around for a while. A nice touch is that, even thought the place gets crazy crowded, the staff isn't pushy about turning over the tables, allowing your party to hang out and enjoy finishing off your wine or a little digestif.
VERY good meal. The french onion soup was outstanding
mussels were great and the beer was good too. the main dishes were also good but nothing spectacular.
Great food & wine! Service is friendly and knowledgeable.

Great mussels pistou, merguez sausage. It's also one of the only places in DC open 364 days of the year (closed labor day), and until 3 am nightly.ReAlly the widest variety of French standards in DC. Frequented often by the cities francophones, Dupont locals, and Franco tourists alike. Also a great place to pop in on off hours and just sit and sip a drink/coffee and imagine yourself on a mini vacation.

This place is always crowded, and it gets loud inside. Make reservations to be guaranteed a spot.The French onion soup is very good. The steak and fries are good, too.It is a little on the expensive side.

Not huge on French food, but my girl wanted that for her birthday. Great Yelp reviews, and the Dupont location, led us here. Cute, somewhat cozy, and informal, and our table was at a window overlooking the street. Very nice, and I like this better than fancy and snooty.Most importantly, the food was really wonderful...mostly. we had escargot (my first time), and it was just awesome, down to the last drop of butter soaked into our bread. The birthday girl was thrilled with them, along with the Foie gras. The large bucket of mussels was really, really amazing, we could have gone through another one! We also had a beef noodle dish (forget the name), and it was pretty good.Bottom line--Pros:Nice place. Nice service (really, even though I've read differently on here). Very good food. Great value. Mussels and escargotCons:A little loud. A little cold. A little smoky (not sure why). Bread only ok. They insist on using French fries as a side on many entrees (doesn't fit the quality level of the food), and the fries were terrible.

First time trying French cuisine, so I didn't really have anything to compare it to, but i'll stick to the entrees I'm familiar with so I can at least compare the quality. For Dinner (came in at 6-7 pm on the weekend): Very crowded place with all kinds of people. It's right on the strip on restaurants on Connecticut Ave so it's a given that it'll be a tourist spot to try in Dupont Circle when visiting D.C. The atmosphere is loud and social, fine dining without the awkward silence. You kinda have to scream at each other to talk. Waiting list was confusing, there's just a scatter of people from the door to the the bar area and no one knows who's been helped or not. The hostess tend to disappear a lot so you had to hunt her down and check up a few times to make sure she didn't miss you. Towards the end of the night, the manager came out to help, it was a good thing she was there because she took notice of who was who. It a big restaurant and they don't waste any space. There's also an upstairs balcony where they fit about 50 people, it was quite hard to move around. None the less, they were very accommodating and apologetic to the long wait. Appetizers- French Onion soup: came out with the cheese still boiling and wonderufl aroma of caramelized onions. Perfect to taste

Simply my favorite brunch place in DC area. Used to live around the corner from it, but still, it's centrally located. I love the combination of ambiance, outdoorsy feeling in warm weather, spaciousness with tall ceilings, great beer selection for those times, and for brunch the eggs benedict with an addictive little salad on the plate. Closer to evening time I prefer the foie gras and calvados for a luxurious snack. Most of all, I love the memories of going here with friends - it seems we always had a wonderful time when we went to Bistro du Coin!

I love this restaurant - rather eclectic and in the heart of DC. I went here with some friends and the tab for 4 people lus wine came to 112.00 with tip thats pretty good considering the quality of food and service. Iwill keep coming back to this one.

I really enjoy the number of selections that Bistrot Du Coin offers. There seems to be a bit of everything. They have a Tartine (open faced sandwich) with black olive puree, prosciutto and Swiss that is really good. Also a dish of grilled skewers of beef, tomato, red onion, bell pepper, zucchini and yellow squash is decent. Good flavors and service by the staff.

Food was as good as any French I've had in my life. We had a great time until the manager outright refused to replace the foie gras that the busboy threw out by mistake. Fortunately the owners were more sensible and wrote me a quaint email bubbling with french accent and lovable snootiness to offer us a complimentary dish upon our return.
I love this place..for the ambience, bar and quality/price of food...MERCI
FOIE GRAS, FOIE GRAS, FOIE GRAS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!'nuff said.
Go here for the mussels and the Leffe on tap! Great stuff.

Since coming to D.C. at the end of March, I have eaten at Bistrot Du Coin twice: Once by myself for late lunch and once for a dinner with my sister from New York. Based on both visits, I have to say that this French bistro is one of the better places to eat at Dupont Circle. The Good: The food tastes great and the portions are filling. The French Onion Soup is perfectly made and not too salty, the Steak Frites are decent but the portion is large and the Bearnaise sauce it comes with tastes great with the fries, the Duck and Monkfish entrees at dinner tasted excellent but both came in thick cream sauces (so don't order if you don't like cream). The mussels are as good as people say they are, a small pot of mussels can serve as a good appetizer for two hungry people. The Bad: The restaurant can get loud and packed during dinner time. The service is great and attentive during their late lunch hours (after 2pm), but it can get spotty during dinner service. Without reservations, it can take an hour to get seated for dinner. Bottom line: the food is excellent and filling, but pricey
Like stepping into France. Amazing.
i have to agree it place is great !
Service and Food was great Fresh prepared tasty food with great selections of wine and other drinks
Great Service. Outstanding food, Nice wine! Good pricing. Desserts delicious!! Casaoule and moussels exceptional.

The food and service are very good. I felt like I walked into a Paris restaurantWe ordered the escargot, rabbit stew, Mussels in creamy roquefort sauce, and Pan seared pave, pepper cream sauce, and French fries.My son wasn't a fan of the French fries but otherwise we all enjoyed our dishes.Now I'm looking at the dessert menu and salivating and decided on the poached peach while my son gets the lava cake. made a reservation here because someone said they have all the French vibes and flavors comparable to Le DiplÃ³mate for half the distance and better availability, and they weren't kidding!Located in Dupont Circle a few blocks from the metro, Great food, worth the expense. Try the rabbit stew is marvelous.I had a birthday party there, it was awesome.I can't wait for my next excuse to come here!

I was brought to Bistrot Du Coin by a friend who claimed they had the best steak frites in the DMV, and I must say, it lived up to the hype! The steak was cooked to perfection, and the variety of options made it even better. The escargot had a wonderful balance of flavors, and the garlic and herbs really shone through. The fries were tasty, and the chocolate mousse was a delightful ending to the meal. The service was efficient, considering how busy they were. The only downside was the slightly small wine portions for the price. Overall, I can't wait to come back!
D.C Staple. Feels like you're on the east coast when you hit this joint. Keith Lee Review: Customer Service: 10/10 Food: 9.2/10 Overall: 9.5/10
Wonderful experience and wonderful food. Most definitely will return to this restaurant in a city full of great restaurants.
I love a casual french bistro, which is what this is.
A perfect lunch. Hot, delicious, huge portions, great service.
perfect place for dinner with friends!
We had a lovely meal last night. Everything was  tasty and fresh. Perfect fries. Been too long since my last visit.
Every meal we ordered was delicious!
Great food and great ambiance ! My wife and I love the variety fo wines and food selection !
The food was great! Kids friendly. Great place for a group of friends to get together.
Great French food and cozy atmosphere.
I have been here twice and both experiences I had excellent service and food. The mussels are a must.

I would classify myself as a professional foodie (meaning i eat anywhere and everywhere i can) - i have travelled the world and i can assure you - i have eaten at Many places. The service is impeccable and the food is divine.
Wrong review for this place!
One of my favorite places to grab moules and frites in DC.
Tasty and delicious! Love .

This is my favorite French restaurant in the entire DC metro area. My favorite dish is the filet mignon with fries and Bernese sauce. Their sauce is quite an experience....The bread is also amazing. I recommend coming in mid afternoon so as to avoid long lines.Lastly, try their crime brÃ»lÃ©e. Ridiculously good.

Absolutely going with the full 5 starts here. That was an all around superb dining experience and the food was no less than outstanding. Bistrot Du Coin serves real French fare and has reasonable prices and a fully unpretentious and inviting atmosphere. That's not a combination you'll see very often and I was blown away. I started off with the baked mussels in garlic butter and ordered the rabbit stew for dinner. Seriously, straight out of France. You could honestly swear that you were there. The rabbit stew somehow pulled off a magic trick of being rich and delicious and yet lean and rustic at the same time. You know a restaurant is good when it looks packed and that was exactly correct here. Bravo.
This restaurant is my favorite French Bistro! The mussels are amazing!
So perfectly and diversely french.
Food is authentic French, not fancy, but very good. Mussel selection is great and traditional French dishes are served. Casual atmosphere, great service, and always crowded.
Yummy, cheap steak frites!!!
Loved the food. Loved the atmosphere. Hated how much it made me miss Paris. Eat here!
Nice place, we loved it, it was warm and delicious. We will definitely go back.
Love the fragua. but some times small some times big... different amount every time i go...
Come here every time I can, love the food and atmosphere!

While returning home from my first completed marathon last Sunday, my stomach was crying out for food. What was the first thing that popped into my head? Steak. Steak in a rich sauce. Where could one find such a thing? Bistro du Coin of course! If you want to become a fat ass (or consume as many calories as you just burned while doing a marathon), I highly recommend getting one of their steaks. If the meat won't fill you up, the rich sauce certainly will. To ensure you feel like a true glutton, they have fries on the side too (which are, eh, not bad but not nearly as good as the steak and its sauce). Of course Bistro du Coin has other options beyond steak. The mussels are also fantastic and a friend raved about the duck he had.It took me nearly 2 years of living in DC to finally come to Bistro Du Coin, but I finally got around to it and have now gone twice within a month. Definitely recommend eating here.Oh, the beer selection is :meh: but it does have an extensive wine selection. I don't recommend getting the cheaper bottles, they kinda suck (but hey, I guess that's just more proof you get what you pay for).

It doesn't get better than this. I've lived in Europe, and I can tell you, this is THE REAL DEAL. This is my favorite restaurant in DC. I highly recommend the mussels with lobster, the seafood mac & cheese, and the chocolate mousse. Go, you'll fall in love!
I love this restaurant. The le steak mason it is great.

Excellent, I have tried many French restaurants in DC and I always find my way back to Bistrot Du Coin. Get the Margaret De Canard medium rare and start off with some mussels and fries! (Note: the staff can sometimes be rude and there is often a wait, however, the food and lively atmosphere are worth it)
I love love love this place!! Not only is the food wonderful but the people out there make you feel like you're part of the family.
LovedThisPlace
we hit this place for dessert... the selection was nice and our dishes were incredible

I had a great time at this charming bistro. I had soup, which was great. Moules gratinees Au Beurre d'Ail is my favorite. Filet de Boeuf GrillÃ© was the pich of my girlfriend, she also was very happy with it. The server was very professional and helped a lot to make our choices. We are very satisfied with this place.
Bistro Du Coin is the only restaurant in DC that I could eat at every day.
I cannot stress how great this place is. Wonderful food, atmosphere etc.
best french food for the price!!!

This restaurant has not the level of a Michelin star, unless, Michelin standards have dropped terribly -The palette cleanser : very sweet -Foie Gras : very sweet, I could not taste the foie gras, it was like eating bread and butter with jam-salmon: tasty and cooked well-ravioli foie gras: the filling was tasty, the sauce very Sweet-wagyu beef: the meet was cooked well, the sauce very sweet-the Canard "Ã  la presse" : The big disappointment!, with a supplement $$, I was expecting the table side service (like La Tour d'argent) , what is the point to name this dish and not seeing the preparation table side, this one was a big looser, the meat was medium +, the sauce Very Sweet, didn't have the flavor "a la Goutte de sang"-Semifredo and banana: both very sweetThe Michelin has changed their entry stars level which before was at a higher level, now you are eating in a casual looking restaurant with rap music and the only Michelin experience was the High price Conclusion our entire meal was just sweet food
Went during restaurant week -- the service was incredible and very accommodating -- it was extremely packed but the service was still pretty quick.

Came in for V-Day and had a great time. We opted to add the foie gras and the pressed duck - absolutely recommend for folks to do the same. I will say that the tasting menu without any additions is enough to fill you up, we were really struggling by the time the pressed duck came around. Only reason for 4 stars was the scallop dish and the bread that came with the wagyu. The scallops were so salty that we could barely eat them and that took us a bit out of the immersion of the meal. Bread was incredibly dry but the butter was really good! All-in-all, I would certainly come back for another experience.
Nfhknskdkddnsjsjdnskskwjhejeje xnskskkwkwiwowikwhxndkkskwkekkwkwheusyududuudhdhebÂ­ejkwo

I think this is one of the cooler spots in the Corridor, I wouldn't say it's perfect but the aesthetic they're aiming for is very refreshing. I really enjoyed the vibe inside here, the interior is cozy with a minimalist touch that makes it super sleek. I thought it would be expensive when coming in here because it looks very high class, but the prices aren't scary at all. The food is top quality, but there aren't many extraordinary dishes that would stand out, I've seen most of the menu in other spots around DC before. The chestnut agnolotti was definitely the standout dish of the night, it came with rabbit, sunchokes, mustard seed and pear that made for a wild yet enjoyable flavor. The pacing of the dishes was somewhat slow, every dish came out in intervals of almost 30 minutes. Still, I don't think this is by any means a 'bad' place, it just needs a few minor adjustments here and there.

I recently dined at BRESCA and had an amazing experience! The food was creative and full of flavor, and the atmosphere was cozy yet elegant. Highly recommend it for anyone looking for a unique dining experience!Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

Food was innovative, perfectly made, and paired well with drinks. From the host to the food runner and especially the bartender Frank, we thoroughly enjoyed our time. We will be coming back. Again, big shout out to Frank, he made our night perfect

My recent dining experience at Bresca was nothing short of extraordinary. Opting for the four-course meal, I was consistently impressed with each dish surpassing the previous one in flavor and presentation.The evening began with the kompachi crudo, which was a revelation. The delicate slices of fish melted in my mouth, each bite a harmonious blend of freshness and subtle seasoning. It set a high bar for the courses to follow.Next, I was served the lamb saddle, which, without a doubt, was the highlight of the evening. The lamb was perfectly cooked, tender, and bursting with rich, savory flavors that lingered long after the last bite. It was, quite simply, the best thing I've ever eaten.Every course at Bresca showcased a meticulous attention to detail and a deep understanding of flavor combinations, elevating the dining experience to new heights. Bresca isn't just another dinner spot
Great management, great food, great service, one of the best restaurants I've ever been to
This place is great. We went to Jont a month before and that was amazing. So we figured we had to try the place downstairs. Both are A+ and you can't go wrong with either.
10 stars!!! Been going to bresca since it opened and everything from the presentation of honeybee drinks to sliced duck (note, menu does vary). Great date night spot
Most impressive dining experience we have ever had. Food and service were outstanding!
Delicious high-quality plates, a selection of wines, and great services. We tried all their entrees, one of their desserts, and everything was delicious. Highly recommended!!!
Can't say enough about the service. From host to bartenders, everyone is great. The food is amazing - some would say pricey, but not for the quality you get. Try, try really hard to get the duck!
Went for a friends bday, decor, food, service, cocktails were the best! (Date not too bad either ) the waitress was really nice & attentive. Made my friend feel special on their birthday
Only had drinks but it was excellent and the bartender Will was outstanding!
Fantastic! Tasting menu was spot on. Service impeccable without being "in your face."
So creative. Great service. Not for simple minded people as it's unique pallet of foods are for sophisticated taste. Seasonal and hanged constantly. Go to the bar if they are full

Bresca is what DC dining should be about! Fun, Witty and Delicious. Not following trends but rather setting them, this new 14th st restaurant delivers amazing food, fun cocktails and outstanding hospitality.  Among my favorites were the chicken with iberico ham, the octopus and the pastrami beets. To end the night on a high note NOT TO BE MISSED: Foie Gras Popsicles...absolute YUM!Cocktails were outstanding and it was a small but well curated wine list with really good finds.

I went back again last night and had an even better time! The new octopus on the menu was incredible. The flavors were balanced and fresh. The Boisson Royale cocktail was also delicious. Our server was attentive and explained the dishes very well.

I went last night for dinner at Bresca and sat at the bar. First of al let me tell you that the space is breath taking. As I relaxed into my seat the bartenders introduced me to their menu that is formatted into different size plates which I thought was very clever! I ordered to start the caviar with parsley root ice cream as I was feeling adventurous and may I just say WOW what a treat!I also tried the chicken with iberico ham that had an incredible balance of flavors.The bartenders were super friendly and the interaction really made my night. Definitely a must go if you are in DC.

My wife and I ate there and the food was amazing. We had great service even met the ower and the chefs. We both drove in from Philadelphia and had a great meal. The selection at the bar was very different. There own take on old fashioned drinks.

Amazing Food and Hospitality! The pastrami beets toast is outstanding as well as the uni pasta! The drinks were delicious and very well crafted. Cool atmosphere with an awesome green wall that creates a fun scene.
beautiful space amazing food! Such attention to detail in all elements. Loved it

hey are not open in the middle of the day or even for to go orders when I came back 20 minutes before they close the kitchen to go they refused to take any orders . The manageress was obnoxious. And disrespectful..
worst service ive ever recieved in my life. ive never been treated worse
Sat for over half an hour and only got a glass of water and NOTHING!! No one ever came back

This is the worst brunch I have ever been to. If you enjoy getting a refill every 20 minutes and last call 20 minutes before you're supposed to, then this is the place for you. Avoid at all costs. There's a reason you can get reservations at this place last minute. Never again

Food was excellent, HOWEVER... went to meet a group of friends for a brunch. The group was doing the unlimited drinks and food for $32.99.. Being 5 months pregnant its a waste of money for me to pay for alcohol i will not drink. I politely asked the server if i could just order plates for myself and be charged separatley from the others because i would not be drinking. He refused to allow me to do that at my table, but If I wanted he would reseat me across the restaurant at a table by MYSELF so i could be charged a different price and chose what I selected without paying for the unlimited brunch. Have you heard of customer service? I felt very discriminated against and If it wasnt a friends birthday, I would have left and chosen a different place to eat. Will not return..
Food: 2 out 5
Never again...my chicken was raw! I'm sorry but if you can't completely cook a chicken you should get out of the kitchen!
On top of truly mediocre food, these guys DO NOT HONOR THEIR GROUPONS . . . avoid. That amazing patio deserves better.
place is good but service is not good, you have to ask water or what you need, food are good..

Although the wait staff were excellent,the food was mediocre. The lentil soup was flavorless.We ordered a 3 meza sampler for $9 which consisted of meager portions(about 1 heaping tablespoon of bland hummus, a decent baba ghanush and red pepper/feta sampling) The small portion size was embarassing since there was nothing to share for the table.The rice dish and sauteed kale were greasy. The only tasty dish was the Greek salad. The falafels were also bland and dry. This restaurant was much better in the past. If only the food was as good as the waiters!

I'm only giving this 2 star because of our waiter was good. Soooo lets get to the point. I have never seen small portions like this before. They should add tapas bar on their name plus they don't know what " iskender" is. The plate they served it was about 5" round and consist of very dry phyllo dough and couple pieces of steak and touch of yogurt. It should be pita bread , gyro meat, tomato sauce butter and yogurt. The bottom line is their iskender tastes awful. Don't ever try. If you're hungry, go somewhere.

The food here is definitely good. However I have an issue with the portions and price ratio. Although the service is somewhat decent, the fact is that, its kinda subpar. After having 2 appetizers, beer battered mussels, the kibbeh, 2 strawberry martinis, 2 cucumber martinis, and a bottle of sparkling water, our bill was $75 NOT including tip.I think that this place can really do a lot better and it needs a lot of improvement. So if you're looking for a "top notch" kinda place. I really wouldn't recommend Agora, unless you're expecting to spend a $100 just on small 2 piece appetizers and a drink or two between you and a friend or date. The indoor area has been redone since it was last Jacks and looks alot better. So that's huge improvement, but the waiter/server we had didn't speak fluent English, although they were very friendly.

I have been on 17th street for some time. I have been here when it was Jacks and then all I had to say was YUCK. I will have to say this is an improvement, but while the food was ok it was not my cup of tea. The price for the food on the plates is ok. The prices for the drinks were a little over the top for a place that is that new and with food that is just ok. If you are looking for good and expensive food and drinks this is the place for you.
It's supposedly Turkish food but there's no turkey on the menu.
Good food with good company. Unlimited brunch everything.
nice atmosphere, nice service, decently priced.
The kebabs are pretty good
Good enough food but nothing special. if you go early very quiet.
Yea, this place is ok.
Great meal! Had some Roberto recommended a great meal. Ate outside under the canopy and it was very pleasant until they turned on the heat to get us to leave. JK! Nice lunch!
The food was delicious. Ambiance was great. The price is a little expensive though. All in all. I would try it again. I got the steak kabobs and every bite was extremely delicious.
This place is very beautiful , and awesome restaurant food was very great taste. services was very great , atmosphere was always great . I definitely will be come back again.

One of my favorite places to take visiting friends in DC for the ambiance, slow pace, and good wine. The service can really be hit or miss, but the food and wine is always incredible. I would highly recommend the spread sampler, sucuklu, dolmades, lamb chops, and sis kebab.

Just as I was about to give up on finding good Mediterranean spots around dupont, I came across these guys. Tried the food here just last night, it was exceptional compared to other Mediterranean spots around DC. My waitress was also very attentive and polite, it's what made me want to come back for seconds. Hopefully my next experience here will amount to 5 stars, I definitely think that'll be the case.

Just as I was about to give up on finding good Mediterranean spots around dupont, I came across these guys. Tried the food here just last night, it was exceptional compared to other Mediterranean spots around DC. My waitress was also very attentive and polite, it's what made me want to come back for seconds. Hopefully my next experience here will amount to 5 stars, I definitely think that'll be the case.
While visiting D.C, I was told to go to this restaurant. Overall the food and the service was good.

I was surprised that so many places in Dupont were closed on Sunday nights, so had limited options of places to take some friends that were in town last weekend. I've walked by Agora a million times and never stopped in. Pleasantly surprised with the food. Friends also enjoyed.
The service is really friendly and the food is very pretty and tiny.
It's a really nice Turkish-Mediterranean restaurant.
The brunch was great! I will definitely be back.
We experienced their awesome food during the restaurant week ...
awesome!
Great food! Love the tapas!!
Turkish delight, this place is!
Excellent food.The cocktails are even better. Inventive and delicious.
Love the small plates that can shared...
The food was very good, as was the service.
Good food, good atmosphere
Good food. Good service
Atmosphere and staff are a five. Food was a four. Couldn't give it a 4.5. I would go back.

If you like Turkish/Greek food+great interior design+nice service+perfect people watch with huge patio,you must try AGORA asap.Manti (small Trikish ravioli with ground lamb and beef) absolute satisfaction,fried mussels and hot stuffed grape leaves also splendid.Very cozy place with exposed brick walls and dark wood.And.... uhmmm....what else? ,oh yes! A+ food :)))
Amazing food and atmosphere, and the service was very good. My fav dish is the Konafa

Highly recommend Agora.The cocktail and wine selections are fantastic, offering a wide variety of options to complement the meal. For dinner, we tried an array of dishes, including the Taramosalata, Sucuklu Pide, Ottoman Rice, fried cauliflower, grilled prawns, Kofte, and the Anadolu Manti. Each plate was delicious, showcasing bold flavors and expert preparation. I highly recommend the Anadolu Manti -- these dumplings were amazing. The small plate style is perfect for sharing, and I'd recommend ordering about three dishes per person to fully explore the menu. The Pistachio SoufflÃ© for dessert was perfect--light, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The service was exceptional. Our waiter was attentive, knowledgeable, and offered thoughtful recommendations that truly elevated our experience. To top it all off, the decor and ambiance created a warm and inviting atmosphere, making it a great spot for a memorable evening out.**I will say, this restaurant automatically adds a 3% surcharge to all checks. This does not take the place of gratuity, and is explained as a way for the restaurant to keep up with increasing expenses, etc.. While the check notes that you can request the removal of this surcharge, I really don't like this and wish they would simply raise the cost of each menu item. The cost listed on the menu should be the cost of the meal, rather than a 3% higher surprise once you've completed your meal.**
We loved our drinks at agora's bar!! We got the Midas and the Istanbul and would definitely recommend. Thanks to Augusto for the great service as well
Augusto was an amazing bartender -- service and drinks are amazing. Highly recommend!!
Augusto is such a friendly and patient server! he answered all of our questions, laughed at our jokes and recommended the best food. I can't wait to come back! everybody get the calamari
Agora is my go-to spot with friends! Special shoutout to Augusto, who made accommodations for us and ensured we had a great time.
This is my favorite restaurant in DC! Augusto was an excellent server! We had such a lovely time. I highly recommend the mucver and the branzino!
favorite restaurant in DC!!! definitely get the dip sampler and mixed cheese pide. Augusto was my server and took care of us all night!
Sit at the bar for Augusto! Great happy hour with good food and drink deals. Highly recommend the labne and Istanbul Bey cocktail
Incredible service! Thanks Agusto, Lee, and Steve were super quick, and explained the menu well.
Augusta was amazing! This was our first time here and he was very attentive and made us feel very welcomed. Definitely recommend this place for happy hour!
You have to go see Augusto at the bar! He makes the best drinks and accommodates to your order if there is something you want to change.
The drinks were good, the food was good, and our server Roberto was amazing. I got the Adnan kebab and it was delicious. The espresso martini and thyme to bloom- amazing!!!
we had a lovely dinner / delicious food and fabulous atmosphere and our server Irbin was great !
Great service and happy hour! Had a great experience with our server Agosto!! Would go back!
The food was amazing! And, Lee was a great server! I would recommend the grilled chicken and Thyme To Bloom drink. Chef kiss and bartender delight!
Augusto and Lionel were great when i went here for happy hour. good food deals and great service. Must try
Lionel and Augusto were awesome bar tenders! Went for happy hour and it was a great time
Roberto was fantastic and gave great service! the Restaurant Week course was extraordinary, great options and delicious range of tastes. The chicken was some of the best I've ever had.

I happened upon Agora looking for somewhere I could sit at the bar and was pleasantly surprised by the creative cocktails and friendly bartenders, particularly my man Augusto. Definitely a great place to stop in for some unique and tasty flavor combinations.

My wife and I had some drinks at the bar before going to Sushi Taro down the street. We loved the ambience and had some amazing cocktails. The Midas Touch has some apple and lemon flavor that work in any season and Augusto the bartender even prepared a basil smash off menu!
Vedat was the most amazing server and always made sure our drinks were full! 10/10 recommend
Amazing service, delicious food! can't recommend bottomless brunch enough! Their french toast is to die for!!
This place is incredible. Bottomless mimosas and bloodies. Omar took care of us and recommended great dishes. Definitely request him. He was very attentive
This place was great. The food was good, service was good and prices were great. Would definitely come back here again.

Agore deserves a 5-star rating without a doubt. Their bottomless brunch is a dream come true, leaving us happily full. The food is exceptional, and we savor every bite. The servers are attentive, ensuring we never have to wait for refills. The porch vibes are simply perfect, and the interior is equally charming. Our waiter, Ali, was the real MVP, making our boozy brunch with a group of friends a fantastic experience. The starters were delicious, especially the smoked salmon, and the entrees, like the fried egg over lamb, were the stars of the show. We were so engrossed in our meal and the enjoyable company that we forgot to take photos!

Agora has the best brunch in DC. The bottomless food and drink is awesome. Also don't skip dinner because the grilled chicken (as boring as it sounds) is out of this world. Super moist and flavorful. I always have a great time at Agora

A truly authentic Mediterranean dining experience! The food was wonderful and the mezze style allows you to try a little bit of everything (the saganaki, labneh, and grilled octopus are my personal favorites). Excellent selection of Greek and Turkish wines and everyone on staff was welcoming, professional, and just the right amount of attentive. Great management, great vibes, and an all around great time!

I just came here for the first time, was here with 2 friends and the staff is nothing short of fantastic!!! We were waited on by Mark who was very friendly, we loved talking to him, and he recommended the grilled chicken and the bodrum kebap, both were so good! Renee was the bar tender and we asked him to make us something refreshing and summery and he came through for us! He made us a strawberry basil drink with lemoncello and it was so perfectly perfect! I cannot wait to come back
Best Burger, Wraps for lunch and amazing bottomless Brunch menu on weekends. Great taste of menu, wonderful atmosphere with a gorgeous outdoor tents.
We had an amazing time thanks to Funda! She recommended the best Raki and cocktails. We definitely enjoyed our dinner and will be back soon. Loved the service here
One of my favorite mediterranean restaurants in the city!! So good ouzo and calamari. Definitely recommend making reservations on a weekend and coming in a group or even on a date. Great ambiance.
Food was great,the atmosphere is excellent service also perfect we recommended for everybody go there.
I've only ever been for dinner, but it was absolutely delicious!Servers were attentive and the small plates were delicious and great for sharing!
I have been to this place many times and I just realized I haven't posted my experience here. Here it goes, first of all
Great food and best service!
My favorite plate was mix seafood, and our server Onur was excellent and so handsome boy!! I will come back for sure!

I highly recommend this place to everyone who likes to eat delicious food.I been to Agora many times and I believe I'll continue to go.I can say this place is the best place to eat meze and Turkish food. The manager and his co-workers are very helpful.Thanks to Agora for giving us this choice.
Best restaurant!! Best service!! Best drinks!! Best Brunch!!! Amazing food!!! If you want to have brunch you gotta come here
Amazing bottomless brunches! So much food and drink, and the staff is so friendly! Definitely one of the neat brunches I've had in DC.
I love this place. Great food and a great brunch! The mimosas were great and the space is nice too. My friends and I enjoyed it. Also, Vesi is the best server ever too!
Best brunch I've been to in a while! Incredible service, delicious food! I definitely will be back for brunch and dinner again. Thanks, Agora!
If you go anywhere in dupont, make it agora. The food is amazing. Price is reasonable. And the service is amazing. Vesi was an amazing server and very patient with our large party!
Best brunch in DC! Vesi is INCREDIBLE! Love her and all the staff Bottomless brunch is totally worth. Everyone dish is unbelievable!
Great staff, great food, great service!!! Vesi was a fabulous server and took great care of our very large party!!!
Agora is by far my favorite place to brunch with friends. The food is delicious and you can't beat their bottomless brunch!
Sunday brunch is amazing. Vesi, our waitress, was amazing and made the experience so much better!
One of my favourite restaurants in DC. Amazing food, wonderful service every time. Brunch is the best in town. Love Vesi and Izzy.
One of the best Turkish cuisine in town. Love the Meze's, Outdoor seating is a big plus.
Service, food, atmosphere. All stellar. I return time and time again.

I have not written a review in a long time but I decided to start rating some of the places I been. I was at agora last night, my uncle came from overseas and wanted to try some Turkish food. A friend of mine recommended the place for us.  Four of us walked in and had great service and excellent food.

Very nice restaurant in the heart of the City. Terrific blend of Mediterranean and Middle East cousin. I strongly recommend it. And delicious dessert option. My Favorite one kadayif. Everyone who contributed to thank you very much.
Great food, ambiance and customer service.
They have the absolutely best Turkish food in DC area.I think they copied many things from Zaytinya but i still love and enjoy Agora's food very much...

Ended up sitting at the bar for brunch because our reservation didn't go through or something. Couldn't have been happier with that. The owner kept bringing us his favorite things and every single item was delicious. He also wouldn't take NP for an answer on keeping our mimosas topped off. 10/10 would go back again
Delicious!
Simply delicious. Dinner was amazing. The best mediterranean food ever!

This is my usual spot and One of the best places in Dc. If you are looking for Mediterranean food, this place should be your spot.My favorites are Branzino, mucver, cheese selections and their perfect pita bread. I have really good time every single time that I go here. Great food , great service. Tapa style plates are good for sharing. If weather is warm, ask for patio table. You guys rock.
Amazing bottomless brunch experience!

Zaytinia was my go to for east Mediterranean food, but now Agora just kicked Zaytinia's butt. The staple of Mediterranean cuisine is freshness and clean crisp taste, and the food here delivers that with excellence. My gf and I could not stop ordering more dishes because each one was just as delicious as the other. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants.

Zaytinia was my go to for east Mediterranean food, but now Agora just kicked Zaytinia's butt. The staple of Mediterranean cuisine is freshness and clean crisp flavorful taste and the food here delivers on all that with excellence. My gf and I could not stop ordering more dishes because each one was just as delicious as the other. Service was great and the patio seating is nice. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants.
Really great small plates. Everything we tried was fresh and full of flavor!

Ohh boy , soo good, lunch could not be better, Agora rocks as usual love being here , friendly staff and always delicious food , and whenever the weather is great love the Patio been here so many times , it is soo Unique . Thnak you AGORA keep up the great job.We will be BACK LOL :))
We have gone to this place three times and loved the food. Recommended.
Everything was great!

I had an AWESOME brunch here 2 weeks ago. We went on a Saturday around 12:30 and had no trouble getting in. We opted for the prix fixe brunch, which is definitely the way to go - $30 for all you can eat (order off the menu) and all you can drink (mimosas, bloody marys, champagne, rail drinks). Our waiter, Brent, was attentive and helpful and didn't roll his eyes when we ordered practically everything on the menu and eventually abandoned mimosas for straight champagne and liquor). We were there for almost 3 hours, eating and drinking as we pleased, and he was happy to continue to serve us.Some of the best dishes I tasted: cacik, htipiti, arugula salad, manchego/tomato/basil omelette, and really all of the flatbreads.Agora's prix fixe brunch is a great choice if you're looking for a booze-heavy marathon brunch with awesome food!

SO happy 17th Street has a great restaurant!! I eat here weekly and aside from the annoying hostess who always claims they are full with reservations even though the tables are empty and stay empty for the entire time I'm there, the food and service is wonderful!! I have yet to get a dish here I don't love!
I always have fun at this place. It is diverse and fun.
I give Agora five stars for being both fabulous and low-key, a combination I have found to be pretty rare in DC. The dining room is immaculate and casual
always enjoyed this place.
I would give it 3.5 if I could. The staff was good. The noodles were tasty but extremely over priced. Not sure what else I can say.
Im quite fond of spicy food. Based on the reviews this places serves spicy food so i came. The food was indeed very spicy but not tasty
Food presented nice but taste is very "okay", so it seems a bit over priced with the quality. Can easily find anything better than this one in other place.
Food was good , Great to stop by for some lunch, wouldnt really go there for dinner.
Came back for lunch and it was much quieter, and they have a lunch special for $9 (-$3 regular prices). It was good!
This was the first restaurant the DMV Noodle has reviewed. We had our first meeting at the restaurant two weeks ago and we have rated DC Noodles on a scale of 1 to 5
Red miso ramen and all kinds of snack is my love, so delicious and low price, you can choose them as you meal. I will come again.
I like this place, like all kinds of noodles, red miso ramen and Pad Thai. so delicious, authentic asian cuisine.
Lots of variety, good service, yummy food!
Great food! Drinks are good and the service isn't bad either
Love the spring rolls, and the Miso soup is amazing.
Excellent food and wait staff. No waiting for a table and priced right.
this is awesome place everybody should try this.

This place is authentic. The best place is the closest thing that you can find to an actual Chinese noodle shop. Everything is handmade fresh in house. Don't come for the atmosphere or the cleanliness. Come for the food!!
Great food, prices and service last night. I will definitely be coming back.
Love the food here, been their customer for over 4 years.
Pretty good
So. Good. Pork buns, amaze. Ginger broth, legendary. Ginger broth. Ginger broth. Ginger broth.
I Love this place!!! the space is nice and relaxing.its nice to go have a lunch date or just order pick-up!Obsessed!
so so goooodddd!!!
I usually get delivery from here and the wait time is pretty standard

The food here is Amazinggg! I came by here on my lunch break to get something small to eat and ended up ordering the drunken noodles with chicken. It came in a huge bowl and was flavored to perfection! The Customer service was also great, I will definitely be back!

This is the best place to get really good, spicy Thai (just make sure you ask for it to be Thai spicy). I *love* the noodle soup and the drunken noodles. The beef buns are amazing and the service is great. Just a great place to get some really great Thai food.
I really enjoyed the food.
i enjoyed the crispy tofu in clear broth. place is clean. my firend had the pork drunken noodles. she said it has a good smoky flavor.
one word: AMAZING.
My favorite place for Asian noodles in the district!
What more could you ask for? Fast service, great food and a low price.

this is one of my favorite noodle places in dc. they have FAB-O interior design. (which i heart) and delicioso food. I have tried three different dishes, and all of them were well beyond my liking. totally awesome!

I showed up there at 1:30 with two other people, we were told there was a 15 minute wait, so we put our name and number down. We looked at the books and around 2 realized we weren't texted about our table. We go back to the hostess and she says that she was about to text us, which I highly doubt because she had to check her ipad. We get seated and aren't served for 20 minutes. Someone who was sweeping noticed that we weren't served and brought us water. We leave around 2:30 after not being served and run into our waiter, who said he was working inside and outside and was very polite but obviously overworked and stressed.
This place service is so bad don't keep going back but never change this my last visits
The food has really fallen off as place seems to be focusing on other things. Too bad
Food is not good and neither is the environment. Would definitely not recommend coming here.
I got food poisoning from here . Suggest to go to another location maybe . The one on ustreet fell off sadly
Legit got more service from a homeless person roaming the restaurant than our waitress
40 minutes passed and the tables around me ( who got there after I did) got their food, wasn't even offered water. Horrible place.
Dont support restaurants that support vax card enforcement. Eat free and healthy on your own terms!
Did not taste fresh. Will not go back again. My bread tasted stale. There are better options.

Walked it at 9:55pm Saturday evening , they close at 11 , I was told along with my wife n kid we won't be seating anyone , while there were 4 girls behind me and she gave them a big smile n seated them!!!!! Disgrace to the hostes an restaurant!!! Will never dine at their locations again

food is great and the place is clean and service is ok. This is not your place to be though if your not an activist or a non political person because it is just the place for them to hang out and a mural to all the america hating people.

Gabriel was the worst manager I ever encountered before in my life. After speaking to an aggressive bar tender . He then grabs the manager after I asked for him 3 times. The manager came over rude and because I walked 20 mints over here he was not trying to help me. I wish I would have known that this anti-gay restaurant would employee someone who was so rude and a nasty. PLEASE DO NOT EAT HERE!!!! The service is HORRIBLE! Anti-Gay ppl.

This is a place to stay away from. A large room packed like sardines with man-bun wearing bearded poseurs and their ironic tattoos. If you want to talk to your dining companions as we did you can forget it. NOTHING to deaden the cacophony...no carpet, no acoustic ceiling, nothing. This must rank as one of the loudest places on the face of the earth. The floor appeared as if it had not been swept since the Carter administration. The food...if it ever arrives...is mediocre and way, way overpriced. The service is the worst I have ever experienced. Snotty, pretentious and most of all...incompetent. Water glasses were never refilled, and one of our party had an entree delivered AFTER THE REST OF US HAD FINISHED OUR ENTIRE MEAL. They will nickle-and-dime you to death. One of our party ordered sliders, and asked for pickles, which did not come with them. They charged a dollar extra for five slices of pickle from a commercial jar. I don't like spicy food, so I wanted a mild cheese on my burger instead of the Pepper-jack. They charged extra for the substitution...one slice of cheese for another. I needed to use the bathroom, which had only one stall. After several unsuccessful attempts to find it vacant, I saw that they had an unoccupied handicap-accessible bathroom. They refused to let me use it, even though by this time it was quite the emergency. Finally the manager reluctantly (and she let me know it was reluctantly) called off the two nasty servers whose job it is...apparently...to police the toilets and allowed me to use it. Handicap-accessible does not mean handicap only, but these unpleasant amateurs are unclear on the concept. So if you want to be VERY badly treated while chowing down on very expensive so-so food (if it ever arrives)...this is the place for you.
There was a bug in my brunch, it was good otherwise.... until the bug came out.... then I didn't want it anymore.

WARNING: they don't take groups over 6. Because splitting the check is too difficult.  I hate this place!!!! With a passion. Why the fuck do you have people waiting for an hour and a half. Then when we get a seat the waitress takes our drink order then decides to leave us because there is too many of us. I don't think so. Fuck this place. Fuck these people and the cooks. The only good part about this place is the assortment of books they have. That's the only thing I tolerated and it kept me occupied from blowing up. So thank you Busboys and Poets for making me NEVER want to come here again.We also asked for LEMONS. What happened? I don't know. But sadly it's my friends birthday so I stocked around. I was young when I arrived here but I aged 20 years because of this place. Thank you

Unfortunately this restaurant boasts itself to be a welcoming forum with food however, the staff proved to be offensive and ignorant. The waitresses and the management are extremely intolerant and the service was horrible. If you like to enjoy your meal time I recommend going somewhere else.

Busboys and Poets claims to be: "...a space for art, culture and politics to intentionally collide...." Unless, of course, they don't agree with your art, culture, or politics. B&P refused to book the venue for Washington's annual GI Film Festival, stating they "did not like what it stands for," that is, an art festival dedicated to the service men and women who have sacrificed so much for our country.

I will NEVER visit this place again.....why would you, an establishment that celebrates art and the freedom of speech, not support the GI Film Festival that celebrates art that celebrates those who've served to protect your rights? (The GI Film Festival wanted to rent this place out for one of their events and B&P refused to allow them to rent their space for a reception because "they do not like what the GI Film Festival stands for." This place doesn't support the troops and is NOT friendly to veterans...Shame on you Busboys and Bigots!  Hypocrites: facebook.com/photo.php?fâ€¦

poseur-ish,, there is a lot of bullshit writers, looking very intense as they hunker over their xpensive laptops.Open mic should be just that. None of this minor extortion to read. Oh yeah using your rap cadence doesn't lend any cred to what you're reading so you might want to listen to some thing outside of what you know. Pick up some Rimbaud, Milton or Yeats, and perhaps not think that feeble channeling RZA or Method Man dials in your game.

BB and P does not seem to like service animals. I have a service dog for a chronic medical condition. I take my service dog everywhere I go including restaurants. Since she is not a pet but a service animal this is legal. I was kicked out of Busboys and Poets for bringing my service dog. I then called another Busboys location and was told I was not be allowed to bring her into that location as well. Busboys seems to have a problem with people who need service animals. They claim to believe in "social justice" but that is not the case.

If i could have given this place zero stars I would have. We a horrible time here, the server was soooo rude. It took and hour at least to get our food and it was not even busy. That however was not the worst thing. We were apparently sitting near one of the managers who was having a VERY inappropriate conversation with someone who obviously did not work there. This managers name was apparently Kristen. She was having a conversation with someone and referred to this place as a place where "N****rs hang out". We all were so appalled that we said something to her and she told us to mind our own business and stay out of her conversation. We saw her talking to servers so on the way out asked who she was and was told she was a manager. We will never come back here and have all been telling people about this no one can believe that was said, especially considering it is in an urban neighborhood. I hope to God that someone who works there sees this because i have tired to get in contact with them to tell them about this but have not been able to.
Great place to meet fellow black panthers while enjoying the fruits of Capitalism in a low-IQ quasi-intellectual atmosphere.
Awful. Overpriced and constantly full of a pretentious crowd. The place used a media blitz to make it seem cool.This is the place you go to if you're a trustfund hipster. It's utter crap.
#Portionswerepetite#emptybutfull#chefchoked#SawARat#unAmused#RudeStaff :/#momentwastoobig#soggynachos#neveragain

Conceptually, I absolutely love this place. From the ambiance, to the mission statement, the bookstore element and selection, as well as the diverse staff working. As a vegan, I'm thrilled at the wide array of options. Unfortunately, however, I've been consistently disappointed with the quality of food (especially whilst considering the price point.) The entrees I've had, like the Polenta and Mediterranean pasta, have consistently been too oily to truly enjoy. The tempeh sandwich was too salty, the vegan chx one was dry as a nun ( or however the saying goes I don't know but I went home and added a glob of my own sauces just so it wouldn't go to waste.) Tuna salad sandwich (v) was okay, not really flavorful but solid texture and made for a light meal... Nothing really to write home about or compel me to come back and try again. And believe me, I've been trying! Something new every time. Have yet to really my clean plate or even take leftovers consistently, which is atypical of me to say THE LEAST (Don't believe the hype of vegan-means-healthy. This vegan likes to throw DOWN.) Anyway, I wrote this review because of how absolutely friggin' AWFUL my service was the last visit. My friend and I are both over five eleven respectively, and were seated at a 2-top corner table was half booth facing window with nothing to bare ones back upon.Okay, I'm young and able bodied, not a deal breaker, but having to sideways scoot your body to be seated while whether making eye or ass contact with the adjacent table is awkward and uncomfortable af to say the LEAST. The drinks we ordered took about 20 minutes to hit the table and were quite underwhelming when they did, in flavor as well as liquor. Our server, "Hollywood" was unironically so curt in both tone and demeanor the entire meal. Being a food service vet myself I try never to take anything personally but I thought perhaps our demographic may have played a role due to the blatant attitude despite us both making a point to be polite and compassionate. I would've gotten another round of drinks but we were both so disappointed with the service that we decided to cut out early. When another table was seated, however, I noticed they too waited exceptionally long to be served and were visibly annoyed-- so much so, another server swung by to check on them. Truthfully, I feel petty even mentioning it but the only time I had a pleasant interaction was once the check came when I asked her how she was feeling and how long she's been working (which she misunderstood and said 4pm, I was trying to see if she was just new.) Anyway, it was nice to see her actually smile and take on a tone that was semi-pleasant and make eye contact for the very first time... this place, and that server, have excellent potential (please just give her some gentle coaching and maybe hire bussers/bar & like runners to help smooth the flow of busy nights) I won't be back for a while though... being the hopeless sentimentalist I am though I'll probably try another location in a few months once the terrible taste in my mouth subsides.

I hate to do this because the manager was so nice. But this review is for the chef. I ordered a salmon salad for pick up and once I got back to work I noticed that my salmon was rare on the inside. I even accidentally ate it. I called and the manager issued me another salmon. When I went to pick it up she told me that the chef cooks all of his salmon RARE unless you request otherwise. First, what?? So he cooks SUSHI when you order salmon. Instead of cooking it medium well he makes it RARE in the middle.. it is despicable. So that is not really the reason for this rating. When I opened the box to eat my new salmon it was charred and dry. So if a customer DOES NOT want to eat RARE salmon for lunch the only option at this location is dry tasteless salmon. He did not even season it well. So customers are punished for sending back rare fish. Teds Bulletin makes normal salmon and I NEVER have to remind them to not make it RARE. What chef doesnt know how to cook salmon? He can only make rare or well done/dry. I am not even a chef and I know how to cook salmon so it is juicy, and cooked all the way. The manager was super sweet and the customer service was incredible! The chef's attempt to over correct or punish me was tacky and petty.
We were next in line and no one waiting and she would not sit us on a 4 top. That sat 3 parties were sat. There were several 4 tops empty and she still would not sit us.Horrible hostess.
Typically really crowed, parking is quite cumbersome and the experience itself is definitely not worth the hoopla.. Honestly there's way better options in the city :-/

Over the holidays my wife and myself decided to go to Washington D.C. from NY to celebrate new years across the street from this place at Eatonville for the Motown New Years Eve Bash. We were told that bus boys and poets is owned by the same people so us having such a great experience at Eatonville we decided to go. What a mistake-- the atmosphere was great service awesome food was awful. The fried chicken is not really fried chicken. My wife is a die hard vegetarian and she almost considered ordering a Big Mac from Mickey D's. The Cauliflower frittata was a combination of bland and hot sick ass. The vegan crab-cake is something that makes me want to go kill and eat a real crab. The Hummus was decent but nothing to write home about it tasted like something that was packaged and served. The nachos were ok i prefer a black bean though and the shrimp cake was under done which even the waitress commented on and sent back. She said that our food looked different than usual.When i spoke to ken or ren or something like that (the Black guy behind the desk- i think he was the manager) he told me that they were short staffed and apologized. He did take the crab cake off the menu which i was not going to pay for anyway. The only reason he did was because i started to get agitated. I understand you're short staffed but does that mean i get half a check?? In other words stick to Eatonville unless your looking for a fun night out of fasting.Note: At Eatonville i bumped into owner which i told entire story to and he said he would get to the bottom of it and call me on Monday BUT that was month ago. Good Job guys - I'm proud of you.
Meh very meh. It's really just an upscale diner with a book store.
Expect a certain level of incompetence from staff.

This seems like the type of place yuppies go who are still scared of black people to try and "experience some real black culture" I mean if I was dating some au undergrad trying to piss her dad off I'd totally take her here and tell her of the black man blight. We could sit and listen to some half tard spit some weak ass poetry and talk about how much we both love kale or some shit. You guys need to start making blooming onions though cause that shit be poppin
Pretentious as fuck, but at least the coffee's strong.
Not so good, but it has a lot of potential

Ok so been here many times but just went there tbe other night and omg the waiting process was beyond not organized...we were a party of 4 and the place is huge and I'm pretty positive they could of sat us several times. But between the hostess forgetting about us several times and tbe chaotic mess we literally waited an hour and 45min... The food was still good and our server was good but the front area was a train wreck...,

I was fan of Busboys and Poets and would say I frequented Saturday and Sunday brunch quite often. Service was right above par. Food, sub-par, but I was most impressed with their attempts to focus on issues such of social justice. *** Love A.C.T.O.R.***I've never met the owner, Andy Shallal, personally but I was very impressed with his vision, until I visited the website tonight and noticed they were opened tomorrow...My first response was "YAY!! If I need to go eat I have a place that will actually take me in", but the more I thought about it, the more it troubled me. How can I support a place thats asking its employees to travel through inclement/dangerous weather? Where's the "justice" in that?I've decided that I will plan to be there tomorrow morning, despite all the hardship, just to see the climate inside. I also hope to see/meet Andy and see if he too is adhering to a policy that would require a kitchen staff, serving staff, and management to open at 9 AM to serve no more than 200 customers that day.We, the customers are important, but so is the staff. Hope for the best for all staff and hope your travels are as safe as possible. Good space for fun and food, but don't believe the hype. Its okay to close for the day. The city of DC is.

I usually never write any reviews. I had to take a visit to take in for myself what Rich the previous reviewer was chatting up. Ugh...crassly commercial? It might be. The food was very good for the price. I was suffering from a major hangover so the mind numbing cheeseball greeting of "peace" made me want to dropkick the all black clad bozo who grinningly wanted to make some sort of statement. Apparently this tomfoolery is standard, albeit self rightous and cloying. Maybe i picked the wrong day? I thought Sunday would be a chill time. Nope.

I don't see the appeal of this place for food and service. The concept and idea behind the establishment is awesome, sure. The thought process of it being an artist, activist, welcome all type of place is absolutely amazing, But food? Ok.. there are options for absolutely every type of diet. But nothing is really done that well. Service is also just mediocre type of "what can i get you?" and ends there. No thrills. So I guess if you are looking for that then go here. Wish the food and service held up to the concept's awesome experience.
The service was not great. Our server was not friendly and had an attitude. I'm not sure I will return again if I'm in town.
Staff is friendly and food is familiar but only DC location, other locations have lost my business!

The place offers a great deal for your money. Do give it a try. Like we 6 friends went in there and we all shared the bill and had enough for ourselves and furthermore the food quality was OK too. And the waiters had us well covered.
It was very loud! I could not hear ladies talking to me!
Regular place. Too noisy, too busy. Food is ok.

Really cool looking place and tons and tons of seating. I came here for breakfast when there was no wait, but I can't imagine you'd ever have to wait long here due to the large amount of tables. But if you do, there's plenty of books to keep you busy.The breakfast was pretty good. Nothing extraordinary, but overall decent. My omelette was tasty and I loved the bread they use for toast (pretty thick) but I couldn't eat the homefries. They were just swimming in oil. I wanted a side of bacon instead of the homefries to begin with, but when I asked, the waiter just shook his head no. I wasn't even given the option to sub it out and still pay full price for the side of bacon, I was just told no. I guess the customer isn't their priority.Just a heads up that this place does do takeout, but apparently not for brunch. I waited for them to open one morning to grab takeout only to find out they don't do it for brunch. So, plan accordingly.

They have free wifi so it's a good place to check emails. I ordered a sweet chai but it was over powered with espresso. The waitress was kind enough to offer to fix it. I then just asked for a dirty chai but that tasted identical with a big dash of cinnamon.
meh
Server is a total loser at the moment. Food is always great. But this server........awful.
Great food and very friendly staff. Highly recommend their Blackened fish sandwich !!

The vegetarian options are pretty great. I was not able to make it to breakfast, but I did have lunch here. I ordered the 'veggie burger,' it was pretty good but rather dry. I definitely would not write home about it. The service is pretty great as well as the atmosphere. It's a good place to wind down and relax. I will definitely come back and try other items from the menu.
Nice grass-fed burger.Mediocre pizza.
Love the atmosphere at this place. The food is ok, nothing to die for. is affordable too. Nice place to chill...
Good atmosphere, place to go for brunch but food is eh
Nothing really wrong but nothing really good either. Crowded unremarkable food
good food. But they can be better.

I like the philosophy of this place, but service there is not perfect. We waited to be seated about 7 minutes at hostess station, because it was nobody there. Also it was really difficult to attract the attention of our waitress sometimes when we wanted to ask her about refills of our drinks or about check.

Although I am always drawn to busboys and poets because of its great location, trendy atmosphere, affordable food, (plus the fact that it is generally an agreeable place amongst friends) I never leave busboys and poets having had the experience I would have hoped for. The wait staff is fairly friendly, but not terribly consistent. Every time I've visited Busboys & Poets there was a wait, unless I've squeezed in at the bar (and I do mean squeeze). Despite all of these minor inconveniences I cannot deny I will surely be back.

A cafe-cum-bookstore-cum-bar-cum-restaurant-cum-performance space. A scaled-up, cleaned-up, and sexed-up Tryst, with much larger spaces (separated areas for each of its parts). The couple of meals I've had there (I had the pizzas) were good, and so was the service. Unfortunately, I did find the whole atmosphere tainted a little by the place looking like it was trying too hard to be cool. For example, all that shiny metal, glass, and black leather covered seating just seemed more appropriate for a mod bar and to clash with the idea of the self-described "progressive" bookstore. Maybe it's my left-coast-defined preferences of cafes, and B&P is not just a cafe...  Don't get me wrong, I think B&P is a good addition to the U St corridor but for a place to gather, I'd prefer somewhere that didn't take itself so seriously.
It was a cozy eclectic space. The service was good. Waiter was attentive and had our preset correct. The food was good. Little more seasoning would go a long way. And make it a 5. In my opinion
