Amazing space. Very unique concept. Food, coffee, and shoes, guys from toki underground have out done themselves. I'll definitely be back and bring a lot of friends. A little confused on where you can and can not eat. When you get here I'm sure they'll have to explain it. Anyway, see you soon

I recently visited Maketto for their weekend Dim Sum brunch experience. All I can say is come hungry, and be prepared to eat some delicious food! I highly recommend doing the Dim Sum brunch, it is an amazing bang for your buck ($38 per person) and we got to try so many different dishes! They also have standard a la carte brunch, but I recommend checking their Instagram to see when the bottomless Dim Sum brunch is being offered. Our favorite dishes included the Maketto Fried Chicken, the Rice Roll with Roast Pork, the Crispy Turnip Cake with XO, and the Ginger Chicken Soup Dumplings. The fried chicken is essential. The seasoning of the crust is unlike any fried chicken I've ever had, and it was so crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The rice roll was so fresh, and I loved the texture of the roast pork with crunchy edges. The brightness of the fresh herbs really completed this dish. The crispy turnip cake was a very unique and interesting texture, almost like mochi. It was addictively good. The broth the soup dumplings were sitting in was perfectly acidic and spicy. I loved the combination of this broth with the classic chicken soup broth inside the dumplings. We also got the pork steamed bao, which was good, but felt a little one note texturally. It was soft braised pork inside a soft bao bun: I would have loved a crunchy element. Lastly, we had the egg custard tart for dessert, which was heavenly. The pie crust exterior was a fun take on a classic dessert! My only complaint with this experience is although we had a reservation, we still had to wait about 20 minutes for our table. Highly recommend Maketto for a unique, delicious Asian fusion meal!
This is definitely an Asian restaurantYour review needs at least 85 characters. Add a

I've been to Maketto multiple times, and I plan to keep going until I've tried the entire menu. It's that good. The best part about the food here is the uniqueness and the pop of fusion flavors you get with each dish. Maketto's Asian fusion cuisine offers a delightful blend of traditional and contemporary tastes that leave a lasting impression.So far, I've sampled a variety of dishes, including the pork bao, fried chicken, crystal shrimp dumplings, wok fried noodles with pork, spicy cauliflower, wok fried yu choy, tofu with spicy basil sauce, and several of their unique drinks. Each visit, I'm impressed by the consistent quality and creativity of the food. This time, I indulged in the fried chicken, dumplings, and fried noodles again--they were exceptional, as always.I highly recommend visiting Maketto with a few friends and trying a variety of dishes, family-style. Sharing multiple dishes allows you to experience the full spectrum of flavors and textures the menu offers. The standout feature of Maketto is the overall menu combined with the trendy and modern interior design. The atmosphere is both inviting and chic, making it a great spot for a casual dinner or a special night out.The service at Maketto is top-notch. The hosts, waiters, busboys, and cooks are all super nice and friendly, contributing to a warm and welcoming dining experience. Their attentiveness and hospitality make every visit pleasant and enjoyable.While these aren't negatives, I do have a couple of tips for improving your visit:1. Parking: Plan for difficult parking as the restaurant is surrounded by neighborhoods and zones where parking is limited. Consider using a ride-sharing service or public transportation if possible.2. Reservations: Reserve your dining time ahead of time to avoid long waits. Maketto is popular, and securing a reservation can make your experience smoother and more enjoyable.If this place were slightly cheaper and closer, I would go every week, no exaggeration. The exceptional food, stylish ambiance, and friendly service make Maketto a standout in the Asian fusion scene. I give Maketto a solid 5/5. It's definitely a must-visit place if you're visiting or anywhere nearby although I also hope they don't blow up more than this so I can keep dining here.

Maketto has become my go-to spot, and for good reason - their consistent quality of food and service is simply unmatched. No matter how many times I've dined here, I'm always impressed by the exceptional experience they deliver.The shrimp dumplings and shrimp fried rice are absolute must-tries - bursting with flavor and expertly prepared. And let's not forget about the drinks - whether I'm in the mood for a latte to start my day or a cocktail to wind down, Maketto delivers with their amazing beverage selection.From the moment you step in, you're greeted with warm hospitality and an inviting atmosphere that sets the tone for a fantastic dining experience. Whether you're a regular like me or it's your first time, Maketto never disappoints.

Everything was welcoming and warm, from the greeting of the host which was genuine and inviting to the friendly service that seemed timed so perfectly. The food was melt in your mouth delicious. It delighted my senses. I wouldn't change a thing!

WOW! One of my favs Asian meal! Caution, this is not authentic, but tastes wonderful. Service was amazing, Maia was incredibly attentive and really fun to talk to, despite busy night. Deserves that top 100 Washingtonian award.Ambiance is a vibe and very chic On to the food, Cambodian pork shoulder is light and had a perfect texture and flavor pork. The Maketto fried chicken might have been the best fried chicken I ever had. The breading and chicken flavor was incredibly flavorful. I was give. Free egg custard because I was celebrating, and it was absolutely delicious. Highly recommend
Absolutely amazing.. Emma was my server she was amazing. I was very pleased with the food and ambiance. I will be back!

I've been to Maketto a few times before the pandemic and it's one of my go-to spots when I want a nice dinner with friends or if I want to impress out-of-town visitors. The food here is top notch and reasonably priced for the quality and portion size. I just want to say, the staff at Maketto have done a truly incredible job with outdoor dining. It's contactless and you order everything from food to to-go boxes by scanning a QR code to minimize contact between guests and staff. The tables are separated out but nobody else was there when I went so we were seated in their heated cabana at a table for 6 (max number for parties as it seems). There were two heat lamps so even on a cold, January night, we were all very warm and able to enjoy our meal outside. The food, as always, was excellent. Get the Cambodian noodle salad, lo mein, or Cambodian style pho as a main and the spring rolls or leek and mushroom baos as an appetizer. The medium sized plates are perfect for one person and you will likely have leftovers, too. The thing about their noodle salad is that the rice noodles don't disintegrate into mush when you take them home as leftovers, which is a HUGE bonus.
The food? Fantastic. The staff? Incredibly kind. The silverware? Missing the knives.
Had a great experience at Maketto today! Every thing that I tried was delicious and was matched with amazing customer service. Not in picture- Maketto Fried Chicken.

My husband and I are the worst at making reservations, and this is one of our favorite go-to restaurants in DC. I appreciate that Maketto has opened up the cafe seating upstairs. We usually end up sitting at the bar. The Spicy Laab over Bone Marrow is a great starter dish, and we always get the Bao Platter. For dessert, I highly recommend the egg custard tart. It's the perfect end to a meal that is not too sweet.
Was not open to this place but my sister took me, and darn it was great.
I love trying different foods this place was excellent.

We had a wonderful birthday brunch. First of all we were running a little late. So I called to let them know. I was expecting push back, bc we all know how dc restaurants can be. But no, it was like running late for brunch at a friends house. They were very gracious and understanding. Service: wonderful. Everyone was kind and personable. Our waitress new details of every item on the menu. Food: let's lead with the French toasts - ridiculousness. I can't really put how good it was into words, you really have to try it yourself. Ditto for the fried chicken, which was juicy on the inside, sweet and spicy on the outside. We also enjoyed lots of other items on the dim sum menu. We ordered one of each of the vegetarian and seafood options. We did not try the pork or beef options bc none of us eat that form of protein.I had a soy latte which was very smooth and no sugar needed which is in my opinion the sign of quality beans and brew. Overall. This is a family friendly restaurant that welcomes and has space for children. We had a wonderful time and I'm looking forward to coming back. .
I love this place. The food is always absolutely stunning. Go, go, go.  It is all fantastic, as are the drinks and service.

I've been hanging out here a lot lately because the creative space is great for meetings, or simply for taking a moment for yourself and forgetting that you're in D.C. during the current status quo. Get the iced matcha with oat milk and if you're feeling sassy, a big slice of the coffee bundt cake (the carrot walnut is insane) or one of the other pastries. They bake everything in house and the flavors are always unexpected and interesting.
i love everything about this place - the tea, the coffee, the food, the atmosphere.
They don't have a big menu but everything is very well prepared. The maketto fry chicken is a must try.
My favorite spot in town! Just visit it, you will understand... make your own experience!
Love the location, very cool. The soup is the best.

Maketto has a great atmosphere! They deliver authentic cuisine with great flavor. I also appreciate the yummy pastries. And to add to the yummy food they also have menswear shop which sells one of a kind pieces. I'll be back soon.
Love the concept of this place. It would be cool to have more in the area like it...maybe a bar/restaurant that women can shop for shoes too
The cold brew is awesome and the matcha lattes are amazing...great ambiance!
I love this place. The food and service are 5 stars. Always have a great time.
This was a wonderful experience. How exciting it was to venture into a great atmosphere where everyone was helpful and delightful. I will always remember this time.
One of the best places in DC. A lot of great vegetarian options and great cocktails.

i really love this place. what the owners did is so amazing. so ZEN and Euphoric, so organic. the ambiance is incomparable to anything else around. It is also the only Cambodian/Taiwanese place that has options with no pork in them. Thank you for that!If you are taking requests, can you please make your own almond milk or maybe hazelnut milk so the lattes can be made even more delicious? The store bought stuff doesn't taste as good and it has Carageenan which is banned in Europe because inflammatory properties.
Love maketto! The food, ambiance and staff are amazing. I'm never disappointed when I'm here.

Americano 5*Macchiato 5*World's most tender Beef Tongue 5*Juicy Fried Chicken 5* (comp from chef Erik, gracias)wagyu tartare 555* ambiance & decor 5555*staffs 55555* hails to you Maketto ... Cheers!!!

I sampled the fare when it was in its infancy stages at the pop up location. I really liked the eclectic offerings at that time and was very interested in seeing what this new space would be like. It's a shared space (retail/light fare/ full service) similar to some spaces I've seen in the bay area and in Europe. Aesthetically it's impressive. I was given the full tour by Dom (the retail manager) and made to feel at home while i waited for both a table and my wife. Upstairs they feature coffee and eclectic magazine and retail choices as well as a dope vending machine that offers odd tchotchkes (it hides around the corner near the walkway to the open space past the coffee bar). The main entry area features a nice selection of attire and footwear and the retail "assistants" serve double duty as greeters and made the environment feel less stressed. We were seated at the bar near the chef and our waiter was very knowledgeable and offered great recommendations. Service was damn near instantaneous and we never wanted for anything. The food was stellar, the kitchen staff was fun and we had a great time. The bill was hefty, but well worth it.

This place is spectacular! I was able to wheel my stroller right inside, and now a fantastic cup of siphon coffee from the coffee bar upstairs. Then I decided to stay for lunch and ordered the Cambodian sandwich, which was divine!!! As I was leaving, I noticed the vending machine in the upstairs courtyard, and was able to pick up some kidrobot toys for my DH, and an iPhone charger for myself- it even takes credit cards! I can't wait to come back to Maketto!
Sat down to order dinner! They said we are out of rice.Enough said! We got up and left.

SUMMARY: fine sushi, prompt service, and expected prices. Worth going back if looking for something in this area but wouldn't seek it out.---FOOD: ordered happy hour salmon avocado roll and the roll with truffle. Could barely taste the truffle though the portions / amount of fish was what I would expect. Can't really tell quality of fish from the rolls, but seemed fine. I would go back and try their sashimi which is my usual go to. Wasn't thrilled with the happy hour prices - not much of a discount though the menu has a lot of optionsDRINKS: didn't order anything but they had a lot of optionsSERVICE: fine - they were prompt and got us what we needed. Nothing particularly special. They didn't interact that much which is fine.ATMOSPHERE: the location is a bit odd to walk into - in a basement and such. Well lit - feels like a typical Japanese american mainstream establishment.

The menu doesn't explicitly state which sushi rolls are raw, and unfortunately, the waitress gave the wrong answer. (Fire Island roll.)Tokyo Ramen broth is very oily. They do a much better job with the vegetable ramen. The Misty Forest roll is especially good for its size.

The food tastes amazing and is very authentic and the sake was executed perfectly! We definitely want to recommend the Tokyo Ramen but then again every single thing we tried was simply delicious!Make sure that you are properly hungry when you visit this restaurant since the portions are generous and you'll regret not being able the side dish, or dessert.
This was a good restaurant! The food is good, service is really good, just giving it 4 stars due to the pricing on things that I feel are over priced. But definitely a good spot to have dinner!
Delicious sushi rolls in DC. Great variety on menu-- we also enjoyed good cocktails too!

I am thoroughly impressed with Toryumon Japanese ramen restaurant. The food is incredibly satisfying, and the service is impeccable. If you're looking to indulge in authentic Japanese ramen, this is the place to be. I wholeheartedly give them a five-star rating because they truly deserve it. Whether you're a local resident or a tourist, make sure to carve out some time to savor the delicious offerings at Toryumon. You won't be disappointed!
Good service, good food. I especially recommend anything with the potato chips add-on. A fun touch
It's the best Japanese restaurant I have ever been to in DC. definitely recommend people coming to this place.
Fresh sushi and amazing new toppings with sushi omakase, definitely recommend to my friends
Great spot. Food was great and service on point. My kids loved this place. You have to check this place out.
Great place with great service!My go to place for my sushi cravings, they also have great lunch specials too!
I want to stay here it was that good. Live the laid back setting and artistic eclectic decor. Staff was good too. Definitely a must try if u love Ramen.
Within seconds of walking in the smells of all the ramen goodness will smack your senses. The food does not disappoint!
That was amazing and the atmosphere was great. If I lives here I would come here once a week..
Amazing food and great customer service. I would recommend this place for lunch and dinner.

I really enjoy Toryumon Japanese house ! They have a great selection, amazing service, and a nice atmosphere. The Ramen was amazing also the sushi. I will definitely come back. And they have happy hours from 4-7pm which is perfect for me. I think I can have drink and appetizer there the entire afternoon after work.
Been waiting for the Opening of Toryumon Japenese House, Great Resturant with a lovely staff and breath taking entrees. Authentic Japenese feel... Definitely will be coming back for more
The place is very nice and the food is amazing. I had some gyosas and sushi and there were great. Also the servers were very friendly! Definitely coming back.
They require masks still which is insane. 1 star and I will never be back.
The staff is apparently anti-napkin. No napkins for you! Not with your drinks, not with your food, no napkins!

Love Archipelago! Tiki bars are so fun! The decor is great. Pineapple of Hospitality and the Banana Daquiri are great. The food is decent. I wouldn't go here specifically for dinner but it's nice for a bite with drinks

What a fun place on 14th! We walked in early on a Friday and were immediately seated. Very whimsical tiki vibe, servers were all great, and the snacks were perfect to tie us over before dinner. The potatoes and smashed cucumbers were wonderful for sharing, and the chicken buns are spicy and so so good!
The water is suspiciously refreshing.
My favorite bar in the district ! True Tiki culture !

Y'all are tripping on acid if you don't like this place. For. Fucking. Real. I'm lying, if you're on acid you'll loose you're goddamn mind here and love it. Tired of the same ol' DC bar scene with the same ol' DC bar people? Well, Archipelago is a breath of fresh air in the heart of DCs best bar district. And when I say fresh I mean damn that PiÃ±a Colada in this hot summer weather is the best thing you'll have. Oh, but you're not into pineapple? Ok, share the Stolen Mercedes with your friends (the drink, don't actually steal a Mercedes -- or do but don't mention my name). Not into sharing? Oh, ok, that's fine, why don't you have a sip of(f) the Retired Stripper? Not drinking tonight just hungry? Awesome, try the best deviled eggs and have your mind blown. Bottom line here is, whether you're looking to relax after work or party hard on the weekend, whether you just want a quick bite before heading home or whether you want to eat 'til you have to unbutton your pants and roll your way back into bed, Archipelago offers the most relaxing atmosphere with amazing music (playing anything from old ska and funk to surf music), delicate and thoughtful decoration that transports you to some alternate Tiki dimension (of course bartenders wearing Hawaiian themed shirts also helps), and various cocktails, drinks and food options. Would highly recommend coming here if you're looking for something different, fun, and an overall unique experience that will leave you (drunk) and wanting more. Ps: I don't know wtf the other reviews are talking about, but the drinks here are strong, so be certain that your money is going to good use.

Unacceptable and Unprofessional ExperienceI was extremely disappointed with my recent visit to Rasika. My group and I were unfairly accused of something we didn't do, and instead of handling the situation professionally, a staff member attempted to intimidate us. What made matters worse was that he physically touched one of the women in our group, which was completely inappropriate and unacceptable.To add to the frustration, the restaurant tried to charge us for two entrÃ©es we never ordered. This level of unprofessionalism is shocking for a place with such a reputation. Instead of resolving the issue with integrity, they escalated the situation and made our experience uncomfortable.I cannot recommend this restaurant to anyone who values respect, professionalism, and proper customer service. I hope management takes these issues seriously and implements better training for their staff.
location: North Virginia Beach, Virginia Beach, VA

text: I visited Rasika with my family, fully expecting to enjoy a delightful meal together. Unfortunately, our experience was far from enjoyable, and I felt compelled to share our experience.Upon arrival, we were in great spirits, eager to indulge in a hearty meal. We ordered Dal Makhani and Chicken Masala, but to our disappointment, the Dal Makhani was overly sugary sweet, and the Chicken Masala had a distinctly stale odor. Not wanting to spoil our family day, we set those aside and opted to order additional items.This is where our troubles truly began. Our server--man in his 50s with a ponytail(likely Javier as per the bill)--exuded an unsettling air of overconfidence from the start. When we asked if he had noted our order, he dismissively assured us that he "remembered everything" and that we shouldn't attempt to "teach him his job." we chose to overlook this rudeness to keep the atmosphere pleasant for our family.As we waited for our additional orders, time dragged on. After 34 minutes, I inquired about the status, and he curtly informed me that they were still preparing our food. An hour and 20 minutes later, I asked again and was met with an equally dismissive remark about the volume of customers they serve daily. Finally, after an excruciating 1 hour and 35 minutes, our second order arrived. During our wait, bussers approached our table multiple times, asking if we were finished so they could clean up, which only added to our frustration.I have never encountered such unprofessional and rude service in any restaurant. The overall quality of food was average, and the lack of hospitality was glaring. It is evident that, despite this restaurant might be serving volume of customers, Rasika has not grasped the fundamental principle of treating customers with respect and primarily the reason for the average food quality and delay in their orders. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. If you value your time and expect a hospitable dining experience, look elsewhere.
Didn't like policy for kids under 8. Totally disgusting. You are not running a club. It's a restaurant behave like a restaurant not like a club! They should not be in restaurants category.

Have been to many Indian Restaurants around the world, but this restaurant had terrible service. Food was only ok. The table we were served at was extremely hot, not a pleasant environment, and when told of the issue, nothing was done. Charged for a drink that they said they had and then when asked where it was, the server said they just ran out, but still charged us for it, plus 20% service fee, but minimal service. Will NOT go back, will NOT take clients, employees, or visitors, and do NOT recommend.

Worst restaurant I have visited in the past 5 years. First tells me kids are not allowed, what restaurant says that kids are not allowed to dine in. There were multiple families with children sitting and dining in while I was there. Their excuse was oh if we had room outside we would sit you down. Then walks my family to a franchise Indian restaurant and says eat here it's the same, while I was parking the car. Who does that, to full of themselves get over it it's just food.Rude on phone, rude in person, and clearly in all the reviews here. If that's how they start the service, means AVOID THIS ESTABLISHMENT AT ALL COSTS!
Horrible food.. no taste at all. Naan is burnt. please don't waste your money

Who tf gave this restaurant a Michelin star? This is along the nastiest Indian food that one can come across! Their food is not edible and I feel bad for the animals that died and were put in these curries! Do yourself a favor and eat homeless persons barf...that might have a bit more flavor than this godforsaken garbage!
they said they were going to eat my butthole

We used to enjoy eating here both in person and takeout consistently before lockdown. That said, we've been surprised by how much the quality of dishes has gone down hill terribly. Over the course of several dishes, they've come half-full, cold or under-seasoned.  Most recently the Dal Mahkini came half-full and with no butter at all.We loved Rasika as the food used to be delicious, and the service consistently attentive and kind. However, those ordering take-out during this time should be warned that the food is inconsistent at best, likely because they are not fully prepared to do the volume of takeout orders they are receiving. For our part, we are done spending this kind of money on food that is sub-par particularly with the great options in town at the moment.
Hands down the Most disgusting Chicken Biryani ever. Even veg Biryani sucked. Shame
Showed up and paid for parking and they said it was closed for a private event, with no sign or anything. Was very disappointed.
Must have hired the dumbest people on the planet who don't know their own menu to do a take out order.

Tuesday Dinner with Guests, dissapointment... Did the kitchen staff get replaced on 2 December with a sub-par staff? There were other tables in the main area seated with two people at a 4-top. However Four well-dressed men pushed to the back of the restaurant. Next to very cute first date couple that were at a rather large table perfect for a party of 6.   My server was watching the bar and everyone else...he was more concerned about everyone else had to wait 36 minutes to order.Every single busboy and server passed us and our water glasses remained empty. I asked it was filled.  Normally the three lamb chops are perfect, spicy and yet three of us ordered the $36 plate and they were not the same as the last visit a few months ago... Did the kitchen staff get replaced on 2 December with a sub-par staff? Almost $400 for a decent meal and horrible service. Apps were perfect...  Makes me wonder why so much staff focus on chatting and laughing with one another while my table and guests were ignored . The Leaders/Staff could take a page from Great American Restaurants "group service" and perhaps the Kitchen would bring on the staff that looks at the quality of food they put out to make sure it not only is warm, but looks nad tastes the same every time...for $36 Entree I actually expect well prepared food... This was not...I've been here several times... Each time it's either hit or miss. Dine at your own risk. Do not bring guest unless you like to be glared at for your choice.
Wow, a lot of you pretentious people still giving this overpriced place 4 stars? It's so obvious a lot of you like to throw a lot of money down the toilet.
Worst indian food I ever tried in my life
Too costly.. Non cooked food. Too less quantity of food.
If it was my choice i would give this place a 0. Worst food I have ever had. Absolutely Disgusting.Will Never go back

one of the worst Experience ! I went to this restaurant on 23 of November night with my fren ! well i found a hair on my rice n stone on the okra masala , n the management is not well enough to handle that kind of classy restaurant ! i wish i could give them a -10 star ! definitely never goin there back again . Just the bad experience

I went to rasika to rasika with 3 other guests. Seated middle of the dining room. as we seated the first thing our waitress asked is do you want a bottle of wine before even asking for water. from there we knew our night is ruined. what a lousy waitress. all she wanted you is to order bottle wine and tasting menu. we been to rasika at least 15 times never had that bad of a experience. she screems 10 feet away to know are we ready and also scream from another table to us about how is everything. she leans over your table and semms like she is so tired and did not have interest serving us. she screamed at a waiter for serving our food right next to our table he did nothing wrong but help serve the food. what a disaster night we had. totally unprofessional what she does in the dining room and also screams at a busboy from our table a la mesa for favor to clean our table. really bad bad horrible night we had at rasika. sorry rasika.
Food - chicken biryani not goodPalak chaat was OKService - was ok and they wanted to get order fast
Disappointed by the food! I had high expectations from this restaurant but was not pleased by the taste at all.

I dined at Rasika and found the food decent but not exceptional. The ambiance was nice, but the service was a bit slow. While it may be worth considering for a pleasant dining experience, those seeking more authentic or flavorful Indian cuisine may want to explore other options.
it's a fine place. but overrated. wouldn't go back.

Meh.I think I ought to preface the whole thing by saying I have to judge the whole experience on value and on that I'm just simply far less than impressed. I'm trying to be understanding here, and a table of five 30 year old guys at 9:45 at night I'm sure the server looked at us and set his expectations low. Had to have, and I'm sure he worked hard on what was a long Saturday night and we were at the end of it but such rote, lackluster, unemotional service I have not seen in a long time. Sure there was nothing WRONG, forks were replaced, waters were refilled, but the bare minimum of motions were went through. 4/5ths of us ordered the coursed menu with wine pairings and we got a light dusting of regurgitated information delivered meekly to one side of the table with each course. But the meal is the more important part right?The appetizer fish was actually delightful. Cooked well, and flavorful. I can't say I understood the wine pairing but it was totally okay. The second course lamb was also very nice, though largely unmemorable. The wine pairing here was actually intriguing, a fresh white, earthy and bright that actually worked well with the dish despite going against conventional pairing ideology and at this point I was quite hopeful for the rest of the meal. But the main was about as drab as you could imagine. 4 portions of different dishes that just felt prepared in a large stock pot and ladled into an ornate serving dish with the seeming intent to beguile someone who prefers facade to substance. A 4 portion dish, with a fair range of flavors, matching with a wine, can certainly be tough, though if done well could certainly take you on a fun journey, but alas the wine smacked of an inexpensive, sulfite ridden red that they got a quantity discount on. The dishes were fine but just felt like little thought was put into them exemplified by one being essentially a vegetable compote bath hiding a large frankly unmanageable and (at this point) vastly overcooked shrimp. The dessert was more of the same, classic, routine, fried dough ball, rice pudding, ice cream with borderline freezer burned fruit rocks lodged in, and a drier than sand lentil cake, again seemingly prepared en masse then plopped on a compartmentalized cafeteria tray. The wine a sickly sweet blend of Sauv Blanc, and apparently the least interesting Chenin I've ever tasted and at this point locking in the theory that the wines were chosen based on a conceived notion of what people wanted to drink and in no way shape or form considered the food at all.It was just an overall uninspired experience. When you have a $150 a head bill and a 20% tip on top of that, sorry, your food and service get judged based on that and I can not in good conscious say either was worth a fraction of that cost. I got nothing that I felt I couldn't get somewhere else and in a world of options I'd just have to recommend literally any other option. Side note the server gave us another table's itemized copy of the bill but I was so done with shy Ben Stein it wasn't even worth tracking him down.
Over hyped...... I've definitely had better Indian food with better service

I don't usually do reviews but I believe people deserve to hear this. I took my wife there for her birthday with really high expectations but we left quite disappointed. I made reservations weeks in advance and got a call two days before asking if I'm ok with a prefixed menu for Mother's Day, if not, they can cancel my reservation. I said okay because I had already planned her birthday in DC around it and didn't think it would be terrible. Very few options in the prefixed menu. We got the palak chaat to start off with. The first couple of bites were good but it got way too heavy and my wife was pretty much full after.For the main course we got tikka masala and lamb achari. Mediocre. There are so many places in the DMV area that serve better tikka masala. Dessert was mango ras malai, rose ice cream, and gulab jaman creme brÃ»lÃ©e. It was good, we both enjoyed the creme brÃ»lÃ©e a lot. The other two were too sweet, but good flavors. Then the waiter came with two champagne glasses to toast my wife a happy birthday, which was really nice of them. However, we told him we don't drink alcohol and he said "Oh ok, well happy birthday" and took it back. Most restaurants would come back with another drink or do a small dessert, but nope. In fact, we would have been more than happy with just a candle in the dessert that came with our meal. So simple. Overall the experience was so not worth the hype. Hype being the keyword, as Rasika tries its best to create hype for their restaurant. It's called psychological manipulation of the mind where the consumer is led to believe this is some exceptional food they are about to experience due to the hype and the mind tricks itself into actually believing they're eating good food. It's also a way for us to rationalize over-priced food. It isn't until you leave the place (maybe even a few days after) that you realize that your mind was tricked. I'm sure they know they are not that unique tasting, and that most of the items can be found at other Indian/Pakistani restaurants which taste authentic and ten times better. I can now see what some of the other reviewers said about Rasika being pretentious and not worth the hype. Save your time and money and please go somewhere else. Two stars instead of one because one-third of the dessert was tasty and the service was overall efficient.
Just get back from it. For sure, not a 4.5 star restaurant. Don't expect too much on it.

After extensive research on multiple websites, I found Rasika to have great ratings for a fine dining Indian experience in the heart of D.C. We were looking forward to a sit-down dinner, but after purchasing last minute tickets to a Broadway show, we realized we might be too late for a full course meal. At 10:45 pm, when our show ended, we called in a phone order for 2 of their Lamb Kathi Rolls, as they closed at 11. Ten minutes later, we arrived to the restaurant and were greeted by the host, who said its not too late for the two of us to have a full service meal if we would like a table. I informed him that I had placed an order for 2 rolls to-go, but would highly appreciate it if we could sit down, and have a full meal, along with our rolls. Unfortunately he said they cannot "unbox" the rolls and serve them to us. I felt this was very unhelpful. Next, I asked for to/go cokes since we were being forced to continue our to-go meal but apparently they didn't have disposable cups. Lastly, as we were leaving, my husband ordered a Sev Puri Chaat, which is just a combination of ingredients thrown into a bowl and mixed together. We kindly requested to leave out the raw mangoes, which the host refused to do, because he said its pre-mixed. That is pretty hard to believe, considering that we are authentic Indians and know that all the ingredients of a "Chaat" are added upon receiving the order, due to sogginess of the "puris."When a restaurant rates as one of the top ten in its city, I would hope the customer service is better than that. I was highly disappointed in their unwillingness to accommodate us after all the great reviews I had read.Moral of the story: small portions, pricey food, bad service.

While the palak chaat is worth talking about, you can't build a restaurant based on one appetizer. I would highly not recommend going to this restaurant if you are a vegetarian. We ordered 3 vegetarian main dishes and they were all lackluster, to say the least: the eggplant was bland

I ate lunch here yesterday with my Indian friend and not only did we pay way too much for this mediocre food we were left wondering why this restaurant gets mentioned as one of the best around????Lets start with the rice - Rubbish/boring/white riceNaan - for $3 I would expect something bigger than 5 bites worthChicken Makani - ok but I'd had better from hole-in-the-wallsLamb Bukara - rubbish !!Tandoori Chicken - Rubbish, over spiced and not cooked throughCome on DC,VA/MD...try out some of the the hidden gems like Ravi Kebab House in Arlington...great indian food that doesn't taste blahhhh and will not cost you too much.(I am in no way affiliated with Ravi Kebab House, I just love their Karai Chicken and kebabs).

After reading and hearing about Rasika from about everyone and everywhere, my colleagues and I wanted to check it out with high expectations on our side. After trying so many times, we finally got a reservation on New Year's Day. Once we arrived, we were seated in the private dining room, excited about the hype about Rasika and its food. We knew what we wanted and were looking forward to order the four course tasting menu however
Good food probably not the best but still the food is good and probably you will go there for a date, not a regular lunch.

Having heard rave reviews about Rasika, an Indian restaurant, we decided to give it a try. Our selections included Palak chaat, biryani, paneer tikka masala, and naan.Palak chaat was an exquisite treat, offering a delightful softness on the palate--a definite must-try.However, the vegetarian biryani didn't quite live up to our expectations

We arrived on time and were seated. The food was ok nothing crazy compared to what i had expected. Drinks and service was the best part of my visit. The saag , the Salmon tikka and panner entree was really bland. I was very excited to try the place but i was really dissaponited with my experience i love their other location the bombay club.
A-OK. When Indian food meets Mass American appeal... nuff said.
Sorry wrog place

Super fancy expensive place so I've only been there once but it was delicious. I had the tasting menu with my wife and another couple and it was a lot of food and it was really good. I don't know anything about Indian food but I will be back to this place for another big occasion.
Yummy !
Still overrated, but service is outstanding. A very well run establishment.
An alligator wearing sunglasses? Now I've seen everything!

Rasika--the food was great, but I have to say based upon the reviews I read, I expected a bit more. I chose this location for my 40th birthday dinner. I was told it was four stars (I believe) and I definitely wanted a upscale restaurant for such an important event. The ambience was just okay and while the food was excellent, the portions were stingy and there wasn't a vast selection. I did return several times after for carryout to get the scallop dish--sorry, don't remember the name--but never have come back for a sitdown meal. I love Indian and while I appreciate the more artistic menu, I still wanted some down-home Indian and I did not get that at Rasika.
Not sure what all the fuss is about....
Food was good if not a little skimpy. Must be the latest place to go... went at lunch time - late lunch and had to sit at the kitchen. Make sure you make a reservation until the popularity dies down

Found this place because we liked the name when we saw it on maps and then saw the amazing reviews. Nice vibe and decor Large variety of classic and newer Indian dishes, and I opted for the tasting menu to try a bit of everything. Fried spinach appetizer and the smoked lentils were the standout dishes for me. The cardamom ice cream was my favorite dessert. The service was attentive, and the waiter explained all the dishes. I would give it four stars, because the portions for the tasting menu could be larger for the price. Overall, it's a good place, but I was still a bit hungry afterwards.

Modern swanky almost lounge atmosphere. Excellent transitional Indian food. Fish was excellent but ordering multiple appetizers is recommended. Especially the spinach. Docking a star because if it's busy they don't seem well organized. Try to go on a weekday when there's not much going on downtown.
Delish! And so accommodating. Our reservations were at the other rasika but they found space for us!
Good place. Interesting take on Indian dishes. Go there for the experience not just the food.
The good and service are very very good however it's very expensive for what you get.

First the Palak Chaat is always amazing! The service is very friendly and efficient, but I was recently disappointed to find that the Lamb Shank is no longer offered at both locations. It was a staple to Rasika. Overall the menu is solid, and the chicken tiki masala is flavorful and rich. Great place for a date night out in DC.
Food was excellent. Even though we did not have a reservation we were sat a the bar with full menu available. Great bar tenders as well.
The food is a little expensive but it tastes amazing and the service was awesome. Thank you!
Every time I come to Rasika I have a pleasant experience. The staff is great, the food is tasty, and the prices are reasonable. I will definitely be coming back again.

Last night I had the surprising pleasure of eating here. I've never been a believer in Indian food, or any other oriental food as a matter of fact. Good thing my friends took me here because they changed my mind for good. I actually liked most of the dishes I tried here, but the award for best dish of the night goes to the dessert. It was a cardamom ice cream, and it tasted out of this world good. It was very creamy and the taste was surprisingly less intense than most of the food I tried that night. 4/5, would come back again for seconds.
The food here is fantastic! Lots of vegan options and great service. Plus amazing cocktails. You have to order the fried spinach. So many people told me this, but I didn't get it until I had it.

It's all about the Chaat Balak here - the crispy fried baby spinach appetizer. WOW. it was soooooo goooood. The secret ingredient must be crack! Anyway, I went to Rasika for the first time today for a restaurant week meal, and was very happy with the service, the food quality, and the ambiance. The entree I got (lamb roganjosh) was very tasty although nothing you couldn't get in another Indian restaurant for a few bucks less. But the desserts were GREAT (the lychee icecream was particularly delicious) and you MUST order the aforementioned spinach appetizer. Be warned--you will be FULL after dining here. I think they also offer a pre-theater prix fixe menu, so consider this place if you are craving upscale Indian food before catching a performance at Woolly Mammoth or the Shakespeare Theater. I will be back to pay full-price here.

Not bad Indian food . Their food is awesome and my friends love it. I had a little bit issue about the serving but that was ok. Rasika can be one of the best Indian cuisine. We have tried other places but this is a place I may go the second time. If you like spices then you got it.
The palak chaat is spectacular! The vegetarian tasting menu is very good. The service is very good.

This place really serves the best Indian food! The curries have a perfect balance of all the ingredients which most Indian restaurant lack.They also serve some street food like vada Pav and chaat. Loved the halibut Goan curry. I cannot forget the awesome taste of the Tandoori Lamb. The service was very good. Overall a very nice experience!
I have heard about this place from my friends many times and I decided to try it. Nice ambiance, great flavors. Will be coming back.
This is a reallllllllllyyyyyyyyyyyyy good restaurant! This is just as good as Olive Garden and I really, really, really like Olive Garden.

1. The service is amazing! I really enjoyed the class, grace, and professionalism I found here at Rasika. I have never seen a group of waiters/waitresses cater to my needs in this fashion in a long time, therefore this was extremely refreshing2. The food was authentic and made spicy to exactly my needs. The proportions could have been a bit bigger based upon the price but the taste of the spices and seasoning made up for it in my opinion. I ordered the Paneer Bhurjee ( cottage cheese with onions and tomatoes and bell peppers) as well as, Tandoori Chicken Tika with a side of Garlic Naan.3. The menu covers all varieties of Indian Food and that diversity is rare to find in Indian Restaurants.
The fried spinach is Killer. We had great service-in fact we let the waitress order. The noise is deafening-eat away from the bar.

Indian food in a fine dining experience... love the bread and crispy spinach. Would recommend to anyone who is tired of the same old Indian food you usually get in strip malls. Only reason it is not 5 stars is because it takes forever to get a reservation on the weekends. The home made nann is amazzzzzing..especially the garlic variety. Highly recommended.

My lunch there was pleasant. I immediately asked the server what the most spicy item on the menu was and she quickly rattled off a few appetizers and entrees. (I like spicy spicy) I ordered two of the mentioned items. Although tasty, it was far from spicy but nonetheless very appetizing. I had the calamari appetizer and the Goa shrimp entree. I will have to say that both items were cooked perfectly-the calamari was tender and not rubbery and the shrimp were large and fresh and perfectly steamed. My colleague ordered chili asparagus and the vegetable stew which she liked very much but again, far from spicy. The service was great - very attentive and unobtrusive. The decor was chic and calming although the bar seemed a bit bleak. I would try this place again but you better bring some cash with ya, it's not cheap. My colleague and I agreed that the food here is a bit "froo-froo" and tailored more for the Washington business crowd. It's not as authentic Indian cuisine as other places but nonetheless delicious.

I am a huge fan of Indian food. I was there over the weekend and the food was just fantastic. Chicken tikka masala and lamb sammi kabob was very good with some naan, chutney and rice. I would definitely recommend it to anyone.
Had a great atmosphere, I would go again.

Superb cuisine in everyway.service was also divine. Cocktail list could've been a little shorter.Took us for ever to decide on a drink and by then we just went to the food menu cause we were so hungry!!
If you want the best Indian food in town, come here

Our second best place in DC was here, pretty solid Chicken Tikka, not as good as seva, but good. The Palak Chaat, Crispy baby spinach / sweet yogurt tamarind / date chutney, was interesting and a good start. overall it was one of the better meals we had.

Simply put, rasika lives up to the hype. Attended a wonderful private party here with an abundance of food and wine at a reasonable price given the quality. Awesome space for a special event with 20ish people. The food was served family style and included all of rasikas most well known dishes. Wonderful evening, great service , cannot wait to go back!
Amazing ambiance by an Indian restaurant standard and good food
Get your reservations early.
The environment is great and the staff is very friendly.
I loved this place for diner, Food was awesome. The staff treated us very well and the services was also very good. I would recommend it for every special occasion.
Had a great dinner. I am a big fan of Indian food so i can tell the dishes i ordered were pretty fusion rather than authentic Indian, but i still enjoyed.will be back and recommend everyone.
ive never really been the kind of person to like indian food. but my buddies wanted to go here for a guys night out and it was actually amazing! the food was incredible and the service was amazing!

Prior to visiting Rasika for the first time, I was a firm believer that it was impossible to eat good Indian food in DC. Most Indian restaurants that I had visited in Bethesda were underwhelming to say the least. After trying the palak chaat , my faith in the DC restaurant scene has been restored. There is hope after all! Every single dish in this establishment is first rate. I will be back and I will bring many with me.
We ate dinner here to celebrate our anniversary and it was absolutely fabulous.
Delicious but difficult to get a table.

Excellent food and service, good ambiance, reasonable price. One of the best Indian restaurants we have been. More expensive than most but worth the price. Certainly a winner. We will come back Rasika!
Meal was very good & Service was fast and friendly.Highly recommended

Very nice place. Delicious food. I'm not an expert on Indian food but everything we had was good. I will be coming back to experience so more of India's food for sure. This was actually my first time eating Indian food but it won't be my last.
One of the best indian restaurant in DC. Great place for holiday lunch and dinners. I've been to a work dinner for about 15 people at semi-private room and we had the set menu which was a great idea.
Very Delicious Indian cuisine!!
outstanding food and service in every way (although it is noisy)
The entire meal was great, and the service was excellent!

Delicious food. I had the wine pairing as well and everything went together well, except for the massive glass of Vermouth that was given with one of the first courses...much to heavy. The fried spinich was amazing! The staff really knows how to make you feel welcome. Over all, one of my favorite places in DC.
Great food...good service...will absolutely return again!!! Palak Chat was amazing.

I'm not a big fan of Indian cuisine, but Ithought that I would give Risika a shot. We ordered palak chaat and were pleasantly surprised. We also ordered the Black Cod. The fish was very fresh and was fantastic. This would've been the most incredible dish if it weren't so spicy. I loved the Palak Chaat as this was my first time trying out this dish. As some others have mentioned it was GREAT, but we thought it was a little too oily. Why did they put so much oil??? Nevertheless it was worth a try and it did taste great.In general, the food and atmosphere was very good, I will definitely be coming back. The portions were a little small for my liking and the prices were a little steep, but overall, we came away happy. The total I paid at the end was what I was expected and it was similar to what other small plates places would have cost me.I felt like the staff there were very courteous and knowledgeable about their food, which added to the positive feeling I received while at the restaurant. I was happy that they brought water, without having to ask for it. Not being used to spicy food, water was definitely necessary!We were glad that we came in the off peak hours before it becomes one of the places where you have to wait for hours to get tables. We definitely would be coming back.

Great everything - ambiance, service, food - but not your typical Indian food - definitely a fusion place. Prices are a little high, but somehow, its still tough to get a reservation. Recession?  What recession?

Loved the restaurant - great fusion style in decor and food - not your authentic Indian food, but great nonetheless. The appetizers are to dei for, and the entrees a little less. Always real busy, so make sure you've made reservations. Great place for a date.
Took some friends from out of town here and loved it! First time I had been here. A totally unique experience. Will go again.
Great food. Very good service. It's a bit loud, but a very enjoyable experience.

I have heard lots of good things about Rasika and have been wanting to try this place out for quite some time now. Finally, having been there, I can say it definitely lives up to its expectations - great, well-spiced, tender tandoori chicken hits the spot and the Palak Chaat is amazing.While it is a little on the pricey side, I'll be returning sometime in the future for sure. Service was great too!
Top notch Indian cuisine for sure. Loved everything about it.
The chicken masala is smoky and delicious.

I wasn't thrilled to try a "new" type of food for me... Indian food. I went with some co-workers because they highly recommended it. I was actually pleasantly surprised. I am not sure what I pictured in my head, but the experience from beginning to end was better than expected. The food and service are great. The wait was a bit lengthy, but it was well worth it.
The chicken green masala was fantastic. The food and ambiance make this the best Indian restaurant in the DC area. Despite some bad reviews, the service was very good. I'll definitely be back.
Fantastic spot and a must try for any DC foodie.
A modern Indian Restaurant! I love this location!
Spinach to die for...

Great service and good food. The green and yellow curry were both very tasty but I prefer the green if I had to choose one over the other. The naan was just right, very chewy and not too doughy. I tried both the traditional and also the garlic flavored naan. I wasn't too thrilled with the garlic since it totally consumed my taste buds, but that could be me.The Tandoori Chicken was sizzling hot on a plate when it came out and was very flavorful. You can taste the many spices in the tender chicken. The only drawback, and the reason I give this only four stars, was the portion was small.
really good

Went here for birthday dinner and the food was amazing We were served by Ahmed who provided us with great service. Definitely will be back.Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

food 10/10 amazingly flavorful, great portions and excellent presentation.service was excellent. I'm never let down when I go. great for date nights, anniversaries and birthdays.It can feel a bit crowded but that comes with the territory with the excellent food. make sure you call for a reservation. not impressed by their west end location

The restaurant offers authentic Indian cuisine with flavorful dishes, quality ingredients, and attentive service. Its warm ambiance features elegant Indian decor, creating an inviting, relaxed atmosphere ideal for both casual dining and special occasions.
Excellent food and the service was amazing. Our server was so knowledgeable and helpful. Thank you
This was the best restaurant I've been to in a long time. The food was amazing, the staff was so great and I loved the atmosphere. Will definitely return.

I recently dined at Rasika and had an exceptional experience. The flavors, presentation, and service were top-notch. The variety of traditional and fusion dishes showcased culinary expertise. Highly recommend trying the [specific dish] and look forward to returning! A must-visit for Indian cuisine enthusiasts! Only wish they had longer happy hours and had them on the weekend!
Sea bass is excellentI will not post less than 85 characters againI will not post less than 85 characters againI will not post less than 85 characters again
Have been multiple times and enjoyed them all Good is always good and do I'd the service

Rasika exceeded our expectations during our anniversary celebration. The service was excellent, and the ambiance was enchanting. From the beautiful glassware to the candlelit tables, everything was elegant. The chicken tikka masala was perfectly cooked and tender, while the palak chaat appetizer was a delightful recommendation from our server. The flavors were light, floral, and expertly balanced. The desserts were not overly sweet and provided a perfect ending to our meal. The attention to detail, including boxing up our leftovers, made it a truly impressive fine dining experience. Whether you're looking to impress someone or enjoy Indian cuisine for the first time, Rasika is the place to go.

Rasika exceeded our expectations during our anniversary celebration. The service was excellent, and the ambiance was enchanting. From the beautiful glassware to the candlelit tables, everything was elegant. The chicken tikka masala was perfectly cooked and tender, while the palak chaat appetizer was a delightful recommendation from our server. The flavors were light, floral, and expertly balanced. The desserts were not overly sweet and provided a perfect ending to our meal. The attention to detail, including boxing up our leftovers, made it a truly impressive fine dining experience. Whether you're looking to impress someone or enjoy Indian cuisine for the first time, Rasika is the place to go.
The food and service is GREAT. I've been 3 times at both locations. I would definitely recommend this place.
Wonderful food and service. Excellent service and location. We hope to get back soon.
Great place and awesome food! Friendly staff.

I am a huge fan of Indian food. I was there over the weekend and the food was just fantastic. Chicken tikka masala and lamb sammi kabob was very good with some naan, chutney and rice. Everything is delicious and cooked so well. Great health scores as well. I highly recommend them.
Always excellent food, never disappointed every time i go.
Very good Indian place I love the place very much very nice place lovely place for ever seen

BEST INDIAN FOOD IN DC!!!! Although not traditional, i love the spin off of classic indian food that the chef here creates. everything is so unique and interesting and i have never been disappointed. only thing i would say is beware when ordering beverages to go/delivery because they forget to put it in almost every time. that being said i mentioned once that they forgot to give me a salted lassi the time before so they gave me one for free. great customer service!
Rasika has extraordinary service and food. Not your typical Indian fare but truly excellent. The atmosphere and service are also upscale so it feels like a treat in every way.

I'm a picky eater and usually eat steak and burgers. I was visiting friends in DC and they wanted Indian so I said what the heck. I was always hesitant to try Indian food more because I didn't know what to expect. I have been missing out. The food is great. My favorite has to be the vindaloo. Wow it is so good. The naan is so fresh. When I get back to Dallas, I'm going to have to try some more Indian.

We've been hearing such good things about this place and when we finally got around to trying it, we were disappointed. We got take-out so we did not experience the excellent...q qqants US. The wait staff are friendly, knowledgeable and helpful and the cuisine is delicious. I particularly love their biryani--lamb or chicken. They also have wonderful cocktails and wines.You'll love it here in a stylish atmosphere with great food and service!

For appetizers, the ordered the Palak Chaat and Mango Shrimp. This is my second time having the Palak Chaat and it was even better than the first time. The spinach is just so crisp and mixed with the tomatoes, toppings, and sauces creates the perfect balance of textures and flavors. The Mango Shrimp was also delicious. It was cooked perfectly and the green sauce really complimented it, however I didn't get too much of a mango flavor.For entrees, we got the Mixed Grill and the Chicken Makhani along with garlic & herb and truffle naan. Highly recommend the Mixed Grill if you want a little taste of all the proteins. Although it doesn't look like much (one piece of salmon, 2 prices of chicken, 1 lamb kabob, and basmati rice), it is actually very filling. Although all the meats were seasoned very well and cooked perfectly, the lamb kabob was my favorite. The Chicken Makhani was also so delicious. I usually don't go for butter chicken (my friend wanted to order it as our second dish) because I don't love super buttery dishes, but it was delicious. The curry is the perfect consistency to absorb into the basmati rice for a perfect curry bite. The chicken was so so tender and flavorful - I think I enjoyed this chicken more than the tandoori chicken in the Mixed Grill.

The food seemed to be of great quality, and the portion size was generous. The best Indian food I've had in MD. I always get their chicken tikka masala, and my wife gets the palak chaat. I ask for cauliflower bezule, and they make it perfect. Everything is delicious and cooked so well. Great health scores as well. I highly recommend them.
Always a great meal! I love to go here for special occasions, as it is a little pricey. But it's totally worth it! Highly recommend. I've gone during COVID too and felt safe. Yum!

Ok, I enjoyed the service right now. This is the best shop I have ever seen before. Food is so good It's so delicious and enjoyable. Definitely come back here. I have no questions at all about it. A lot of them are nice to me, and I was so glad that I found them. Five star ratings!

This is the best shop I've ever seen. The Foods are very wonderful, the way they cooked is just right. I'm going to order you to share it with my friends again. We've had a very good experience. Both of the staff are very competent and hard at work. It is highly recommended!
Very good food and service. The appetizers were unique and the selection were plentiful

For the first time, at that restaurant. For an incredibly good late breakfast cooked for me to enjoy my breakfast so much, we stopped here! One of my favorite restaurants in DC has always been Rasika. Best Location Ever!
A typical food but it's great, thanks!
The place is worth it to visit they have great service!
The next time I'm in town, I 'd probably go there. The food was nice and the prices here are cheap, the workers were friendly. Wonderfully recommended!

If you're trying to enjoy yourself a little in the COVID era, look at Rasika for sure. Getting here for the first time! I loved the food really, the price might seem high for lunch at a glance, but the quality and portion of the food lived up to its price.

The food was terrific and the restaurant prices were good for the week. The service was great and the place was well managed with precautions taken to prevent covid from spreading. The queue was long, but it was worth it. I can see that it was great here. The food they had was great. So delicious, man. It's a pretty new product. It is highly recommended.

We stopped here for a short lunch on our way to the White House, and we enjoyed it! If you're trying to enjoy yourself a little bit back in the days of COVID, certainly look at Rasika. It is highly recommended
I love all the dishes and the sauces are on point. Excellent service.
BEST crispy spinach salad and cod!!!
perfect dine in experience. perfect food :) i would definitely try this place if i were you. we used to go there ( pre covid) at least once a month.

I'm a new Yelper and I confess this is very fun!I love this restaurant. My husband and I eat here each and every time there is DC restaurant week and we love it.I order the same thing each time though..I've got to work on experimenting lol.I definitely give Rasika and home run 5/5.
Amazing food and great service. Sam is the best bartender!
One of my absolute favorites in DC. Just so good.
Great food and excellent service.
Excellent restaurant, service was over the top! Our server went above and beyond and I couldn't have had a better time! Can't wait to be back.
Fancy Indian food but also has the basics like chicken tikka masala. The food is expensive, it is difficult to get a reservation but it is worth it, best Indian food in the city that I have had.

This place is so great! i've heard about this place for along time, and i didn't regret coming here!The food was amazing. i really enjoyed every bite that i made :) "Great atmosphere and service too! thanks guys thumbs up to the owner and staffs!
Very nice place really good Im so surprised and also this is very nice. I cant belive this I an so surpiee this is the best ever I cant wait to go again

I have been to Rasika for lunch and thought my husband would love it. We had an early dinner reservation the other day. The service and timing of courses was great. The staff were pleasant and not instrusive. It is a nice looking restaurant with comfortbale seats at the bar.The food - was also top notch. I'm not a huge fan of indian food and my husband is. This restaurant was perfect as we both had wonderful options and I was able to order an Indian entree. I'd recommend going to Rasika when it is not so busy. Its in a bustling and terrific and fun neighborhood.

I've been to this place 3 times now and love it more each time. Rasika is the only indian food i've ever eaten, so i certainly can't attest to its authenticity, but it's been great each time and I find myself craving it all the time now!The restaurant has great decor and fantastic service. Plus it's not as loud as most other DC Restaurants. If you're into Indian food, definitely check Rasika out. You won't regret it.

Had to make a reservation a month in advance, which made me think this place must be really good. Its outstanding... probably the best indian food i have had in my life. The kale starter is amazing. Sorry i don't recall the actual name of it.
The food here is fantastic! A lot of options for vegetarians and excellent service. Plus amazing cocktails. I strongly recommend to all.

Palak chaat was so good for the appetizer good thing I read the reviews haha! Me & my girls enjoyed our stay here, the food was great, the service was awesome & the restaurant it self is very cute & calm... they should add calming indian music & it would be complete other then that loved everything & definitely will be coming back here & this time I'll try their deserts! And also I recommend this restaurant if you love indian food this is the place to go!

Rasika is one of the best restaurants in the D.C. area period. It is outstanding food at fairly high prices. Rasika is Indian food like you have probably not had it... Complex flavors and served in almost tapas sized portions. The flash fried baby spinach is a can't miss appetizer and the lamb chops are out of this world. Great wine list, great service. It is a fun, delicious experience.

The food here is fantastic! Lots of vegan options and great service. Plus amazing cocktails. You have to order the fried spinach. So many people told me this, but I didn't get it until I had it. It's like spinach turned into chips and full of flavor.

We had lunch here yesterday, this place was packed. We didn't call for a reservation and just walked in, was seated within minutes by the chef's table where we got to watch his cooking. Lovely ambience, friendly staff, and awesome authentic Indian food. Ordered Chicken Green Masala with Basmati rice, Salmon, Pepper Crab, Goat cheese kulcha, Naan and Carrot Halwa with Cardomom ice cream for dessert. Everything was good, my favorite was the Goat cheese kulcha. I devoured that within seconds.This place is a must try while in DC.
Amazing food! Amazing service! Amazing decor! I loved everything about it! Definitely 5 stars
Love this place. Always top of list when visiting DC.

Rasika serves Indian food with a twist that transforms it into something very exotic (I am of Indian origin and cook and eat Indian food all the time). Small plates of takes on Indian themes, and something different each time one goes there. The cocktails are very different and have Indian names that are more exotic than your standard Manhattan or Cosmo or Gin and Tonic.Rasika has valet parking. Getting a reservation is not easy and you may have to book well in advance to get a table - especially for a Friday evening! The service is very refined and this is a place that one goes to for special occasions.
Amazing meal!! Reminds me of Star of India in London, but better. Will return!!
Hands down this place may be one of the best places we have been! Our waiter Ahmed recommended dishes and it was perfect! We will be back!
you will not regret eating here!
Great food and atmosphere with good wine list. The tasting menu is something special. Book in advance as it is really hard to get into!!
Everything was delicious! Great service. Fantastic cocktails. I can see why tables here are in high demand.
Amazing food! Amazing staff! Amazing ambiance! Will go back for sure.. when I have a couple hundred dollars to drop.
yum
A real restaurant. Thank you, Rasika.
Overall experience, love this place. I recommend give it a try!
This was a wonderful experience. How exciting it was to venture into a great atmosphere where everyone was helpful and delightful. I will always remember this time.
Amazing amazing food! I loved everything I ate.
As good as it gets. It's the spinach appetizer. I fantasize about it.
Fried spinach? Yes please. This is a top 3 spot in town. Go!
The Best Indian food I have ever had. Worth the wait.

I LOVE THEIR CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA. It's heavenly. Although they dont give you a lot of rice, it's honestly still worth coming here. My friend is not a fan of curry but we came here for a birthday get together...it's a bit pricy but I love it. Probably my favorite curry restaurant ever.
Better than the best in London. So good, I had my wedding rehearsal dinner there.

Although we were a bunch of foot store tourists with lots of little kids who had just been kicked out of the national gallery at closing time, they squeezed us in a private dining room because they didn't have any reservations for the room until a little later that evening. The food was delicious. The service was superb, especially considering the fact that they were serving four grown-ups and seven children. It is reasonably priced for a nice dinner

Goodness! This place is absolutely phenomenal! If you need to satisfy your cravings for Indian food this is the spot to do it at!It is a bit pricey for the portions but the quality is extremely high! The flavors you will experience is on another level! We had this amazing flash fired spinach , paneer, chicken tikka, scallops, crab cakes, and fire roasted lentil all of which are amazing!The cocktails were amazing as well!I'm definitely coming back here and I definitely recommend to check this place out if you have the chance!
Excellent in a word! Went there for my anniversary and had a perfect meal.

One of our favorite places for a special occasion or date. It's hard to get a reservation if you just have a craving, you really have to plan ahead. And it's definitely on the pricey side, but the food is soooo good, I haven't had other Indian food like it. Would definitely recommend it. I'm craving it now just writing about it haha
Perfect everytime. Delicious food. Excellent servers.
Food was delicious Service was nailed up to the mark Best tandoori salmon I ever had in my life Had a wonderful time with frd,Good place to hangout with friends and family
Best Indian food EVER. Great service too. Amazing.
Best food I have had in 25 years. 'Nough said.

So I've now been to Rasika twice now. The first time I was blown away by the appetizers and found our entrees to be pretty ordinary. This time? The two appetizers we got (palak chaat of course along with an egg plant dish) were once again excellent. As for the entrees? We went with tandoori salmon and rajsthani lamb curry. Thankfully they too were excellent. The salmon was perfectly done and the sauce went very well with the fish. My only gripe with Rasika this time was the cocktail options. Too many of them were gin based. It is the one alcohol I really don't like, so it was a little frustrating to have only 2 other options. Of course the restaurant has an extensive wine list and respectable beers, so I realize I am being rather petty and anal. Overall a fantastic restaurant. I am sure I will be back again some day.
Amazing flavors/variety
The best Indian food I have had in awhile. Loved the Palak Chaat, Chicken Kebabs, Lamb Biryani & Chicken Tikka Masala. The service is great! Was in DC for work and ate both nights at Rasika.
This is my all time, undefeated indian restaurant. Parvez is my favorite server and the food is a pleasurable experience that you won't forget, hail to the palak chaat!
Go to place every time we visit. Everything is amazing!!! We always get the chefs tasting.
Hands down my favorite restaurants in Washington D.C.!
My wife and I love this restaurant!!! It's delicious!!
#1 in USA!

Had the chicken tikka masala, green curry with chicken and cauliflower dish.The chicken tikka was a bit spicy and the green curry was extremely spicy. The cauliflower was my favorite just because it is lighter. It was well cooked, but not too mushy.Their naan was pretty normal, do not remember anything particularly interesting about it. I liked the mango lassi. It was a bit tart and tasted like real yogurt, not too sweet.We were able to find a seat at the bar, but the place was completely booked for dinner so best make a reservation
love this place one of my favorite places to eat
ONE WORD- AMAZING !!!!Great service and the spinach appetizer is the way to go-- enjoy :) I will be returning !

Ive never really been a huge fan of indian food but my girlfriend brought me here and i have to say this has definetly changed my mind about indian food! the food was delicious and so tastefull! i will be coming back very soon!
Reviewed wrong restaurant
Outstanding indian food and service

Finally got around to going here and it was everything I hoped for and more!!! Delicious food, knowledgeable and attentive staff and beautiful atmosphere. No wonder Sietsema seems to always include this place as one of his favorites. I left here with a smile on my face

Pricy, but fantastic.  Highly recommend the most popular recommended appetizers, dishes, and dessert!  Highly recommend the crispy spinach salad type dish for an appetizer, even if you don't plan to get one.  Amazing.
Still awesome!!Wonderful dinner - love it
Crispy spinach ... Enough said.
Among my favorite restaurants in DC
always delicious!!
Best food, best value, ever!
Awesome food, service and presentation.
Amazing!
Food: PerfectPresentation: PerfectService: Perfect
great food!!!!
The food of that restaurant was very good . I love that restaurant . The staff of that restaurant was very nice .I appreciate the sprite of the staff of that restaurant . I like that stuff.
best service!!! best food!!! I had so much fun with my boyfriend!!
seriously......by far the best indian food i have had in dc
Appetizers!
Excellent food and service will recommend to all my friends go there its great.
I do not like Indian food, but I LOVE Rasika. The service was excellent and it was a culinary adventure!
Everything was delicious. You really can't go wrong.

This is the best Indian food in DC, no question. If you have a chance to stop by, do it, you wont be disappointed. The naan is amazing, and the chicken tikka masala is to die for. I recommend this place to all of my friends, it's that good.

This has to be THE BEST Indian restaurant I ever tried. Absolutely awesome decor, clean enviroment, friendly staff and the food simply out of this world.I tried many many varieties in my various visits and food always without failrocks. My personal fav are Gobhi Mattar, palak chaat, seekh kabab.Tip: Open table best for reserving your seats ahead..
Awesome.
Simply Amazing..... From Service to Food to Ambiance.... Top 5 in the City!

So I wanted to see how this five star restaurant staked up against the actual Indian restaurants that I was eating at during my recent trip to New Delhi. For me it blew away every Indian restaurant that I actually ate at in India. I don't actually know if that's a good thing or a bad thing. Well for me it's a great thing because I didn't much like the food I had in New Delhi where as I absolutely loved everything I ate here and the service was definitely second to none. The food was actually much lighter than the same dishes I had in India which I was also thankful for. I remember every time I ate in New Delhi I would feel lousy for hours after because the meals were just so heavy and buttery. I did not have the same experience here. Great place to go.
Get the Palak Chaat. 'nuff said!
great food
I will absolutely make out with anyone that brings me here on a date.
Deep fried spinach is a must. Make reservations.
Yummy been back twice now.
I have only 2 words:Amazing Food :)
I have been here several times. The food is truly inspired and the waitstaff are friendly.
Tasting menu - one of the best meals I've ever had.
This place was perfect. From the food to the drinks to the service.
amazing.

Rasika is the place to go for contemporary Indian cuisine. This is the best Indian food I have ever had and probably ever will have! The menu offers a delicious array of food that is filled with exotic spices. The decor is modern and the atmosphere is pleasant for an evening dinner. For an appetizer, I recommend the kadi patte ke scallops and the chicken tikka masala for an entrÃ©e. The overall experience was delightful and I will definitely be back!
So good when it hits your lips...so good
Best Indian I've ever had, great atmosphere, and excellent service
Best Indian food ever.

Food is excellent here. I had the Palak Chaat, which was crispy and juicy, and the Chicken makhani, which was spicy and moist. They were both prepared very well. The Naan was very good, too.Prices are high but the food is very good. You need reservations. The first time I came we did not have them, and I was not able to get in.
Excellent food here. I had the Palak Chaat and the Chicken Makhani. The Naan was excellent, too. Service is very good, too. Definitely worth checking out.
Great place.  Thoroughly enjoyed my meal there last week.

One of the best restaurants in DC. The food is amazing! I was craving the food the next day. The palaak is absolutely delicious. The service was really good as well. All of our needs were anticipated and the server was very professional and courteous. I will definitely be back!

Palak Chaat....AMAZING!!! I love the fish wrapped in the banana leaf, garlic naan and practically anything on the menu. You have to enjoy a mango cosmo with the rich and spicy food to enhance the food explosion experience!

Great Indian food, modern hip decor, good wine selection. It was definitely the best upscale indian food I've ever had, although I can't compare it to the simple, clear, straight forward, cheap, and delicious dishes I get in Pittsburgh.

Two words: orgasmic explosion. I have tried a lot of indian food all over the country and this was by far the best food (had chicken tikka) and venue I have seen. I would write a verbose review but none is needed. What you need to know is go there. Get friends, make reservations, and GO. NOW. You're still here??

AMAZING! The best Indian restaurant in DC! Not the cheapest but so  worth it! The Palak Chaat, the lamb chops, the Basmati rice with chicken... All fanstastic! The staff is always nice and helpful! Excellent decor and the ambiance is perfect.
Best indian restaurant in long time. Service was superb
