Outstanding service!!! Delicious food!!! Unique experience!!!
It's very nice inside. The best restaurant in CT.

Some of the best Indian food I've ever had!! A friend and I decided to try the 2 tasting menus and split everything. That was well worth it!!! There was plenty of food and everything was fantastic. The nan was perfectly cooked and the lamb curry was absolutely divine. Our server was very attentive and she knew the menu like the back of her hand. She even recommended a wine that went beautifully with most of the dishes we had. I highly recommend this place and will definitely be back.
Best. Restaurant. On. The. Planet.Went back and will keep returning, again and again. [See my reviews below.]
Absolutely wonderful amazing great awesome food!!!!

Nice place with a very friendly staff. From the moment we stepped inside till the minute we left we felt welcomed. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and gladly answered all the questions we had and (oh, believe me!) we had a lot as it was the first time we've been to an Indian restaurant. We didn't have to wait long till our food was ready. We were also recommended to taste their deserts. I had Chocolate Samosa and my husband ordered Mango Kulfi, both of them were great.Our working days are usually crazy and we value these times when we can rest from the usual busy life. Rasika was the place worthy to visit on one of our rare days off. Thanks a lot to all the team of Rasika restaurant!
This place is the best.

I have never been to India, never enjoyed needlessly spicy foods, or seating. Rasika is none of these.It is an amazing venue with crafted cocktails, inventive menu items, and a bustling inside. We have had the palak chaat (i know, everyone has), sea bass in a banana leaf, lamb dishes and chicken dishes (masalas, grilled). The black cod really is as good as mentioned and so flavorful. (anise, butter, rich)The sides are almost better than the main courses- cauliflower is great (sweet peas with a light curry). The scallops are wonderful and are perfectly cooked in a light creamy, spicy sauce. If you cant sit in the dining room wait and eat the bar or at least grab a lounge seat. Service is always good, but you might have to shout over the dull roar of other happy diners.
have been there twice, and the food and the service are so good, I cannot wait to go back! Prices are reasonable too, for what you get!
AMAZING Indian food! Amazing Service! Can't wait to go back !
Great Vegetarian restaurant. Atmosphere is fun too!

One of my favorites in DC. Fantastic Indian restaurant. The Goat cheese Naan is to die for, and all of the chutneys were fantastic. Service was very attentive and concerned if we did eat everything (they genuinely thought we didn't enjoy it). But we did. I had the chicken Makhani as my entree and it was widely regarded as the best meal at the table. By the end of our lunch I was passing my bowl around for everyone to dip in. It was that good. The ice tea is a special "Star of Africa" tea that they bring in from Teaism. Most at our table loved it, but one sent it back and asked for a coke. An acquired taste perhaps? The only negative was the Chai afterwards. It was very mild and seemingly made with skim milk (a big mistake in my books). Otherwise it was a fantastic lunch and certainly one of my top 5 places to eat in DC.
The best Indian food experience you can find in the area besides actually going to INdia yourself.
This place makes me proud to be Indian
Best Indian food in the city! I heart this place.
I love Rasika too much to review it. It would be like reviewing my mother.

I have dined here about 25 times since they first opened. High quality and consistent quality each and every time. Kind staff, and an inventive cocktail list and menu that changes at a refreshing pace. There is always something new to try. The space itself, gorgeous.

One of the best and creative restaurants in the dmv, where their own interpretations of Mexican ingredientes comes in dishes as a fusion with another technique of cooking and cuisines.  Short rib was tender and yummy , cocktails are stars on their own here.  A little expensive, don't expect Tex Mex oversized dishes here , everything look well plated and appealing to the eye, and taste like scratch kitchen . The quesadilla it's small with a big boom of flavors of cheese and sesame oil sauce and mushrooms. We'll try it by yourself, next time I'll eat the Pescado (fish) . Heard was fresh and tasty and light!
fantastic ambiance and really creative food! the quesadilla is the best in dc

Destino, a Mexican-inspired restaurant located within the La Cosecha Market, is easily a 5-star review. The ambiance at Destino was really great - the market itself is a vibrant and exciting place, with frequent events and a wide variety of Latin American food stalls. While there is seating inside the restaurant, I would recommend enjoying Destino on a fall or summer day from the patio, where there are plenty of tables and umbrellas.The food at Destino was truly outstanding. The ceviche was a beautiful beet-red color and was absolutely delicious. The duck breast, braised in a prickly-pear gastrique, was also a standout. In addition, the desserts at Destino are not to be missed. The churro with fluffy sweet coconut and passionfruit cream was heavenly, and the ancho con chocolate chile - a chocolate dessert with the texture of a lava cake and the punch of smoky ancho chile - was truly unique and delicious.Overall, I had one of the best dinners I have had in this city at Destino. The ambiance was great, the food was outstanding, and the service was excellent. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a truly memorable dining experience.
Jose was awesome, great drinks and good food. Highly recommend!

I recently dined at Restaurant Espita and while the food was good, the poor customer service left me disappointed. I have a medical condition that prevents me from drinking cold drinks, so when my friends and I all ordered Orchatas, I requested mine without ice. However, while everyone else was served a large glass of the drink, I was given a small cup that was only half-filled.I felt like it was a joke to try and avoid wasting space that ice cubes take up in a regular glass. It was only enough for two sips, which left me feeling disappointed and frustrated. As someone with a medical condition, I expect restaurants to be accommodating and take my needs into consideration.Unfortunately, the poor customer service in not properly accommodating my request left a negative impression on me, and I have no plans to return as a customer. While the food was good, the lack of consideration for my needs overshadowed the positive dining experience.In conclusion, while I enjoyed the food at Restaurant Espita, the poor customer service and lack of proper accommodation of my needs left a negative impression, and I would not recommend the restaurant to others.
Went here for lunch and I was disappointed. Very over priced and the food was neither good nor enough.

Bizarrely terrible service. First, our food came a good 10 minutes before our drinks. Ok - maybe the bar is running a little slow. But then the waitress brought the check without prompting while our plates were still full and our (very late) drinks were barely touched, and then kept agitatedly circling to see if we had left a card yet. It was like they absolutely couldn't wait for us to leave - which was strange, because the place was almost entirely empty. The food was fine but we won't be back - since clearly we weren't welcome for some reason.

It's a shame that I have to spend time writing this review after too much time was already wasted at this restaurant. First impressions were quickly overwritten by our table not being ready until 15 minutes after our Sunday 12:00pm reservation, and drinks not being served ten minutes after being ordered. When we finally were able to place our food order from their limited brunch menu, instead of poached eggs I requested that my eggs be cooked scrambled. To you and me, this is an easier, quicker, and more fault-proof way of preparing eggs. When our food was brought out, my eggs were poached. I don't eat soft or runny eggs. Personal preference which I'm entitled to have as a patron. When I asked that my plate be taken back and the dish prepared with scrambled eggs, our waiter proceeded to tell me that they don't have scrambled eggs. This led me to believe that there was a language barrier between the waiter and I. I don't blame the waiter for not understanding my request, as I've spent plenty of time abroad and have experienced language barriers. However, to tell me that they don't have scrambled eggs, when eggs were sitting in front of me, I was a little confused. If the waiter didn't understand my request when putting in my order, he should have asked me, or another member of his team what I had meant instead of ignoring my request and letting the dish be prepared and served. He then left and gave me a thumbs up from across the restaurant, to me, indicating he understood my request and a new plate would be prepared. 15 minutes go by and I'm presented a plate of scrambled eggs next to my original dish. I asked to speak to the manager. The manager came and I told them I simply wanted my dish prepared with scrambled eggs. He told me he would like to have the dish prepared the way I like it, which I obliged to. 20 minutes go by, no dish. I got the attention of the manager and requested the check. I left without eating. I didn't want a comped meal, or comped items that my table had ordered. I wanted my dish prepared the way I requested, and when it wasn't prepared correctly, replaced timely. I don't have problems at restaurants. I don't send food back under many circumstance and I am happy to present references that will testify to this. But scrambled eggs, come on.

After trying this place over 12 times, it just keeps getting worse. Service is nice, but understaffed and constantly frustrated. Portions are small but the food is good. The menu never changes significantly, and is getting somewhat boring. It's unclear why there is always a 45+ minute wait for a table at this place.
The tacos were expensive, too small, and not very tasty.
Cool vibe and decor. Average food that costs A LOT.

Bar posing as a restaurant....incredibly loud, slow service. Food was really just okay. Then again I have eaten at some amazing places in Mexico and in new York where I think the owners are from. Overall better for a bar than a night out.

We had a lovely dinner here for a celebratory night out, the service was great and the food excellent. Loads of vegetarian options. The cocktails are all tasty. We over ordered - the large plates are large! The salads are really yum.
I absolutely love the cocktails, and the bartenders are extremely knowledgeable. The ambiance is lovely, which is always a plus.
Very tasty Mezcal cocktails and equally yummy dishes. The owner Ace, went out of his way to check on me while I was there and the staff was friendly and attentive. I'll be sure to return!
The food is delicious and the Mezcal experience is great.
Although our busy bartender/waitress could have been a bit more attentive, we enjoyed our mole, tacos, and ceviche. The Vago Elote mezcal was amazing.
Got to visit the day before they closed. The food and drinks are always good. Plus the service is always fast and accommodating. Will miss the good times and food.

It's easy to see why this Oaxacan watering hole in South Shaw (SoSha?) is constantly buzzing. Mezcal seekers lining the bar to size up the freshest selection this side of In Situ, patio patrons sipping on the best happy hour margaritas in town, and an incredible combo menu featuring authentic Oaxacan cuisine alongside the hottest new pop-up kitchen in the country. Pro Tip- Get here early for secret cocktail specials
Very good chicken and waffles and mezcal selection. Good music and atmosphere and the service is excellent.

We came to celebrate my mother's in law birthday and man oh man! The food was beyond delicious and the staff very friendly. The outdoor seating was awesome even though it was 30 degrees outside we couldn't even feel it because they're very well equipped with heaters. What I liked the most besides the food and accommodations is that you can order through the online menu and pay online. Once we put the order in, it didn't take more than 10 minutes to get our food served. Nice restaurant and we will definitely come back!

You know how there is that one food that no matter when you have it it absolutely hits home and tastes delicious. Well for me that's tacos al pastor. And let me tell you, at Espitas they do it right. Their balance between the sweetness of the pineapple and savoriness of the tortilla and meat is uncanny. Instant flavor explosion among the first bite and the venue has a great modern vibe to it. I couldn't be happier, I got a new taco spot!
Great place!!! Mike our waiter was AMAZING!!! He was great and attentive!! The food was amazing as well!!!

When it comes to Mezcalerias north of the Rio Grande, Espita riendas supremas.Here lives authentic Oaxacan mole, hand ground masa, and the most extensive mezcal collection assembled this side of the TSA at Houston airport, all presented by a passionate and knowledgeable staff that believes in what they do and what they serve.You would be hard pressed to find a finer tortilla or copita anywhere on the East Coast, and surely none presented with more love than from the hands of the staff at Espita. I highly recommend you go here and connect with a real person.
Wonderful Oaxacan fare in the heart of our nation's capital. Five star experience!Looking forward to returning!

Great awesome place! I had the best place of my life! Came here recently, i was kinda excited cause I didn't know any of the things that the menu was offering so I knew it was going to be an adventure and because it was typically stuff i would never order but i was fortunate enough to be able to have most of the food on the menu and it was all incredible. I HATE seafood with a passion yet i can honestly say their fish tacos were amazing and my favorite item on the menu, the drinks were all amazing. I would definitely come here again and recommend it to anyone looking to have some amazing food. The staff was also really great, very knowledgeable, gave great recommendations and made the entire experience better.

By far my favorite place to eat in DC! The food there is to die for. My mouth was watering when I saw the waiter coming out with the main dish. The decor is mesmerizing as well. The waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and even brought me a special vegan menu at the start of the meal. Highly recommend it!

I used to live just a block away from Espita and it's the only part of living in DC that I miss. This place really exceeds every expectation I have of a high end Oaxaca style restaurant. Everything from the most knowledgeable bartenders and excessive selection of Mezcal to the assortment of fresh and authentic salsas that they make. You just can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Always made fresh and always changing. Solid value for the amount of effort and quality of product that you get. What my wife and I do is order a salsa & guac & ceveiche then share a Mole and a side of veggie (Elote is killer when available). The Mayahuel goes down so easy, be careful!

Espita's bar staff is among the most thoughtful, creative, and welcoming you're likely to find anywhere. Their kitchen does everything the hard way, and the results show. Definitely, definitely go check it out.
Love Espita not only for the exceptionally delicious (and beautiful) food and drinks but also for genuinely supporting local farms and sourcing locally! Thank you Espita!

My first review on yelp wanting to share if you're looking for authenticity in the food you eat, this is it. It's modern Oaxacan. Great food, and whatever you order, don't forget to get their guacamole - so fresh. so good. And their drink menu. Superb. One of the few few places with their wide selection of mezcal. If you're not a mezcal fan (it's smoky), you can easily become one here.Excellent service and decor. Talk to the staff - my goodness, they know so much about everything on their menu!

I have celiac and I'm vegan, and this place did not disappoint. We had the guac, salsa verde cruda, and salsa de seis Chile's to start, and finished with taco de pescado. Great food and the best drink menu ever. If you are looking for good fun food and Mezcal, this is the place. Loved it and will be back soon.

I really enjoyed both of my visits to Espita. The staff was knowledgeable and seemed genuinely invested in the program they've got going on. A perfect spot for a date night or special gathering with friends. Expect to pay for the quality that they're serving- both in the glass and on the plate. Now that I've been, I try to stop in every time I'm in DC.
The food, service and atmosphere are absolutely amazing. One of the best restaurants I ever ate at!

I was a cursory mezcal fan because I sat down at the bar at Espita. I've been coming back again and again for the new and fascinating stories of the mezcals they serve there. Every flavor and history of the mezcal is complimented with food that really makes you feel like you're tasting mexico the way its supposed to be tasted.

My favorite restaurant in the Shaw district. Atmosphere is relaxing, restaurant is clean, staff is attentive. We had some questions about the different types of mezcal, servers and bartenders were knowledgeable. Food was amazing!! The drinks were refreshing and eye appealing. Don't forget to get dessert. I would highly recommended this place for a dinner or lunch out. I have been there numerous times since they opened and even have taken my children who enjoy the food greatly.

What I love most about Espita is the revolving menu, every time I've been there is always something new to try whether it be food or drink, my experience is always different. Kudos to the staff and of course Josh and Kelly....if there is one place in DC to stop and explore, it HAS to be Espita!
location: South Newport News, Newport News, VA

text: The food was excellent, and the drinks were even better. We were a party of four and were seated without too much of a delay, though they were quite busy. Service was exemplary. Can't wait to go back!

For my activities I have the opportunity to travel and know all kinds of restaurants, for me, Espita is one of my favorites in Mexican Food! Excellent food, excellent selection of mezcal and tequila, excellent cocktails, excellent service in a very nice atmosphere. Congrats !

I travel extensively in both sides of the border, and I take very seriously my standards for restaurants especially for Mexican food. Espita is one of my references when it comes to Mexican food. In addition to their incredible food and atmosphere, Espita has one of the best agave cocktails programs in this part of the world and a rare and amazing Tequilas and Mezcales selection!

This place has one of the most thoughtful selection of agave spirits in the U.S. For them, it's definitely quality over quantity and their commitment to ethics in Mexican spirits is truly praiseworthy. It's not an easy thing to do in this industry, but something everyone in it should aspire to. Add to that their knowledge and passion and it really doesn't get any better.

Delicious food and incredible drinks. I'm NOT a fan of mezcal but these drinks, even the mezcal ones are delicious. The food is out of this world good. I really love this place for their tacos and guacamole. Ask for the really hot salsa that isn't on the menu for an extra special kick.

I have been here before and thought it would be the perfect place to celebrate a friends birthday. The vibe was perfect. Festive and interesting. We started out at the bar and although we weren't sure what to get, Meghan was unbelievably helpful in our selection. She just asked us what type of drink we were in the mood for and then she worked her magic to create the perfect cocktail, garnished to perfection! We started the meal off with guacamole and salsa verde cruda. We honestly could have stopped right there because the chips were so incredible, but wanted to save room for dinner. Our waiter was so knowledgeable about the menu,which was a big win for me because it was very unique and a lot of things were unfamiliar. He was right on point with the amount of food for us to share family style and we couldn't have been happier with his suggestions. The food was not only incredible but the presentation was beautiful. We wrapped up the evening with a surprise dessert sent over to us. We enjoyed our evening at Espita so much we decided to go the next day for brunch. Let me just say if you want to start your day off with something special, do not miss this! We sat outside and ordered grains and greens and churro french toast accompanied with wonderful cocktails. Although the egg dish was delicious, the french toast was exceptional! You will never think of FT the same way again!! Can't wait to go back!

This place is the best place to experience mezcal and Oaxacan cuisine. Please do not ask for other liquors and enjoy what they offer. With that being said: the food is phenomenal and will sweep you off your feet. Once again, they offer from the Mexican state of Oaxaca so don't bother asking for fajitas or chimichangas!! Our server explained the menu pretty well and we followed his suggestions which led to one amazing dining experience. Start with a guacamole and a salsa, follow up with the ceviche and Apache huaraches, then get the borrego and the octopus and you'll be in food heaven. Make room for dessert cuz it's worth every single calorie!!

They apparently just launched a new cocktail menu for the summer and it is crazy. The one in the oil can was my favorite. I liked how the cocktails actually complimented the food here. We tried the rabbit tamal, the ceviche, the beef crudo, and the almond tostada. It was hard to pick a favorite because everything had so many good flavors going on. Was seriously impressed by how good the dessert was though.Overall, the service here was really friendly and attentive without being overbearing. I'm really looking forward to our next visit so I can dig into their mezcal list.

I have been looking for authentic tortillas in DC for sometime now and they are finally here. What makes this place special is the details in the cooking and the time put into their menu. Stopped in for dinner early in the week and was blown away by how good the corn flavor of their tortilla is. I tried three different types of tortillas and they were all rich, delciious, soft and not crumbly. You can tell they were made that morning. All of the sauces were complex and vibrant with flavors that changed throughout the experience. Recommended are the Al Pastor tacos, Lamb Mole, and Tamal. Our drinks were well paired with the food and the cocktail menu was really interesting. Lots of ingredients and combinations I've never seen before led me to try the Snap Pea Highball which was vibrant, fresh, tart with a little smoke. I could taste fresh from the garden snap peas, and fernet foam on top!? What!Oaxacan cuisine is truly celebrated here without feeling contrived or kitschy. It's like being in modern Mexico, not my grandmother's Mexico.The difference in the details here is clear and hands down my new favorite restaurant in the city. Come for the food, stay for the friendly staff and hip bar scene.

Mezcal for days! Came here on a Thursday and had a great time at the bar, enjoying a few mezcal cocktails and mezcal straight which was a delight. Very skilled bar staff provided me with some great recommendations, and the food was top notch.Drinks: Their mezcal margarita was on point, but my second cocktail was even better, think mezcal negroni? Also had a pechuga that was not overpriced, a rare find for that quality.Food: Guacamole, classic and delicious, ask for spicy salsa maranon as well. Fish tacos (tacos pescado) this entree was big enough for 5 tacos. Woah, delicious. Octopus!! Their Octopus dish was the most flavorful and tender i've ever had outside of portugal. Chicken wing tacos were a hit with my date.Service: Very attentive and personal, we didn't want to wait so we ate at the bar, best decision ever, learned so much about mezcal.Will be back, great addition to the neighborhood!
Drinks and food were awesome. Very out of the box! Will come back here for the drinks and the tacos. Yummy!

I've lived in DC for a few months now and I'm so glad I found Espita! I'm a huge fan of what they do. One of the best bars in DC in my opinion. They always seem to craft the perfect cocktail. The food menu is always up to date with fresh, exciting dishes. Try the mole or the Octopus! The perfect spot for a romantic date night, an after-work cocktail or a birthday dinner. Make sure you make a reservation, they are starting to get very popular. I guess the secret is out.

Wondered in while waiting for a friend and we loved it! The atmosphere is unique and so is the staff. The bartender gave us a quick run down of the drink menu and pointed out the most popular drinks. We tried their Mayahuel margarita. The spiced rim and beverage mixed together are a fantastic taste. We had the guacamole as well and loved it. We will be back soon to try out the rest of the dinner menu. Great place, friendly staff and good service!!!
great food, great service and great atmosphere. try the shishito peppers!
MEZCAL - the mezcal selection is incredible and the cocktails are SO well done! I love this bar.

We had a lovely meal at Espita yesterday. We started with their guac and fresh chips and the tuna ceviche (to die for - would probably be back JUST for that), then had tilapia tacos, pork tacos and the mushroom tacos, with a side of black beans and a side of shishito peppers. The meal was delicious, with just the right amount of kick. The tacos are small, but don't be fooled because they are quite filling - so much so that we didn't have room for dessert. The owner was at the restaurant and told us all about how carefully crafted their meals are - even their masa is made in-house, with maize they import from Mexico every week? It's obvious he cares greatly about the food they serve. The ambiance is chill: informal and unpretentious, even if the place was packed. I'll be back!

Playbook: If you're going to go -- Strong: Mole Negro, TacosQuite Strong: Mezcal Selection, Crudos, Fundido's, Salsas, Chips, TortillasNot so Strong: Can be packed...One Hitter Quitter: Come to Espita, sip mezcal and make a meal out of their dope salsas, crudo's, fundidos and try a mole.
I ate at the bar. The chips are amazing and the sopes solid. I don't remember the name of the mescal I had but it was nice and smoky and complex.

BF and I came in at 5:30 on Saturday in our way to a wedding - we weren't sure how long the ceremony would be and we were starving, so we wanted to get something really fast, like "can we be in and out in 25 minutes?" fast. They were so accommodating and everything came out in record time and was delicious. Definitely going to try them again for a more leisurely dinner when we're back in DC.

This restaurant is bringing politics into their establishment, and it's unacceptable. The host--a white guy--was wearing a Keffiyeh, a symbol that targets Jewish patrons. It's disturbing that they would allow this, making some customers feel unwelcome and unsafe. I will never eat here again. Restaurants should be welcoming to all, not pushing divisive symbols. Shame on them!
location: Temple Bar, Dublin, Republic of Ireland

text: I visited Compass Rose several years ago and, unfortunately, had a less-than-ideal experience. We were seated in the lower level, uncomfortably cramped shoulder to shoulder with other diners, making it nearly impossible to hold a conversation. The food was simply average, and the atmosphere was subpar at best.So, when I was scouting restaurant options for a group of 10-15 people, I was understandably hesitant to give this venue another try. However, in the spirit of due diligence, I decided to revisit the restaurant.What initially piqued my interest was the recent buzz around Compass Rose's "Tour of the World" tasting menu, which had been featured in videos by several D.C.-based food influencers. From what I gathered--likely in coordination with the restaurant's marketing team--this menu was advertised as a pre-fixed selection allowing diners to sample various items at a set price ($42 for brunch, $57 for dinner). This seemed like the perfect way to evaluate their offerings.To ensure this wasn't just a social media promotion that had since been discontinued, I went directly to Compass Rose's website and reviewed both their brunch and dinner menus. Nowhere was it indicated that this tasting menu was restricted to groups.After planning this visit for two days and canceling reservations elsewhere, I arrived at Compass Rose only to be informed that the "Tour of the World" menu was available exclusively for groups--a crucial detail that was missing from their website, social media, menu, or any influencer-led promotions.Having already had a disappointing experience here once before, I was frustrated to learn that my only option to sample the menu as an individual diner was to either spend significantly more money or return with additional people. I attempted to work out a way to try a variety of dishes in a reasonable manner, but the pricing structure made it infeasible.When I asked if the restaurant could accommodate me in any way, I was told no--twice--by the staff. At this point, I was understandably frustrated.Eventually, I spoke with the restaurant's Director of Operations, explaining how the misleading advertising, incomplete menu descriptions highlighting a required group, and overall unwillingness to adjust for a customer who had specifically set aside time to try this menu was unacceptable. To her credit, she apologized and assured me that the restaurant would update its menus and improve its advertising to clarify the tasting menu's restrictions re party size. However, based on my interactions with staff--one of whom mentioned that several other solo diners had encountered the same issue--it was clear that this had been a known problem for some time, yet no changes had been made.More importantly, while I appreciated the acknowledgment of the issue, I was still left with no resolution for the time and effort I had wasted due to Compass Rose's misleading promotions.Considering my past negative experience, what appears to be an ongoing pattern of disregarded customer dissatisfaction, and the fact that I lost an entire morning due to deceptive or poorly managed advertising, I would caution potential diners against visiting Compass Rose. In a vibrant dining scene like 14th & U, there are plenty of restaurants where you'll receive exactly what's advertised and enjoy a far better experience.Additionally, please see attached pictures of the restaurants menus as well as screenshots of their social media advertising which sells this as an almost restaurant week-esque tasting menu open to all.

We've decided to take my brother who's here on a trip from Armenia to Compass Rose since we knew they have International dishes. That was the worst decision ever! We were totally disappointed! We were excited to order Armenian ground beef kebab( Lulya) In addition to some appetizers and Georgian khachapuri ( I grew up in Georgia). To our surprise it was a salty sausage rather than a ground beef kebab and it tasted awful!!! It is disgrace to use Armenian name on a dish like that. Georgian khachapuri was half baked with only one egg on it. The service was nowhere to be found! After reporting to the server and the host no apology was given from the restaurant! We were embarrassed and disgusted! We would never go back there again!!!

The manager Genna is some shit! Don't come in when she's here because she's extremely racist. My friends and I are regulars and we weren't even treated that way. She literally said she was "watching our table" and I felt discriminated. We personally know the owner Rose and it's sad to be treated this way and we come and give them business 2/3 times a week. PLEASW FIX THIS BECAUSE ITS BAD FOR BUSINESS!!

We wanted to like this place so much since it's literally right around the corner from our house. So, after the much anticipated wait me hubby and several neighbors went this past Thursday to go try it out. First impression when you walk in is pretty good.The front of the restaurant/bar, I guess it's the lounge, looks fantastic but we were led to the back dining room which was quite dreary cold and dark. I like ambience but it was too dark to read the menus and when I asked our server to relight our dead candle we got a little bit of attitude from him? We also asked if he could get the temperature adjusted and it seemed like it got colder. Food was ok not bad but just underwhelming if not a bit overpriced for what you pay. What really soured the experience for us was the very poor service. The whole food menu, wine, beer, and cocktail list all fit on one page but our server didn't seem to have much knowledge about any of it. The place is new, but like I said all the menus fit on one page. You can probably learn the whole thing in a couple of hours. We were charged for 2 glasses of wine that we never ordered or received. We did ask to speak to a manager, the reply?
Really pretty inside! Get a taste of foods all around the world!

Food was ok, I didn't really get the hype that I was hoping to taste. We got Grilled Calamari that were decent and Khachapuri (that was under baked and cheeses tasted Lil rotten). I am familiar with Georgian cousine and it was OK pie. Service was quick and nice. Quick sitting. Drinks
4/5 because the reservation system is so complex. Food is delicious. Get the kachapuri!

Probably one of the best food we had in DC... in a cool hip area, the decor and place was super cool and weird. We had a large party and they accommodated us in their private room. Service was friendly and attentive. The food was good but pricey for such small portions. Most of the food are meant to share. I got the Korean BBQ short ribs. It had great flavors. My friends got the curry with jasmine rice and I tried some and it was really good. Get that!
Great atmosphere. For a place that looked like it would have such eclectic food, we already had almost everything on the menu, which was kind of disappointing.

I went to an after-work party here yesterday evening with a couple of friends. I was intrigued by the interior as soon as we stepped in, the decorations were very charming and unique. The menu wasn't very extensive which was disappointing because I wanted to try something new, but in the end the khachapuri I shared with a friend was astonishingly good.
Awesome place. Food and drinks all great. It's still the best in DC, I suppose, and everyone seems to go for it. Be adventurous when there, I'd say.
The food is great but expensive.
Delicious and I plan to go back. Definitely worth the money. Great for groups but I recommend a reservation for more than four people
Great atmosphere and great food. Great variety of foods and cultures to experience!
location: Canal St Martin/Gare de l'Est, Paris, France

text: Definitely a restaurant that I will be visiting again. With small dishes from around the world you will always find something that you probably haven't tried before. The shrimps with sambal are great, and so is their take on a ceviche.
Fantastic food, lots of variety.
Beautiful place, incredible ambiance, insanely delicious food.
We had great service, an awesome meal with drinks and enjoyed the atmosphere here. Really a great little spot!
Ambitious menu. Fantastic service. Great vibe. Get some!!

Always a great spot for food and drinks. I always bring friends who are visiting from out of town and they absolutely love it. The ambiance along with the eclectic street food inspired dishes are what definitely wins me over every time. As someone who has traveled extensively, this place always reminds me of the great food I've had along the way!
Really cool atmosphere. The wait staff knows what they're doing and were super fast.

I'm new to Yelp but I went here last night for a friend's bday and absolutely loved it!!! We went for the Bedouin tent event and loved every dish that was served especially the Jamaican Lamb Curry!!! Definitely going back!! :-)
Went back, had a different server and it was fantastic. Delicious food and our whole party was extremely happy.

Playbook -- If you're going to go.Strong: Worldly small plates, cocktailsQuite Strong: Vibe, Decor and and every intangible.Not So Strong: Gets packed at times.One Hitter Quitter -- So much greater then the sum of its parts this is just the place where you want to spend a night on a date, unwinding for the grind or meeting a friend -- khachapuri is a standout dish and try some Georgian wine.
Amazing food and amazing service. If your looking for something you have never tried before, this is your place!
One of my favorites in DC. Rose and her staff are amazing. Food is exceptional!
We Loved it ... Excellent !!

Ventured to Compass Rose on a snow day in DC and couldn't have been more thrilled to find this place open, cozy and with great service. The menu is ecclectic and exciting - the Georgian bread was fantastic though sadly the only thing we tried since it was post-lunch. The bar was serving $6 snow day slushies which we loved. The wait staff was friendly and accomodating. Can't wait to go back.

The shop itself is cute and clean which is what prompted me to stop by on my walk to work. The gentleman at the counter was very polite but hesitant. I think he was likely still learning and possible at his first customer service job. The pastries were out in the open, uncovered, and mislabeled. Other items were in a small case below. The ham and cheese "quiche" that I ordered was mislabeled as something $2 cheaper. The quiche itself was pretty terrible. It was a tiny square about 3x3 inches and maybe a half inch high for just under $6. The quiche was dense and mostly tasted like cheese and was dried out as though it had been sitting in the case since the prior morning. The pastry was also lackluster and I picked most of it off. It also looked very dried out like it has been sitting out in the case for at least a day. I honestly almost threw it away and would have had it not been so expensive. 100% would not go here again.

service was excellent, Florian, our waiter was really on point with the service and made us feel like we were the only guests there even though the place was completely booked! Would definitely recommend!

Very small menu, but everything I've had there is some of the best I've had. Great location on a quieter street, so no cars are zooming by when you sit outside. The only thing I wish they had were more comfortable/ sturdier chairs and tables outside. Service does not lack, like most. places in DC and the food hits all the marks.

Super cool Norwegian restaurant with real authentic pastries. They reminded me so much of the my French pastries from home. The fresh occurs was also quiet tasty. Everyone should definitely try here if you're looking for European pastries of delicious delicacies from this region of the world.
Went here for a quick bite to eat after spray tan! I felt instantly transported to Norway once I entered. The pastries are to die for! This place is a hidden gem.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Mikko, a delightful Scandinavian restaurant. From the moment I stepped inside, I was struck by the colorful decor that gave the space a warm and inviting feel. The pastries on offer were absolutely delicious, and I especially enjoyed the mushroom soup - it was rich and flavorful, and the perfect way to warm up on a chilly day.But it wasn't just the food that made my experience at Mikko so enjoyable - the ambiance of the restaurant was fantastic. The cozy, intimate setting made it the perfect place to enjoy a leisurely meal with friends. I was also impressed by the attentive and friendly service - the staff went out of their way to make sure our experience was top notch.In short, I highly recommend Mikko for anyone looking for delicious pastries and hearty soups in a cozy, inviting atmosphere. Don't miss out on this gem of a restaurant!

This was our first time being here. We ordered a brunch special and I ordered a sprite, the waitress forgot my sprite and I said that was fine, until I asked about 2 more times and I still haven't gotten it even when she came to check up on us and the table. They also forgot to give the whole table one entree which were waffles and pancakes. No one received it but received the other meals. At this point, we're almost done with our food and we're STILL waiting. And I still haven't gotten my sprite. And now we spent money on meals that were getting late for no reason. I am extremely disappointed in this, and I won't be coming back at all. I'm an Afghan and I realized that I can get better service and food in my own comfort of my house. Very very disappointed.

I love Lapis, delicious food everytime. That's not what this review is about.They are now doing 20% autogratuity and they aren't announcing it to people aside from the fine print on paper. Pay your workers fairly or explicitly tell me when there is a 20% fee. I am sick and tired of this deception. I tip 20% every damn time already. Pay your workers fairly. Pay your fairly. Pay your fairly. I will upgrade my review to the 5 stars that your food and location deserves if the auto-grat is removed.
Too salty, too expensive, servings not generous enough.
Nice patio and cool vibe
The food and service was definitely excellent. The atmosphere is very, very loud as it's difficult to have conversation. Although the food is excellent, it is very pricey.
Good quality food and nice ambiance. Above average quality but a bit overhyped in my opinion.

We really enjoyed it, especially the waitress Ashley who was so kind and outgoing. Great selection of red wines (tried 3). The downstairs could use more music and dimmer lights but otherwise everything was as it should be
Great place! Good food. Taking away one star due to the extremely small tables.
A fan of the chickpeas dish and the chai.
MmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmÂ­mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
Amazing food! Service was super helpful. We loved the food as much as the atmosphere.
Amazing atmosphere, excellent food, love dining here, highly recommended .. can hardly wait to go back for dinner
One of the best meals I have ever had! Everyone in my group loved it. I will be back as soon as I can
A lovely outdoor patio in AdMo.  Food is tasty and staff are friendly.

A go-to many times over. Elegant, comforting, substantial, great service and great vegetarian options. I have a 'usual' order but they make it hard when every menu item I've tried is excellent.Our server was so kind to my two small dogs, too. Just excellent service and experience all around

Phenomenal experience. Top-notch food, atmosphere, and wait staff. Have been here multiple times, and every time is an amazing experience all around. I always take my out-of-town guests here, as the food is always superb. Definitely a lifetime customer!!!
Great food, ambiance and service. I have dreams about the pumpkin dish. One of my favourite restaurants in DC.
The food was amazing. All of my dishes were wonderful and full of taste. Very authentic.
I was here for my birthday bash and everything amazed me. The taste of every single dish was just outstanding. My favorite was the dessert & the ambiance. I'll definitely visit soon :)
One of the best spots for a delish meal and a great conversation. Great spot for date night.
This food is $@%&ing delicious.
This place is amazing. It's our favorite restaurant in the area and some of the best food I've had ever.
Amazing food, atmosphere & service! We will definitely be back for brunch again!!
Really great meal! Not too expensive for the portion sizes. I'd recommend reserving a table for weekends since they do get really busy.
Unbelievably Good Food!Try Kebabs and Kabulipolo
This might be the best food I have ever had. Green sauce is amazing. Everything is amazing! 10 stars!
Every single dish we had was delicious. Very reasonably priced. Highly recommend! We will be coming back!
Delicious food, excellent service. Would definitely go again.
Vegan friendly. The pumpkin, onion-potato, and lentil biryani were great, the vegetable sandwich was very good.
Really great food, good ambience. Everything was great, the waitress was nice and the prices are reasonable. I definitely recommend it.

As an Afghan, I am an extremely tough critic of Afghan restaurants- because where has better Afghan food than my mom's house? This place was truly on point. You can taste every single flavor, as authentic Afghan should be. My friends & I literally ordered one of everything and were so blown away. Try the sholah, the bolawnee, banjaan, firni- you cannot go wrong with anything. Only sad part was they ran out of aushak when I arrived. Just an excuse for me to go back. Beautiful decor & great service. Lapis FTW!

Haymaker is a charming hidden gem that might be easy to overlook from the outside.The bartenders are exceptionally friendly, providing some of the best customer service I've experienced at local bars. The cocktails are skillfully crafted, adding to the overall experience. However, I find the food, particularly the wings, less impressive. At $14 for just five small wings, they are overpriced and only mediocre in flavor. Despite this, the welcoming atmosphere and superb drinks make it a worthwhile spot to visit.
The punch is so good. So good.

The perfect place for Sunday brunch! I recommend the Smoked ferro salad, the Green tomatoes benedict and the petit gateau as dessert! Their Aperol Spritz it's the best cocktail I ever had...you can't have only one (hahaha). The service is great, comfortable and relaxed atmosphere.
Loved the bar atmosphere and the bartenders were very patient.

The lowdown: This used to be Atlas Room--an upscale American restaurant that I LOVED. So anything that took it's place would face high scrutiny. That said, it's more of a bar than a restaraunt so there's not really a comparison. The inside was redesigned and is more spacious and bright. It's still not a space for big parties but if you head over with three friends or less, you shouldn't have a problem finding a spot. Seating is first come first served. They have food but it's mainly snacks--wings, sandwiches and tots. I will say, though, the tots are so good. They are mixed with cheese, chives, bacon, etc. Based on this selection, I'm assuming even though the menu is limited, the food is good. The sandwiches looked really good. My one suggestion would be to have desserts. I believe in my heart that Haymaker wants to be a restaurant. You don't make gourmet Korean chicken wings to just be a bar. And no matter how small or simple the restaurant, you MUST have sweets. Bread pudding, chocolate cake, panna cotta, gelato--give me something. Baileys and cookies?? Yes, this is all about what I want. Now for what you care about: the happy hour is amazing. $5 rail drinks but the "rail" includes Tanqueray and the like. No bottom shelf gross liquor that will make you regret happy hour the next morning. Haymaker is off to a good start. I plan to become a regular and continue demanding some sugar on top of the savory.

Had a great time here! The drinks and service were great. Didn't have any of the food, but we totally would have had a few different things if we hadn't just come from dinner. Can't wait to come back!!Dietary restrictions: Had good gluten free drink optionsService: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 5/5
The rice was soggy and wet This is not a Chinese restaurant It's Persian so the rice must be dry I had to add a lot of Salt To make it eatable

I ordered a chicken kabob With some salad And another chenje kabob For my wife The kitchen was crowded, They messed up our order Instead of a chicken kebab they brought up something Else, when I complained and shown them my receipt they accepted it. The whole process took about an hour so I was frustrated

I would leave zero stars if I could. The food is mediocre for the price and to make it even worse it is not even close to authentic. You should not call yourself a Persian restaurant. The vibe, music, and food feels ridiculously whitewashed.
The rice was too dry and the bread was burnt And they make their ghorme sabzi with shambalile Who does that????
As a Persian And someone Who had a lot of Iranian Foods This menu And the taste of food Was nothing close to Authentic

The kitchen's ventilation system wasn't very good I visited this restaurantn a couple weeks ago With my family And they were All Complaining About the smell in the kitchen Even when you stood outside you can still smell the fat burning In the kitchen
I was honestly shocked By their price is $6 for a falafel And $11 for chicken kebab This is just ludicrous And a ripoff

Very nice owner, came out to say hello to us. Large portions, I mean you gonna have some leftovers for sure. Clean interiors, everything looking fresh and new. I like their kebabs, that's what they're known for, the chicken kabob plate is yummy and comes with rice and a delicious yogurt sauce. They do take-out and you can also dine in I think. For those that are vegetarian, they have falafel.
Very clean but the actual food is not the same what they have in the app. I like the cleanliness.
Nice people, really good food, and fitting ambiance. I definitely recommend. He even gave me a free hummus.
Best Persian Kabob in the DMV. I highly recommend Maman Joon. They have the best Hummus.
Great place small and local! The owner was so kind and was so glad that we were enjoying. Our meal!
Great food, atmosphere, and customer service. Arguably the best hummus I have had anywhere.
Delicious, authentic food, with great service, and awesome and hospitable owners! Especially enjoyed the hummus!
The owner came up and offered my friend and I some hummus to try. It was the best I have had in DC. Great service and will come here again

Unlike most of you in DC, I had an unexpectedly fantastic election night thanks to Peter at Z Burger "He is associated with this restaurant as well". As a Marine combat veteran from the war in Afghanistan (Marjah Afghanistan 2010) I am fascinated by the US government, flaws and all. I am new to the area and live in Northern VA so I decided to get a hotel in DC to experience election night there for the first time. To my dismay the city was completely dead when I finally made it out. I assumed I would be able to find food but nearly everything was closed! After not eating anything all day, panic began to set in. While in an Uber I saw Z Burger and an adjacent bar. I stopped my ride on the spot and headed inside. Upon entering the restaurant, Peter was the first person I encountered. He informed me they had actually been closed for nearly an hour at that point. Seeing the excitement in my eyes turn to utter disappointment, he offered to make me fries on the house. He then proceeded to make me a chicken sandwich with the fries. Anyone who has eaten at this restaurant knows the food is fantastic. That being said, the review I wish to give is a review of the person I met that night, Peter Tabibian. Peter is a kind, generous, and talented man who saw a person in need and chose to make a difference in at least one persons life that night, mine. To me, the best gift one can give is to restore someones faith in humanity. Peter, you gave me that gift and I am deeply thankful.  Please support this man and his employees. The delicious food is a great bonus.
Great food and hospitality. Authentic and fresh Persian food. Will certainly go here again
I rate this meal delivery 5 stars! Great food, great selection of dishes, and fast delivery. I will definitely be ordering here again!"

I have been at Maman Joon couple of times, this place has a jaw-dropping and tasty foods. They have a well seasoned cook. The service is great and responsive, staff are friendly and they go out of their way to satisfy you, My picks are, Soltani kabob, lamb shank, and Lubia Polo.

A+ At Maman Joon, everything they serve is prepared fresh daily, so you know you're getting only the best. You can choose from a variety of menu items, including lamb shank, koobideh, Soltani, and of course their famous beef and chicken kabob . Along with their sides and sauces, this is an absolute feast of a meal. If only all kabobs in America looked and tasted this good. provide consistency and authentic flavours on a daily basis. They have been wowing their customers with consistent quality and superb kabobs. Their roots and recipes come from the Iranian baazaar and are as authentic as anything you will taste in America.
Amazing Persian food! The service is amazing and the hummus is to die for. I highly recommend it!
The food was amazing! The people were very nice! Everything was very clean. Highly recommend it
I'm Persian and I approve of the food! Their Ghorme Sabzi was pretty great.

Great Persian food and vegan/vegetarian options which are so hard to come by but sorely needed in Iranian restaurants! My only complaint is a frustration with a Yelp poster lower down who said the rice was dry... when I had it, it was a bit more buttered than I needed, especially with stew. I feel like that was reactive to that mediocre review. Everything I had was great, still, and I hope they do well with the takeout scene in tenley!
Best food ever, very clean place workers are very friendly And generous with port
location: Downtown Silver Spring, Silver Spring, MD

text: Doesn't look like much when you walk past, but I waspractically dying of hunger so I popped in. The definition of ahole-in-the-wall. I got the regular hamburger and wow... thereare no words. A classic burger done right. Crisp bun, juicypatty, stuffed with all the essentials (ketchup, shreddedlettuce, tomato, and pickles). There's about a million optionsavailable between the menu board and wall full of specials, soit can get a little overwhelming, but you really can't go wrongNot much else to say besides go see for yourself! You won't bedisappointed
Delicious meal! The food was so fresh and it tasted amazing! Can't wait to go back and try more dishes.

My sister and I tried Maman Joon for the first time today. It was amazing. The serviced we received was great, the employees value their customers. We had the lamb kabob entree and Hummus which was served with Naan which was all very good! The food was prepared quickly! I will definitely be returning to Maman Joon!!

Excellent service and amazingly tasty food. I especially appreciate the extras such as a packet of sumac to use on my "to go" order. Everything ordered so far was excellent and I am happy to see several entrees that feature vegetables. The extensive menu lists several dishes that I have not tasted before so I will be back for more in the very near future.Thrilled to have them in the neighborhood.

My husband and I went to Maman Joon.  first thing we noticed it was the customer service and friendly people. They treated us like we were the only customers there. rice and kabob was delicious.For the price you pay, you get so much food , you have to ask for a To go box. I wish we could go over there every day unfortunately we have to go back home tomorrow.

ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE!! This place is one of the best Persian restaurants in the DMV. The chicken kabob, koobideh, lamb, crispy rice and kashk were all spectacular. I had leftovers and even couple days later the food still tasted amazing! Unlike most places they also use really good quality rice as well that tastes amazing. The people running the place are super friendly and accommodating. And the quality of food you get for the price is unbelievable. I'm Persian and have been to most of the restaurants in the DMV. Maman Joon is by far one of the best. I would highly recommend this place, everything was superb.
Chef was greeting people as they walked in. Offered extra food when I said it my first time here. Great environment and authentic food.

This is delicious, really high-quality Persian food dressed down in casual take-out. A rare thing for Persian restaurants is providing the best of the cuisine which is much more labor intensive to make, that is not kabob, but the stews... for example Gormeh Sabzi and Fesenjoon, which to me are God's gift to humanity [note I'm half-Persian but full-crazy for Persian food]. They even went next-level and provided a VEGAN option for the Gormeh Sabzi with tofu. This is a bold move. I'm gonna be honest the tofu is not the same as the meat, but they really did the best that can be done (I did add a dash of salt and it was awesome). Though I'm a wanna be vegetarian, the kabobs are super delicious - moist, flavorful, and portions are generously sized making for fantastic leftovers. The rice is super long and high quality (many Persians care about this weird nuance). But let's go back to the veggo options - the falafel, though not Persian per se - is knock your socks off esp with the tahini sauce. [TMI but I'm salivating heavily writing this]  They are freshly open so be kind, kinks being worked out. The staff members are welcoming and warm. I want nothing more than this place to thrive.

I only stopped by to try the falafel appetizer, but the owner was so generous with free samples that I wound up with a full meal. Everything tasted better than I expected, the portions were decently large, and the prices are on the low side for Tenley. No complaints here!

Rice tender and mellow flavor which embodys whatever it is being eaten with. Koobideh: I liked the Texture in between and the flavor was unique. A piquant savory taste. It was very enjoyable, definitely something I would request seconds on.Chicken : very moist and succulent, tasted great with the rice and ghormeh sabzi(greens).Chenteh: choice Steak - perfect juiciness not over or under cooked. Excellent taste easy cut and easy to chew. Ghormeh sabzi- Tied in citric pand aftertaste. with or without meat-Vegitarian (Good tofu, I believe the vegitarians would love this with rice and bread. Overal : savory, the spices were light and flavorful enough that it brought everything together. It is different then my usual kaboob places and definitely one I'd recommend to a friend. They have assortment of soft drinks, and the "stubborn root beer" Simply something to try taste straight from the tap.Be sure to ask about the desserts, and enjoy the experience.!kcsb
So gross --- they will sell you lab grown (tumor!) meat without telling you what it is! AVOID !
Customer Service is the worst. Don't come with a big group or else...
You can do better! This place is way over priced and not good. They are not welcoming
This restaurant is schizophrenic. The fusion flavors fall flat and the staff leaves a lot to be desired. Just because you're smiling and nice doesn't mean you're a good server.

The host was uninviting, rude, and unprofessional. Was hoping for a better experience from a Jose Andres establishment. Very unfortunate for DC and the downtown area. Drinks weren't cold. Food wasn't warm. We will not come back.
Thought I was going to love this place, until the cockroach came running at us across the bar....
Portion is soooooooo little. And the food? Like bunch of non Asian chefs cooking burnt or bland "Chinese" food. Nice decor tho, but the food, meh !
Restaurant group does not bother nor does the manager!
Very pretentious. Decent food, but definitely NOT worth the price.
Management is terrible. Because they are so incompetent, you might end up waiting for 2 hours.
Rude server, very SMALL portions, extremely salty food. Deemed by yelp as family friendly, yet there's not kids menu! Only item server suggested for kids was very spicy!
Very average food . Totally underwhelming!

Oh fusion restaurants! I'm very open minded when it comes to food but when I think of fusion cuisine - specially Peruvian fusion cuisine - I'm always dubious about it. Unfortunately, I was right once again. First of all, I was born in Peru and have eaten at countless of restaurants in Lima, Ica, Cuzco, Tacna, Puno, Tumbes, etc. anything from street food to down the hatch food, to actual restaurant food

Food was just fair, nothing really outstanding. Dim Sum was not seasoned well. Their Lamb dish was excellent. Taste value for the price was very low overall. Drinks really over priced for the alcohol and taste value. Their version of an Old Fashioned was weak, the Hendricks Gin drink was excellent. Price for food and drink quality really not on par at all for the price and portions of food or alcohol.

During my visit to the restaurant, I tried two appetizers, two entrees, and two desserts. While the food was okay and too salty, the dessert was truly amazing. If I were to return to the restaurant, it would be solely for the dessert. In regards to the service, I found it to be average - not particularly friendly, but also not rude. My only suggestion would be for the receptionist to greet customers with a smile. Overall, it was a decent experience.

Delicious ceviche but they must use MSG because the reaction I had at the end of the meal is the exact same symptoms as when I am exposed to it. Delicious but won't go back due to foo allergy/reaction.
Fun and interesting flavored. Small portions though for the price. I was expecting more.

As another reviewer said: Meh. Went with friends for brunch. The service was very slow, drinks took a long time. Though the drinks (Brunch Cocktails, we tried all of them) were pretty good. The food was unremarkable, mediocre overall. Food came out at different times, often far apart. I know this is partly intentional, but the way it did was more because everything was slow and not coordinated. Picante Huevos was pretty good, as were the Dorayaki. But the Tortilla China was like La Choy Egg Foo Yung, except not as good and the Jook was blah. It seems like they still haven't figured out how to coordinate everything to make it work in terms of service and quality of food. The atmosphere I'd sum up as: trying too hard. It's ok, but not great, seems like it's trying too hard to be hip, a bit inauthentic. I wouldn't recommend against trying it, but I wouldn't recommend it either. There are a lot of other, better options, unless they work to improve both the food and the service, as well as the atmosphere. Disappointing.
The food is very good and well thought out.
Too pricey considering the food and the service.

I was so excited to try this place and I am not going to lie but I was a bit disappointed. The food came out way too quick, our server was ok. He didn't give us much attention. Our table was wobbly and for some reason all this made our experience not as enjoyable. We were there for my wife's bday and I feel it could have been better. Good was tasty and I enjoyed trying the different flavors but definitely not the best Peruvian Chifa I ever had.
The food was delicious and the server was nice. But the food came one plate every 10 minutes for the whole meal. The people in my table were not served at the same time.

Good food and good service but the prices are a bit high. The AjÃ­ de Gallina and Suspiro LimeÃ±a were delicious. The Lengua de Pato anticucho was eh. I felt like Jaleo's Restaurant Week was a better deal. I left China Chilcano on a relatively empty stomach.

China Chilcano presents an intriguing concept: a fusion of Chinese and Peruvian cuisines. While the idea may seem unconventional, the execution is surprisingly successful. The menu offers a diverse range of dishes, some more inspired than others.The service, however, was a bit of a letdown. The slow pace detracted from the overall dining experience.Ultimately, China Chilcano is a unique dining experience worth trying for adventurous eaters. While the fusion concept may not be for everyone, it's certainly an interesting culinary experiment.
Great atmosphere and great service. My problem was my palette didn't think the mesh of Chinese and Peru worked. Every thing is done perfectly however. Just a personal preference for me.
Food and service, both exceptional !
Great food and place to get together with friends. Portions are small. Place is also expensive

Jose Andres has done it again with another fine example of his culinary genius - a Japanese/Chinese/Peruvian restaurant that is sure to please. I highly recommend the chef's tasting menu if this is your first time. At 5 per person, you get a ton of courses and are able to sample a good range of different foods. I dined here with my friend, who is pescatarian, a few nights ago and they had no problem accommodating her dietary restrictions! They have a multitude of different piscos for drinking straight or made into a sour. If you're looking for a fun new food fusion, this is the place to be!
The only thing is the portions. Not enough food but it was delicious.!!!
Vegan friendly, great food and drinks.
It is a little pricey but the food was creative and yummy!
Fantastic food and drinks. Great service. Fun atmosphere.
Food was really good and wait staff attentive but no overbearing.
Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. The ceviche is amazing. I don't remember much else, but go have ceviche here.
Lovely environment. Food is a little spicy.
Go craving nothing in particular. The food was all around good. Great service.
I love anything Jose andres. Everything he produces is a gem.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Pretty good. The lightening changes a bit of the food's color though. Probably they can try to change it.

Food was amazing. Service was great. Joselin had an amazing personality and she made the experience memorable. We will definitely be coming back!Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

We had lunch at this restaurant a while back and loved it. The food was incredibly delicious, with a perfect blend of flavors from different cooking methods and seasonings. The interior decor was outstanding, with a primary red color scheme complemented by yellow accents, a beautiful mural, and bold design elements. The red glass lanterns hanging from the ceiling added a special touch. The attentive staff provided excellent service, making our dining experience even better.

We had an office party at China Chilcano by JosÃ© AndrÃ©s for dinner, and it was a delightful experience. The concolon, dim sum, and dancing yucca were absolutely delicious. Despite waiting more than 9 minutes for our table, which made us rush a bit, the overall atmosphere with moderate noise was okay. The prices were fair and reasonable, making it a great value for the quality of food and service. The staff was active, super quick, attentive, responsive, professional, and friendly. The manager had an excellent personality and a constantly smiling face, enhancing our dining experience. The washroom had a cool smell, and the outdoor seating was beautifully decorated. It's the best place for kids, and we appreciate the free street parking with plenty of space. Highly recommended!
Amazing food, amazing staff, beautiful restaurant!! Definitely recommend. Everything was delicious.
Food was amazing. Glad we stopped by. Highly recommend. Couple next to us recommended the tasting menu but we didn't have time so will be back to check that out.

I had an amazing experience at China Chilcano and highly recommend the chef's tasting menu with cocktail pairing. It's one of the best dining experiences we've ever had. The food is incredibly fresh, and the drink pairing was spot on. Their attention to detail truly shines, and it's clear why they're an award-winning restaurant. The waiter was exceptionally polite, and I never had to ask for extra water refills

We had a group of 10 people for a dinner and could not have had a better time. We received excellent service including special care with a member of our group that had food allergy needs. This was our third or fourth time in the last two years coming back and we will be coming back again.

We have become regulars at this delightful place, and it never disappoints. Whenever friends or family visit, we bring them here, and they always leave impressed. We love the concept of sharing small dishes family-style, as it allows everyone to try something new and find their favorites. The service is flawless, and our server, Jimmy, was knowledgeable, attentive, and an absolute delight. The energetic yet cozy ambiance adds to the overall experience. We can't get enough of the amazing noodle dish that keeps us coming back. The Asian fusion flavors are spot on, and the service and atmosphere make it even better. We could honestly eat these noodles all day long!
One of the best food experiences I have had in DC. Exceptional services from start to end.
Love the food here. Excellent flavor and service. Also not too expensive. Coming here a second time and will keep coming back
I've never had anything like it before. Very attentive and friendly staff. Would go again for the yucca fries.
Food is flavorful and drinks are great highly recommended if you are in the area. Great atmosphere
Jose Andres always hits the mark. Enough said.
Very nice environment. The Chinese food is authentic.
Love the dining room decor!!Food is excellent, I had the tasting menu, so much food! Everything was delicious !
The food was amazing, and the service was top of the line. I had to wait to get a table, but it was absolutely worth the wait.
The food, the drinks, desserts and the atmosphere all amazing... definitely a favorite!!

Great ambiance. I wasn't expect from outside but heard that is owned by Jose Andres so had to give it a try. It is on expensive side but if you are up for small treat, this is the place. Staff was friendly from entering till time we close. Food portion was on smaller side but it was done with passion and dedication. You can tell. Wouldn't recommend eating here everyday since its pricey but from time to time you deserve a little treat.
Great atmosphere, great food, great drinks, great service!!
Excellent food and great service.
TallarÃ­n Zhen Fe is sooooo good.
Amazing food, I was really happy with the service and all their recommendations, can't wait to go back.
Just go here and try everything. That's what we did and we weren't disappointed.
From Long island to China Chilcano! Very good. Cobia ceviche!
This places is amazing. The food was just amazing lots of flavor. The best fried rice, I ever had.
Great meal and great service. Asked for and received a quiet table. Will be back!
Probably the most interesting tastes I've ever had. Everything was really good and really different!
Excellent food and excellent service
Beyond delicious
The food was amazing. Very unique & delicate flavors. Would highly recommend this restaurant to others.
Make sure to have an adventurous attitude and you will have the best time and great food!
Amazing dining experience!
Delicious unusual food.
Brings back a the good memories I had in Peru

Oh where to begin! Goodness my friends and I had Such an outstanding dinner at China Chilcano last Monday night.We were a party of 6 and enjoyed ourselves for hours. The decor is an interesting combo of industrial materials (pallets overlay an interesting pattern amongst the ceiling lights & particle board and shipping containers add color/texture to the walls).Our waiter was outstanding! His easy friendly demeanor was so welcoming. As a matter of fact every member of the staff was friendly, knowledgable and inviting. Every time a dish was delivered we received a description of its contents - very helpful.We mentioned to each other as we ate - hard to believe it's only been open two weeks. So congratulations.As for the dishes we loved them all. From the plantain chips and sauce to the lomo saltado - all left us wanting more. Personal favorite was the chicken thigh skewers with potatoes. Oh goodness I couldn't eat enough - the perfect blend of meaty goodness with light spice zing! Well top it off w bite of potato - buckle ya seatbelt gonna be Deliciousness!! Thank you China Chilcano it was a delightful evening
great energetic vibe and decorunique, delicious and reasonably priced food and drinksobviously well-trained helpful staffnothing to complain about

Our family went to Easter Brunch here on Sunday. They refused to accommodate any dietary restrictions or allergies (my sister is vegetarian, I have food allergies, and my 2-year-old daughter can only eat soft food due to a serious mouth injury the night before). We asked if we could just get bread or lettuce or yogurt- anything simple so we wouldn't be hungry. They were incredibly rude in saying no. It took an hour to place an order for the people who could eat food off their menu. My poor daughter, after being in the emergency room most of the night, cried and said "I'm hungry" the entire meal as they wouldn't provide anything soft for her. The food, for those who got any, took another hour. We were ultimately charged for 4 adults (only 2 ate) and 2 children (none of whom ate-- my nephew is 7 months old and is not on solid food). It cost $310 and we each took a separate trip to McDonalds on the way home because we were starving. Had we been provided a menu ahead of time or a note that said they wouldn't accommodate vegetarians or allergies, we would not have made the reservation. Typically, most restaurants have a vegetarian option and will provide *something* for those with allergies.

Rude staff! Worst than the staff is the manager.Saw an encounter where the server was absolutely racist towards some customers and the manager backed his employee for being a racist trash.That was wild.

Racist StaffThe staff extremely rude and disrespectful. The manager definitely doesn't know how to handle business as he approached customers and asked us if we disrespected his employee rather than asking us if there was a problem. Other customers sitting next to us even stood up for us and confirmed that the staff insulted us.Definitely never go there. Via Sophia needs to work on their staff because this is obviously a racism encounter.
Very salty food, and pretty bad service.
Food and service were not the best. The food was average and the service was very slow.

I can't say enough good things about Via Sophia! From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warm smiles and a friendly atmosphere. The food was absolutely delicious, and the service was quick and efficient. The standout for me was the gondola sandwich, it was simply mouthwatering! And let's not forget about the garlic bread... so flavorful and perfectly toasted. Lastly, their spaghetti dish was truly wonderful. Overall, my experience at Via Sophia exceeded all expectations. Highly recommended for anyone looking for great food and a delightful dining experience!
We found this place through walking and had the most amazing server! The drinks and food were good.
Delicious! Attentive wait staff, quick service and really cute atmosphere. Had breakfast and dinner here and both were delicious. Would go back!

Unfortunately they were out of a lot of drink options on a Monday evening.Service was great though, she was very accommodating and tried her best to sort these issues out.I ordered the grilled salmon which was fantastic.All in all a great restaurant.Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Atmosphere: 5/5
Some of the best pizza I have had for some time. And this is coming from a pizza lover. Five stars!
Highly recommend- delicious food and super friendly staff. We had the best night. Love this place and will be back!!

The duck was great. Visiting DC for work and some of my foodie coworkers brought us back here for a 2nd night in a row. Highly recommended. Food is reasonably priced and great atmosphere. Highly recommended!
Found bugs in my fried rice and the restaurant did not seem to care When I told them.

Waiting 45-50 minutes for an underwhelming meal of 8 pieces of nigiri and 1 roll detracted from our dining experience, a sentiment that seemed shared among other patrons. At this point, the restaurant was half occupied. Our water glasses remained unfilled, and the service could only be described as exceedingly slow, with every table visibly teetering on the edge of frustration. As the room filled, observations of surrounding guests revealed dissatisfaction centered around delays in service, food, beverages, and the delivery of checks. At one point, a server was overheard expressing remorse to a colleague, saying, "I feel bad." There's underlying issues with training or operational awareness. Management must undertake a comprehensive overhaul of their service timing to improve the dining experience.
It's awful, it's been pressing for the bill, and there's no guest at all, and the comments are untrue.
trust the other low rating comments. I had the exact same experience.

I recently visited Takara 14 and had a solid dining experience. The service was polite and efficient (average).Based on vibrant photos I had seen online, I expected a livelier, brighter space, but instead, the decor felt somewhat subdued. It wasn't bad, but it didn't match the energy I had anticipated.The food, however, was the highlight. We tried the Spicy Salmon and Eel rolls along with the signature Pearl and Alexandrite rolls. The Alexandrite roll was by far the standout--fresh, flavorful, and complex. The Spicy Salmon and Eel rolls were good, though they didn't match the brilliance of the Alexandrite.To complement our meal, we enjoyed the Kuromatsu Hakushika Snow Beauty cold sake, which was crisp and smooth--definitely something I'd order again. While the food was excellent, I'd love to see a more vibrant atmosphere to take the experience to the next level. Overall, Takara 14 offers great sushi, but with a few tweaks, it could really shine.

It was my first time at Takara but it definitely won't be my last! I ordered their 8 piece peridot roll which had spicy tuna, tempura, avocados and a few veggies. Might be the best sushi I've had in a while!Their service was also excellent! They served our food within 10 minutes. They had a cute seating area by the windows on the second floor but I would recommend making a reservation beforehand though because that area was packed.
Amazing experience here! They made my birthday really special, and I will absolutely be going back if I am in the area.
location: Sant Pere, Santa Caterina i la Ribera-Born, Barcelona, Spain

text: Takara14 is a fabulous Japanese restaurant with excellent fresh fish. I enjoyed the crunchy sea weed salad which was fresh and tasty. The sashimi platter featured excellent fresh fish and I was able to request some of my favorites. Our waiter, Andrew, was very accommodating and eager to ensure we had a special night. LaBelle, the bartender was a skilled professional who provided us with an experience of cold and hot sake that I have not experienced outside of Japan. I would highly recommend Takara14 for a special night or simple sushi.
Food was great with friendly service. Everyone at our table was happy with their dinner!
