Been here multiple times and it's an experience unlike no other. The owners pour such love and attention to detail into every dish and moment. My hubby is a chef and has high standards but they never fail to meet and exceed them. Cool vibe all around for date night, a spot for one at the counter or a late night drink at their bar. Highly recommend!

This was my first time visiting this restaurant and the entire experience was 10/10. The food was delicious and reasonably priced, the hosts were very friendly and the music was great. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a place to grab sushi.
Drinks were amazing. Owner is very hospitable. Would recommend. Labella and James are amazing bartneders and attended to my amazing. I ordered the takara 14 it was fire.

If you're in DC you need to go to this place! Janice, the owner, is so warm and friendly, along with the rest of the staff. The atmosphere is so cool and the sushi was amazing. They also make great drinks. Would definitely go back there again!
Great menu, great quality fish. I look forward to going back! Be sure to stop by for happy hour!

We walk inside, 5 minutes before closing, and immediately, the place is extremely messy. There are piles of trash everywhere on the floor and no workers there to assist us. The service was nonexistent Just a couple of screens. It was not very welcoming at all. After ordering and paying from a computer, one of the members of our party fills a large cup with water and ice. Out of the blue, an employee comes charging from the back with an apparent attitude and rudely exclaims, "ma'am, you have to pay for that!" Even though it was literally just water and ice, it was $3.19. This would not have been an issue had there been service. Unlike the service and the restaurant vibes, the food was good but I wasn't blown away. It certainly was not good enough to make up for the lack of service.
18 dollars for some bullshit dat ain't right make it at least 13 or some 18 jus not right for some mid but y'all know that
Service is so slow. Find another place!
it was OK but it was very messy and service was very bad
Shittiest burrito of my life. It sucks.
I went on Sunday, 11/18/18, and got food poisoning.
Awful
This place has so many good reviews on yelp that i had to try it! I just hated the food. It didnt taste like a proper Mexican Cuisine
Was terrible could have been more fresh meat was set up Like subway ugggh n I hate that never go here

Need to deal with the ROACH problem. Who wants a baby roach visiting em' when they're sitting down getting ready to tear the hell outta a taco that they've been dreaming about all evening?? I sure don't. Me Def Thinks not about this place!!
Had the "runs" for the next 24 hours... Was not pretty

More like Dry Taco! The steak and bacon is good, but they are stingy with the salsa, meat and Guacamole. They love to give away rice, but nothing worth overspending for. Dry Taco or District Taco is fine, but definitely not like the tacos in Chicago.

Well, was out with friends and we couldn't really think of another place so we walked in since we didn't want to go too far. we ordered tacos, quesadillas with grilled steak. though I totally enjoyed the guacamole but that was about it for me. the menu was just a bit confusing also very little eating space so we just cramped. nothing extraordinary just regular food. we decided we would try them again maybe at a more relaxed time and hopefully by then I change my rating.
I used to love this place. They had the best Tacos but now the quality has dropped down alot
Mexican is my favourite cuisine so i have tried alot of Mexican restaurants but i was quite disappointed with District Taco, the food quality here is so bad it doesnt even taste like Mexican food
Charged me for a bottle of water, but never gave it to me.
Food was ok not that great it didn't wow me. I would rather eat chipotle then to come here.

The last 2 times I have ordered here, I have either had the meat completely forgotten off of my meal, or the meat be very skimp (in a bowl full of nachos, why do I only have 10 pieces of chopped up chicken, a little queso, and a disproportionate amount of chips and onion. I do not want to eat just chips and onions).I'd have to agree with someone else who said everyone must be high when they are eating here. As soon as I stopped smoking and slowed on the drinking, the food got noticeably worse. Wish I would have just went to Chipotle and dealt with the carb overload of rice and tortilla. At least I would have gotten my money's worth.2 stars because those high times were good times and because the salsa bar is cool. Tired of the hit and miss already though. Back to Chipotle or Pico Taco! At least they are consistent.

I do not understand this place' great reviews. I mean first of all, its NOT CLEAN. When they are making the food in the back, they are literally throwing leftover food on the ground or back into the little containers even if the cheese is getting mixed in with the steak or lettuce with the peppers. Of course this is probably why I got STEAK in my vegetarian bowl. This really made me mad. I mean, that is just nasty because I DON"T EAT STEAK. I don't understand long lines for really mediocre almost inedible (and for me actually inedible since I don't eat steak) mexican food.

This restaurant is worth a visit if you're craving tacos, bowls, or burritos in DC. The queso with chorizo is incredibly flavorful and garlic rice in the burritos and bowls is to die for. You can order through a kiosk or an employee. However, the soda machine was often out of order and the cleanliness could be improved. Chicken taco unfortunately lacked flavor. It is a step above fast-food chains but falls short compared to top taco joints in the region.
Difficult to differentiate the bowl I got from mundane Chipotle bowls.

My friends love this place. I am not too impressed. I understand that fast-casual Mexican joints are not going to have the most authentic experiences, but I would not rank this too far above Chipotle. To each their own, though!
This place is pretty good. Their breakfast tacos are the stars of the show
Pretty good
Good tacos, could be a little more tasty though
I tried Fish Taco. It was good, and I like the salad bar. The only thing not that good was to find a seat...it took me 10 minutes waiting for a seat.
I don't get it. It's definitely not trying to be authentic and it wasn't much better than chipotle.
Shrimp tacos were good, but even 3 of them made for a very small lunch. Quick service considering how crowded it was during lunch.
Good food but not the best. Cheap and casual make this a popular spot. Love the salsa bar. Always get the chicken but it's just ok. Will keep going here too as it's worth a stop.

Very average taco, better than fast food at close to their prices. You get what you pay for so if you want a step between Taco Bell and a great Taco Shop then by all means have at it and enjoy. Similar to maybe Robertos or Chipotle tacos in price/quality. The salsa bar is pretty decent also. The breakfast burrito was very filling if a little bland.
not the best tacos. not the worst tacos.
Pretty good. If I lived in DC, I'd probably visit occasionally.
Not sold. Fine, but not outstanding.
Good tacos, now only if they were to bring in rice tacos
Food's good, but the taco prices are way too high for the amount you get. The burritos are way more filling.

Well after one of the other "awesome" taco spots I stopped in here. I was expecting to walk out disappointed. Not the case! The food was actually good. They have a variety of things on the menu. Also different styles of serving it. I went with the traditional Mexican way and was happy with my meal. Also I ordered the bag of chips and guac. I still have chips at home as they give you a bunch! ***BY NO MEANS IS IT AUTHENTIC*** but it was a really well thought out meal! I would go back.
It's like Chipotle.

So I've been here a couple more times and have had the tacos. I don't get the hype. The carne asada is ok and the pastor is way too dry. The fish tacos, though, are legit. Fish tacos: 4.5 starsOther meat options: 2-3 starsDistrict Taco isn't bad, it just isn't amazing either.
Great prices, but the food is a little less than average. (Would go again regardless).
Decent food w/ good prices.

Oh man, I love District Taco. This is coming from a man who has been to Mexico and Texas plenty of times. I was not expecting to love this place so much. It's perfect for a quick lunch in the city if you're in between meetings. My office has also gotten catering from District Taco and it was a hit! The fish tacos (which I believe are only served on certain days) are so good. My favorite is probably the pineapple al pastor and I really love the toppings bar. It's solid food without the frills
The tacos here are some of my favorite. Those I do wish the tacos aren't as soggy, the flavor is there and I do love how it all blends together in one bite. Try a burrito too!
The fish taco's are to die for!!! Super spot to chill with friends and have a quick bite. Had no idea this place was so good have driven past it for years, what a fool not to swing in sooner.
quick, relatively inexpensive, good. better than a larger chain like chipotle

Nice fast food joint. great tacos for a reasonable price too. Various flavors and the burritos are really delicious. place does get really busy, signaling the love people have for this place. can always stop by if i get into DC

Great tacos with a unique flavor. I honestly loved it. I am fond of the salsa bar. Loved the hot salsa and how they are so not stingy with helpings. This was my first time here and everything was well priced, def one of the better deals in D.C. if you are looking for more bang for your buck. Service A++
It is nice! Way better than Chipotle.

I am a taco expert not only at eating but also making it too. Tacos are in my family heritage and culture. Once in a while when my kids and I want a break from my cooking we go down to this place just to chill. We always order grilled and chopped steak taco and beans, veggie and cheese taco. These are my kids and mine favorite. The atmosphere at the place also gives you an authentic Mexican experience. The staff is very decent and cool to deal with.

I love the tacos at District Taco! I was hoping more for a hole in the wall place, but it was still pretty great. My friends got the burrito bowls and loved it. I had the corn tortilla tacos and was underwhelmed by the tortillas. The service was fast, and they'll bring the food to your table even though you wait in line to order. Recommended.

Just went to this place for the first time yesterday and loved it the food was really good the surface was nice parking was easy and the price was very affordable we will definitely be back and would recommend it to anyone who likes authentic tacos...

Visited this place and was hesitant at first. I ended up going back 2 days later. Food is tasty and many different Mexican options. Tacos were super good! Staff was very nice and I would recommend if you craving good authentic Mexican food. The restaurant is also very cute and I would recommend sitting outside.
This is second time I'm visiting District Taco..The food is tasty and place is very clean.Good customer service.

I've been to damn near every taco stand and restaurant in DC, I used to make them back when I owned a stand years ago and that always makes me curious to see the kinds people are making these days. When I tried the tacos here I was pretty impressed, they can really proportion the ingredients well but the salads lacked some freshness. The quesadillas were pretty extra though, no complaints there.
Authen Mexican cuisine, so delicious and fresh, I like this place, usually come here two times one week.
This place has excellent food, my only issue is not much eating space. Recommend taking food to go.
I like this place very much, Good service and fresh food, delicious. Authentic Mexican flavor. I will come again.
Great authentic tacos at reasonable price with many meat and topping options. Salsa bar is great too!
I love this place the dishes are spicy and flavourful. My mouth is watering while writing this review
This place is amazing~ The have so many varieties and they have alot of flavourful sauces

This place is incredible. I ate the best breakfast burrito in my think. The guac is spectacular, you must order it. Fresh organic food. Excellent fresh ingredients & salsas. Price is perfect. Customer service good. Seating is typical of a small restaurant.

the good: This is one of the outlets of a DC only chain of Mexican restaurants. Started out as a food truck. Usually it is not cheap to eat out in the District but this is an exception. The tacos have six possible fillings with an assortment of toppings and salsas. The veggies were all fresh, the meat fillings all delicious. The Burrito Mojado plate was large, more than enough food for most people. Both dishes are only $8.  the bad: Its very crowded inside, mainly because there aren't that many seats. Lines to order were a little long, but nothing terrible, and moved quickly. People taking orders weren't particularly friendly.
Good was good and cheap
Had tacos very good so much better than a chipotle would definitely recommend! Many drink selections as well.

Super quick, tasty and clean and they are open beyond the mid-lunch rush. This was nice when we wanted a quick bite. Tacos were made order by order, fresh and hot. I beef taco with flour tortillas. Yummy!!
My go-to taco spot!! Their meats are super juicy unlike other places and everything about each taco just goes together very well. Their chicken tacos are also very good!
Good fast food mexican.

This fast paced little taco shop is busy for a reason. Their tacos are absolutely impeccable. From texture, to flavor, to sassy salsa and condiment bar, you are going to fall in love. They also have an array of vegetarian options, and heat options in case you're feeling spicy.
The fish and shrimp tacos are the best menu options.
Awesome! Clean, inexpensive, but avoid the lunch rush!
Pretty Good Tacos. I tried it out during lunch time.
Great food!

Awesome for quick Mexican food for lunch or after work. I came here and the tacos were 3 for $8 which is unheard of in DC! They were all flavorful and delicious, especially the al pastor, and their selection of sauces is great too. I wish there were more seating, because it is a little frustrating to have to wait for other guests to get up while your food is cooling down. All in all a great place though, and a go-to in DC's downtown area.
Always a good spot to grab something quick and good.
Lots of sauce options
Great food, very clean and great prices. Not giving it 5 starts cause you can't call head to order.

I love this taco place! I think it is definitely one of the most authentic places to get a good taco. My favorite is the al pastor on a corn tortilla. I can definitely consume a few of those in one sitting. The ingredients are fresh. I have used the online ordering system which worked really well and great to cut the line.If you are looking for a quick place to grab lunch (and fairly healthy too), I highly recommend this place. I go back again and again, both at the restaurants and the food truck.

I thought Chipotle was the best thing ever once they started serving breakfast burritos with chorizo as a meat choice. Now I can get chorizo at all hours of the day thanks to District Taco. Because I love chorizo so much, I was a little bit confused about why it was only listed as a topping, as opposed to a meat choice, but I like chicken, I like chorizo, and I like it when I can combine the two items to make one amazing taco (or three).They messed up my order once. I asked for a side of rice, and they put it inside my tacos. Not that I really cared, but I got to enjoy twice as much rice after they brought me a brand new side of rice. Yum. The cards they give you to identify your order are pretty cool. I really love it when I receive the purple elephant.
Really nice burritos and tacos. Delicious. Very fast service and helpful staff. Portions are pretty BIG!
great tacos. very authentic love the sauces
Yes yes yes, wanted to dislike another taco joint but simply cannot (at least fr this location). Several simple and nicely acidic options.
Best soft tacos in the whole area, hands down. Love mixing up taco combinations, plus the salsa bar. One of my go-to places for lunch. Arrive before noon if you want sears upstairs.
Great food & nice atmosphere for the small location it is.

Great factory line type tacos, and no they are not similar to Chipotle, their food definitely tastes way better and is cheaper. Also they have fish tacos, Chipotle definitely does not serve fish and certain flavors that you can add like the green salsa. My advice would be to come here and let your wallet thank you. P.S one downside is that sometimes they may skimp on their single servings so definitely order double meat when you come to fill you up.
So delicious. You won't regret it.

Great huevos rancheros. Well, not maybe great, but good, very filling, and reasonably priced for DC. Previously had a veggie burrito here. Also good. Of course, I can't really tell the difference between a veggie burrito here, at Baja Fresh, Qdoba, or Chipotle. On the other hand, they're all good! However, District Taco has a salsa bar (not quite as good as BF) so you can spice up whatever you order quite a bit.Note: I'd probably give them 5 stars, except that I've come by 2 other times, only to be driven away by the crowds. Now I only come here in the off hours when it's not crowded, so if you visit, please come while it's busy so you don't bother me.
Good food. Nice atmosphere. Look forward to coming back.
Better than Chipolte and locally owned.
Yummy fish tacos, great price
I got the 3 taco vegetarian, so good. I was stuffed by the second taco. I wish they had a bigger eating area.
Yum! Vegetarian options are very good.
Disctict Taco's breakfast tacos are an awesome way to start the day.
This place has amazing buritos - its not the best mexican food I have had in the district but the service and atmosphere are great and I have never had a bad experience here!
Great tacos, good for vegetarians.
Now this is a Taco/Burrito place. Love it.
great quesadillas and guac!

I hit up the District Taco Truck, when it comes by Crystal City. I love that the burritos come with unlimited toppings (including bacon, guac, chorizo, etc). The burritos aren't much different than a Chipotle burrito, but the cost is lower and the taste is more authentic.
Good friendly service and tasty food.

What a fun little taco place! We shared a quesadilla that was quite tasty. The chips could use a pinch of salt, though. They have both indoor and outdoor seating, along with a cozy "hidden" upstairs area in the back. It's a bit on the pricier side, but worth a visit!
Great service and great food. I will definitely be going back for lunch again. Tacos were great
I had such a great time, the workers are so friendly and the food is amazing! I would recommend to everyone!
The people were so nice and the food was great! I will definitely be coming back to this great restaurant for lunch!
everyone was so nice and the food was amazing!! i will definitely be coming back here for lunch many times!
Great food. I enjoyed the delicious food there me and my wife went for lunch and was sooo delicious. we had rice bowl was goooood.

I had a great experience at this place for lunch. The make-your-own salad option was fresh and delicious, with charred chicken adding a smoky flavor. The service was quick, and the order was ready in no time. The only downside was the limited seating upstairs, which became crowded with families waiting for tables. But if you're planning on takeout or have a small group, it's perfect. Overall, a satisfying and convenient choice.
love the service at the silver spring location

District Taco has quickly become a fast-casual Mexican obsession for me. With easy-to-navigate kiosks for ordering and helpful employees available for assistance, it's a breeze to customize your tacos. The build-your-own taco option offers a perfect size for a quick bite and the flavorful chorizo and jefe way toppings on a warm flour tortilla are heavenly. The pollo asado tocos are a must-try with their smoky and tender chicken. While seating is limited, the quality of ingredients and the quick service make it worth a visit. Whether for dine-in or takeout. District Taco delivers a delightful and satisfying dining experience.

we are a paper food packaging factory from china. i am so glad to look your packaging items which are our product list , i hope more and more people use eco packaging .if you are interested of our story .welcome to visit sunkea.com

This has to be the best fast food place in DC. The food is simply awesome, and what makes it outstanding is that it tastes authentic. You can tell they use quality fish and ingredients. The staff is very friendly, accommodating and they actually enjoy being nice to their customers.
It was very good. The chicken was a large portion and tasted great! Would highly recommend
Delicious and fairly priced. I'm going back again today. The fish tacos were excellent.
Easy ordering and fast service! Food was delicious! I would definitely recommend the queso!
For a quick, delicious bite this place is my favorite! This location is really clean with friendly and efficient staff. gotta love district taco!

Yes Taco! Yas Taco! I love a good taco and flavors. I come here when I get a chance. Which I wish was more often than not. Love this place. Nothing beats a long day and to come here and have a cold beer or drink and have some tacos or whatever you like. Good crew here.
Great location- good staff- and fresh food. never had a bad experience here. I would definitely recommend it.
Service was great, the food was great, the line was short and food came out quickly. I would definitely recommend!
Best fish tacos ever! So much so I went back the next day hoping to get more only to realize they are available on certain days.
The best tacos ever!! They are a little small so I'd get four next time. 3 tacos for shot 9$
I love this place! Everything tastes really fresh and they are super fast. Lots of options to customize your meal.
Man best taco spot I been to In D.C. Hands down.. Will come back again. Food was delicious and filling.

Of course the line is always long here, the location is right in the city. Well during lunch time and dinner time is the busiest. Their flour tortillas taste like true authentic Mexican flour tortillas. The shrimp tacos are my favorite as well.
Cheap, always fresh and the cheese with jalapeÃ±os is always bomb! love this place for lunch

Literally my favorite tacos in DC. Has chipotle beat by far. Their burritos are so huge, I never finish mine and for the price, you cant beat it. The sauces go perfect with my tacos and the queso, i like that you can add jalapeÃ±os to it as well
My favorite place to come when Im in DC!
the food was amazing !! i would recommend getting the 3 tacos. the amazing part was the beef. it was rly good !!
Steak taco with cheese was one of the best I have ever had. The chips were also spot on. Great food, great atmosphere, great everything.

Yummy and quick! Came here for dinner one rainy night and it completely made the trip! Was hoping for delivery but they only do catering as far as i know. I ordered a burrito with shredded beef. There are various ways to make your orders with recommended variations as well.Seating places were upstairs and cozy. Food came out delicious and fresh, big portions as well. Love the fact that everything is labeled like a classroom to learn spanish.Only downfall is that i wish there was a delivery as the weather wasn't the best and I didn't want to trek out in the rain!
The fish tacos are EVERYTHING....Gonna go back and try the shrimp tacos next.

It's fast food, but good food. It is not fine dining. but the service is good, the ingredients consistant. I do like the soda fountain as it has root beer. I am here weekly for lunch, sometimes dinner.
The food was amazing!!!!! The food didn't take long to make and the service was great.

The chicken, steak and Al Pastor taco. All were super flavorful and delicious. I savored each bite. You can tell they use quality fish and ingredients. Sooooooo good. Nothing matters when the tacos are that good. They were also extremely quick. Took less than 5 mins to get my tacos. Give them a try, you won't be disappointed. Can't wait to try other items off the menu!
Great food it's quick fresh. Place is cool (style) & it's cool (temperature)Got orders exactly right (quick serve places don't always)Thanks for a good place to go!!
Awesome tacos! Fresh, fun atmosphere. I love coming with friends, especially on Thursdays.
I created a Yelp account just to review these guys. These were some of the best tacos I've ever had! I cook for a living and I don't think I've ever made tacos this good. I need their recipe!
The best tacos in DC! I love this place! Service is great too.
Authentic, watch the spice (if you ask for it)! Free salsa bar, great service, great value, what else could you ask for?
Great Food! The burrito is delicious. I will definitely come back next time I am around there.
I love tacos and the tacos at District Taco are outstanding..................
Highly recommended!! There's always a line and that goes to show how delicious they are!!!

Amazing! Came for a quick lunch on Saturday and tried the fish tacos and al pastor. Both are great.The best part of DT is that it is so fresh. From the fish/meat to the tortilla to the salsa bar, everything is on point and fresh out of the kitchen with a homemade feel. Now please just open closer to Baltimore!!
Loved their salsa, which makes me want to go back again and again!!
Oh my god their burritos are sooooo goooooood. Fresh ingredients and the sugar cane sodas are so refreshing. Definitely my new go to place for Mexican food.
Amazing authentic tasting tacos for a decent price. Definitely try the sauces in the sauce bar.
Seriously good eats!
AMAZING TACOS! Tastes just like moms tacos. Brings a little of that mexican spice and culture into my mouth. Some tacos and jarritos, and its game over! Love this place.
Everything was very fresh and tasted great.

This has to be the best fast food place in DC. The food is simply awesome, and what makes it outstanding is that it tastes authentic. The staff is very friendly, accommodating and they actually enjoy being nice to their customers.  The lines are always long, so it is feasible to go around 11:15-11:30am. In that the vast majority of restaurants in DC serve food that tastes horrible, District Taco certainly suits my palate.
best, cutest, tastiest little tacos in the heart of D.C!!

Love District Taco! Great food, customer service, and vibe. I moved here after living in California for a number of years and this is probably the best taco experience I've had in DC. Fresh ingredients and a soulful business mission go a long way in my book. Also, I was surprised to learn that this business had its humble beginnings being a food truck! Nice!Definitely a thumbs up from me and I make sure to tell anyone looking for a great taco to make this their place to visit.

I loooooved the food here. i'm a fan of rick bayless' food, and this place was exceptional. the chocolate churros and the sandwiches were to die for. definitely a great place for small group dinners. highly recommend.
they have a mixture of food that is amazing. Their spin on the authentic mexican tacos had my mouth watering just smelling it.
Excellent ! 3 Tacos and a drink great quality at a great price. Definitely recommend.
This place is so good! You can get take-out or dine-in and it's really quick. Lots of options and it's a cool space and good location. Go!!
Great!Great food, great cost, great staff. There is always a line, but they are fast with it. And you can get beer here!
the tacos are so good.you should stop by and try there food.
Delicious food!!! At a very reasonable price too. We always have a great time here.
The food here is to die for. Fresh, authentic, and appropriately portioned. There's something on the menu for everyone, even if you're with someone who doesn't like spicy food.
Had a meeting downtown and ate here for lunch. It was some of the best Mexican food I have ever had. I defiantly recommend trying if you are ever in the neighborhood.
So good and simple! Will be returning.
Some of the best tex-mex I've had since living in Texas. Consistent and tasty.
District taco is so good.

I've gone to District Taco aka DT several times and I love it but I have never tried the FISH TACOS! I finally got the courage to step outta my normal Burrito Mojado w/ Al Pastor topped with Jalapenos and I tried the FISH TACOS today for the FIRST time....and they simply BLEW MY MIND. The place was packed with a line out the door but some how they manage the chaos. The food is always made quick and fresh, and I love the costumer service. This is my first review but I am a REAL FOODIE and I plan on returning to both YELP & DT!!!
Hi everyone I want share this.I been on this place on saturday because I had a meeting on my job on that day
I went here with my GF's for taco tuesdays and it was sooo bomb! I ordered the fish tacos and they were superb. They also have great drink specials! I highly recommend.
We were unable to go due to the limit of people in our group. Hopefully, we can try it again another time.
Made a reservation for 6 people. There was no one there, and they refused to sit us together because "it was about to get crowded"
Oxtails were EXTRA dry and tough. Tasted very old and like they just warmed them up. Was not fresh at all. Probably wouldn't order from them again but their rice was good.
Had dinner here with a few of my girl friends and we ordered several dishes to share, every single one was so flavorful and delicious.

St. James is truly a gem we have here in DC! The restaurant is a blend of excellent customer service and food. Whether I am dining with my family or clients the experience here has always been quite a hit! They have an environment that is comfortable for everyone! Authentic Trini taste with the delicateness that allows you to try multiple dishes and drinks without weighing down your night!For dessert the rum cake is a must! Highly recommend!

Authentic Caribbean Flavors at St. James!**Rating:** I recently had the pleasure of dining at St. James, and it was an extraordinary experience from start to finish!From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warm smiles and a vibrant, welcoming atmosphere. The decor is colorful and lively, perfectly capturing the essence of the Caribbean. The staff were attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu, making great recommendations.St. James Caribbean Restaurant offers an authentic taste of the Caribbean, with a menu full of flavorful, well-prepared dishes. Whether you're a fan of Caribbean cuisine or looking to try something new, this place is a must-visit. I'll definitely be back soon to explore more of their delectable offerings!I highly recommended trying the Jerk wings!!!!

I love this place! I'm from out of town and this is the 2nd time I go to this place becuase of the vibes alone. The staff is so friendly and have a pastime attitude. From the host,the server and the bartenders. Everyone seems to love what they do and I believe that's what makes it a great experience. They service is fast and food is always good and their mixed drinks are just right. You can tell who every manages the place puts dedication in to the staff becuase it shows. High recommended!-Brian

St. James Modern Caribbean is truly a gem for those seeking an authentic taste of Trinidadian cuisine. As soon as you step inside, you're enveloped in an ambience that feels like a warm embrace from home. Each dish is a delightful journey through Trinidadian flavors, evoking memories of homemade meals St. James Modern Caribbean is more than just a restaurant
The food was outstanding!! I am excited to go back and take a friend. Highly recommend.
Amazing food and vibes especially for a first date. Definitely would recommend and make sure to make reservations

Absurdly poor service--unprecedented in DC for the caliber of restaurant they are trying to be. Waited 15 minutes post-reservation time for our table (which was one of the shorter wait times amongst various parties standing around also waiting for their tables. Couldn't order drinks at the bar during the wait for "covid reasons"... Eventually someone on the staff brought wine to some of the parties waiting but not us. We started a timer for a party who arrived after us and they hit 25 mins before a glass was given to them.After 10 minutes sitting at our table, we had to ask for our waiter (or any waiter) to take our drink order. Extensive wait times in between ordering, service, etc. No exaggeration, we waited over 30 minutes for the dessert course...again, the dessert course.From arrival to departure, we were at Dauphine's over two hours and certainly not by our choice. Not once did a manager or other member of the staff speak with our party regarding the extensive waits or poor service. One of the managers kept pacing the restaurant and stood in the corners looking completely overwhelmed.It's a new restaurant so maybe they are trying to find their footing. Clearly they had a heads up when Tom Sietsema was coming by because his experience was very different from ours this weekend.

The restaurant was beautiful with great live music. I had spinach artichoke toast, veggie quiche, and beignets. The portions weren't very large, but they satisfied my hunger. The toast was good, but the egg on top was unsalted, which was surprising. The quiche was creamy and packed with mushrooms, but I wanted a bigger piece. The salad was surprisingly good without arugula, and the beignets felt plain

I visited Dauphines for dinner with colleagues to celebrate a successful conference. We had a great time enjoying good and a delightful atmosphere. Here are some of my takeaways. EnvironmentThe restaurant has a large and beautifully designed interior with a full bar and plenty of seating. I loved the versatile ambiance which makes it great for a variety occasions - whether it's dinner with friends, colleagues or a date night. The vibe was lovely and inviting. ServiceThe service at at Dauphines was great. Our server was friendly, attentive and ensured we had everything we needed.The food and drinks were delivered promptly. Overall, the service was great. Food and drinksThe food was truly enjoyable. I highly recommend staring with the bread service which includes buttermilk biscuits, baguettes & sweet potato brioches - all great. We also tried the BBQ shrimp which was pretty tasty. For the main dish, i had the crawfish stuffed chicken which was pretty good. To top it off, we had some delicious beignets with powder sugar that you sprinkle yourself. My meal was enjoyable and I Iook forward to returning to try more items on the menu. OverallDauphines is a great choice for both drinks and food. I had a great meal and a great time with my colleagues. I will definitely be back to explore more of their menu.

I decided to try Dauphins during restaurant week, and the ambiance struck me right away. The restaurant is undeniably beautiful, but I couldn't help but notice it was quite loud. It made it a bit challenging to have a conversation with my friend, though I'm unsure if this is just the new normal or a sign of me getting older - we definitely struggled to hear each other- but were there for the food! I'd probably think twice about choosing it for a date night due to the noise level or a night out to catch up via convo. Now, onto the food - it was outstanding! I kicked off with the Cured Beef Carpaccio, followed by the Blackened Fish Creole, and wrapped up with the parsnip cake. All three dishes were a delightful journey of flavors, and at $55 for the entire experience, I found it to be reasonably priced. Despite the noise, the culinary experience left a lasting impression.
Really enjoyed this restaurant. Everything we ate was delicious. The fresh oysters were the perfect appetizer after a day of exploring DC. Great atmosphere. Service was top notch.

Dauphine's is such a gem! The atmosphere is warm and lively, and the food is packed with bold flavors that feel like a celebration. I loved their seafood dishes--so fresh and perfectly cooked--and the cocktails were a treat too. Definitely a spot I'll keep coming back to!Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie

Dauphine's is an absolute gem in Washington, DC, blending the vibrant flavors of New Orleans Creole cuisine with a contemporary twist. From the moment you walk in, the warm and welcoming ambiance sets the stage for an unforgettable dining experience.The food is nothing short of outstanding. Their menu offers a variety of small and large plates, allowing you to sample a wide range of their creative dishes--including a fantastic raw bar. Every bite bursts with flavor, showing their dedication to both tradition and innovation. The bar menu is equally impressive, with options for every palate.What truly sets Dauphine's apart is the exceptional service. The wait staff is attentive, striking the perfect balance between being available and giving you space to enjoy your meal. The manager stopping by after each course to ensure we were happy was a thoughtful touch that elevated the experience even further.If you're visiting DC, I can't recommend Dauphine's enough. Whether you're a lover of Creole cuisine or just looking for an incredible meal, this restaurant is a must-visit. Five stars all the way!
Food was delicious, service was great. Great for a happy hour with an upscale feel but not overly upscale.
Beautiful restaurant with amazing food and drinks, as well as amazing service! Will be back soon!
location: H Street Corridor/Atlas District/Near Northeast, Washington, DC

text: I enjoyed my time here! The service was excellent! The menu can be overwhelming if you have absolutely no clue what you want, but the staff is so knowledgeable...they will always help.
Awesome food even better service I would recommend this to anyone wanted a great place to eat.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Dauphine's in Washington DC during restaurant week, and I can confidently say that it was an exquisite culinary experience that left a lasting impression. As a Bib Gourmand restaurant, Dauphine's had set high expectations, and it surpassed them in every way.The ambiance of Dauphine's exudes elegance with a touch of Southern charm. The interior design is tasteful and inviting, creating the perfect atmosphere for an upscale dining experience. The attentive and knowledgeable staff only added to the overall sense of hospitality.Now, onto the star of the show: the food. I started my meal with the corn bisque, and it was nothing short of a masterpiece. The creamy bisque had a depth of flavor that captured the essence of fresh, sweet corn. It was impeccably seasoned and garnished with a delicate drizzle of truffle oil, elevating it to another level of indulgence. The corn bisque was a delightful introduction to the culinary journey that awaited.For my main course, I selected the catfish creole, and it was a revelation. The catfish was perfectly cooked, flaky on the inside and wonderfully crispy on the outside. The creole sauce was a symphony of flavors, blending spicy and savory elements that danced on my taste buds. It was evident that each component of the dish was crafted with precision and care.Throughout the meal, I appreciated the attention to detail in both the presentation and the flavors. The portion sizes were generous without being overwhelming, allowing me to savor each bite. The menu at Dauphine's showcases a rich tapestry of Southern-inspired cuisine, and I could see the dedication to authenticity and quality in every dish.The wine selection was extensive and well-curated, offering the perfect accompaniments to the diverse menu options. The sommelier's recommendations were spot-on, enhancing my overall dining experience.Dauphine's has truly mastered the art of combining culinary excellence with Southern hospitality. It's no wonder it holds the prestigious Bib Gourmand designation. From the moment I stepped through the door to the final bite of dessert, my visit to Dauphine's was a gastronomic journey I won't soon forget.If you're seeking a restaurant that seamlessly blends tradition with innovation and offers a memorable dining experience during restaurant week or any time, I wholeheartedly recommend Dauphine's in Washington DC. It's a testament to the rich culinary tapestry of the South, expertly presented in the heart of the nation's capital.
The service was fantastic and the foods lived up to the description on the menu. We will definitely be back.
Ashley was an amazing server!!! Knew the menu very well and made great recommendations for cocktails and food. We had a great night!

My husband thinks this is his place for business dinners - but I really love it too. This is my go-to for drinks and a classy night out with my gals. I love the cocktails and the subtle touches in this place, and it wasn't till my 3rd visit that I realized each bathroom has a different whimsical touch - how fun! Food is very yummy and service always make me feel at home. Parking is also super convenient and safe downstairs in the well-lit parking garage.

Dined here four times now with my wife and various friends, and hope to do so many many more times. We haven't encountered a single misstep yet, from the atmosphere to the service and, of course, the food and drink.Whether you're an adventurous diner or not, pretend that you are. The fried hogs head cheese with sweetbreads and crab is the best bite I have ever had. But standards are executed to perfection as well - steak & potatoes was outstanding
don't go. worst service. expensive.
We were served stale food here today on our first visit to this place! Never coming back!!

Very bad service ,it is like bombay street in bombay not like dc . No hygiene no quality of service even food not so great. Only they marketing in magzines it is great place but nothing great here .Better to go pappe .hi business owner go and try pappe indian restaurant in dc then compare your st food with them,not only food hospitality service everything you need to learn from them , your service worrest then st side food stalls .again i tried here 2nd time sat dinner again not great it is fake publicity so they are so much crowd it is only few months in future it is going to worrest restaurant in dc . This owner act like bombay hero but he bullshit guy , he closed so many restaurants in va because of poor quality food and bad attitude.
Food was great and authentic. Love the atmosphere. Everyone was respectful and on top of things.
Food is very good. I enjoy Indian food do this Restaraunt hit the spot. Prices are reasonable
Food was fresh and portions are large, two people can eat from one order. Can't wait to try other things from their menu.

Lovely atmosphere with delicious food.... authentic taste of Bombay.... after a long time got to taste . Coming from a Mumbaikar... it's a compliment. Loved the thali ... vada paav... kheema paav and Biryani. Also check out the bhelpuri .... dahi puri ... chilli chicken and the amazing cutting chai... really love the food !
Excellent food and amazing customer service
Food was great and staff was extremely accommodating! Great for a first night in town :)
The food was amazing and the owner was most gracious. I highly recommend this restaurant.
I popped in for early dinner and had the most delicious meal. Highly recommend the chef's specials on the back of the menu. I had the Spicy Lal Mirch (chicken) and it was fantastic

Amazing amazing food. Amazing customer service. This is my new favorite Indian restaurant. Super clean too. I cannot express enough how much I love this place. Impeccable ambiance and service. Amazing owner too

At Bombay Street Food , sincerely enjoyed the chicken curry a, the rice and peas, and the many Indian spices used in the preparation of the wonderful and mouth watering dishes.In view of such quality foods I strongly recommend anyone having great and sumptuous meals at any time.

The vegan choices are delicious!  I have had at least twenty meals here, alone and/or with my wife, and the food has been outstanding every time. The owner will often visit our table to ensure we are happy with the meal. Fantastic food and great customer service have made Bombay Street Food my first choice for Indian cuisine.

Great food! My mother and I shared the 2 person platter and the single dish that came with it was great! As someone who doesn't eat much meat, the vegan option was delicious which is hard to find when a place doesn't necessarily cater to that type of dining. Very friendly staff and a great owner who assisted and explained every step of the meal. Very good food worth the trip!

I walk by this place all the time. So tonight I decided to give it a try. I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, Garlic Naan and the Lamb Rogan Josh. The food was outstanding!!! A symphony of flavors. I wipe my plate clean with the delicious Naan bread.
Delicious food& great service! Would come back.

My first time here. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I ordered the Lamb Kadai with rice. It was very good and the food was very fresh. I will be coming back. it's really a hidden gem in the Northwest Area.
Great food, good ambience and hospitable service. We tried tea and vada pav which were perfect for a chilly evening. Kolhapuri while good taste, dint resemble maharashtrian authentic flavor.

Amazing food and hospitality. My boyfriend is American White non-vegetarian and I'm an Indian vegetarian. He likes mild and I like it spicy and our tastes are really hard to capture. I have grown up with Indian home cooked food with a very adventurous mom so my palette is especially hard to please. I have had terrible food at many places in DC Indian restaurants. When I stepped in I was prepared to be disappointed again. Instead, I found the food to be absolutely bomb. In traditional words "majho ai gayo." We ordered a thali, vada pav, and kulfi. The owner came out when we were eating to check on us. Seeing my excitement he also offered us tea on the house. I was almost crying at how good the food was, which I tend to do when I finally have food that I love. I will go here again after my exams. The bill was a bit expensive for a college student like myself but I did not regret it one bit as I had not enjoyed such good food in DC area. if you are a vegetarian, do try Vada Pav and the Mung dal sabji. If you are a non-vegetarian non-spicy lover, try butter chicken and kulfi. Say hi to the owner for me too, though I don't know if he will remember me. - Vidhi Patel

My girlfriend and I stopped here for dinner after a day of taking photos with the cherry blossoms. She's from Gujarat and lived in an Indian household before she came here for college, and she has been very disappointed by other Indian offerings in the city.However... This establishment did not disappoint! It is a little expensive, but not much by a DC standard, expect to spend $20-25 a head, and plan on a comfortable tip because you'll want to leave one. The staff here is excellent and helpful, especially the owner/head chef who took it upon himself to come and check on us a couple times during our meal. He even offered us Chai on the house at the end of it all.Great food, great staff, good prices. Will definitely be eating here again.

Okay so this is my first yelp review ever, and I wish I took pictures before devouring my food! I love this place! I usually order to go, but I had my first sit down dining experience today. The ambiance, and staff along with my favorite the Alo Gobi we're spectacular. And they have several locations in DC! Must try authentic Indian food!

I ordered Dahi Puri, Pav Bhaji, and Tea. The staff were very hospitable, the food was great, and the service was extremely quick. Would definitely recommend if you are craving Indian food in the Columbia Heights vicinity.
The food was amazing, the service was impeccable everyone made sure that everything was perfect.

We had a great time enjoying our dinner at Bombay Street Food. Combination of excellent service and food taste made this one of our favorite restaurant in the area while we were visiting DC. It brought back memories of eating on the streets & beaches of Mumbai. Palak pakoda and cutting chai was a great combo to begin with on a wintery evening followed by vada pav and dahi puri. Veggie biryani was Yumm too. Overall we had a great experience and highly recommend this restaurant for taste and service.
This food was great! Some of the best food you can find! It tasted great and the staff was so polite.
Very nice service and great food!! The restaurant manager was very friendly!!
This place is amazzziinnggg. I love it I come here every once in a while to treat myself
Get the Pakora! It is amazing. My wife and I love this restaurant

Great addition to the dining scene on barracks row. Second visit. Samosa are really good with great sauces. They don't skimp on the hot spices so be warned. For a spice/ heat lover, it's just right. Management and servers gracious and very attentive. Well done and welcome to the neighborhood. You made a believer out of me.
Everything was so delicious and as far as I know authentic. Loved it.

The best place to have a great Indian experience ,I urge you to go and try the most spiced food with a great taste!!Hurry up ladies and gentlemen, Because you will have to wait for your turn until the server turns your table down!!
Food is quite good. They don't skimp on the amount of meat in their dishes. Will definitely go again!
Amazing decor , service and above & beyond Bombay street dishes taste . I love vada pav , missal pav and cutting chai . Definitely I will be back .
Delicious food, attentive service and a reasonable price. What more could you really ask for?

So excited for this place to open. It's a great mixture of trendy Indian street food and traditional Indian. They did a great job with the atmosphere, very fun. There's even a small bar in the front. We had the chicken Komar and garlic naan. Both excellent. The staff was great as well.

they have racist douchebags waiting (or not) at the front door. apparently you have to sit where they tell you and they don't feel like they have to wait on you. $15 for a basic burger, i'll sit where the f*ck i want. there are much better options in the area.

The burger was very good. But the soup was cold & it took 20 minutes to get it back from the kitchen. Also fries were cold & stale. We had to order fresh ones . It also took a while to get someone to clean the table. Dessert was tasty. Coffee very good. Otherwise our waiter was friendly.

I remember the food being pretty good. The burgers were simple but tasty, and I really liked their bun. The atmosphere was fine, but parking was a bit tough, like in any city, though you can usually find a spot. I had to mention our server - she was awesome. Super friendly, great service, and she really seemed to enjoy working there. It made the whole experience better. I'd go back just for the service alone. The burgers were a bit pricey, but the great service made up for it.
Must try the Blue Cheese and Truffle Burger, absolutely delicious. Yummy Yummy! Plus great cocktails.

really pleasant ambiance and polite staff. Ordered the clam chowder to start and the Bacon Cheeseburger. Burger was made extremely well and came out just as ordered. The clam chowder though never arrived. Hiccups happen, but the food was really good so I will be back
During my time in DC, I dined at that establishment on two occasions. The Lobster bisque surpassed any I've tasted elsewhere

I recently treated myself to a good but pricey cheesy cheeseburger, and it was a gourmet burger experience that didn't come cheap. This burger was a true cheese lover's dream, with a generous helping of gooey, melted cheese that oozed from every bite.What stood out was the quality of the ingredients. The cheese was top-notch, and the artisanal bun added a nice touch of texture and flavor. The presentation was also impressive, reflecting the care and attention that went into crafting this burger.The only downside was the high price, which was undeniably on the expensive side. While it was a delectable treat, the cost might make it more of an occasional indulgence than an everyday dining option.
Great place and amazing bar staff.. my burger was cooked perfectly and was absolutely delicious!
Everything was really good, service was friendly and fast, and highly recommend the chowder!
Great burger, great atmosphere right near my hotel. I would definitely come here again.

The Capital Burger is such a great place to eat, they offer some of the most amazing burgers I have ever seen. The meals here are hefty and they always impress, I love getting the capital burger and the french fries. They always have extra toppings and include extra flavor boosters in their burgers, the melted cheese on my burger was the icing on the cake for me. The service was spot on as they were quick to greet and were kind-hearted. The prices were fair for what I was paying for and I am glad that I got to experience such a pleasant dining experience. Some of my favorite burgers include the capital burger, chicken sandwich, bacon burger, and the crab cake appetizer. I definitely recommend the Capital Burger to anyone who's looking for a nice meal at a great price
Great selection of beers and delicious burgers. They have great happy hour. Don't forget to ask for pickles--yammy!
Amazing burger place, only issue was that the food took a bit long to come out. Other than that, our server was very attentive and the food was fantastic.

The capitale burger was great, The taste of meat was guranteed from capital grill i guess.. freshly fried french fries were delicious tooI loved complimentary pickles and sparkling water they gave us before foods are being served. I hope they continue doing it.The managers kept checking on us. The table/high sofa chair was comfortable as well.
Really good burgers! I mean really good! I need to try a couple more before I get to a 5 star rating. And whatever you get - add bacon to it :)
Had a great visit! The burger and fries were excellent. Had some local beers available too.
Good food, good service, good vibe. Place was super busy for lunch but food came quickly.

Happy hour was great. Super chill and service provided by Quan and Sam was great at the bar. I recommend the Hot Honey Margarita and the Southern Style Fried Chicken sliders on the Happy Hour Menu.Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie
Very good burger, fries and service. Will return soon. Wish there was one in my area.

The Capital Burger in Washington is a solid spot for a quality burger with a gourmet twist. The vibe is upscale casual, making it perfect for both a quick bite or a relaxed meal. The burgers are juicy, packed with flavor, and they have a great selection of craft beers to go along.

If you're in search of a good burger, this is definitely the spot for you. They're definitely worth it. The flavor combination is absolute perfection. All the burgers were juicy and perfectly cooked. Great vibes and music selection as well.

Kung pao Brussels sprouts were out of this world. It was like having Chinese takeout but made with Brussels sprouts, and I could even swap them in as my side. I went for the bacon cheeseburger, and my friends got the Capital Burger. The bacon was crispy and sweet, and my burger was cooked perfectly medium. My friends were all about the Capital Burger - the onions and cheese totally made it for them. One had regular fries, and the other had Parmesan fries
Great service - Great food - loved this place - would go back again when in town - service was great also

We were there for a mid-afternoon lunch and decided to sit at the bar. The bartender was friendly and helpful. The bar seemed to be where most people decided to sit during this hour. Excellent burger and excellent fries. Good choice!

First time trying this spot being my 3rd time visiting Washington DC. The service was out of this world! Our server Michelle was an absolute gem and was extremely personable and funny. She gave great recommendations to my girlfriend and I which we both loved. The burgers and drinks were delicious and I wish they never ran out. I also liked the modern rustic vibe of the place. It has a touch of classy casual. Definitely stop by if you're at DC!

I had a fantastic dining experience. The food was absolutely delicious! On top of the amazing food, the service was top-notch. Our server, was attentive, friendly, and always available to answer any questions we had. They made sure our dining experience was enjoyable from start to finish.Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant. It's a great place for a delicious meal and excellent service.
Perfect place to Washington in after a night out. The service is fast the food is great for the price.

Absolutely, the hamburgers here are phenomenal. We tried both the Capital Burger and the truffle + blue cheese burgers, and both were exceptional. The fries were perfectly fried and seasoned. Coming from California, where a $20+ burger is just average, this place is a must-visit to enjoy a burger that truly justifies the cost. The chocolate mousse was good, but it didn't knock our socks off.Unfortunately, we didn't get a chance to try the beer or mixed drinks, so I can't provide any commentary on those.

I'm visiting from out of state, and I must say, those burgers were absolutely delicious. We tried the bacon cheeseburger with tomato jam, cooked medium. As a side, we opted for fries with Gruyere cheese sauce and fresh chives. The bar itself was stunning, creating a fantastic atmosphere. When we sat down, the two bartenders warmly greeted us, and we started with (2) espresso martinis, eventually enjoying (2) more before we left.

I'm visiting from out of state, and I must say, those burgers were absolutely delicious. We ordered a bacon cheeseburger with tomato jam cooked medium and fries topped with Gruyere cheese sauce and fresh chives. The bar itself was beautifully designed, creating a fantastic atmosphere. When we sat down, the two bartenders warmly greeted us. We started with two espresso martinis and ordered two more before we left.
Great food at a great price. The capital burger is amazing with their sea salt fries. The sweet chili chicken wings are also a favorite of diners there.
Definitely coming back! Food was very fresh and yummy. Also the staff and service were outstanding.
Excellent service. Delicious food. Bar was fantastic, great quality and attentive service!

This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps This burger slaps
Excellent and delicious! You cannot go wrong with a good burger and a beer! Great quality meat.
Good good and friendly service. Our server, Malaysia, did not rush us and provided friendly service
Awesome restaurant. Food was amazing, and service was extremely fast & friendly. Can't wait to go back!
Favorite spot for a burger in the city...
Delicious burgers. Great service. Worth stopping by. Get a drink with your appetizers. Friend said the lobster roll was good too.
Great service, absolutely beautiful venue and AMAZING food! One of the best burgers I've had in a while. Can't wait to come back and try the shakes.
A Fresh Burger that was juicy and amazing tasting. Quality add-on that were fresh. Fries were crispy and hot. Will be back
Juicy and tasty burgers...full flavors of burgers. Staff were nice and very helpful. Recommended!
The best burgers in town, if not in the world. We have being to many places around the world and I can't remember a better place than this.
5 Stars for the service and food, I was pleased.
Had a wonderful visit. Our server was amazing. Extremely knowledgeable of the menu. Our food was delicious and our drinks just as amazing. I highly recommend this restaurant.

These is really satisfied my craving for a burger. It's really delicious the burger is incredible, really taste great. I order this cheeseburger and chicken sandwiches, and I'm really full. The staff are friendly and have a good customer service. Definitely recommended.
Very tasty food, great burgers and fries. Friendly staff, they are very polite and the service wasexcellent. Recommended.
One of my friends recommended this place, and the burgers were incredible, it was juicy and delicious. The staff is great and super friendly. Prices are good as well. Definitely going back again.

I love this place whenever I am in DC I have to stop by here for some burger satisafacfion and I have to agree with other reviews here the Gouda souce is a must have you won't be disappointed. It's a shame I haven't been able to go here since the pandemic I can't wait for things to get back to normal so I can sink my teeth in that juicy burger.

I have visited a few times with my friends and it is conveniently located across from the convention center, which has a nearby train station. I typically order the French Onion burger which has a consistent onion-y flavor / garlic taste that I crave. Other than that it has your typical burger-esque fare you can expect from a DC joint. Reasonable prices for food and for a nice time.

Y'all. This burger was everything. EVERYTHING. The Capital Burger- French Onion-Style: Caramelized Onions, Wisconsin Grand Cru GruyÃ¨re, Shallot AioliI died and went to burger heaven. Plus, the bartender Jameka was cool as hell.
Service was great, food even better!
Best burger ever. Definitely wanted a second after I ordered the first. Wish we had be back home

First time going I was hoping it was as god as the reviews. Our server was prompt, polite and made suggestions. The water was ice cold, I had the spiked Bourbon Caramel milkshake that was smooth and delicious...I highly recommend having one. Next was the Bacon Cheeseburger cooked just as I asked and so juicy and delicious I could eat one every day. And flavor was perfect in every way. As a side I had the Kung Pao Brussels Sprouts just because I was curious but wow the flavor and caramelization with the smoked Canadian bacon! I will be eating here every time I'm in town.
Hands down the best burger in all of dc. The beef was well down and delicious. Love it

I am usually not a fan of fast food places, but in the few times that I do eat fast food, this is where I go. This is the only fast food joint that I trust. The quality of the items they sell isn't compromised despite them being cheap.
OMG!! This was great!! Service was a 10 and the burger was a 10! I'll definitely be back soon!
I think it would be difficult to find a better burger, places like these could destroy the fast food chain mechanism completely... it would be great if they could obliterate that ancient concept
Bacon Burger was 5/5! Highly suggest giving this place a try.

You can clearly see that they put a lot of effort in cooking. Because they take a bit longer than other burger joints to serve. But they keep your appetite on with their delicious pickles and fries. I was there all alone since I was returning from Comic-con, I had both the pickles and fries. Fries were just heavenly, perfect taste, perfectly cut and perfect amount of salt.Their burgers are served with side salads which I like the most. I ordered their most like burger: The Capital Burger. Though, your plate does get messy with salad and burger but I enjoyed it since there was innumerable taste my taste buds was getting. Its my favorite spot to come in alone and enjoy a great meal.

This was my second time coming here, and while the appetizers were fresh, the service and experience were incredibly disappointing. The menu prices were misleading - some menus had different prices than others, and it seemed that the prices fluctuated often so there were some outdated prices, so there were charges that we weren't aware of at the end of the meal. In addition, there was a $7 per bottle charge for waters, even though we hadn't specified we wanted anything other than the normal kind. (Be sure to specify tap water, anything other insures a fee). It might've been our own naivetÃ©, but from our experience in other restaurants, we didn't think anything of bottled water coming to the table because they are usually complimentary. Food-wise, the safron taglierini came with noodles that were clumped, and the scallops were not fresh. It was incredibly flat. Overall, it was a poor experience and I would not come back.

Good food but terrible service and way overpriced. The server, who claimed to be the owner's son, didn't really seem to get it. We eat out in DC all the time. The care you provide to a customer is absolutely important. When you receive an order wrong and don't properly deliver the drinks, you should own it. But to be argumentative takes away from the overall experience. Lots of other, better quality restaurants where you don't have to deal with this. Go somewhere else.

As a party of three we found Tortino open on a Wednesday night around 9.00. Was shown to a table in a section of the restaurant where there were no other customers. I will say the food was quite nice, but the evening was spoilt by staff who were more concerned with getting us out of the restaurant ASAP to enable them to close at approximately 10.15 The music was turned off half way through our meal, waiter was trying to remove plates from our table while some of our party were still eating. And as soon as we had finished we were presented with the check, with no offer of a desert if we would have liked one. I cannot see myself returning to this restaurant in the near future.
Good wine, good service, the food was not worth the price at all.
Cozy Italian place Food was average but expensive for the actual quality of it. Friendly customer service though.
Not worth it for the price. The food was good but definitely not worth the price they were set at.
Average italian food, in a fun and lively atmosphere. Good place to come with a big group to celebrate and drink margaritas. But do not expect a gastronomic experience.

We decided to treat our daughter to a meal here since she's attending school nearby. We were thoroughly impressed--booking online made the process incredibly convenient, and we were promptly seated upon arrival. The service was exceptional
Didn't expect such a nice lovely Italian cuisine in this restaurant we happened to pass by
Only lost 1 star because the food was not hot enough. Delicious and Well prepared though

Delicious Italian food in DC. The food is outstanding quality. The place is cozy and the service was attentive. The food was reasonably priced and the waiters were very friendly.Definitely come here if you're craving for some good Italian food!

I discovered this place through WA since I could stroll there from my area. I had a booking for 4 pm on a Sunday and they were extremely occupied. I wound up sitting at the bar rather than a table for inclination. The bread was hot and complimentary. The balsamic vinegar in the plunging sauce had the kind of toasted marshmallows and I couldn't get enough. Decent sustenance and great staff. I would eat here once more.

Tortino is a good choice should you want tasty and reasonably priced Italian, and it is convenient and easy to reach. There are tables that have candles and white table clothes, but this is not a super high end place. Decibel level is bearable, particularly if you are at one of the little tables for two against the walls. Service was friendly and efficient.Now on to the food. My dinner companion and i both had the fish special with asparagus and mashed potatoes, and were not disappointed. THe portion size was just right. Shared a very well priced bottle of Chianti as well as a nice slice of cheesecake for dessert - also very nice. The menu has enough for everyone's tastes. Clientele was very diverse. Overall, very pleased with the dining experience.

Dinner with professional friends. Salads appetizers and dessert were great. Pesto risotto was on the "rice" side, but scallops were nearly perfect. Staff was awesome!! Overall, good experience, would go back.

Really excellent restaurant. The Caprese type appetizer made with Burrata cheese was superb. The eggplant appetizer was also great. Thin slices of eggplant with a tomato sauce. The pan seared scallops were perfectly cooked over a cauliflower puree. Finally, the grilled marinated Portobello mushrooms were al dente with a balsamic drip. The spinach Tagliatelle with chicken was just right. Finally, the Roasted Veal Tenderloin was served medium rare as requested served over au gratin potatoes with a Black Truffle reduction. The couple next to us raved about the grilled pork chops. So don't go anywhere else before Tortino. By the way, very reasonably priced.

I just heard about this new restaurant in my neighborhood which is extremely great. The linguini with seafood is right up there with the greatest. Everything was fresh and it absolutely was substantial but not heavy. I 'd the tricolor salad to begin and it absolutely was flavorful and fresh. The chef can cook! The staff was friendly and welcoming. This will be on the normal turning.

We have been three times since they opened, and have consistently been treated to delicious food and outstanding, friendly, and accommodating service. And the recently renovated dining room gives a relaxing, warm, and pretty surroundings to relish your meal---plenty fine, but still casual. We want to make it one of our regular area places!
Excellent value. High end service and food without the high end prices. A neighborhood gem.

The staff is inviting, the ownership truly cares about your experience, the wine list is interesting and diverse and the food is beautifully served in a very authentic style. The temperature of the wines that were served was perfect, which is actually pretty rare, even in a city like Washington, DC.Tortino is a gem. Truly impressed by our meal and the hospitality.
It was great - tasted good, reasonably priced, good service - even a nice wine selection. I definitely plan to go back sometime!

Visiting the D.C. area and felt the need for good Italian food. Tortino's did not disappoint. We were a party of 5. My brother and I ordered the Fettuccine alla bolognese which we enjoyed tremendously. My wife ordered Veal Scallopini Piccata which I thought was the best dish at the table and one of the best I have tried in recent memory. Sister in law ordered Pan seared Scallops which I found to be good but not great and my daughter ordered the Butternut Squash Ravioli which everyone enjoyed as well. As you can tell we were a group that liked sharing our entrees with one another. Service was very good. At the end of the meal we rewarded ourselves with coffee and dessert to cap of a great day of sight-seeing and a delightful meal. I will come back to this place on my return visit to the Capitol.
Nice place, very good food and nice peopl!
Hidden little jem!

After reading all of the positive reviews for this place, I decided I needed to go asap. Went here for a weekday lunch and the food (complimentary warm bread right out of oven, burrata cheese appetizer and finally the delicious gnocchi) was incredible. I wanted to order everything on the menu, but I suppose I have to save something for future visits! The service was excellent, though I have to say I was literally the only customer there at the time
great addition to the neighborhood! lovely little italian joint.

Tortino is one of the best values in the District. Great food at a very reasonable price. The ambiance was warm, but the music was on the loud side and didn't really go with that warm ambiance. It was a bit jarring. As for the food, we started with the calamari. It was just fried rings served with a "spicy" tomato sauce. It had a little more "spice" to it than a normal tomato sauce, but it certainly wasn't what most people would consider spicy. Nevertheless, it was pretty good. The rings were not overly greasy either, they were fried just right. My entree was the Agnolotti di Agnello. It was a little on the rich side, but it was quite flavorful and definitely filling. My mom had the grilled salmon, which was cooked perfectly: thoroughly cooked, but still moist. We ended our dinner with the tiramisu, which was excellent. Overall Tortino is a good Italian option. Prices are reasonable and the food is above average.
Loved the food. Great service. Not too expensive.
Food service ambiance great service wonderful place to be Everything is amazing and nice ambiance

My friends and I shared three pasta dishes (i.e., crab ravioli, seafood linguine, and pasta with pork sausages and cream sauce). All of them are great. The sauces for all plates of pasta were on the light side but very flavorful. I think I find my favorite pasta spot in DC!

I had an incredible dining experience at this restaurant. The food was creative and delicious, and the service was excellent. The atmosphere was upscale yet comfortable, and the staff made us feel very welcome. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a special night out or celebration

We had just a lovely meal here. We had the lamb osso buco and Bolognese, both done very well. The desserts were housemade and delicious. I don't have any complaints. Good value for money and quick service.

During our visit to D.C., we stopped by Tortino Restaurant. The place was recommended to us. The food was delicious. We had the Salmon, Lamb Ravioli, the Chef's special, and more! Wine list was great. Service was welcoming and very attentive. We even managed to meet the Chef! Great experience. Highly recommended!
Food and service were excellent!! Would highly recommend!! I wish we lived closed in the area!
Staff is super friendly and the food is amazing super tasty and fresh would definitely come back again and and definitely worth it
Wonderful Italian food in a comfortable atmosphere with friendly and efficient service.
This is a wonderful restaurant with incredible customer service and delicious food. I liked it so much I don't want to tell anyone about it because I want it to be my personal spot!
Beautiful gem in the Logan Circle neighborhood.. A must-visit!
This place is a total gem...fantastic bolognese and everything else.
I love this place. Not only is the food delicious but the friendly service is wonderful. I would highly recommend this place.
Always a fantastic place to go for lunch or dinner. My favorite is the gnocchi. You can't go wrong with this place.

The worst food i had in a long time, i do not know why they opened up this place. The quality is poor and food is too oily. Staff also isnt well trained and a bit rude. I would recommend them to re analyze their priorities and try to serve quality food

Tried Beef Quesabirria for the first time and the flavors were spot on! My only gripe is the portion size and pricing for a takeout-only place. Spending around $18 for 3 tacos and the dipping soup with tax and tip felt a bit steep. I'll definitely come back, but it would be more satisfying if the $15 tacos came with chips or a side dish at least.

While not my top pick for tacos in DC, these are certainly ones I wouldn't mind having again and again. Currently offering only takeout, we opted for the al pastor tacos. The meat boasts impressive flavor but tends to be on the dry side, craving a sauce to balance it out--relying solely on lime wasn't quite sufficient. Even the onions, while flavorful, struggled to counteract the charred edges of the meat. However, the taco shells were a highlight--soft, non-greasy, and resilient till the last bite. Though not the most budget-friendly option, they're definitely worth sampling.

I don't know why people give lesser reviews for this place, I think it's awesome. The service is quick and efficient. Tacos always come out piping hot and delicious. The al pastor is my personal favorite. Whenever I'm in U Street corridor I try to stop by Taqueria and I'm never disappointed.

Taqueria Xochi is hands down one of my favorite taco spots. The flavors are bold and authentic, the tortillas are always fresh, and their birria tacos are a game-changer. It's a cozy spot with friendly service, and I love how every bite feels like a celebration of Mexican street food.Follow my IG account for Curated Google Maps list for brunch, happy hours, rooftops, parks, wineries & more in the DMV area: @yourdmvbestie
WOW!!!! Best taco takeout spot, hands down. I got the chicken tacos and my sister got the pork tacos. We also shared guacamole and we thoroughly enjoyed and devoured everything!! 10/10 recommend!
The food is always delicious, the place is more of a get your food and go. I recommend ordering your food before you get there to pick up
Excellent authentic. Big portions. Delicious. Quick delivery. Great prices. Highly recommended. Great salsas. Tacos are great.
Very good tacos and very good service
Went back for another try and was SO pleasantly surprised! The birria tacos are AMAZING, and the staff was so friendly when I requested for minor accommodations bcuz of COVID.

We ordered a chicken Cemita and the beef Birria tacos -- both were delicious!! The tacos were filled with a good amount of tasty braised beef and melted cheese and the chicken Cemita had a great balance of ingredients and spicy sauce (see picture). A great addition to the neighborhood and can't wait to return and try other menu items.
they're taking covid 19 precautions really well. the food is delicious and i cant wait to go back! the only thing is that it's a bit pricey.
